title: For Clever Admins: Clever API v3.0
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Clever API v3.0
section: For Clever Admins: Clever API v3.0
text:
Title

For Clever Admins: Clever API v3.0

URL Name

000001448

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001448?language=en_US#header1) 
2. [Features](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001448?language=en_US#header2) 
3. [Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001448?language=en_US#header3)

Announcing API V3.0! Clever’s newest API version simplifies data management for partners and districts. The next-generation API offers a new flexible data model to help partners meet the fast-evolving and unique needs of their district customers in a scalable way.

---

API v3.0 will include the following features:

In v1.0 and v2.0, users with multiple roles had a Clever ID for each role. This could often be confusing in downstream applications where users might have duplicate accounts or struggle to access the correct account. API v3.0 provides flexible user-role data to streamline the experience of provisioning teachers, staff, and contacts so applications can quickly scale access for all users on their platform. If a user has multiple leadership roles (at the district, school, or teacher level), they will now have a single Clever ID.

This updated data model will not be very noticeable in the Clever Dashboard or Portal. Users with multiple roles will still have separate Portals in Clever. However, downstream applications will now be able to identify users with various roles and link those accounts accordingly. Some applications will also allow users to toggle between accounts.

We’re adding even more granularity to our contact relationships to make it easier for partners to support and connect with family members. If a contact is a parent to two children, has a nephew in the district, and is an emergency contact for a family friend, they’ll have one Clever ID, and you’ll be able to see those unique relationships with every student.

Contact data will be more accurate and relationship types will be much less rigid. This update recognizes the complexity of the different types of relationships individuals may have as students' contacts. This change will address the security risks of assigning only one relationship type to a contact who may otherwise have other relationship types with other students.

API v3.0 will support a consistent experience for how districts and applications refer to Staff (formerly ‘School Admins’).

Furthermore, role types for Staff will now be available through the API, making it easy to distinguish between the different levels of permissions Staff have in Clever (e.g., School Tech Lead vs. Portal-Only).

This update will improve the alignment between how our school district and application partners communicate about staff users. By updating the way we refer to this user type in the API, we hope to close the loop on some miscommunication that occurs when rostering staff users.

In addition, exposing the staff role field in the Clever API will give application partners more flexibility in provisioning account permissions.

Some applications allow you to map resources to specific courses, classes, or users. This often requires district administrators to work with each application directly to assign these resources manually. To address this pain point, we’ve created a feature that helps you manage content mapping directly from your Clever Dashboard!

To learn more about content assignment, check out this article: [For Clever Admins: Content Mapping.](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360052615892)

---

**When can we expect to see these changes?**

- It is up to each application to decide when to adopt the new API version. Even for our early adopters, it will take some time to implement these changes and migrate their data over. If you would like to know more about how an application will utilize our new API, we recommend reaching out to them directly.

**How will I know what version of the API the application is on?**

- You can always reach out to Clever Support for more information about the API version an application uses. However, how each application uses v3.0 will be up to them. Clever doesn't guarantee any specific user experience changes as a result of this new API version release. If you have more specific questions, we recommend reaching out to the application directly.

title: For App Partners: Clever Library
text:
> Note: Title For App Partners: Clever Library URL Name 000001450 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. How does the Clever Library work? 3. Understanding Teacher Sign-Ups with the Clever Library 4. How "Sign Up with Clever" works for teachers 5. How "Sign Up with Clever" works for students
>  
> Overview
>  
> The Clever Library is a place for teachers to discover, learn about, and adopt new resources for their classroom. Resources in the Library can be added to a teacher’s Teacher Page for easy access by students and teachers. >  
>  
> How does the Clever Library work? >  
> When a teacher adopts a Library application with SSO, Clever shares only the absolute minimum information: student first name, last initial, grade level, and course enrollment. Clever does not share any sensitive information with Library applications, including student email, student number, SIS ID, state ID, school/district information, or any demographic information about the student. >  
> In the Clever Library, teachers can:
> Add applications for themselves and their students
> Review applications for other teachers to see
> Recommend and share applications to other teachers
>   Please note: The Clever Admin for each school organization can turn off the Clever Library and block individual resources that they don’t want teachers to access. Please see this article for more information on district and school controls over Library applications. >  
> Understanding Teacher Sign-Ups with the Clever Library
>  
> Sign Up with Clever enables teachers to create accounts for themselves and their assigned students in your application using data from their existing Clever accounts. This streamlines onboarding by automatically setting up accounts without manual data entry. Applications added by teachers through Clever also appear as SSO resources in the Clever Portal for both teachers and their students.

title: For App Partners: Clever Library
text:
>  
> Currently, only existing teachers in a Clever district can use Sign Up with Clever when utilizing their Clever Library; new teachers who attempt to Sign Up with Clever are directed to have their district IT administrators set up an account with Clever. >  
> Teacher sign-ups with the Clever Library differ from district connections primarily in management and data access. With teacher sign-ups, individual teachers independently decide to connect your application via the Clever Library and can add or remove access at any time. In contrast, district connections are authorized and managed by district-level Clever Admins, who control Sharing Permissions to grant access en masse. Teacher sign-ups provide only essential data—teacher and student names, emails, sections taught, and Clever IDs—while district connections share the full Clever Data Model and support overnight data syncing. Please note that data from teacher sign-ups can only be accessed on login; unlike district connections, teacher sign-ups do not support overnight data syncing. >  
> Click Analytics on the left sidebar of your app dashboard to see the total number of students and teachers who are using your application. You can use the “Source” filter to identify the usage coming from teacher sign-ups, district connections, or both. > How "Sign Up with Clever" works for teachers
>  
> If your application supports Sign Up with Clever, teachers can create an account in your product either via a Login with Clever button on your website, or via your product’s listing on the  Clever Library . Learn more about Clever Library integrations here . >  
>  
> Teachers will then be presented with a screen to confirm that they would like to share their profile information to create accounts in your product for themselves and their students. Teachers may also take this opportunity to review your application’s terms of service and privacy policy.

title: For App Partners: Clever Library
text:
>  
>  
> After confirming their approval, the teacher will be taken to your product to complete their onboarding and start using your product. > Immediately upon signup, a Single Sign-On (SSO) link to your product will also appear on the Clever Portal for the teacher and all of his or her students. Specifically, the link will appear on the teacher’s Class Page, to distinguish it from resources that are managed at the district level. > After signing up, a teacher may log in to their account in your product either through the SSO link on their Clever Portal. Alternatively, if you have a Log In with Clever button on your site, they can go to your site directly to log in. > How "Sign Up with Clever" works for students
> Once a teacher has used Sign Up with Clever to create an account for themselves and their students, the teacher’s students may log in either via the SSO link on their teacher’s Class Page, or by going to you site directly and clicking “Log in with Clever”. > In the typical case, students should not need to create their own accounts, as your product should provision student accounts automatically when teachers sign up. > Any new student who joins a teacher’s class will automatically have any SSO links added to their portal, and your application should provision an account for the student the next time they or their teacher logs in.

text:
> Tip: Title For Teachers: Making a purchase request in Clever Library URL Name 000001451 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. How do I make a purchase request? 3. What happens after a purchase request is made? >  
> Overview
> The Clever Library is a place for teachers to discover, learn about, and adopt new resources for their classrooms. Teachers can browse applications across multiple subjects and grades. Clever also surfaces popular apps in your district and across Clever, as well as apps new to the Library. Resources in the Library are added to a teacher’s Teacher Page for easy access by students and teachers. > If you don’t see a Library tab in your Clever Portal, your Clever Admin has disabled the Library. Learn more here . >  
>  
> How do I make a purchase request? > Please note: In order to make a purchase request, the desired application must first be added to your Teacher Page from the Clever Library. Not all Library apps are available for purchase (such as free apps). > In order to add an application from the Clever Library, follow these steps:
> Navigate to the Library page in your Clever Portal. Find this option in the upper right corner. If you know the name of the application, you can use the search bar. > Click on the desired application and you’ll be taken to the application page. If you don’t see an application, it may not be available in the Library. > From the application page, click Install . If the Install button is gray and not clickable, your Clever Admin has blocked this application. Learn more here or contact your admin or IT team for more information. > Complete the form on the following page. You can choose which Teacher Pages to display the application on. > Click  Allow and continue . > Once an application has been added to your Teacher Page via the Clever Library, you have the ability to request that your district purchase the resource.

title: For Teachers: Making a purchase request in Clever Library
heading_path: For Teachers: Making a purchase request in Clever Library
section: For Teachers: Making a purchase request in Clever Library
text:
There are two ways to make a purchase request:  
> Option 1
> Select the application you want to request a purchase for from the appropriate Teacher Page in Clever Portal. Choose the Upgrade  option below the application icon. Fill out the form presented and click Send Request . > Option 2
> In the Clever Portal, search for the application by name using the search bar in the upper right corner. Once the application appears in the dropdown menu, click the link labeled Details . This will take you to the application page in the Clever Library. Click Request an upgrade . Fill out the form presented and click Send Request . >  
> What happens after a purchase request is made? > Once you’ve submitted your purchase request, Clever Admins and School Tech Leads at your district or school will be notified. Those individuals will determine if they will take action on your purchase request. If you have questions, please reach out to your IT or tech support team.

The [Clever Library](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360015683471) lets teachers install applications for themselves and their students, write reviews, and share apps with other teachers.

This article outlines information on the data provided to Library applications via Clever. For more information on Library settings and access, [please see this article](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360015683471).

---

Clever Library applications added by teachers receive a limited amount of data. These applications do not receive all fields like Secure Sync applications. Find the data Library apps receive for each record type below:

- Clever ID
- Name
- Email

- Clever ID
- Name (first name, last initial)
- Grade

- Clever ID
- Name
- Subject
- Grade
- Section number
- Teachers
- Students

> Important: Title For App Partners: Reviews for your Clever Library listing URL Name 000001454 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. How teachers can leave a review for your application 3. Best practices for requesting reviews from teachers 4. How to read teacher reviews for your application 5. How to reply to teacher reviews
> Overview
> Teacher reviews and comments are extremely valuable for curriculum leaders when evaluating existing or new edtech apps to purchase. In addition to leaving a rating, teachers often provide helpful comments about the accessibility and usability for decision makers to consider when assessing your application. You can help increase the number of reviews on your app detail page by asking teachers who are using your application to leave a review. Once teachers leave a review, you will be able to read and reply to the review in your dashboard. Reviews and any replies will also be published on your application’s public-facing profile page in the Clever Library. > How teachers can leave a review for your application
> Whether you have a Secure Sync or Library integration, once you are in the Clever Library, your application is eligible to receive verified teacher reviews. A verified teacher review means that the teacher has logged into your application at least once before leaving a review. >  
> Teachers can leave reviews from their Clever Portal by navigating to your application via the search bar, and clicking 'Details'. >  
> If you have a profile page in Clever Library, teachers can navigate to your Library listing's URL where they'll be able to leave a review (if they have already installed and used your application). This is useful if you want to direct teachers to a specific page where they can leave a review. > Please note:  You can identify teachers who installed your application in the Clever Library via your API.

title: For App Partners: Reviews for your Clever Library listing
heading_path: For App Partners: Reviews for your Clever Library listing
section: For App Partners: Reviews for your Clever Library listing
text:
> Best practices for requesting reviews from teachers
> If your application doesn't have reviews, we encourage you to reach out to teachers directly to as for them to leave a review and comments in Clever. Use this sample messaging to ask teachers who have used your app to leave a review. Clever is also proactively prompting teachers to leave reviews for the applications they use when they log into their Clever Portal. > Use value-based messaging when asking for reviews. When sending emails asking for reviews, include some tips, ideas, or guidance on how to get the most out of using your application. View sample messaging here . Optimize the timing of when you ask teachers for reviews. Consider timing your ask around when the teacher has used your product independently or with students, within a certain number of days after logging into your application, or during a time when they're likely to engage with your product. Send one review request per teacher. If a teacher doesn't respond to your request for a review, don't send them a second request. > Guidelines
> Be open to all types of feedback. Teachers trust the feedback of other teachers, so having a range of reviews on your application gives you an opportunity to establish trust and authenticity with your users, in addition to receiving valuable product feedback. Per FTC guidelines , don't offer money or prizes in exchange for reviews. If you offer an incentive for teachers to leave reviews, you must instruct the reviewer to indicate that this was an incentivized endorsement. > Clever is excited to be a trustworthy source of teacher reviews. With this in mind, we reserve the right to flag any unusual review behavior. > How to read teacher reviews for your application
> You can view all teacher reviews in your Clever Dashboard. Navigate to the Library  tab, where you will see all your reviews listed.

title: For App Partners: Reviews for your Clever Library listing
heading_path: For App Partners: Reviews for your Clever Library listing
section: For App Partners: Reviews for your Clever Library listing
text:
Depending on your integration(s), either Secure Sync or Library, you'll be able to see which version the reviewer is accessing next to their name. > Important things to note about reviews
> Reviews will be sorted based on the date they were submitted. You do not have the ability to delete reviews. However, you do have the ability to reply to reviews. Reviews will be shared publicly on your profile page. Continue reading below for guidance on how to reply to teacher reviews. > How to reply to teacher reviews
> Applications can reply to each individual review directly in their dashboard by clicking on the 'Respond' button next to the review. > Teachers will see a notification in their Clever Portal that their review has a response. > Your response will be visible to all visitors on your Application Detail Page. > After leaving your response, you can return to your dashboard any time to edit or delete your response.

title: Clever + Google Classroom: Requirements & Troubleshooting
text:
> Tip: Title Clever + Google Classroom: Requirements & Troubleshooting URL Name 000001463 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Requirements 3. Teacher experience 4. Troubleshooting Errors on the Sync History page 5. Using the Google Classroom Course Information Lookup Tool 6. As-Needed: Reprovision any courses that teachers declined by accident 7. FAQs
> Overview
> ➕  The Google Classroom roster import application is available to request in the Clever application gallery ! > U.S. and Canadian school districts with a Google Standard Edition or Google Workspace for Education Plus  subscription for staff and students have the option to roster Google Classroom courses via Clever. If you’re interested in utilizing this rostering method, please visit your Clever Dashboard to accept your invite or request the application . Once the application is connected and the scheduled sync start date has arrived, Clever will provision Google Classroom courses based on your district’s SIS + Clever data. Google Classroom course names will match to Clever section names and rosters will update automatically as students change sections in your SIS + Clever. The Google Classroom roster import application will:
>   Create Classroom courses and enroll students, teachers, and co-teachers based on Clever section data. Automatically update rosters based on changes in Clever. Allow teachers to manually add and remove students and co-teachers to Clever-created courses. Allow teachers to rename Clever-created courses. Allow teachers to accept or reject Clever-created courses. > The application will NOT:  
>   Create, modify, or delete user accounts in Google Workspace. Modify courses that teachers manually create in Classroom. Write Classroom grades back to your district’s SIS (but should be compatible with other grade passback solutions).

title: Clever + Google Classroom: Requirements & Troubleshooting
text:
Overwrite changes that teachers make to their courses, such as the course name or manual changes to enrollments   Sync any Guardian info to Classroom or modify/overwrite any Guardian data
>  
> If you are already the district administrator for a Clever account, you can  r equest Google Classroom Roster Import from your Clever Dashboard > Applications > Add Applications page. Districts interested in Classroom rostering who don't already use Clever can create a Clever account  here to request the application. > Requirements
>  
> Districts must have a Google Standard Edition or Google Workspace for Education Plus  subscription for staff and students in order to utilize the Google Classroom roster import application via Clever. If your district has questions about upgrading to Education Plus, please contact  na-k12-gwfe@google.com . > If your district has a paid 'legacy' subscription (also called “G Suite Enterprise for Education”) for staff and students then your district has access to this tool. To maintain access your district will need to renew the Education Plus tier when you are up for renewal. > One of your district's Clever Admins will need to coordinate with your district’s Google Workspace Super Administrator  for the initial setup of Google Classroom roster import. > The domain for the Super Admin (\_ ex @school.org\_) must match the domain for your teacher's Google Accounts (also @ school.org ). For more info, see the setup guide here . > If you’re interested in finding out about your Google Workspace subscription or for help identifying your Google Workspace Super Admin, please log into your Google admin console . Teachers, students and the Super Administrator can be in different subdomains, but they must all be part of the same primary domain . The application requires all Classroom users to have their Email field in Clever populated with the Google email. The emails need to already be provisioned.

title: Clever + Google Classroom: Requirements & Troubleshooting
text:
This Classroom rostering application does not generate any user accounts. > For help with generating user accounts, read here for more info on Clever IDM! >  
> Teacher Experience
> Once rostering is turned on for Google Classroom then teachers will have the option to accept Clever-created courses. They can also reject them and continue managing their rosters manually. Courses created outside Clever will not be modified or deleted by the Clever connection. > Troubleshooting Errors on the Sync History page
> If you notice that some rostering data is not successfully populating within Google Classroom automatically, please review the Google Classroom roster import Sync History page  of your Clever Dashboard. From that page, you will be able to download CSV files of the sync errors or successfully synced reports:
>  
>  Please note: When sections match, we may or may not have updated the class. It'll also show as an update, but this doesn't mean that anything changed. It's just indicating that it is the new current state of the Google Classroom class. >  
> Below are some sync errors you might see, what they mean, and how you can resolve them! > Error: 403: @CannotDirectAddUser - Unable to directly add the user to the course. Please check that the user account exists and is within the course admin's domain. > Reason:  The user can’t be added because they are in a different domain (e.g. gmail.com or @ student.school.org ) or their Google account could not be found. Resolution:  Look up the user’s email in Clever and Google and make sure the user’s email address matches an active, already-created Google account that belongs to the primary Workspace domain. > Error: 400: @UserAccountSuspended - The user account specified in the request is suspended
> Reason:  The user's Google account has been suspended. The user is still active in the SIS/Clever data and being shared with Google Classroom roster import.

title: Clever + Google Classroom: Requirements & Troubleshooting
text:
Resolution:  Check Google and the SIS to ensure that the user account is active in both systems or is removed in Clever. >  
> Error: 403: The caller does not have permission – unable to create Course because of issue with primary teacher
> Reason: The teacher account has not been created in Google Workspace or is in a separate domain than the Super Admin. Resolution:  Contact Google Workspace Support if you need help managing your synced users and subdomains. Teacher accounts should be created before syncing and the Super Admin should be able to manage all of the users who are synced with Classroom roster import. >  
> Error: 400: @JoiningUserNotEnabledForRosterImport Joining user is not enabled for SIS Roster Import via the current integrator (Clever). > Reason: Unable to import user due to insufficient licenses or roster import settings. Resolution: Please ensure the target user has sufficient workspace licenses and is managed by the connected Google service account. In addition, please ensure Clever is enabled for roster import: in Google Admin Console, go to Apps > Google Workspace > Settings for Classroom > Roster Import, and select ON-CLEVER. > Error: 403: Request had insufficient authentication scopes. Reconnect Clever with a Google Super Admin account. > Reason:  Your latest Google Classroom sync failed because the sync did not have permission from a Super Admin account to modify your data in Classroom. Resolution:   Please visit the settings page  and use the Disconnect button under Google Authentication. Then press the Reconnect button and accept all of the requested permissions with a Google Super Admin account . > Error: 400: Bad Request - invalid\_grant - token has been expired or revoked
> Reason: Your latest Google Classroom sync failed because the connection between Clever and Google Classroom has broken.

title: Clever + Google Classroom: Requirements & Troubleshooting
text:
Resolution:  Please visit the settings page  and reconnect Clever with a Google Super Admin account , making sure to include all of the requested permissions. > Error: 400: admin\_policy\_enforced
> Reason:  Your latest Google Classroom connection failed because your Google Workspace domain has blocked the connection to Clever. Resolution:   Navigate to the Google Workspace Admin console and add this Client ID to your allowlist: 598262247637-f2nenipsam9fohv8dfleifqbgbae8gui.apps.googleusercontent.com  
> Error: Could not remove student: Unknown email for [student Clever ID]
> Reason: This student has been removed from Clever, so the system is unable to remove them from the Google Classroom roster. Resolution: You may need to delete their accounts manually in Google if they're still present on that end, or just ignore these messages if they are already missing there too. >  
> Error: 403: The Super Admin user is not permitted to access Classroom
> Reason:  Your latest Google Classroom sync was unsuccessful because the Google Classroom service is disabled for the Super Admin connected to Clever. Resolution:   Visit the Google Admin Console  to enable the Classroom service for that user. See here  for info about controlling user access to Classroom.​​​​​​
>  
> Error: 400: Precondition check failed - user account is disabled
> Reason:   The student or teacher account is disabled. Resolution:   Check on the status of the user’s account within Workspace. >  
> Error: 404: The course was not found
> Reason:   The user could not be added to the course because the course could not be found. It has been archived or deleted. Resolution:    Contact Clever Support if you need help checking on the status of this course. >  
> Error: Unknown email for the primary teacher on the section. > Reason:   The primary teacher’s email in Clever is unknown to Workspace.

title: Clever + Google Classroom: Requirements & Troubleshooting
text:
Resolution:   Check the email for the primary teacher on the section in Clever and Workspace to make sure it is correct and active in Workspace. >  
> Error: 400: Course member limit reached
> Reason:   The course has reached the limit of active users tied to it. Resolution:   The primary teacher can add or remove co-teachers manually. The sync will not add teachers as long as the course member limit has been reached. See this article  for more information. >  
> Error: 400: User course limit reached
> Reason:   The user has reached the limit on the number of courses joined and cannot be added to this course. Resolution:   The user cannot be added as long as the limit on the number of courses joined has been reached. Check in Clever and Classroom to determine why this user is tied to a high # of courses. See this article for more information. >  
> Error: 400: Cannot remove course owner
> Reason:   The course owner may not be removed. Resolution:   If you'd like to remove a teacher from a class, transfer the ownership  of the class to another teacher, then remove the teacher. >  
> Error: 400: Ineligible Course Owner
> Reason:   Only a teacher with a valid account can be invited as owner of a course. Resolution:  Verify that the requested owner has an active Google account. If they do, please contact Clever support . >  
> Error: 404: Requested entity was not found
> Reason:   The course or user could not be found in Google Classroom. Resolution:  The course that couldn’t be found may have been declined, archived, or deleted. The teacher can create the course manually. For ‘user not found’ check if the email in Clever matches an existing account in Google Workspace. >  
>  Using the Google Classroom Course Information Lookup Tool
> You can follow these steps to determine the current state that a course is in, within Google Classroom, from inside of the Clever Dashboard! 1. Navigate to the Profile View for a section in your Clever Dashboard.

title: Clever + Google Classroom: Requirements & Troubleshooting
text:
A quick way to do this is to search for and navigate to a section via the search bar at the top of Clever Dashboard: 2. On the section’s profile page - scroll down to the Google Classroom Course Information lookup tool. 3. Click the button to look up the current state of the Course within Classroom: 4. Note the Google ID # and Google State. These can be used for further troubleshooting and to understand the current status of a Course:   5. Here is information about the different Course ‘states’ that you could see: Active: The course is active. Archived: The course has been archived. Teachers can un-archive courses themselves. Provisioned: The course has been created, but not yet activated. It is accessible by the primary teacher and domain administrators, who may modify it or change it to the ACTIVE or DECLINED states. Declined: The course has been created, but declined. See below for instructions on how to reprovision a declined or archived course. > As-needed: Reprovision any courses that teachers declined by accident
> Be sure to let your teachers know that they need to accept the synced courses in Google Classroom! If you need to reprovision any courses that teachers declined or archived by accident, Clever Admins can do that from the section's profile page in the Clever Dashboard:   
> FAQ
> What will the courses be named when they sync to Google Classroom? > Clever-created courses will utilize the section name in Clever as the course name in Google Classroom. You can also customize the course names directly from the Google Classroom roster import settings tab in your Clever Dashboard using fields that already exist in the data you sync to Clever. Teachers can modify this course name if they want, and their changes will not be overwritten by the sync. > How are students and teachers matched between Google Workspace and Clever? > Google Classroom rostering matches users between Clever and Google based on the email field in Clever and emails in Google Workspace.

title: Clever + Google Classroom: Requirements & Troubleshooting
text:
This means that all Classroom users must have the Email field in Clever populated with their Google email in order to utilize this rostering method. Students or teachers that do not exist in Google Workspace will not be associated with Classroom courses. > What happens if a student or teacher exists in Clever but does not exist in Google Workspace? > The Google Classroom rostering app will not create, modify, or delete user accounts based on Clever data. Accounts must be created in Google Workspace for Education for them to be rostered to Google Classroom courses. Once an account in Google Workspace is created for the student or teacher, they will be added to their courses. > Can we manage when the Google Classroom roster import application will start syncing and creating courses in Classroom? > Yes, during the setup you can configure your first sync date. Courses will only be visible to teachers once this first sync is complete. > What if some of my district’s teachers want to continue manually managing their Classrooms? > Teachers can decline Clever-created courses and continue manually managing their rosters. Courses created outside Clever will not be modified or deleted by the Clever connection. The Clever team can’t help troubleshoot courses that are manually managed by teachers. >  
> How can I view manual changes that teachers have made in Google Classroom? > You can view and track these changes on Google Classroom's audit and investigation page. Instructions can be found here: Classroom log events . > Do co-teachers sync with the classroom? > Yes, co-teachers for sections in Clever will automatically sync to courses created by Clever as long as their email address in Clever matches their Google email address. > Can I use sharing rules to control which schools or sections are rostered in Classroom? > Yes! Clever will provision Classroom courses based on section data that is shared with Google Classroom rostering.

title: Clever + Google Classroom: Requirements & Troubleshooting
text:
You can use sharing rules to prevent certain types of sections from being synced, or to ensure that only the right schools are synced. > Will this application share guardian information with Google? > No, guardian information will not be shared with Google Classroom rostering via this application. > Can Clever help me create user accounts in Google Workspace? > The Google Classroom rostering app does not provision user accounts in Google Workspace. For Identity Management options via Clever, please contact Clever Support. > What happens if a teacher accidentally declines a Clever-created course? > Clever-created courses can only be declined if a teacher makes multiple clicks and confirms their intention to decline. If you need to restore a declined course, re-provision the course per the instructions above . > Is this connection available to schools with Google Workspace for Education Fundamentals? > This integration is not available to schools with Google Workspace for Education Fundamentals. > Is Google Workspace for Education Plus different from GSuite Enterprise for Education? > Google Workspace for Education Plus is the rebranded name for G Suite Enterprise for Education. All customers who previously purchased G Suite Enterprise for Education will receive new features and functionality that are released to the new Google Workspace for Education Plus editions. > Can students remove themselves from a class? Will they be re-added on the next sync if they do? ​​
> You can adjust unenrollment settings for Google Classroom so students cannot remove themselves from a class. Learn more here . If a student unenrolled themselves prior to you toggling this feature off in Google Classroom, Clever's sync will not re-add the student. They will need to be added back manually. > How often is the sync from Clever to Google Classroom? > The sync runs on a nightly basis. The sync will also run after each SIS sync and after any changes to sharing permissions.

title: Clever + Google Classroom: Requirements & Troubleshooting
text: > Can I pause the sync between Clever and Google Classroom? > Yes! You can configure a sync pause for the Google Classroom roster import application in your Clever Dashboard > Google Classroom roster import > Settings. If you do not see the screen pictured below, please contact Clever Support. This option is intended for semester rollovers when enrollments are still being finalized. > What happens to courses that are removed from sharing rules? > If the course has already been accepted or declined by a teacher, there is no effect. If the course has not yet been accepted or declined by the teacher, the course is removed from the list of provisioned courses that the teacher can review. If the course is re-shared in the future, the course will again appear in the list of courses the teacher can either accept or decline

title: For Clever Admins: Syncing students’ preferred names

section: For Clever Admins: Syncing students’ preferred names
text:
> Note: Title For Clever Admins: Syncing students’ preferred names URL Name 000001464 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Syncing preferred name data 3. Viewing preferred names in Clever 4. The student and teacher experience 5. Syncing preferred names as extension data 6. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
> Overview
> School districts using SFTP , SIS-Managed Auto Sync , or Infinite Campus API Sync OneRoster 1.2 sync type can sync preferred first, middle, and last names in their student data to Clever. > For example, if a student’s legal name is Jacob, but they go by Jake, you can sync Jake as their preferred first name. > When you sync preferred name data, this shows up in the students’ Clever Portal and in applications that accept this data. Some applications may not accept preferred name data. > Please note: Clever previously had a feature that allowed students to change their name in their Clever Portal. Preferred name syncing replaces this feature, and students can no longer change their names themselves. >  
> Syncing preferred name data
> To sync preferred name data, include one or more of the following fields in your Clever sync for students:
> preferred\_last\_name
> preferred\_middle\_name
> preferred\_first\_name 
> For more on exporting these fields, you can find specific information based on your sync type:
> SFTP Syncs: Overview
> SIS-Managed Auto Syncs
> Infinite Campus API Sync  
> Once you’ve synced preferred name field(s), you must go into each application and share the field(s) , as preferred name is considered a sensitive field. See here for information on sharing sensitive fields . If you don't see the field as an option in your field access settings for a specific application, this means that the application doesn't accept the preferred name field at this time. Please contact Clever Support to determine if you can utilize an extension field instead .

title: For Clever Admins: Syncing students’ preferred names
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Syncing students’ preferred names
section: For Clever Admins: Syncing students’ preferred names
text:
>  
> Viewing preferred names in Clever
> As a Clever Admin, you can view a student's preferred name (if populated) by comparing their Profile Page in your Clever Dashboard to the name in their Clever Portal. Start by going to: Clever Dashboard > search for student > student’s profile page . Note the name syncing at the top of their Profile Page. This will be values provided in the first\_name and last\_name fields of your data sync. Next, head to the top right corner of the Profile Page and click Support Tools > Access Portal as user and review the name in the top right corner of the student's Portal. If the preferred name is syncing, it will display in the Portal and be different than the synced name on their Profile Page. >  
> The student and teacher experience
> Students
> Students can see their name in the upper right corner of their Clever Portal:
> Students can also see their preferred name in applications if that app accepts and shares preferred names. > Teachers
> The students’ preferred name (if populated) will show up on the teacher’s Clever Portal on the My Students > Student Roster page. >  
> Syncing preferred names as extension data
> If an application doesn't currently accept preferred names as a field, but you'd like to send preferred names, you can provide the preferred names to Clever via an extension field. > Depending on your sync method with Clever, there are a few options you can consider for uploading extension data to Clever. Learn more about  extension data here . > Once the extension data is in Clever, our support team can assist with providing this data to your learning applications as the name fields for your students. Please  contact Clever Support  with questions or to further explore your options for adding preferred names as extension data to sync to your learning applications. >  
> Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
> Can students change their names themselves? > No, this feature has been sunsetted.

>  
> Do preferred names show up in Class Analytics? > Presently, preferred name does not show up in Class Analytics. >  
> Is it possible to sync teachers’ preferred names? > Presently, this feature is only available for students.

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001465?language=en_US#section1) 
2. [How does this affect current Clever customers?](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001465?language=en_US#section2) 
3. [Will there be any changes to Clever’s existing data privacy policies?](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001465?language=en_US#section3) 
4. [When will Clever rostering and SSO be available for my international customers (school districts)?](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001465?language=en_US#section5) 
5. [How will Kahoot! and Clever integrate their platforms?](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001465?language=en_US#section6)

Kahoot!, a global learning platform company, recently acquired Clever, Inc. The partnership between the two companies, with distinct and highly complementary offerings, provides improved learning solutions and offerings for U.S. schools and districts while accelerating the global expansion of Clever's solutions. Clever's big vision includes reaching even more students and working on new ways to make learning more enjoyable. We are thrilled that joining the Kahoot! Group will make that vision a reality even sooner.

---

title: Clever + Kahoot!
heading_path: How does this affect current Clever customers?
section: How does this affect current Clever customers?
text:
While we're excited about the changes, rest assured that we haven't changed. Clever is continuing to do what we do best. Our team's dedication to incredible customer support and reliability is unchanging. Our industry-leading commitment to student data privacy, security, and compliance is only getting stronger and will continue to be a key focus when scaling internationally. Finally, our innovative business model (i.e., working with our app customers to offer Clever's Digital Learning Platform to districts for free) isn't changing. We're remaining an open platform, accessible to all schools and companies.  
We do not expect that the acquisition will result in any significant changes at this time (or in the future) for existing Kahoot! or Clever customers. Both Kahoot! and Clever customers can expect business as usual and continue using both platforms as they did before. Over time, the ambition is to deliver an even more robust experience for all customers on the platform. The Clever platform will continue to be an open platform.

---

title: Clever + Kahoot!
heading_path: Will there be any changes to Clever’s existing data privacy policies?
section: Will there be any changes to Clever’s existing data privacy policies?
text:
Clever remains fully committed to honoring all of the privacy practices documented in our current privacy policy as well as the commitments we've made to protect student data while complying with COPPA, FERPA, state student data privacy laws, and all contractual agreements. However, as Clever's international presence grows, we will need to expand our privacy and security compliance and data management programs to comply with local laws in other countries. As a result, you will likely see changes to our privacy policy as these additional protections are implemented. The acquisition will not impact Clever's privacy practices for our U.S. clients and partners. Clever's school, district, and student data will be protected as it is today and will not be impacted by the acquisition by Kahoot!. **All U.S. student data will continue to be stored in the U.S.**

---

Learn more about using Clever internationally [here](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202043013).

---

We are actively building a plan for how Kahoot! and Clever will operate synergistically, including with regard to partner integrations. We are two companies with the potential to grow stronger, empowering users (e.g., districts, schools, teachers, students, parents, and lifelong learners) globally with industry-leading EdTech tools and resources. Our two teams will have a talent force of over 500 employees, leveraging deep application and product development expertise, technology, marketing, and engineering capabilities to deliver innovative solutions to customers worldwide. Kahoot! 's global learning community will also have the opportunity to discover the benefits of Clever, while Clever's app partners will be able to reach an international audience through Kahoot! 's global presence.

title: Clever IDM: Overview
text:
Clever IDM helps districts automate account provisioning and lifecycle management for Microsoft Active Directory, Entra ID, and Google Workspace. This affordable new offering provides school districts with a simple workflow that can be completed in minutes to automate organizational unit (OU) and account management directly with Clever. Additionally, if you use Clever IDM with Google you can manage free Fundamentals, Fundamentals-archive, and Gmail-only licenses via Clever as well. Any paid Google license types can be managed via the [Google License Manager](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001707).

Clever IDM automatically syncs users from your SIS to Active Directory, Entra ID, or Google daily for an entire year. Your Clever IDM Dashboard can be found [here](http://schools.clever.com/identity-management).

---

For more information on pricing, please contact our team [here](https://www.clever.com/security-consultation). There are no additional costs if you want to manage users in multiple destinations (e.g. Google, Entra ID, and Active Directory).

Districts can try out Clever IDM prior to purchase.  After configuring the solution and viewing a free preview of their sync, IT administrators can purchase Clever IDM directly in the Clever App Store, without any involvement from a salesperson, if desired.

Clever’s digital learning platform (including single sign-on, rostering, messaging, and analytics) remains completely free for districts.

---

title: Clever IDM: Overview
text:
To start using Clever IDM you must have your SIS sync to Clever set up. You can learn more about this requirement and [additional prerequisites to setting up Clever IDM here](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001561).

For detailed instructions on the setup process, use the following resources:

Clever IDM helps districts automate account provisioning and lifecycle management for Microsoft Active Directory, Microsoft Entra ID, and Google Workspace. This affordable new offering provides school districts with a simple workflow that can be completed in minutes to automate organizational unit (OU) and account management directly with Clever. Clever IDM automatically syncs users from your SIS to Active Directory, Entra ID, or Google daily for an entire year. Your Clever IDM dashboard can be found [here](http://schools.clever.com/identity-management).

A full overview of Clever IDM and the setup process can be viewed below:

---

title: Clever IDM: Google Setup
text:
You can work through setting up your IDM configuration at any time; however, you won’t be able to complete the setup to start provisioning accounts without review from an onboarding specialist or our support team. Our team must review your setup before your first provision to protect your destination accounts and prevent issues with SSO for your end users. Contact your onboarding specialist for configuration review. If you're not sure who to contact, reach out to [Clever Support](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360001041326).

**![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TJC9&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028BpB)**Click on the following links to find information about: 
• [Setting IDM login credentials](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001605) 
• [Organizing OUs](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001603)  
• [Building sub-OUs with the IDM format builder](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001603#header3)

In order to provision accounts, Clever must be granted access to manage the provisioning of users on your domain. The user authorizing the access request must have the ability to grant the following permissions:

- View and manage the provisioning of users on your domain
- View and manage organization units on your domain
- View domains related to your customers

![Connect to Google to start setup](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TJC9&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000004aLgr)

title: Clever IDM: Google Setup
text:
If you encounter either of the following errors (screenshots), please ensure that the Google Account you are connecting to Clever has the right level of access. For more information, see: [For Clever Admin: Minimum Google Admin access required to set up Clever IDM](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001681?language=en_US).

![Connect to Google error message](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TJC9&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000004YyAR)

![Connect to Google error message](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TJC9&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000004YyAb)

---

**Select your IDM Management Level**

Next, choose whether you’d like to set up **Full Provisioning and Password Management** or **Password Management Only**. Both options support Identity Management in Clever—it just depends on what works best for your district’s timing and goals.

**Full Provisioning and Password Management**

This option automates account security and password management through Clever IDM. Since it requires more setup time, many districts choose this path at the beginning of the school year or during a long break. It’s best for:

- Automatically provisioning, updating, and archiving user accounts
- Configuring password reset, account recovery, and account claiming settings
- Building and maintaining OUs and groups from your SIS data

**Password Management Only**

This lighter setup gives you access to Clever’s secure password management tools for matched users, with the flexibility to configure it at your own pace.

It includes the same powerful IDM matching and collision detection as the full setup to ensure the right Clever user is matched to the right destination user—but requires less time to implement. It’s best for:

- Piloting Clever IDM or starting setup mid-year
- Accessing Clever’s password management tools
- Managing matched users between systems

---

title: Clever IDM: Google Setup
text:
Clever IDM can provision accounts for students, teachers, and staff. You may select for Clever to provision accounts for one or more of the following:

**Students** 
Students are users that are enrolled as students in educational courses or sections.

**Teachers** 
"Teachers" is the term Clever uses to refer to a district's instructional staff. These are the individuals that are directly managing a classroom and students.

**Staff** 
"Staff" is the term Clever uses to refer to both non-instructional staff (e.g. secretaries, bus drivers, counselors) and instructional staff that are not directly in charge of a classroom (e.g. school tech leads, instructional coaches, and principals). These users are often a different employment designation than teachers and may even be managed outside the Student Information System (SIS) in a HR Information System (HRIS)

**Users with multiple user roles** 
If a user is assigned to multiple user roles (i.e. Teacher and Staff) in Clever, they will be provisioned a Google account if either role is selected for Clever IDM provisioning. If the district chooses to provision accounts for both teachers and staff *and* a user is assigned to both teacher and staff roles in Clever, during Clever IDM setup the district will be able to select the primary role to be used for OU and group structure.

**Users with existing Google accounts** 
Users with the same email address in Clever and Google will be matched/organized in the OU structure as outlined in step: “Organize Google OUs”. Clever will NOT update the email address for existing Google accounts. To ensure accurate matching, please confirm accurate email addresses are synced to Clever from your student information system (SIS) prior to enabling Clever IDM.

title: Clever IDM: Google Setup
text:
Additionally, Clever IDM allows you to customize which subsets of users that you would like to provision. If you would like to filter by user type, grade, school, or extension field please contact Clever Support so that we can make those adjustments for you.

**Graduation rollover date**

If Clever IDM is set to manage your students, you will be prompted during this step to configure a graduation rollover date.

![Screenshot of IDM graduation year rollover prompt](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TJC9&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl000007Wipu)

If you do not sync student graduation year directly from your SIS, Clever IDM will use this rollover date to calculate a graduation year for use in formulas. To ensure that this calculation associates your data with the correct school year, set a graduation rollover date. Clever IDM calculates the graduation year based on the student’s synced grade level. Data synced before the graduation rollover date will be associated with the previous school year for graduation year calculations. Data synced after the graduation rollover date will be associated with the upcoming school year for graduation year calculations. Providing a graduation rollover date enables Clever IDM to automatically update any information based on the graduation year (OUs, groups, etc.) as grade levels change during rollover. If your expected graduation rollover date changes, you can edit the graduation rollover date anytime by navigating to your **Select Users** step in Clever IDM.

---

title: Clever IDM: Google Setup
text:
There are two pathways for Clever to set user data in IDM: creation and user modification.

**Creation**

In the case of user creation, the following fields are synced to Google:

- User first name
- User last name
- User type (student, teacher, staff)
- Primary email address as configured by the district
- Organizational unit as configured by the district
- Initial password as configured by the district

All newly created users are assumed to be unsuspended.

**Modification**

If a user exists in both Clever and Google data, IDM will optionally update the user. Updates occur when a user's first name, last name, user type, or organization unit changes. When updating a user, the following fields are synced:

- User first name (if changed)
- User last name (if changed)
- Organizational unit as configured by the district (if changed)
- Suspension status
 - Suspended if a user exists in the Google Directory under a managed OU but not in the most recent Clever dataset.
 - Unsuspended if a user was previously suspended (i.e., not in the Clever dataset) but has been restored in the Clever dataset within 300 days.
- Archive management
 - Users with free Fundamentals, Fundamentals-archive, and Gmail-only licenses will have their archive behavior managed by Clever IDM. Users with paid licenses will have their archive status managed via the [Google License Manager](https://schools.clever.com/license-manager).
 - You'll be able to select the archive behavior of users with a free license to one of three options in Clever IDM:
 - Move to archive OU, suspend, and archive
 - Move to archive OU and suspend
 - Move to archive OU
 - For Gmail-only licenses, we recommend having IDM move the users into an OU with automatic license assignment turned on for the Gmail-only license. Clever IDM does not directly manage Gmail-only licenses.

If you have questions or comments about the visibility of these attributes or would like additional attributes to be set by IDM, please contact Clever Support.

---

We now provide SFTP access to user emails managed by Clever IDM. The SFTP files can be accessed by enabling Participation Reports, and the associated SFTP server as described in [this article](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360049642311?language=en_US). 
The CSV files in the SFTP server contain mappings of user emails to their Clever ID, SIS ID, and User Type. Districts can use these files to personally build automation for write back into their SIS on their end. Clever does not support direct SIS write back automation outside of the above documentation.

---

title: Clever IDM: Google Setup
text:
Clever IDM can now manage users’ memberships in Google workspace Groups – including both security and distribution groups. Please note that this doesn't create groups.

**Setting up** 
​In order to set up group membership management, you will need to start by confirming the groups you want managed in Google are properly configured.

All Clever-managed groups must have unique names. As well, if you want to set up a rule to put users into different groups, the relevant group names must follow the same conventions. For example, if you want a rule set up that will add each user to a group for their school, the relevant groups need to be consistently named – e.g. “Toll Gate Elementary - Students”, “Hopewell Valley High School - Students”.

If this isn’t possible for your district, please reach out to let us know. There are some more complicated setups that we can support.

**Membership rules** 
When you reach out to Clever Support to set up group membership management, we’ll ask you for the membership rules you want to create and the groups you’d like Clever IDM to manage. You can set up one or more membership rules for each user type you provision in IDM.

---

The summary page will display all the selections made for each user type for both user account settings and organizational structure (OUs).

Confirm that all boxes for the user types that should be provisioned are marked ![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TJC9&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000003BmEL)

Select **Preview Google Accounts** once all selections have been confirmed.

---

title: Clever IDM: Google Setup
text:
Clever will generate a preview of the number of users that will be created or updated. Additionally, the system will flag any potential issues. When the preview is done generating, it is downloadable as a CSV file from the setup guide.

You can also check on specific accounts that will be created/updated to ensure that they follow the process you'd like, via IDM Preview Sync Visualizer. Learn more about [IDM Preview Sync Visualizer here](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001528).

You’ll see a note in your account that IDM Provisioning is disabled and requires review from a Clever specialist. Our team must review your setup before your first provision to protect your destination accounts and prevent issues with SSO for your end users. Please reach out to your onboarding specialist with any questions or for review of your preview before provisioning. If you're not sure who to contact, please reach out to [Clever Support](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360001041326).

**Purchase Summary** 
The purchase summary will display the estimated total per year for Clever IDM. Please note, this number is subject to change based on the number of user accounts managed and does not include sales tax.

After reviewing the results, select **Purchase Clever IDM** to proceed to the checkout flow and begin provisioning

---

After your initial Clever IDM sync, you can continue to track changes to your users via the [User management > Clever IDM > Events tab](https://schools.clever.com/identity-management). On this tab, you can select a date range for which you’d like to review Clever IDM creates, updates, archives, and matched users. You can also apply filters to examine changes by destination (if you have multiple configured), event type (create, update, etc.), or specific users by name or SIS ID.

Once you find the event for the user and destination you’d like to review, click the dropdown arrow next to the event to examine more details.

title: Clever IDM: Google Setup
text:
**How long does setup typically take?**

- Setup time depends on the number of students in the district, and the amount of customization required. Smaller accounts with no customization can be set up within 30 minutes, while larger accounts will take longer.
- Implementation varies greatly depending on the overall quality of data in Clever, if additional data is required, the Clever Admin’s access to features at the district such as firewalls, servers, SIS data, etc.

**Can I provision for multiple destinations?**

- Yes, Clever IDM can be used to provision multiple destinations such as both Google and Active Directory at no additional cost per user.

**Does Clever IDM change anything about my SIS to Clever data sync?**

- No, the sync between your SIS and Clever will remain the same. However, email addresses created by Clever IDM will be stored as part of your Clever data.

**What if I want to manage non-teaching staff with Clever IDM, but they aren't stored in my student information system (SIS)?**

- There are various options for syncing staff users, including CSV files, custom data, or an Active Directory sync. [Learn more in our article about adding staff to Clever](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/229253547).

**Does Clever IDM change anything about existing single sign- on (SSO) access to applications?**

- No, SSO access will remain the same. It may run more smoothly with the automated provisioning of user accounts.

**Can we maintain our current user email addresses?**

- Yes! Work with your IDM Onboarding Specialist to maintain email addresses.

**When formatting the password in the Clever IDM set-up, is this simply to create new passwords, or will this reset passwords across the entire domain?**

- The password format will only be used for new accounts which are provisioned - this will not reset existing passwords.

**Will our email addresses and passwords sync back to our SIS?**

title: Clever IDM: Google Setup
text:
- No, Clever IDM provides automated syncing only in one direction (from Clever to your destination). You are able to download a CSV file of usernames via the Clever IDM page to upload to your SIS.

**Does Clever IDM automatically calculate Graduation Year for students?**

- If synced to Clever, IDM will use the **Graduation\_year** field from your SIS. Otherwise, IDM will automatically calculate Graduation Year for students K-12 based on the student **Grade** field. In calculating graduation year, PreKindergarten and TransitionalKindergarten will be treated as grade -1.
- Students in the following grade levels will NOT have a Graduation Year unless provided by the district: InfantToddler, Preschool, 13, PostGraduate, Ungraded, Other.

**Why do I see a note that my IDM provisioning is disabled?**

- To protect your destination accounts and prevent SSO issues, our team must review your IDM setup before your first provisioning. Please reach out to the Clever team if you have any questions or to review your sync before you provision for a new destination.

**What are the minimum required permissions for the Google Admin role used to set up Clever IDM?**

- Please view this article: [For Clever Admin: Minimum Google Admin access required to set up Clever IDM](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001681).

**What if my question is not answered here?**

- Check out our Clever Academy course, Quick Start - Getting started with Clever IDM for [Setup FAQs](https://clever.academy/quick-start-idm/1031502?user_type=district_admin) and [Troubleshooting FAQs](https://clever.academy/quick-start-idm/1031504?user_type=district_admin) or reach out to Clever Support.

**I can’t find the functionality I’m looking for. What should I do?**

- Reach out to our teams at [support.clever.com](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360001041326). The functionality may be available on the back end. If not, we may be able to add new functionality.

![Clever Academy.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TJC9&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000035fcv) 
Interested in deep-diving into how to best use Clever and Google together? Check out our course, [Clever & Google: Secure Connected Classroom Certification](https://clever.academy/clever-google-cert?user_type=district_admin) available in Clever Academy!

---

title: Clever's Business Model
text:
Clever’s digital learning platform, which 77% of US K-12 districts use to connect to their digital learning resources, is and always will be free for schools globally.  The free digital learning platform includes rostering, single sign-on, the Clever Portal, and Analytics all in one place. 
We believe that technology has the ability to empower teachers, create new ways to learn, and improve education outcomes for all students.  And we believe everyone - all students -  should be able to access EdTech quickly and securely.

Our innovative business model is why we can offer Clever’s digital learning platform to districts for free.  We’re grateful to application partners who use and [pay Clever](https://clever.com/pricing) for secure, automated rostering so that educators and students can seamlessly log in to their digital learning resources for free.  We also work with our application partners to ensure their pricing is not higher for districts that use Clever.

We continue to provide world-class training and support at no cost.  This includes self-paced, on-demand training for district administrators, school tech leads, and teachers on how to get started with Clever. Plus, find documentation customized for your role in our help center, or open a ticket with our dedicated support team.

[Clever gives educators transparency, visibility, and control over data sharing](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202393058?language=en_US). Student data is used only for educational purposes at the direction of the district - Clever never sells student data.

---

Districts can add Clever IDM to their free Clever digital learning platform to automate identity management to help keep Google and Active Directory in sync with their SIS.

We heard districts telling us they were looking for account provisioning solutions and wondered if Clever could help solve this problem.  That’s why we developed Clever IDM to provide a simple way to manage accounts. For more information on pricing, please contact [our team here](https://www.clever.com/security-consultation).

We’re proud to offer Clever IDM at a fraction of the total cost of alternative identity management solutions because we want to be able to support all Districts in having access to improve their user security.

---

Districts can strengthen the security of their free Clever accounts by adding Classroom Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)—no second device required. Classroom MFA protects applications that use Clever for single sign-on, using age-appropriate second factors like Clever Badges or login pictures. This applies to the Clever Portal, Google Workspace, and Google Chromebooks.

We designed Classroom MFA to help districts stay ahead of cybersecurity threats without disrupting learning. For more information on pricing, please contact [our team here](https://www.clever.com/security-consultation).

We’re proud to offer an MFA solution built specifically for the classroom—no extra devices needed, making it easy for both teachers and students to use.

This article is a step-by-step walkthrough for setting up Google Classroom roster import via Clever.

Google Classroom roster import helps you securely sync rosters from any SIS and automatically create and update courses in Google Classroom. It is available as an app [in the Clever app gallery](https://schools.clever.com/applications/add/google-classroom-rostering) for any US or Canadian district using Google Standard Education or [Google Workspace for Education Plus](https://edu.google.com/products/workspace-for-education/education-plus/) for staff and students. Your district’s [Google Workspace Super Administrator](https://support.google.com/a/answer/2405986) will need to help set up Google Classroom roster import.

![Clever Academy.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000MFoP&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000035fcv) 
If you'd like step-by-step directions, teacher training resources, and more, check out our [Quick Start Guide on Google Classroom roster import in Clever Academy](https://clever.academy/quick-start-google-classroom?user_type=district_admin)!

---

title: Clever + Google Classroom: Setup guide
text:
Once you've had the [Google Classroom roster import app](https://schools.clever.com/applications/add/google-classroom-rostering) added to your Clever Dashboard, here’s how to proceed. Please note that approval of your request to connect with the app is automated, and can **take around 24 hours to be approved**, so please factor this into your timeline for getting set up!

***To begin, access the setup wizard from the Google Classroom roster import***[***app overview page***](https://schools.clever.com/applications/google-classroom-rostering):

![Clever___Google_Classroom_roster_import.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000MFoP&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000004ZBjF)

**Step 1: Review details and FAQs about Clever’s Google Classroom roster import integration.**

![Step one of Google Classroom roster import integration wizard](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000MFoP&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000E39rW)

**Step 2: Preview your data.** You need student and teacher email addresses in Clever in order to utilize this integration. If email addresses are not stored in your SIS, you will need to [manually upload them via csv file](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115004455026?language=en_US).

![Step two of Google Classroom roster import integration wizard](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000MFoP&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000E2kEp)

Google Classroom roster import uses the following fields to create and roster courses in Google Classroom:

- **students**: email, Clever section id
- **teachers**: email, Clever section id
- **sections:** name, period, sis id, Clever section id
- **optional:** additional fields used in naming the course, see Step 4 for more information

title: Clever + Google Classroom: Setup guide
text:
**Step 3: Sign in to connect your Google account.** Please note that a Google Workspace Super Administrator must complete this setup. The Super Admin whose token is being used needs to have an EduPlus license assigned. 
![Step three of Google Classroom roster import integration wizard](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000MFoP&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000E3JNq)

**Step 4: Configure course names.** By default, course names and periods in Google Classroom are set by your section name and period in Clever. If you think the default name would be unclear to teachers, you can modify the naming convention using our course naming tool. This allows you to configure how courses should be named in Google Classroom by using the fields available in Clever.

![Step four of Google Classroom roster import integration wizard](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000MFoP&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000E3M7B)

Any fields selected must be populated with data or it will result in an error. In the example below, a school district chose **Course Number**, which isn't a required field in Clever. Since this isn't required, the warning box will appear, and if there is an error with any field, it will show in the preview on the right. Additionally, once courses are created and accepted by teachers, the course names will not be updated dynamically again unless a teacher manually changes the course name in Google Classroom.

![Screenshot showing a Google Classroom Roster Import Course Naming error](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000MFoP&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl0000027Pjh)

**Step 5: Enable ‘Clever Roster Import’ in the Google Admin console** and confirm this step is complete within your Clever dashboard.

![Step five of Google Classroom roster import integration wizard](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000MFoP&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000E3GTD)

title: Clever + Google Classroom: Setup guide
text:
**Step 6: Set your sharing permissions** to indicate which users should be connected to Google Classroom roster import. You can roster your entire district, select schools, or even specific users. Please see more about Clever sharing permissions [here](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/203115007?language=en_US).

Many districts prefer to share only the current term's sections to avoid confusion for their teachers.  
See the [course rollover article](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001492) for more information.

![Step six of Google Classroom roster import integration wizard](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000MFoP&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000E3Moj)

**Step 7: Schedule your access dates for teachers and students.**Teachers will see courses when the teacher access date arrives, allowing them to prepare for the upcoming semester. Students will be added to courses on the student access date, allowing them to see the courses teachers have accepted. Data will sync for each user type at 12:30 AM PST/3:30 am EST on the access date input in the application’s settings.

![Schedule access date page](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000MFoP&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl0000006n2r)

If you ever need to go back and modify your configurations, including your first sync date, in the setup wizard, you can go back to it by clicking on this link on the overview page:

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000MFoP&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000003CMH6)

**Step 8: Finished!****Google Classroom courses will be created based on your Clever data.**

When teachers log into Google Classroom, they’ll have the option to approve or reject the Clever-created courses. Teachers will need to 'accept' the courses in order to have them syncing automatically!

With Google Classroom roster import, you can get straight to learning without worrying about the extra work that goes into getting your students set up in their Google Classroom courses!

Once your school sets up the application via Clever, you will no longer need to create classes manually in Google Classroom. Your Classrooms will automatically be created based on your SIS and Clever data.

---

Google Classroom roster import is an application allowing your district to connect data from Clever to your Google Classroom accounts. This means your Google Classroom course names will match Clever section names, and rosters will update automatically as you or your students change classrooms. We save you time by taking these time-consuming tasks off your plate!

---

Google Classroom roster import will be connected to Clever by your district administrator. Once a sync has completed your Google Classroom accounts will be updated with course data that exists within Clever. You will then have the option to accept or decline Clever-created courses in Classroom.

Please note that courses will appear in Google Classroom once your district administrator(s) sync the classes for the term. This will typically be a few days before the start of instruction for students. Keep an eye out for these suggested synced classes and be sure to click **Accept**!

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000FCYj&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000003BvD7)

---

title: For Teachers: Clever + Google Classroom
text:
**Can I still manually create courses in Classroom? Will existing courses that I created be overwritten by Clever-created courses?**

- Teachers can still create courses and will have the option to decline any Clever-created courses and continue managing class rosters manually. Any courses that are created outside the Clever sync will not be edited or deleted by the Clever sync.

**Can I add and remove students from Clever-created courses?**

- Yes! The sync will not overwrite your changes.

**Can I edit the Classroom names that Clever assigned?**

- Yes! The sync will not overwrite your changes.

**Will co-teachers be able to access Clever-created courses? Can I add co-teachers to Clever-created courses?**

- Yes, co-teachers are synced from the Clever data. Primary teachers can also manually add and remove co-teachers on their Clever-created courses in Google Classroom. Co-teachers will not be able to view courses until the primary teacher has accepted the course and it's in an active state.

**What happens if I accidentally decline a Clever-created course?**

- The district admins who manage your district's Clever account can restore courses that you accidentally declined.

**I'm seeing a lot of courses from other terms: can those be removed?**

- You can either archive or decline the courses that you do not want to manage in Google Classroom.

**Is it possible to merge existing classes?**

- This is currently not supported, but we'll update this page if that changes!

---

- [**Check out this training slide deck for more information about what teachers can expect!**](https://bit.ly/google-teacher-deck)
