title: Clever IDM: Sync reports & issue troubleshooting
heading_path: Clever IDM: Sync reports & issue troubleshooting
text:
This article runs through how the Clever IDM sync works and how to identify and resolve issues with your sync.

By default, IDM syncs occur once per day, in the evening hours. At that time, Clever will compare the data in Clever to the accounts in Google, Active Directory, and/or Entra ID and create, update, or archive users appropriately.

- Users added to Clever will have accounts created in Google, Active Directory, and/or Entra ID
- Users deleted from Clever will have their accounts moved to the Archive OU in Google/Active Directory. In Entra ID, the account will be disabled.
- Users updated in Clever will be updated in Google, Active Directory and/or Entra ID if their user or organizational (e.g., school or grade level) attributes are changed.

If you would like to customize your district’s IDM sync time or frequency, contact Clever support.

---

title: Clever IDM: Sync reports & issue troubleshooting
heading_path: Clever IDM: Sync reports & issue troubleshooting
text:
The [Tasks tab](https://schools.clever.com/identity-management) contains a list of issues that need to be resolved for users. Below are the possible tasks and the actions required to resolve them:

- Task: # user/s has/have unsupported characters and their account/s could not be created.; Detail: These users have unsupported characters in fields used to create their email addresses and were not created in Google/AD/Entra.; Action: Contact support to resolve users that have unsupported characters.
- Task: # user(s) has missing fields and their account(s) could not be created; Detail: These users have missing fields in your SIS used to create their email addresses and were not created in Google/AD/Entra.; Action: Please contact support for a list of users with empty fields.
- Task: [User email] already exists in Google/AD/Entra and their accounts could not be created.; Detail: The email already exists in Google/AD/Entra, but has not been matched to an existing Clever user.; Action: If this Google/AD/Entra user is the same as a Clever user, select “Yes match users” If this user is different from an existing Google/AD/Entra user, select “no, create a new account” which will allow you to add a custom email address for this user.
- Task: # of users already exist in Google/AD/Entra and their accounts could not be created.; Detail: There are more than 10 users that already exist in Google/AD/Entra, but have not been matched to an existing Clever user.; Action: Contact support to match more than 25 users.

---

title: Clever IDM: Sync reports & issue troubleshooting
heading_path: Clever IDM: Sync reports & issue troubleshooting
text:
After your initial Clever IDM sync, you can continue to track changes to your users via the [User management > Clever IDM > Events tab](https://schools.clever.com/identity-management). On this tab, you can select a date range for which you’d like to review Clever IDM creates, updates, archives, and matched users. You can also apply filters to examine changes by destination (if you have multiple configured), event type (create, update, etc.), or specific users by name or SIS ID.

Once you find the event for the user and destination you’d like to review, click the dropdown arrow to examine more details.

![Screenshot of example Events page](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000StO9&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000PvnDh)

If you find that Clever IDM is managing a user in an unexpected manner, and you need help troubleshooting, please [contact Clever Support](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360001041326).

Please see the section below on Sync history reports if you’re interested in downloading CSV files to review your Clever IDM sync changes.

---

Below are descriptions of possible issues you may see in your Events or Sync History reports. Please click the dropdown menu for the destination you'd like to review issues for.

Google Issues

title: Clever IDM: Sync reports & issue troubleshooting
heading_path: Clever IDM: Sync reports & issue troubleshooting
text:
- Issue: Conflict with existing email address (conflictWithExistingUser); Description: The user's email in Clever does not match the expected Google email, but an existing Google email match is found, however, we don't have an existing link between the Clever user and Google user.; Resolution: There are 3 options to resolve this:
1. On the Tasks tab, click Yes, match user. This  will create a link between the user’s Clever account and their Google account. 
2. On the Tasks tab, click No. You will be prompted to enter a custom email for the user.
3. Contact support. This option is required if there are more than 25 Conflicts.
- Issue: conflictWithExistingGoogleUser; Description: The email already exists in Google, but has not been matched to an existing Clever user.; Resolution: Options for resolving:
Manually add the email to the sis\_email field for the user.
Click “Yes, match” in the task section of the IDM Dashboard.
Contact support. This option is required if there are more than 25 conflicts.
- Issue: Clever user already has this email address (conflictWithAssignedEmail); Description: Two Clever users have the same email, or an alias for the user in Conflict exists on a different user.; Resolution: Ensure each Clever user has a unique email, or remove the conflicting alias from the target Google account
- Issue: email: unrecognized identifier: email; Description: The user doesn’t have a value for the email field set in Clever.; Resolution: To resolve this issue, you can update the email value in the SIS.
- Issue: Formula (template); Description: Unable to compute template for a user's Google attribute.; Resolution: The user is missing an attribute required in a template. e.g. If the template error is on "OU" and the error is on student.graduation\_year, please ensure you are syncing graduation\_year for that student from the SIS.

title: Clever IDM: Sync reports & issue troubleshooting
heading_path: Clever IDM: Sync reports & issue troubleshooting
text:
- Issue: Incorrect formula format; Description: IDM is not able to complete the action described by the template.; Resolution: This often occurs because there is a missing field, group, etc. Check the Description column of the Issues Report for more specific information about what is missing.
- Issue: password: could not compute password for user; Description: Users could not be created due to password template not being available in Clever data; Resolution: Check the password template. What fields are in the template? If those fields do not exist on the affected user(s), the district must add those fields in the SIS.
- Issue: unsafe archive; Description: This shows when you have more than 20% of users in a user type are flagged for archival. This is shown to prevent accidental archival.; Resolution: Click Archive in the IDM Dashboard under the Tasks tab if you do intend to archive more than 20% of users.
- Issue: googleapi: Error 500: Internal error encountered., backendError; Description: Undetermined; Resolution: Push a manual IDM sync to resolve, or contact Clever Support.

title: Clever IDM: Sync reports & issue troubleshooting
heading_path: Clever IDM: Sync reports & issue troubleshooting
text:
- Issue: LDAP result Code 50 "insufficient access rights"; Description: IDM is unable to provision in AD, LDAP bind account does not have correct permissions. Could be at OU or individual user level.; Resolution: Please see Clever IDM: Connecting to Active Directory via LDAPS for step-by-step directions to fix this issue.
- Issue: LDAP Result Code 51 "Busy"; Description: This is an AD server connection error; Resolution: This will likely go away on the next IDM sync. Push a manual IDM sync to resolve.
- Issue: LDAP Result Code 68 "Entry Already Exists": 00002071: UpdErr: DSID-031B0C65, problem 6005 (ENTRY\_EXISTS), data 0; Description: Indicates a potential Conflict on commonName (cn). Similar error code for a Conflict on userPrincipalName or sAMAccountName. Conflict may occur on longer names where IDM abbreviates UPN/username due to AD’s 20-character limit on sAMAccountName.; Resolution: Search Active Directory for another user with the same CommonName as would be created for this user.
If UPN doesn't match due to IDM's 20-character limit on username, contact support.
- Issue: LDAP Result Code 64 "Naming Violation": 00000057: LdapErr: DSID-0C090EA6, comment: Error in attribute conversion operation, data 0, v3839; Description: The DN structure is incorrect. IDM might be struggling to parse a common name/OU with commas.; Resolution: Correct DN structure. Reach out to Clever Support if you need additional assistance.
- Issue: 400, Unable to update the specified properties for on-premises mastered Directory Sync objects or objects currently undergoing migration. (And other '400' errors); Description: These '400' errors appear to be Azure AD Connect sync blocking IDM from making changes to those users.; Resolution: Turn off Azure AD Connect for these users.

title: Clever IDM: Sync reports & issue troubleshooting
heading_path: Clever IDM: Sync reports & issue troubleshooting
text:
Sync history reports enable you to download a set of CSV files to review your Clever IDM sync changes. These reports have the information reflected on your Events tab, but allow you to filter and edit the data within the files. They're available for the last 30 days on the Sync History tab. For each report, there is an overview of:

- Sync time
- # Creates
- # Updates
- # Archives
- # Issues

Clicking![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000StO9&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000003C88F) under the **Actions** column provides a zip of two CSV files.

- The issues.csv lists all users that were not created due to a Conflict.
- The sync syncreport.csv lists all the users that were created, updated, or archived with their existing and new attributes.
 - In Google/AD, we additionally show OU and group placement and whether an update occurred.

---

Clever administrators can subscribe to Clever IDM email notifications from the [email tab of the Profile page](https://schools.clever.com/profile/emails). Subscription options include weekly reports, daily reports, and issue alerts. By default, Clever Admin owners will be subscribed to weekly reports and issue alerts.

---

title: Clever IDM: Sync reports & issue troubleshooting
heading_path: Clever IDM: Sync reports & issue troubleshooting
text:
If an email address is incorrect in Clever and IDM syncs the incorrect email to your destination, correcting it in the SIS will update the email unless your IDM sync is paused or there is a Conflict.

If your sync is paused or there is a Conflict, the email will not update, so IDM will not write back the corrected email address to the user's Clever profile.

Either unpause the IDM sync or resolve the Conflict and run your SIS sync again to update the email. If you are unable to do either of these, reach out to [Clever Support](https://support.clever.com/) for assistance.

>  
> If your district is already on Clever, you can connect Imagine Learning’s applications by accepting your invite OR following these instructions:
> Log into your Clever Dashboard and select: Applications > Add Applications from the left navigation. Search for Imagine Learning You will then be brought to a page where you can authorize your Imagine Learning request. As Clever SSO and rostering for Imagine Learning is provided at no cost to the district, you can mark that it has already been purchased for the district. You will also be asked if you would like to request a custom Launch Date.

title: Clever + Imagine Learning Setup Guide
text:
The Launch Date is the first day users can see the Imagine Learning icons in their Clever portal. Product access may or may not be available on this day. Once you have made your selections, click Request! > Once you have shared data with Imagine Learning, the Imagine Learning team will set up the initial sync and will reach out to you to discuss communicating with teachers. >  
> Recommended Sharing
> Before sharing:  
> Make sure to match product applications with purchased license counts. Ensure that students and teachers are in their correct grade levels and that classes are updated for the current school year in your Student Information System (SIS). > Imagine Learning recommends that you “Share by Rules” in Clever (you can find more info about “Share by Rules” here ). Create a sharing rule by following these steps:
>  
> Access the Sharing Permissions page for Imagine Learning. To do this, log in to your Clever account and click the icon for Imagine Learning in the sidebar. From the 'Data Sharing' tab, click Share by Rules. Configure your sharing rules by limiting sharing to only the schools, and students that should be synced, and by only sharing sections with the appropriate subject. > For Literacy products we recommend “Homeroom/Advisory” or “English/Language Arts”. For Math products we recommend “Homeroom/Advisory” or “Math”. > Important: To avoid delays in product access, Imagine Learning must receive your updated and completed sharing rules at least 7 business days prior to your target launch date. >  
> Required Fields
> Check the Data Quality tab in your Clever dashboard to see whether you’re meeting the required data fields.

title: Clever + Imagine Learning Setup Guide
text:
Imagine Learning requires the following data fields be sent: Student:
> name district school sis\_id and/or student\_number credentials grade
> Teacher/School Admin/District admin:
> name district school(s) email
> \*A few things to keep in mind for Math Products: 
> In order for teachers to see students, and for student accounts to function properly, students must be assigned to a classroom. Each educator should only be shared as a teacher or staff or a district admin. Accounts shared in more than one role may have the wrong role assigned in-product. Teachers can only be assigned to one school. Students should only be shared with one math class, where possible. Co-teachers are not supported in sections. > FAQs
> Why am I getting a “data warning” or a “data error”? > A data error occurs when the record is incompatible with Imagine Learning’s integration with Clever, and the user or section will not appear in the application. Data Errors must be resolved for users or sections to be successfully processed by the application. Reach out to Clever Support if you have questions about how to resolve your data error. A data warning  occurs when the user or section has a compatibility issue with the application that may result in a degraded app experience. We recommend addressing these issues or contacting the application directly to determine the impact of a particular Data Warning. > Why is a student or teacher missing from Imagine Learning? Please check to see if this user meets the following requirements before reaching out to Imagine Learning:
> In your SIS data In your Clever data Is shared with Imagine Learning in your data sharing permissions
> Please note, for the Math suite, a user may be missing because they are not enrolled or they are assigned to more than one school. What if a teacher (and/or student) already has an Imagine Learning account outside of Clever?

title: Clever + Imagine Learning Setup Guide
text:
When existing Imagine Learning users (both teachers and students) login through Clever, they will be prompted to type in their previous Imagine Learning username and password. Once a user's account has been linked to Clever, any progress previously made on the account will show up when they log in through Clever. Can teachers and students be assigned to multiple school locations? The Math suite only supports educators and students in one school. The Literacy suite supports educators in multiple schools, but not students. Can multiple teachers/staff be assigned to the same course/section? Imagine Learning can support multiple teachers or staff assigned to the same course/section. Are staff supported? Yes, Imagine Learning supports staff with Clever. Who should I ask for help with an issue? If it’s related to data within Clever, or data coming from Clever, please contact Clever. If you are receiving an error message within the Imagine Learning URL, please contact Imagine Learning. > Support Contacts
> Imagine Learning  support@imaginelearning.com Clever support.clever.com (click Support in the bottom right corner and follow the prompts)

1. Navigate to the [Clever Dashboard > Support tools > Troubleshoot sharing](https://schools.clever.com/troubleshoot-sharing) tool

2. Select a user using **Clever ID, SIS ID, Name, or Email**and select the **Application Name**

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TJwv&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028E2g) 
The tool will immediately check if the user is shared

3. Review the **Sharing Status**

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TJwv&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000003CCWL)  
The user is not shared with the application. As a result, they will not have an account created in the application nor will see the application in their Clever Portal.

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TJwv&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000003CCWQ) 
The user is shared with the application. If the application supports rostering, the student will have an account created in the application. If the application supports Single Sign-On (SSO), the user will see the application in their Clever Portal.

4. Review the **Next Steps**

Below the sharing status, Clever will provide recommendations on how to share or unshare an application with a user.

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TJwv&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000003CCdW)

The two most common adjustments are:

**Option 1 (RECOMMENDED):** **Update the user in your student information system (SIS).** 
This usually involves enrolling the student in a specific section or school in your SIS. The most common issue is the user is not enrolled in a section with a specific subject or grade level.

**Option 2: Update the app's sharing rules** 
If a user is not shared, you can always update or add a sharing rule that matches the properties for that user. Directions for updating sharing rules can be found [here](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115000392247).

---

title: For Clever Admins: Troubleshoot Sharing tool
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Troubleshoot Sharing tool
text:
The **Troubleshoot Sharing** tool will run an analysis across all sharing rules for the selected application. For each rule, it will return one of the following match types.

A user will be shared with an application if at least one (1) rule is a "Matching" rule.

- Match type: Description
- Matching: The user matches all the rule's requirements to be shared with the application. Matching rules are outlined in green. Example: The user is associated with a school that is shared. Since this satisfies all criteria for the rule, the user is shared.
- Partial Matching: The user matches some, but not all, the rule's requirements to be shared with the application. Example:  This user is associated with a school that is shared, is enrolled in a section grade is 3-6 , but is not enrolled in a section that section name contains 'math' . Since the user does not meet all criteria, the user is not shared via the rule.
- Non-Matching: The user does not match any of the rule's requirements to be shared with the application Example:  This user is not associated with a section at a school listed. Since the user does not meet any criteria, the user is not shared via the rule.

title: Messaging - Sending Attachments
text:
> Note: Title Messaging - Sending Attachments URL Name 000001481 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Sending attachments 2. Viewing attachments 3. Supported file types and size limits 4. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
>  
> Sending attachments
> Please note: Clever will be discontinuing Clever Messaging by December 31st, 2025 . This will allow our teams to focus on features that enhance our identity platform offerings including new and improved free tools like Substitute Access , Clever Badges , and coming soon, a more streamlined iOS app for students. >  
> Teachers can upload attachments to their messages in Clever Messaging! > Select the paper clip icon to add a file to a message. >  
> Choose the file from your computer that you’d like to attach and select Open . Please note it may take a few seconds for the file to upload. >  
> Add text to your message if you’d like and then press Send ! >  
> You’ll be able to view and download your attachment in the message thread. The attachment can be removed by deleting the associated message. >  
> Viewing attachments
> The recipient will see the attachment icon as well as any text in the thread once the message has been sent. The recipients of the message will be able to download the attached file. For image files, the recipient can click to preview the image before downloading. > Supported file types and size limits
> The following are supported file types that can be uploaded through Messaging: .pdf .doc (and variations) .xls (and variations) .ppt (and variations) .jpg (and .jpeg) .gif .png .svg .mp4 .mov .wmv .mp3 .wav .m4a .flv .txt The maximum file size for attachments is 10 MB. > Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
> Can I attach more than one file to a message? > No. Only one file may be attached per message
> Who can send attachments in their messages? > Teachers and parents can send attachments in their messages. Attachments cannot be sent by students.

> Can I send an attachment in a direct message, or only through an announcement? > Both methods are supported. Attachments can be sent as an announcement or as a direct message to a student or parent!

title: Sync Reports: Error messages
text:
> Note: Title Sync Reports: Error messages URL Name 000001482 Article Body This article contains the following:  1. Overview 2. Schools 3. Students 4. Teachers 5. Sections 6. Contacts / Student Contacts 7. Staff
>  
> Overview
> This article provides more details on the sync errors found in the error files downloadable from the Last Attempted Sync page in the Clever Dashboard. These errors indicate specific records that have failed to sync to Clever as a result of not meeting all requirements to successfully sync to Clever. >  
>  
>  Please note: It is common for the Last Attempted Sync page to display errors, and not all errors need to be resolved. In general, if an error is not impacting user access or causing downstream errors with applications, the error does not need to be resolved. Error counts may change and resolve over time as data changes in your student information system (SIS) throughout the school year. >  
> Schools
> - Error: Description
> - Duplicate school\_id used: School\_id must be unique to each site. If this error occurs, confirm the school\_id is a field in your SIS that is unique to each school site. See our article  this article for step-by-step troubleshooting directions and a video tutorial. > - Missing required field: Schools must have the following fields populated to process: 
> School\_id School\_name School\_number
>  
> Students
> - Error: Description
> - Missing required field: Students must have the following fields populated to process: 
> School\_id Student\_id Last\_name First\_name
> - School "X" not listed in data syncing: This error is rare for students. This indicates the School\_id on the student's profile doesn't match a School\_id in the Schools.csv file. To resolve the error: 
> Confirm the student is enrolled at the correct school site Update export settings for the schools.csv to include the missing school 
> See our article  this article  for step-by-step directions and a video tutorial.

title: Sync Reports: Error messages
text:
>  
> Teachers
> - Error: Description
> - Duplicate teacher\_id used: Teacher\_id must be unique to each teacher. Begin by confirming the teacher\_id is not assigned to another teacher. If the teacher\_id is NOT unique. Correct the user's teacher\_id in your SIS and upload another data set to Clever. > If the teacher\_id is unique, this error is usually the result of the teacher being enrolled at two schools. Most SISs will export a user once per school site. Though this will prompt an error in the sync report, the teacher will successfully be processed into Clever and be connected to all their sections across both schools. As such, the error can be ignored. > See this article for step-by-step troubleshooting directions. > - Missing required field: Teachers must have the following fields populated to process: 
> School\_id Teacher\_id Last\_name First\_name
> - School "X" not listed in data syncing.: This indicates the School\_id on the teacher's profile doesn't match a School\_id in the Schools.csv file. To resolve the error: 
> Confirm the teacher is enrolled at the correct school site Update export settings for the schools.csv to include the missing school 
> See this article for step-by-step directions for troubleshooting. > This error is common for PowerSchool districts. Please see "Missing Staff" in this article for more information on resolving this error. >  
> Sections
> - Error: Description
> - Duplicate section\_id used: Section\_id must be unique to each section. This error is usually an indicator that an alternate field from the SIS should be used for section\_id to ensure the value is unique. If a globally unique identifier (GUID) is not available, consider combining two fields to create a unique value. Example: "section\_id" + "course\_number" + "period"
> See this article for step-by-step troubleshooting directions.

title: Sync Reports: Error messages
text:
> - Missing required field: Sections must have the following fields populated to process: 
> School\_id Section\_id Teacher\_id
> If Teacher\_id is missing, it is usually the result of a missing section assignment in the SIS. This can often occur before the beginning of a school year when teacher hiring and assignments are being finalized. The error will resolve once enrollments are assigned. > - School "X" not listed in the data syncing: This error is rare for sections. This indicates the School\_id on the section's profile does not match a School\_id in the Schools.csv file. To resolve the error: 
> Confirm the section is enrolled at the correct school site Update export settings for the schools.csv to include the missing school 
> See this article for step-by-step troubleshooting directions. > - No students: Sections must have at least one (1) active student enrolled in order to process. This error is common prior to a term when enrollments are still being finalized. This error can also occur if school\_id, section\_id, or student\_id is not consistent across CSV files. > See this article for step-by-step troubleshooting directions. > - Student XXX is not listed in the data syncing.: An enrollment was included in the enrollment.csv for student\_id: XXXX but the student\_id: XXXX does not exist in Clever
>  
> Contacts / Student Contacts
> - Error: Description
> - Duplicate identifier: Contact\_sis\_id must be unique to each contact. This error is usually an indicator that an alternate field from the SIS should be used for contact\_sis\_id to ensure the value is unique. Contact\_sis\_id is optional. If a unique id is not available, we recommend removing contact\_sis\_id from the students.csv
> See  this article for step-by-step troubleshooting directions.

> - Missing required field: Student contacts must have the following fields populated to process: 
> Contact\_name Contact\_type
>  
> Staff
> - Error: Description
> - Missing required field: Staff must have the following fields populated to process: 
> School\_id Staff\_id Staff\_email First\_name Last\_name
> - School "X" not listed in data syncing: This indicates the School\_id on the staff member's profile does not match a School\_id in the Schools.csv file. To resolve the error: 
> Confirm the staff member is enrolled at the correct school site Update export settings for the schools.csv to include the missing school 
> See this article for step-by-step troubleshooting directions.

text:
> Tip: Title For Clever Admins: Downloading & deleting messaging history URL Name 000001483 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Downloading the Messaging history for a student or teacher 3. Viewing the Messaging transcript 4. Deleting messaging transcripts 5. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
> Overview
> Please note: Clever will be discontinuing Clever Messaging by December 31st, 2025. This will allow our teams to focus on features that enhance our identity platform offerings including new free tools like Substitute Access , role-based access control , and access logs . >  
> Clever admins can now download the Messaging history for an individual student or teacher from that user’s Profile page in the Clever Dashboard! >  
>  
> Downloading the Messaging history for a student or teacher
> 1. Navigate to the student or teacher’s profile page in Clever by searching for their name, SIS ID, or Clever ID using the search tool in the upper right-hand corner of your Clever Dashboard. 2. From the student or teacher’s profile page, select Download message history . You should see a notification that an email with the transcript will be sent shortly. 3. An email will be sent with a link to the transcript. Please note that you’ll need to be logged in to your Clever account in order to open the link. The transcript will then open as a CSV file. > Viewing the Messaging transcript
> The transcript will include every message that the user has ever sent, including any messages that were deleted by users. The transcript will not include any messages that were deleted as part of the summer rollover process if you've opted into this (see below).

title: For Clever Admins: Downloading & deleting messaging history
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Downloading & deleting messaging history
section: For Clever Admins: Downloading & deleting messaging history
text:
The transcript file will be organized into four fields:
> - Field: Description
> - Date: The timestamp of the message in UTC-0
> - Sender: The Clever ID of the user that sent the message
> - Recipient: The Clever ID of the user that received the message
> - Message: The message sent from the sender to the recipient
>  
>  
> Deleting messaging transcripts
> Clever retains all messaging transcripts since the messaging product was launched in August of 2020. Districts can  opt in to have messages deleted by navigating here . When this toggle is turned on, the previous school year's messages will be deleted starting after August 1 of the new school year. This toggle will gray out after August 1 until the last year's messages are deleted. > Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
> Will I see any messages that a user has received in the transcript, or will the transcript only list the messages that the user has sent to other users? > Yes! The transcript will contain the messages that the user has received as well as the messages that they have sent. > Can I download the Messaging history for multiple users at one time? > No. Message history can only be downloaded on a per-user basis. > Am I able to delete messages for a user from the Clever Dashboard? > No. This feature allows Clever Admins to view the Messaging history for a user, but not to delete messages. If you need to delete a Messaging thread for a user, please contact Clever Support with the Clever IDs of the sender and recipient and the date of the thread that needs to be deleted, and we will be happy to assist!

title: Clever + ARC Setup Guide
text:
> Important: Title Clever + ARC Setup Guide URL Name 000001485 Article Body 1. Overview of applications 2. Setup process 3. Recommended sharing rules 4. Setting up SchoolPace for co-teachers and support staff 5. FAQ
>  
> Overview of applications
> SchoolPace: SchoolPace is ARC’s analytics platform for schools and districts. This web-based platform is accessed by teachers, school administrators, and district administrators. Teachers use the built-in assessment tools to evaluate student reading skills and record observations. Data is aggregated into graphs and charts to help schools and districts monitor progress. > myARC: myARC is a web-based platform that allows ARC to organize and distribute curricular content, digital books, videos, and other intellectual property securely with educators, families, and students. > ARC Bookshelf: ARC Bookshelf is American Reading Company’s digital book platform, and fully integrated with SchoolPace (for analytics) and myARC (for sharing). Students can read digital books on the web, or on native apps for iOS and Android. > ARC Adventures: ARC Adventures allows students to practice foundational reading skills in a fun, 3D game world. > ARC Reads®-  A student portal for the 100 Book Challenge® and ARC Core® classrooms, offers powerful tools to enhance reading growth, practice, and engagement. With the Digital Logbook, students log their reading practice, receive book recommendations, and track their reading habits. The My IRLA tool identifies where a student might be able to handle text independently through phonics and vocabulary questions. >  Important note: Not all license purchases will include myARC, ARC Bookshelf, ARC Adventures and ARC Reads. >  
> Setup process
> 1. Make sure your district is set up with Clever! If your district has not been set up with Clever, you can get started by going to this link: https://clever.com/signup. 2.

title: Clever + ARC Setup Guide
text:
Submit Implementation Checklist: Once your district’s licenses have been activated, districts and schools will be emailed a link to the “Implementation Checklist”. Districts must complete and submit the “Implementation Checklist” and choose Clever as their rostering method. > 3. SchoolPace Support confirmation email: Once the implementation checklist has been submitted and finalized, SchoolPace Support will email confirming the rostering method and rostering dates, and include information on next steps. 4. Accept Invitations: After submitting the “Implementation Checklist”, the SchoolPace Support team will invite your district or school to Clever. You should see a Clever invite for each application purchased in your email inbox. > 5. Notify SchoolPace Support when Accepting Clever Invitation: Districts and schools should accept the invitation and notify SchoolPace Support of the acceptance. Notifying SchoolPace Support of acceptance helps ensure that syncing with Clever is set up properly. To notify SchoolPace support simply reply to the email sent to you by SchoolPace Support, or email schoolpace@americanreading.com . 6. Set sharing rules: Districts set up sharing rules in Clever. 7. Start syncing:  SchoolPace starts syncing with Clever on the “Rostering Start Date” as provided on the implementation checklist. > Recommended sharing rules
> It’s important to only share the sections that are using SchoolPace in the classroom. The simplest way to do so is to choose “Share by Rules” in Clever. You can create a sharing rule by following these steps:  
> Access the Sharing Permissions page for SchoolPace. To do this, log in to your Clever account and click the icon for the name of the application on the Home page. From the 'Data Sharing' tab, click Share by Rules Select the type of rule you want to create. We recommend choosing “Custom share by section”, as it will allow you to create your own rule that can apply specifically to classes that will be using SchoolPace.

title: Clever + ARC Setup Guide
text:
Create your rule. You can share classes with certain course names or numbers, grades, subjects or schools. > We also recommend using this Help Center article when setting up custom sharing rules. If you need any further assistance setting up sharing rules please contact Clever Support. > Important Notes:
> SchoolPace is the main rostering application. You must set up your rules for SchoolPace and copy those rules over to myARC, ARC Bookshelf, and ARC Adventures to enable sign sign-on (SSO), if purchased. If you set up rules for myARC, ARC Bookshelf, or ARC Adventures that are different from the sharing rules for SchoolPace, there can be access errors. Students can only be in one school at a time. If a student is shared in two classrooms, the classrooms must be in the same school. For example, if you share student A to a homeroom section and an ELA section, the sections must be assigned to the same school. >  
> Setting up SchoolPace for co-teachers and support staff
> Co-teachers: The best way to add co-teachers is to add them as a co-teacher in the Student Information System (SIS) to the section they will be supporting. If you manually add the co-teacher in SchoolPace, they will lose access the next day due to the nightly sync with Clever. SpEd teachers and other support staff: You can manually add users as staff members, through a CSV upload to Clever through your Clever Dashboard , or by creating a custom staff account. When you upload a staff file, they will have admin access. For more information on adding staff users to Clever, check out the following Help Center article: Clever Roles: Staff - How to add to Clever . Once the staff user accounts have been created in Clever, create a sharing rule that will share that staff member with SchoolPace and accompanying apps. > FAQ
> Why is a student or teacher missing from SchoolPace? > Schoolpace is rostered nightly through Clever.

So if a student or teacher was missing from SchoolPace, it may be because they have been removed from the Clever share. If a student is missing from a classroom, check to see if the student is assigned to two classrooms. If a student is assigned to two classrooms, SchoolPace will roster the student in only one of those classrooms. If a teacher doesn’t have access to SchoolPace, check if the section was shared in Clever, and check if there are students assigned to those sections. > I made updates and it’s reflected in Clever. Why don’t I see those changes in SchoolPace? > Changes from Clever will be reflected in SchoolPace the next day. > For support, please email SchoolPace@americanreading.com

title: Managing Rollover with Google Classroom Roster Import

section: Managing Rollover with Google Classroom Roster Import
text:
> Important: Title Managing Rollover with Google Classroom Roster Import URL Name 000001492 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Plan for rollover: pause and access dates, and course archiving 3. Review sharing rules 4. Let your teachers know what to expect! 5. Monitor the sync history page for errors and successfully-synced data 6. Steps to take as-needed 7. Bulk Archive Tool
> Overview
> Google Classroom roster import makes setting up courses in Google Classroom easier than ever for school-year rollover! We’ve created this guide to help ensure that you’re set up for a smooth semester or summer term rollover with Google Classroom roster import. If you’re new to using roster import, be sure to accept your invite and initiate your sync first! You can find an overview of the integration here , and our full setup guide here. > Step 1: Plan for rollover: pause and access dates, and course archiving
> When a district's student information system's (SIS) data rolls over to the new semester or school year, courses are synced automatically with Google Classroom once they are active in Clever and shared with Google Classroom roster import. Once a district  approves its SIS sync hold  and rolls over to the new semester’s rostering data in Clever, those shared sections will create corresponding courses in Google Classroom! >  
> Please note:  If sections are removed from your SIS and Clever account, it won't result in the corresponding Google Classroom course being removed from Google Classroom. The course will remain active unless one of the following occurs: - A Clever Admin archives the section using the Bulk Archive Tool - The section is archived or deleted by the teacher or a Clever Admin  - The section is archived
> However, districts can delay syncing new courses to Google Classroom by pausing their Google Classroom sync and setting teacher and student access dates.

title: Managing Rollover with Google Classroom Roster Import
heading_path: Managing Rollover with Google Classroom Roster Import
section: Managing Rollover with Google Classroom Roster Import
text:
Please note that this pause is separate from any pauses to a district's SIS sync  to Clever. To pause your district's Google Classroom sync, please follow these steps:
> Navigate to the Settings tab of your Google Classroom roster import application. Add a start for your pause. Clever will stop syncing new information to Google Classroom when your start date arrives. Pausing will not remove or change any existing data in Google Classroom. To pause the sync immediately, set the start date to today. By default, the pause start date for Summer 2025 is set to May 30, 2025. Add access to dates for teachers and students. > Teachers will see courses when the teacher access date arrives, allowing them to prepare for the upcoming semester. The teacher will not see students in these courses until the student access date. Students will be added to courses on the student access date, allowing them to see the courses teachers have accepted. If you would like students to see courses as soon as teachers accept them, you can set the access dates to the same day. The sync will run for each user type at 12:30 AM PST/3:30 AM EST on the corresponding access date
> Select the Update option to save the pause start date and access dates. By default the pause end dates for teachers and students were set to your SIS sync pause end dates if configured. > Please select the Clear option to unpause the sync, and the Google Classroom roster import will begin syncing again for both teachers and students. The Google Classroom roster import sync pause is a great tool to use if your district does not want students to see their courses in Google Classroom before schedules are officially announced. Simply set a teacher access date for the day schedules are updated in Clever and set a student access date for the day your district schedule will be released. Please note that previously created courses that are no longer shared can be archived using the Bulk Archive Tool .

title: Managing Rollover with Google Classroom Roster Import
heading_path: Managing Rollover with Google Classroom Roster Import
section: Managing Rollover with Google Classroom Roster Import
text:
> Clever Tip:   For additional tips on preventing students from viewing their schedules prematurely in Clever, please visit this article detailing Clever's  Access Control feature. >  
> Step 2: Review sharing rules
> Navigate to your district's sharing rules for Google Classroom roster import. Do the sharing rules you have in place now work for the coming semester’s data as well? This is a great time to ensure that your district is sharing all necessary courses with Google Classroom. Need help with sharing rules? Clever Support can help. Many districts prefer to share only the current term's sections to avoid confusion for their teachers. See the term rollover article for more information. > Step 3: Let your teachers know what to expect! > This is one of the most important steps! For a great rollout, make sure your teachers know the following three things:
> When they should see courses populated in Google Classroom (and what they look like - see below). Google Classroom courses should be synced within about an hour after your teacher access date arrives. When students will be added to those courses. If your student access date is after your teacher access date, make sure to let teachers know when students will be added - so they don't add them on their own and are prepared for when they appear! That they need to "accept" courses for them to be editable and visible to students. Courses that aren't accepted will not be visible to anyone except their primary teacher. >    
> Step 4: Monitor the sync history page for errors and successfully-synced data
> Navigate to the Sync History page for Google Classroom roster import  to monitor the courses that are being created and updated. Be sure to review any sync error reports, including the reason and resolution for any sync issues. >  Please note: When sections match, we may or may not have updated the class. It'll also show as an update, but this doesn't mean that anything changed.

title: Managing Rollover with Google Classroom Roster Import
heading_path: Managing Rollover with Google Classroom Roster Import
section: Managing Rollover with Google Classroom Roster Import
text:
It's just indicating that it is the new current state of the Google Classroom class. >  
> Steps to take as-needed  
> Reprovision any courses that teachers declined by accident
> Be sure to let your teachers know that they need to accept the synced courses in Google Classroom! If you need to reprovision any courses that teachers declined or archived by accident, Clever Admins can do that from the section's profile page in the Clever Dashboard:   An example screenshot of what the course will look like if declined. > Customize course names
> If the default naming convention or a previous year’s customized naming convention needs to be changed during rollover, you can utilize the course naming tool from the Google Classroom roster import settings page in your Clever Dashboard. These changes will only be reflected in courses created in future syncs and will not overwrite previously synced courses. If courses are created and already in use, the names will not update dynamically when using the custom course naming feature. > Teachers can customize course names
> If a teacher has courses with the same name syncing due to a previous year or term's course having the same name as a new course, the teacher can change one of the course names manually to differentiate them. The sync will not overwrite any changes the teacher makes to the course name. > Disable student access to Google Classroom in the Google Workspace Admin Console
> If you do not set a pause during a rollover period (e.g., summer, winter) students will be able to see schedules as soon as the teacher accepts their course in Google Classroom. This can cause students to see their schedule before the school is ready. If this occurs, the school can disable the student's access to Google Classroom in the Google Workspace Admin Console to prevent schedules from being revealed to students.

title: Managing Rollover with Google Classroom Roster Import
heading_path: Managing Rollover with Google Classroom Roster Import
section: Managing Rollover with Google Classroom Roster Import
text:
>  
> Bulk Archive Tool
> The Bulk Archive Tool in Google Workspace offers a streamlined way to manage your courses by allowing you to archive multiple courses at once, preventing your Google Classroom from getting cluttered with old courses that are no longer in use. This tool is especially useful during term rollovers or when you need to tidy up your Google Classroom environment. This tool will only allow you to archive courses that Clever created. > Bulk archive cannot archive sections while they are still shared with the Google Classroom Roster Import application. If you need to archive a section shared with this application, you must first update the sharing permissions to exclude it from sharing. Once this is done, you can proceed with archiving the section using the Bulk Archive Tool. > The Bulk Archive preview allows you to see which courses are no longer shared with Google Classroom Roster Import. This ensures that you archive only the courses that are ready to be archived. >  
> To begin using the Bulk Archive Tool, follow these steps:
> Navigate to the Google Classroom Roster Import application > Settings > Courses bulk archive box. > Adjust the course creation dates so that the tool archives any sections that were created in Clever during a specific time period. title: For App Partners: Extension Fields
text:
Title

For App Partners: Extension Fields

URL Name

000001493

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001493?language=en_US#header1) 
2. [Syncing extension fields to Clever](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001493?language=en_US#header2) 
3. [Accessing extension fields](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001493?language=en_US#header3)

If a district needs to send data fields outside of the standard fields listed in Clever's [SFTP Specifications](https://schools.clever.com/files/clever-sftp.pdf), they can do so by uploading extension fields.

District admins can add custom fields for the following data types: 
•    Schools 
•    Sections 
•    Students 
•    Teachers 
•    Staff

We do not accept custom fields for enrollments or student contacts.

---

A district can upload extension fields in two ways:

1. Manual upload via the Clever Dashboard: [Clever Dashboard > Data sources > Custom data](https://schools.clever.com/custom-data) page. 
2. Automatic upload through the district's current student information system (SIS) sync.

Directions for districts that would like to add extension fields can be found [here](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360024370912).

---

Extension field data is available for v2.1 and higher. These fields will appear on the associated record as an extension field.

Full documentation for supporting extension fields can be found in our [Dev Docs](https://dev.clever.com/docs/extension-fields).

In order to receive extension fields, you'll need to add the fields to the list of fields you will accept in your Data Access settings ([Settings > Data Access](https://apps.clever.com/clever-academy-dev/settings/data-access)). You'll need to mark the **ext** field as optional for any record types you'll support.

Additionally, a district will need enable access to extension fields from their Clever Dashboard under the **Settings > Field Access** for your application. Once the district has enabled access, the data will be available to your application in the Clever API.

Because fields are created and populated by the district outside of our schema, we cannot normalize the data within the field. Additionally, there are no constraints on what districts can use for field name(s).

---

**Related Articles:**

[For Clever Admins: Syncing custom (i.e., extension) fields to Clever](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360024370912)

If new to Clever or updating your configuration to pull data from PowerSchool, please reference our article  PowerSchool Plugin Sync. • If your schools use ESchoolPLUS as your SIS, please see our article on  SFTP Syncs . This article is intended for districts using PowerSchool as their SIS. > To review student email data currently in Clever, District Admins can navigate to the Clever Dashboard > Data browser > Students tab and add a filter for students with an email that contains @. >  
> If student emails are stored in a field exportable via DDE
> If your student emails are stored in a field that is exportable by Direct Database Export (DDE), contact Clever Support with the exact field name as it appears in the DDE. Our team can assist with updating your sync to pull student emails from this location. To determine if the field is exportable via DDE, please follow these directions. > In PowerSchool, navigate to System > Data Management > Direct Database Export (DDE) Select  Current Table: Students Click Select all records in this table  Click  Export Records Review the available fields in the dropdown.

title: PowerSchool Auto Sync: Student Emails
text:
If you find the field, please provide the exact name of the field (including capitalization and punctuation) to Clever Support. If you cannot locate the field, it is not exportable via DDE. >  
> If student emails are stored on the Email Configuration page
> If student emails are stored on the Email configuration page in PowerSchool, Clever can pull this data with additional PowerSchool permissions. The Email configuration page looks similar to this:
> In order to sync your student email addresses, we'll need you to enable page level-permissions for Quick Export. > 1. Navigate to System > Security > Access to Page Permissions (/admin/security/changepageaccesspriv.html). Set Turn modify permissions = On and click Submit. >   2. Navigate to Quick Exports: System > Page and Data Management > Quick Export (admin/importexport/exportstudents.html). Click  Modify access privileges. >   3. Find the security group assigned to Clever and set Level of Access  to Full . Click  Submit  (The security group should be the group assigned to the PowerSchool user you've shared with Clever). >    4. Navigate to System > Security > Access to Page Permissions  (/admin/security/changepageaccesspriv.html). Set Turn modify permissions = Off  and click Submit. > 5. To confirm the permissions, log in to PowerSchool using the credentials provided to Clever. Navigate to Quick Exports: System > Page and Data Management > Quick Export  (admin/importexport/exportstudents.html). If permissions were correctly applied, the Clever user account should have access to the  Submit  button. > In the Clever Dashboard, navigate to Data sources > SIS sync > Settings  and press Sync Now. You can review the results on the Sync page once the sync completes (15-20 minutes). >   Troubleshooting email deletions
> When your district chooses to sync student emails via the Email Configuration page, this is a separate process from the rest of your sync.

title: PowerSchool Auto Sync: Student Emails
text:
For some districts, on occasion, our system may fail to successfully sync all student emails, resulting in some student emails being deleted from Clever. If this occurs, try rerunning a sync by navigating to your Clever Dashboard > SIS sync > Settings page and pressing Sync Now . This should resolve the issue. If your district regularly encounters issues with student email deletions, contact our team and we can discuss applying a safety threshold for the sync. For example, we can reject the email sync if more than 10% of student emails fail to export, preventing large changes to active Clever email data. Please contact our support team if you would like to learn more. > Other options
> If emails are not exportable via DDE or the Email Configuration page, Clever won't be able to pull student emails as part of the auto sync. However, you do have the ability to manually sideload emails. Please see the following Help Center article to upload student emails: How do I upload emails that are not in my SIS? .

Head to your [Clever Dashboard > SIS sync > Last Attempted Sync](https://schools.clever.com/sync) page. On the right-hand side of the table, you'll see a **Download SIS File** column. Click the download icon for any file(s) you'd like. After clicking the download button, a download link for the file(s) will be emailed to the email connected to your Clever account. Clicking the **Sections** download icon will email a link for both the sections.csv and enrollments.csv files.

Please note, for security purposes, you will need to be logged into the Clever Dashboard to use the download link.

2. [Custom section names](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001501?language=en_US#custom)

Section names in Clever are auto-generated to ensure unique names, making it easier for teachers and students to recognize and use them. The auto-generated name is: **"course\_name" - "teacher\_last\_name" - "period"**

If course\_name isn't provided, the section "**name"** provided in your SIS data will be used. If neither course name nor section name are provided, Clever will use **”teacher\_last\_name - period”**

⚠️  Clever can't customize the format of auto-generated section names.

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TGm9&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000004Y5vF)

---

Districts can choose to sync their own section names to Clever. Below are the directions for each sync type. Your sync type can be found on the [Clever Dashboard > Data sources > SIS sync](https://schools.clever.com/sync) page.

1. Confirm the desired section name is populated in your SIS and exportable. The custom section name must be contained in a **single field**. Other than our default formula, Clever can't combine multiple fields to create a custom section name.
2. Contact your SIS manager and request they update your district's sections.csv file to send the field **"name",** with the desired data field from your SIS.
3. Contact Clever Support and request we disable auto-generated section names for your district.

title: Clever + Google Classroom: Overview
text:
**[The Google Classroom roster import application is available to request in the Clever application gallery](https://schools.clever.com/applications/add/google-classroom-rostering)!**

- The integration is available at no additional cost to U.S. and Canadian school districts with a Google Standard Edition subscription or a [Google Workspace for Education Plus](https://edu.google.com/products/workspace-for-education/education-plus/) subscription for staff and students.
- Once the application is connected, and the scheduled sync start date has arrived, **Clever will provision Google Classroom courses based on your district’s SIS + Clever data.**
- Google Classroom course names will match to Clever section names, and rosters will update automatically as students change sections in your SIS + Clever.

The Google Classroom roster import application will:

title: Clever + Google Classroom: Overview
text:
- **Districts must have a Google Standard Edition or [Google Workspace for Education Plus](https://edu.google.com/products/workspace-for-education/education-plus/) subscription for staff and students** in order to utilize the Google Classroom roster import application via Clever. If your district has questions about upgrading to Education Plus, please contact [na-k12-gwfe@google.com](mailto:na-k12-gwfe@google.com).

 - For more detailed setup info, see the setup guide [here](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001469?language=en_US).

Teachers will have the option to accept Clever-created courses. They can also decline them and continue managing their rosters manually. Courses created outside Clever will not be modified or deleted by the Clever connection.

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000Srar&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000003BSVl)

title: Clever + Google Classroom: Overview
text:
**What will the courses be named when they sync to Google Classroom?**

- Clever-created courses will utilize the section name in Clever as the course name in Google Classroom. You can also customize the course names directly from the Google Classroom roster import settings tab in your Clever Dashboard using fields that already exist in the data you sync to Clever. Teachers can modify this course name if they want, and their changes will not be overwritten by the sync.

**Can we manage when the Google Classroom roster import application will start syncing and creating courses in Classroom?**

- Yes, during the setup, you can configure your first sync date as well as input access dates for teachers and students separately.

**What time will data sync when you set access dates?**

- Clever will sync with Google Classroom roster import at 12:30 AM PST/3:30 AM EST on the access date set in the application’s settings.

**How often is the sync from Clever to Google Classroom?**

- The sync runs on a nightly basis. The sync will also run after each SIS sync and after any changes to sharing permissions.

**Can I pause the sync between Clever and Google Classroom?**

- Yes! If you need to pause the sync between Clever and Google Classroom, head to [Clever Dashboard > Google Classroom roster import > Settings > Schedule Google Classroom Roster Import Sync Pause](https://schools.clever.com/applications/google-classroom-rostering/settings) and set the pause dates for teachers and students.

**What if some of my district’s teachers want to continue manually managing their Classrooms?**

- Teachers can decline Clever-created courses and continue manually managing their rosters. Courses created outside Clever will not be modified or deleted by the Clever connection. The Clever team can’t help troubleshoot courses that are manually managed by teachers.

**Do co-teachers sync with the courses?**

title: Clever + Google Classroom: Overview
text:
- Yes, co-teachers that you have in the Clever data are synced to Google Classroom roster import. Co-teachers won’t be able to see a course until the primary teacher has accepted the course.

**Can I use sharing rules to control which schools or sections are rostered in Classroom?**

- Yes! Clever will provision Classroom courses based on section data that is shared with Google Classroom rostering. You can use sharing rules to prevent certain types of sections from being synced, or to ensure that only the right schools are synced.

**What if the student roster of a Google Classroom course does not match the roster of its section in Clever?**

- Teachers are able to add and remove students manually without Clever's sync overwriting those changes.

Google Classroom also has a feature that allows students to unenroll themselves from courses. You can adjust unenrollment settings for Google Classroom so students cannot remove themselves from a class. [Learn more here](https://support.google.com/edu/classroom/answer/11189334).

![Clever Academy.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000Srar&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000035fcv) 
Interested in deep-diving into how to best use Clever and Google together? Check out our course, [Clever & Google: Secure Connected Classroom Certification](https://clever.academy/clever-google-cert?user_type=district_admin) available in Clever Academy!
