title: Clever IDM: Connecting to Active Directory via LDAPS
heading_path: Clever IDM: Connecting to Active Directory via LDAPS
section: Clever IDM: Connecting to Active Directory via LDAPS
text:
> Tip: Title Clever IDM: Connecting to Active Directory via LDAPS URL Name 000001504 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Connection Steps 3. Final Connection Test 4. Common Errors 5. FAQs
>  
> Overview
> Clever IDM uses LDAPS to establish a connection with your district’s Active Directory instance. LDAPS is different from LDAP and requires different configurations at the firewall and server levels (learn more about the differences here ). This article outlines the steps you can take to set up your LDAPS connection and can help you troubleshoot any issues you might encounter during that process. If you have any questions or feedback, email us at Clever Support. > Connection Steps
> To provision accounts, Clever needs permission to connect to your Active Directory server. To establish a successful connection with Clever, you will need to provide the following information for your Active Directory server:
> LDAPS URL SHA-256 fingerprints of AD server’s SSL certificate Username and password for a bind account Base Distinguished Name (Base DN)
> In addition to providing the information above, if you use a firewall please give access to the Clever external IP addresses ( 54.241.134.131, 50.18.217.135, 54.241.154.41 ) on port 636 to ensure a successful connection with your server. Also please ensure your firewall reroutes Clever to a domain controller for your Active Directory with write access . > Providing the LDAPS URL
> An LDAPS URL lets Clever know where to look when trying to connect with your Active Directory server. It is a URL that starts with “ldaps://” and ends with your server’s external IP address or domain name. To provide the LDAPS URL for your server:
> Locate your server’s external IP address or domain name. We recommend using your IP address.

title: Clever IDM: Connecting to Active Directory via LDAPS
heading_path: Clever IDM: Connecting to Active Directory via LDAPS
section: Clever IDM: Connecting to Active Directory via LDAPS
text:
To find your IP address do one of the following:
> Google “What is my IP address?” -or- Go to the “Server Manager” application on your Windows device and navigate to “All Servers”, where you will see the IP addresses listed for all of your servers. > Copy your server’s IP address. Paste your server’s IP address into the LDAPS URL input in step 2 of the Connect to Active Directory setup. > Click “Test connection” If the connection to the LDAPS server is successful, click “Next step”. If there is an error connecting to the LDAPS server, please ensure you have: Entered your LDAPS URL following proper formatting (e.g. “ldaps://123.123.123.123” or “ldaps:// district.org ”) Given access through your firewall to Clever’s external IP addresses ( 54.241.134.131, 50.18.217.135, 54.241.154.41 ) over port 636 and try again. Also please ensure your firewall reroutes Clever to a domain controller for your Active Directory with write access . >  
> Providing the SHA-256 fingerprints of your server’s SSL certificate Your server’s SSL certificate establishes a secure, encrypted connection between Clever and your Active Directory server, which keeps your data safe. The fingerprint is a hash of your SSL certificate, which safely stores all of the certificate’s data. > To provide the SHA-256 fingerprints of your server’s SSL certificate:
> Click “Add fingerprint” in step 3 of the Connect to Active Directory step. If you already have a fingerprint, you'll need to remove it and add a new one. Clever will automatically download the SHA-256 fingerprints of your server’s SSL certificate. Click “Add fingerprint” once your fingerprints have been downloaded. You will now see the added fingerprint in the “Certificate fingerprints” table. If you would like to add additional certificate fingerprints, contact Clever Support.

title: Clever IDM: Connecting to Active Directory via LDAPS
heading_path: Clever IDM: Connecting to Active Directory via LDAPS
section: Clever IDM: Connecting to Active Directory via LDAPS
text:
>    
> Providing a bind account username and password with read and write access The bind account username and password are used to request authentication when performing searches on your Active Directory server. Clever needs access to a bind account with read and write permissions to successfully provision accounts. > To apply the necessary permissions on your bind account:
> Go to the “Active Directory Users and Computers” application on your Windows device and select your server’s top level domain. Click the “Action” menu then click “Properties”. Click the “Security” tab in the Properties window. If you don’t see your bind account user listed in the “Group or user names” menu, click “Add…” If you do see your bind account user listed, skip to step 6. Type the name of your bind account user and click “OK”. In this case, we have named our bind account “Bind Account”, but yours may be named something else. You should now see your bind account selected at the top of the “Group or user names” menu. Click “Advanced” to open the advanced security settings window. In the “Permission entries” menu, double-click your bind account user. In the “Permissions” menu, click the checkbox next to:
> List contents Read all properties Write all properties Read permissions All validated writes All extended rights Create all child objects Delete all child objects Delete
> Change the Applies to to be This object and all descendant objects. > NOTE: Once you have applied the necessary permissions to your bind account, please ensure your server configuration allows Clever’s simple bind authentication method. Learn more about allowing simple bind authentication here . >   To provide your bind account username and password:
> Go to the “Active Directory Users and Computers” application on your Windows device and select your bind account user (this is typically found in the “Users” or “Administrators” OUs).

title: Clever IDM: Connecting to Active Directory via LDAPS
heading_path: Clever IDM: Connecting to Active Directory via LDAPS
section: Clever IDM: Connecting to Active Directory via LDAPS
text:
Click the “Action” menu and select “Properties” Click the “Account” tab Write the full expression of the “User logon name” in the “Bind account username” field in step 4 of the Connect to Active Directory  step. In this case, the Bind account username is “ bind-account@test-ad.clever-idm.com ”. Write your bind account password in the “Bind account password” field. Passwords in Active Directory are stored using encrypted hashes and the method of storing passwords will be specific to your server configuration. If you don’t know your bind account password, please contact your network administrator or read this article  to learn more about how passwords are stored in Active Directory. >  
>  
> Providing the Base Distinguished Name (Base DN) The Base DN is the starting point when performing a search on your Active Directory server. Clever will use the Base DN to navigate your server’s data. > To provide the Base DN for your server:
> Go to the “Active Directory Users and Computers” application on your Windows device and select your server’s top level domain. Click the “Action” menu and select “Properties” Click the “Attribute Editor” tab Scroll down to the “distinguishedName” attribute Write the “distinguishedName” value in the “Base DN” field in step 5 of the Connect to Active Directory  step. In this case, the Base DN is “DC=test-ad,DC=clever-idm,DC=com”
> NOTE : Your Base DN should be the same domain used in your bind account username, but written in Domain Controller, or “DC”, format. In this case, the domain used in the bind account username was “@ test-ad.clever-idm.com ” so the DC format for the Base DN would be “DC=test-ad,DC=clever-idm,DC=com”. >  
> Final Connection Test
> Once you have completed all of the connection steps, you will be asked to run a final connection test to ensure everything is working as expected. If the test is successful, you can save your Active Directory connection configuration and proceed to the next step: Select users.

title: Clever IDM: Connecting to Active Directory via LDAPS
heading_path: Clever IDM: Connecting to Active Directory via LDAPS
section: Clever IDM: Connecting to Active Directory via LDAPS
text:
If you encounter an error during the final connection test, the error message will explain what has happened and redirect you to the specific part of the connection step that needs attention. > Common Errors
> Here are three common errors that might come up when Connecting to Active Directory via LDAPS:
> LDAPS URL failing to connect Bind account authentication was unsuccessful Could not perform a search with the Base DN Connection errors during first sync
>  
> LDAPS URL failing to connect
> In general, this error means that Clever IDM wasn’t able to find an AD server with an SSL certificate at the URL provided. There are a variety of different reasons that can happen. 1. Double-check your LDAPS URL. If you use a firewall, make sure that the URL provided is your external URL. If you’re using your hostname, try your public IP address instead. You can find your public address by using a site like this . 2. Check your firewall settings Confirm that you have allowed traffic from Clever’s external IP addresses on port 636 : 54.241.134.131 50.18.217.135 54.241.154.41 Also, ensure your firewall reroutes Clever to a domain controller for your Active Directory server with write access . Once you’ve confirmed the above, use the test connection button in Clever and monitor your network traffic within your firewall to see if there’s any activity from our IP addresses. If not, revisit the earlier steps to ensure you have the right LDAPS URL and that Clever’s IP addresses are allowed through your firewall over port 636. Once you’ve confirmed that Clever is making it through your firewall, check the policies you’ve applied to redirect traffic from Clever to the appropriate AD server in your network. 3. Confirm your AD server has an SSL certificate If you’ve made it this far, but are still hitting the “connection unsuccessful” error in Clever, it’s possible that your AD server doesn’t have an appropriate SSL certificate.

title: Clever IDM: Connecting to Active Directory via LDAPS
heading_path: Clever IDM: Connecting to Active Directory via LDAPS
section: Clever IDM: Connecting to Active Directory via LDAPS
text:
You can learn more about setting up LDAPS and applying an SSL certificate to your server in this article: Step-by-Step Guide to Setup LDAPS on Windows Server . > Bind account authentication was unsuccessful
> This error indicates that Clever IDM is unable to log in using the bind account credentials provided. The most common causes of this error are: 
> The username and password are invalid (meaning that either the username or password were not typed in correctly. To resolve this issue, read more here . Your server is not configured to allow Clever’s simple bind account method. To resolve this issue, read more here. You have not provided read and write permissions on the bind account. To resolve this issue, read more here . The domain used for the bind account username and the Base DN don’t match (with the bind account username using domain format and the Base DN using Domain Controller, or “DC”, format). To resolve this issue, read more here . >  
> Could not perform a search with the Base DN
> This error indicates that Clever has successfully logged in using the provided bind account credentials, but is not able to perform a search on your server using the provided Base DN. The most common causes of this error are: 
> Your Base DN was not entered following Domain Controller, or “DC”, format. To resolve this issue, read more here . You have not provided read and write permissions on the bind account. Although the bind account credentials may have been valid, and thus Clever could successfully log into the bind account, a search cannot be performed on the server using the Base DN because read permissions have not been provided. To resolve this issue, read more here . The domain used for the bind account username and the Base DN don’t match (with the bind account username using domain format and the Base DN using Domain Controller, or “DC”, format). To resolve this issue, read more here .

title: Clever IDM: Connecting to Active Directory via LDAPS
heading_path: Clever IDM: Connecting to Active Directory via LDAPS
section: Clever IDM: Connecting to Active Directory via LDAPS
text:
> Examples of acceptable Base DNs:
> DC=testdistrict,DC=local DC=abc,DC=com DC=clever,DC=k12,DC=com
> Common mistakes in this step include:
> Not including DC=local, DC=org, etc. in the Base DN Including the parent OUs or CN of the BIND account used (these should not be included). >  
> Connection errors during first sync
> The most common connection error that a district may see after the connect step is during the first attempted sync. If a sync preview shows very few issues, but the first attempted sync results in many more, it’s likely that IDM’s BIND account doesn’t have appropriate write access. In the issues CSV, these errors could look like:
> LDAP Result Code 34 “Invalid DN Syntax”: 00000057: LdapErr: DSID-0C090C4D, comment: Error in attribute conversion operation, data 0, v2580
> Check that the BIND account has write access. To resolve this issue, read more here . > LDAP Result Code 50 ""Insufficient Access Rights"": 00002098: SecErr: DSID-0315130D, problem 4003 (INSUFF\_ACCESS\_RIGHTS), data 0
> This means that the Clever Bind Account does not have the permissions to make the changes its being directed to. Try these three troubleshooting steps:
> Check that the Clever bind account has the permissions outlined in this section . Ensure that for all OUs/Users that Clever IDM will manage have inheritable permissions Go into OUs that our IDM users are in and make sure that “Disable Inheritance” is not checked in the settings Ensure that your OUs are are not set to “protect from accidental deletion”
> Please check spot check users to see if they’re inheriting permissions. Tip: you can use a powershell script to enable this for all users without having to do it manually. > Go into OUs that our IDM users are in and make sure that “protect from accidental deletion” is not checked on the objects tab and ensure that there are no “deny” permissions set as the top level permission in that OU. >  
> FAQs
> Why do you use LDAPS instead of LDAP to connect to my AD instance?

title: Clever IDM: Connecting to Active Directory via LDAPS
heading_path: Clever IDM: Connecting to Active Directory via LDAPS
section: Clever IDM: Connecting to Active Directory via LDAPS
text:
> Data sent via LDAPS is encrypted in transit, making it a more secure option than LDAP. Clever considers the data it manages (including the BIND credentials provided by districts) to be highly sensitive and, as such, uses the most secure option available for establishing a connection with local Active Directory servers. > Is Clever’s connection to my Active Directory instance secure? > Clever IDM uses a bind account to sync with the destination AD server. The district gives the bind account the minimum permissions needed -- read/write users + org units (as well as "replicating directory changes" permission to read the latest changes). Clever IDM for AD uses a standard LDAPS package and is limited to these operations: create/update/archive users, create org units. Clever IDM is not able to make any other changes, such as policy changes or domain configuration changes. Internal employees are not able to view plaintext bind account credentials. You can read more about Clever’s security practices here . >  
> Related articles:  Clever IDM: Overview Clever IDM: Active Directory Setup Clever IDM: Purchasing & Billing Clever IDM: Sync Reports

title: Clever IDM: Active Directory Setup
text:
> Tip: Title Clever IDM: Active Directory Setup URL Name 000001505 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Setup           •    Connect to Active Directory           •   Select your IDM Management Level           •    Select Clever users           •   Data written to Active Directory           •    Manage group membership           •    Summary           •    Preview and provision           •    Events 3. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
> Overview
> Clever IDM helps districts automate account provisioning and lifecycle management for Microsoft Active Directory and Google Workspace. This affordable new offering provides school districts with a simple workflow that can be completed in minutes to automate organizational unit (OU) and account management directly with Clever. Clever IDM automatically syncs users from your SIS to Active Directory or Google daily for an entire year. Your Clever IDM dashboard can be found here . A full overview of Clever IDM and the setup process can be viewed below:
>  
> Note: Clever IDM does not yet support home folder provisioning or exchange mailbox provisioning. If you’re interested in this functionality, we’d love to hear from you! Please reach out to Clever Support. > Setup
> You can work through setting up your IDM configuration at any time; however, you won’t be able to complete the setup to start provisioning accounts without review from an onboarding specialist or our support team. Our team must review your setup before your first provision to protect your destination accounts and prevent issues with SSO for your end users. Contact your onboarding specialist for configuration review. If you're not sure who to contact, reach out to  Clever Support .

title: Clever IDM: Active Directory Setup
text:
>   Click on the following links to find information about: • Setting IDM login credentials • Organizing OUs • Building sub-OUs with the IDM format builder
> Connect to Active Directory
> To provision accounts, Clever needs permission to connect to your Active Directory server. To establish a successful connection with Clever, you will need to provide the following information for your Active Directory server:
> LDAPS URL (your server’s external IP address or domain name after “ldaps://”) SHA-256 fingerprints of SSL certificates Base Distinguished Name (Base DN) Username and password for a bind account with:
> Read/write access to users and organizational units Replicating directory changes permissions
> In addition to providing the information above, if you use a firewall please give access to the Clever external IP addresses ( 54.241.134.131, 50.18.217.135, 54.241.154.41 ) on port 636 to ensure a successful connection with your server. Also please ensure your firewall reroutes Clever to a domain controller for your Active Directory with write access . For a detailed, step-by-step guide on connecting and troubleshooting your connection to Active Directory, see Clever IDM: Connecting to Active Directory via LDAPS . >  
>  
> Select your IDM Management Level
>  
> Next, choose whether you’d like to set up Full Provisioning and Password Management or Password Management Only . Both options support Identity Management in Clever—it just depends on what works best for your district’s timing and goals. >  
> Full Provisioning and Password Management
> This option automates account security and password management through Clever IDM. Since it requires more setup time, many districts choose this path at the beginning of the school year or during a long break.

title: Clever IDM: Active Directory Setup
text:
It’s best for:
> Automatically provisioning, updating, and archiving user accounts
> Configuring password reset, account recovery, and account claiming settings
> Building and maintaining OUs and groups from your SIS data
>  
> Password Management Only
> This lighter setup gives you access to Clever’s secure password management tools for matched users, with the flexibility to configure it at your own pace. > It includes the same powerful IDM matching and collision detection as the full setup to ensure the right Clever user is matched to the right destination user—but requires less time to implement. It’s best for:
> Piloting Clever IDM or starting setup mid-year
> Accessing Clever’s password management tools
> Managing matched users between systems
>  
> Select Clever Users
> Clever IDM can provision accounts for students, teachers, and staff. You may select for Clever to provision accounts for one or more of the following: Students  Students are users that are enrolled as students in educational courses or sections. Teachers "Teachers" is the term Clever uses to refer to a district's instructional staff. These are the individuals that are directly managing a classroom and students. Staff "Staff" is the term Clever uses to refer to both non-instructional staff (e.g. secretaries, bus drivers, counselors) and instructional staff that are not directly in charge of a classroom (e.g. school tech leads, instructional coaches, and principals). These users are often a different employment designation than teachers and may even be managed outside the Student Information System (SIS) in a HR Information System (HRIS)  
> Users with multiple user roles  If a user is assigned to multiple user roles (e.g. Teacher and Staff) in Clever, they will be provisioned an Active Directory account if either role is selected for Clever IDM provisioning.

title: Clever IDM: Active Directory Setup
text:
If the district chooses to provision accounts for both teachers and staff and a user is assigned to both teacher and staff roles in Clever, during Clever IDM setup the district will be able to select the primary role to be used for OU and group structure. Users with existing Active Directory accounts Users with the same email address in Clever and Active Directory will be matched/organized in the OU structure as outlined in step:  Organize Active Directory OUs . Clever will not update the UserPrincipalNames or sAMAccountNames for existing Active Directory accounts unless a new SIS username is synced for a user. To ensure accurate matching, please make sure that usernames are synced to Clever from your student information system (SIS) and that the usernames match your UserPrincipalNames in AD. >  
> Additionally, Clever IDM allows you to customize which subsets of users that you would like to provision. If you would like to filter by user type, grade, school, or extension field please contact Clever Support so that we can make those adjustments for you. >  
> Graduation rollover date If Clever IDM is set to manage your students, you will be prompted during this step to configure a graduation rollover date. > If you do not sync student graduation year directly from your SIS, Clever IDM will use this rollover date to calculate a graduation year for use in formulas. To ensure that this calculation associates your data with the correct school year, set a graduation rollover date. Clever IDM calculates the graduation year based on the student’s synced grade level. Data synced before the graduation rollover date will be associated with the previous school year for graduation year calculations. Data synced after the graduation rollover date will be associated with the upcoming school year for graduation year calculations.

title: Clever IDM: Active Directory Setup
text:
Providing a graduation rollover date enables Clever IDM to automatically update any information based on the graduation year (OUs, groups, etc.) as grade levels change during rollover. If your expected graduation rollover date changes, you can edit the graduation rollover date anytime by navigating to your Select Users step in Clever IDM. > Data   written to Active Directory
> There are two pathways for Clever to set user data in IDM: creation and user modification. > Creation In the case of user creation, the following fields are synced to Active Directory:
> User first name User last name User type (student, teacher, staff) CommonName UserPrincipalName as configured by the district sAMAccountName as configured by the district Primary mail address as configured by the district Organizational unit as configured by the district Initial password as configured by the district
> All newly created users are assumed to be unsuspended. Modification If a user exists in both Clever and Active Directory data, IDM will update the following fields when changes occur:
> User first name User last name CommonName Organizational unit as configured by the district Optional Custom Fields, such as Department, Title, etc. Suspension status
> Suspended if a user exists in Active Directory under a managed OU, but not in the most recent Clever dataset. Unsuspended if a user was previously suspended (i.e. not in the Clever dataset), but has been restored in the Clever dataset. > IDM will only update UserPrincipalName or sAMAccountName if a new SIS username is synced for a user. IDM will only update the Mail attribute if a new SIS email is synced for a user. Additional Mapped Fields If you are mapping additional fields from Clever to Active Directory, Clever will update the AD fields when relevant data in Clever changes. If you decide to stop mapping an additional field to AD, Clever IDM will ignore that field in future syncs, leaving any previously-synced data populated.

title: Clever IDM: Active Directory Setup
text:
If you have questions or comments about the visibility of these attributes or would like additional attributes to be set by IDM, please contact our support team . Data written to a student information system (SIS) We now provide SFTP access to user emails managed by Clever IDM. The SFTP files can be accessed by enabling Participation Reports, and the associated SFTP server as described in this article . The CSV files in the SFTP server contain mappings of user emails to their Clever ID, SIS ID, and User Type. Districts can use these files to personally build automation for write back into their SIS on their end. Clever does not support direct SIS write back automation outside of the above documentation. > If you have questions or comments about the visibility of these attributes or would like additional attributes to be set by IDM, please contact our support team . >  
> Manage group membership
> This functionality enables Clever IDM to place users in one or more security or distribution groups using formulas. Clever IDM will then manage membership as users’ data changes. For example, if students are placed in school-specific groups, Clever IDM will remove them from their old school’s group and place them in a new one whenever a student changes schools. Learn more about AD group membership management here . > Summary
> The summary page will display all the selections made for each user type for both user account settings and organizational structure (OUs). Confirm that all boxes for the user types that should be provisioned are marked  Select Preview Active Directory Accounts once all selections have been confirmed. > Preview and provision
> Clever will generate a preview of the number of users that will be created or updated. Additionally, the system will flag any potential issues. You can also check on specific accounts that will be created/updated to ensure that they follow the process you'd like, via IDM Preview Sync Visualizer.

title: Clever IDM: Active Directory Setup
text: Learn more about IDM Preview Sync Visualizer here . > You’ll see a note in your account that IDM Provisioning is disabled and requires review from a Clever specialist. Our team must review your setup before your first provision to protect your destination accounts and prevent issues with SSO for your end users. Please reach out to your onboarding specialist with any questions or for review of your preview before provisioning. If you're not sure who to contact, please reach out to  Clever Support . The Clever Admin completing the setup guide will receive an email with a CSV summary when the preview is done generating. The CSV preview is also downloadable from the setup guide. Matching Clever IDM will attempt to match users in one of two ways. First, it will take the user’s Clever username and match it against existing UserPrincipalNames in Active Directory. If a Clever user doesn’t have a username populated, Clever IDM will use the UserPrincipalName defined in the “Set login credentials step” and search for identical UserPrincipalNames in Active Directory. If there is a match using either of these methods, Clever will match the user (and perform “Update” events, as necessary). If there is no match, Clever will attempt to create the user, resulting in a “Create” event. Clever tip: for the best matching and preview experience, make sure you’re uploading up-to-date usernames to Clever. Issues There are a variety of issues that may occur when attempting a first sync. You can view issues by downloading the sync preview files from your dashboard and viewing the issues file. Many issues result from Clever attempting to create a user using one or more unique fields (sAMAccountName, UserPrincipalName, CommonName, Mail) that already exist on a different account in Active Directory. In most cases, these errors can be resolved by updating usernames in Clever and generating a new preview.

title: Clever IDM: Active Directory Setup
text:
If your usernames are updated and you’re still encountering issues, please reach out to Clever Support . >   Events
> After your initial Clever IDM sync, you can continue to track changes to your users via the User management > Clever IDM > Events tab . On this tab, you can select a date range for which you’d like to review Clever IDM creates, updates, archives, and matched users. You can also apply filters to examine changes by destination (if you have multiple configured), event type (create, update, etc.), or specific users by name or SIS ID. > Once you find the event for the user and destination you’d like to review, click the dropdown arrow next to the event to examine more details. >  
> Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
> How long does setup typically take? > Set up time depends on the number of students in the district, the amount of customization required, and if any errors are encountered with connecting with Active Directory. > Implementation varies greatly depending on the overall quality of data in Clever, if additional data is required, the Clever Admin’s access to features at the district such as firewalls, servers, SIS data, etc. > Can I provision for multiple destinations? > Yes, Clever IDM can be used to provision multiple destinations such as both Google and Active Directory at no additional cost per user. > Does Clever IDM change anything about my SIS to Clever data sync? > No, the sync between your SIS and Clever will remain the same. However, email addresses created by Clever IDM will be stored as part of your Clever data. > What if I want to manage non-teaching staff with Clever IDM, but they aren't stored in my student information system (SIS)? > There are various options for syncing staff users, including CSV files, custom data, or an Active Directory sync. Learn more in our article about adding staff to Clever . > Does Clever IDM change anything about existing single sign- on (SSO) access to applications? > No, SSO access will remain the same.

title: Clever IDM: Active Directory Setup
text:
It may run more smoothly with the automated provisioning of user accounts. > Can we maintain our current user email addresses? > Yes! Work with your IDM Onboarding Specialist to maintain email addresses. > When formatting the password in the Clever IDM set-up, is this simply to create new passwords, or will this reset passwords across the entire domain? > The password format will only be used for new accounts which are provisioned - this will not reset existing passwords. > Will our email addresses and passwords sync back to our SIS? > No, Clever IDM provides automated syncing only in one direction (from Clever to your destination). You are able to download a CSV file of usernames via the Clever IDM page to upload to your SIS. > Does Clever IDM automatically calculate Graduation Year for students? > If synced to Clever, IDM will use the Graduation\_year field from your SIS. Otherwise, IDM will automatically calculate Graduation Year for students K-12 based on the student Grade field. In calculating graduation year, PreKindergarten and TransitionalKindergarten will be treated as grade -1. > Students in the following grade levels will NOT have a Graduation Year unless provided by the district: InfantToddler, Preschool, 13, PostGraduate, Ungraded, Other. > Why do I see a note that my IDM provisioning is disabled? > To protect your destination accounts and prevent SSO issues, our team must review your IDM setup before your first provisioning. Please reach out to the Clever team if you have any questions or to review your sync before you provision for a new destination. > I can’t find the functionality I’m looking for. What should I do? > Reach out to Clever Support. The functionality may be available on the back end. If not, we may be able to add new functionality. > What if my question is not answered here? > Check out our Clever Academy course, Quick Start - Getting started with Clever IDM for Setup FAQs and Troubleshooting FAQs or reach out to Clever Support.

title: Clever IDs
text:
Title

Clever IDs

URL Name

000001507

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001507?language=en_US#overview) 
2. [Changing Clever IDs](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001507?language=en_US#change) 
3. [Clever ID Retention Policy](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001507?language=en_US#policy)

**Clever ID** refers to the globally unique identifier that is assigned to a record in Clever. This value is important as it ensures that every student, teacher, section, etc. on Clever has a unique ID across all active schools on Clever. Since it is globally unique, most application partners use the Clever ID as the primary identifier for a record when pulling data from Clever.

Clever IDs are an alpha-numeric string that is generated by Clever and can be viewed on the profile page for a record.

Clever IDs are directly connected to the following primary ids provided by the district to Clever. For more information on Clever's field specifications, please see this [document](https://schools.clever.com/files/clever-sftp.pdf).

- Record Type: Primary ID Field
- School: School\_id
- Staff: Staff\_id
- Teacher: Teacher\_id
- Student: Student\_id
- Section: Section\_id

---

Changes in Clever IDs are the result of the primary id field for the record being changed. If the primary id field is changed for a record, a new Clever ID will be provisioned. For example:

**IF 
             Student A** is uploaded from the SIS to Clever with **Student\_id: 1234**. 
**THEN** 
       A new student record with **Student\_id: 1234 / Clever ID: 53446ae050bb279fb03d2a3e** is created.

**IF** 
**Student A** is updated in the SIS and uploaded from the SIS to Clever with **Student\_id: 5678**. 
**THEN** 
             Student record with **Student\_id: 1234 / Clever ID: 53446ae050bb279fb03d2a3e** is deleted.           
             A new student record with **Student\_id: 5678 / Clever ID: 54d263946cc968010000007a** is created.

---

title: Clever IDs
text:
Clever retains the relationship between a primary id and Clever ID for 300 days.

For example, if a student is deleted from Clever and added back within 300 days, the student will be assigned the same Clever ID. If a student is deleted from Clever and added back after 300 days, the student will be assigned a NEW Clever ID.

Since applications build off the Clever ID, students that are added back within 300 days will be restored with their historical data (progress, scores, etc.) Students that are added back after 300 days will have a new account provisioned in the application and will have no historical data.

If your district has a student population that regularly cycles between enrollment and withdrawal, Clever can extend this 300-day window to one that will preserve Clever IDs for longer. (i.e. 730 days). If interested in extending your Clever ID retention policy, please submit a support request at [support.clever.com](http://support.clever.com).

title: For Clever Admins: Copying Sharing Rules
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Copying Sharing Rules
section: For Clever Admins: Copying Sharing Rules
text:
> Tip: Title For Clever Admins: Copying Sharing Rules URL Name 000001509 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. How do I copy sharing settings from another application? 3. Frequently Asked Questions
>  
> Overview
> By configuring sharing permissions for applications, district admins can determine what data will be shared with each district app, and which district users will be able to access the application from their individual Clever portals. If you’ve already set up sharing for an application and need to use the same sharing settings for another application, you can copy the settings over to simplify your setup process. When you use copy sharing, Clever will take the sharing settings from the source application and apply them to the new application. This is a one-time copy that allows you to then update each application’s sharing settings independently. > Clever Tip: For an overview of application sharing permissions, please visit: Sharing Permissions: Sharing data with new applications . >  
> How do I copy sharing settings from another application? > When selecting a sharing type, choose the “Copy Sharing” option. Next, choose which existing application’s sharing settings you’d like to copy. Once you’ve selected a source application, you’ll see a preview of the sharing settings that will be applied. If the settings are correct, click “Apply settings.” By configuring sharing permissions for applications, district admins can determine what data will be shared with each district app, and which district users will be able to access the application from their individual Clever portals. When sharing by rules, Clever will only share data that meets the specific criteria you've set. This is the most recommended sharing type as it provides districts with the flexibility in determining specifically what data should be included, or excluded, in the sharing.

Additionally, applications are dynamically updated as new data is synced to Clever from your district's student information system (SIS). The data shared with the application via sharing rules evolves based on the new data in Clever. > Frequently Asked Questions
> If I copy sharing settings, then change the sharing settings for the source application, will the updated sharing settings be applied to the second application? > Since this is a one-time copy, you’d need to update the sharing settings for the second application separately.

section: For Clever Admins: Field mappings and customizing your data sync
text:
Title

For Clever Admins: Field mappings and customizing your data sync

URL Name

000001512

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001512?language=en_US#header1) 
2. [Viewing field mappings](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001512?language=en_US#VIEWING) 
3. [Editing field mappings](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001512?language=en_US#header3) 
4. [Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001512?language=en_US#FAQ)

Sync field mappings refer to the relationship between fields from a student information system (SIS) and fields in Clever. A field mapping is when you specify the field in your SIS that you want to map to a specific data value in Clever. For example, Clever accepts student\_email as a data value. Depending on the field (e.g., emailaddress.emailaddress, SchoolEmail, etc.)  in which you store emails in your SIS, you may want to map a specific field to the student\_email field.

**![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TBbB&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028C4p)**For **SFTP syncs**, Clever has an SFTP web upload feature with field mapping! Find out more [here](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001608).

---

To view sync mappings, navigate to [Data sources > SIS sync > Settings > Sync Mappings box > View field mappings](https://schools.clever.com/sync/settings/mappings). This page shows the relationship between each Clever Field & SIS Field.

Clever Field refers to the data field in Clever where the SIS data is being stored.

SIS Field refers to the name of the field in the SIS where the data is being pulled from. In the below screenshot, we can see that for students, School\_id is being synced from HomeSchoolId³. If the SIS Field is followed by **(custom mapping)**⁴, it means the mapping was added custom for your account. If the SIS field is blank⁵, Clever is not pulling any information from the SIS for the corresponding Clever Field.

**Edit⁷** indicates that Clever Admins may customize which SIS field to sync to the corresponding Clever Field. If the value you are looking for is unavailable from the dropdown, please contact Clever Support with the exact name of the SIS field you want to map, and our team will investigate whether the mapping is supported. If the **Action** field is blank⁸, the SIS Field either is not customizable or requires a Clever Support team member to customize the field for your account. Contact Clever Support to learn about your available options.

Use the view record type selectors to view the mappings for each record type. If you require a field mapping for a record type not listed, please contact Clever Support to learn about your options.

![Clever Field Mappings page with sections highlighted](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TBbB&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000005TSW4)

---

title: For Clever Admins: Field mappings and customizing your data sync
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Field mappings and customizing your data sync
text:
Depending on your sync type, you may be able to customize which field in your SIS correlates to which field in Clever through a field mapping. If you utilize an SFTP sync, [please see this article](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001608) for more information on field mapping.

If you utilize a Clever-managed auto sync, you may be able to complete basic field mappings yourself via your Clever Dashboard, or you can reach out to Clever Support, and our team can assist with more complex field mappings.

For the following auto-syncs, some custom fields can be added and customized via your Clever Dashboard for self-service field mapping:

- Illuminate Auto Sync
- [PowerSchool Plugin Sync](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001590)
- [SchoolInsight Auto Sync](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/206090237)
- [Skyward LMS API](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/232211028)

For the following syncs, custom fields can be added and customized by reaching out to Clever support:

- [Aeries Auto Sync](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/203005016)
- [Blackbaud API sync](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001544)
- [Infinite Campus API sync](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/226677767)
- [Skyward Auto Sync](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202058193)
- [Skyward OneRoster (Qmlativ) API](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/232211028)

If you utilize one of the syncs above that supports self-service mappings and want to determine if you can edit a field mapping yourself, navigate to your [Data sources > SIS sync > Settings](https://schools.clever.com/sync/settings) page, locate the Sync Mappings box, and click on the [View field mappings button](https://schools.clever.com/sync/settings/mappings).

![View field mappings button](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TBbB&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000H5Tqn)

title: For Clever Admins: Field mappings and customizing your data sync
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Field mappings and customizing your data sync
text:
If you see an **Edit** button in the actions column, you can customize the field mapping for a specific data type (schools, teachers, students, sections, enrollments).

Click on **Edit** to view a dropdown of available SIS Fields to map from.

![Edit field mappings dropdown](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TBbB&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000H5MJ4)

If you do not see the SIS field you wish to map from in the dropdown, please contact Clever Support to see if the field is available for mapping by our team.

If the field is available, please select it and then click **Update**. This will save the field mapping, and the data will be pulled from the new field the next time your sync runs. You can push a manual sync following [these instructions](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115004747027).

Depending on the percentage of changes, this may cause a [sync hold](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202494358). Please review the hold carefully via your [Clever Dashboard > SIS sync > Last Attempted Sync](https://schools.clever.com/sync) page. If the changes are intended, you can approve them and the new data will sync to Clever.

---

title: For Clever Admins: Field mappings and customizing your data sync
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Field mappings and customizing your data sync
text:
**Which sync types support self-service mappings?**

- Illuminate Auto Sync
- [PowerSchool Plugin Sync](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001590)
- [SchoolInsight Auto Sync](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/206090237)
- [Skyward LMS API](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/232211028)

**What if I do not see an edit button on the Field Mappings page?**

- You cannot complete a self-service field mapping for this field. Please contact Clever Support for additional information.

**What if I do not see the SIS field I want to map from?**

- Please contact Clever Support for additional information.

**What if I accidentally chose the wrong field for my mapping?**

- If your sync is on hold, discard the hold, then navigate back to your [field mappings](https://schools.clever.com/sync/settings/mappings) page and edit the mapping.
- If your sync is not on hold or you already approved the hold, navigate to your [field mappings](https://schools.clever.com/sync/settings/mappings) page and edit the mapping. If more than 24 hours have passed since you completed the mapping, you may want to notify users or application partners that there may have been accidental data changes.

title: Clever IDM: Summer Rollover
text:
> Tip: Title Clever IDM: Summer Rollover URL Name 000001513 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Default behavior 3. Pausing Clever IDM syncs 4. Options for syncing during the summer 5. Back to school 6. Preserving access
> Overview
> Clever IDM is built to work seamlessly with your existing summer rollover practices – from preparing for summer school, to getting ready for back to school, to preserving access for graduated students. This article is your guide for what to expect and the tools and processes you can use to customize Clever IDM – and Clever, more broadly – to fit your needs. > Default Behavior
> Clever syncs are set to pause at the end of the school year and unpause just before the back to school season. See this article for more on sync pauses and when default sync pause dates are set for this year. When your sync is paused, data in Clever won’t be automatically modified or changed. By default, Clever IDM’s nightly syncs will continue to run. Since there are no automatic data updates happening in Clever, most of the time Clever IDM syncs won’t have any impact. There are two exceptions:
> Custom data . If your district modifies custom data in Clever during your sync pause, Clever IDM will sync newly created or modified users to your identity provider. Manual changes in a destination. If someone in your district manually updates users in Google or Active Directory, Clever IDM may revert those changes on its next sync – if they conflict with Clever data. For example, if you move a Clever-managed user to a new OU in Google, Clever IDM will move that user back to its original OU during the next sync. Note: this is only true for users that Clever IDM actively manages. Clever IDM will not make any changes to users that it doesn’t manage. >  
> Pausing Clever IDM syncs
> If you would like Clever IDM’s nightly syncs to pause during this time, please use the “Pause <destination> Syncs” button, found on the IDM dashboard.

title: Clever IDM: Summer Rollover
text:
If you have multiple IDM destinations (e.g. Google and Entra ID, or Entra ID AND Active Directory), you must pause both of them, as pausing only applies to the currently selected destination. You can resume Clever IDM syncs at any time. > Learn more about pausing IDM syncs here . >  
> Options for syncing during the summer
> Some districts may want Clever IDM to automatically create and manage accounts for users over the summer. The easiest way to manage this is through the use of custom data. Our Summer School: Overview  article includes a comprehensive guide for how to manage summer school data in Clever. Any users added via custom data will be automatically synced through Clever IDM’s nightly syncs. If custom data isn’t a good option for your district, you can consider delaying your sync pause so that summer school data is updated in Clever before your pause starts. In some cases, it may make sense to not pause your Clever sync at all. For example, if you’d like to continue syncing staff and teachers to Clever – so they have their accounts created – but don’t want to use custom data. Districts using an SFTP sync can achieve this by continuing to sync the teachers.csv and staff.csv but temporarily pausing the syncing of all other files. We recommend discussing this option with the Clever team so you understand the implications. Lastly, as need be, you can manually provision users in Google, Entra ID, or Active Directory while your sync is paused. When your sync resumes, Clever IDM will match the newly created users and begin to manage them. >  
> Back to school
> Once your sync is unpaused for the coming school year, new data will begin flowing into Clever and old data will be removed. Once the data for the upcoming year is successfully synced, Clever IDM will update data in Google, Entra ID and/or Active Directory accordingly. Here are the most common changes you can expect from Clever IDM:
> Creating new users who’ve joined your district for the new school year.

title: Clever IDM: Summer Rollover
text:
This includes the newest class of students, any students who’ve transferred from other districts, as well as any teachers or staff that have joined. Updating existing users. The most common updates are OU changes. If your district’s OU structure involves schools or grade levels, you should expect Clever IDM to move students to their new OUs and sub-OUs. Archiving removed users. Any users that have been removed from your Clever sync during your pause will be archived by Clever IDM. That includes graduated or promoted students as well as any students, teachers, and staff who have left the district for other reasons. > If you’re using the graduation year field in Clever IDM and aren’t syncing graduation year values directly to Clever from your SIS, you’ll also see the following prompt in Clever IDM when you unpause:   Clever IDM calculates the graduation year based on the student’s synced grade level if you are not already sending graduation year data via your SIS. This prompt is to ensure that this calculation associates your data with the correct school year. Data synced before the graduation rollover date will be associated with the previous school year for graduation year calculations. Data synced after the graduation rollover date will be associated with the upcoming school year for graduation year calculations. Providing a graduation rollover date enables Clever IDM to automatically update any information based on the graduation year (OUs, groups, etc.) as grade levels change during rollover. If your expected graduation rollover date changes, you can edit the graduation rollover date anytime by navigating to the Select Users step in Clever IDM. Once you confirm that the graduation rollover date is correct, Clever IDM will continue syncing with the correct graduation years. > Preserving access 
> By default, Clever IDM will archive graduated students as soon as they’re removed from Clever.

title: Clever IDM: Summer Rollover
text:
In most cases, graduated students remain in Clever until a district’s sync is unpaused. That means, they’ll retain access to Google, Entra ID, and/or Active Directory during that period. Once the sync resumes, these users will then lose access. If you’d like graduated users to retain access beyond your unpause date, you can:
> Set Clever IDM to not suspend or deactivate users in ignored OUs in the OUs setup step (see below), and Move those graduated students to an ignored OU. Once in an ignored OUs, these users will retain access until you move them out of an ignored OU or manually deactivate them. > If you’d like graduated users not to retain access beyond your unpause date, you can either have them removed from your Clever sync before you pause or move the users to an ignored OU in Google or Active Directory and manually deactivate them there. If you have any questions about summer rollover with Clever IDM that haven’t been answered here, please reach out to Support.Clever.com . > Related articles:  Clever IDM: Overview Clever IDM: Active Directory Setup Clever IDM: Purchasing & Billing Clever IDM: Sync Reports Clever IDM: Pausing Syncs

title: Sharing Permissions: Guided Sharing
text:
> Warning: Title Sharing Permissions: Guided Sharing URL Name 000001514 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Guided Sharing           •    Choose setup method           •    Choose who needs access           •    Preview & share user data           •    Data validation           •    Finalize setup
>  
> Overview
> As part of the process of adding an application, Clever Admins can configure sharing permissions in order to determine what district/school data should be shared with the app, and which district/school users should have access to the application from their Clever Portal. Clever offers two experiences for sharing data:  Guided Sharing  and  Standard Sharing . > Guided Sharing  is best for new users or those who don't set up sharing settings often. Standard sharing  is best for experienced Clever users or those who need to use School Site Sharing . > The choice in experience is custom to each user -- a new admin at your district can choose to use Guided Sharing while an admin with more Clever experience may choose Standard Sharing. Users can choose to switch between these two experiences at any time by selecting  Edit Sharing  for an application, and selecting  Switch Sharing setup view  in the top-right. Your choice in sharing experience will be remembered and used anytime you edit sharing permissions for an app. >  
> Guided Sharing
>  
> Step 1: Choose sharing method
> You have options for how to share data, however, you can only choose to share based on one of the criteria below. > Share specific sections, teachers, students, and/or staff: Clever will only share data that meets the specific criteria you've set. This is the most recommended sharing type as it provides districts with the flexibility in determining specifically what data should be included, or excluded, in the sharing. Read this article to learn more about this sharing option .

title: Sharing Permissions: Guided Sharing
text:
>    Clever tip: Need help with structuring a rule to Share by specific sections, teachers, students, and/or staff? Check out our tutorial videos for Guided sharing to help create rules to share by share by section , share by teacher, share by student , and share by staff . >  
> Share everyone in specific schools: Clever will only share any data associated with the schools you've selected (e.g. students, teachers, sections, staff). >  
> Share everyone in the district: All district data in Clever will be synced to the application. This includes Clever admins, schools, teachers, students, staff and sections. >  
> Use an application’s suggested data sharing template: Some applications have set general recommendations for how to share data. You can view the recommendation and see if it’s a good fit for you. >  
> Use an application’s customized data sharing template for your district: In addition to general recommendations, sometimes an application team member will create a custom recommendation for your district. You can view the recommendation and see if it’s a good fit for you. >  
> Copy another app’s data sharing rules: If you’ve already set up sharing with another application and want to apply the same settings to this application, you can select this option. Read this article to learn more about copying sharing rules ! > The data shared with the application will dynamically update based on the sharing permissions configured. As a new record meets the sharing criteria, please allow up to 24 hours for the record to be created in the application. > Step 2: Choose who needs access
> In Step 2, you will select which users to share with an application using the selected sharing method.

title: Sharing Permissions: Guided Sharing
text:
For additional information on using the various sharing methods, please see these articles: 
> Specific sections, teachers, students, and/or staff Use an application’s customized data sharing template for your district Copy another app's data sharing rules
> During this step, you can configure sharing rules and filters as many times as you’d like. Data will not be changed in your learning applications until you click Save at the end of the Guided Sharing experience. In the next step you’ll be able to preview the data that will be shared. >  
> If you have a lot of rules, use the Jump to end/Jump to start button to scroll to the bottom/top of your rules. >  
>  
> Once you’re ready to preview that data that will be shared based on your rules, click Next. > Step 3: Preview & share user data
> In Step 3 you can preview the records that will be shared by your data sharing settings. Clever provides both the total number of shared records as well as a table of the individual records that will be shared with the application. After you have reviewed the shared records for accuracy, click  Share with application. The data is now successfully shared with the application! > Step 4: Data validation
> Many applications set data errors and warnings to flag potential data issues that will affect students and teachers. If any data errors or warnings are triggered, they will display on this page. For more information on data errors and warnings, please see this article . This step may or may not appear depending on the application's settings. When ready to proceed, click Next . > Step 5: Finalize Setup
> Some applications will provide additional instructions for finalizing setup for their application. If any final instructions have been provided, they will be surfaced here. If this is your first time setting up sharing for the application you may also see a Launch Date. This is the date when the application will be available to users in the Clever Portal.

If you need to adjust this date, please contact the application's support team directly. Once you read the setup information and complete any required steps, click Finish. > If you haven’t chosen a category for the application in your Clever Portal (it’s in the More Apps section) you’ll receive a prompt to add the application to a category. Choose a category from the dropdown if you’d like.

text:
Title

Clever IDM: Multi-Destination Support

000001516

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001516?language=en_US#overview)

Clever IDM allows you to manage accounts in on-premise Active Directory, Entra ID, and Google Workspace simultaneously.

---

title: Clever IDM: Multi-Destination Support
text:
If you haven’t started setting Clever IDM up yet, please visit [this article](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001466?language=en_US). Once you have your first destination set up, you can add another destination by simply clicking the **Add new destination** button on your Clever IDM homepage:

![Clever IDM homepage](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TmfZ&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl000002Z6Ft)

After adding an additional destination, you can start configuring it. For guidance on setting up the new destination, see [Clever IDM: Active Directory Setup](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001505), [Clever IDM: Entra ID Setup](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001553), or [Clever IDM: Google Setup](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001467).

Of note, each destination will be set up independently, meaning that you can use the same credential and OU conventions or different ones – depending on the setup that works best for you.

---

Once Clever IDM is syncing with multiple destinations, you’ll see them each as cards on your Clever IDM homepage. The cards contain summary metrics from your most recent sync. To view more about a destination, click the card to see the relevant tasks, reports, and more.

![Clever IDM destination cards](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TmfZ&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl000002Z6PZ)

---

title: Clever IDM: Multi-Destination Support
text:
**Can we manage different sets of users for each destination?**

- Yes. Clever IDM allows you to configure each destination independently, so you can select whichever user types you’d like to be managed for each destination. If you’d like to filter down users by school or grade level for a given destination, reach out to Clever Support and we can help.

**Can we keep the passwords the same across multiple destinations?**

- Clever IDM will set passwords based on your chosen convention whenever accounts are created. Clever IDM also supports random passwords across multiple destinations. Once one destination is configured, you’ll see the option to use that destination’s password in other destinations.
- School districts using Clever IDM can also enable [recovery and reset](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001613) functionality for any connected destinations.

![Screenshot of the password format setup for IDM](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TmfZ&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl000002Z3Bb)
- Once accounts are created, passwords can be managed via Clever. See this article on how to do so: [Clever Admin: Account recovery and password reset.](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001613#header3)

**Does it cost more to add multiple destinations?**

- No! Clever IDM charges based on the total number of managed users, regardless of how many destinations we manage. The only case where adding another destination will increase the cost of Clever IDM is if you use the new destination to manage users that aren’t already being managed by the first destination you configured.

**Can I add two different destinations of the same type?**

- We support multiple destinations of the same type, e.g., you can use Clever IDM to sync users to two or more Active Directory, Entra ID, or Google Workspaces servers. If you’re interested in this feature, reach out to [implementation@clever.com](mailto:implementation@clever.com).

**I use Google Directory sync and Google Password sync to keep my AD and Google in sync. Should I still keep that running if I set up IDM for both?**

- Clever IDM will manage users and their placement in OUs in Google. If those are the only things you use Google Directory Sync to manage in Google Workspace, running it in tandem with Clever IDM is unnecessary.
- If there are other elements, like Groups or Passwords, that you use Google Directory Sync to keep in sync between AD and Google, we recommend you continue to use GDS alongside Clever IDM. **Ensure you only use GDS to sync the data Clever IDM isn’t already managing.**

If you still need support or have additional questions, please reach out to [support.clever.com](https://support.clever.com/).

title: Clever IDM: Group Membership Management
text:
> Note: Title Clever IDM: Group Membership Management URL Name 000001517 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview   2. Prerequisites 3. Configuration 4. Frequently Asked Questions
> ​
> Overview
> This article describes the group membership management functionality available in Clever IDM. This functionality is only available to Clever IDM subscribers who have configured Clever IDM with Active Directory or Google. Clever IDM can create, update, and archive users in your Active Directory or Google Workspace instances. In addition, Clever IDM can now manage these users’ memberships in groups – including both security and mailing (or distribution) groups. > Prerequisites
> ​In order to set up group membership management, you will need to start by confirming the groups you want managed are properly configured. All Clever-managed groups must have unique names. > Also, if you want to set up a rule to put users into different groups, the relevant group names must follow the same conventions. For example, if you want a rule set up that will add each user to a group for their school, the relevant groups need to be consistently named – e.g. “Toll Gate Elementary - Students”, “Hopewell Valley High School - Students."  
> Configuration
> You can configure your group membership in your IDM setup under the Configure Groups step. First, select a user type you would like to manage groups for. You can manage groups for students, teachers, and or staff. Next, select all of the groups you would like Clever IDM to manage. Note: you should only select groups that you want Clever IDM to add users to and remove them from. If a user is in a group but none of Clever IDM’s membership rules indicate they should be in that group, Clever IDM will remove the user from the group. Once you’ve selected all the groups you’d like Clever IDM to manage for your selected user type, you can set up membership rules for those groups.

title: Clever IDM: Group Membership Management
text:
Click Add membership rule and create a rule for your groups. In this example, the rule will place users in groups based on their graduation years. > Please note: Navigate to the Clever IDM: Formulas Help Center article  t o learn more about common formulas and operations that you can use to manipulate data in Clever to create formulas! >   You can add as many rules as you would like for each user type. Once you have created rules, you can always go back and edit or delete them. Click Review Summary  and run a sync preview to see any changes Clever IDM would make to users’ group memberships. >  
> Active Directory: Nested Groups
> Active Directory allows for group nesting. This is the process of making one Active Directory group a member of another group. A nested group inherits all the permissions and privileges of each group it is a member of. > In the example below, the group is SamTest, the sub-group is Groups , and the nested groups are 3-Group 4-Group, PreKindergarten-Group, etc. >  
> In order for Clever IDM to manage nested groups, special group membership rule formatting is required. For the nested groups to be managed, the whole file path has to be in brackets (see below) otherwise the rule will cause an error. > Frequently Asked Questions
> ​Can membership rules place users in distribution/email groups and security groups? Yes! Clever IDM does not distinguish between security and distribution/email groups, so will add/remove users from any groups per the district’s membership rules. What happens when a user leaves my district? When a user leaves a district, Clever IDM will archive that user. If group membership management is enabled, Clever IDM will remove the user from all groups, including default AD groups. If the user returns, Clever IDM will unarchive them and place them back in the appropriate groups per the district’s membership rules. Will users’ group membership update automatically? Yes!

title: Clever IDM: Group Membership Management
text: Whenever Clever IDM syncs, it will re-evaluate all the membership rules for each user type and adjust users’ group memberships accordingly. For example, if a user moves schools and a district’s membership rules are school-based, Clever IDM will remove that user from their old school and add them to the new school group. Will Clever IDM create a new group if one doesn’t exist? No, Clever IDM will never create, edit, or delete existing groups. If Clever IDM evaluates a membership rule and the resulting group doesn’t exist, it will create an issue in the sync report. Once the relevant group is created in AD, the relevant users will be added to it, and the issue will be resolved. Why are some users not being added to groups? Clever IDM won't manage group membership for groups outside of your chosen OU. You may manually add users to groups outside of your OU, and Clever IDM will not remove a user from that group except when the users are archived. > What will happen if a user has both a teacher and a staff account in Clever? Clever IDM will manage their groups based on the primary role selected during Clever IDM setup. > Can I review any potential changes before enabling group management? Yes, after you set up your rules, Clever IDM will generate a preview. You'll review any changes to be made, and if satisfied, click Provision !

Schools in Canada are permitted to use online services, such as Clever. Clever’s services follow privacy principles and data security standards that can help schools comply with regulations applicable to Canadian schools.  
In order to meet the needs of Canadian schools, Clever has:

- Updated its privacy notice for [Canada-specific regulatory requirements](https://clever.com/trust/privacy/canada)

title: Clever and Canadian Educational Institutions
heading_path: Clever’s Compliance with Canadian Privacy Laws
section: Clever’s Compliance with Canadian Privacy Laws
text:
Clever adheres to internationally recognized privacy principles. Clever understands that Canadian schools are subject to specific Canadian privacy laws. With Clever’s services, public schools can comply with provincial Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy legislation and private schools can comply with private sector personal information protection laws such as the British Columbia Personal Information Protection Act, the Alberta Personal Information Protection Act and the Quebec Act respecting the protection of personal information in the private sector.

Clever is also a proud signatory of the [Student Data Privacy Pledge](https://studentprivacypledge.org/), the first recipient of the [IMS TrustEd Apps Seal](http://trustedapps.org/), and has received [CommonSense Privacy Program](https://privacy.commonsense.org/evaluation/Clever)’s highest possible rating, **Use Responsibly**, based on a full privacy evaluation.

---

Clever understands that Student Data is generally considered to be sensitive under Canadian privacy laws and that schools must retain control over that Student Data.

With Clever, schools can see and control all data shared with their authorized partners in one Clever dashboard rather than having to access multiple systems. When a school uses Clever, it maintains complete control over what data to share and in what circumstances.

Clever will delete Student Data and other school information from Clever’s systems upon request.

---

Clever only shares data with applications that have been explicitly authorized by the school.

Student Data is private by design. Schools are able to minimize the amount of student information shared with third party applications. Role-based access allows authorized district users to access only the features they need, without being able to modify important settings. And Clever proactively prevents end-user mistakes from leaking unauthorized data by placing automatic security holds on unusual data transfers.

---

Clever does not sell or monetize Student Data. Clever does not display advertising to students through Clever’s services. Clever does not profile students based on their behaviour. Clever does not allow behavioral tracking by any third parties on Clever for the purpose of targeted advertising or to show ads on Clever.

---

Clever does not sell or monetize Student Data. Clever does not display advertising to students through Clever’s services. Clever does not profile students based on their behaviour. Clever does not allow behavioral tracking by any third parties on Clever for the purpose of targeted advertising or to show ads on Clever.

---

Clever’s comprehensive security program is designed to secure Student Data from loss, unauthorized access, unauthorized use, unauthorized alternation and unauthorized disclosure. In accordance with Canadian legal obligations, Clever considers the sensitivity of the information in designing its security practices. Clever regularly aligns its security practices with the internationally recognized NIST Cybersecurity Framework. Clever’s Security Overview describes Clever’s approach to security. To dive deeper, please see the Clever Security Practices.

As part of Clever’s security program, Clever evaluates its vendors and works with vendors that meet Clever’s standards.

---

title: Clever and Canadian Educational Institutions
text:
Clever’s robust security practices allow Canadian schools to access and use Clever’s services hosted in the United States. Canadian laws do not prohibit the use of U.S.-based cloud services as long as the student personal information is protected in an equivalent manner as it would be in Canada. In Nova Scotia, schools may also need permission of the head of the school board as defined under the Nova Scotia Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act.

Clever is also a proud signatory of the [Student Data Privacy Pledge](https://studentprivacypledge.org/), a member of the [Student Data Privacy Consortium](https://privacy.a4l.org/), the first recipient of the [IMS TrustEd Apps Seal](http://trustedapps.org/), and have received [CommonSense Privacy Program](https://privacy.commonsense.org/evaluation/Clever)’s highest possible rating, "Use Responsibly," based on a full privacy evaluation.

---

Clever does not have a one-size fits all privacy impact assessment because each school’s use of the Clever platform may vary depending on how the school configures the Clever platform services.

However, Clever understands that public bodies in Canada and some private sector organizations are required to conduct privacy impact assessments or PIAs. Clever makes information publicly available on its privacy practices: Working with schools to safeguard data privacy. We are here to help if a school needs to conduct a PIA and Clever’s publicly available information does not provide all of the information the school needs.

---

Every member of the Clever team is responsible for ensuring that Clever meets its commitments with respect to Student Data. Clever’s privacy team can be contacted at: [trust@clever.com](mailto:trust@clever.com) .

For more information on privacy, see this page: [Working with schools to safeguard data privacy](https://clever.com/trust/privacy).
