heading_path: Clever + EBSCO Information Services Setup Guide
text:
Setting up Clever to access your EBSCO resources is simple and entirely self-service. First, you will add the EBSCO Information Services app and configure sharing permissions within the Clever dashboard.

Then, you will enable schools for Clever access in EBSCO Experience Manager. This step maps schools to EBSCO accounts, which allows EBSCO to direct Clever users to the specific resources for their school. This step is important because every district subscribes to a different set of EBSCO products.

Before you begin, it’s important to understand how your EBSCO products are set up on your district and school EBSCO customer accounts. Every school and district has an EBSCO account that their EBSCO resources are associated with. When enabling schools in EBSCO Experience Manager, you will need to know if any schools should be enabled in their own EBSCO account, or if all schools can be enabled in the district account.

The easiest way to decide is to find out if any schools in your district have subscribed to EBSCO products just for their school. If they have, you will need to enable those schools in their own EBSCO accounts. This way, users at those schools will have access to their school’s unique content as well as any shared content across the district.

If none of your schools have their own subscriptions, you can enable every school in the district’s EBSCO account.

For help with this, you can [contact EBSCO support](https://connect.ebsco.com/s/article/How-do-I-contact-EBSCO-Support), ask your school or district librarians, or reach out to your district’s EBSCO administrator. Your EBSCO administrator has primary responsibility for configuring EBSCO resources for your school or district and may be someone associated with your school library, district office, or consortium office.

​

---

title: Clever + EBSCO Information Services Setup Guide
heading_path: Clever + EBSCO Information Services Setup Guide
text:
​To add EBSCO Information Services to your Clever Dashboard, please search for it from the [Applications > Add Applications](https://schools.clever.com/applications/add) page.

We recommend sharing all records in your district with EBSCO Information Services. Once the sharing permissions have been configured, you will need to enable schools in the Authentication & Access module of EBSCO Experience Manager. For instructions, please visit EBSCO Connect: [Setting Up Clever for Your District or School](https://connect.ebsco.com/s/article/Setting-Up-Clever-for-Your-District-or-School).

Completing these steps will allow users to anonymously access EBSCO resources from within the Clever Portal. All users will be directed to the same EBSCO product. To change the product your users are directed to, ask your EBSCO administrator to help you change the top-ranked profile so that it corresponds with that product.

To direct your users straight to different EBSCO products, you can create EBSCO links that prompt for Clever authentication and add these to Clever as External Links. For example, using links you can direct primary school students to Explora, and high schoolers to EBSCOhost, and provide a separate link to access Flipster.

To learn more, please visit EBSCO Connect: [Clever SSO - Additional Customization Options](https://connect.ebsco.com/s/article/Clever-SSO-Additional-Customization-Options).

​

---

title: Clever + EBSCO Information Services Setup Guide
heading_path: Clever + EBSCO Information Services Setup Guide
text:
Once you have enabled schools in EBSCO Experience Manager and confirmed that your integration is working, there’s more that you can do. You can customize the user experience within the Clever portal, and your district can use Clever to authenticate users to EBSCO resources from outside the portal as well. For more information on these options, please see: [Clever SSO – Additional Customization Options](https://connect.ebsco.com/s/article/Clever-SSO-Additional-Customization-Options).

You can also control whether and when MyEBSCO accounts are automatically created for users. MyEBSCO accounts allow users to persistently save items they find in EBSCO products, download eBooks, and engage in other activities, such as placing a hold on an ILS item in EBSCO Discovery Service. No personally identifiable information is shared for accounts created for students. For more information on the options available, please see [How do I configure personalization for Clever?](https://connect.ebsco.com/s/article/How-do-I-configure-personalization-for-Clever?language=en_US)

---

For questions about your EBSCO account settings and configuration, please review [Clever SSO - Frequently Asked Questions for Administrators](https://connect.ebsco.com/s/article/Clever-SSO-Frequently-Asked-Questions-for-Administrators) on EBSCO Connect or reach out to your EBSCO administrator. 
  ​​

---

Please review:

- [Setting Up Clever for Your District or School](https://connect.ebsco.com/s/article/Setting-Up-Clever-for-Your-District-or-School)
- [Clever SSO - Additional Customization Options](https://connect.ebsco.com/s/article/Clever-SSO-Additional-Customization-Options)
- [How do I configure personalization for Clever?](https://connect.ebsco.com/s/article/How-do-I-configure-personalization-for-Clever?language=en_US)
- [Clever SSO - Frequently Asked Questions for Administrators](https://connect.ebsco.com/s/article/Clever-SSO-Frequently-Asked-Questions-for-Administrators) on EBSCO Connect.

If you still have questions, or if you see an EBSCO-branded error message, please submit a support case. 
​

---

​For additional help requesting the EBSCO Information Services app in your Clever Dashboard or questions on setting up sharing permissions, you can open a ticket with Clever Support by clicking the messaging icon in the lower right corner of the [Clever Help Center.](http://support.clever.com)

7. [Frequently Asked Questions](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001523?language=en_US#faqs)

You can share Teacher Pages and resources with other teachers **in your school**, and they can share their pages and resources with you as well.

Sharing Teacher Pages is perfect for:

- Teachers covering a class who want to know what resources students have access to
- Sharing content with teachers in your department to spark more collaboration
- Sharing a stellar Teacher Page as an exemplar for other teachers
- A common unit of study that a class team might be doing in tandem (so other teachers don’t need to reinvent the wheel).

**![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000SicP&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028C4p)** If you’re not yet familiar with Teacher Pages, [check out this article](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360001158323) first!

---

You can increase collaboration with colleagues by sharing your page with other teachers within your school. Click the **More page actions > Share Page** button at the top of the Teacher Page you are sharing and enter the person you’d like to share the page with.

Rest assured, they won’t be able to modify your page! They’ll only be able to see the resources you’ve added to your page and add any desired resources to their own page.

![Share my teacher page](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000SicP&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl000009ZsGT)

---

You can also share a single specific resource, such as an app, PDF, or link. To share a resource, click on the **three vertical dots (⋮)** on the resource, then click **Send**. You can send the resource to a specific teacher or your entire grade level.

![Teacher Page resource with Send button](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000SicP&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000005SzE8)

---

When a page or resource is shared with you, you’ll see a notification in the bell icon of your Clever Portal.

![Teacher notification icon](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000SicP&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl0000044hIb)

![Teacher notification panel](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000SicP&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl0000044hKD)

You can also access shared pages by going to the **Shared with Me Pages** tab of your Clever Portal under the **Pages** drop-down on the left-hand side of your Portal.

![Teacher Page Shared with Me page](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000SicP&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl0000044hSH)

---

How to copy resources from a page shared with you
section: How to copy resources from a page shared with you
text:
See a resource on another teacher’s Page that you like? You can add that resource to your own Teacher Page by clicking on the **Add** button. If the resource is a [Clever Library](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360013488672) app that you don’t already have, you’ll be able to provision accounts for your students when adding the app to your Page.

Please remember that if a district app on a Teacher Page isn’t shared with you in Clever, you won’t have access to it. For instance, let’s say you’re a science teacher. If an ELA teacher shares their Page, which has a **district-added** reading program that only reading teachers can view in your school, you’ll see a grayed-out icon and won’t be able to access the app.

![Add resources from this page to your Teacher Page](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000SicP&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl0000044hYj)

title: Clever Portal: Sharing Teacher Pages & resources with other teachers
heading_path: Clever Portal: Sharing Teacher Pages & resources with other teachers
text:
**Who can I share my Teacher Page or resource with?** 
Currently, you can select to share with any teacher who works at your school site. Your district assigns your school site. If you teach at more than one school, you'll only be able to share at your primary school, which is either the school your district has assigned as your primary school or the school where you teach the most classes/sections.

**Can I revoke shared access from someone after I have shared my Teacher Page with them?** 
Yes! You can remove view access from others at any time via the sharing settings.

**Can I dismiss Pages that are shared with me that I am not interested in?** 
Not at this time. Those Pages will only be accessible under the “Shared with Me” tab of your homeroom.

**Can teachers edit or change my Page while they’re viewing it?** 
No! At this time, teachers can view your Page and add resources from it to their own Page. They won't be able to make any changes to your Page.

**If I share a Page with another teacher, can their students access my Teacher Page?** 
No, only your students can view your Page(s). When you share with another teacher, only that teacher can view your Page.

**How can I add a resource from another teacher’s Page to my own?** 
Click the **Add button** on a resource that you’d like on your own Page. You’ll be able to select the Page and category you’d like to add that resource to! If it is a Clever Library app, Clever will prompt you to provision accounts for your students first.

**Why can’t I add a grayed-out resource to my Page?** 
Your district may add resources that aren't provisioned for your use. If this is the case, the resource will appear grayed out, and you’ll need to contact your district for permission.

**How will I know if another teacher has shared a page with me?** 
You will receive a notification on your Homeroom Page and see an icon for their Teacher Page underneath the **Shared with Me** tab.

---

Clever enables you to check your configuration settings by user with the Sync Visualizer Preview tool. The **Sync Visualizer Preview** tool helps Clever admins understand the changes to be made to different users that are currently being managed by Clever IDM before the changes occur. This tool only shows the differences for users whose information changed. Users with no changes won’t show up in this tool.

To review all creations, matches, updates, and archivals after your Clever IDM sync has run, we recommend utilizing the Events tab on your Clever IDM overview page. The events tab will allow you to filter and locate specific users to view more details on how Clever IDM is managing their destination account.

---

title: Clever IDM: Preview Sync Visualizer and Events
heading_path: Clever IDM: Preview Sync Visualizer and Events
text:
The Sync Visualizer Preview tool is available during setup at the [Preview and Provision step](https://schools.clever.com/identity-management/setup/preview).

![Check user button](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000StET&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl000000Bl3g)

Please refresh your preview before attempting to use this feature

To use this feature:

1. Click **Check a user**
2. Search for user by name or email
3. Once you select a user, you will see information based on the action being done for the user.

**For users that will be created, you will see:**

- The locations where the user is or will be placed
- First and last name
- Clever IDM username
- If the user needs to change their password on next login

![image](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000StET&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000005PvXy)

**For users that will be updated, you'll see:**

- Current Value of field(s) to be updated
- Updated Value for field(s)

![image](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000StET&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000005PvWh)

**For users that will be archived, you'll see:**

- Original location of the user
- New archive location

![UserArchived.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000StET&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000005PvY8)

**For user accounts with current issues, you'll see:**

- Issue type

- More details

![UserIssue.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000StET&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000005PvYD)

With this tool you can view and confirm expected changes to your users quickly and easily. If you discover unexpected changes, you can go back through the configuration to adjust what’s needed.

title: Clever IDM: Preview Sync Visualizer and Events
heading_path: Clever IDM: Preview Sync Visualizer and Events
text:
After your initial Clever IDM sync, you can continue to track changes to your users via the [User Management > IDM > Events tab](https://schools.clever.com/identity-management). On this tab, you can select a date range for which you’d like to review Clever IDM creates, updates, archives, and matched users. You can also apply filters to examine changes by destination (if you have multiple configured), event type (create, update, etc.), or specific users by name or SIS ID.

Once you find the event for the user and destination you’d like to review, click the dropdown arrow to examine more details.

![Clever IDM Events view](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000StET&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000PvbME)

If you find that Clever IDM is managing a user in an unexpected manner, and you need help troubleshooting, please [contact Clever Support](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360001041326).

title: TN Universal Reading Screener - Setup Guide
heading_path: TN Universal Reading Screener - Setup Guide
text:
Tennessee school districts can use Clever to integrate applications used for the Tennessee Universal Reading Screener and meet the state’s data requirements. While solutions may vary, districts can leverage their Clever Sync and use extension fields to manage their data for the TN Universal Reading Screener. Please reference the steps below to include these required data fields in Clever.

The following data fields are required by the Tennessee Department of Education:

1. **District ID (District Number)** - 5-digit ID\*
2. **School ID (School Number)** - 4-digit code\*
3. **Student Unique Student Identifier** - USID
 - Clever standard field - State ID
 - Clever extension field - studentstateid.ext
4. **Teacher License Number (TLN)**
 - Clever standard field - State ID
 - Clever extension field - teacherstateid.ext (Highly recommended)

title: TN Universal Reading Screener - Setup Guide
heading_path: TN Universal Reading Screener - Setup Guide
text:
- Data Element: District ID (District Number); ColumnName: DistrictID; Definition: The number in the school directory assigned by the state to each district.; Length: Max Length: 3 Data Type: Numeric; Sample Value / Additional Info: Source: School Directory / Department List Provided (column A in district tab). Unique in state, non-duplicated.
- Data Element: School ID (School Number); ColumnName: SchoolID; Definition: The number in the school directory assigned by the state to each school within a district.; Length: Max Length: 4 Data Type: Numeric; Sample Value / Additional Info: School Directory / Department List Provided (column D in schools tab)   Unique in district, may be duplicated across state
- Data Element: State Assigned Student ID (USID); ColumnName: SSID; Definition: Unique student ID generated by the state and assigned to a student.; Length: MaxLength: 9 DataType: Numeric; Sample Value / Additional Info: Usually 7 digits; trim leading zeroes as needed
- Data Element: Teacher License Number (TLN); ColumnName: TLN; Definition: Unique number assigned to an educator by the state when they are first entered into the teacher Certification and Licensure system; Length: Data Type: Numeric  Usually 6 digits; trim leading zeros as needed.; Sample Value / Additional Info: If teacher has no TLN, schools/districts should use the last 4 of the instructors SSN for the TLN field.  Growth scores will not be calculated for those teachers if no TLN provided before final spring cumulative file.

title: TN Universal Reading Screener - Setup Guide
heading_path: TN Universal Reading Screener - Setup Guide
Step 1: Sending Clever the required fields
section: Step 1: Sending Clever the required fields
text:
You can send Clever each field using the standard fields below:

**School ID (School Number)** - 4-digit code\*

- schools.csv: Clever Standard Field - School\_ID

**Student Unique Student Identifier** - USID

- students.csv: Clever standard field - State\_ID

**Teacher License Number** **(TLN)**

- teachers.csv: Clever standard field - State\_ID

If you are unable to use the standard fields in Clever to send your data, you can leverage extension fields using the instructions below:

**For SFTP and SIS-Managed Auto Syncs:**

There are a couple of options for uploading custom field data to Clever via SFTP/CSV files:

- Districts can add a custom/extension field column to one of the existing rostering files being synced to Clever (schools.csv, teachers.csv, students.csv, sections.csv, and enrollments.csv). The column name must begin with 'ext'.
 - For example: Fields such as 'Teacher License Number' or could be added to the teachers.csv with columns named 'ext.teacher\_license\_number' or 'ext.teacherstateid' to your CSV files.
- If your district currently syncs data to Clever via SFTP, you can also upload custom fields via CSV files directly to your Clever SFTP folder by uploading to a subdirectory named /extensionfields. The files should be named:
 - schools\_ext.csv
 - sections\_ext.csv
 - students\_ext.csv
 - teachers\_ext.csv
 - staff\_ext.csv

**For Clever Managed Autosyncs:**

For the following auto-syncs, custom fields can be added by reaching out to Clever support to help set up custom field mapping using extension fields.

- PowerSchool
- Infinite Campus Auto Sync
- Skyward Auto Sync
- Illuminate Auto Sync
- Aeries Auto Sync
- SchoolInsight Auto Sync
- iNow Auto Sync

Please reach out to [Clever Support](https://support.clever.com/hc/en-us) and we can get this started for you.

---

title: TN Universal Reading Screener - Setup Guide
heading_path: TN Universal Reading Screener - Setup Guide
Step 2: Sharing extension fields with Applications used for the TN Universal Reading Screener
section: Step 2: Sharing extension fields with Applications used for the TN Universal Reading Screener
text:
You can share your custom fields with any app by follow these steps:

1. Navigate to the overview page for the app and click on the **Settings** tab
2. Under **Field Access**, select **Advanced Settings**
3. Select **Customize fields shared with {app}** and click **Customize fields**![advanced settings pop up box](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TjwD&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000005Q1oY)
4. On the **Edit Student Fields** page, select **Next**
5. On the **Edit Contact Fields** page, select **Next**
6. On the **Edit District Admin Fields** page, select **Next**
7. You are now on the **Edit Extension Fields** page. Any extension fields that you have uploaded to Clever will be found in the left column under **Fields**. Click on the fields you wish to share with the app to bring it to the right column under **Share with {app}**. Once you have selected the desired fields to share, select **Save**. ![Edit extension fields pop up box](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TjwD&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000005Q1oi)

​

Often charter schools (and sometimes small districts) share a Student Information System (SIS) with other schools or a larger school district.  Since Clever syncs data from your SIS, many districts and schools in this scenario share a Clever account, however, there are times when a district or school may prefer to maintain its own Clever account. Below are a few items to take into consideration when choosing if your school should manage its own Clever account. 
NOTE 
**If your SIS is managed by a separate team (e.g. a school district or charter school network), you will want to reach out to that team to consider the following information together.**

---

If you share an SIS account with a district or group of schools, you'll need to know how to export and upload just your school’s data.

This can be done via an [SFTP Sync](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/205783078), but you may need to work with the district or charter network team to ensure just your school’s data is exported. Clever isn't able to provide guidance on the export process from your SIS when using an SFTP sync.

​

---

Are you currently syncing data to any applications through the existing Clever account? If so, please contact your application representative if you are anticipating a change to your existing Clever account. Creating a new Clever account will provision users with new Clever IDs, potentially impacting historical data within connected applications.

​

---

​If you have any students or teachers currently accessing an existing district account, Clever won't be able to preserve historical data across these accounts.  Individual application partners may be able to assist, but you will need to reach out to them directly.

Additionally, if you have students who are highly transient (move between schools in the district or charter network frequently), please consider that these students will not have data preserved as they potentially move between Clever accounts.

---

If multiple schools share a Google Admin Console, Badges into Chromebooks can only be supported for one Clever account. The setup for Badges into Chromebooks requires the unique sign-in/sign-out URL for Clever, and this can only be input in Google once.

Clever Admin cannot have the same email address on multiple Clever accounts. If you wish to have the same admins on multiple accounts, a unique email address will be necessary for each account.

​

---

Many large districts prefer to use the School Tech Lead role to help manage individual school accounts within a larger district account.

School Tech Leads have additional permissions such as the ability to customize their school’s Clever Portal, utilize School Site Sharing to control their school’s sharing rules for applications, and help with troubleshooting logins for users in their school. For more information on School Tech Leads please see our articles [Clever Roles: School Tech Lead](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115003207663?language=en_US) and [Sharing Permissions: Enabling School Site Sharing for School Tech Leads](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115001972366?language=en_US).

---

heading_path: Requesting a New Clever Account: Shared Student Information Systems
text:
**Can I use a Clever-Managed Auto Sync or API Sync for an individual account if I share a Student Information System (SIS)?**

- This depends on your SIS. Reach out to Clever Support for additional information.

**If I choose to share a Clever account with my district/network, can I update the emails for just my school?**

- It's common for districts to have one email domain stored in their SIS, while an individual school may also have its own unique domain. If you need to update emails in the existing account to reflect your preferred domain for student logins, you can do so by manually side-loading emails. See our article [Manually Uploading (i.e. side-loading) User Emails to Clever](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115004455026?language=en_US) for more information, or reach out to [Clever Support](https://support.clever.com/) for additional assistance.

title: Clever + Virginia Wizard: Setup guide
text:
- If your division is already on Clever, you can connect Virginia Wizard’s application by accepting your invite (please email [wizard@vccs.edu](mailto:wizard@vccs.edu) to ask for an invitation to connect) OR following these instructions:

 - Once you have made your selections, click **Request**.

Once you have shared data with Virginia Wizard, the Virginia Wizard team will set up the initial sync.

Before sharing:

- Ensure that students and teachers are in their correct grade levels and that classes are updated for the current school year in your Student Information System (SIS).

Virginia Wizard recommends that you “Share all records in my district” in Clever. You can find more info about sharing data [here.](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/203115007)

Check the Data Quality tab in your Clever dashboard to see whether you’re meeting the required data fields. Virginia Wizard requires the following data fields be sent:

**Student:** district, name, school, schools, sis\_id, credentials, dob, email, ext, gender, grade, graduation\_year, hispanic\_ethnicity, location, race, state\_id, student\_number

**Teacher:** district, name, school, schools, sis\_id, credentials, email, ext, state\_id, teacher\_number, title

**School Admin:** district, name, schools, staff\_id, credentials, department, email, ext, roles, title

**District admin:** district, name.first, name.last, email, title

---

**Virginia Wizard** 
The Wizard team offers training for counselors and teachers on how to use Clever with student logins and rostering. Just request this by emailing [wizard@vccs.edu](mailto:wizard@vccs.edu).

**Clever** 
Support.clever.com (click the chat icon in the corner of the screen) 
Contact Clever with issues that relate to the steps outlined in this article, or see [Clever Academy](http://www.clever.academy) for more information on how to get the most out of Clever.

title: Clever IDM: Pushing and Pausing syncs
heading_path: Clever IDM: Pushing and Pausing syncs
section: Clever IDM: Pushing and Pausing syncs
text:
Title

Clever IDM: Pushing and Pausing syncs

URL Name

000001532

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001532?language=en_US#header1) 
2. [Pushing a sync](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001532?language=en_US#pushsync) 
3. [Examples of when to pause](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001532?language=en_US#header2) 
4. [Pausing a Clever IDM sync](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001532?language=en_US#header3) 
5. [Resuming a Clever IDM sync](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001532?language=en_US#header4)

Clever IDM’s default behavior is to sync once daily, at night. At that time, Clever will compare the data in Clever to the accounts in Google/AD/Entra and create, update, or archive users appropriately.

There may be some reason that you want to temporarily pause your nightly Clever IDM sync, though. This article will walk you through the process of pushing, pausing, and resuming your Clever IDM syncs.

---

To initiate a manual sync of IDM:

1. Navigate to [Clever Dashboard > User Management > IDM.](https://schools.clever.com/identity-management)
2. Click on the desired destination.
3. Click **Edit <destination> provisioning.

![Screenshot of edit provisioning button](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000StG5&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000VaU2X)**
4. In the bottom right, click **Provision <destination>

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000StG5&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl0000025hzF)**

---

Some examples of when pausing your Clever IDM sync may be helpful:

- Encountering issues with IDM? Pause your sync while you understand what the issue is. Resume your sync once you have identified the issue.
- Making big changes to your Clever sync (summer rollover, semester rollover, changing an SIS)? Pause your sync. When the majority of your changes are complete, resume the sync. This will ensure that you don’t have too many rapid, unnecessary changes in your provisioned Google/Active Directory/Entra accounts while the SIS changes are happening.

---

title: Clever IDM: Pushing and Pausing syncs
heading_path: Clever IDM: Pushing and Pausing syncs
text:
On [the Clever IDM Dashboard](https://schools.clever.com/identity-management/), select the destination that you want to pause the syncs for.

![Pause button for Google syncs](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000StG5&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000VaW7Z)

Click the **Pause <Destination> Syncs** button and confirm the pause in the pop-up.

Once you have confirmed the pause, your destination’s Clever IDM syncs should be paused.

On the Clever IDM Dashboard, the destination will now have a **Paused** indicator, and a banner will appear, informing you that the syncs are paused.

![IDM dashboard with banner at the top that says sync is paused](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000StG5&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000005QM7c)

While Clever IDM syncs are paused, you'll still be able to change your configuration settings and preview these changes.

You won't be able to provision the changes until you resume the IDM syncs.

If you have Clever IDM for more than one destination (e.g., for Google AND Active Directory), you can pause them each individually. This means that your Google IDM sync can still continue while your Active Directory IDM sync is paused.

However, this also means you must manually pause both of them if you don't want any IDM syncs to run.

---

title: Clever IDM: Pushing and Pausing syncs
heading_path: Clever IDM: Pushing and Pausing syncs
text:
To resume Clever IDM syncs, click the **Resume <destination> Syncs** button on the [IDM Dashboard](https://schools.clever.com/identity-management/).

![IDM dashboard with sync paused, with Resume Google Provisioning Syncs button highlighted](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000StG5&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000005QM8L)

A popup will appear, asking you to confirm the change. When you press confirm, Clever IDM will automatically kick off a preview of your accounts for you. Please review these changes and verify they are correct before your next nightly IDM sync. If you notice any unexpected changes, you may pause your syncs again at any time as you resolve the issues.

Another way to resume Clever IDM syncs is to click the **Resume Syncs** button in the banner that informs you that your IDM syncs are paused. It works exactly the same as the button on the IDM Dashboard.

---

**Related articles:**

- [Clever IDM: Overview](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001466)
- [Clever IDM: Summer Rollover](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001513)
- [Clever IDM: Sync Reports](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001473)

title: For Clever Admins: Adding a long-term substitute teacher
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Adding a long-term substitute teacher
section: For Clever Admins: Adding a long-term substitute teacher
text:
> Important: Title For Clever Admins: Adding a long-term substitute teacher URL Name 000001533 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. How to add a substitute 3. How subs log in to Clever 4. Frequently Asked Questions
>  
> Overview
> A common piece of feedback we’ve heard from substitute teachers is that they often aren’t given any access to edtech programs, making it hard for them to support students. > Good news! You can use Clever to give both long-term and short-term substitute teachers access to Clever and your district’s edtech programs. >  
> IMPORTANT  This article covers the process for adding long-term subs to your schools. For short-term subs (roughly five days or less) please have teachers use our short-term substitute teacher feature . > This enables them to support students in ways such as:
> Troubleshooting logins for students using Clever Creating or viewing Teacher Pages Launching apps and logging students out of Clever Accessing edtech programs to check on student progress and offer support
>  
> Please note: Please remember that, like any user added via Clever, subs who access Clever may count towards your license caps for your edtech programs. This varies considerably from app to app, as some apps might offer an unlimited school or district license while others charge per user. If you’re unsure if adding subs will affect any app subscriptions, please check in with the app directly. >  
> How to add a substitute
> Short term substitutes
> For a substitute covering a class last minute or for less than one week, we recommend the following steps. > If the substitute teacher works in your district regularly and already has a Clever teacher account, please proceed to step two. If the substitute teacher doesn't work for your district as a regular teacher , or if they are only a  staff user in Clever, you’ll add them as a custom teacher in Clever.

title: For Clever Admins: Adding a long-term substitute teacher
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Adding a long-term substitute teacher
section: For Clever Admins: Adding a long-term substitute teacher
text:
When adding them as a custom teacher, you can set a predetermined date when they’ll lose access (which you can update as needed). If you add a predetermined date when they lose access, you’ll have to re-add the sub if they ever come back to your school to sub again. Note:  Please wait 15 minutes after adding the custom teacher before moving to step two; this allows the custom teacher to sync across Clever. Add the teacher as a co-teacher to all of the sections they will be substituting for. This will give them access to those sections in Clever, along with most edtech apps that support co-teachers. Some edtech programs don’t support co-teachers, so please check with any critical programs directly. > Please note: For the teacher to log in, they must have an email that matches the Identity Provider (IDP) your district has set up. For example, if you have Google as your IDP, the teacher must have a Gmail address (either personal or provided by your district). Alternatively, you can add Clever Passwords  as an IDP, which subs access via a username and password (and doesn’t require a specific email address/provider). > Inform the substitute. You can share this article with them , which runs through how Clever works for teachers and how they can access it. > Please note: While the sub can log into Clever around 15 minutes after you’ve added them, it may take up to 24 hours for them to be shared with all apps (this sync typically occurs on a nightly basis). If it’s been more than 24 hours and the sub does not have access to an application, we suggest contacting the app(s) in question or Clever Support. >     Long term substitutes
> For a substitute covering a class longer-term (such as parental leave), we recommend the following steps. Option 1: Add them as a teacher via your Student Information System (SIS): This option is ideal, as it automatically creates their account in Clever, and shares them with the section(s) they’ll be teaching in any connected apps.

title: For Clever Admins: Adding a long-term substitute teacher
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Adding a long-term substitute teacher
section: For Clever Admins: Adding a long-term substitute teacher
text: > If possible, have the teacher added as the teacher of record in your Student Information System (SIS), and add them as the teacher for the sections they’ll be covering. We also recommend providing them a district email address as this is often a requirement for your connected apps and will help the sub to access Clever. > Note: If adding them as the teacher of record isn’t possible, you can also add them as a co-teacher . Some edtech programs don’t support co-teachers, so please check with any critical programs directly. > If you’re able to follow step one, this teacher will automatically be added to Clever and provided access to the sections you’ve added them to, along with any edtech programs those sections are shared with. As such, they’ll have access to Clever and edtech programs in the same way as any other district teacher. Inform the substitute that they have a Clever account and a district email account. You can share this article with them , which runs through how Clever works for teachers and how they can access it. > Option 2: Add them as a custom teacher in Clever If you add the sub as a custom teacher, you’ll have to take more manual steps than with option one. > If option one isn’t viable, you can add the long-term sub as a custom teacher in Clever. Note:  Please wait 15 minutes after adding the custom teacher before moving to step two; this allows the custom teacher to sync across Clever. Add them as a co-teacher for all the sections they’ll be teaching. > Inform the substitute that they have a Clever account. You can share this article with them, which runs through how Clever works and how they can access it. > Please note: While the sub can log into Clever around 15 minutes after you’ve added them, it may take up to 24 hours for them to be shared with all apps (this sync typically occurs on a nightly basis). If it’s been more than 24 hours and the sub is not showing up, we suggest contacting the app(s) in question or Clever Support.

title: For Clever Admins: Adding a long-term substitute teacher
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Adding a long-term substitute teacher
section: For Clever Admins: Adding a long-term substitute teacher
text:
>    
> How subs log in to Clever
> Subs with district email addresses 
> If the sub has a district email address, they can sign in using that email on your district’s Clever URL (such as Clever.com/in/district-nickname ). If your district uses Clever Passwords as your Identity Provider (IdP), the teacher will use the username/password configuration you’ve determined for signing in (you can  check that here if you’re not sure). >   Subs without district email addresses  
> If the sub doesn't have a district email address, they can sign in using a personal Google email account if your district uses Google as an Identity Provider . Just be sure to use their Google email address when creating their account. If the sub does not have a district email address, and your district doesn’t use Google as an Identity Provider, the sub will need to sign in via Clever Passwords. You can add this as an Identity Provider here . > Frequently Asked Questions
> Can you provide substitutes with access for a specific date range? > Yes! When adding the sub as a Custom Teacher, you can determine a date for them to lose access. Learn more about custom teachers here . > Will subs have access to Teacher Pages? > Subs will have access to build their own Teacher Pages, whether they’re a regular teacher created via your SIS or a custom teacher. If the teacher the sub is covering for has Teacher Page(s), that teacher can also share their Teacher Page with the sub. You can find out more about sharing Teacher Pages here .

title: For Teachers: Using Clever as a substitute teacher
heading_path: For Teachers: Using Clever as a substitute teacher
section: For Teachers: Using Clever as a substitute teacher
text:
Title

For Teachers: Using Clever as a substitute teacher

URL Name

000001534

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001534?language=en_US#header1) 
2. [What’s Clever](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001534?language=en_US#header2) 
3. [How to get access to Clever](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001534?language=en_US#header3) 
4. [Frequently Asked Questions](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001534?language=en_US#header4)

If you’re a short or long-term substitute for a school, this article is for you! This article will run through what Clever is at a high level, how to get access, and FAQs.

---

Clever connects districts with the applications and programs they use every day.  
Students and teachers sign in to Clever, and are then able to log in to hundreds of applications and programs. With just one username and password, students and teachers can get into many edtech programs, making digital learning quicker and easier.

In addition, Clever also shares up-to-date class rosters with apps and programs, so the class list is always updated across all programs. When a new student is added or removed from a class, Clever shares this update with all programs connected to Clever.

Finally, with Clever, teachers have access to troubleshooting tools. They can easily help students who are having trouble getting logged in, instead of needing to contact the district IT department.

You may need access to Clever because you are a long-term sub who needs to work with students in their online curriculum, or you may need access for the day to follow a lesson plan left by the classroom teacher that was set up in their Clever Teacher Page.

Using Clever allows you to better support students, whether you’re with them for a day, a week, or months.

---

title: For Teachers: Using Clever as a substitute teacher
heading_path: For Teachers: Using Clever as a substitute teacher
How to get access to Clever
section: How to get access to Clever
text:
Clever is set up at the district level, so you’ll need to reach out to the district you’re working at to request access. Typically, Clever is managed by a district’s information technology (IT) team, so you should ask your point of contact at the district (such as the principal or a school admin) to reach out to the district’s IT team.

Once you’ve been added to Clever by the district, you’ll log in using the district’s unique Clever web address, such as [Clever.com/in/school-district-name](http://Clever.com/in/school-district-name). If you don’t know this URL, you can also [click here to search for the school and district](https://clever.com/oauth/district-picker?channel=clever&client_id=4c63c1cf623dce82caac&confirmed=true&redirect_uri=https%3A%2F%2Fclever.com%2Fin%2Fauth_callback&response_type=code&state=9da401d904185a5260cfde336cfe34815f8c361e11c08c931bf4ccace2509eb1). Keep in mind that you must be added by the district before you can access Clever.

![Clever Academy.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000EPub&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000035fcv)To learn more about Clever, you can check out our free, on-demand training: [Clever Academy](https://clever.academy/?user_type=teacher) ! In as little as 10 minutes, you can learn more about Clever’s powerful features and use them to support digital learning. Please note that you must already have a Clever account before you can access Clever Academy.

---

**Who can I reach out to if I don’t have Clever access?**

- Please reach out to your main point of contact at the school you’re subbing at (such as a principal).

title: Clever + NWEA MAP Growth: Sharing Program status
heading_path: Clever + NWEA MAP Growth: Sharing Program status
section: Clever + NWEA MAP Growth: Sharing Program status
text:
> Tip: Title Clever + NWEA MAP Growth: Sharing Program status URL Name 000001539 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Required Fields 3. Sharing Program Status: Setup Process 4. Frequently Asked Questions 5. Support Contacts
>  
> Overview
>  
> Please note:  On July 15, 2025, the NWEA MAP Growth application and the HMHCore application will be merging into a new application called HMH Rostering Service. You can start this upgrade June 23rd or whenever you plan to begin rostering for the new school year. All districts with NWEA MAP Growth on Clever will see a migration wizard in your Clever Dashboard starting on June 23rd to automatically migrate your data from NWEA MAP Growth to HMH Rostering Service. Please see clever.com/clever-hmh for more information. >  
> Before reading this guide, please ensure your district is set up with Clever and that you've added the NWEA MAP Growth app to your district's Clever account! If your district hasn't been set up with Clever, you can get started by going to this link: clever.com/signup . For more information on setting up Clever for the first time, please see this guide . A District Admin must add the application in Clever. To add the NWEA MAP Growth app, search  NWEA MAP Growth  in the search bar of your Clever account . When it comes to rostering for NWEA MAP Growth with Clever, one of the most common requests from districts is for the capability to summarize test results by program (e.g., 504, IEP, special ed, etc.). To address this need, the MAP system supports importing program designations from Clever, making program data available in several MAP Growth reports. The “ Sharing Program Status: Setup Process ” section of this article explains how to share programs from Clever to NWEA MAP Growth. > Required Fields
> Check the Data Quality tab of the NWEA MAP Growth app in your Clever Dashboard to see whether you’re meeting the required data fields.

title: Clever + NWEA MAP Growth: Sharing Program status
heading_path: Clever + NWEA MAP Growth: Sharing Program status
section: Clever + NWEA MAP Growth: Sharing Program status
text:
NWEA MAP Growth requires the following data fields to be sent:   Student:
> sis\_id name district school(s) grade race gender dob hispanic\_ethnicity state\_id (if you’re using NWEA as part of a state program) frl\_status, iep\_status, ell\_status and extension fields are optional
> Teacher:
> district name school(s) sis\_id email
> If you’re using NWEA as part of a state program, you may have additional fields required by your state, including but not limited to the state\_id field at the school level. Please see your state program documentation for the fields required by your state. >  
> Sharing Program Status: Setup Process
> If you’d like to import program designations from Clever into MAP, please read the following setup process. > Step 1: Find the MAP Custom Names for the programs you'll sync 
> When Clever sends program data to MAP (e.g., if a student is an ELL), the MAP system will attempt to import the data using the MAP Custom Names for the programs you’ve defined. Therefore, a good first step is to identify the MAP Custom Names that are already entered the MAP system (if any). To find the Custom Names for the programs in your district: 
> Log in to MAP at teach.mapnwea.org . In the left navigation menu, click  Modify Preferences > Modify District . Scroll to the Programs section. A list of programs showing the NWEA Standard Name and Custom Name appears. Note the Custom Names for programs you want to sync using Clever. > Please keep in mind:
> The NWEA Standard Name isn't used to match program data from Clever. The Custom Name is the name that shows on reports. It's possible for multiple Custom Names to have the same NWEA Standard Name, and it's also possible for the Custom Name to be identical to the NWEA Standard Name. If you need a program added (such as Individualized Education Plan (IEP)) that isn't a default value in the MAP System, you'll need to add the program in NWEA if you want this program data to sync from Clever.

title: Clever + NWEA MAP Growth: Sharing Program status
heading_path: Clever + NWEA MAP Growth: Sharing Program status
section: Clever + NWEA MAP Growth: Sharing Program status
text:
Follow these steps:
> In the left navigation menu of NWEA, select Modify Preferences > Modify District . Click Add Program , then select Other as the Standard Name and paste the program name, like "Individualized Education Plan (IEP)" into the Custom Name text field. Click Submit to save. >  
> Step 2: Learn about Clever standard fields
> Clever has three standard fields that are pre-populated in the Clever system. > ell\_status frl\_status iep\_status 
> These three Clever standard fields, if shared with the MAP System, will automatically link up with the following MAP Custom Names if the MAP Custom Names are present in your MAP system (see chart below). This table provides an overview of values in Clever and what you would see in the MAP System under Modify Preferences > Modify District . > Step 3: Identify if you need to modify or create new extension fields in Clever
> Now that you understand that Clever has three default fields that align with a small handful of common school programs, you can determine if you need to add or modify extension fields in Clever to identify additional programs in your school (e.g., talented & gifted, after-school classes, etc.). The easiest way to do this is to compare the extension fields in Clever to the list of MAP Custom Names:
> If the extension fields in Clever perfectly match (including spelling and punctuation) the list of MAP Custom Names, then no action is needed, and your data should transfer accurately. If you have extension fields in Clever (e.g., Talented & Gifted) that aren't on the list of MAP Custom Names, you will need to create new MAP Custom Names to match these extension fields. If you have MAP Custom Names (e.g., After School Program) that don't have a matching Clever extension field, you will need to create a new (or modify a current) extension field to match the MAP Custom. > Please note:  The extension fields in Clever must perfectly match the MAP Custom Name (including  spelling and punctuation ).

> Step 4: Creating new extension fields in Clever

The exact process will depend on the sync type you have set up to connect your Student Information System (SIS) to Clever. If you need help syncing the data from your SIS into Clever in the correct format, contact Clever Support by clicking the blue chat box in the bottom right corner of the Help Center. The names of the Clever extension fields that the MAP system accepts are listed in the right-hand column in the table below. The data you'll enter in the CSV file to assign a particular student to a program will be the exact Custom Name of the program you have listed in the MAP system. Let's look at an example of students who are assigned different programs in Clever (via extension fields) that will then be sent over to MAP as a Standard Name or Custom Name:     In the above example, you see that:
> Student 123 will be assigned to two programs in MAP: the Remote Learning program and the Gifted and Talented program. Student 456 will also be assigned to the Remote Learning program, as well as the Section 504 program. Student 789 is assigned to two programs in MAP: the Remote Learning and Economically Disadvantaged programs. >  
> Step 5: Share data with NWEA
> Now that the data is synced to Clever, you can share the data with NWEA. The instructions for sharing custom fields in Clever can be found here . Since these fields are considered sensitive, you must provide special permission for Clever to share these fields with MAP. Refer to For District Admins: Syncing Sensitive Fields (i.e., ELL status, IEP status, FRL status) for instructions. > Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)

text:
> You can add multiple "other" extension fields! If you're using a CSV file to upload your extension fields, you'll simply list all of the extension fields for the student within the ext.other column, separating each field with a comma, as shown in this example, a student with sis\_id 789 is assigned Remote Learning and Economically Disadvantaged:

The student assigned to, for example, ELL Spanish, should have “ELL Spanish” as the value for the ext.ell field, while the student assigned to ELL Arabic will have “ELL Arabic” in that field. > The only field that NWEA will accept multiple values for the same student is ext.other. So if there is a chance that a student will be assigned to multiple programs that could have the same custom field name in Clever, you should use another field such as the ext.other field for these programs instead. The ext.other field will accept comma-separated values. >

title: Clever + Brainpop: Setup guide
text:
Product access may or may not be available on this day. Once you have made your selections, click Request ! > Part 2: Set up Single Sign-on (SSO)

BrainPOP recommends that you share all data for your district. The simplest way to do so is to select “Share All Data” in Clever. If you plan to share specific schools, you can find more info about “Share by Rules” here . You can create a sharing rule by going to the Sharing Permissions page for BrainPOP Suite. To do this, log in to your Clever account and click the icon for BrainPOP Suite in the sidebar. From the Data Sharing   tab, click Share All Data . > Required fields

> Apostrophes Please keep in mind that if you're syncing any users whose names have apostrophes, they must be the vertical type (') instead of a curled version. If it's curled, it will trigger a data error and filter out the user! > Frequently Asked Questions
> Why am I getting a “data warning” or a “data error”? > A data error occurs when the record is incompatible with BrainPOP’s integration with Clever, and the user or section will not appear in the application. Data Errors must be resolved for users or sections to be successfully processed by the application. Contact Clever Support if you have questions about resolving your data error. A data warning occurs when the user or section has a compatibility issue with the application that may result in a degraded app experience. We recommend addressing these issues or contacting the application directly to determine the impact of a particular Data Warning. > Why is a student or teacher missing from BrainPOP? > Please check to see if this user meets the following requirements before reaching out to BrainPOP:
> In your SIS data In your Clever data Is shared with BrainPOP in your data-sharing permissions
> Can multiple teachers/staff be assigned to the same course/section? > BrainPOP can support multiple teachers or staff assigned to the same course/section. > Can multiple teachers/staff be assigned to the same course/section?

text:
> Important: Title Single Sign-on (SSO): Setting up Clever Badges and Chromebook logins with Clever via the Legacy setup in Google URL Name 000001541 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Clever and Chromebook Logins 3. Setting up Clever logins via the Legacy setup in Google         •    Prerequisites for setting up Badge or credentials-based logins         •    Part 1: Configuring SSO         •    Part 2: Configuring User and Device settings         •    Part 3: Testing on a Chromebook 4. Adding additional identity providers as SSO Profiles in Google 5. Frequently Asked Questions
>  
> Overview
> Clever works seamlessly with Chromebooks, providing students and teachers access to all their learning applications while only logging in once per device. Google supports several ways to configure utilizing other identity providers (IdPs) within the Google Admin Console. This article covers how to configure Clever as the organization-wide single sign-on (SSO) provider for Google, which is a legacy setup and no longer our recommended workflow for most districts. > IMPORTANT  Our general recommendation is to set up Clever as an individual SSO Profile in Google , as this offers more customization. For instance, if you want some students to log into Chromebooks with Clever Badges but other students to use a Google email and password. If you’d like to set up Clever as an individual SSO Profile in Google, please see this article . >  
> Clever and Chromebook logins
> There are two login flows for using Clever with Chromebooks:
> Students use Clever Badges to log into Chromebooks then access Clever. > Students open their Chromebook and scan their Clever Badge This automatically logs the students into their Chromebooks and Clever Portals (they don't need to log in again). Students can click on any learning application to begin their learning session.

title: Single Sign-on (SSO): Setting up Clever Badges and Chromebook logins with Clever via the Legacy setup in Google
heading_path: Single Sign-on (SSO): Setting up Clever Badges and Chromebook logins with Clever via the Legacy setup in Google

text:
Use case: This is best for younger students and any students who might struggle with typing as they can access learning apps with zero typing. > Users log into Chromebooks manually, using credentials, then access Clever. > Users open Chromebooks and log in with their school-provided Google login credentials. After logging in, the Clever Portal is automatically opened for them (i.e., the user does not need to log in again). Users can click on any application icon to begin their learning session. Use case: This is best for older students who don't use Badges. > Depending on your preferences, each method can be configured separately for different Organizational Units (OUs) in your Google Admin Console. > Setting up Clever logins via the legacy setup in Google
> The simplest method to configure either Badges into Chromebooks logins or set up your users’ Chromebooks to launch and log them into Clever automatically is to set up Clever as the organization-wide SSO Profile for your Google account. > If Clever is set as the organization-wide SSO Profile for your Google accounts, you can add additional SSO profiles for other IdPs. You can learn more about this in Google’s support documentation here . > Prerequisites for setting up Badge or credentials-based logins
> Prerequisites for Badge Logins
>  Please note: Clever Badges into Chromebooks are not compatible with Kiosk Mode , and you must have the "set up SSO with third-party identity provider" checkbox selected under the Third-party SSO profile for your organization section of Google Admin. >  
>  Enable Clever Badges. > Head to your Clever Dashboard > Authentication > Badges. Select Begin Setup. > Confirm Google email addresses are populated for students in Clever. > To confirm if email addresses are populated, search for a few test students and confirm on their profile page if the email field is populated.

> Using the information from the  Authentication > Badges > Chromebook tab  page in your Clever Dashboard, complete the following in the Google Admin Console Legacy SSO Profile form. > Tick the box for Enable legacy SSO profile. > Copy your unique Sign-in page URL and paste it into the form. > Copy your unique Sign-out page URL and paste it into the form. > Download your verification certificate and then upload it into the Google Admin Console. > Tick the box for Use a domain specific issuer. > Copy the network mask into the form. > Do not enter network masks other than the one provided from Clever. Entering a different network mask will result in undesired behavior when accessing Google and Chrome devices. > Leave Change Password URL as-is. Leaving this URL blank will allow students to change their password. > Click Save and continue to the next step. > Part 2: Configuring user and device settings
> You can apply these settings to individual Organizational Units  (OUs), if you want to enable Badges into Chromebooks for only certain schools, grade levels, or types of users. The student account and the device they’ll be using for Badges into Chromebooks need to be in an OU with these settings! You may consider setting up a test OU with a test student and a test device. > These settings allow students to log in with their Clever Badges from the moment the Chromebook screen turns on. They also enable the transfer of cookies, which lets them log into Clever and Google whenever they use a Clever Badge. >    Please note: You can quickly find each setting in Google by using Ctrl + F or CMD + F and typing in the name of the setting. > See below for written instructions, a video guide, or click here for a step-by-step clickable tutorial of the setup! >  
> Configuring user settings
> Navigate to Devices > Chrome > Settings > Users & browsers and scroll down to the Security section. Set Lock Screen settings to Do not allow locking screen . Set the following Idle settings.

> Set Action on idle to Logout Set Action on lid close to "Logout" Set Lock screen on sleep to Don't lock screen
> Scroll a little bit until you reach the Single sign-on and SAML single sign-on login frequency settings in the Security section. > Set Single sign-on to Enable SAML-based single sign on for Chrome devices . Set SAML single sign-on login frequency to an appropriate duration. We recommend "Every 2 weeks" for the best experience. > Next, scroll down to Startup section further down on the same page. > Change the Homepage URL and Startup pages to your Clever Portal URL . Change the Startup pages to your school website
> Configuring device settings
> Navigate to Devices > Chrome > Settings > Device and scroll down to the Sign-in settings section, then follow the guided steps below. Set Guest Mode to Disable guest mode . Set Sign-in Screen to Never show user names and photos . Set Single Sign-On IdP Redirection to  Allow users to go directly to SAML SSO IdP page . Set Single Sign-On Cookie Behavior to Enable transfer of SAML SSO Cookies into user session. Next, enter this URL under Single sign-on camera permissions : https://clever.com/oauth/badges/login . These settings ensure that Clever has access to your Chromebooks' cameras to validate Clever Badge logins. Switch to the Managed guest session settings tab and ensure that Managed guest session is set to Do not allow managed guest sessions . > Part 3: Testing on a Chromebook
> First, confirm that student email addresses are syncing to Clever. Clever must have an active Google email address for the user to facilitate Chromebook login. Once confirmed, verify that you have saved your new settings. > Testing Badge logins

title: Clever Portal: Launch a Kahoot
text:
> Tip: Title Clever Portal: Launch a Kahoot URL Name 000001542 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Launching a Kahoot 3. The Student experience 4. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
>  
> PLEASE NOTE  If you’re not seeing the Launch a Kahoot! button, make sure you have added the Kahoot! app  from the Clever Library . >   Overview
> Teachers can save classroom time by launching Kahoot! directly from their Clever Portal by going to their Kahoot! icon > three vertical dots ( ⋮ ) > Launch a Kahoot! >  
> Launching a Kahoot
> Before you begin, ensure that you have the Kahoot! application in your Clever Portal. If your district hasn't added it for you, you can add it as a Clever Library app. Click here to learn how to add Kahoot! as a Clever Library app. When you’re ready to launch a Kahoot!, make sure your students have logged in to Clever and have the Clever Portal open on their devices . Then, follow these steps to start your game:
> Navigate to Create.kahoot.it and either create a Kahoot or select an existing one you want to use. Start the Kahoot and copy the game PIN . In the Clever Portal, go to Kahoot! app > three vertical dots ( ⋮ ) > Launch a Kahoot! Paste the game PIN into the e nter Game PIN field. > You can optionally check the Populate student initials box, which will automatically add students' initials instead of letting them add their own nicknames. > Click Next, choose your students . Click Next , then select the class(es) or individual student(s) you want to launch the Kahoot for. Click Continue when ready. Ensure all students have their Clever Portal open on their device. Once all students are logged in, click Launch Kahoot. The Kahoot! will open in the students’ Clever browser tab. A confirmation will appear on your screen. Once your students are in the game, don't forget to share your screen to show the questions in Kahoot!

title: Clever Portal: Launch a Kahoot
text:
>    
> The student experience
> Instead of navigating to kahoot.it to enter the game PIN, when teachers launch Kahoot! to students through Clever Portal, students will automatically enter the game and be prompted to create their nickname. After teachers select Launch Kahoot!, the game will launch for students in the same tab that Clever was in, where they’ll be prompted to enter their nickname. After they enter their nickname and select the  Ok, go button, they can start playing. If you've chosen for their initials to populate, they'll be dropped right into the game without needing to click anything. >  
>  
> Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
> Why don’t I see the Launch a Kahoot feature in my Clever Portal? > This feature is currently only available for teachers that have access to the Kahoot! application on Clever. > How can I gain access to the Kahoot! application if my district hasn't added it for me? > For an enhanced experience, contact your school or district administrator to see if access to the Kahoot! EDU application can be enabled for you. Alternatively, you can install the Kahoot! application from the Clever Library. Learn how to install applications from the Clever Library here. > Note: Some districts choose to disable the Clever Library. If you don’t see it in your Clever Portal, it’s likely that your district has turned off this feature. >  
> How does Kahoot treat adding initials for students who have the same initials? > If multiple students share the same initials, the first student to launch the app will claim those initials. Any students who try to join afterward with the same initials will see a message that the nickname is taken and will be prompted to choose a different one.

title: Secure Sync: Changing SIS IDs
text:
> Important: Title Secure Sync: Changing SIS IDs URL Name 000001543 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. The Process 3. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
> Overview
> When you sync your data to Clever, you are required to provide an SIS ID for each user type, section, and school as follows:
> - Data Type: SIS ID Field
> - School: School\_id
> - Student: Student\_id
> - Teacher: Teacher\_id
> - Section: Section\_id
> - Staff (optional): Staff\_id (if your schools sync staff)
> - Contacts (optional): Contact\_sis\_id (cannot be matched if ID changes occur)
>  
> These identifiers are what Clever uses to create the Clever ID, so if the SIS ID changes, the Clever ID will change. The Clever ID is what creates the user and school accounts in Clever and in most connected applications. For this reason, Clever does not recommend changing SIS IDs, especially during a school year. We recommend all SIS ID changes be made in the summer between academic years. > If an SIS ID change is being requested by an application partner: Clever Support can update the data available to the application without affecting the core data in Clever or the data available to other applications. Please submit a support case with the following information:     •  The name of the application (Example: NWEA)     •  The record type (Example: Students)     •  The name of the field to be used as SIS ID (Example: State\_id)
>  
> Here’s an outline with an accompanying flowchart of how changing an SIS ID can cause the loss of historic data. > Student, Jamie Greene, has an account in Clever with the student\_id of 7301. Clever created the Clever ID of 641cbb82f81de671203cfc66 for Jamie’s account based on the SIS ID. The student is shared with several applications via Clever and has accounts in each of those apps based on that Clever ID. At some point, the school changes Jamie’s student\_id to C732001 and syncs the new id to Clever so student\_id 7301 is no longer syncing.

title: Secure Sync: Changing SIS IDs
text:
Clever now sees this as a new student and deletes Jamie’s account associated with student\_id 7301 since this ID is no longer syncing to Clever. Clever creates a new account based on C732001 with a new Clever ID of 529ava3902efa349206cfs01. Jamie’s connected applications are no longer receiving Jamie’s original Clever ID because it no longer exists. The applications create a new account based on Jamie’s new Clever ID and delete or archive the previous account based on Clever ID 641cbb82f81de671203cfc66. This results in a loss of historical data and any progress since it is a completely new account. >   Please note: When a teacher\_id changes and data is not preserved, the teacher will lose their historical data in Clever and connected applications, as well as their Teacher Pages and resources they have added in their Clever Portal. >  
> How does Clever help schools preserve data? > How do we preserve the Clever IDs if you need to change your sync and/or SIS IDs? By running our matching tool! Our matching tool matches up the existing SIS IDs in Clever with the new SIS IDs your schools are syncing. Please note that we can only match school\_id, student\_id, teacher\_id, and staff\_id values to preserve data. We are unable to match contact\_sis\_id, and section\_ids are unlikely to be matched as well since section\_ids are expected to change during a conversion. If we run into duplicate entries or other issues, this can slow the process, potentially adding several days to a week to the conversion. >  
> The Process
> IMPORTANT: Reusing SIS IDs  Clever treats SIS IDs as unique identifiers and uses them to generate Clever IDs. To avoid data issues in Clever and connected applications, do not reuse SIS IDs within 300 days of when they were last used. Reusing IDs can add more than a week to the sync conversion process. > If a change to the SIS ID is required, the following process will be followed.

title: Secure Sync: Changing SIS IDs
text:
> Contact Clever Support  Submit a new support case at support.clever.com and let us know the record type that needs to be updated and the name of the field that should be used as the SIS ID in Clever. Migrate data We will enable protection settings for your account to ensure your teachers and students are minimally affected by the data changes. During this period, all data syncing between the district, Clever, and connected applications will be paused. However, users will still be able to access Clever and their applications. > Once the safety settings are applied, we ensure the necessary data from your SIS is syncing to Clever. If the data looks good, we will complete a matching process to preserve historical data where possible. > ⚠️ Please allow up to 2-3 weeks for the matching process to be completed. During this time, your account may  have a sync status of "On Hold" or "System Maintenance In Progress". This is normal and will resolve once Clever Support has finished the migration process. Confirm data changes, sync with apps The final step of the process is for our team to review the changes with you. Once the review is complete, you will release the hold. Once the updated data is live in Clever, please allow up to 48 hrs for the updated data to update in your connected applications. Application partners manage pulling data from Clever and processing it into their system. If you have any questions about the effect of data changes in an application, please contact the application's support team. They will be happy to assist! > Ready to get started or have a question? Contact our Support Team . > Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
> Which SIS IDs can Clever preserve? > School\_id, student\_id, teacher\_id, staff\_id. The Clever team cannot preserve contact\_sis\_id data. Additionally, our migrating tool is not configured to preserve section IDs, as it is expected that section IDs will change during a sync conversion.

title: Secure Sync: Changing SIS IDs
text:
However, if section IDs need to be preserved for an app connection, you can speak with the Clever team to discuss potential options. > Is there an option if I need more guidance and would like additional services from Clever for my sync conversion? > Yes! We offer Sync Conversion Consulting Services. The sync conversion process is a collaborative effort involving the district, Clever, and connected applications to achieve a smooth transition. While our sync conversion team is committed to helping you meet your goals, opting for our paid services can provide additional consultation and support to streamline the process further. Contact our team here to learn more . > Why does the sync or SIS ID conversion take 2-3 weeks? > Anytime you execute record linkage between data sets, the integrity of data is always at risk. Sync conversions involve numerous steps that must be performed accurately, and depending on the complexity and size of the data, this can take time. > During a school break is the best time to complete a sync conversion because the account is already often in a sync pause status. Many districts are reaching out to our teams to complete a sync conversion during the winter or summer break, which can impact timelines for completion. > What if I don’t need any historical data preserved? I have from last year in Clever, so I don’t need to maintain their historical data in Clever or the connected applications. > If this is the case, you can forego the sync conversion process. Teachers will lose any Teacher Pages created in Clever, and all users will lose historical data in their connected applications. Please provide in writing that you do not want our teams to preserve the historical data and that you understand that your users will no longer have any historical data in Clever or their connected apps. >
