title: Setup guide for Clever SSO into Entra ID
heading_path: Setup guide for Clever SSO into Entra ID
section: Setup guide for Clever SSO into Entra ID
text:
> Tip: Title Setup guide for Clever SSO into Entra ID URL Name 000001546 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Prerequisites 3. Configure Clever as an IdP for Entra ID 4. Configure Entra ID as a Service Provider (SP) for Clever 5. Verify federated authentication between Clever and Entra ID 6. Removing Clever as an IdP for Entra ID  7. Troubleshooting
> Please note: Microsoft’s current version requirements can be found here . >  
> Overview
> In this article, you'll learn the steps to configure Clever as a SAML identity provider (IdP) for Entra ID. Once configured, users will be able to use their Clever credentials or Badges to sign in to Entra ID, including on Windows deployments. >  
> Please note that if your district would like to utilize Clever Badges for sign-in to Entra-joined Windows devices, you will need to complete the steps listed below to configure Clever as an IdP for Entra ID. Once Clever is configured, students will be able to use Badges to sign in to their Entra-joined Windows devices. > Prerequisites
> To configure Clever as an IdP for Entra ID, the following prerequisites must be met:
> An Entra ID tenant, with one or multiple custom Domain Name System (DNS) domains (i.e., domains that aren't in the format \* . onmicrosoft.com )
> If the federated domain hasn't yet been added to Entra ID, you will need to have access to the DNS domain to create a DNS record. This is required to verify the ownership of the DNS namespace Learn how to  add your custom domain name using the Azure Active Directory portal
> Access to Entra ID with an account with the Global Administrator role Access to Clever with an account with the Clever admin role
> To test federation, the following prerequisites must be met:
> A Clever environment, with users already created
> Please note: Users require a matching field in Clever that is set to the same value as the ImmutableId in Entra ID.

title: Setup guide for Clever SSO into Entra ID
heading_path: Setup guide for Clever SSO into Entra ID
section: Setup guide for Clever SSO into Entra ID
text:
> If your Entra users do not have an ImmutableId, Clever recommends mirroring the email address to that field. You can learn how to update the ImmutableId for individual users in Entra using the PowerShell example shown here . If the ImmutableId does not match a field in Clever, please update your data in Clever to contain a field that matches the ImmutableId. Learn more about custom fields here . > Individual Entra ID accounts are already created: each Clever user will require a matching account defined in Entra ID. These accounts are commonly created through automated solutions, for example:
> School Data Sync (SDS) Entra ID Connect sync for an environment with on-premises AD DS PowerShell scripts that call the Microsoft Graph API Provisioning tools offered by the IdP - this capability is offered by Clever as a dedicated offering
> Please see here for Microsoft’s current version requirements. > Configure Clever as an IdP for Entra ID
> To add Entra ID, please navigate to your  Clever Dashboard > Applications > Add Applications page, and search for the Entra ID app in the search bar. Click to request the application. >  
> Once the app is ready, the District admin will be notified via email to accept the invitation to the app Sign in to Clever as a Clever admin, then go to your Entra ID page via Application > My application > Entra ID, and click Begin setup to set up which of your users can access the app. Don’t worry, you can always come back and edit this setting at any time. > Once you have set up sharing, go to the Settings tab and configure the Entra ID SAML app with the following details: 
>  
>  
> - Variable: Value
> - Assertion Consumer Service Url: https://login.microsoftonline.com/login.srf
> - Entity ID: urn:federation:MicrosoftOnline
> - Name ID Format: urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:nameid-format:email
>  
> Ensure that the Attribute for each user type is set to the field in Clever that contains the matching value to the ImmutableId in Entra ID.

title: Setup guide for Clever SSO into Entra ID
heading_path: Setup guide for Clever SSO into Entra ID
section: Setup guide for Clever SSO into Entra ID
text:
If you are using the recommended value of Email, select Email from the dropdown. If you are using a custom field, select Custom from the dropdown and enclose the custom field name in double curly brackets using all lowercase, for example, {{ext.field\_name}}. > The other parameters should already be pre-configured. Please take note of the Identity Provider Metadata URL value, as it will be required in the next step. For example: https://samlidp.clever.com/saml-azure-ad/metadata/<GUID> ;
> Please note:  Federation won't work if the app has a launch date set in the future. Once the application is ready to be used, ask Clever Support to change the launch date. >  
> Configure Entra ID as a Service Provider (SP) for Clever
> The configuration of Entra ID consists of changing the authentication method for the custom DNS domains. This configuration can be done using PowerShell. > Set-ExecutionPolicy -ExecutionPolicy RemoteSigned -Scope CurrentUser -Force
>  
> Note, depending on your environment, the command above may give the following error:  Set-ExecutionPolicy: Operation is not supported on this platform. In these cases, simply proceed with the remaining commands. > Modify the $idpMetadataUrl and $DomainName variables of the following script to match your environment. When prompted to authenticate to Entra ID, use the credentials of an account with the Global Administrator role. > Please note: In the code below, https://clever.com/logout should be in "double quotes" - there is a glitch with out Help Center preventing these from showing up, but please add them when you use the script.

title: Setup guide for Clever SSO into Entra ID
heading_path: Setup guide for Clever SSO into Entra ID
section: Setup guide for Clever SSO into Entra ID
text:
>  
> Install-Module Microsoft.Graph -Scope CurrentUser
> Import-Module Microsoft.Graph
> $domainId = "your domain here"
> $idpMetadataUrl = "your SAML metadata URL here"
> $xml = [Xml](Invoke-WebRequest -Uri $idpMetadataUrl -ContentType "application/xml").content
> $cert = -join $xml.EntityDescriptor.IDPSSODescriptor.KeyDescriptor.KeyInfo.X509Data.X509Certificate.Split()
> $issuerUri = $xml.EntityDescriptor.entityID
> $signinUri = $xml.EntityDescriptor.IDPSSODescriptor.SingleSignOnService | ? { $\_.Binding.Contains('Redirect') } | % { $\_.Location }
> $signoutUri = https://clever.com/logout
> $displayName = "Clever Identity"
> Connect-MGGraph -Scopes "Domain.ReadWrite.All", "Directory.AccessAsUser.All"
> $domainAuthParams = @{
> DomainId = $domainId
> IssuerUri = $issuerUri
> DisplayName = $displayName
> ActiveSignInUri = $signinUri
> PassiveSignInUri = $signinUri
> SignOutUri = $signoutUri
> SigningCertificate = $cert
> PreferredAuthenticationProtocol = "saml"
> federatedIdpMfaBehavior = "acceptIfMfaDoneByFederatedIdp"
> }
> New-MgDomainFederationConfiguration @domainAuthParams
>  
> Note, the configuration may take up to 60 minutes to update before end users will be redirected to your Clever Portal login when navigating to https://portal.azure.com/ . > Verify federated authentication between Clever and Entra ID
>  
> From a private browser session, navigate to https://portal.azure.com and sign in with a Clever account:
> As the username, use the email as defined in Clever The user will be redirected to Clever to sign in After Clever authentication, the user will be redirected back to Entra ID and be signed in
>  
>  
>  
> Removing Clever as an IdP for Entra ID
> To remove Clever as an IdP for your Entra ID domain, run the following command using PowerShell:   Remove-MgDomainFederationConfiguration -DomainId < EntraDomain.org >   For more information, see Microsoft Support or reach out to your Microsoft support contact.

title: Setup guide for Clever SSO into Entra ID
heading_path: Setup guide for Clever SSO into Entra ID
section: Setup guide for Clever SSO into Entra ID
text:
>  
> Troubleshooting
> Entra is not recognizing my user
> This usually happens when the ImmutableId field in Entra is not being matched for this user in Clever. This may look like Microsoft error AADSTS51004 or AADSTS90072. >  
> To correct:
> Double check what the ImmutableId is set to for this user in Entra using the following PowerShell - replace [ user@district.org ] with the UserId for your user. Check the value displayed after OnPremisesImmutableId. > get-mguser -UserId [ user@district.org ] -property DisplayName,Mail,OnPremisesImmutableId,UserPrincipalName,Id | Format-List DisplayName,Mail,OnPremisesImmutableId,UserPrincipalName,Id
> Check which field you are matching on in the Entra ID app in the Clever Admin dashboard. text:
Title

For Clever Admins: Cybersecurity best practices

000001549

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001549?language=en_US#header1) 
2. [Clever products and features that support your cybersecurity practices](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001549?language=en_US#header2) 
3. [Cybersecurity recommendations for your district or school organization](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001549?language=en_US#header3)

title: For Clever Admins: Cybersecurity best practices
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Cybersecurity best practices
text:
Cybersecurity and protecting user accounts with access to sensitive information continues to be a key priority for districts as more malicious actors target school districts and exploit vulnerabilities in their IT infrastructure. This article discusses some key cybersecurity best practices when managing your Clever account for schools and districts located in the US and Canada.

As always, we recommend evaluating your current cybersecurity practices, environment, and risk tolerance when making decisions for your school regarding authentication and digital identity management. Please also consult the [Cybersecurity & Infrastructure Security Agency’s website](https://www.cisa.gov/) and [their report on cybersecurity](https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/news/cisa-releases-report-k-12-schools-help-address-evolving-cybersecurity-threats). Use this article for general cybersecurity reminders regarding your management of Clever, Clever users, and Clever integrations.

![Clever Academy.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000T4BV&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000035fcv) 
If you'd like more in-depth support on district cybersecurity, such as creating a cybersecurity blueprint for your school, check out [Quick start - District cybersecurity in Clever Academy](https://clever.academy/quick-start-cybersecurity?user_type=district_admin). We also have teacher training, [Quick start - Cybersecurity basics for teachers](https://clever.academy/quick-start-cybersecurity-teachers?user_type=teacher).

---

Review a summary below of Clever’s various no-cost and paid solutions for supporting your school’s cybersecurity efforts:

title: For Clever Admins: Cybersecurity best practices
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Cybersecurity best practices
Clever products and features that support your cybersecurity practices
text:
- [Clever Admin multi-factor authentication (MFA)](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202062333): All Clever Admins must set up MFA for admin accounts.
- [Sharing Permissions](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/203115007): Configure sharing permissions for your learning applications to ensure that the application only receives data for users who need access to the application. If a user is no longer coming in via your sync, their access to any edtech tool they’ve been shared with is removed.
- [Field Access settings](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360000501586): Adjust field access settings in addition to sharing permissions to minimize the data you are sharing and ensure that only the required data fields are shared with individual applications.
- [Clever Portal Single sign-on (SSO)](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/203166807): Secure application accounts by providing teachers, students, and staff with one secure set of credentials that they can use to access Clever and any learning application instead of utilizing multiple insecure usernames and passwords.
- [Access Logs](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001698): Utilize Clever’s robust access logs to track user logins, including IP addresses from which Clever is accessed.
- [Substitute access](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001675): Help teachers securely provide temporary access to select applications on Clever for their short-term substitutes.
- [Role-based access control (RBAC)](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001702)**:** Admins can granularly manage administrators and staff at scale by giving them the minimum permissions necessary to accomplish their responsibilities on Clever.

title: For Clever Admins: Cybersecurity best practices
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Cybersecurity best practices
Clever products and features that support your cybersecurity practices
text:
- [Classroom MFA](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001616): Ensure your staff, teacher, and student accounts are protected with layers of security with Clever’s Classroom MFA. Use school-friendly second factors like Badges, PIN codes, login pictures, and phone calls to secure accounts.
- [Clever Identity Management (IDM):](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001466)
 - **Life cycle management:** Use Clever IDM to ensure your end users gain and lose access to their Google, Active Directory, or Entra ID accounts at the right times. Automatically manage user group membership in Google and Active Directory as well.
 - **Account claiming:** Help users securely gain access to their new Google, Active Directory, or Entra ID accounts. There is no need to email usernames and passwords or provide a paper list to teachers; use automated account claiming to help end users gain access to their accounts easily via URLs and email notifications.
 - **Password generation and management:** Use Clever IDM to generate secure, random passwords and phrases for end users based on the criteria you set. Provide delegated and self-serve reset and account recovery capabilities to subgroups of users with built-in complexity settings while Clever prevents usage of passwords found in public data breaches.

---

We recommend you review these recommendations **at least** once a semester to make your schools as secure as possible.

title: For Clever Admins: Cybersecurity best practices
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Cybersecurity best practices
text:
IMPORTANT  
Given the unique permissions Clever Admin accounts have, we recommend carefully reviewing these recommendations whenever a new Clever Admin needs to be added or removed from your district.

- All Clever Admin accounts should have [strong, unique passwords](https://www.cisa.gov/sites/default/files/publications/NCSAM_CreatingPasswords_2020.pdf) or passphrases that are not reused on any other service. A Clever Admin can reset their password [here](https://schools.clever.com/reset) by following the instructions [here](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/202083536).

- The Clever Admin Owner of your district should be assigned to the appropriate staff member. This admin user role has special privileges, including deleting all your data from Clever and creating custom roles for other admins! For a complete list of permissions for the Clever Admin Owner, please [see this article](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202518038).

- All Clever Admins must have [Multi-factor Authentication (MFA)](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202062333) turned on.
 - If Clever Admins use an Identity Provider (IdP) such as Google to access their accounts, ensure they have MFA turned on via the IdP for access to Clever.

- Audit and remove any administrative accounts that are no longer in use [here](https://schools.clever.com/team/members).

title: For Clever Admins: Cybersecurity best practices
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Cybersecurity best practices
text:
- Certain district logins, like Active Directory and Google, also act as IdPs, granting access to additional resources (like Clever). Ensure students, teachers, and staff use strong, unique passwords and passphrases to access their IdP accounts. See [Clever IDM](https://clever.com/products/clever-idm) for ways to ensure that your IdP accounts are always up-to-date and secure.

- Review Clever access to Clever for anyone no longer in the district. Also, review access permissions for those who may have changed roles (i.e., a principal had a staff account but has switched to a teacher role).
 - We recommend that you implement automated account provisioning for your district identity accounts so accounts are managed automatically (so, for instance, staff members who have left your school or district no longer have access to their email accounts). See [Clever IDM](https://clever.com/products/clever-idm) for more information about automated account provisioning for Google, Active Directory, and Entra ID.
 - You can also automatically add or remove admin accounts in Clever by syncing Clever Admins via SFTP.

- Implement multi-factor authentication (MFA) for teachers and staff to protect access to sensitive services across your organization. Consider implementing MFA for your students, as well.

- Verify authentication attempts via Clever [Access logs](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001698) regularly to look for any unusual activity (such as suspicious IP addresses or multiple login attempts from an unknown user).
- Void and reprint badges each year during your natural rollover period (i.e., summer or winter break).

- Ensure that all administrative logins to your SIS, including automated service logins (such as for [Clever-managed Auto-Sync](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202042973)), use strong, unique passwords or passphrases.

- If your district uses SFTP to sync data to Clever, and you believe your SFTP password was compromised, please reach out to [Clever Support](https://support.clever.com/s/) to reset it immediately by clicking Contact Us and answering the prompts.

title: For Clever Admins: Cybersecurity best practices
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Cybersecurity best practices
text:
- Adding your district’s apps to Clever to access with SSO is a more secure way of offering access to users versus creating and maintaining a username and password for each app. Likewise, we recommend you regularly review any apps that are not on Clever and add them if an SSO and/or rostering integration is available.

- Periodically audit apps you’ve added to Clever to ensure you’re sharing data responsibly:
 - Review the apps you’ve connected to in Clever, along with the data you’re sharing with them. You can review the data being shared via your Sharing Permissions, or in the Application Receives box for each application.
 - If your schools no longer use an app listed in your Clever Dashboard, consider disconnecting it from Clever so you’re not sharing data unnecessarily.
 - For apps your schools are still using, check your sharing rules to see if you’re sharing data that no longer needs to be shared. For instance, if you were using an app with grades 6-8 last year, but this year it’s only being used by 6th graders, you should update the sharing settings, so *only* 6th-grade data is being shared.
 - For apps your schools are still using, check your sharing rules to see if you’re sharing data that no longer needs to be shared. For instance, if you were using an app with grades 6-8 last year, but this year it’s only being used by 6th graders, you should update the sharing settings, so *only* 6th-grade data is being shared.
 - You should also review the [field access settings](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360000501586) for each application to ensure you are only sharing the required fields.

Lastly, if you notice anything suspicious with your Clever account, please get in touch with [Clever Support](https://support.clever.com/s/) immediately by clicking Contact Us and answering the prompts.

title: Clever + MAP Accelerator: Setup Guide
text:
> Warning: Title Clever + MAP Accelerator: Setup Guide URL Name 000001550 Article Body  
> This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Setup process           • Recommended Sharing           •  Setting up your MAP Accelerator sharing rules - Scenario 1           •  Setting up your MAP Accelerator sharing rules - Scenario 2           •  Sharing staff 3. Required Fields 4. Support Contacts
>  
> Overview
> This guide walks through how to get set up with MAP Accelerator in Clever. Before reading this guide, please make sure your district is set up with Clever! If your district has not been set up with Clever, you can get started by going to this link: https://clever.com/signup . For more information on setting up Clever for the first time, please see this guide . A personalized learning tool for grades 3-8, MAP Accelerator reduces the manual work of differentiating math instruction by automatically integrating class rosters, MAP® Growth™ scores, and Common Core-aligned Khan Academy content to generate learning pathways—complete with lessons, instructional videos, and practice problems. > Setup process
> IMPORTANT  Before MAP Accelerator will be approved for setup, your district must be using Clever for auto-rostering with the NWEA MAP Growth application. > If your district is already on Clever, you can connect the MAP Accelerator application by following these instructions:
> Log into your Clever Dashboard and select Applications > Add Applications . Search for MAP Accelerator . You'll then be brought to a page where you can authorize your MAP Accelerator request. You'll be asked if you'd like to request a custom Launch Date. The Launch Date is the first day users can see the MAP Accelerator icons in their Clever Portal. Product access may or may not be available on this day and is determined by the application. Once you have made your selections, click Request. >  
> Recommended Sharing
> MAP Accelerator recommends that you S hare by Rules in Clever .

title: Clever + MAP Accelerator: Setup Guide
text:
Create a sharing rule by following these steps:
> Subjects:
> Only the following subjects can be shared with MAP Accelerator: Math, Other, Homeroom/Advisory, and Interventions/Online Learning
> Grades:
> Section grade should be 3-8 2nd and 9th grade sections can be rostered, but are not recommended and will produce a warning. > Student data must include the following:
> Unique email address Date of birth Grade level Students can only be assigned to one class/teacher within Accelerator. If they are enrolled in multiple math sections, only one of those sections can be shared. > Teachers:
> Unique email address
> Sections:
> Should have unique names to avoid confusion
> Staff/Admins:
> Unique email address Only users from the Staff  tab can be shared, not District Admins from the Team  page. >  
> Setting up your MAP Accelerator sharing rules - Scenario 1
> Scenario 1: All math classes have the subject listed as math in Clever. > Clever Tip: How do I know how subjects synced to Clever? Check the Sections tab of the Data Browser . Subject is one of the columns listed. > Step 1 : From the MAP Accelerator overview page , click Begin setup . Please note, if you have previously set up sharing rules, you will be able to click Edit sharing . Alternatively, you can set up the sharing rules by clicking Share data now from the  Applications > My Applications page. Step 2 : You can select MAP Accelerator’s recommended sharing rules: The sharing rule above will share grade 3-8 math sections. > Setting up your MAP Accelerator sharing rules - Scenario 2
> Scenario 2 : Not all sections where math instruction occurs have the subject listed as math in Clever. For example, elementary school students may only be enrolled in one section where all instruction occurs, and that section may have the subject listed as homeroom/advisory  or other . Step 1 : If you’ve never set up the sharing rules before, you will be able to customize them from the setup guide (pictured).

title: Clever + MAP Accelerator: Setup Guide
text:
Alternatively, click Edit sharing from the MAP Accelerator overview page to edit rules you’ve previously set up. Step 2 : You will likely need to set up multiple rules. We recommend Custom share by section because section rules include students and teachers associated with the shared sections. Step 3 : Set up your filters to include only the data you want to share. For example, if your elementary school students are only enrolled in one section where all instruction occurs, and that section has homeroom/advisory  listed as the subject, you can include filters for the school, grades, and subject. Click Done editing once you are finished adding filters. Step 4 : Add additional rules to capture different users. For example, your middle school or junior high students may be enrolled in sections where the subject is listed as math . You can create another rule to broaden your sharing to include elementary students where the section’s subject equals homeroom/advisory OR middle school students where the section’s subject equals math. From here, you can again set up a rule with filters to include the new group of users. Step 5: Once you’ve captured the appropriate users, click Save Sharing Rules . > Sharing staff
> If you have non-instructional staff (users listed in the Staff tab in your Data browser ) who also need access to MAP Accelerator, they will not be included in a section's sharing rule. You will need to set up an additional rule to capture these users. Click Edit Sharing Rules  and Add Another Rule to find the Custom share staff  option: We recommend taking a look at your list of staff to determine who will need access rather than sharing all staff. Once you have the list of staff members ready, you can share them by using an identifying factor such as email, ID, or title. As always, don’t forget to click Done editing  and Save Sharing Rules  before leaving the page!

> Required Fields
> Check the Data Quality tab in your Clever dashboard to see whether you’re meeting the required data fields. MAP Accelerator requires the following data fields be sent: Student: name, school, district, sis\_id, schools, dob, email, grade Teacher: district, name, school, schools, sis\_id, email School Admin: district, schools, name, staff\_id, roles, email, title District Admin: district, name.first, name.last, email, title  
> Support Contacts
> MAP Accelerator techsupport@nwea.org Clever Support.clever.com (click Contact Us ) Contact Clever with issues that relate to: Setting up sharing rules Syncing required fields to Clever

title: For App Partners: How do I enable two-factor authentication?
heading_path: For App Partners: How do I enable two-factor authentication?
section: For App Partners: How do I enable two-factor authentication?
text:
> Note: Title For App Partners: How do I enable two-factor authentication? URL Name 000001551 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Setting up two-factor authentication 3. Disabling Two-Factor Authentication 4. Account recovery
> Overview
> Two-factor authentication adds another level of security to your account. If you enable two-factor authentication, you'll be asked to enter a verification code in addition to your username and password every time you log in to Clever. This extra verification prevents unauthorized parties from accessing your account, even if your password has been compromised. > You can set up two-factor authentication for your Clever account in two ways:
> Via a text message sent to your phone or device (SMS) Via the authenticator application  Authy (available for iOS and Android )
> Please note: Due to the requirement for SSO or 2FA to log in to the Clever apps dashboard, non-human user accounts will no longer be supported. >  
> Setting up two-factor authentication
>   1. Log into your Clever Account 2. Click on your name in the upper right-hand corner, and select Profile 3. Scroll down to select Enable TFA 4. Select how you’d like to receive verification codes, and then enter your phone number to proceed. > Please note: If you choose to use Authy and have not already downloaded the app, you will be prompted to do so. > 5. When prompted, either enter your code from Authy or request a code via SMS. 6. The next time you log in to Clever, you will be prompted to enter your verification code. Enter the verification code received via Authy or SMS. You can ask Clever to remember you for 30 days on your device so that you do not need to authenticate every time you log in. This option is not recommended if you are on a public or shared computer, or don’t have password protection on your personal computer.

title: For App Partners: How do I enable two-factor authentication?
heading_path: For App Partners: How do I enable two-factor authentication?
section: For App Partners: How do I enable two-factor authentication?
text:
> Disabling Two-Factor Authentication
> Once you have two-factor authentication enabled, you can disable this setting at any time from your Clever Profile page . You’ll be prompted to enter your current Clever password to disable two-factor authentication. Please note that you cannot disable two-factor authentication if you have lost access to your two-factor authentication method. If you have lost access to your two-factor authentication due to having a new device, new phone number, or inability to receive an SMS message from Authy, please see the Account Recovery instructions below. > Account Recovery
> If you are unable to access your two-factor authentication code, it will be necessary to complete account recovery as outlined here: Restoring Authy Access on a New, Lost, or Inaccessible Phone     Clever Support is unable to disable two-factor authentication for your account. The account recovery must be completed by our two-factor service provider, Authy. tags: 2FA, MFA

1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001552?language=en_US#header1) 
2. [Glossary](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001552?language=en_US#header2)

This article is a glossary of terms and acronyms frequently used in edtech. Like much of the tech landscape, edtech has its own set of specific acronyms and terminology. To help you navigate your experience with Clever, please reference the glossary below whenever you encounter an unfamiliar term.

Found an unknown term or acronym that is not covered in this glossary? Please [reach out to Clever Support](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360001041326) to make a suggestion.

---

title: Clever & Edtech Acronyms / Glossary
text:
- **Account Claim** — [Account Claim](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001695) is a tool for Clever IDM customers to make it easier for end users to set up their Clever, Google, Active Directory, and/or Entra ID accounts. New accounts created by Clever IDM can be accessed by end users by providing two or more points of private information for students and three or more points for adults, all without IT intervention – making onboarding and account distribution easier than ever for time-constrained IT teams.

- **AD, ADFS**— **Active Directory** or **Active Directory Federation Services** (Microsoft Windows identity service)
 - Active Directory is a Clever-supported Identity Provider ([IdP](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001552?language=en_US#IDP))
 - Support in Clever for Active Directory:
 - As an Identity Provider: [Single Sign-On (SSO): Log in with ADFS](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202102576), [Clever Badges: How do I enable Badges into Active Directory On-prem managed Windows devices?](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360000384086)
 - With our Identity Management service, [Clever IDM: Clever IDM: Active Directory Setup](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001505)
 - As a source for Staff user accounts: [Staff Setup: Syncing staff with Active Directory](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360028781552)

- **API** — **Application Programming Interface** - a way for two programs or apps to talk to one another. Programs have APIs so that they can share data easily. Clever syncs with the APIs of many popular Student Information Systems ([SISes](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001552?language=en_US#SIS)). Clever’s Application partners sync to Clever’s API.

- **BTS** — **Back to School** - the time period around the first day of the school year when school organizations are preparing for the return of students for the new school year.

title: Clever & Edtech Acronyms / Glossary
text:
- **Clever Academy** - Clever's free online training and certification program for educators and admins. You can go directly to Clever Academy here: <https://clever.academy>.

- **Clever Admin** — Also known as a district admin, or [DA](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001552?language=en_US#DA), this is an individual from your school or district who administers your Clever account.

- **Clever LMS Connect** – A solution that enables application partners to connect directly to district and school [Learning Management Systems (LMS)](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001552?language=en_US#LMS). Districts and schools can also connect their LMS directly with Clever to simplify application use.

- **COPPA – Children’s Online Privacy Protection Rule –** Federal law protecting children’s online privacy.

- **Course -** a course is an academic subject. Courses are often assigned a specific course code and title to track academic credit. Examples: Algebra 101, 3rd Grade Science, Concert Band.

- **CS — Customer Support** or Clever Support - our world-class support team. [Learn more about contacting the Customer Support team here.](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360001041326)

- **CSV** — **Comma Separated Value** - a file type using text to represent data fields separated by commas with the file extension .csv. CSV files are used in [SFTP](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001552?language=en_US#SFTP) syncs to export data to Clever. CSV files can be opened in programs like Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets.

- **DA** — **District administrator -**an individual from your school or district who administers your Clever account. Sometimes referred to as a [Clever Admin](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001552?language=en_US#CleverAdmin).

- **ELL** — **English Language Learner**

title: Clever & Edtech Acronyms / Glossary
text:
- **Entra ID —** (Microsoft Windows identity service)
 - Entra ID is a Clever-supported Identity Provider ([IdP](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001552?language=en_US#IDP))
 - Support in Clever for Entra ID:

- As an Identity Provider: [Single Sign-On (SSO): "Log in with Office 365/Entra ID"](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/205889768),
 - With our Identity Management service, Clever IDM:[Clever IDM: Entra ID (Azure) Setup](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001553)
 - SSO to Entra ID: [Setup guide for Clever SSO into Entra ID](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001546)

- **FERPA –** Federal Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA). Federal law that governs the access to educational information.

- **FRL** — **Free or Reduced Lunch.** May also be referred to as FRP (free or reduced lunch program).

- **FTP** — **File transfer protocol** - The File Transfer Protocol is a standard communication protocol used for the transfer of computer files from a server to a client on a computer network. This is how your [CSV](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001552?language=en_US#CSV) files get to Clever for an [SFTP](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001552?language=en_US#SFTP) sync.

- **FTP Client** — [FTP Clients](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/206020358?language=en_US) allow you to transfer files via Secure File Transfer Protocol safely. Examples of FTP Clients would be FileZilla or WinSCP.

- **GAC** — **Google Admin Console** - The Google Admin console is a central place to manage your Google Workspace services.

- Google is a Clever-supported Identity Provider ([IdP](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001552#IDP))
 - Support in Clever for Google:

title: Clever & Edtech Acronyms / Glossary
text:
- - As an Identity Provider: [Single Sign-On (SSO): Log in with Google](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202084503), [Clever Badges: Chromebook login flow](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360024681032)
 - With our Identity Management service, Clever IDM:[Clever IDM: Google Setup](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001467)
 - See [For Clever Admins: Clever & Google](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001659) for additional information
- **Google Classroom roster import** — a rostering [application](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001503) that enables admins with Google Workspace for Education Plus to automatically create classes, populate, and sync rosters directly to Classroom from their Student Information System (SIS) through Clever.

- **IAM** — Identity and access management

- **IC** — [Infinite Campus](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360049821892), a student information system (SIS) used to sync data to Clever.

- **IDM** — **Identity Management** - [Clever IDM](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001466?language=en_US) helps districts automate account provisioning and lifecycle management for [Microsoft Active Directory,](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001552?language=en_US#AD) [Google Workspace](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001541?language=en_US), and [Entra ID](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001552?language=en_US#entraid). Clever IDM automatically syncs users from a Student Information System ([SIS](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001552?language=en_US#SIS)) to Active Directory, Google, or Entra ID daily for an entire year.

title: Clever & Edtech Acronyms / Glossary
text:
- **IdP** — **Identity Provider** - what districts use to **manage identity** at their district to allow access to Clever. Many districts already have a username and password that students use to access applications on their school site. Common login methods are [Google](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202084503?language=en_US) and Active Directory Federation Services ([ADFS](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001552?language=en_US#AD)).

- **IEP** — **Individualized Education Program**

- **Instant Login (IL)** — Instant Login is a way for users to log in once and then access all their connected applications without having to log in again.

- **Instant Login Link [(ILL)](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/205546348)** — A custom link that allows districts to embed application login URLs directly into their district's Single Sign-On portal, website, or Learning Management System (LMS). This allows district users to access Clever applications via your district portal using their Clever credentials.

- **LEA** — **Local education agency**, a public school district, or a public charter school in the United States.

- **LDAP** — **[Lightweight Directory Access Protocol](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/207090387?language=en_US)** is a protocol for two systems to talk to each other but it is not an identity provider. Clever uses LDAP to match user information from a server (typically, [Active Directory](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001552?language=en_US#AD)).

- **LMS** — **Learning Management System** - a software application for the administration, documentation, tracking, reporting, and delivery of electronic educational technology (also called e-learning) education courses or training programs.

title: Clever & Edtech Acronyms / Glossary
text:
- **LTI — Learning Tools Interoperability** (IMS standard) is an education technology specification developed by the IMS Global Learning Consortium (now known as 1EdTech Consortium). It specifies a method for a learning system to invoke and to communicate with external systems.

- **Mapping** — The process of linking data fields from one database to another. In Clever, mapping typically means bringing a field from the SIS into a Clever field.

- **MDM** — **Mobile Device Management -** typicallydistricts or schools use a Mobile Device Management (MDM) software (i.e. JAMF, Intune) to add the Clever app to the users' school devices, which allows the district to automate, control, and secure administrative policies on their network.

- **MDR** — MDR is a company that provisions unique numbers for schools and districts. Certain applications require an MDR number for schools and districts, such as Collegeboard.

- **MFA** — **Multi-Factor Authentication** - Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) is a way to log in to programs that requires you to use two methods (or factors) to prove your identity, like your username and password on your computer and a text message code sent to your phone. [Clever's Classroom MFA](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001616) (CMFA) helps school districts protect sensitive student and staff information through secured access to critical applications and systems such as email, student information systems ([SIS](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001552?language=en_US#SIS)), and payroll.

- **MIS — Management Information System** - see SIS/Student Information System. This is the term used for SIS in the United Kingdom.

title: Clever & Edtech Acronyms / Glossary
text:
- **NCES** — **National Clearinghouse for Educational Statistics** - The National Center for Education Statistics (NCES) is the primary federal entity for collecting and analyzing data related to education in the U.S. and other nations. NCES is located within the U.S. Department of Education and the Institute of Education Sciences. NCES fulfills a Congressional mandate to collect, collate, analyze, and report complete statistics on the condition of American education; conduct and publish reports; and review and report on education activities internationally. NCES provides unique IDs for schools and those IDs can be found here: [https://nces.ed.gov/ccd/schoolsearch/.](https://nces.ed.gov/ccd/schoolsearch/)

- **NCES ID** – A unique ID value provided by the National Center for Education Statistics for identifying districts and schools. May be utilized by some application partners for data tracking purposes.

- **OAuth** — Shorthand for OAuth2, a standardized protocol used by Clever Instant Login.

- **Office 365/Entra ID**— [Office 365/Entra ID](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/205889768?language=en_US) is a common [IdP](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001552?language=en_US#IDP) for districts using Microsoft products. It's cloud-based, as opposed to [ADFS](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001552?language=en_US#AD), which requires a local computer to run a server. Formerly known as "Azure" or "Azure Active Directory".

- **OneRoster** — [OneRoster](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115001975103?language=en_US) is the standard specification for securely sharing class rosters and related data between a student information system ([SIS](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001552?language=en_US#SIS)) and any other system, typically a content application or learning information system ([LMS](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001552?language=en_US#LMS)).

title: Clever & Edtech Acronyms / Glossary
text:
- **Organizational Unit (OU)** — Organizational "folders" used in Google and Active Directory to group users and devices and often used to apply rules or policies to them.

- **Personally Identifiable Information (PII)** — Any data that could be used to identify an individual such as their first/last name, email address, sis\_id, etc.

- **Plugin** — A software add-on that is installed into a program to add additional functionality. For example, Clever offers a plugin for PowerSchool to power the automatic sync of data from PowerSchool.

- **SAML** — [**Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML)**](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/218050687?language=en_US) is a login standard that helps users access applications based on sessions in another context. It’s a single sign-on ([SSO](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001552?language=en_US#SSO)) login method offering more secure authentication (with a better user experience) than usernames and passwords.

- **Section**— a section refers to different classes or sessions of a [course.](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001552?language=en_US#course) A course may have multiple sections, each of which may be taught by a different instructor, at different times, or in different locations. Examples: Algebra 101 - Mrs. Bowes - 2nd Period, 3rd Grade Science - Mr. Carter, Concert Band - Harper Middle School.

- **Secure Sync** — Clever Secure Sync is a bridge between your Student Information System ([SIS](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001552?language=en_US#SIS)) and online learning applications. Secure Sync maintains up-to-date roster information in your learning applications by securely transferring your roster uploads or connecting directly with your SIS.

- **SFTP** — **Secure File Transfer Protocol** - a secure file transfer protocol that uses secure shell encryption to provide a high level of security for sending and receiving file transfers.

title: Clever & Edtech Acronyms / Glossary
text:
- **SIS**— **Student Information System** - a SIS is a web-based platform that helps schools take student data online for easier management.

- **SIS\_ID** — the unique user identification value provided by your SIS for each user in Clever.

- **SPMS — Secure Password Management Suite** — a suite of password management tools in Clever IDM that support automated account claiming, password reset and account recovery, password synchronization, and prevention of weak passwords.

- **SSO** — [Single Sign-on](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/203166807?language=en_US) - Clever's SSO enables users to securely sign in to connected applications via Clever Portal.

- **Staff** — Within Clever, non-instructional users are referred to as [**staff**](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/229253547?language=en_US), i.e. principals, office administrators, etc. [Staff members can also have a teacher account](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360032149791?language=en_US) in Clever as well as their staff account.

- **STL** — **[School Tech Lead](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115003207663?language=en_US)** -  the School Tech Lead role provides a staff member with limited admin permissions in Clever for their associated school(s). This role is assigned by a [District or Clever Admin.](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001552?language=en_US#DA)

- **Term** — A portion of the academic year associated with [sections](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001552?language=en_US#section) in Clever. Some examples of terms are **Year**, **S1**, and **Q3**, depending on how your schools set up terms such as yearly, by semester, or quarterly.

- **Users** — Refers to your students, teachers, & [staff](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001552?language=en_US#staff) in Clever (i.e., those using Clever)

- **User Groups** — Collections of users you create for managing access and policies. Today, Clever supports the management of your Google and Active Directory groups through [Clever IDM](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001466).

---

title: Clever IDM: Entra ID Setup
text:
> Tip: Title Clever IDM: Entra ID Setup URL Name 000001553 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Setup       •    Connect to Entra ID       •   Select your IDM Management Level       •    Select Clever users       •    Data written to Entra ID       •    Data written to a student information system (SIS)       •    Summary       •    Preview and provision       •    Events 3. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
> Overview
> Clever IDM helps districts automate account provisioning and lifecycle management for Microsoft Active Directory, Google Workspace, and Entra ID. This affordable new offering provides school districts with a simple workflow that can be completed in minutes to automate account management directly with Clever. Clever IDM automatically syncs users from your SIS to Entra ID, Active Directory, and/or Google daily for an entire year. Your Clever IDM dashboard can be found  here . > A full overview of the Clever IDM setup process is below. If you haven’t already purchased Clever IDM, you'll be asked to purchase after completing the setup process. More information on pricing and purchasing can be found here . >  
>  
> Setup
> You can work through setting up your IDM configuration at any time; however, you won’t be able to complete the setup to start provisioning accounts without review from an onboarding specialist or our support team. Our team must review your setup before your first provision to protect your destination accounts and prevent issues with SSO for your end users. Contact your onboarding specialist for configuration review. If you're not sure who to contact, reach out to  Clever Support . > Please note: Click on the following link to find information about Setting IDM login credentials. > Connect to Entra ID 
> To provision accounts, Clever must be granted access to manage the provisioning of users on your Entra ID domain.

title: Clever IDM: Entra ID Setup
text:
The user authorizing the access request must have admin access to the relevant Entra ID instance. > Select your IDM Management Level
>  
> Next, choose whether you’d like to set up Full Provisioning and Password Management or Password Management Only . Both options support Identity Management in Clever—it just depends on what works best for your district’s timing and goals. >  
> Full Provisioning and Password Management
> This option automates account security and password management through Clever IDM. Since it requires more setup time, many districts choose this path at the beginning of the school year or during a long break. It’s best for:
> Automatically provisioning, updating, and archiving user accounts
> Configuring password reset, account recovery, and account claiming settings
> Working in tandem with Entra's dynamic membership groups to write to fields in Entra. >  
> Password Management Only
> This lighter setup gives you access to Clever’s secure password management tools for matched users, with the flexibility to configure it at your own pace. > It includes the same powerful IDM matching and collision detection as the full setup to ensure the right Clever user is matched to the right destination user—but requires less time to implement. It’s best for:
> Piloting Clever IDM or starting setup mid-year
> Accessing Clever’s password management tools
> Managing matched users between systems
>  
> Select Clever users 
> Clever IDM can provision accounts for students, teachers, and staff. You can select for Clever to provision accounts for one or more of the following:
> Students 
> Students are users that are enrolled as students in educational courses or sections. > Teachers
> Teachers is the term Clever uses to refer to a district's instructional staff. These are the individuals that are directly managing a classroom and students.

title: Clever IDM: Entra ID Setup
text:
> Staff
> Staff  is the term Clever uses to refer to both non-instructional staff (e.g., secretaries, bus drivers, counselors) and instructional staff that are not directly in charge of a classroom (e.g., school tech leads, instructional coaches, and principals). > These users are often a different employment designation than teachers and may even be managed outside the Student Information System (SIS) in an HR Information System (HRIS)
>  
> Users with multiple user roles If a user is assigned to multiple user roles (i.e., Teacher and Staff) in Clever, they will be provisioned an Entra ID account if either role is selected for Clever IDM provisioning. If the district chooses to provision accounts for both teachers and staff and a user is assigned to both teacher and staff roles in Clever, during Clever IDM setup the district will be able to select the primary role to be referenced. >  
> Additionally, Clever IDM allows you to customize which subsets of users that you would like to provision. If you would like to filter by user type, grade, school, or extension field, please contact Clever Support so that we can make those adjustments for you. >  
> Graduation rollover date If Clever IDM is set to manage your students, you will be prompted during this step to configure a graduation rollover date. > If you do not sync student graduation year directly from your SIS, Clever IDM will use this rollover date to calculate a graduation year for use in formulas. To ensure that this calculation associates your data with the correct school year, set a graduation rollover date. Clever IDM calculates the graduation year based on the student’s synced grade level. Data synced before the graduation rollover date will be associated with the previous school year for graduation year calculations. Data synced after the graduation rollover date will be associated with the upcoming school year for graduation year calculations.

title: Clever IDM: Entra ID Setup
text:
Providing a graduation rollover date enables Clever IDM to automatically update any information based on the graduation year (OUs, groups, etc.) as grade levels change during rollover. If your expected graduation rollover date changes, you can edit the graduation rollover date anytime by navigating to your  Select Users  step in Clever IDM. > Data written to Entra ID 
> There are two pathways for Clever to set user data in IDM: creation and user modification. Creation In the case of user creation, the following fields are synced to Entra ID:
> User first name User last name User type (student, teacher, staff) UserPrincipalName as configured by the district Primary email address as configured by the district Initial password as configured by the district Any custom fields configured by the district All newly created users are assumed to be unsuspended. > Modification If a user exists in both Clever and Entra ID data, IDM will optionally update the user. When updating a user, the following fields are synced:
> User first name (if changed) User last name (if changed) Email address (if changed) District-configured custom fields (if changed) Suspension status
> Suspended if a user exists in Entra ID, but not in the most recent Clever dataset. Unsuspended if a user was previously suspended (i.e., not in the Clever dataset), but has been restored in the Clever dataset. >  
> Please note: If you have questions or comments about the visibility of these attributes or would like additional attributes to be set by IDM, please contact Clever Support. >    
> Data written to a student information system (SIS) 
> We now provide SFTP access to user emails managed by Clever IDM. The SFTP files can be accessed by enabling Participation Reports, and the associated SFTP server as described in this article . The CSV files in the SFTP server contain mappings of user emails to their Clever ID, SIS ID, and User Type.

title: Clever IDM: Entra ID Setup
text:
Districts can use these files to personally build automation for write-back into their SIS on their end. Clever does not support direct SIS write-back automation outside of the above documentation. > Summary 
> The summary page will display all the selections made for each user type for user account settings. Confirm that all boxes for the user types that should be provisioned are marked completed . Click Preview Entra ID Accounts once all selections have been confirmed. > Preview and provision 
> Clever will generate a preview of the number of users that will be created or updated. Additionally, the system will flag any potential issues. You can also check on specific accounts that will be created/updated to ensure that they follow the process you'd like, via IDM Preview Sync Visualizer. Learn more about IDM Preview Sync Visualizer here . The Clever Admin completing the setup guide will receive an email with a CSV summary when the preview is done generating. The CSV preview is also downloadable from the setup guide. > You’ll see a note in your account that IDM Provisioning is disabled and requires review from a Clever specialist. Our team must review your setup before your first provision to protect your destination accounts and prevent issues with SSO for your end users. Please reach out to your onboarding specialist with any questions or for review of your preview before provisioning. If you're not sure who to contact, please reach out to  Clever Support . Purchase Summary The purchase summary will display the estimated total per year for Clever IDM. Please note this number is subject to change based on the number of user accounts managed and does not include sales tax. After reviewing the results, select Purchase Clever IDM to proceed to the checkout flow and begin provisioning. More information on purchasing here . >  
> Events
> After your initial Clever IDM sync, you can continue to track changes to your users via the User management > Clever IDM > Events tab .

title: Clever IDM: Entra ID Setup
text:
On this tab, you can select a date range for which you’d like to review Clever IDM creates, updates, archives, and matched users. You can also apply filters to examine changes by destination (if you have multiple configured), event type (create, update, etc.), or specific users by name or SIS ID. > Once you find the event for the user and destination you’d like to review, click the dropdown arrow next to the event to examine more details. >  
> FAQs
> How do I add users to groups in Entra ID? > We recommend using Entra ID’s dynamic group functionality to manage group membership. When used in tandem with Clever IDM’s ability to write to any field in Entra ID, dynamic groups offer a simple, powerful way to maintain groups for students and staff. If dynamic groups don’t meet your needs, please contact Clever Support. > How do I add licenses for new users in Entra ID Active Directory? > Entra ID’s dynamic group functionality allows you to not only manage group membership but apply certain licenses to any group members automatically . We recommend that you create one dynamic group for each of the different license types you have and use Clever IDM to populate a field in Entra ID to differentiate between the users that should receive those different licenses (e.g., writing “student” or “staff” to the employeeType field). > What if I don’t want Clever IDM to manage a user in Entra ID? > We have some functionality that allows you to prevent Clever IDM from archiving users. If you’re interested in that functionality or something else, please contact Clever Support. > What if I want to manage non-teaching staff with Clever IDM, but they aren't stored in my student information system (SIS)? > There are various options for syncing staff users, including CSV files, custom data, or an Active Directory sync. Learn more in our article about adding staff to Clever . > Does Clever IDM automatically calculate Graduation Year for students?

title: Clever IDM: Entra ID Setup
text:
> If synced to Clever, IDM will use the Graduation\_year  field from your SIS. Otherwise, IDM will automatically calculate Graduation Year for students K-12 based on the student Grade  field. In calculating graduation year, PreKindergarten and TransitionalKindergarten will be treated as grade -1. Students in the following grade levels will NOT have a Graduation Year unless provided by the district: InfantToddler, Preschool, 13, PostGraduate, Ungraded, Other. > Why do I see a note that my IDM provisioning is disabled? > To protect your destination accounts and prevent SSO issues, our team must review your IDM setup before your first provisioning. Please reach out to the Clever team if you have any questions or to review your sync before you provision for a new destination. > I can’t find the functionality I’m looking for. What should I do? > Reach out to Clever Support. The functionality may be available on the back end. If not, we may be able to add new functionality. > Related articles:
> Clever IDM: Overview Clever IDM: Purchasing & Billing Clever IDM: Sync Reports Clever IDM: Account links

title: Clever IDM: Formulas
text:
> Tip: Title Clever IDM: Formulas URL Name 000001555 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Building formulas 3. Common operations 4. Supported operations on fields 5. Supported field names 6. Complex modifications 7. Random password custom formulas 7. Using the forEach function
>  
> Overview
> This article will walk you through common operations that you can use to manipulate data in Clever to create formulas for Clever IDM. These allow you to build a format for many different products in Clever - from IDM email addresses to SSO (Saved Passwords) application credentials and many other places in the Clever Dashboard . These formulas work all across Clever - so if you’re setting up Clever IDM for Google, Active Directory, or even Entra ID, you’ll still be able to transform data into the format you need! >  
> Building formulas
> Easily tailor formulas with Clever IDM's format builder. This intuitive tool guides you through crafting formats for IDM fields like sub-OUs and login credentials. Choose between the standard block builder for simplicity or the advanced format editor for more customization. > Please note: The block builder approach for building formats doesn’t currently support extension fields or advanced use of functions. >  
> Random Password Custom Formulas
> To create random passwords for IDM login credentials , you can manipulate these random features in an IDM Custom Formula using these functions:
> {{randomString 6 "ULDS"}}
> The randomString function randomly creates a string with these parameters: length, upper, lower, digit, and symbol. The digit after randomString dictates the length of the random string. The characters afterward correspond to specific types of characters to include in the random string. They are:
> U = uppercase character L = lowercase character D = digit S = symbol
> For example, if you wanted a four-letter random password that is only upper and lower-case characters, you’d use {{randomString 4 “UL”}} Clever will automatically remove ambiguous characters [zero, uppercase "O", one, uppercase "i" and lowercase "ell"] for any character type combinations containing "UL", "UD", or "LD"
> Character type combinations that don't contain any ambiguous sets will use all available characters. For example: "DS" random strings include zero and one. > {{randomWord}} or {{randomUpperWord}}  
> The randomWord function randomly selects a 4-5 letter word from a kid-friendly dictionary. The randomUpperWord function selects from the same dictionary but capitalizes the first letter. >  
> Using the forEach function
> The forEach function allows you to assign multiple groups to a single user based on a single group rule. This functionality is only available in the group membership management step of the Clever IDM setup wizard. The forEach function will iterate over a selected array of values associated with a user and apply a format to each value in that array.

title: Clever IDM: Formulas
text:
The selected array can either be:
>  
> Schools associated with a user
> Sections associated with a user
> A space-delimited string where each element of the "array" is URL encoded
>  
> This functionality is available in Clever IDM’s basic format builder. We recommend trying to set up a forEach rule using the basic format builder first. >  
> Using forEach in the advanced format builder
> If you need more customization, you can do so via the advanced format builder. Take the example format: {{forEach "s" schools "%7B%7Bs . name%7D%7D"}}. This format would look through each school associated with a user and place them in a group that matches the school’s name. The forEach function is accepting three arguments:
>  
> The first argument, "s" in this instance, is the name we assign the variable
> The second argument, schools, is the array that we’d like to use
> The final argument, "%7B%7Bs . name%7D%7D", is the format to apply to each value in the array
> Please note: The final argument in the format must be URL encoded. URL encoding replaces special characters and spaces with codes. For example, “%20” encodes a "space" and “%7B” encodes the left curly bracket character "{". URL encoding allows the format builder to interpret the format correctly in all cases. >  
> The final argument can also use other IDM-compatible functions. An example using the required URL encoding for a format where we want to put users in groups that are a combination of their school name and “Staff” would look like this: {{forEach "s" schools "%7B%7Bconcat%20s . name%20%22Staff%22%7D%7D"}}. >  
> Please contact Support.Clever.com if you need additional help with custom formats.

title: SFTP Syncs: SFTP Sync FAQ
text:
> Note: Title SFTP Syncs: SFTP Sync FAQ URL Name 000001556 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
>  
> Onboarding to Clever and want to learn about uploading CSV files? Check out our  Onboarding - Getting your schools’ data into Clever course, available in Clever Academy! >  
> Overview
> Whether you’re exporting data for an SFTP sync directly from your Student Information System (SIS) or building your own CSV files to sync data to Clever, there are several commonly asked questions our team receives, as shown below:
> General SFTP sync questions
> What CSV files are required to sync with Clever? How do my data files work together? What if I’m not sure how to export data from my SIS? Is there a way to manually sync data to Clever, or add users one at a time? Can your team review my data files before I upload them? Can I upload the files one at a time so you can make sure I'm on the right track before uploading all of them? How do I know if my data upload went through? > File requirements and formatting questions
> Do I need to include a schools.csv file if we’re a single school? Do I need to include a sections.csv file? What's the difference between teacher\_id and teacher\_number (or school\_id and school\_number, or student\_id and student\_number)? How do I know if additional fields are required for a particular application? > Updating or editing data
> Can I manually trigger a sync? How do I archive classes in Clever? How do I remove data from Clever? > Troubleshooting
> Why didn't my data update after pushing a sync? Why is grade level showing as "Other" in Clever? Do you have content to help me troubleshoot the data errors on my last attempted sync page? > Please note: This article is specifically about SFTP syncs. If you use a Clever-managed auto-sync, please click here . >  
> Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
> What CSV files are required to sync with Clever?

title: SFTP Syncs: SFTP Sync FAQ
text:
> The Clever SFTP Specifications outline the five required CSV files for a data sync to complete: 
> schools.csv teachers.csv students.csv sections.csv enrollments.csv
> The staff.csv is an optional additional file for adding non-teaching staff to Clever. Learn more in this article . > How do my data files work together? > This graphic is helpful to explain how your files work together:
> Is there a way to manually sync data to Clever or add users one at a time? > Your 5 required CSV files must initially be synced simultaneously. They can be synced to Clever directly from your SIS, via an FTP client, or manually uploaded to your Clever Dashboard via the Web Upload Tool found on your Clever Dashboard > Data sources > SIS sync page. You can make any updates or changes to users by editing and re-uploading these data files. Please note that the entire file must be uploaded as each file overwrites the previous. Clever doesn't recommend adding or managing accounts through the Custom Data tool if you’re managing your own CSV files manually, as this often creates confusion on the primary source of data for your district. Custom data is intended to complement data coming from the primary CSV files, not replace it. > What if I’m not sure how to export data from my SIS? > We recommend reaching out to your SIS team directly or checking for online help center documentation if you have questions about using the export tools in your SIS. While our teams are happy to answer any questions you have regarding our  Clever SFTP Specifications , file formatting, or the manual data upload process to Clever, we don’t have insight into your individual SIS instance and the export processes. > Can your team review my data files before I upload them? > It is most secure to upload your files to Clever for our team to review. For security reasons, the Clever team does not recommend sending CSV files via email.

title: SFTP Syncs: SFTP Sync FAQ
text: Additionally, our system automatically surfaces errors that our team may not manually detect! We recommend completing all five required CSV files and uploading them to Clever, and then our team is happy to review the files and provide additional insight into any errors that may occur. > Can I upload the files one at a time so you can make sure I'm on the right track before uploading all of them? > For your first data sync, you must upload all five files simultaneously. When troubleshooting, we also recommend uploading all five files to ensure they work properly together during the sync. As you add each file to Clever  via the upload tab , our system automatically surfaces basic errors. Once you’ve uploaded your CSV files to Clever, our team is happy to review the files and provide additional insight into any errors that may occur. > Do I need to include a schools.csv file if we are a single school? > Yes! The schools.csv is required even if you’re a single school. This is how Clever’s sync system will know to associate your teachers and students with the school. > Do I need to include a sections.csv file? > Yes! The sections.csv file is how Clever syncs your classes and assigns students to their class(es). Even if you only have one section/class per grade, a sections.csv is required. The section\_id can be any unique value that is kept consistent across the sections.csv and enrollments.csv. If you’re making your own files, our team recommends keeping it simple and using single numbers (section\_id = 1, section\_id = 2 for each section/class). > How do I know if my data upload went through? > A sync will occur any time data is successfully uploaded to Clever. Syncs generally take 15-30 minutes to complete. If you’ve uploaded new data to Clever, please give the sync at least 30 minutes to complete. Once 30 minutes have passed, please review your Data sources > SIS sync page for the status of your sync.

title: SFTP Syncs: SFTP Sync FAQ
text:
You should also receive an email to the email address in your Clever profile. Click here  to learn more about your sync status! >  
>  
> Why didn't my data update after pushing a sync? > First, make sure the sync actually processed by looking at the sync status at the top of the home page of your Clever Dashboard . >   
> After confirming that the sync went through and that the data did not update by reviewing the SIS sync page , the next step is to check your files. Head to your FTP directory to ensure you don't have duplicate files. Having duplicate files will cause Clever to continue reading the first file that was uploaded while ignoring the newest one. Click here for a tutorial on accessing your remote site via an FTP client, or follow the instructions below:
> Open the FTP client (like  Filezilla , which is what this example uses) and enter the directory details found on your  Sync > Settings  page. Click  Quickconnect. > Once connected, on the right, you will see the CSV files in your Clever SFTP directory (Remote site). Check to see if any files are duplicated. In the example below, you can see the teachers.csv file has a duplicate file. > Right-click the duplicate files and select "delete." Re-upload the correct file to replace the duplicates. Clever will begin processing the updated file approximately five minutes after it has been uploaded to your FTP box. Please note that it may take 30 minutes for the sync to fully complete
> What's the difference between teacher\_id and teacher\_number (or school\_id and school\_number, or student\_id and student\_number)? > All of the user\_id fields (school\_id, teacher\_id, student\_id) are required fields for syncing data to Clever as this ID is the basis for the creation of a Clever ID, and the source of truth for which historical data is tied to in Clever. Our Clever SFTP Specifications  requires this field be unique to each user in the district.

title: SFTP Syncs: SFTP Sync FAQ
text:
> While school\_number is required, any additional user\_number fields (teacher\_number, student\_number) are optional in Clever. Many schools will re-use their chosen user\_id for this field, or populate it with another unique number available in their SIS such as a user’s state ID Should you choose to populate the user\_number field, please note that this field should also be unique to each user in the district. > How do I know if additional fields are required for a particular application? > If you think an application partner may require specific data fields, we recommend reaching out to the application partner directly to confirm if they have required fields in addition to the fields required to sync data to Clever. > Once you’ve added the application, your district/school-specific Clever SFTP Specifications can be found on your Data sources > SIS sync > Settings page. After adding applications, this document will show any required fields for a particular application that the Clever team is aware of. For the most accurate data field requirements, we also recommend reaching out directly to the application partner! > Can I manually trigger a sync? > Yes! To trigger a sync, you'll need to send a new set of files to Clever, and Clever will automatically trigger a sync. Uploading too many times in a short period of time may trigger a sync upload error. > How do I archive classes in Clever? > You can't archive sections/classes within Clever at this time. However, sections can be assigned term data to show applications when the section is active or not. If you wish to remove old sections in Clever, you'll need to remove the sections from your SIS sync. For SFTP sync, this would mean removing the sections from the sections.csv file. > How do I remove data in Clever? > To remove data in Clever, you'll need to remove the data from the CSV files being sent to Clever for your SIS sync. Once Clever is no longer receiving that data, it'll be removed.

You can see any data that has been removed from the most recent sync on the  SIS sync page. > Why is grade level showing as "Other" in Clever? > If grade level data is showing as "Other" in Clever, this means that the data we are receiving doesn't align with the Clever data requirements. Check out the accepted grade-level entries here: Data Formatting Instructions . > Do you have content to help me troubleshoot the data errors on my last attempted sync page? > Yes! Check out our article Sync Reports: Error Messages . This article also links to additional articles for troubleshooting which contain helpful tutorial videos!
