title: For Clever Admins: Term Data
text:
Title

For Clever Admins: Term Data

URL Name

000001558

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001558?language=en_US#header1) 
2. [How are terms created?](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001558?language=en_US#header2) 
3. [Viewing term data in the data browser](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001558?language=en_US#header3) 
4. [How is term data used?](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001558?language=en_US#header4) 
5. [Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001558?language=en_US#header5)

This article will help to explain how you can import term data to Clever, how to view it, and how you can use it!

---

Term data is synced to Clever from your SIS as part of your section data. Term data is not required by Clever, but it may be required by certain applications. 
The fields associated with term data are:

- Term\_name
- Term\_start
- Term\_end

For most Clever-managed auto syncs, term data is included by default. If your Clever-managed auto sync does not include term data, please contact Clever Support to discuss what options are available for your sync type.

Clever auto-generates a unique Clever ID for each term based on term\_start, term\_end, and term\_name. If any of those values change, a new term Clever ID will be generated which could affect term data in some connected applications.

---

To view the terms data that has synced to Clever, you can go to the [Clever Dashboard > Data browser > Terms](https://schools.clever.com/data-browser?collection=terms) tab.

![Screenshot of the Data Browser showing the Terms tab](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TJs5&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000062e9C)

The Terms tab includes the term name, the start and end dates, the Clever ID of the term, when it was created, when it was last modified, and a link to the Sections tab.

---

title: For Clever Admins: Term Data
text:
Term data can be used to share with applications. When constructing sharing rules, you can **Custom Share by Section** when **Sharing by Rules**. You can use this sharing type to filter by section attributes such as subject, school, course, and term. For more information on this, please see [Sharing Permissions: Share by Rules](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115000392247?language=en_US). This will allow you to share your data with an application by certain terms. As an example, you can see below there is a sections sharing rule that has been set up to share sections with a specific term. This will share sections that are associated with the Spring 2022 term.

![Screenshot of a sections sharing rule using term name as a property](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TJs5&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000062eAP)

---

title: For Clever Admins: Term Data
text:
Can I side-load term data?

- No, it is not possible to manually upload term data (term\_name, term\_start, term\_end) for sections. For SFTP syncing districts or schools that are unable to export term data in their sections.csv, we recommend manually updating the sections.csv file to include term data and to update/upload their sections.csv on a regular cadence (i.e. every week)

Since section data is relatively static (student enrollments can change without any section data (name, course, period, etc.), schools will only need to manually update and upload their sections.csv when sections are added or removed from their school's SIS.

What if our Student Information System doesn’t sync term data?

- If you have a Clever-managed auto sync, you can contact [Clever support](https://support.clever.com/s/?language=en_US) to see if your sync type can be customized to pull term data.
- If your sync type doesn’t allow for the syncing of term data, we can discuss changing you to a sync type that does allow for this data to be synced.

---

**Related Articles:**

- [For District Admins: Sync Reports](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202213756?language=en_US)
- [Sharing Permissions: Share by Rules](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115000392247?language=en_US)

title: For Clever Admins: Course Data
text:
Course data is synced to Clever as part of your standard sync, usually through sections data (sections.csv). Course data is not required by Clever, but it may be required by certain applications. The fields associated with courses are:

- Course\_name
- Course\_number
- Course\_description

Clever auto-generates a unique Clever ID for each course, based on the  course\_number and course\_name fields. This value is distinct to the course and is different than a section Clever ID. The course Clever ID is used to identify unique courses within your data and is used for [content mapping](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360052615892) .

Since we use the course\_number and course\_name fields to generate the course ID, any changes to the values in those fields will auto-generate a new course Clever ID. If a Clever ID for a course is regenerated, it will require updating the content mappings for any applications that use the content mapping feature.

Unfortunately, Clever is unable to revert to any previous values of this number, since the IDs are auto-generated and old IDs are auto-deprecated when changed, as they behave just like a Clever ID.

---

To view the course data that has synced to Clever, you can go to the Data Browser and look at the [Courses tab](https://schools.clever.com/data-browser?collection=courses&filters=%255B%255D).

![Image of the Data Browser highlighting the Courses tab.](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000T49t&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000062f8f)

The Courses tab includes the course number, the course name, the Clever ID of the course, a link to sections related to the course, and when that course was last modified.

---

title: For Clever Admins: Course Data
text:
Course data can be used to share with applications. When constructing sharing rules, you can **Custom Share by Section** when **Sharing by Rules**. You can use this sharing type to filter by section attributes such as subject, school, course, and term. For more information on this, please see [Sharing Permissions: Share by Rules](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115000392247?language=en_US). This will allow you to share your data with an application by specific courses. As an example, you can see below there is a section sharing rule that has been set up to share sections with a specific course name. This will share sections that have a course name of Algebra II/Trigonometry.

![Image of a section sharing rule](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000T49t&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000062f9E)

Course data can also be used for content mapping as some applications allow you to map resources to specific courses.  For more information on content mapping, please click here: [For Clever Admins: Content Mapping](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360052615892?language=en_US).

---

What if our Student Information System doesn’t sync course data?

- If you have a Clever-managed auto sync, you can reach out to [Clever support](https://support.clever.com/s/?language=en_US) to see if your sync can be customized to include course data.
- If your sync type does not allow for the syncing of course data, we can discuss changing your account to a sync type that does allow for this data to be synced.

---

**Related Articles:**

- [For District Admins: Sync Reports](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202213756?language=en_US)
- [Sharing Permissions: Share by Rules](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115000392247?language=en_US)

title: Managing your Clever administrative team
text:
Title

Managing your Clever administrative team

URL Name

000001560

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001560?language=en_US#header1) 
2. [What are Clever admin users?](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001560?language=en_US#header2) 
3. [Do you have the right Clever account owner?](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001560?language=en_US#header3) 
4. [Adding and removing users from your admin team](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001560?language=en_US#header4) 
5. [Admin users and rostering](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001560?language=en_US#header5) 
6. [Do users have the right role?](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001560?language=en_US#header6) 
7. [Removing outdated accounts](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001560?language=en_US#header7) 
8. [Frequently Asked Questions](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001560?language=en_US#header8)

Keeping your admin team users in Clever up to date is an essential part of maintaining account security. There are numerous [roles](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115001733726) and [custom roles](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001702) that you can assign to your administrative team in Clever to minimize risk and ensure that team members have the minimum access required in Clever. This article will guide you through reviewing and cleaning up your team.

To view your Clever team, navigate to the [Clever Dashboard > User management > Admin team](https://schools.clever.com/team/members).

---

Your Clever administrative team may include users with one of the following roles: Clever Admin (Owner), Clever Admin, District Curriculum Lead, District Help Desk, or a [Custom Role](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001702) that you've created in the Clever Dashboard. To learn more about the default admin team roles, [see this article](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115001733726).

School Tech Leads (STLs) are not admin users. School Tech Leads are staff users with additional permissions in Clever, allowing them to provide support and troubleshoot for your schools. [Learn more about School Tech Leads here](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115003207663).

---

The Clever Admin Owner holds unique privileges and is designated as the primary point of contact for all Clever-related issues. See this [article](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202518038#Clever%20Account%20Owner) to learn more about Clever Admin Owners.

The Clever Admin Owner account must be in the possession of the person at your schools who is empowered to make important decisions about your Clever account. If your account owner leaves your district or schools, you may experience delays when making some requests.

To transfer the account owner, [see the instructions here](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202518038#Transferring%20Ownership%20to%20a%20new%20Account%20Owner).

---

title: Managing your Clever administrative team
heading_path: Adding and removing users from your admin team
section: Adding and removing users from your admin team
text:
Any users who are assigned the Clever Admin role are also able to add other Clever Admins to Clever by following these steps:

1. Log in to the [Clever Dashboard.](https://schools.clever.com/)
2. Select [User management > Admin team](https://schools.clever.com/team/members) from the left navigation menu.
3. Select **Actions** in the top right of the page.
4. Select **Add team member** from the options available.
5. Add the new Clever Admin's information in the pop-up box and select their role. Remember to select the role that will provide the minimum permissions required in Clever for security.
6. Select **Add.**

Once a team member has been added to the account, they will receive an email with a link to create an account. If they do not receive this message, please have them check their spam folder for a message from [no-reply@clever.com](mailto:no-reply@clever.com).

To remove an administrator from your team, click the trash can icon next to their name.

If you are utilizing an SFTP or SIS-Managed SFTP sync you can also sync, remove, and update Clever Admins via CSV. [Please see here for more information, including steps for removing admins synced via CSV](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001709).

If you utilize a SIS-Managed sync and want to automate the syncing of your administrators.csv, you’ll need to work with your SIS directly to add this file to your exports.

---

By default, Clever shares admin users with all rostering applications. Before making any changes to your team, consider whether you are using the default admin rostering in any of your connected applications. If you are, any users added to the team will be shared with these applications, and any users removed will lose access to these applications. If you’re considering removing team members, consider adding them as staff users to Clever and sharing them with the appropriate applications so they maintain application access if needed.

Learn about [Customizing District Admin field access here](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360000501586#four).

Learn about [Staff users](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/229253547) here.

---

When reviewing your team, you can edit which role your users have. See this article to [determine the best default Clever role for a user,](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115001733726#best_role) or this article to learn more about creating [custom roles](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001702).

You can review all roles assigned to a given user on [the Admin team page](https://schools.clever.com/team/members).

---

To keep your Clever account secure, we recommend reviewing your Team page periodically to:

- Delete any admin users who are no longer with your schools.
- Delete any admin users who have moved to a new position where they no longer need an admin role.

---

title: Managing your Clever administrative team
text:
**Will deleted admins receive an email notifying them that their account has been deleted?**

- No. However, you may choose to reach out to inform your team about updated accounts.

**I am the Clever account owner and will be leaving my role soon. Do I need to transfer ownership before I leave?**

- It is best practice for a seamless transition to transfer the Clever account ownership before you leave while you still have access to the Clever account as the account owner.

**How do I know which permissions I should assign a role?**

- Clever recommends assigning the minimum required permissions to user for their role. There is no limit to the number of custom roles in Clever, so you can create as many unique roles as needed to ensure proper permissions are in place for each admin.

---

title: Clever IDM: Prerequisites and Planning
text:
Clever IDM helps districts automate account provisioning and lifecycle management for Microsoft Active Directory services and Google Workspace. This affordable solution can create user accounts and organizational units based on data in Clever. However, before using this service, we recommend making sure your data is in tip-top shape. This article will guide you through a few things to check before starting your IDM journey and some tips to ensure you make the most of it after you complete the setup. As always, if you have any questions, feel free to open a new case in our [Help Center](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/?language=en_US).

A note on verbiage - Clever IDM may be confusing if you haven't used an identity management system before. Here's some quick lingo:

- **Destination** - Google Workspace, ADFS, or Entra ID, where Clever IDM will create and manage your users.
- **Formula** - the part of your Clever IDM configuration that determines how we create email addresses and Organization Units (OUs). This uses "templates", or combinations of data or predetermined values, to specify what Clever puts into your destinations.
- **OU (organizational unit)** - the "folder" of your destinations, a group where users are placed when managed by Clever IDM.

---

title: Clever IDM: Prerequisites and Planning
text:
You'll want to ensure that your sync from your SIS to Clever is running before adding IDM to the mix. Everything else in Clever depends on Secure Sync to work! You can read about Secure Sync in this Help Center article: [What is Secure Sync?](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/236113588?language=en_US)

A wide variety of sync types are available, each with its own set of quirks and advantages. Check out your specific sync type in the list below, and pay close attention to any field limitations or the timings of automated syncs.

- [Which sync type should I choose?](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202289278)
- [SFTP](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/205783078?language=en_US)
- [Aeries](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/203005016?language=en_US#five)
- [PowerSchool](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001590)
- [Infinite Campus Auto](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202094756?language=en_US#Header4)
- [Infinite Campus API](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/226677767?language=en_US#troubleshooting)
- [SchoolInsight](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/206090237)
- [Skyward API](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/232211028?language=en_US#h_01EHB1XM013ZNM5DNARJXQPZ5N)
- [Blackbaud API Sync](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001544?language=en_US)

For instance, if your sync type doesn't automatically include student emails, you should review our options for populating that field, such as field mapping. Clever Support is happy to assist you with these mappings. Note that not all sync types support mappings - you'll want to check out your respective sync type above for details.

title: Clever IDM: Prerequisites and Planning
text:
Additionally, if you plan to use Clever IDM to manage non-teaching staff in Clever, there are various options for syncing staff users, including CSV files, custom data, or an Active Directory sync. You'll want to ensure that you sync staff users to Clever before setting up Clever IDM. [Learn more in our article about adding staff to Clever](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/229253547).

Note that Clever IDM can create emails using a template you've set in your Clever Dashboard**even if the email field isn’t populated** by data from your SIS. If you're syncing data to Clever’s email field, we'll use that instead of your template.

In addition to the email address, you'll want to consider getting other data to Clever that you want to sync over including data like student lunch numbers, building IDs, or other information you may need to populate in your destination automatically.

Additionally, if your sync only runs once daily, you may want to schedule your IDM sync to run after your SIS sync. Our teams can assist with configuring a time for your IDM sync.

---

IDM matches and creates users using the standard fields: the email from your Student Information System (SIS) for Google, and the district username field from your SIS for AD/Entra.

- If your SIS syncs the email you want into Clever, you don’t need to change anything.
- If it doesn’t, IDM will use the template you create in **Step 4: Set login credentials** to create the user.

Below is a breakdown of the most common paths that IDM may take depending on whether you’re syncing with Google or AD/Entra ID.

- If Clever already has an email from SIS:

- IDM looks for a Google account with that email.
 - If it finds one, it links the account.
 - If it doesn’t find one, IDM creates a new Google account with that email.
- If Clever does not have a SIS email:

- IDM creates an email using the template you set in **Step 4: Set login credentials**.
- If the templated email already exists in Google:

- If IDM manages that account, it will add a **1** to the username (or use your fallback option configured in Step 4).
 - If IDM does not manage that account, it shows up as a **Conflict with Existing User** in the Issues report. You can manually match these accounts under the **Tasks** tab in IDM after IDM syncs.

title: Clever IDM: Prerequisites and Planning
heading_path: How IDM decides whether to match an account or create new one
**IDM logic for AD or Entra ID**
section: **IDM logic for AD or Entra ID**
text:
- IDM matches accounts based on **District Username**. If you would prefer for IDM to match by email prefix, please let our team know so that we can update this on our end.
- If Clever already has a username or email from SIS:

- IDM combines that username or email with the domain set in your IDM configuration.
 - If this matches a UPN in AD/Entra, IDM links the account.
 - If it doesn’t match, IDM creates a new account using that format.
- If Clever does not have a username/email in Clever and formula doesn't match, IDM creates using template configured in **Step 3: Set login credentials**

- If the templated formula produces a value, IDM moves forward with creating the UPN with that value. If that UPN configuration is already assigned to another user, this will result in a conflict.
 - If the templated formula results in a blank value or there is a missing attribute (username or email in most cases), then IDM assigns '1' to the end of the username by default, or uses the custom fallback configured in **Step 3: Set login credentials**.
- If the UPN already exists on another account:

- If IDM manages that account, it will add a **1** to the username or use your fallback from Step 4.

If IDM does not manage that account, it shows as a **Conflict with Existing User** in the Issues report. You can manually match these in the **Tasks** tab.

You can start setting up Clever IDM free from your [Clever Dashboard](http://schools.clever.com/identity-management). For detailed instructions on the setup process, use the following resources:

- [Clever IDM: Setup for Google](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001467)
- [Clever IDM: Setup for Active Directory](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001505?language=en_US)
- [Clever IDM: Entra ID Setup](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001553)
- [Clever Academy Course: Quick Start - Setting up Clever IDM](https://clever.academy/quick-start-idm)

---

The Clever Admin Owner is sent weekly IDM Sync Report emails that contain key metrics for IDM syncs over the prior week. You can determine the Clever Admin Owner at your district by checking the Role column on the [Team Page](https://schools.clever.com/team/members) of your District Dashboard. You can request daily sync report emails by contacting Clever Support. If additional team  members need access to these emailed reports, please have the Clever Admin Owner configure a forwarding filter in their email system.

---

title: Clever IDM: Prerequisites and Planning
text:
After you've got your IDM sync up and running, plan out your long-term implementation. For example, if you intend to use Clever's Badges into Chromebooks solutions or Badges into Windows solutions, you'll want to ensure you've applied the necessary settings to the OUs or devices where they're required. If you'll be managing your OUs with Clever IDM, think about which groups of students will need access to those solutions, such as K-5.

- [Single Sign-On (SSO): Chromebooks - Setup & Troubleshooting](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/224420247?language=en_US)
- [Clever Badges: How do I enable Badges into Windows devices?](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360000384086?language=en_US)

You'll also want to disable any other IDM or automated software or scripts that may be running - Clever IDM can't override or disable these other tools, and you may see unintended behavior with multiple automations running. Some may work well in tandem, but we'd recommend just using one at a time until you're sure they'll complement each other.

---

title: Clever IDM: Prerequisites and Planning
text:
Password management can be difficult and may present security concerns. [Consider setting up account recovery and password reset](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001662) to simplify management for your schools.

If you're running both Entra ID *and* ADFS but only one instance of Clever IDM, you may consider checking out [this Microsoft Help Center article about Entra ID Connect](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/hybrid/how-to-connect-fed-management).

Good luck with your implementation, and remember we're here to help!

---

Title

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001563?language=en_US#header1) 
2. [Sign in with Google](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001563?language=en_US#header2) 
3. [App Dashboard SSO](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001563?language=en_US#header3) 
4. [Two Factor Authentication](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001563?language=en_US#header4) 
5. [Frequently Asked Questions](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001563?language=en_US#header5)

Securing logins with SSO or two-factor authentication (2FA) is a simple, effective way to protect accounts and data. Many enterprise applications make secure logins standard - and now, so is Clever.

Explore your options for becoming more secure below.

---

Sign in with Google helps you to quickly and easily manage user authentication into the Clever dashboard. Users sign into the Google account associated with their Clever user email address and then simply click the **Sign in with Google** button found at [apps.clever.com](http://apps.clever.com)

To support Sign in with Google, ensure that your Clever user account email addresses match your Google email addresses. You can review your team on the **Team** page of your Clever Dashboard.

---

App Dashboard SSO allows app partners to configure organization level logins using SAML from their existing Identity Provider (IDP). You'll work with our Partner Engineering team to configure the settings on your IDP to allow for seamless logins using the **Login in with SSO** button found at [apps.clever.com](http://apps.clever.com)

Learn more about configuration in the [For App Partners: App Dashboard SSO](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001564?language=en_US) article.

---

Two-factor authentication adds another level of security to your account. If you enable two-factor authentication, you'll be asked to enter a verification code in addition to your username and password every time you log in to Clever. This extra verification prevents unauthorized parties from accessing your account, even if your password has been compromised.

Learn more about configuration in the [For App Partners: How do I enable two-factor authentication?](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001551) article.

---

Why is there a focus on improving account security now?

- Cybercrime is on the rise, and school district technology is a popular target. We want to help increase the security of app partner accounts as soon as possible to ensure all data is protected.

---

**Related Articles:**

- [For App Partners: How do I enable two-factor authentication?](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001551)
- [For App Partners: App Dashboard SSO](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001564?language=en_US)

section: For App Partners: App Dashboard SSO
text:

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001564?language=en_US#header1)

App Dashboard SSO allows app partners to configure organization level logins using SAML from their existing Identity Provider (IdP). You’ll work with our Partner Engineering team to configure the settings on your IdP to allow for seamless logins using the **Log in with SSO** button found at apps.clever.com.

![Screenshot of app partner login page](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000T1S9&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl000003Gh8v)

---

**Team Review**

- Please review your current app team to ensure that you have accounts for the correct users. To view your team, navigate to the Team section of your Clever dashboard.
- It is required that the email addresses associated with user accounts in Clever match the email addresses associated with accounts in your IdP.

**Organization Review**

- If your team administers multiple apps on Clever or your organization spans multiple email domains, you may need Multiple Domain support. To prepare for App Dashboard SSO across your organization, ensure that the correct users have user accounts created with all of the appropriate applications in Clever using credentials that align with the IdP you intend to use for App Dashboard SSO.

---

title: For App Partners: App Dashboard SSO
heading_path: For App Partners: App Dashboard SSO
text:
**To get started:** 
If you would like to configure single sign-on for your organization, please contact our team at [integrations@clever.com](mailto:integrations@clever.com) with the following information:

**Email Domain:**

- This will be the @ of your email address. ex: At Clever, our email address has a “[clever.com](http://clever.com)” domain.

**Encrypted Assertion?:**

- Will the SAML assertions that their IdP sends to Clever be encrypted or unencrypted?

**metadata.xml Info:**

- This can either be provided via an URL (recommended) or a file.
- Your metadata info must include the following information:
 - EntityDescriptor with an Entity ID
 - KeyDescriptor tag that includes the X509Certificate
 - SingleSignOnService tag with HTTP-Redirect Binding

**Configuration Steps to take In your IdP:**

1. Add <https://clever.com/oauth/saml/metadata.xml> as the EntityID
2. Add <https://clever.com/oauth/saml/assert> as the Assertion Consumer Service URL (ACS URL)
3. Add a SAML assertion attribute “clever.email” that is mapped to email addresses in your IdP. Please note that the email addresses in your IdP will need to match the email addresses in Clever.

**Our integrations team will contact you with next steps to complete the configuration.**

---

App Dashboard SSO can now support multiple email domains across the same organization. This will allow you to set up App Dashboard SSO across all of your applications. Reach out to [integrations@clever.com](mailto:integrations@clever.com) to explore your options.

---

title: For App Partners: App Dashboard SSO
heading_path: For App Partners: App Dashboard SSO
text:
**Which IdPs can we use as our SSO Provider for App Dashboard SSO?**

- Any IdP that can set up a SAML connection will work. See your IdP documentation for IdP-specific instructions on configuring the SAML connection.

**Will Dashboard logins using email and password continue to work?**

- Dashboard logins will continue to work through the configuration and transition period and when you are ready to fully transition to App Dashboard SSO, we will disable logins using email and password.

**We have a Third-party development team that needs access, but we don’t have them as part of our SSO org. How can they have access?**

- We believe that our Multiple Domain solution will work for your situation. Reach out to [integrations@clever.com](mailto:integrations@clever.com) to explore your options.

**We have team members from two different organizations, both of which have their own SSO solutions. What’s the best solution for us?**

- We believe that our Multiple Domain solution will work for your situation. Reach out to [integrations@clever.com](mailto:integrations@clever.com) to explore your options.

**We don’t have an IdP; what options are available for securing our user logins?**

- In addition to App Dashboard SSO, Clever offers both Sign in with Google and two-factor authentication. See the following articles for additional information.
 - [For App Partners: Securing Users](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001563?language=en_US)

title: Secure Sync: Sync or SIS ID conversions
heading_path: Secure Sync: Sync or SIS ID conversions
section: Secure Sync: Sync or SIS ID conversions
text:
> Important: Title Secure Sync: Sync or SIS ID conversions URL Name 000001566 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. What is a sync or SIS ID Conversion and why is this important? 3. Sync Conversion requirements + pre-work 4. The Sync or SIS ID Conversion process 5. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
>  
> Overview
> This article will explain a Sync or SIS (S tudent Information System) ID conversion is , why it matters, and how your school or district can prepare. > Please note: Sync or SIS ID conversions can take 2-3 weeks to complete. >  
> What is a Sync or SIS ID conversion and why is it important? > You need a Sync Conversion when you change how data syncs to Clever. This includes switching SIS providers or changing sync types, such as moving from a manual SFTP sync to a Clever-managed Auto Sync. > You need a SIS ID Conversion   when you change school\_ids, student\_ids, teacher\_ids, or staff\_ids in Clever. > These conversions help preserve Clever records and historical data in connected applications. > Most transitions require both a sync conversion and a SIS ID conversion. If your SIS provider and sync type stay the same, you’ll only need a SIS ID conversion. The Clever team will help you determine the best approach. > Sync Conversion requirements + pre-work
> Before starting a sync or SIS ID conversion, make sure the following requirements are met:
> Your SIS includes all users who still need access to Clever. > Your SIS includes rosters for the current calendar year. If rosters aren’t final for a new school year, you can still start as long as at least one active section or enrollment exists. >  
> Clever also recommends completing this pre-work to ensure a smooth process:
> Identify how you will sync data to Clever: Clever provides districts with multiple methods to sync their data. If your district is transitioning to one of the SISs listed here , you may be able to use Auto Sync to send data to Clever.

title: Secure Sync: Sync or SIS ID conversions
heading_path: Secure Sync: Sync or SIS ID conversions
section: Secure Sync: Sync or SIS ID conversions
text:
If your SIS isn't listed, you'll use an SFTP sync. Learn more about syncing data via SFTP  here . Confirm the primary identifiers for records: Clever recommends keeping student\_id and teacher\_id the same when transitioning SISs to avoid duplicate or lost records. If IDs must change, Clever can match records to preserve historical data in Clever and connected applications. Clear duplicate teacher or student accounts. Duplicates often occur when users have separate SIS records for multiple schools. These duplicates can cause login issues, rostering problems, or data loss. Consolidate records in your SIS before starting the conversion whenever possible. Confirm that SIS IDs are not being reused. Clever treats SIS IDs as unique identifiers. Reusing an ID within 300 days of its last sync can cause data issues both within Clever and connected applications. Confirm with your SIS admin that IDs won’t be recycled. If your SIS reuses IDs automatically, assign unique identifiers that haven’t synced with Clever in the past 300 days. Populate data in your new SIS. Your new SIS must contain active data before the conversion. Plan to have data ready 3–4 weeks before you want it live in Clever. Proactively start notifying SSO, Rostering apps: App coordination often takes the most time. Work with Clever Support to identify impacted SSO and rostering apps. Notify those vendors early so they can prepare for the data change. We also recommend pausing the sync with these specific applications to prevent data changes during the sync conversion process. See our article  For Clever Admins: Pause your sync for a specific app for more information on how to pause the sync with an application. >  
> The Sync or SIS ID conversion process
> Reach out to Clever : Reach out to Clever Support before syncing new or updated data. A specialist will guide you through the process and help protect your data.

title: Secure Sync: Sync or SIS ID conversions
heading_path: Secure Sync: Sync or SIS ID conversions
section: Secure Sync: Sync or SIS ID conversions
text:
Configure your Auto Sync or SFTP files: You need to set up your new sync connection before migration begins. If you've chosen an Auto Sync, work with our support team or your SIS provider as appropriate to set up the data sync. If you'll be syncing via SFTP, use  the directions found here. Please allow up to one additional week to troubleshoot getting your sync or SFTP files successfully configured. Migrate data: Once your new data is ready, notify Clever Support. Clever will enable protection settings to ensure your teachers, students, and staff are minimally affected by the changes in data by preventing SIS > Clever syncing during the migration. Existing users will still access Clever and apps, but new users won’t gain access until the conversion finishes. N o new data will sync until the conversion process is complete. Confirm data changes, sync with apps:  The final step of the process is to approve the data changes. After migration, Clever will place your sync on hold so you can review changes. No new or custom data will sync during this time. Approve or discard changes from your Sync page as appropriate. You can find more details on Holds here . Once data goes live, allow up to 48 hours for apps to reflect updates. App vendors control how and when they ingest data. If you have any questions about the effect of data changes in an application, please get in touch with the application's support team. > Frequently Asked Questions
> Is there an option if I need more guidance and would like additional services from Clever for my sync conversion? > Yes! We offer Sync Conversion Consulting Services for school organizations that want extra guidance and hands-on support. Opting for our paid services can provide additional consultation and support to further streamline the process. If you're interested in exploring this option or have any questions, please let us know! > Can this be done during a sync pause? > Yes, and Clever recommends it.

title: Secure Sync: Sync or SIS ID conversions
heading_path: Secure Sync: Sync or SIS ID conversions
section: Secure Sync: Sync or SIS ID conversions
text:
Since no new data or data changes process during a conversion, a planned pause works best. > Why does the sync conversion take up to 2-3 weeks? > Sync conversions involve complex data matching, which carries risk if done incorrectly. Larger or more complex datasets take longer. Many school organizations schedule conversions during winter or summer breaks. > What are common issues that occur during the sync conversion process that I should be aware of? > Incorrect credentials for the new sync
> Duplicate user accounts in the SIS. In Clever, users shouldn’t have multiple accounts if they are at more than one school; Clever associates a user with various schools via sections and enrollments. If a user is duplicated in your SIS to associate them with multiple schools, this can cause issues in the data-matching process in Clever. > SIS ID reuse
> Unexpected SIS ID changes
> When should I reach out to start this process? > Contact Clever at least 3 weeks before your desired completion date and only after your SIS data is fully populated. Our support team cannot schedule sync conversions in advance, so please be sure the data in your SIS is ready for upload when you contact our team. If you'd like to schedule a sync conversion in advance, please read about our sync conversion consulting services . > Can I only change the SIS ID of one user? > Not at this time. Our internal tools only work for large numbers of SIS ID changes (e.g., 100 IDs or more). Anytime you execute record linkage between data sets, the integrity of the data is always at risk. If you need to change student IDs for individual students, the best course of action is to contact your connected applications and let them know so that they can attempt to match up the new student ID and Clever ID to the student's historical data within their application. > What are some Clever-managed sync options districts can switch over to? > This  article details the types of Managed Auto Syncs that Clever offers.

> Who do I reach out to when doing a sync conversion? > Contact our Support Team. > Are section IDs preserved during sync conversions? > Our migrating tool is  not  configured to preserve section IDs, as it is expected that section IDs will change during a sync conversion. However, if section IDs need preservation for an app connection, you can speak with the Clever team to discuss potential options. > Related Resources:
> Secure Sync: Changing Student Information Systems Secure Sync: Changing SIS IDs

title: For App Partners: What is a sync conversion?
heading_path: For App Partners: What is a sync conversion?
section: For App Partners: What is a sync conversion?
text:
Title

For App Partners: What is a sync conversion?

URL Name

000001567

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001567?language=en_US#header1) 
2. [What is a sync or SIS ID conversion?](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001567?language=en_US#header2) 
3. [What is the Clever ID vs the SIS ID?](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001567?language=en_US#header3) 
4. [How Clever preserves user accounts](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001567?language=en_US#header4) 
5. [Application requirements](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001567?language=en_US#header5) 
6. [Frequently Asked Questions](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001567?language=en_US#FAQ)

This article is to provide our application partners with information on the sync or SIS ID conversion process for districts and schools.

---

A [sync conversion](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001566?language=en_US) is when schools change their way of syncing their data to Clever. This means they have either:

- Changed their sync type (e.g. going from a manual SFTP sync to a Clever-managed auto sync)
- Changed their Student Information System (SIS) (e.g. going from Infinite Campus to PowerSchool)

An [SIS ID conversion](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001543?language=en_US) is when schools keep the same syncing system but need to change their users’ SIS IDs.

**Both of these require Clever go through the conversion process to preserve the Clever IDs for users.**

---

title: For App Partners: What is a sync conversion?
heading_path: For App Partners: What is a sync conversion?
What is the Clever ID vs the SIS ID?
section: What is the Clever ID vs the SIS ID?
text:
The primary identifiers for records in Clever are known as SIS IDs. The following fields are SIS IDs:

- Data type: School; Column Header/Field Name: School\_id; Notes: Typically the school local id. Used in all other files. Corresponds to ’sis id’ field in Clever. Must be unique across the district.
- Data type: Student; Column Header/Field Name: Student\_id; Notes: Unique and constant id for student, may be student number, state id, or other unique identifier, to be used in enrollments.csv upload. Corresponds to ’sis id’ field in Clever. Must be unique across the district.
- Data type: Teacher; Column Header/Field Name: Teacher\_id; Notes: Unique and constant id for teacher, may be teacher number, state id, or other unique identifier, to be used in sections.csv upload. Corresponds to ’sis id’ field in Clever. Must be unique across the district.
- Data type: Sections; Column Header/Field Name: Section\_id; Notes: Unique and constant id for section, to be used in enrollments.csv upload. Corresponds to ’sis id’ field in Clever. Must be unique across the district
- Data type: Staff; Column Header/Field Name: Staff\_id; Notes: An identifier provided by the district when syncing or creating this staff member. Must be unique across the district.
- Data type: Contacts; Column Header/Field Name: Contact\_sis\_id; Notes: The unique identifier for this contact, if one exists

Clever ID refers to the globally unique identifier that's assigned to a record in Clever. This ID is based on the SIS ID. If the SIS ID changes, the Clever ID will change. If schools change their SIS IDs, this causes the users' accounts to be deleted and will generate new accounts. This can cause the loss of historic data in connected applications as most apps use the Clever ID as the identifier to create accounts.

---

title: For App Partners: What is a sync conversion?
heading_path: For App Partners: What is a sync conversion?
How Clever preserves the user accounts
section: How Clever preserves the user accounts
text:
When schools reach out about starting either conversion process, we enable protection settings on their account to ensure teachers and students are minimally affected by the changes in data.  During this time, all syncing of data between the district and Clever will be paused, however, users will still be able to access Clever and their applications.

We can then work with the district to make sure that their data is error-free and use our matchmaker tool to ensure that the new sis\_ids are associated with the old sis\_ids for each user, thus preserving the Clever IDs for each user. This process can take up to 3 weeks during peak times for various reasons such as troubleshooting sync errors, the need to notify applications for any reason, cleaning up data, etc. The schools’ role in the conversion is to supply accurate, error-free data. Schools should **not** reuse SIS IDs. If schools do re-use SIS IDs or have duplicate accounts for users, this can add to the sync conversion delay.

---

title: For App Partners: What is a sync conversion?
heading_path: For App Partners: What is a sync conversion?
text:
The best practice for our application partners is to use the Clever ID for account creation. However, if you’re unable to match the Clever ID for account creation (you use another field), we need to know what your requirements are when our districts go through a sync or SIS ID conversion.

- If you're **not** using the Clever ID for account creation, **what fields are you using to create these accounts?**
- Do you require a crosswalk file (a file that matches up the old data to the updated)?
- Is there any additional support or information you need during the conversion process?

Please reach out to [Clever Support](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/?language=en_US) if you need any of this additional support. **If you don’t require a crosswalk file or additional support, there is no need to reach out.**

---

title: For App Partners: What is a sync conversion?
heading_path: For App Partners: What is a sync conversion?
text:
- For school data:
 - **School\_id**
 - **School\_number**
 - **School\_name**
- For student data:
 - **School\_id**
 - **Student\_id**
 - **First\_name**
 - **Last\_name**
- For teacher data
 - **School\_id**
 - **Teacher\_id**
 - **First\_name**
 - **Last\_name**
- For section data
 - **School\_id**
 - **Section\_id**
 - **Teacher\_id** (Unique identifier of primary teacher for section, must match a Teacher id found in teachers.csv)
- For enrollments data
 - **School\_id** (School id must match a School id provided in schools.csv upload)
 - **Section\_id** (Section id must match a Section id provided in sections.csv upload)
 - **Student\_id** (Student id must match a Student id provided in students.csv upload)
- Contact data is not required but if the district decides to sync this data, we require the following:
 - **Contact\_relationship** (Contact’s relationship to student - e.g. ”Father”, ”Aunt” or ”Neighbor”)
 - **Contact\_type** (Type of contact - e.g. ”family”, ”emergency” or ”guardian”. If providing student contacts, then Contact type is required)
 - **Contact\_name**
- Staff data is not required but if the district decides to sync this data, we require the following: 
 - **Staff\_id**
 - **Staff\_email**
 - **First\_name**
 - **Last\_name**

If your application requires certain fields that you are not seeing as synced, please reach out to the district to make sure they are syncing that field to Clever.

- Clever completes the conversion process while working with the schools

If you have any questions, please reach out to [Clever Support](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/?language=en_US)!

---

text:
> Note: Title For Clever Admins: SSO access to the Clever Dashboard URL Name 000001568 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Configuration 3. Logging into the admin Clever Dashboard and Portal 4. SSO and Multi-factor Authentication (MFA) 5. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
>  
> Overview
> In addition to logging in using your email address and password at schools.clever.com , admin users can also log into the district dashboard and admin Portal using their identity provider (IdP) via single sign-on (SSO). SSO logins use the “Log in with” button from your Clever Portal URL. This article applies to users with the following roles: Clever Admins, District Curriculum Lead, District Help Desk. > Configuration
> Requirements for admin SSO access:
> You must have an external IdP, such as Google or Entra ID, configured for SSO into Clever on the Clever Dashboard > Authentication > SSO settings tab. You can learn more about  configuring SSO here . >  
> The email address associated with your admin account as seen on the Profile  or Admin Team pages must match the email address in your IdP. See details for your IdP below. > Admins must update their own email addresses from the Profile page . You can learn more about how to update your profile settings here . > Your username or login claims rule in your IdP must be your email address. > Google Google will always use an email address as the username. If you have added Google as a login method and your admin user email address is a Google email address, you are configured for Clever Dashboard SSO. Entra ID A claims rule for clever.district\_admin.email or clever.any.email should be added in Entra ID as outlined here. The claims rule should indicate which field in Active Directory contains the same email address that matches the email address on the Clever Admin's Profile in Clever. Active Directory A claims rule for clever.district\_admin.email should be added in Active Directory as outlined here.

title: For Clever Admins: SSO access to the Clever Dashboard
heading_path: For Clever Admins: SSO access to the Clever Dashboard
section: For Clever Admins: SSO access to the Clever Dashboard
text:
The claims rule should indicate which field in Active Directory contains the same email address that matches the email address on the Clever Admin's Profile in Clever. Canvas By default, Canvas will try to match on email. Ensure that your admins have an email address in Canvas that matches the email address on the Clever Admin's Profile in Clever to enable SSO access with Canvas. If these default matches do not work for your district, please let us know in your support request. > Logging into the admin Clever Dashboard and Portal
> To log in as an admin user using SSO, you will need to navigate to your district's Portal URL. This is the URL that your students, teachers, and staff use to log in, and can be found on your Clever Dashboard > Portal > Portal settings page. When logging in directly from your Portal URL, you will first access your admin Clever Portal. To navigate to the Clever Dashboard, click Dashboard at the top of your Portal. > SSO and Multi-factor authentication (MFA)
> By default, admin users still need to use multi-factor authentication (MFA) to access the Clever Portal when using SSO (learn more about  MFA for admin users here ). If your district admin team already uses MFA when accessing your identity provider (IdP) and you would like to by-pass admin MFA when accessing Clever, contact our support team and be prepared to provide details about your admin team and IdP MFA. Learn more about managing your Admin Team here . Disabling password login for your admin team As an additional layer of security, Clever can disable password login for your admin team. This means that email address and password logins will no longer work at schools.clever.com and your team must use SSO through your district Portal URL. If you would like to disable password logins for your district, contact our support team. > Please note: The Clever Account Owner can always use an email address with a password login and MFA to access the Clever Dashboard.

This is to provide a backup in case your IdP configurations change and other admins lose access. >  
> Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
> Can admins use Clever Passwords to log in to the Clever Dashboard? > No. SSO admin login through the Portal URL must use an external IdP. > Sometimes I log in directly to the Clever Dashboard when using SSO. Why does that happen? > If you start at schools.clever.com and click School Login to navigate to your district Portal URL, you will log into the Clever Dashboard directly instead of the admin Portal. > Related articles:
> For Clever Admins: Setting up multi-factor authentication (MFA) for Clever Admin Managing your District Clever Admin Team Single Sign-On (SSO): Setup & Configuration

title: For App Partners: Resetting app dashboard passwords
heading_path: For App Partners: Resetting app dashboard passwords
section: For App Partners: Resetting app dashboard passwords
text:
Title

For App Partners: Resetting app dashboard passwords

URL Name

000001569

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001569?language=en_US#header1) 
2. [Password strength](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001569?language=en_US#header2) 
3. [Reset password](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001569?language=en_US#header3) 
4. [Update password](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001569?language=en_US#header4) 
5. [Frequently asked questions (FAQs)](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001569?language=en_US#header5)

Clever app team members can easily reset their passwords in case of a lost or forgotten one. This article details the process for resetting an app team member's password.

This only applies to app partners who log in with an email address and password. App partners who log in with Sign in with Google or App Dashboard SSO should reset their IDP passwords in their IDP.

---

Clever requires a certain level of complexity to ensure a strong password and also does privacy-preserving checks.

During account creation, password reset, and login, Clever will determine if a password is unsafe if it's been made public in an unrelated data breach. If an app team member’s password is determined unsafe, we require the user to select a different password.

For recommendations on selecting strong passwords, see the FAQ.

---

To reset your app team member password for Clever,

1. Visit [apps.clever.com](https://apps.clever.com/) and click Forgot your password?
2. Enter the email address associated with your admin account, click the Captcha, and click Reset
3. An email will be sent with a link to reset your password. If you don't receive the email, please check your spam filter and make sure [no-reply@clever.com](mailto:no-reply@clever.com) is added as a contact to your email account.

Quick link: <https://apps.clever.com/reset?captcha=true>

---

If you'd like to update your Clever password, click on your name in the top-right of the app dashboard and click Profile Settings. Enter your existing password and new password and then click Update to update your password.

![Profile page with Profile Settings and Change Password sections highlighted](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000ULWr&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000063MMZ)

---

title: For App Partners: Resetting app dashboard passwords
heading_path: For App Partners: Resetting app dashboard passwords
text:
**When attempting to log in to Clever, why do I see a note about my password being part of a public data breach?**

- Clever determines that a password is unsafe if it's been made public in an unrelated data breach. We perform privacy-preserving checks for passwords which have been leaked online. If an app team member password matches any of these, we require the user to reset their password. 
 ![Log in screen with a note about the password having been found in a public data breach](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000ULWr&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000063MMo)

**Are there recommendations for choosing a secure password?**

- Use a password management solution like 1Password to use strong/unique passwords for all logins.
- Combine three or four random words. For example: “student-task-fish-fly”. These combinations are usually easy to remember and very secure.

---

**Related articles:**

title: Clever + Raptor Setup Guide
text:
Title

Clever + Raptor Setup Guide

URL Name

000001570

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001570?language=en_US#header1) 
2. [Adding staff](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001570?language=en_US#header2) 
3. [Sharing considerations](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001570?language=en_US#header3) 
4. [Contacts](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001570?language=en_US#header4) 
5. [Users at multiple school sites](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001570?language=en_US#header5) 
6. [Co-teachers](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001570?language=en_US#header6) 
7. [Duplicate sections](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001570?language=en_US#header7)

Founded in 2002, Raptor has partnered with over 52,000 schools globally, including over 5,000 K-12 U.S. school districts, to provide integrated visitor, volunteer, emergency management, safeguarding, and early intervention software and services that cover the full spectrum of school and student safety.

By adding Raptor Technologies to your district’s Clever account, you're securely and automatically sending your most up-to-date roster data from your SIS to Raptor.

In this article, we’ll go over some best practices to consider when connecting with Raptor through Clever. Since each district’s sync setup is different, please reach out to Clever Support with any questions or concerns.

---

For Raptor Technologies and in general, you will want to have all of your staff in Clever, including non-teaching and non-admin staff. Please see [Clever Roles: Staff - How to add to Clever](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/229253547) for instructions. We typically recommend the “uploading staff via CSV” method, but please reach out to Clever Support if this does not work for your district’s setup.

---

title: Clever + Raptor Setup Guide
text:
For Raptor Technologies, we recommend sharing all district data with the app. Please see [Sharing Permissions: Overview](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/203115007) and the **Share by District** option.

One common concern is that districts want to make sure their staff members, especially non-teaching and non-admin staff, don't have access to some/all of the district’s other applications. You can avoid oversharing staff with your other applications by setting your other apps to [**Share by Rules**](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115000392247) and making sure only to include the appropriate staff users.

You'll also want to utilize Share by Rules if you need to share users with multiple roles in Clever (i.e., users with both a teacher and a staff account). At this time, Raptor does not support users with dual roles. Raptor will create duplicate profiles if multiple account types sync to the application. To prevent this, you should determine which account type should be shared with the application and set your sharing rules so that only that account is shared.

If there are staff members you only want to share with Raptor, and none of your other applications, we recommend giving them a title such as “Raptor Only” when creating your Staff.csv file. This way, they will be easy to exclude from your other apps’ sharing rules.

---

title: Clever + Raptor Setup Guide
text:
Contacts are important to include in your sync with Raptor, since parents/guardians will need to be notified if there is an emergency. To make sure your student contacts are syncing from your SIS to Clever, please visit your [Data browser](https://schools.clever.com/data-browser) and check the Contacts tab.

Contacts are automatically shared with Raptor. You can make sure they are shared by visiting [Raptor’s Settings page](https://schools.clever.com/applications/raptor/settings) within your Clever Dashboard.

If you're concerned about oversharing contacts with your other applications, you can go into the settings for your other apps and make sure that contacts are not shared if not appropriate. See [For District Admins: Apps - Field Access](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360000501586) for how to do this. If you’re unsure about this, please reach out to Clever Support for assistance.

---

Raptor prefers that all users are associated with one school site only. If possible, you can edit your Staff.csv file to ensure staff are each associated with only one school site.

If needed, Raptor can support users at multiple schools, with the caveat that staff assigned to multiple buildings will most likely impact the reporting of emergency accountability at schools that they are not at during the time of the emergency. For example, if a staff person is at School B today but School A has an emergency, they will be seen as "missing" during School A’s emergency because they are physically at School B. The same would apply to students assigned to multiple sites.

---

Raptor doesn't currently support syncing co-teachers/secondary teachers from Clever. The primary teacher will sync to Raptor for each section.

---

Raptor doesn't sync duplicate sections. For any two sections that have **the same teacher** and **the same section** name, the following is true:

- If the section name and the student list are identical on both rosters, then all shared students on both rosters do not sync.
- If the section name is the same but the student list is different on the two sections, Raptor will combine them into one larger section.

To avoid this, we recommend making sure that teachers have unique section names for each of their sections. It is not an issue if two different teachers have sections with the same names since Raptor will recognize they're different sections belonging to different teachers.

title: For Clever Admins: What do I do if a student sends an inappropriate message?
heading_path: For Clever Admins: What do I do if a student sends an inappropriate message?
section: For Clever Admins: What do I do if a student sends an inappropriate message?
text:
> Note: Title For Clever Admins: What do I do if a student sends an inappropriate message? URL Name 000001571 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Message Transcript 3. Access logs
>  
> Overview
> Please note: Clever will be discontinuing Clever Messaging by December 31st, 2025 . This will allow our teams to focus on features that enhance our identity platform offerings including new free tools like Substitute Access , role-based access control , and access logs . > Clever promotes respectful messaging by displaying text that prompts the student to confirm if they would like to send their message if our system detects inappropriate language. This will give them the option not to send the message. However, in some cases, the student will confirm that they would like to send the message to their teacher anyways. When this happens, Clever wants to make sure you have the tools to help investigate who actually sent the message and to get access to the message transcript for your records. > Message Transcript
> All message history between a teacher and students/families is saved for the length of the school year. Clever District Admins can access a user's message history by using the Clever search bar in the Clever Dashboard to locate the user, wherever they’re a teacher or student. Once you are on the user’s profile page, click Support tools in the top right-hand corner and select Download Messaging transcript from the drop-down menu (as seen in the image below). Once the transcript has been downloaded, you’ll receive an email with “Messaging transcript” as the subject to the email address associated with your Clever Admin account. When you open the email, you’ll find a link that will download a CSV file.

Within the file, you’ll find the:
> Dates of the messages Recipients  Senders Contents of the messages Sender’s IP address Attachments in the message (if any were included in the message)   
> Access logs
> You can also utilize the Access logs to help detect all of the login attempts the user has made in the past 5 days. You can filter the data by date and by the ID of the user whose account the messages originated from. You can then view the IP address associated with those logins. This is the only information about the logins that we have available.

section: For Clever Admins: Classroom MFA Google Workspace SAML Setup Guide
text:
> Important: Title For Clever Admins: Classroom MFA Google Workspace SAML Setup Guide URL Name 000001572 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Setup 3. Troubleshooting 4. Using Classroom MFA Google Workspace SAML for Chromebook Logins
> Please note: The Google Workspace app requires an MFA subscription. If you're interested in adding MFA to your Clever account, you can learn more here or get started directly at your Clever Dashboard > Authentication > Classroom MFA page. >  
> Overview
> This article is a step-by-step walkthrough for setting up Google SAML with Clever's Classroom MFA. Before reading this setup guide, please make sure your district is set up with Classroom MFA and Google! If your district has not purchased Classroom MFA, you can get started in your Clever Dashboard > Authentication > Classroom MFA page , or if you are new to Clever, get started by going to this link: https://www.clever.com/district-signup . For more information on setting up Classroom MFA, please see this article . Classroom MFA protects the Clever Portal, Google Workspace, and Google Chromebooks. With the classroom-friendly MFA methods and the ability to require re-authentication for login attempts outside your designated geographical location or network, you can rest assured that potential bad actors will hit your MFA wall and get turned away. >  
> Setup
> Search for the Google Workspace app and click Request Application . You can set up user sharing now or do so later. > If you’re getting a 404 error, copy and paste directly into the address bar: https://schools.clever.com/applications/add/saml-google-workspace If you already have this app installed and you don’t see the Request application button, go to step 2 below. >  
> Share the Google Workspace app with any Clever users who need access to Google through Clever but don’t use Badges to access a Chromebook. Typically, this includes older students, teachers, and staff users in Clever.

Please remember that the users in this OU must also be shared with the Google Workspace application ( step 2 above ) to successfully access Google from Clever. > IMPORTANT  Google does not allow Superadmins to SSO via another IdP, so if you apply the Clever SSO profile you just made to a Superadmin at your district, it will not work. >

> This can sometimes be caused by the individual user setting in the Google Admin Console to force a password reset on the next login. title: For Clever Admins: Classroom MFA Google Workspace SAML Setup Guide
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Classroom MFA Google Workspace SAML Setup Guide
section: For Clever Admins: Classroom MFA Google Workspace SAML Setup Guide
text:
> Using Classroom MFA Google Workspace SAML for Chromebook logins
> To configure Chromebook logins with Clever credentials and Classroom MFA, you'll need to enable:
> Clever to access the device camera on the login screen
> Re-prompt for a Badge after the device is reopened after being closed
> Sign the user into Clever automatically when they sign in to the device
> Navigate to Devices > Chrome > Settings > Users & browsers and scroll down to the Security section
> Set Lock Screen settings to: "Do not allow locking screen"
> Scroll a little bit until you reach the Single sign-on and SAML single sign-on login frequency settings in the Security section. > Set Single sign-on to "Enable SAML-based single sign on for Chrome devices". > Set SAML single sign-on login frequency to an appropriate duration. We recommend "Every 2 weeks" for the best experience. > Scroll to the Power and Shutdown section. Set the following Idle settings
> Set Action on lid close to Logout
> Set Lock screen on sleep to Don't lock screen
> Set AC idle action to Logout
> Set Battery idle action to Logout
> Next, scroll down to the Startup section further down on the same page
> Change the Homepage configuration to Homepage is always the URL set below . Set your Homepage URL to your Clever Portal URL. You can find your Clever Portal URL here . > Click the Device settings tab at the top of the settings panel and scroll down to Sign-in settings
> Set Guest Mode to Disable guest mode
> Set Sign-in Screen to Never show user names and photos
> Set Single Sign-On IdP Redirection to Allow users to go directly to SAML SSO IdP page
> Set Single Sign-On Cookie Behavior to  Enable transfer of SAML SSO Cookies into user session  
> Enter https://clever.com/oauth/badges/login under Single sign-on camera permissions.

These settings ensure that Clever has access to your Chromebooks' cameras to validate Clever Badge logins  
> Scroll down to Kiosk Settings and ensure that Managed guest session is set to Do not allow managed guest sessions
>

title: Deploy Edtech Analytics for Edge using Microsoft Intune
heading_path: Deploy Edtech Analytics for Edge using Microsoft Intune
Step 1: Silently install the Clever Plus Edge Extension
section: Step 1: Silently install the Clever Plus Edge Extension
text:
1. Sign in to [Microsoft Endpoint Manager (Intune)](https://endpoint.microsoft.com/).
2. Select **Devices** in the left-hand navigation pane.
3. From the **Devices | Overview** right-hand pane, select **Configuration Profiles**.

![Screenshot of the Microsoft Endpoint Manager admin center](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TX5R&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000005lf2N)

4. On the top command bar, select **Create profile**.
5. From the drop-down list:
 1. Below Platform, select **Windows 10 and later**.
 2. Below Profile Type, select **Templates**.
 3. Below Template name, select **Administrative Templates** and then click the **Create** button.

![Showing Administrative Templates drop-down list in Microsoft Endpoint Manager](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TX5R&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000005lf78)

6. On the Basics tab, enter a descriptive Name, such as **Microsoft Edge Clever Plus Policy**. Select **Next**.

![Screenshot of the Basics tab](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TX5R&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000005lf86)

7. On the Configuration settings tab, search and select **Control which extensions are installed silently** under Path\**Microsoft Edge\Extensions**

![Image of the configurations settings tab](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TX5R&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000005lfeb)

8. The settings will be shown on the right pane.
 1. Set it to **Enabled**
 2. For the **Extension/App IDs** use dikiaagfielfbnbbopidjjagldjopbpa;<https://crx.clever.com/updates> then click **OK** and **Next** to progress

![Screenshot of where you control which extensions are installed silently](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TX5R&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000005lfpy)

9. Set Scope tags if applicable, click **Next**.
10. Set Group Assignments & Exclusions with Filters as applicable, click **Next**.
11. Review the profile then click **Create.**

---

text:

title: Deploy Edtech Analytics for Edge using Microsoft Intune
heading_path: Deploy Edtech Analytics for Edge using Microsoft Intune
Step 3: Configure the Extension with your District ID Analytics Token
section: Step 3: Configure the Extension with your District ID Analytics Token
text:
The following steps set the AnalyticsToken for the extension, which determines which sessions should be tracked and enables usage data collection.  The AnalyticsToken for your district or school's Clever account is the District ID found on your [Clever Dashboard > Data browser](https://schools.clever.com/data-browser).

![Screenshot example of where to locate your District ID](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TX5R&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000Wl4Lt)

To add your AnalyticsToken:

1. Sign in to [Microsoft Endpoint Manager (Intune)](https://endpoint.microsoft.com/).
2. Select **Devices** in the left-hand navigation pane.
3. From **Devices | Overview**, select **Scripts and Remediations,**then the **Platform Scripts Tab.

![Screenshot of the devices scripts and remediations page](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TX5R&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl000003Yxok)**
4. On the top command bar, select **Add**, and **Windows 10 and Later**
5. On the Basics tab, enter a descriptive Name, such as **Set\_Clever\_Edge\_Token**. Select **Next**.
 1. Create a powershell script with the .ps1 extension (e.g. Set\_Clever\_Edge\_Token.ps1), save it with the following command replacing YOURANALYTICSTOKEN, then upload to **Script location**

New-Item -Path HKLM:\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Edge -Name 3rdparty

New-Item -Path HKLM:\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Edge\3rdparty -Name extensions

New-Item -Path HKLM:\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Edge\3rdparty\extensions\ -Name dikiaagfielfbnbbopidjjagldjopbpa

New-Item -Path HKLM:\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Edge\3rdparty\extensions\dikiaagfielfbnbbopidjjagldjopbpa -Name policy

New-ItemProperty -Path HKLM:\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Edge\3rdparty\extensions\dikiaagfielfbnbbopidjjagldjopbpa\policy -Name AnalyticsToken -PropertyType String -Value YOURANALYTICSTOKEN
 2. Toggle each of these options to **No**

1. 1. **Run this script using the logged on credentials No**
 2. **Enforce script signature check No**
 3. **Run script in 64 bit PowerShell Host No**

![Image of script settings](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TX5R&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl000003YyuU)

6. Set **Group Assignments & Exclusions with Filters** as applicable, click **Next**.
7. Review the profile then click **Add**.

---

title: Deploy Edtech Analytics for Edge using Microsoft Intune
heading_path: Deploy Edtech Analytics for Edge using Microsoft Intune
text:
To verify the install worked, log in on a targeted device and confirm the following:

1. ​In Edge, navigate to **edge://extensions** and look for **Clever Plus**. Click into it to see details.

![Image of the Clever Plus extension](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TX5R&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000005lg2Y)

2. Check **Registry Editor** on a target Endpoint, navigate to HKLM:\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Edge\3rdparty\extensions\dikiaagfielfbnbbopidjjagldjopbpa\policy, and check that the Analytics Token string value is set accurately.

![Screenshot of the analytics token](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TX5R&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000005lg2s)

---
