title: Clever and North Carolina third-party data integration
heading_path: Clever and North Carolina third-party data integration
text:
In May 2023, the North Carolina Department of Public Instruction (NC DPI) released new data security standards for any system that receives student information from a statewide system. Since Clever connects to the North Carolina student information system (SIS), we understand that these requirements apply to Clever. This article will provide districts with information and materials about Clever’s compliance with these new requirements.

The requirements go into effect January 1, 2024 (originally August 1, 2023), and must be met before any new service agreement or renewal can be signed. Clever’s Secure Sync service does not operate on a renewal schedule, however, we still intend to meet the requirements on or before August 1, 2023, to give school districts assurance of compliance and non-interruption of service.

The North Carolina requirements are:

1. Signed Data Confidentiality and Security Agreement for Online Service Providers and Public School Units (Student Data)
2. Completed Third-Party Collection Worksheet
3. Completed Vendor Readiness Assessment Report (VRAR) self-assessment
4. Third-Party Assessment Report
5. Compliance with North Carolina’s Statewide Information Security Manual

---

NC DPI has determined that all vendors who connect with North Carolina’s statewide SIS need to sign the Data Confidentiality and Security Agreement for Online Service Providers and Public School Units (Student Data) (“DCSA”) in whole with no modifications. Please follow this [DocuSign link](https://na2.docusign.net/Member/PowerFormSigning.aspx?PowerFormId=95ed9d92-25bc-462c-9818-b6460e314f12&env=na2&acct=8f3af476-5ae1-4be5-8870-8f8f1790daf1&v=2) to access a pre-signed version of the document. Using the link, you may countersign and download your own copy of the DCSA. If you have trouble with DocuSign, please contact [legal@clever.com](mailto:legal@clever.com) to find a different process.

---

Please follow [this link](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1nLZ35YXPHh4ckNgfv2lTiieiyCtv5nWuF8eOOhplr3Q/edit) to access a completed Third Party Collection Worksheet using the NC DPI’s required template. You can fill out the top portion with your own school district’s information and keep a copy for your records.

---

Please follow [this link](https://www.clever.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/05/North-Carolina-Department-of-Information-Technology-vrar-non-state-hosted-solutions.docx-1-1.pdf) to access Clever’s signed and completed VRAR self-assessment using the NC DPI’s required template.

---

title: Clever and North Carolina third-party data integration
heading_path: Clever and North Carolina third-party data integration
text:
The NC DPI requires a third-party conducted security assessment report, such as the Federal Risk and Authorization Management Program (FedRAMP) authorization, SOC (Security Operations Center) 2 Type 2 audit, ISO 27001 certification, or HITRUST certification, dated within the last 12 months.

Clever has obtained and intends to maintain a SOC 2 Type 2 Security report on an annual basis. The SOC 2 organization requires that an NDA be entered into before sharing the report with existing or potential customers.  If you are a school district that is connected to or connecting to Clever, please [click this link to sign an NDA](https://na2.docusign.net/Member/PowerFormSigning.aspx?PowerFormId=5d039b52-88c8-4926-aefa-02a13d533d38&env=na2&acct=8f3af476-5ae1-4be5-8870-8f8f1790daf1&v=2) if you would like to review a copy of our report.

---

The NC DPI requires alignment with the Statewide Information Security Manual. While Clever complies with a majority of the elements, there are some gaps that we expect to close during the next year during our SOC 2 Type 2 assessment process. In the meantime, if you would like to review Clever’s most recent penetration testing and/or vulnerability scans, please sign an NDA using [this DocuSign link](https://na2.docusign.net/Member/PowerFormSigning.aspx?PowerFormId=6fc6637f-6d6d-40a4-a3c6-45dbc6a00805&env=na2&acct=8f3af476-5ae1-4be5-8870-8f8f1790daf1&v=2) and we will provide a copy to the email address of the person signing the document. If you have trouble with DocuSign, please contact [legal@clever.com](mailto:legal@clever.com) to find a different process.

---

title: PowerSchool Plugin Sync
text:
> Important: Title PowerSchool Plugin Sync URL Name 000001590 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Setup       •  Troubleshooting Installation Errors 3. Updates   4. Customizations 5. School Year Rollover 6. Troubleshooting 7. Sync Errors 8. Default Field Mappings
>     
> Overview
> ✓ Runs every four hours ✓ Syncs all students with an active enrollment status ("enroll\_status" = 0) ✓ Syncs teachers that are assigned to an active school and have an active staff status ("Status" = 1) ✓ Syncs co-teachers ✓ Syncs student contacts from PowerSchool v12.x (unlimited contacts). Please note, we highly recommend consolidating contacts prior to using the upgraded PowerSchool sync. More information on contacts can be found here . ✓ Works alongside Google and O365 SSO into PowerSchool. This allows SSO access to PowerSchool using Google or O365. It does not provide SSO to PowerSchool via Clever. More info here .)  ✓ Sync users to the staff user role in Clever. Staff sync is available for districts that have set up the PowerSchool plugin sync option for the first time after February 2025. If you’ve been using the PowerSchool plugin sync prior to February 2025 and would like staff to be synced, please contact Clever Support to discuss potential options. > X Cannot sync the Central Office (school\_id = 0) or any teachers assigned to this site
>  
> Setup
> New to Clever? Please contact your district onboarding specialist for setup directions. If you have not yet connected with a district onboarding specialist, you can sign up here . If you have an existing Clever account and would like to transition to the PowerSchool plugin sync, please contact our support team. Please note, the process of changing sync types can take 2-3 weeks. We highly recommend reviewing the conversion process as outlined  here .

title: PowerSchool Plugin Sync
text:
>  ⚠️  IMPORTANT: If upgrading from the legacy PowerSchool Sync , please confirm the following before proceeding: • Your current PowerSchool sync is active (no sync status errors). If your sync is broken, the plugin will not successfully generate for your account. • There are active enrollments for the current academic year • SSO into PowerSchool SIS using an identity provider (Google or O365) as outlined here has NOT been enabled. • After you've received confirmation from Clever Support that your conversion is complete, you can enable SSO if you'd like, as well as remove the Clever User utilized for your previous PowerSchool Auto Sync. > To securely install the upgraded PowerSchool sync, please follow these directions:
> Download the Plugin
> The PowerSchool plugin allows Clever to connect to your PowerSchool Student Information System (SIS)  to import data for Clever rostering and Single Sign-On (SSO) services. > The plugin contains a secure token that is specific to your district. Do not share the plugin with individuals outside your district or transmit the plugin through insecure methods such as email. >  
> Log in to the Clever Dashboard Navigate to the Data sources > SIS sync > Settings page. Under PowerSchool Plugin , click Download PowerSchool Plugin to download to your local device
>  
> Install the Plugin  
> Log in to PowerSchool as an administrator On the start page, choose System Management in the main menu on the left side Then click Server Then click Plugin Management Configuration Click Install Under Plugin Installation File , click Choose File Select the file named  clever\_plugin.zip from your device and click Open. (Do not unzip the file and install the .XML file) In PowerSchool, click Install If the plugin installs correctly, it will take you back to the Plugin management Dashboard. A popup will appear requesting confirmation of registration. Click Register .

title: PowerSchool Plugin Sync
text:
On the Plugin Management Dashboard, click the Enable/Disable checkbox next to the Clever Plugin, which will be named “District  {{your District ID}}” (example: “District 5a2b7742d220a50001d0880f”) . In the sidebar that opens, click Enable . >                      🛑  STOP ! Be sure you  Enabled  the plugin in Steps 10 & 11! > If your account is using the legacy PowerSchool sync, do not disable the Clever Admin access user in PowerSchool until you have received email confirmation of the upgrade from the Clever team. Disabling access will block the transition process. > If you are an existing Clever district, you will receive an email from our team once the transition is complete. The "Sync Type" on the SIS sync  page will also be updated. If any additional actions are required our team will contact you via email. 🚨 Do NOT "Regenerate Client ID and Secret" for the plugin; it will break your sync . If you are informed that you need to regenerate the Client ID and Secret, please contact Clever Support. >  
> Troubleshooting Installation Errors
>  
> - Error(s): How to Fix
> - "No active enrollments found for the new school year. Sync will resume once enrollments are published": The PowerSchool plugin sync is unable to find active enrollments for the current academic year. Clever automatically rolls over to the new school year on July 1st. To resolve the error, publish enrollments for the new academic year. > - "Plug-in installation error": In the Clever Dashboard, click  Download  to generate the plugin. Once downloaded, install the plugin in PowerSchool. You can view and download your district's latest plug-in here:  https://schools.clever.com/sync/settings .

title: PowerSchool Plugin Sync
text:
When installing the plug-in, please confirm:
> You have clicked the enable button for the plug-in Any previous plug-in versions have been deleted You have installed the entire .zip file that downloaded from the Clever Dashboard (installing only the plugin.xml file will break the sync)
> - "User passwords no longer exportable from PowerSchool": Your district is using one or more legacy password fields that are no longer available to Clever. > In  PowerSchool v23.5.0.0 and later , the following fields are no longer exportable: 
> Students.Student\_Web\_Password Teachers.Password Teachers.TeacherLoginPW
> In order to sync passwords to Clever, create a custom field in PowerSchool to store password data. Once created and populated with data, contact Clever Support and let us know the exact name of the table. We will update your sync configuration to pull the data into Clever. > - "Update SSL certificate in order to continue syncing with Clever": Please update the SSL certificate for your PowerSchool account. For assistance with this process, please contact PowerSchool support. > - "Registration was rejected by the publisher. Contact the publisher of this plugin for resolution. > Bad Request": This error typically indicates that the registration token in the plugin has expired. Please reach out to Clever Support to have a new plugin generated. >  
>  
> Updates
> Clever’s team may need to provide an updated version of the plugin to ensure we meet your district’s needs. You do not need to disable PowerSchool SSO to update your plugin. If Clever has indicated you need to install an updated version of the plugin, you can update the plugin using these directions:
> Download the updated plugin as described here . Log in to PowerSchool as an administrator On the start page, choose System under Setup in the main menu. Under Server, click System Settings . Click Plugin Management Configuration .

title: PowerSchool Plugin Sync
text:
Locate the existing upgraded sync - your plugin will have the name format: District - {Clever District ID} (example: “District - 5a2b7742d220a50001d0880f”) Click Update Under Plugin Installation File , click Choose File . Select the file named  clever\_plugin.zip from your device and click Open. (Do not unzip the file and install the .XML file) In PowerSchool, click Install If the plugin installs correctly, it will take you back to the Plugin management Dashboard. A message will indicate that the plugin was successfully updated. In the Enable Plugin confirmation sidebar that opens, click Enable . On the Plugin Management Dashboard, ensure the Enable/Disable checkbox next to the updated plugin is checked. On the Plugin Management Dashboard, locate your previous plugin version and delete it by clicking the  Delete  button in the actions column. >   Please note: If your ISP or IP address changes, Clever typically doesn't require your new IP address to sync with the PowerSchool Plugin. However, if your IP addresses are changing as a result of transitioning from on-premise to a cloud hosting server, please notify our support team, as this may require updates. >  
> Customizations
> PowerSchool syncs can be customized to sync nightly, instead of every four hours, but the time of day that the syncs occur is not customizable. Syncs can always be initiated/forced at any time from your Clever Dashboard on the Data sources > SIS sync page > Settings tab > Sync Controls box > Sync Now button. Clever can filter exports from PowerSchool to limit the schools, teachers, or students included in the sync. Reach out to Clever Support if you would like to filter exports. To request customizations or filtering for your PowerSchool sync, please submit a request to Clever Support . >  
>    Please note: If you’d like to sync additional data to Clever, you can do so via our automated custom data sync for auto sync districts and schools.

title: PowerSchool Plugin Sync
text:
Please reach out to Clever Support for access to your Clever SFTP Directory. You'll need to set up any automatic exports to the remote site, as Clever doesn't provide support for automation scripting. >  
> School Year Rollover
> On August 1st, Clever will stop syncing last year's section data from PowerSchool. If you would like to stop syncing last year's sections and enrollments before August 1st, or if you would like to continue syncing last year's sections and enrollments after August 1st, please reach out to Clever Support. > If enrollments for the new school year are not available after August 1st, you will receive the error: "No active enrollments found for the school term configured in Clever". The error will be resolved once enrollments are published for the new school year. > Troubleshooting
> Missing Records 
> If an entire record is missing, we recommend checking the following in PowerSchool:
> - Record Type: Troubleshooting Steps
> - Enrollments: If you are noticing incorrect enrollments in Clever and your plugin was installed prior to 8/24/23, please navigate to  https://schools.clever.com/sync/settings and re-download the plugin. Upload and enable the plugin update to PowerSchool and enable. Once complete, press  Sync now  in the Clever dashboard.

title: PowerSchool Plugin Sync
text:
> - Students: Clever will only sync students that meet the following conditions: 
> Record is active enroll\_status = 0
> - Teachers: Clever will only sync teachers that meet the following conditions: 
> Record is active ("Active" box is checked) Assigned to a school, not the district office (school\_id = 0) status = 1

This can commonly happen starting July 1st when Clever begins pulling from the new school year. > - "The data in your most recent sync has changed significantly. To prevent unintended loss of data, we have not processed this sync. Please review the "Action Required: Clever Sync on Hold" email to resolve this hold.": Your district is currently on hold due to significant changes in data. text:
Title

Clever IDM: Exporting data to your SIS (also known as writeback)

URL Name

000001593

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001593?language=en_US#header1) 
2. [Default fields](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001593?language=en_US#header2) 
3. [Setting up writeback](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001593?language=en_US#header3)

Clever IDM allows sync data export via download and SFTP from the [User management > IDM > Exports tab](https://schools.clever.com/identity-management).

Using this feature, Clever IDM customers can write Clever IDM-generated data back to their SIS if their SIS can import CSV data. This provides another option for schools and can save Clever admin time.

---

The default fields exported from Clever to write back are Google email or AD/Entra ID userPrincipalName and passwords for any destination. Clever IDM export files include rows for all IDM-managed accounts by user type. Other fields may be available depending on your need. Please reach out to Clever Support and we may be able to help.

---

Follow these steps for setting up writeback to your SIS:

1. If exporting passwords, you must be using Clever IDM and have **Allow password export** enabled for each user type. This is configured in the **Set login credentials** step in the IDM wizard.

![Screenshot of the Allow password export box](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000St4n&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl0000009KPJ)

2. Enable **SFTP access for IDM exports** under the **Exports** tab in IDM.

![The Exports tab in Clever IDM](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000St4n&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl000001Da0I)

title: Clever IDM: Exporting data to your SIS (also known as writeback)
heading_path: Clever IDM: Exporting data to your SIS (also known as writeback)
**Remaining steps should be completed in your SIS**
section: **Remaining steps should be completed in your SIS**
text:
The specific steps to follow will depend on your SIS. We’ve included general information for SISes we know support imports or writeback, but this is not an exhaustive list. If unsure, your best bet is to contact your SIS directly.

**PowerSchool**

The best way to set up writeback with PowerSchool is using their Data Import Manager (DIM), which supports automated scheduled imports. You can find DIM in PowerSchool by going to **Data & Reporting > Imports.** Learn more about [PowerSchool DIM here](https://ps.powerschool-docs.com/pssis-admin/latest/data-import-manager).

If you do not need to writeback the Global ID or email fields, you can also use AutoComm instead of DIM. Learn more about [PowerSchool AutoComm here](https://ps.powerschool-docs.com/pssis-admin/latest/autocomm-setup). Clever will deliver AutoComm compliant files to the SFTP box in addition to the standard export files.

**Infinite Campus**

Reach out to the Infinite Campus [Technical Services](https://www.infinitecampus.com/services/technical-services) team to explore options for scheduled CSV imports.

**Alma**

Alma doesn't support regular automated imports from files sent to an SFTP folder, but they do support manual import via their import tool. As long as it’s a field in Alma’s import library for that entity, a Clever-formatted CSV can be used. For more information, be sure to reach out to their team directly.

If you know of any other SISes that support data imports, please let us know by contacting Clever Support and referencing this article! To contact Clever Support, click the chat icon in the bottom right corner and work through the prompts.

---

title: Single sign-on (SSO): Adding Google SSO applications
heading_path: Single sign-on (SSO): Adding Google SSO applications
text:
The Google SSO applications **require configuring a SAML connection** between your Clever account and your Google workspace. You can configure this SAML connection in 3 ways.

1. Setting up Clever as the organization-wide SSO Provider in your Google Admin Console. Learn about this setup in our article [Single Sign-On (SSO): Setting up Badges into Chromebooks and Chromebook logins with Clever as your organization-wide SSO Provider](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001541).
2. Setting up Clever an SSO Profile in Google. Learn about this setup in our article [Single Sign-On: Setting up Clever Badges and Chromebook logins with Clever as an SSO Profile in Google](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001645).
3. The **Google Workspace** app for districts with a Clever MFA subscription - see configuration instructions here: [For Clever Admins: Clever MFA Google Workspace SAML Setup Guide](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001572).

Setting up Clever as your organization-wide SSO provider is the simplest configuration. If you have not already set up one of the above SAML connections, you will need to do so before proceeding.

If you configure more than one SAML connection for different users, ensure that the [sharing permissions](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/203115007) for the **Chromebook Login for SSO Profiles** or **Google Workspace** apps match the OU enrollment in your Google workspace. The individual Google SSO apps will use the same SAML connection that is configured for that user. Only share Google SSO apps with users who have a SAML connection. You can share the Google SSO apps with all users that have a working SAML connection regardless of which SAML connection that user utilizes.

IMPORTANT If using on shared iOS devices with native Google apps, ensure that users explicitly log out of all Google accounts within the apps. If users do not explicitly log out, the Google session will remain accessible on the shared device within those apps.

---

title: Single sign-on (SSO): Adding Google SSO applications
heading_path: Single sign-on (SSO): Adding Google SSO applications
text:
Adding a Google SSO applications is easily done from your Clever Dashboard.

1. Go to the [Clever Dashboard > Applications > Add Applications](https://schools.clever.com/applications/add) page and search for the Google SSO application you’d like to add. Ensure that you are not selecting the *Saved Passwords* version of the application.

![Screenshot of adding a Google SAML application](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TXYT&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl000000GflZ)

2. Send the integration request.
3. Confirm that you have completed the SAML Connection.
4. The application should now have the status of Launched in the Applications table. Please see [this article](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360016204711) to understand the application's status.  Remember that your sharing rules for the application must include users in OUs managed by Clever in your Google Workspace in order for the logins to be successful.

---

title: Single sign-on (SSO): Adding Google SSO applications
heading_path: Single sign-on (SSO): Adding Google SSO applications
text:
**Why use Google SAML rather than a Saved Passwords version of the app?**

- The SAML app can be a better choice because:
 - With the SSO version, you don’t have to set up the user's credentials. Users are automatically logged in when they click on the icon in their Clever Portal.
 - With the SSO version, there is less room for error when users log in the first time.
 - SAML connections are a secure industry standard for performing SSO

**Is there ever a situation where we should choose the Saved Passwords version?**

- No. Once configured, the Google SSO apps provide a superior experience.

**Does this work with Clever's Google Workspace app, which is included with Clever MFA?**

- Yes. These Google SSO apps will work for any users who use the Clever Google Workspace app to access Google.

---

For school districts that use Clever Passwords to log in as well as another Identity Provider (IDP), you can use our [SSO Policy](https://schools.clever.com/instant-login/ssopolicy) to assign which users can use Clever Passwords as a login method and which users must use another IDP. This can be helpful for making sure your users are logging in with the method that you want them to use.

title: Clever IDM: Organizing OUs
text:
> Tip: Title Clever IDM: Organizing OUs URL Name 000001603 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Organize OUs          • Parent OU          • Sub-OUs          • Archive OUs          • Ignored OUs 3. Building sub-OUs
>  
> Overview
> This article will help you understand how Clever IDM organizes users into your existing Active Directory or Google OU structures, part of the IDM setup process. The organization of these is very similar for both destinations, Active Directory and Google. > You can find the general setup for each destination type here:
> Clever IDM: Google Setup Clever IDM: Active Directory Setup
>  
> Organize OUs
> OU stands for organizational unit, a group that an administrator can create in Active Directory or the Google Admin console to apply settings to a specific group of users, such as students or 7th graders. > Clever IDM will organize users into your existing OU structure and create optional sub-OUs based on Clever user data. A preview will populate, displaying the resulting OU structure based on your selections during setup. >  
> Parent OU
> Select the primary OU where all users for the user type should reside. In the next step, the school district can identify which sub-OUs Clever should create to organize students. Clever requirers the following OUs for Google and Active Directory:
> Parent OU for student users Parent OU for teacher users Parent OU for staff users Parent OU for archived users
> Sub-OUs
> Clever can create sub-OUs to organize users based on data in Clever, such as school, grade level, and graduation year. Please note that sub-OUs are not required. > Here are a few popular options: 
> Student sub-OUs:
> {School} {School} > {Grade} {School} > {Graduation year} {Grade} {Graduation year}
>   Graduation Year :  If synced to Clever, IDM will use the Graduation\_year field from the school district's SIS.

title: Clever IDM: Organizing OUs
text:
Otherwise, IDM will automatically calculate Graduation Year for students K-12 based on the student Grade field. In calculating graduation year, Preschool, PreKindergarten, and TransitionalKindergarten will be treated as grade -1. Kindergarten is treated as 0. >  
> Students in the following grade levels will NOT have a Graduation Year unless provided by the school district: InfantToddler, 13, PostGraduate, Ungraded, Other. > Teacher sub-OUs:
> {School} 
> Staff sub-OUs:
> {Department} {Job code} {custom formula}
> Clever recommends implementing sub-OUs to assist with organization and permissions. > Archive OUs
> Clever allows the school district to determine the parent OU where a user will be placed when an account is removed from Clever. If a user is removed from Clever, they will be placed in the Archive OU during the next Clever IDM sync. > If a user returns to Clever within one year of departure and is in an Archive OU:
> If a user returns to Clever within one year of departure and is in an Archive OU, Clever will restore their account and move it from the Archive OU to the appropriate active OU based on your Parent/Sub-OU settings. Clever will generate a new Clever account and Active Directory or Google account if a user returns after one year. >    Please note: For Google, Clever IDM will manage archival of users with any free Fundamentals, Fundamentals-archive, and Gmail-only licenses as specified in your Clever IDM archive OU setup . To manage users with paid licenses, please use the Google License Manager in your Clever Dashboard . >  
> How Clever IDM protects against the accidental archiving of multiple users by detecting unusual behavior:
> We calculate the percentage of users marked to be archived for each user type (e.g., students, teachers, and staff). If this percentage exceeds 20%, the archive will be automatically paused, and Clever admins will receive a notification. This notification will be visible in the IDM dashboard under the Tasks section.

title: Clever IDM: Organizing OUs
text:
Clever Admins review the users to determine whether or not the users should be archived. > Ignored OUs
> Ignored OUs are OUs in your destination (Active Directory and Google) that you want Clever to ignore. Clever won't move users out of these OUs and you'll manage them manually. You can use ignored OUs to impart more rigorous controls, such as applying settings for specific individuals or groups of users (for example you might have an ignored OU for users that blocks YouTube). Multiple OUs can be selected. > By default, Clever IDM will deactivate accounts once users are removed from Clever – unless they are within an ignored OU. The default behavior for users in ignored OUs is to ignore those accounts entirely. However, you can update this behavior as outlined below. > Clever IDM offers three options for student, teacher, and staff accounts in ignored OUs, giving you more flexibility. These options are available in the Organize OUs step of the IDM Provisioning Setup:
> When users are removed from Clever, automatically suspend user accounts in ignored OUs. > Clever IDM will update user accounts with this setting. > When users are removed from Clever, don’t automatically suspend user accounts in ignored OUs. > You’ll suspend these user accounts. > Don’t match, update, or suspend users in ignored OUs. I will manage these user accounts myself. > You’ll handle all updates for users in ignored OUs. >  
> Building sub-OUs
> Clever IDM can support OU modifications, which allow you to organize users based on data in Clever. The IDM format builder walks you through creating formats for sub-OUs. Please review our Clever IDM: Formulas article to learn more about using the format builder. >  
> To access the format builder for Clever IDM:
> Click on the Organize OUs step in the provisioning setup for Google or Active Directory. Click Edit in the OU for which you want to create a format. Click Next step in the blue box on the bottom right to get to the Build your format step.

title: Clever IDM: Organizing OUs
text:
Click Build your format to create sub-OUs. To learn more about your options with building a format, review our Clever IDM: Formulas article . You’ll have several options to build a format:
> Block builder
> Use a premade sub-OU format (can be edited) Build a sub-OU format using blocks
> Enter a format string (Advanced)  
> On the right, you can preview the data. If the format looks correct, click Save format . > Please note: The block builder approach for building formats doesn’t currently support extension fields or advanced use of functions. If you need to use your extension fields or write more complex functions that you know Clever supports but don’t see as an option, you’ll need to use the advanced option of entering a format string. See the Clever IDM: Formulas Help Center article for assistance with format strings. >

title: Clever IDM: Account links
text:
Title

Clever IDM: Account links

URL Name

000001604

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001604?language=en_US#header1) 
2. [Linking accounts between Clever and a destination](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001604?language=en_US#header2) 
3. [Common troubleshooting](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001604?language=en_US#header3)

Clever IDM account links are the glue that ties a Clever IDM account and a destination, such as Google, Active Directory, or Entra ID, together. When an IDM sync runs, we create a link between what's in Clever and what's in the destination and provision a destination account and email based on the Clever account.

---

title: Clever IDM: Account links
heading_path: Linking accounts between Clever and a destination
section: Linking accounts between Clever and a destination
text:
When an IDM sync runs, Clever creates a link between a Clever account and an account in either Google, AD, or Entra ID. If Clever IDM can't find an existing account with the relevant username or email address for a user, it will create a new account in the destination and link it to the corresponding account in Clever. 
Links are helpful in preventing issues. An example would be when a student graduates that happens to have the same username as an incoming freshman. For example:

1. User 1, jsmith graduates
2. User 2, jsmith is an incoming freshman
3. We don’t want user 2 taking over user 1’s Google account
4. Clever throws a conflict to flag this issue for the Clever admin

Without the links, we would erroneously automatically match Clever user 2 with the old jsmith account.

Occasionally, because of inaccurate data in Clever or a destination, Clever IDM will incorrectly link a Clever account to an account in a destination.

For instance, if a user's email syncs to Clever with a typo or it’s the incorrect email altogether. In such cases, the link connects that Clever user to the wrong email address.

When this happens, you can remove the link, fix the typo,  and run a new Clever IDM sync. You can remove the link by going to the Clever [Dashboard](https://schools.clever.com/) > User’s profile page > Details tab > Clever IDM Information box > click Unlink user.

![screenshot of Clever IDM info page](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000A8Qv&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl000000uyRJ)  
 As long as you correct the data in Clever and/or the destination, the new link will be correct.

The link creation lifecycle follows these steps:

title: Clever IDM: Account links
heading_path: Linking accounts between Clever and a destination
section: Linking accounts between Clever and a destination
text:
1. Clever IDM creates a link when we find a matching account in a destination or when it provisions a new one. 
 - Example: Joyce is a new student at the school district and her email address in Clever is provisioned in the destination and linked to her Clever account.
2. If your school district syncs the user's email and username from your SIS, the link is updated automatically if the username changes. If you rely on a template-generated username or email, you must unlink to create a new template-generated username or email.
 - Example: A student is adopted and now has a new last name. Their last name change alters their username and email. Their link is automatically updated since you’re syncing their username and email from the SIS!
3. If the Clever user is no longer in your SIS, we archive them via IDM.

If a user returns to Clever within one year of departure and is in an Archive OU, their Clever account will be restored**and** moved from the Archive OU to the appropriate active OU based on your Parent/Sub-OU settings.

If a user returns after one year, a new Clever and destination account will be generated.
 - Example: Joyce has the opportunity to be an exchange student for 6 months, so she leaves her school district temporarily. When she gets back, her account is restored.
4. Once they’re archived in IDM, the destination account as disabled.
5. If desired, you’ll need to delete the accounts manually
 - Example: A couple of years later, Joyce graduates. Many Clever admins keep graduated seniors in archive OUs for a few months after graduation before deleting them
6. Once the Clever user and the destination user are entirely deleted, we delete the link upon the next IDM sync.

---

title: Clever IDM: Account links
text:
Here are a few examples of some common issues:

- Issue: Resolution
- A user gets married, changes their name, and has a new email address. The link for that user is connected to the old email.: If your school district syncs the user's email and username from your SIS, the link is updated automatically if the username or email changes.
If you rely on a template-generated username or email, you must unlink to create a new template-generated username or email. 
Once updated, the account will be correctly linked after the next Clever IDM sync.
- There’s a typo in a user’s email that has been synced to Clever. Now that user is linked to the wrong email address.: If your school district syncs the user's email and username from your SIS, the link is updated automatically if the username or email changes.
If you rely on a template-generated username or email, you must unlink to create a new template-generated username or email. 
Once updated, the account will be correctly linked after the next Clever IDM sync.

---

> Overview
> The web upload tool now makes it easier to upload your schools' data to Clever by helping you match the columns in your files to the columns Clever requires, such as school\_id, using field mapping. A field mapping is when you assign the column headers you sync to Clever via CSV upload to a Clever field. You can associate a column header from your uploaded file to multiple required Clever fields. > For example, you could map your school number field to both School\_id and School\_number in Clever. Keep in mind that the reverse is not available, as you can’t associate a Clever field with multiple column headers. > This is a useful tool for districts that manage their Clever files and don’t have a way to edit the files they are uploading. For example, if you are using a SIS-Managed Auto Sync and your SIS is not able to edit a file header for you. Keep reading to learn how to upload your files with field mappings! >

> schools.csv
> teachers.csv
> students.csv
> sections.csv
> enrollments.csv
> staff.csv (optional)
> Make sure your files include all data that is marked as required for each file in the Clever SFTP Specifications. >

>  
>

text:
> Tip: Title For Clever Admins: Clever LMS Connect URL Name 000001609 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Features 3. Learn More 4. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
>  
> Overview
> Clever is excited to announce that we're offering a solution to districts that allows you to directly connect your LMS with Clever. Clever LMS Connect allows districts to launch applications directly from their LMS, save teachers time by eliminating grade double entry, and easily add application content and assignments to their LMS. >  
> Please note: As seen in the graphic above, LMS Connect does not connect your LMS to your SIS and vice versa. >  
> Features
> Clever LMS Connect connects learning applications to your LMS through the Clever API and creates a seamless learning experience for students and teachers by:
> Saving time: Teachers and students can launch applications directly from the LMS (compliant with LTI launch protocol requirements). > Eliminating grade double entry: Teachers can sync grades and assignments between your LMS and learning applications. > Adding content and assignments: Teachers can automatically insert content and assignments directly from applications into the LMS. This means that students can easily launch applications and find assignments in their LMS. > View the videos below to see the LMS Connect teacher and student experience. > Canvas
> Google Classroom
> Learn More
> Clever LMS Connect is available for free to districts, and will be available on a per-app basis as learning applications build their LMS Connect integrations. We encourage you to reach out to applications that you are already rostering through Clever, and let them know that you're interested in using Clever LMS Connect with their application. > If you're interested in partnering with Clever to be one of our first districts to implement LMS Connect, please fill out our  interest form .

title: For Clever Admins: Clever LMS Connect
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Clever LMS Connect

text:

title: What is SAML?
text:
Title

What is SAML?

URL Name

000001610

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001610?language=en_US#header1) 
2. [What is SAML?](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001610?language=en_US#header2) 
3. [How SAML works](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001610?language=en_US#header3) 
4. [How you can use SAML with Clever](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001610?language=en_US#header4)

This article will give you an overview of what SAML is and how to use it. By the way, SAML stands for Security Assertion Markup Language, in case you were wondering!

---

So technically, SAML is an open standard for exchanging authentication and authorization data between two parties. It’s commonly used for single sign-on (SSO), allowing users to sign in once and authenticate securely with multiple third-party applications. SAML is one of the methods Clever uses to help you access a variety of connected applications just by signing in to Clever!

---

title: What is SAML?
text:
Two primary roles in a SAML exchange are Service Providers (SP) and Identity Providers (IdP).

- **Service Providers**: SPs are services or applications (like BrainPOP or Remind) that users want to access. Service Providers coordinate with Identity Providers to authorize and grant access to those services or apps.
- **Identity Providers**: IdPs (like Active Directory or Google) authenticate the user (making sure you’re you!) and share authorization information with SPs. Identity Providers package the users' information into a well-known format known as a SAML Assertion.

The thing to know about SAML is that both SPs or IdPs can kick off the sign-in process into an app; it just depends on where you, as the user, visit first:

- If you visit the application first, the application (or SP in SAML terms) will ask the Identity Provider for information about the user and then use that information to process the login, essentially asking the Identity Provider if you’re legit.
- If you first visit an SSO application (or IdP like the Clever Portal) and then navigate to an application from a list of approved applications, the IdP will forward information to the Service Provider, giving them a heads up that you’re who you say you are.

To illustrate this, let’s look at the following scenario: 
You’re attending the Educators of the Year conference (yay, you!). When you arrive, you need to pick up your attendance badge and a color-coded lanyard to allow you into specific sessions at the conference.

![Illustration of service providers and identity providers sign-in process](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TmPR&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl000001js5J)

You can get your badge and lanyard in one of two ways.

title: What is SAML?
text:
**Option 1**: **Check in, then go to the venue for your session (like going through an IdP and then a Service Provider/app)** 
Checking in to the event involves contacting the event coordinators, who then verify registration and put together a packet with your badge and lanyard.  
 **Option 2:** **Head to the venue and get checked in (like going to the Service Provider/app, and having it verify you via an IdP)**

Alternatively, you can check in at the venue, which then contacts the event coordinators who verify your registration.

Regardless of the check-in method, the result remains the same- your registration is verified, and you have the necessary badge and lanyard to participate in the sessions. 
In this scenario, the event coordinator acts as the Identity Provider while the venue acts as the Service Provider. The packet put together by the event coordinator is similar to the SAML assertion. You have two options for checking in. The first method, early check-in, is similar to the IdP-initiated flow. The second method, checking in at the venue, is similar to the SP-initiated flow.

---

You can add any SAML connection as an IdP into Clever! We offer support for Active Directory Federation Services  (AD and Entra ID), Okta, and Rapid ID. However, any SAML connection can be created by following the same steps outlined in [this article](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/218050687). Clever won’t have insight into the IdP other than those we offer support for.

---

title: For Clever Admins: Classroom MFA Overview
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Classroom MFA Overview
text:
Classroom Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)  is a second layer of security for Clever without a second device. Classroom MFA protects applications that use Clever for single sign-on with age-appropriate second factors like Clever Badges or login pictures. This includes the Clever Portal, Google Workspace, and Google Chromebooks. This solution helps districts stay ahead of cybersecurity threats without disrupting learning.

![Classroom MFA protection flow chart](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000WLvl&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000FZtgx)

By providing a dual layer of authentication, Classroom MFA can help you meet cybersecurity insurance requirements and worry less about compromised credentials for your students, teachers, and instructional staff. As a bonus, Classroom MFA helps increase students' digital citizenship skills as they navigate our digital environments in a way that's safe and responsible.

Classroom MFA works by requiring a second factor of authentication for students and teachers via Clever Badges, pictures, authenticator apps, SMS, voice calls, or biometrics/hardware tokens, for any Clever-based SSO login. With the ability to require re-authentication for login attempts outside your designated country or network, rest assured potential bad actors will hit your MFA wall and get turned away.

![Clever MFA allows picture logins and Badges for students](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000WLvl&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl000005kDDt)

---

This is a way for your students and teachers to securely MFA into Clever to protect all of your Clever applications without the requirement of a second device. Classroom MFA protects the Clever portal for your users. Any application that a student or teacher accesses from the Clever portal will have a layer of protection.

Classroom MFA currently supports the following factors:

- Picture logins (students only)
- Clever Badges
- PIN (students only)
- Authenticator app
- Text message (SMS)
- Voice call
- Biometrics or security key

---

For more information on pricing, please contact our team [here](https://www.clever.com/security-consultation).

Districts can preview Classroom MFA before purchasing [here in your Clever Dashboard](https://schools.clever.com/mfa)!  After completing the configuration and viewing a free preview, IT administrators can purchase Classroom MFA directly in the Clever App Store.

Clever’s digital learning platform (including single sign-on, rostering, messaging, and analytics) remains completely free for districts.

---

You can learn how to get started with Classroom MFA by checking out our article [For Clever Admins: Classroom MFA Setup](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001625) or connecting with one of our cybersecurity specialists here: <https://www.getclever.com/mfa-contact-a-specialist>

---

title: For Clever Admins: Classroom MFA Overview
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Classroom MFA Overview
text:
**How is Classroom MFA different from other MFA options on the market available?**

- Most MFA solutions available on the market are not designed for the classroom and require a second device to be present with their user. Classroom MFA eliminates the need for a second device making it accessible to teachers and students.

**Will Classroom MFA work for my staff users?**

- Yes, your staff will be protected for any applications that are accessed only via single sign-on through Clever. If you would like to learn more or have other requirements for staff users, please connect with a cybersecurity specialist here: <https://www.getclever.com/mfa-contact-a-specialist>

**Can students use the same Clever Badge they already use to log into Clever as their MFA Badge method login?**

- No, a Clever Badge and MFA Badge are not the same thing. For maximum security, we strongly recommend that districts assign an alternative MFA factor for students who already Badge into Clever.

**Which applications are covered by Classroom MFA?**

- Classroom MFA will cover all Single Sign-on (SSO) and Rostering & Single Sign-on (SSO) applications. This includes the Clever Portal, Google Workspace, and Google Chromebooks.

**How can Classroom MFA protect Google?**

- Classroom MFA can protect Google through the Workspace application. Learn how to set up the Workspace app to protect Google for your district [here](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001572?language=en_US)!

**How often will students, teachers, or staff be asked to use their second method of authentication?**

- During the MFA configuration process, you'll be able to choose to have users re-authenticate every time they login, every 7 days, or every 30 days. You can also add IP addresses for secure networks (such as your school network) on which you can choose to never require a second factor.

**Can I turn off teacher troubleshooting tools for Classroom MFA?**

- If you configure Classroom MFA for students, teachers will have some tools available in their Portal to troubleshoot login issues for students. For example, teachers can reveal student MFA pictures or reset them. It is not possible to turn off teacher troubleshooting tools for Classroom MFA at this time.

**Can students use Classroom MFA when logging into a Chromebook with a Clever Badge?**

- Yes! Check out the video below to see what the login flow looks like:

> There is a default auto-generated district office in Clever. To associate a staff member with the district office, enter the school\_id: DEFAULT\_DISTRICT\_OFFICE
>  
> Editing & removing staff or updating their roles
> From your Clever Dashboard, select  Data sources > SIS sync > Upload tab. Under Download existing files, select staff.csv. The downloaded staff.csv   file will contain all pre-existing staff in Clever for your district. Edit the records for staff as desired and save the file. Next, upload the file. When the cloud displays as green, select  Upload.

This feature provides schools with an SFTP directory that can accept a staff.csv file. Clever will use this staff.csv file as the source of truth, as this file will supersede any SIS-synced staff data. Utilizing your SIS sync or Custom data are preferred methods for syncing staff and you should only use this solution if you want to automate staff via SFTP that supersedes your SIS. To activate this feature, reach out to our support team. Once activated, you’ll see SFTP credentials on your SIS sync page under the Staff tab for you to use, as shown below. Once you have the SFTP credentials, you can use an FTP client like Filezilla , or WinSCP , to upload your staff.csv file to the preferred-sis-data directory in your SFTP box. > IMPORTANT: If you upload your staff.csv file to a directory other than preferred-sis-data, your data will not process, and you will not receive an error message. See this article   to learn more about sync pauses. In this article, you can learn more about what Classroom MFA is and how to use it when logging in. If you are experiencing any other type of issue, please reach out to your teacher.

---

Classroom MFA is a way to safely log into your Clever account using two different login methods (or factors) to prove that you are logging into the correct account. Classroom MFA may require you to use any of the following options:

- Picture logins
- Clever Badges
- PIN (6 digits)
- Authenticator app
- Text message (SMS)
- Voice call
- Biometrics or security key

section: How do I use Classroom MFA?
text:
There are a few different login methods (factors) that you may be asked to use. Here are the general steps that you should follow. [Click here](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001618?language=en_US#header4) to learn about Classroom MFA login pictures, [or click here](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001618?language=en_US#setbadge) to learn about Classroom MFA Badges.

1. Go to your school or district's login screen (For example: [Clever.com/in/district-URL](http://Clever.com/in/district-URL)) and sign in the way you normally do.
2. You'll be prompted to set up Classroom MFA.
3. Once you have set up Classroom MFA you can use Clever as you normally would! Don’t forget what you set up - Clever may ask you again on every time you log in, every seven days, or every 30 days depending on your school’s requirements.

text:
> Tip: Title For Teachers & Staff: Setting up Classroom MFA URL Name 000001619 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. What's Classroom MFA? 3. Setting up Classroom MFA 4. Adding authentication methods 5. Using Classroom MFA after setup
> Please note: If you’re an admin trying to set up Classroom MFA for your teachers and staff, please reference this article . > Overview
> This article has information for teachers and staff on setting up Clever’s Classroom Multi-Factor Authentication (Classroom MFA). As an optional add-on feature, Clever offers districts Classroom MFA for short to provide an extra layer of security for teacher and student logins. > You’ll only have access to Classroom MFA if your district has added it to your district Clever account. > For information on how to help your student’s set up their Classroom MFA, please see our article For Teachers: Helping your students set up and troubleshoot Classroom MFA . > What's Classroom MFA? > MFA is a way to log in to programs that requires you to use two methods (or factors) to prove your identity, like your username and password on your computer and a text message code sent to your phone. You likely already use MFA when signing in to other programs, such as your online bank account. >  
> Clever’s Classroom Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) creates a second layer of security for student and teacher accounts without the need for a second device. This will help you to protect sensitive information through secured access without disrupting learning in your classroom.

title: For Teachers & Staff: Setting up Classroom MFA
heading_path: For Teachers & Staff: Setting up Classroom MFA
section: For Teachers & Staff: Setting up Classroom MFA
text:
>  
> Classroom MFA works by requiring a second factor of authentication for students and teachers using one of the following options that has been pre-selected by your district: 
> Picture logins (students only) Clever Badges PIN (students only) Authenticator app Text message (SMS) Voice call Biometrics or security key
>  
> Setting up Classroom MFA
> Go to your school or district's login screen (For example: Clever.com/in/district-URL ) and sign in the way you normally do. You'll be prompted to set up Clever Classroom MFA. > You’ll be presented with one or more authentication methods. Read more about authentication methods below. Choose a method and click Next step . > Follow the instructions to set up the authentication method. You can learn more about authentication options below. > Once you’ve finished the instructions, click Exit settings . > Optional: If your district offers more than one authentication method, you can click Set up another method to add another authentication option. > Adding authentication methods
> Reminder: Authentication methods are used to prove your identity. You must add at least one authentication method to use Classroom MFA. >  
> It is best practice to add multiple methods if your school has made other options available to you. This way, if you’re not able to use one method for any reason (e.g. your cell phone is not charged so you can’t get a text message ) you can use another method to successfully log in. This saves time by providing an alternative method for yourself. >  
> Text message (also called SMS) 
> A numeric code is texted to a cell phone number you chose; you can type this code into your Clever login screen. Setup tips:
> Make sure the number you add when setting up Classroom MFA will go to a phone you can access during the school day, as you’ll need the code texted to this number to log in to Clever. Also, keep in mind that this will not work for a landline.

title: For Teachers & Staff: Setting up Classroom MFA
heading_path: For Teachers & Staff: Setting up Classroom MFA
section: For Teachers & Staff: Setting up Classroom MFA
text:
If you can only access a landline, consider an automated voice phone call. >  
> Automated voice phone call  
> A numeric code is shared via an automated voice phone call to a number you choose (can be a landline or cell phone); you then type this code into your Clever login screen. Setup tips:
> This will trigger a phone call to the number you added, so ensure you’ll be able to answer the phone and hear the code shared. >  
> Mobile app 
> You install an app on a cell phone that provides you with a numeric code you type into your Clever login screen. Setup tips:
> To access this option, you’ll need to install an authenticator app (such as Google Authenticator or Authy) to a mobile device or tablet and follow the Classroom MFA setup steps in Clever. Be sure you can access this  device during the school day. You’ll need to scan a QR code, so ensure the camera works on the device. Authenticator applications work without requiring cell service or network so this is still a great option if you have cell service concerns. >  
> Setup steps, Google Authenticator App: If your district uses the Microsoft Authenticator App, please see the directions here . > On your cell phone , install the app by searching “Google Authenticator App” in the Google Play Store (Android) or the App Store (Apple). The app icon looks like this:
> You can also click the links below to access the download page for the apps, but be sure to download the app onto your phone or mobile device , not on your computer:
>       
> On your computer , open the Classroom MFA setup steps (this will show up after you attempt to log in to Clever), or, if you’re already logged in, go to the top right corner of your Clever screen and click the person icon (👤), then MFA settings . > In the Classroom MFA setup directions, choose the App authentication method and click Next step until you see the QR code (it looks like a square bar code). > From your phone , open the authenticator app and select Scan a QR code .

heading_path: For Teachers & Staff: Setting up Classroom MFA
section: For Teachers & Staff: Setting up Classroom MFA
text:
You may need to grant permission for the app to use your device’s camera. > Scan the QR code on the computer screen using your device’s camera. > After scanning the code, click Next step on your computer. > On your device , the app will provide you with a code. On your computer , type this code into the provided space on the Classroom MFA setup screen. > Click Done . > Click Exit settings . You’re all set. > After this initial setup, when prompted to use Classroom MFA, you won’t need to scan a QR code: you’ll just open the Google Authenticator App and tap on the account you added . You’ll be provided with a numeric code to type into Clever. The code will change every 30 seconds. >  
> Setup steps, Microsoft Authenticator App: If your district uses the Google Authenticator App, please see the directions here . > On your cell phone or mobile device , install the app by searching “Microsoft Authenticator App” in the Google Play Store (Android) or the App Store (Apple). The app icon looks like this:
> You can also click the links below to access the download page for the apps, but be sure to download the app onto your mobile device, not on your computer. >      
> On your computer , open the Classroom MFA setup steps (this will show up after you attempt to log in to Clever), or, if you’re already logged in, go to the top right corner of your Clever screen and click the person icon (👤), then MFA settings . > In the Classroom MFA setup directions, choose the App authentication method and click Next step until you see the QR code. > From your mobile device , open the authenticator app, and review any user/privacy terms. If prompted to log in, you can press Skip in the top right corner (unless you have an account your district has given you directions to log into). > Press the Add account button, then Work or school account , then select Scan a QR code . You may need to grant permission for the app to use your device’s camera.

title: For Teachers & Staff: Setting up Classroom MFA
heading_path: For Teachers & Staff: Setting up Classroom MFA
section: For Teachers & Staff: Setting up Classroom MFA
text:
> Scan the QR code on the computer screen using your device’s camera. > After scanning the code, click Next step on your computer. > On your mobile device , select the account you’ve just added, and the app will provide you with a code. On your computer , type this code into the provided space on the Classroom MFA setup screen. > Click Done . > Click Exit settings . You’re all set. > After this initial setup, when prompted to use Classroom MFA, you won’t need to scan a QR code: you’ll just open the Microsoft Authenticator App and tap on the account you added. You’ll be provided with a numeric code to type into Clever. The code will change every 30 seconds. > Biometrics or security key  
> You use a scanner on your device (like Apple Touch ID or Windows Hello) or an external device (like a Yubikey) to verify your identity. Setup tips:
> To access this option, you’ll need either a scanner on your device, or a physical key that your district provides each time you need to verify your identity with Classroom MFA. You can set up up to 4 biometrics or security keys (e.g., TouchID, FaceID, or 2 Yubikeys). > Setup steps:
> From the Classroom MFA setup screen, select Security Key. > You may see a prompt from your computer asking you which option you’d like. Select USB security key (or similar, the exact wording varies by device). > Insert your Security key into your device. You may be asked to place your fingerprint on the key. > Classroom MFA will verify the biometric or security key and then verify that setup is complete. > Click Done. > Click Exit settings. You’re all set. > After this initial setup, when prompted to use Classroom MFA, you’ll simply verify your identity by using the biometric or security (such as scanning your finger, plugging in the Yubikey, etc.)
>  
> Badges
> You scan a printed QR code via a device camera as a second factor after you have provided your password. > Setup tip:
> You do not need  a printer to download and use your MFA Badge!

title: For Teachers & Staff: Setting up Classroom MFA
heading_path: For Teachers & Staff: Setting up Classroom MFA
section: For Teachers & Staff: Setting up Classroom MFA
text:
You can download your MFA Badge as a PDF, take a picture of it on your mobile device or print it. > Setup steps:
> Go to your school or district's login screen (For example: Clever.com/in/district-URL ) and sign in the way you normally do. > Select Badge  
> Click Download and print Badge (Remember our setup tip - you don’t need a printer!)
> Once you have secured your Badge, click Next Step
> Hold up your newly downloaded Clever MFA Badge to the camera. > You should now be logged into your Portal! >  
> Security tips for Badges:
> Never post a picture of your Badge on social media  Don't leave your Badge unattended When not using your Badge put it in a secured area If you think your badge may have been compromised, void your Badge immediately and print a new one. > Voiding and printing Badges There are two ways to void a Badge:
> If a teacher or staff user has more than one MFA method set up, they can delete the Badge themselves from their portal: Teacher Portal > MFA settings > click on Badge under Your authentication methods > click Remove . If a teacher or staff user only has the Badge setup and no other MFA method, then they will need to contact their Clever Admin to reset MFA configurations for the user. >  
> Teachers and staff users can not reprint the same Badge. They need to go through the process above and click  Remove to remove the Badge from MFA Settings, and then confirm that the Badge should be removed. > Then click Add method and add a replacement Badge. >  
> Using Classroom MFA after setup
> After following the setup steps above, your district decides how frequently you’ll need to verify your identity using the additional method(s) you set up. Currently, your district can require one of the following:
> MFA is required every time you sign in to Clever MFA is required once every seven days MFA is required once every 30 days.

>   If your district has set Classroom MFA to be required every seven or 30 days, you can click the Remember me for {#} days checkbox when logging in via Classroom MFA, as shown in the screenshot below. >  
> Whenever you are required to use Classroom MFA (be that every time, or every seven or 30 days), you’ll need access to one of the methods you set up, be that your mobile device, a landline number you used to set up voice calls with, or your security key. You won’t be able to access your Clever account if you don’t have access to one of the method(s) you use to set up MFA if you are prompted to use MFA. If this happens, click the Problems with MFA? button to access information on contacting your IT team for a bypass verification code.

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001621?language=en_US#header1)

Edtech vendors play a key role in supporting comprehensive school security. However, for K-12 administrators—especially those managing tech responsibilities alone—vetting vendors for data security can pose a challenge.

To support administrators in this process, we rely on trusted experts. This article provides you with neutral third-party security rubrics to help you select vendors with a cybersecurity-focused mindset.

---

title: For Clever Admins: Neutral Third-Party Security Rubrics
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Neutral Third-Party Security Rubrics
text:
It is important for every school district to develop policies and priorities that best suit your district. We recommend using rubrics created by neutral third parties, such as the [Consortium for School Networking](https://www.cosn.org/about/) (CoSN) and the [Cybersecurity Infrastructure and Security Agency](https://www.cisa.gov/about) (CISA):

- [CoSN: K-12CVAT: K-12 Community Vendor Assessment Tool](https://www.cosn.org/tools-and-resources/resource/k-12cvat/)
- [CoSN: Cybersecurity toolkit on authentication management](https://www.cosn.org/tools-and-resources/resource/k12-cybersecurity-toolkit-authentication-management/)
- [CoSN: NIST Cybersecurity Framework Resources Alignment for K-12](https://www.cosn.org/edtech-topics/cybersecurity/cosns-nist-cybersecurity-framework-resources-alignment-for-k-12/)
- [CoSN + CISA: Online Cybersecurity Toolkit](https://www.cisa.gov/protecting-our-future-cybersecurity-k-12)
- [CISA: Online Toolkit: Partnering to Safeguard K-12 Organizations from Cybersecurity Threats](https://www.cisa.gov/online-toolkit-partnering-safeguard-k-12-organizations-cybersecurity-threats)

Clever has a close partnership with CoSN, and we’ll continue to support the creation of neutral third-party rubrics to provide districts with unbiased evaluation sources. Discover key steps to select edtech vendors with a cybersecurity focus to help protect student data on Clever’s Blog: [K-12 Administrator guide to evaluating edtech vendor security](https://www.clever.com/blog/2024/01/edtech-vendor-security).

---

Clever is proud to join forces with the White House and the Cybersecurity Infrastructure and Security Agency (CIS) by signing the Secure by Design Pledge. We’re committed to supporting a secure, interoperable digital learning ecosystem and providing free and low-cost resources to school districts that strengthen cybersecurity. Learn more about our commitments [here](https://www.clever.com/secure-by-design-pledge).

You can also learn more about Clever’s comprehensive security program in our [Trust Center](https://www.clever.com/trust).
