title: For Clever Admins: Classroom MFA setup
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Classroom MFA setup
section: For Clever Admins: Classroom MFA setup
text:
> Tip: Title For Clever Admins: Classroom MFA setup URL Name 000001625 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Getting started         •   Step 1: Select users who will be required to use MFA         •   Step 2: Select MFA methods         •   Step 3: Configure MFA settings         •   Step 4: Set Policy name         •   Step 5: Preview and complete MFA configuration 3. Exploring the MFA Dashboard         •    Managing Classroom MFA Badges 4. User self-enrollment
> Overview
> This article walks through the setup process for Classroom MFA. > For more information on how Classroom MFA works, pricing, and FAQs, please refer to  this Help Center article. If you are interested protecting Google through the Workspace application, please refer to this Setup Guide . > For more robust information, including teacher training resources and email templates to roll out Classroom MFA, we recommend going through our Clever Academy Classroom MFA Quick Start Guide . >  
>  
> Getting started
> You can begin setting up Classroom MFA right in your Clever Dashboard. Click here to jump right in and start your first MFA policy setup. >  
> In this guide, we'll mention end-users. End-users are people who will use MFA while accessing Clever, like students, teachers, or instructional staff. >  
> Step 1: Select users who will be required to use MFA:
> By Group
> Students
> All students Students by schools, grades, and/or groups (IEP or ELL status)
> Teachers
> All Teachers Teachers by schools
> All Staff
> Or by specific users
>  
> Classroom MFA can be set up with unique policies that you can combine subsets of users in. For your first policy, you may want to start with a small subset of test users rather than all teachers or staff. However, the decision is up to you. Learn about the differences between Staff and Teacher users here . District administrators also have some MFA options natively built into Clever, which you can read about here.

title: For Clever Admins: Classroom MFA setup
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Classroom MFA setup
section: For Clever Admins: Classroom MFA setup
text:
> Step 2: Select MFA methods
> You can choose multiple MFA methods for your end users to choose from. When an end user (e.g. teacher) sets up their MFA, they'll get a list of possible MFA methods to set up. In this step, you'll define what MFA methods will be displayed as possible methods to an end user. It’s a good practice to have at least one other authentication method available to users so they can have a backup method. This way, if they are not able to use one method for any reason (e.g. their cell phone is not charged) they can use a backup method to successfully log in. This saves time by providing an alternative to users. > Picture Logins
> End-user uses two pictures that they select to verify their identity. Pictures can vary for age group. Younger students can utilize cartoon images, and older students can use realistic pictures. During policy setup, you'll choose which images the policy will use. This method is only permitted for students. Recommended for K-6 students, as it is easy to use. This option does not require a second device. Clever tip: You can set up separate MFA policies for students in younger grades and older grades (ex: K-2 and 3-6) to customize which login pictures students can utilize. > Badges
> End-user scans a printed or downloaded QR code via a device camera as a second factor after they provide their password. Recommended for students in grades 7-12. It pairs well with a password as the first authentication method. Recommended for teachers as a non-phone alternative. This option doesn't require a second device. Clever admins can bulk print student MFA Badges via the MFA Dashboard. Admins cannot print teacher MFA Badges. Teachers can manage MFA Badges for their students right from their Teacher Portal. Find out more  here . > Please note: If your students already use a Clever Badge to SSO into Clever , we advise against using the MFA Badge as well because it will result in needing two badges to log into Clever.

title: For Clever Admins: Classroom MFA setup
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Classroom MFA setup
section: For Clever Admins: Classroom MFA setup
text:
This is less secure than a Badge + other authentication method. > PIN
> End user sets their own PIN by entering a 6-digit PIN code that they select to verify their identity. For security reasons, students cannot use use their ID number, birthday, sequential numbers (e.g., 123456, 678901), or repetitive digits (e.g. 000000, 111111). Attempting to use an ID number, birthday, sequential or repetitive digits will surface an error during setup that states, “PIN is too weak.” This method is only permitted for students. Recommended for students in grades 4-8. This option doesn’t require a second device. Teachers can help manage MFA PINs for their students right from their Teacher Portal. Learn more here . > Mobile app
> End-user uses an app that generates a verification code - a Time-based One-Time Password (TOTP). They'll use this code to verify their identity during MFA. Choose an app that you recommend your end user should use to generate verification codes:
> Google Authenticator or Microsoft Microsoft Authenticator
> Authenticator apps are not dependent on wifi or internet networks to generate codes so these are great options for those with network concerns. We recommend using this method as it has a good combination of security strength and convenience. > App-based token
> End-user uses an app that generates a verification code - a Time-based One-Time Password (TOTP). They'll use this code to verify their identity during MFA. Choose an app that you recommend your end-user should use to generate verification codes:
> Google Authenticator or Microsoft Authenticator
> We recommend using this method as it has a good combination of security strength and convenience. > Biometrics or security key (e.g., Apple Touch ID, Windows Hello, Yubikey) 
> End user uses a physical hardware key that plugs into the user device or is included in the device for authentication. Please note that Clever does not provide or re-sell hardware tokens. These must be district-provided.

title: For Clever Admins: Classroom MFA setup
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Classroom MFA setup
section: For Clever Admins: Classroom MFA setup
text:
> Text message 
> End user provides a phone number and receives a verification code by text message (SMS). Text message does not support International numbers. > Voice Call
> End user provides a phone number and receives a verification code through an automatic voice message (call). Voice phone numbers support extensions. Voice phone numbers do not support international numbers. > Step 3: Configure MFA settings
> Enforcement date (required)
> End users will be prompted while logging into Clever to set up MFA two weeks before the enforcement date. They can skip the MFA setup until the enforcement date. After that, an end user will be required to set up MFA before being able to access Clever. When you select Skip enforcement date , it will make MFA optional for end users. They can set up MFA within their own profile settings but won’t be required to add it. If you’re testing Classroom MFA, you’ll want to set the enforcement date within two weeks of when you want your test policy users to get set up, so it automatically triggers their enrollment. > Re-authentication frequency (required)
> Select how often a user will be prompted to MFA while logging into Clever:
> Every time - If the user is on a shared device and is signed out from Clever, they will be required to use Classroom MFA every time they log in to Clever. However, if they are using a 1:1 device, they will only need to authenticate once every 24 hours when this option is selected. Every 7 days - end user will use MFA every 7 days to log in to Clever. Every 30 days - end user will use MFA every 30 days to log in to Clever. Never (on a secure network) - you can define secure networks (such as your school network) where users are exempt from MFA during login. If logging in outside of these networks, users will be prompted for MFA every time they login. > Optionally, you can add more conditions to the “Every 7-day” and “Every 30 days” settings by clicking Advanced settings .

title: For Clever Admins: Classroom MFA setup
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Classroom MFA setup
section: For Clever Admins: Classroom MFA setup
text:
> In Advanced settings, you'll define safe zones, where the end user will use MFA every X days to log in. End users outside defined safe zones must re-authenticate every time. To define a safe zone use:
> Trusted user locations. Select country(s) where end users can log in every X days. User new location. When an end user logs in from a new location, they must log in with MFA. Trusted networks. Specify networks with CIDR blocks where end users can log in every X days. > Please note: If you configure multiple MFA policies, after setup you will be able to rearrange policies by dragging and dropping to sort by order of preferred precedence. >  
> Guardian support
> You can allow guardians to receive a one-time MFA bypass code via email to bypass the student’s MFA if a student forgets their second factor. We only recommend enabling this feature if your district syncs accurate guardian contact emails to Clever. You can review the guardian information syncing to Clever via the Clever Dashboard > Data Browser > Contacts tab. > Step 4: Set Policy name
> On this page you will name your policy. We recommend choosing a distinctive name and adding a description to describe the policy that you just set up. > Step 5: Preview and complete MFA configuration
> On this page is a summary of all the selections you have made in previous steps. We recommend checking if everything is correct. If yes, complete your MFA configuration. You can always come back and edit your MFA configuration. >  
> That’s it! You’ve configured Classroom MFA. Congratulations on securing authentication for classrooms with Clever! >  
> Exploring the MFA dashboard
> After completing setup, we recommend you check out the MFA dashboard, where you can:
> Get an overview of MFA status, the number of end-users who were assigned to use MFA, and the number of end-users who activated and didn’t activate MFA.

title: For Clever Admins: Classroom MFA setup
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Classroom MFA setup
section: For Clever Admins: Classroom MFA setup
text:
> Access detailed MFA end-user list and MFA configuration
> Add a new MFA Policy and reorder existing policies based on preferred precedence
> Print student's Classroom MFA Badges in bulk
> Edit your MFA configuration
> Managing Classroom MFA Badges
> If you configure Classroom MFA Badges as an authentication option, there are a few methods for managing the creation and distribution of Badges:
> During the self-enrollment process outlined below, users can take a picture of or print their MFA Badge. > Teachers can print, void, and generate student MFA Badges via their Portal troubleshooting tools. > Clever admins can print, void, and generate student MFA Badges in bulk via the MFA Dashboard. Admins cannot print Teacher MFA Badges. >   To manage student Badges in bulk:
> Navigate to your Clever Dashboard > Authentication > Classroom MFA page. Click the Download all MFA Badges button to download MFA Badges for all policies. To download MFA Badges for a specific policy, navigate to the policy and then select the Download MFA Badges button. You will only see the option to Download MFA Badges if the policy includes Badges as an MFA method for students. Your next steps will vary based on the current state of your student’s MFA Badges. > If you have not generated student MFA Badges before, you’ll see the setup below to download all new student MFA Badges. If some students have existing MFA Badges, and there are new students needing MFA Badges, you’ll see the checkbox below to Only create Badges for students who haven’t set up Badges yet . If you check the box and click Download all new MFA Badges it will only generate new MFA Badges for students who haven’t had an MFA Badge previously created. If you do not check the box and click Download all new MFA Badges , all existing student MFA Badges will be voided, and new Badges will be generated for all students.

title: Clever + Great Minds® Setup Guide
text:
> Tip: Title Clever + Great Minds® Setup Guide URL Name 000001626 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Onboarding Steps 3. Required Data 4. Accessing Great Minds via Clever 5. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
>  
> Overview
> Great Minds supports Single Sign-On (SSO) and Rostering integrations with Clever. > Single Sign-On (SSO) : Users can access their Great Minds products anytime using their Clever login credentials. Rostering :  District administrators can manage and update user and roster information in their SIS that syncs to Clever. Clever data syncs nightly with Great Minds. > Onboarding Steps
> Your Great Minds Digital Implementation Specialist will send you an invitation to our Great Minds Application via Clever. If you don’t see an invitation, you can send a request to our application. When you accept the invitation, please share only schools and sections that will be utilizing Great Minds products. This can be done through Clever sharing rules . Once you’ve launched your district and shared your data with Great Minds, their Digital Implementation Support team will complete your onboarding. Your designated Digital Administrator will receive an email when your onboarding is complete. Note: Users do not get an email once they have been rostered in Great Minds. Please distribute this information to the users in your organization. >  Required Data
> Great Minds requires the following data from Clever to roster users in our digital platforms:
> - Required Field: Required Metadata
> - District: Name
> - School: Name
> - Student: First Name Last Name Grade District School(s) Student ID: Can contain alphanumeric characters and underscores only. Cannot contain spaces. > - Teacher, School Admin, District Admin: First Name Last Name Teacher/Staff ID (see sis\_id, below) Email: Can contain alphanumeric characters and the following supported characters only: + = , . @ and -.

title: Clever + Great Minds® Setup Guide
text:
> - User sis\_ids: sis\_id maps to Student ID, Teacher ID, and Staff ID in Clever. sis\_id's for users are required and must :
> Be unique in your district for all user roles Never be changed Never be reused for different users Only contain alphanumeric characters and underscores (no spaces)
> If you need to change a user's sis\_id or reuse a sis\_id (not recommended), contact your Great Minds Digital Implementation Specialist to work with them to implement this change. > - Section: district, school, name, grade, primary teacher, students
> Each class is assigned a unique Section\_id in Clever. The section\_id must remain the same throughout the school year to avoid deleting existing sections and creating new sections in Clever and Great Minds. >  
> Please note: Data in Great Minds reflects the data synced from your SIS and shared via Clever. Historical data in Great Minds is retained through the persistence of local IDs (sis\_ids) that generate globally unique Clever IDs. Changing local IDs (sis\_ids) in your SIS will result in the deletion of existing records and the creation of new records in Clever and Great Minds. To ensure that historical data is maintained in Great Minds throughout a given school year, districts are encouraged to use stable/consistent IDs for all records (student, section, teacher) that require data retention in Great Minds. If you anticipate sis\_ids changing throughout the school year, please contact Clever Support to discuss the change. >  
> Accessing Great Minds via Clever
> If your District uses Clever access to the Great Minds platform, you may log in using one of the following two options: Option 1: Log in through the Clever website
> Choose your role. Find your District. Sign in using your Clever integration method (email or badge). Locate and launch the Great Minds application. > Option 2: Log in through the Great Minds Digital website
> Navigate to digital.greatminds.org . Select the Clever button.

title: Clever + Great Minds® Setup Guide
text:
Enter your School Name and select the correct school from the drop-down menu. Enter your login credentials or select an alternate login method (e.g., Google) to access your account. > Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
> Does Great Minds support multi-role users? > Yes. Great Minds supports multiple roles for staff users only (not students). Either using your SIS import or Custom Data through Clever, a user needs two roles and will need to be rostered as two separate users with the following information:
> Each entry must have different sis\_ids. Each entry needs to be the same email. Each entry has different roles. Each role should link to the same Clever User ID. > Can we access sync reports to help us correct any rostering/data errors? > Yes. Clever sync reports can be accessed by administrators in the Manage application in their Great Minds account. See Clever Sync Reports on the Great Minds Help Center for more information. > Can I add users that are not in my rostering data source (SIS)? > Teachers and students must be in your rostering data source to appear in Great Minds. However, administrators can be created manually in Great Minds if necessary. Contact the Great Minds Support Team for more information. > How can support staff (e.g., coaches) access Great Minds? > See Custom data: Non-teaching staff for more information on adding non-teaching staff in Clever. > By default, custom staff are assigned a Portal Access Only role in Clever, which means they will only have access to the applications that have been shared with them on a district level. >

Clever has partnered with [Edlink](https://ed.link/) to develop [Clever LMS Connect](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001609) and enable gradebook and assignment syncs between LMSs and edtech applications. title: Clever + Verkada Guest Setup Guide
text:
Districts that are new to Clever can get started by signing up here. Clever is a free service for schools and districts! Existing Clever districts can request Verkada Guest from the Clever Dashboard. Log in to your administrator account and select [Applications > Add Applications](https://schools.clever.com/applications/add). Search Verkada Guest and click **Send integration request**:

![image3.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000Ssrt&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl000003iQgE)

The Verkada team should reply to connection requests within 24 hours.

Verkada Guest requires only student and student contact data to be shared via [Clever’s sharing settings](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/203115007?language=en_US). For security and privacy, please only share data that is required for your district’s needs.

While in Clever, locate your unique district Clever ID from the Data browser. You’ll need to paste that ID in Verkada Command in the next step:

![image2.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000Ssrt&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl000003iMEQ)

---

Follow these steps to complete the setup process:

1. In Verkada Command, go to **All Products** > **Guest**.
2. In the left panel, click the **Guest Settings** icon
3. Under **Organization,** select **Schools** to access the school settings.
4. Select the **Sync students with Clever** option

![image1.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000Ssrt&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl000003iY5t)

5. When prompted, enter your Clever district ID number.
6. Assign a school from Clever to the corresponding school site in Verkada Guest. This links the school and the Guest site.

If you need assistance completing the setup process, please refer to the [Verkada Guest Overview](https://docs.verkada.com/docs/verkada-guest-overview.pdf) or [contact Verkada Support](https://help.verkada.com/en/).

---

>  
> Overview
> Virginia’s Visualization and Analytics Solution (VVAAS) is a web-based tool available to all Virginia K-12 divisions. The VVAAS portal displays measures of students’ academic growth over time based on SOL testing data, diagnostic reports for student groups, and student projections to help educators improve student achievement and inform classroom instruction. Reports provided by VVAAS, in tandem with other data sources, can help educators make decisions regarding curriculum changes, identify and support long-term student goals, and help reveal trends of student groups needing additional support. > This article covers the extension fields you will need to add to Clever for the VVAAS application (including user roles), the required standard fields, and the SAML setup steps to take within your Clever Dashboard. > Please note, all users that need VVAAS access need accounts created (synced or manual) prior to the file upload. > All Clever Admins who need access to VVAAS will need a second Clever account. The account can be a "custom staff" or a "custom teacher". The Clever Admin will need to login from Clever.com and select from the drop-down Login as Teacher/Staff to access VVAAS in the Clever portal. >  
> Extension Fields
> Please add the following extension fields to your Clever rostering sync for each teacher and staff user who should have access to the VVAAS application. To learn how to add extension fields to your Clever sync, see: For Clever Admins: Syncing custom (i.e. extension) fields to Clever .

title: Clever + VVAAS Setup Guide
text:
>  
> - Clever Extension Field: ext.primary\_school\_code; SAML Attribute Name: PrimarySchoolCode; Description: Four-digit state-assigned School number that identifies the school, center, program, or placement that employs the account holder. > - Clever Extension Field: ext.additional\_school\_codes; SAML Attribute Name: AdditionalSchoolCodes; Description: One or more additional school codes separated by the “|” character. > For example, 160|3245|23
> - Clever Extension Field: ext.role; SAML Attribute Name: Role; Description: Code used to identify the account holder's role in the school division and determine what level of access is needed. Select From: VVAAS\_DIVISION\_ALL VVAAS\_DIVISION\_NS VVAAS\_SCHOOL\_ALL VVAAS\_SCHOOL\_NS VVAAS\_SCHOOL\_SPLIT VVAAS\_SCHOOL\_WRS VVAAS\_TEACHER\_WRS See more about the roles below . >  
>  
> SAS/VVAAS Roles for Single Sign-On
>  
> - Role Name: VVAAS\_DIVISION\_ALL; Required Attributes: 1. Email 2. FirstName 3. LastName; Role Privileges: Users will have access to ALL reports and data associated with the division, schools, and students within the division.; Example of User Type: Position examples: • Superintendent • Central Office staff (instructional, student services, special education, and/or data) • Multi-school staff (instructional coaches, administrators
> - Role Name: VVAAS\_DIVISION\_NS; Required Attributes: 1. Email 2. FirstName 3. LastName; Role Privileges: Users will have access to all reports and data associated with the division and schools within the division but NO access to student data or reports.; Example of User Type: Position examples: • Central Office staff who should not have access to student-level data • Multi-school staff who should not have access to student-level data
> - Role Name: VVAAS\_SCHOOL\_ALL; Required Attributes: 1. Email 2. FirstName 3. LastName 4. PrimarySchoolCode (exactly 1) 5.

title: Clever + VVAAS Setup Guide
text:
AdditionalSchoolCodes (0 or more); Role Privileges: Users have access to ALL associated school reports and student data at those schools. Note: Optional to provide additional schools for this user.; Example of User Type: Position examples: • Administration • Counselors • Instructional Coaches • Special education
> - Role Name: VVAAS\_SCHOOL\_NS; Required Attributes: 1. Email 2. FirstName 3. LastName 4. PrimarySchoolCode (exactly 1) 5. AdditionalSchoolCodes (0 or more); Role Privileges: Users have access to school reports, but NO student reports or data. They have access to only School Reports for Additional Schools (No Student Report access for additional schools).; Example of User Type: Position examples: • Instructional coaches that support the division but are assigned to one school • School Administrators
> - Role Name: VVAAS\_SCHOOL\_WRS; Required Attributes: 1. Email 2. FirstName 3. LastName 4. PrimarySchoolCode (exactly 1) 5. AdditionalSchoolCodes (0 or more) 6. LocalProviderID; Role Privileges: Users have access to primary school reports and rostered student data through pre-populated Custom Student Reports (CSR). They have access to school reports only at additional schools. Note: DivisionCode, PrimarySchoolCode, and LocalProviderID must match the MSC file to receive access to a roster.; Example of User Type: Position examples: • Classroom teacher

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001641?language=en_US#header1) 
2. [Setup process](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001641?language=en_US#header2)

6. [FAQs](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001641?language=en_US#header5)

This article contains information to help your school district set up with Clever and i-Ready. You can also review the i-Ready rollover process to help you prepare for Back to School season.

---

title: Clever + i-Ready: Setup guide & rollover process
heading_path: Clever + i-Ready: Setup guide & rollover process
text:
- Make sure your school district is set up with Clever!

- If your school district hasn’t been set up with Clever, you can get started [here](https://www.clever.com/district-signup).
- If your school district is already using Clever, you can add i-Ready by following these instructions:

1. 1. Log into your Clever Dashboard and navigate to [Applications > Add Applications](https://schools.clever.com/applications/add).
 2. Search for i-Ready and click on it when it appears in the list.
 3. You’ll then be brought to a page where you can request the application. When requesting i-Ready, select whether or not you have made a purchase.
 4. You can then opt to request a custom Launch Date. The Launch Date is the first day users can access the app through Clever.
 5. On the right side of the page, you can view the fields required by i-Ready.
 6. When you have made your selections, click Send integration request.

Once requested, please reach out to i-Ready’s Roster Support team at [rosters-support@cainc.com](mailto:rosters-support@cainc.com) or your i-Ready Partner Success Manager to let them know you are ready to sync via Clever. *Data will not automatically sync to i-Ready as backend setup work is needed to provide your district access. Their team will help you get started!*

---

title: Clever + i-Ready: Setup guide & rollover process
heading_path: Clever + i-Ready: Setup guide & rollover process
text:
i-Ready recommends that you share data by school. The simplest way is to set up your sharing using [**Share by Rules**](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115000392247?language=en_US) in Clever. You can create a sharing rule by following these steps:

1. Set up your sharing rules:

1. If you are setting up sharing rules for i-Ready for the first time, please follow these instructions: [Sharing Permissions: Sharing data with new applications](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360043482712).
 2. If you need to edit existing rules, please follow these instructions: [Sharing Permissions: Share by Rules](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115000392247).
2. Configure your sharing rules by limiting sharing to only the schools and students that should be synced.

- - Once i-Ready receives your data, they will have an additional filtering process.

Once you've shared data with i-Ready in Clever, you'll need to work with i-Ready to finish your sync. i-Ready’s rostering team will guide you through this process.

IMPORTANT  
Once you have spoken with i-Ready’s rostering team and your data is received by the i-Ready team, setup may take 5-10 business days, depending on the time of year.

---

Check the Data Quality tab in your Clever dashboard to see whether you’re meeting the required data fields.

![Screenshot of i-Ready app setup page in Clever, with Data Quality tab highlighted](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl0000003DC1&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl000004SkyU)

title: Clever + i-Ready: Setup guide & rollover process
heading_path: Clever + i-Ready: Setup guide & rollover process
i-Ready requires the following data fields:
section: i-Ready requires the following data fields:
text:
**Student Fields:**

- first and last name
- district
- school
- sis\_id and student\_number
- State ID
- DOB
- Grade (0-12)
- Class enrollments

- In order to log in to i-Ready, students need to be enrolled in a class that is shared with i-Ready.

**Staff fields:**

- First and last name
- district
- school(s)
- sis\_id
- Email
- Class enrollments (for teacher role)
- State ID

**Section fields:**

- School ID
- Section ID
- Name

i-Ready can sync site/school district-level administrators from Clever to i-Ready.  If your district selects this option, the following Clever Staff roles translate to the following i-Ready roles:

- Clever Role: i-Ready Role
- Clever Admin: i-Ready District Admin
- Clever Help Desk: i-Ready District Admin
- Clever District Curriculum Lead: i-Ready District Admin
- Clever School Tech Lead: i-Ready School Admin
- Clever Portal Access (Staff role): i-Ready School Admin

Unsure of what role a user should be in Clever? Check out this article for more information: [Clever Roles: Overview of Roles & Permissions](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115001733726).

---

title: Clever + i-Ready: Setup guide & rollover process
heading_path: Clever + i-Ready: Setup guide & rollover process
Summer usage, i-Ready account rollover processes & preparation
section: Summer usage, i-Ready account rollover processes & preparation
text:
In addition to Clever’s Rollover processes, which are linked [here](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202118886?language=en_US), *i-Ready* also has its own account rollover process.

- At the end of the district’s school year, *i-Ready* pauses nightly syncs through the summer unless otherwise discussed with the school district.

- If you would like to continue syncing for Summer School, you must contact the *i-Ready* team by emailing [rosters-support@cainc.com](mailto:rosters-support@cainc.com).
- After the last day of school, *i-Ready* will be accessible to users (as long as they are rostered in Clever) until the i-Ready Account Rollover, which typically occurs about two weeks before the start of the next school year.

- Don’t you know when youri-Ready Account Rollover will occur? Ask your district administrator, or if you are a district-level i-Ready administrator, follow [these steps](https://i-readycentral.com/pdfs/faq-leaders-how-can-i-prepare-for-the-i-ready-rollover/).
- In preparation for the new school year, please follow [Clever’s rollover processes](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202118886?language=en_US) to release your new academic year data.

- *As a reminder, the sync hold needs to be released in Clever before i-Ready can receive your new year data.*

After the i-Ready account rollover occurs, i-Ready is not accessible until the new school year data is shared with i-Ready and has been processed. Once data is shared with the i-Ready team, it can take up to five business days to get your account up and running for the next school year.

---

title: Clever + i-Ready: Setup guide & rollover process
heading_path: Clever + i-Ready: Setup guide & rollover process
text:
**Why am I getting a “data warning” or a “data error”?**

- A data error occurs when the record is incompatible with i-Ready’s integration with Clever, resulting in the user or section not appearing in the application. Data errors must be resolved for users or sections in order to be successfully processed by the application. Reach out to Clever Support if you have questions about how to resolve your data error.
- A data warning occurs when the user or section has a compatibility issue with the application that may result in a degraded app experience. We recommend addressing these issues or contacting the application directly to determine the impact of a particular data warning.

- Please note that section name data warnings can be ignored for i-Ready.

**Why are student usernames inaccurate in i-Ready (e.g., an ‘AUTO\_’ username)?**

- My district’s students log in through a single sign-on (SSO) portal.

- For school districts utilizing SSO, the “username” column in i-Ready has no functionality and can be ignored.  Teachers and Students should log in through their district portal by clicking the appropriate i-Ready tile or icon.
- My school district’s students log in directly through <https://login.i-ready.com/>.

- Suppose your district logs in directly through i-Ready, and a student needs their username corrected. In that case, a school or district administrator can update the username field by following these [linked steps](https://i-readycentral.com/faq/how-do-i-change-a-students-password/) in i-Ready Central.

**How can my district sync demographics from Clever to** ***i-Ready*****?**

To see demographic reporting in the i-Ready Dashboard, you’ll need to sync demographic data via Clever by following these steps:

title: Clever + i-Ready: Setup guide & rollover process
heading_path: Clever + i-Ready: Setup guide & rollover process
text:
1. You’ll need to sync demographic data to Clever from your SIS or CSV file (depending on your sync type).
2. Once your data is in Clever, you’ll need to make sure it’s shared with i-Ready. In your Clever Dashboard, navigate to the Applications > My applications > i-Ready > Settings tab > scroll to the Field Access box.
3. Click on **Advanced Settings.**
4. Choose **Customize fields shared with i-Ready** (see a [how-to here](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360000501586) for instructions and screenshots) and click **Customize fields**.
5. Here, you can edit which fields are shared with the app.

- Sensitive Student Information fields in Clever require an additional sharing step with i-Ready. Please see step-by-step instructions [here](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360020926771).

- Type of information: Personal information; Clever field: gender; i-Ready demographic field: gender
- Type of information: race; Clever field: ethnicityId
- Type of information: hispanic\_ethnicity; Clever field: hispanicOrLatino
- Type of information: Sensitive student information; Clever field: ell\_status; i-Ready demographic field: englishLanguageLearner
- Type of information: iep\_status; Clever field: specialEducation
- Type of information: frl\_status; Clever field: economicallyDisadvantaged

In addition to the fields above, i-Ready also offers extended demographics that vary by state. Please contact your i-Ready Partner Success Manager and/or [rosters-support@cainc.com](mailto:rosters-support@cainc.com) to learn about extension demographic fields for your state. A complete list of Clever demographics can be found [here](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360020926771?language=en_US).

Please note that Hispanic/ Latino is not included in the values for **Race** in Clever and **EthnicityID** in i-Ready at this time.

**Can students log in both via Clever SSO and the i-Ready website?**

At this time, districts have the option to either utilize Clever SSO or log in directly via [i-Ready.com](http://i-Ready.com). Currently, we don't support logging via both methods, you must choose one method.

title: For Clever Admins: Tasks
text:
Title

For Clever Admins: Tasks

URL Name

000001642

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001642?language=en_US#header1) 
2. [What are tasks?](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001642?language=en_US#header2) 
3. [Using tasks](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001642?language=en_US#using-tasks) 
4. [Dismissing tasks](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001642?language=en_US#header3) 
5. [FAQs](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001642?language=en_US#header3)

Over the school year, there are a variety of actions for you to take as a Clever Admin to ensure Clever works smoothly for you and your district.

Tasks help you keep track of everything: from prepping for summer school, to addressing data errors and everything in between.

---

Tasks highlight opportunities, issues, and errors that need attention, connecting you to resources you need and surfacing new features. With tasks, you have one more layer of support to ensure you’re getting the most out of Clever.

![Clever Dashboard tasks / awaiting your action](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TJaL&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000WQQnd)

In addition to tasks created by Clever, District Curriculum Leads can create a task to remind Clever Admin to accept any pending application invitations.

---

Think of tasks as your Clever to-do list. They're there to remind you of important actions and other information.

For example, if there's an issue with your sync, you might see a task suggesting you take action to fix the issue.

Or, if a new feature has launched that might make your life easier, you might see a task encouraging you to check it out.

Consider logging in to Clever regularly to check for any new tasks to keep your Clever account in tip-top shape.

---

If there’s a task that’s not relevant to you, you can dismiss it by clicking the X to the right of the task.

---

**Who else in my district sees tasks?**

- All users with the role of [Clever Admin](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/202518038) see tasks. District Curriculum Lead and District Help Desk users don't see tasks.

**Does a task go away for everyone if I dismiss it?**

- No, it only goes away for you!

> Client ID (this is the Key in Skyward)
> New Client Secret (this is the Secret in Skyward)

> Steps in Skyward:

Click on API > Integration Access . > On the next page, click Add Integration Access. > On the Integration Access page, you’ll need to fill out the following:

title: Upgrading Skyward Qmlativ OneRoster API

Select Clever as the Vendor Name with Clever OneRoster as the Product Name . > Key : This can be whatever you want and is similar to a username. Please make sure that this key is different from your current sync’s API key so that we can verify that data is being pulled exclusively from the Integration Access system. > Authentication Type : Choose OAuth 2.0. > Make sure Is Active is checked. > Effective Date : Choose a date when you want this to be active. > Expiration Date : Choose a date when you no longer want this to be active (this can be many years in the future). > OneRoster Configuration : This is where you can set up your OneRoster Configuration giving you a greater sense of control and stewardship over your data and how it is utilized. > There is no need to fill out the  Description . > Click Save in the upper left corner. > Once the request has processed successfully, click Generate Secret . > This will generate an encrypted password for your Skyward account. Be sure to copy these details as you’ll need to update them on the Sync > Settings page of your Clever Dashboard as outlined in the section above. > IMPORTANT  You must copy the Key and Secret because the info isn't retrievable once you close this page. When copying the secret, please be sure to  only  copy the value of the secret. Do not include the word "Secret:."

title: Sync or SIS Conversion: Notifying applications
heading_path: Sync or SIS Conversion: Notifying applications
section: Sync or SIS Conversion: Notifying applications
text:
Title

Sync or SIS Conversion: Notifying applications

URL Name

000001644

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001644?language=en_US#header1) 
2. [Why is app notification important?](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001644?language=en_US#header2) 
3. [The district’s role](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001644?language=en_US#header3) 
4. [Clever's role](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001644?language=en_US#header4) 
5. [FAQs](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001644?language=en_US#header5)

If you’re switching sync types or student information systems (SISs) and/or changing sis\_ids, notifying applications is one of the most critical parts in ensuring that historical data is preserved for students and teachers in the application’s platform. In fact, this piece takes up the bulk of the timeframe during a sync or SIS conversion as we work with your applications to ensure a smooth transition!

---

Our system generates unique Clever IDs for each record based on the sis\_id that we receive from the district. If student\_ids, teacher\_ids, staff\_ids, or school\_ids change in Clever, the Clever ID will also change.

Changing user records in this way can cause issues in Clever and connected applications because many of our application partners use the Clever ID as the key identifier in their platform to manage records and preserve historical data. As such, we must notify the application support teams and give them a heads-up! This notification allows the applications to make any necessary changes needed to ingest the new data.

---

title: Sync or SIS Conversion: Notifying applications
heading_path: Sync or SIS Conversion: Notifying applications
text:
Before starting a sync or SIS conversion in Clever, we recommend that districts proactively reach out to all SSO, Rostering applications that they’re connected with in Clever to make them aware of the upcoming changes to the data. This helps to expedite the conversion process and ensures that everyone is on the same page. **Here are a few things to keep in mind when reaching out to the applications:**

1. The *tentative* date you plan to start the sync or SIS conversion in Clever.
2. Which SIS data fields will change (eg. student\_id, teacher\_number, email\_address, etc)?
3. Confirm what key identifier the application uses to manage records and preserve historical data (eg. Clever ID, state\_id, teacher\_id, email\_address, etc).
4. Does the application have to *match* the data on their end prior to the sync conversion? Or will they need to ingest the new data first and then match it?
5. Will the application need anything from the district or Clever, such as a crosswalk file of the data changes?
6. Advise the application that you'll [pause the app sync in the Clever Dashboard](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001607) until they confirm that everything is good to go within the application. Request that the application notify you directly once it’s okay to resume the app sync from Clever.

![Screenshot of App sync pause feature, with highlight pointing to the on button](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TjOL&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl000004YzgH)

---

The Clever team will contact some applications but not all! Our main goal is to contact SSO & rostering applications that use Clever IDs or SIS IDs as key identifiers.

However, there are some applications that use other SIS fields (eg. student\_number, email\_address, etc.) to preserve data that would also need to be notified, and this is where the district comes in. The district would ultimately be responsible for informing all SSO & rostering applications of the pending changes in Clever.

---

**Is there a list of applications that should be notified?**

- Unfortunately, we don't have a comprehensive list! As such, we recommend notifying all SSO & rostering applications that you’re currently connected with in Clever.

**When should I start reaching out to the applications?**

- The sooner, the better! We recommend reaching out at least a week in advance of starting the sync conversion process with Clever.

---

**Related Articles:**

- [For Clever Admins: Pause your sync for a specific app](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001607)
- [Secure Sync: Sync or SIS ID conversions](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001566)

section: Single Sign-on (SSO): Setting up Clever Badges and Chromebook logins with Clever as an SSO Profile in Google
text:
> Tip: Title Single Sign-on (SSO): Setting up Clever Badges and Chromebook logins with Clever as an SSO Profile in Google URL Name 000001645 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Setup         •     Configuring SSO         •     Configuring OU targeting         •     Testing on the Web         •     Google settings for users and devices         •     Testing on a Chromebook 3. Known issues 4. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
>  
> Overview
> Clever works seamlessly with Chromebooks, providing students and teachers with access to all their learning applications while only logging in once per device. This means students are logged into their Chromebook, into Clever, and into any applications that the student has access to. > Google supports configuring other identity providers (IdPs) within the Google Admin Console. This article covers configuring Clever as an individual SSO Profile in Google. >  
> Advantages of the SSO Profile configuration:
> Students can use their Clever Badge for all Google sign-ins, not just district-managed Chromebooks. > The district can set up different SSO providers for various user groups (e.g., Clever for student Badge users, Entra ID for staff). > The SSO Profile configuration can target specific devices, so the Badge prompt only shows by default on the desired devices. >  
> Setup
> The setup process has several parts, so please set aside roughly two hours to work through it. Please follow the instructions listed carefully to ensure proper configuration, and test it after setup! > Part 1: Configuring SSO
> In your Clever Dashboard, go to your Clever Dashboard > Authentication > Badges > Chromebook tab . If you haven't already, add the Chromebook Login for SSO Profiles application to your Clever district account by clicking the Add application button. The button will only show if you haven't added the application already. > Adding the application automatically shares it with all users in your schools.

title: Single Sign-on (SSO): Setting up Clever Badges and Chromebook logins with Clever as an SSO Profile in Google
heading_path: Single Sign-on (SSO): Setting up Clever Badges and Chromebook logins with Clever as an SSO Profile in Google
section: Single Sign-on (SSO): Setting up Clever Badges and Chromebook logins with Clever as an SSO Profile in Google
text:
Clever recommends sharing the app with all users, even if they aren’t going to use Badges into Chromebooks. This way, if you ever expand Badges into Chromebook settings, you won’t need to adjust sharing. The app won’t be visible in the teacher and student Clever Portals. > Users won’t be able to log into Chromebooks with this app until you’ve configured the settings in Google Admin Console. You’ll configure these settings later in this article. > Log into Google Admin Console and go to the SSO with third party IdP settings page. > Under the Third-party SSO profiles section, click Add SAML Profile . > Copy the following information from the  Authentication > Badges > Chromebook tab  in your Clever Dashboard to the Google Admin Console SAML profile form: SSO profile name: “Clever - Badges” or any name of your choice. This won't be seen by end-users IdP entity ID : paste the IdP Entity ID Sign-in page URL:  paste the Sign-in page URL
> If you want all users to log in to Chromebooks exclusively using Badges, you can add ?specify\_auth=badges to the end of this value. This will make the Clever Badge camera the first screen the user sees upon opening the Chromebook. > Sign-out page URL : leave blank Change password URL : leave blank, because Badges don’t use a password Certificate: Download the verification certificate from your Clever Dashboard, then click Upload Certificate to upload it. The certificate file downloaded from Clever will be a .crt file. Google’s UI says that the file must be PEM or DER, but .crt will be accepted Click  Save
>  On the next page, note the Entity ID and ACS URL listed under SP details . You will need these in the next step.

title: Single Sign-on (SSO): Setting up Clever Badges and Chromebook logins with Clever as an SSO Profile in Google
heading_path: Single Sign-on (SSO): Setting up Clever Badges and Chromebook logins with Clever as an SSO Profile in Google
section: Single Sign-on (SSO): Setting up Clever Badges and Chromebook logins with Clever as an SSO Profile in Google
text:
In the Configure SSO in Clever section (on the Authentication > Badges > Chromebook tab ), paste the values from Google Admin Console:
> Entity ID: paste the “Entity ID” noted in step six from Google’s SP details ACS URL: paste the “ACS URL” noted in step six from Google’s SP details    Please note: Make sure the Entity ID and ACS URL are entered in the correct fields. They look very similar, and it’s easy to mix them up! The ACS URL should include “/acs”. >   
>  
> Part 2: Configuring OU targeting
> Setting up OU targeting lets you determine who should be using Badges into Chromebooks. For example, first and second grade students or those who have IEPs. > First, ensure that you have one or more Organizational Units or Groups in Google containing the users and devices that should have access to the Badges into Chromebooks feature. > Return to the SSO with third-party IdP settings page in the Google Admin Console and scroll down to the Manage SSO profile assignments section. Click Get started if you’ve never set up an SSO assignment or Manage if you have. >  
> If you’ve never set up an SSO assignment, click on GET STARTED. >  
> If you already have SSO assignments set up, click on MANAGE. >  
> In the sidebar, find the Organizational Unit, Group, or individual users for whom you want to use this feature. Then, in the main window, select Another SSO profile, and in the dropdown select the Clever profile created in Part 1. We recommended naming it “Clever - Badges.” This won't be seen by end users. > In this screenshot, we’ve selected the Students OU. You might select an OU based on user, grade, etc. based on how you’ve structured your Organizational Units.

title: Single Sign-on (SSO): Setting up Clever Badges and Chromebook logins with Clever as an SSO Profile in Google
heading_path: Single Sign-on (SSO): Setting up Clever Badges and Chromebook logins with Clever as an SSO Profile in Google
section: Single Sign-on (SSO): Setting up Clever Badges and Chromebook logins with Clever as an SSO Profile in Google
text:
> In the  Select what happens if users go directly to a Google service without first signing in with this SSO profile's third-party IDP section , you may select either option depending on the user experience that works best for your district:: 
> Have Google prompt for their username, then redirect them to this profile's IDP sign-in page: Select this option if users should always use Clever to sign in to Google, including sign-ins on browsers and unmanaged devices (Recommended for most setups). Require users to enter their Google username and password to sign in: Select this if users should only use Clever to sign in to Google when initially logging in to a managed Chromebook device or if users should have the option to log into managed devices with either Badges or Google credentials. Users will have to use their Google username and password to sign in to Google on browsers, non-Chromebook devices, and unmanaged Chromebooks. Choose this option if you're having issues with logins on some devices. If you have questions, please contact our support team . > Repeat for any other user or device OUs or groups that should use the Badges into Chromebooks experience. For the best user experience, you should target both users AND their devices. Targeting the device as well as the user will cause Clever Badges to be the default login method. Otherwise, users must first type in their Google email address for Google to recognize that they are in a targeted OU. >  
> Part 3: Testing on the Web (optional)
> If you selected the Have Google prompt for their username, then redirect them to this profile's IDP sign-in page setting in step four of the Configure OU targeting section , you can test on the Web without a Chromebook device. > If you selected Require users to enter their Google username and password to sign in , skip this part and proceed to Part 4: Google Settings for users and devices .

title: Single Sign-on (SSO): Setting up Clever Badges and Chromebook logins with Clever as an SSO Profile in Google
heading_path: Single Sign-on (SSO): Setting up Clever Badges and Chromebook logins with Clever as an SSO Profile in Google
section: Single Sign-on (SSO): Setting up Clever Badges and Chromebook logins with Clever as an SSO Profile in Google
text:
> To test on the web you'll need:
> A Google user in one of the targeted OUs
> A Clever account whose email matches the Google user
> A Badge for this Clever account
> Here's what to do:
> In an Incognito or Private browser window, go to accounts.google.com and enter the email address for the Google user account. You should be redirected to Clever to sign-in. Follow the Clever prompts to scan your Badge. You should be authenticated with Clever and then signed in to the Google account. Note that it may take some time for Clever and Google to each process their various authorizations to allow your user(s) to use SSO. If the login doesn’t work the first time, try again in a few minutes. If it still isn’t working, please review the steps above or  contact Clever Support . >  
> Part 4: Google Settings for users and devices
> In this section, you'll update your Google user and device settings to enable:
> Clever to access the device camera on the login screen
> Re-prompt for a Badge after the device is reopened after being closed
> Sign the user into Clever automatically when they sign in to the device
> See below for written instructions, a video guide, or click here for a step-by-step clickable tutorial of the setup! >  
> Navigate to Devices > Chrome > Settings . In the search bar, type in “lock screen.”
> Set Lock Screen settings to: Do not allow locking screen . You can target this to specific OU(s) as well, if you only want this to apply to students using Badges. > Search for Single sign-on. > Set Single sign-on to Enable SAML-based single sign on for Chrome devices . > Search SAML single sign-on login frequency. > Set SAML single sign-on login frequency to an appropriate duration. We recommend Every 2 weeks for the best experience. > Search Idle settings and click Idle settings . > Set the following Idle settings as follows. This ensures that students aren’t prompted for a local password if the device locks.

title: Single Sign-on (SSO): Setting up Clever Badges and Chromebook logins with Clever as an SSO Profile in Google
heading_path: Single Sign-on (SSO): Setting up Clever Badges and Chromebook logins with Clever as an SSO Profile in Google
section: Single Sign-on (SSO): Setting up Clever Badges and Chromebook logins with Clever as an SSO Profile in Google
text:
> Set Action on lid close to Logout If your district is 1:1, you can change these idle settings to Sleep . > Set Lock screen on sleep to Don't lock screen
> Set AC idle action to Logout
> Set Battery idle action to  Logout
> Next, scroll down to the Startup section further down on the same page
> Change the Homepage configuration to Homepage is always the URL set below . Set your Homepage URL to your Clever Portal URL provided in your SSO & Portal > Badges> Chromebook page, or you can find your Clever Portal URL here . > Add your district's Clever Portal URL under the  Pages to load on Startup  settings
> Click the  Device settings tab at the top of the settings panel and scroll down to Sign-in settings. > Set Guest Mode to Disable guest mode . > Set Sign-in Screen to Never show user names and photos . > Set Single Sign-On IdP Redirection to Allow users to go directly to SAML SSO IdP page . > Set Single Sign-On Cookie Behavior to Enable transfer of SAML SSO Cookies into user session . This ensures a user is signed into both their Chromebook device and into Clever in the Chrome browser, saving students time. > Enter https://clever.com/oauth/badges/login under Single sign-on camera permissions. These settings ensure that Clever has access to your Chromebooks' cameras to validate Clever Badge logins  
> Scroll down to Kiosk Settings and ensure that Managed guest session is set to "Do not allow managed guest sessions"  
>  
> Part 5: Testing on Chromebook
> To test on a Chromebook you'll need:
> A Google user in one of the targeted OUs
> A Chromebook device from a targeted OU
> A Clever student account whose email matches the Google user
> A Badge for this Clever student account
> To test the login:
> Power on the device. When prompted, present the Badge. You should now be authenticated and logged into ChromeOS. > If you do not see the Clever login screen, double-check your OU targeting from Part 2 .

title: Single Sign-on (SSO): Setting up Clever Badges and Chromebook logins with Clever as an SSO Profile in Google
heading_path: Single Sign-on (SSO): Setting up Clever Badges and Chromebook logins with Clever as an SSO Profile in Google
section: Single Sign-on (SSO): Setting up Clever Badges and Chromebook logins with Clever as an SSO Profile in Google
text:
> If everything seems correct and you still don’t see the Clever login screen, restart the device. The device must be connected to the Internet, and SSO settings may take some time to apply. Depending on your configuration, you may need to first enter the Google email address of a user in the SSO target OU. > If you’re still not seeing a Clever login screen, please contact Clever Support. >  
> Known Issues
> Badge scan looping or not logging in
> Users may experience issues logging in when SSO is enabled and the Require password change is set to ON on the Security tab of their user account in the Google Admin Console. This issue is due to a problem in how Google handles this situation - they are waiting for a password change that never happens since the user utilizes SSO to sign in. To workaround this, turn off Require password change for any SSO users. >  
> Multiple SSO Profiles
> If you have multiple SSO profiles in your district (e.g., Clever and ADFS), then you should set the Domain-specific service URLs setting to Require users to enter their username on Google’s sign-in page first . Any other setting could cause issues for users signing in with specific SSO profiles. >  
> iPad and iPhone
> Users may encounter unexpected behavior when the Have Google prompt for their username, then redirect them to this profile's IdP sign-in page setting is enabled and if they are signing in to a native iOS application using Google on an iPad or iPhone with the Clever app installed. The initial login attempt will fail to redirect them to their target application, and they will have to retry the login again. If users frequently sign in to iOS applications with Google on shared iPads, consider switching this setting to Require users to enter their Google username and password to sign in . >  
> FAQs
> What is the best way to use Google applications (Docs, Sheets, Drive, etc.) through Clever?

This setup is significantly easier since there are fewer settings to apply, and is recommended for admins less familiar with the Google Admin Console. For more information, please see this article. >

Title

URL Name

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001647?language=en_US#header1) 
2. [LTI flow for teachers and students](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001647?language=en_US#lti-flow) 
3. [Setting up LTI SSO for Canvas](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001647?language=en_US#header2) 
4. [Setting up LTI SSO for Schoology](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001647?language=en_US#header3)

If you’re utilizing Clever LMS Connect, Learning Tools Interoperability Single sign-on (LTI SSO) enables your students and teachers to SSO into applications directly from your learning management system (LMS).

If you’re using Schoology as your LMS, Clever **requires** you use LTI 1.3 SSO to ensure the best LMS Connect experience.

If you’re using Canvas as your LMS, Clever **strongly suggests** you use LTI 1.3 SSO to ensure the best LMS Connect experience.

If you’re using Google Classroom as your LMS, this feature is **not** available.Google Classroom does not use the LTI standard, but your users can still use Clever SSO with Clever LMS Connect for a seamless login experience.

---

When you set up LTI SSO for an LMS Connect app, teachers can choose to add the app for any of their courses/classes in the LMS.

Then, students and teachers can log into that app with one click from the LMS, without needing to go to Clever to log in. This feature is in addition to assignment and gradebook sync from LMS Connect apps.

You must set up LTI SSO for *each* LMS Connect app, and the app must support SSO functionality.

For any apps that you don’t set up for LTI SSO, gradebook and assignment syncs will still work as usual. To access these apps, users will need to use another login method, such as Clever SSO from the portal.

Setting up LTI SSO for Canvas
section: Setting up LTI SSO for Canvas
text:
Setting up LTI SSO for Canvas is **strongly recommended** to ensure the best experience with LMS Connect.

1. Log in to Canvas. Select your school from the Admin menu.
2. Click **Developer Keys.**

![Canvas sidebar menu with Developer Keys section highlighted](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TRzJ&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000CHPzD)

3. Click **+ Developer Key > + LTI Key**.

![Canvas Developer Key, LTI Key dropdown](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TRzJ&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000CHOn0)

4. Fill in the following fields:

1. **Key Name:** You can name this app whatever you’d like: this is internal and won’t be seen by teachers or students.
 2. **Method:** Choose enter **URL**.
 3. **JSON URL**: Paste in JSON URL from Clever Dashboard > LMS Connect > Launch from LMS > Click Set up to open modal > Copy over the URL.

![LMS Connect screen in Clever Dashboard with arrow pointing at View button](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TRzJ&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000CHIT5)
 4. **Owner Email:** You can leave this blank, or optionally put your email if you want other admin to know who added the app.
 5. **Redirect URLs:** Leave this field blank
 6. **Notes**: Add any internal notes you’d like for internal purposes.
 7. Click **Save**. 
 ![Canvas Key Settings screen](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TRzJ&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000CHT3V)
5. On the Developer Keys page, copy the Client ID for the LTI Key you just created. You’ll need this for the next step.

![App in Canvas with arrow pointing at Client ID](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TRzJ&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000CHaWQ)

6. On the Canvas left sidebar, go to **Settings > Apps > View App Configurations**.
7. Click **+ App**.

![Canvas External Apps page with highlight around add app button](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TRzJ&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000CHbtu)

8. Paste in the **Client ID** you copied in step 5.

![Add App screen with Client ID and Submit button](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TRzJ&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000CHdSf)

9. Click save and install the app when prompted.

![Add App screen in Canvas with Install button](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TRzJ&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000CHdCX)

Repeat these steps for any other app(s) you want to enable for LTI SSO.

To ensure this works correctly, you can use Canvas’ [Act as User](https://community.canvaslms.com/t5/Admin-Guide/How-do-I-act-as-another-user-in-an-account/ta-p/161) functionality to test things out.

---

title: For Clever Admins: LTI SSO for LMS Connect
heading_path: For Clever Admins: LTI SSO for LMS Connect
Setting up LTI SSO for Schoology
text:
1. **In Clever,** head to your [Clever Dashboard > Applications > LMS Connect](https://schools.clever.com/lms-connect) page. For the app you want to set up LTI SSO for, go to the **Launch from LMS** column and click **Set up**.

- **Keep the set up modal open in a tab, you’ll need the fields listed here in following steps.**

![Schoology set up information in Clever LMS Connect page](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TRzJ&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000CHOgZ)

2. Head to Schoology and log into your account.
3. Click the **waffle icon ![Screenshot of Schoology waffle icon](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TRzJ&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl0000054NzF)** **> App Center.**
4. Click on **My Developer Apps** near the top of the screen. [Don't see My Developer Apps? Check out this article to fix that.](https://ed.link/help/how-to-create-dev-apps-in-schoology-for-school-admins/)
5. Click **Add App**.

![Screenshot of Add Schoology App screen](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TRzJ&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl0000054O2T)

6. Complete each section:
 - **App name**: You can name the app anything (but we recommend a clear name since this is the name teachers and students will see).
 - **Description**: Write in a description of the app.
 - **Category**: Select the subject.
 - **Recommended for**: Select whichever applies, Instructors, Students, Admins (or all three).
 - **Available for**: Select “Only people in my school”
 - Leave the remaining boxes unchecked/unfilled. You can upload an App Logo and Feature Graphic - these images will display in Schoology.
 - Select LTI App 1.3, and more fields will appear, as shown below.

![Screenshot of Schoology LTI app setup screen](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TRzJ&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000CHN7m)

7. In the additional fields that show up after selecting LTI App 1.3, follow these instructions:

title: For Clever Admins: LTI SSO for LMS Connect
heading_path: For Clever Admins: LTI SSO for LMS Connect
Setting up LTI SSO for Schoology
text:
- Next to LTI App 1.3, leave the **Launch app in Schoology** checkbox **unchecked**, unless the app you’re adding has told you to check it.
 - **Can be Installed for**: Select the categories that apply.
 - **Configuration Type**: Manual.
 - **Privacy**: Send Name and Email/Username of user who launches the tool
 - **For Domain/URL, Custom Parameters, OIDC Login Init URL, and Redirect URLs:** You’ll copy and paste these from the setup modal that you opened in Clever in step 1.
 - If you are asked for or encounter a requirement in Schoology requesting either a Tool Public Key or a JWKS URL, copy the same URL used for the OIDC Login Init URL, and replace everything after **/lti/** with **jwks**. If this doesn't resolve the issue, please [contact Clever Support](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360001041326) to troubleshoot further.
 - All other boxes can remain unchecked. Check the **Terms of Use** box at the bottom of the page.

![Screenshot of Schoology LTI app setup screen](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TRzJ&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000CHOGl)

8. Click **Submit**. Your screen should now say, **Your App has been created**.
9. Next, click **Install LTI App**, then **I Agree**, and **Add to Organization**.

1. After you’ve added the app, click **Install LTI 1.3 App**, to install it.

![Install app screen in Schoology](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TRzJ&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000CHF0Y)

2. Agree to the prompt and select **Add to Organization**.
3. Click **Install/Remove**.

![Install app modal in Schoology](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TRzJ&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000CHmSj)

4. Select which group(s) applies: **All Users**, **All Courses**, or **All Groups**.
5. Click **Submit**.

Students, teachers, and staff (if shared with the LMS) can now access the app when they log in to Schoology.

To test things out, go to your **App Center** > **Organization Apps**. Find the learning app you installed and click on it. Check that it’s working as expected.

title: Google for Education Plus + Clever IDM: Google Bundle Overview
heading_path: Google for Education Plus + Clever IDM: Google Bundle Overview
text:
Clever’s Google for Education Plus + Clever Identity Management (IDM), also known as the Google Bundle, combines Clever’sidentity management solution with Google’s Workspace for Education Plus to save you time and money. This bundle ensures that students, teachers, and staff always have access to the solutions they need. For $7.25 per user per year, you get:

- [Google Workspace for Education Plus](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001653?language=en_US#header2)
- [Clever IDM](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001653?language=en_US#header3)

- [Clever Badges](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001653?language=en_US#header5)

The Google Bundle establishes interoperability across the tools used every day in your district, with a focus on data privacy and security. [Click here](https://www.clever.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/Clever_GoogleBundle_2024.pdf) for a one-page overview of the Google Bundle.

title: Google for Education Plus + Clever IDM: Google Bundle Overview
heading_path: Google for Education Plus + Clever IDM: Google Bundle Overview
text:
Google Workspace for Education Plus allows you to transform your institution’s digital learning environment. As Google’s most comprehensive solution, Education Plus provides advanced security, insights, and user-friendly tools that enrich and customize learning. Take a look at these tools and the specific needs each tool addresses for your district:

- **Collaboration and productivity:** Docs, Sheets, Slides, Forms, Sites, Calendar, AppSheet, Core, Google Cloud Search
- **Privacy, security, device, and access management:** Admin
- **Classroom management and plagiarism detection:** Classroom, Assignments
- **Storage:** Drive
- **Video conferencing:** Meet
- **Email and messaging:** Gmail, Chat, Groups
- **Visibility and analytics:** BigQuery, Looker Studio

For more information on the tools included in Google Workspace for Education Plus, please see [Google’s Education Plus One-Pager](https://services.google.com/fh/files/misc/education_plus_onepager.pdf).

title: Google for Education Plus + Clever IDM: Google Bundle Overview
heading_path: Google for Education Plus + Clever IDM: Google Bundle Overview
text:
Clever IDM saves time and keeps accounts secure by automating account provisioning and access management for Google, Active Directory, and Entra ID. Clever IDM automatically creates and updates usernames, passwords, and organizational units (OUs) based on the data you sync to Clever from your student information system (SIS) or Human Resources Information System. Maintain secure, up-to-date accounts with audit logs that allow you to control access and enforce strong passwords. With Clever IDM, you can prevent classroom disruptions by ensuring that everyone has the access they need at the right time.

Clever’s teams will provide ample training and setup guidance to ensure a smooth configuration of Clever IDM with your existing systems.

To learn more about Clever IDM, see our article [Clever IDM: Overview](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001466).

---

Clever is the only premier rostering partner for Google Classroom. Google Classroom roster import saves your teachers time by automatically creating and managing your Google Classroom rosters at scale based on the data you are syncing from your SIS to Clever.

Google Classroom course names will match Clever section names, and rosters will update automatically as students change sections in your SIS and Clever. You can set specific access dates for teachers and students to align with school start dates or professional development days.

For a complete overview of the Google Classroom roster import application, please see our article [Clever + Google Classroom: Overview](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001503).

---

title: Google for Education Plus + Clever IDM: Google Bundle Overview
heading_path: Google for Education Plus + Clever IDM: Google Bundle Overview
text:
Clever Badges are a free login tool available to any district using Clever. Use Badges with your Google Bundle to seamlessly integrate your tools and provide instant secure access for any student.

Students flash their Badge, a physical passcode similar to a QR code, at their device webcam to log into their device and learning applications with no typing required!

Clever Badges are compatible with Chromebooks, iOS devices, Android, and Windows devices. They also work with Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge, and Internet Explorer browsers.

You can configure settings in your Google Admin Console for students to use their Badge to log directly into their Chromebook and Clever Portal.

For more information on utilizing Clever Badges at your school, check out our article [Clever Badges: Overview and Setup](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/220213907).

Title

For Families: What's Classroom MFA?

URL Name

000001654

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001654?language=en_US#header1) 
2. [What is Classroom MFA?](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001654?language=en_US#header2)
