title: For Clever Admin: Access logs
text:
Title

For Clever Admin: Access logs

URL Name

000001698

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001698?language=en_US#header1) 
2. [Features of access logs](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001698?language=en_US#header2) 
3. [How to use Access logs with login error messages from end users](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001698?language=en_US#header3) 
4. [Frequently asked questions (FAQs)](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001698?language=en_US#header4)

Access logs give you a holistic snapshot of any attempts to access Clever. Use Access logs to spot any suspicious activity early, to keep your schools’ users and data safe. You can also use Access logs to troubleshoot users who are having trouble accessing Clever.

![Access logs screenshot](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TGRB&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000VpL0X)

For example, you might notice that a user’s login keeps getting stuck on an MFA timeout, meaning the user has entered their password correctly, but that they are not completing their MFA security method. That could mean that their password has been compromised, and that they need a reset.

This article covers each feature of access logs and how you might use them.

---

title: For Clever Admin: Access logs
text:
**Filter functionality**

You can quickly filter access logs by date, IP Address, status, user, and user type. For instance, if you believe a certain user’s account has been compromised, you can drill down to that user to see their access history. In addition, you can look via reference ID (such as an error code a user has shared with you).

![Access logs filter functionality](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TGRB&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000IC3z3)

**User access activity**

All users (students, teachers, [short-term substitute teachers](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001675), staff, and Clever Admin) access activity shows up as a summary:

![Access logs user access activity](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TGRB&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000K9cKH)

**Individual access log summary**

If you click the down arrow, you can see useful information, including:

- the authentication method (e.g. Substitute Badge, MFA, etc.)
- the final user action
- their user ID
- email address
- error code(s) if relevant

![Individual access log summary](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TGRB&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000IC4S5)

Access logs will also include details on Clever Admin and School Tech Lead (STL) impersonations. The authentication method listed will indicate impersonation, and the log summary will contain details such as the impersonation’s start and end time, the user account impersonated into, device details, etc.

![An example of an impersonation event in Access Logs](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TGRB&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000Pw6WT)

*An example of an impersonation event in Access logs*

**Emailing CSV exports**

You can also email a CSV export by day, which includes all data in the access logs by column:

![Access logs CSV export](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TGRB&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000IC4qH)

To pull an export:

title: For Clever Admin: Access logs
text:
1. Click **Export** **CSV**
2. Select your dates. You can export data for up to seven days at a time, up to 60 days in the past. If you need more than 7 days of data, you can export the data for multiple 7-day timeframes.
3. Click **Export CSV:**

![Export CSV modal](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TGRB&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000JzEG1)

**CSV exports include:**

- Timestamp

- When the event took place
- Authentication\_context\_id

- This ID relates to a single user’s single login attempt. For instance, if a user logged in with a primary method, requested an MFA code, had an MFA timeout, and then successfully entered an MFA prompt, these would all be under the same Authentication\_context\_id.
- User\_id

- The user’s Clever ID
- User\_type

- Teacher, student, staff, or Clever Admin
- Client\_ip

- The user’s IP address
- Auth\_method

- Their primary authentication method, such as SIS, Google, or Clever Passwords.
- Second\_factor

- Their MFA method (such as Mobile app MFA, SMS code, etc.)
- Event

- Part of the login process, such as:

- Login\_success

- Part of the login process was successful (such as a first method, second method, or backup login code).
 - Login\_failure

- Part of the login process was unsuccessful.
 - MFA\_prompted

- The user was prompted to enter an MFA prompt
- Error

- There was an issue with the login process, such as a duplicate ID, no match to a user in your schools, etc.

---

title: For Clever Admin: Access logs
heading_path: How to use Access logs with login error messages from end users
section: How to use Access logs with login error messages from end users
text:
When students or teachers can’t log in to Clever, they’ll receive an error message that provides information about the error, a copyable Reference ID, possible troubleshooting steps, and instructions to contact their school’s IT support.

![An example error message an end user may receive when their login fails](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TGRB&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000O79S9)

While the login error may suggest steps towards resolution, if you need additional information, please navigate to your  [Clever Dashboard > Access logs](https://schools.clever.com/access-logs) and input the Reference ID for more details.

If you’re still unsure how to resolve the issue, please [contact Clever Support](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360001041326) and provide the user’s Clever ID and the Reference ID so our team can help troubleshoot further.

---

title: For Clever Admin: Access logs
text:
- **What’s the length of logging shown in Clever?**

- Five days.

- **What’s the length of logging shown from the CSV download?**

- You can download up to seven days of data from the past 60 days.

- **What does it mean if an authentication method is “Impersonation?”**

- This means that a Clever Admin impersonated a teacher or student account, or if this setting is enabled for your school, an STL impersonated into a teacher account. Click the Access log entry for more details on the impersonation.

- **What fields can you search via?**

- As of now, you can only search via reference ID.

- **What errors might we see in a log?**

- Wrong email, wrong pw, incorrect 2nd factor
 - Pending MFA: users have 10 minutes to complete their MFA challenge, if nothing happens, Clever will fail the login.
 - Timeout error: Meaning it took longer than 15 seconds for Clever to download your data.

- **What are the differences between our classic login logs versus new access logs?**

- Length of logs shown:

- 2,000 logs or 14 days in login logs
 - 5 days for access logs with no limit on # of logs
 - Download limits:

- 5k logs for login logs
 - 14 days with access logs (you can also request a longer history by contacting Clever Support).
 - Access logs also include:

- Combined logs into one view when there are multiple access touch points, so it’s easier to troubleshoot.
 - More detail around methods of authentication, such as MFA, Substitute Badge access, etc.
 - Better error messaging with more detail on access errors.

title: For Clever Admins: Clever Complete Overview
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Clever Complete Overview
text:
Clever Complete, our newest platform solution, enables applications to connect with any school, whether they’re rostering with Clever or using another solution, in one centralized place.

If you currently use Clever, nothing will change in your Clever experience. Clever Complete is a platform solution for application partners to simplify district and school data management into one system: Clever.

If you do not currently utilize Clever, application partners you work with may utilize Clever Complete to more easily synchronize data from your schools. As always, your student data privacy is a top priority for Clever. Learn more about our practices, FERPA, COPPA, GDPR, and state-level compliance in [our Trust Center](https://www.clever.com/trust).

Whether you currently use Clever or not, you’ll be able to continue managing your data via your existing systems while experiencing the benefits of simplified integrations with your application partners.

---

Clever Complete utilizes Clever’s existing 1EdTech OneRoster® integrations to help applications more smoothly integrate with schools without requiring schools to learn any additional systems. Applications using Clever Complete will be able to more easily integrate with your school because they’ll have access to:

- A single integration point for rostering, SSO, and your LMS
- Additional data fields related to demographics and attendance
- Best-in-class data visibility and management

---

title: For Clever Admins: Clever Complete Overview
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Clever Complete Overview
What does this mean for you?
section: What does this mean for you?
text:
If you’re currently using Clever, nothing will change! You’re going to continue getting all of the great benefits of Clever that you always have.

If you’re not currently using Clever, and one or more of your applications utilizes Clever Complete, Clever will serve as a subprocessor of your data. This means that Clever will serve as a middleman between any system you use to send data to your applications, and the application itself.  This will improve your implementation experience with applications as data is normalized and simplified via Clever for application partners to ingest.

Clever is committed to student data privacy and security, complying with COPPA, FERPA, GDPR guidelines. Learn more about our data privacy and security practices [here](https://www.clever.com/trust).

Whether you currently utilize Clever or not, when you use an edtech vendor that leverages Clever Complete you’ll benefit from:

- Easier onboarding and faster implementation timelines for new edtech tools
- Improved cybersecurity
- Higher quality application integrations and improved troubleshooting

---

If you’re interested in learning more about how applications will utilize Clever Complete, please check out our article [For Application Partners: Clever Complete Overview](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001700).

---

title: For Clever Admins: Clever Complete Overview
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Clever Complete Overview
text:
**If I already roster my application via another service, and the vendor wants me to begin rostering via Clever Complete, will I need to take action?**

- Yes, the Clever team will help you configure your data flow to route through Clever Complete instead of your current provider.

**Will Clever Complete impact how my users log in to an application?**

- No. Schools and applications can continue using their preferred authentication methods while ensuring a seamless login experience for students and educators.

**We don’t currently use Clever, how will Clever Complete impact our current environment?**

- You do not need to utilize Clever for an application partner to utilize Clever Complete to synchronize data from your schools. You can continue managing your data via your existing systems.

**Can I choose how I want to roster within Clever?**

- Yes, districts can decide how they want to roster, whether using Clever Secure Sync, OneRoster, or other supported methods. Clever Complete ensures that no matter how a school chooses to roster, applications receive the data they need.

---

>  
> Overview
> We know every admin team has a unique structure and needs. Custom admin roles grant specific access in Clever based on your team's unique roles. Custom roles minimize risk by ensuring users have the minimum access required in Clever. > For example, you might have a curriculum coordinator who only needs access to analytics and the Clever Portal. Or, you might have an SIS admin who only needs access to Clever’s sync settings. The levels of customization are nearly endless! > This article will guide you through the process of creating and assigning a custom role, along with the granular access available. >  
> Creating a custom role
> Navigate to your Clever Dashboard > User management > Admin team. Click Actions > Create custom role. > Name your role and add a description. For this example, we're creating a role for a curriculum coordinator. Role names must be unique (for example, you can’t have two roles named “Math Curriculum Coordinator, but you  can assign multiple people to the same role). > Decide which permissions users with this role will need. In this case, the curriculum coordinator needs access to view Clever analytics. However, we don't want them to manage these settings. > They also need access to our  Portal to add and remove resources. > Once you're satisfied with the permissions, click  Proceed to review . > Review your new role and the permissions and then click  Create role . >  
>  
> Assigning the role to a user
> Assigning a user to the role immediately after creating a role
> 1. If there's a user you want to assign the role to immediately, you can do so right after you’ve created the role. This step is optional. > 2. Click Assign .

text:
> Tip: Title For Clever Admin: Attendance data in Clever URL Name 000001704 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. What attendance data is shared with app partners 3. Use cases for attendance data  4. How to add attendance data 5. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
>  
> Overview
> Clever is offering a new way for districts to send student attendance data to select educational applications. > This article provides a high-level overview of attendance data in Clever, how it’s added, and other logistical info. >  
> What attendance data is shared with app partners
> Clever is ingesting, storing, and exposing negative attendance data to application partners. > Any application using Clever for rostering can request access to attendance data through the Clever API at no additional cost to them or you. > Clever will grant access to approved application partners, and schools are always in control of whether or not to share their attendance data. If you’d like to use attendance data with a specific app, please contact the app provider directly to confirm support and request setup. > Clever is ingesting, storing, and exposing negative attendance data to application partners. This means any value that is not “Present”, including:
> Absent

This article contains the following:

Clever is piloting a new way for districts to send student attendance data to select educational applications.

These apps can use attendance information for many purposes. Here are some use cases with some example students and districts:

Here are some examples of how you may use attendance data that’s shared with an app:

title: For App Partners: Getting attendance data from districts
heading_path: For App Partners: Getting attendance data from districts
text:
- Use case: Details
- Emergency response & student safety: During an unexpected fire drill, the school’s safety system syncs attendance data via Clever’s API. Teachers confirm which students are present, and the system alerts the administration that Alex, a 3rd grader, has not checked in. Staff quickly confirm that Alex was picked up early, preventing unnecessary panic and ensuring an accurate headcount.
- Student transportation optimization: Each morning, your district’s transportation system pulls attendance data via Clever’s API. When a student is marked absent, the system removes them from the bus route for that day, reducing unnecessary stops and optimizing fuel efficiency. This helps buses run on time and improves transportation logistics.
- Parent communication for absences: Liam’s school uses an app to send automatic alerts when a student is absent. When Liam misses school without a parent excuse, his mother receives a text notification in her preferred language, reminding her to submit a reason. This helps ensure proper documentation and reduces chronic absenteeism.
- Absenteeism's impact on learning outcomes: David, a high school junior, struggles in math and has been absent frequently. The district’s assessment tool is integrated with Clever’s attendance data. Likewise, his teacher notices a correlation between his absences and declining test scores. With this insight, David is given extra tutoring sessions during advisory periods, leading to improved test performance and engagement.
- Personalized learning adjustments: Sophia, a 5th grader, is using a math app to learn multiplication concepts. Due to frequent absences, she has fallen behind. With Clever’s attendance data integration, the math app’s adaptive learning system identifies gaps in her knowledge and automatically assigns personalized exercises, helping her catch up at her own pace.

If you’re interested in receiving attendance data, keep reading!

This article provides a high-level overview of attendance data for application partners. If you’re a district or want to learn more about the district experience, read this article.

---

Clever is ingesting, storing, and exposing negative attendance data to application partners. This means any value that is not “Present”, including:

- Absent
- Tardy
- Excuse\_code, if shared by the district:

- For example, “ED” for Early Dismissal, or “UA” for unexcused absence.
 - We currently don't filter any data sent by districts, so data is being stored as-is.

Attendance data is stored for up to 6 months from the date it was recorded.

---

If you’d like access to attendance data, follow these steps:

1. Ensure you are on version 3.1 of the Clever API.
2. Talk to your Application Success Manager within Clever to express your interest.
3. Once the first two steps are done, and a district you’re connected to uploads attendance data, you can make a request to the Clever API with a [district-app token](https://dev.clever.com/docs/api-overview#district-app-tokens) to receive this data.

---

Check out the [district-facing article](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001704) for more information!

---

**How do districts share the attendance data?**

- They share via their existing SFTP box, ensuring compatibility with any SIS.

We know cybersecurity requirements are rapidly changing, and many states now require districts and schools to share which digital resources are used with students openly.

Clever’s Digital Learning Directory generates a website where teachers and families can see all the learning applications your schools are using through Clever with just the click of a button.

The Digital Learning Directory will provide teachers and families with a list of the applications each school is utilizing, which grades those applications are used in, and an overview of each application with a link to learn more at the application’s website.

---

title: For Clever Admins: Clever's Digital Learning Directory
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Clever's Digital Learning Directory
Setting up and viewing your Digital Learning Directory
section: Setting up and viewing your Digital Learning Directory
text:
To activate your Digital Learning Directory, navigate to your [Clever Dashboard > Portal > Portal settings > Digital Learning Directory tab.](https://schools.clever.com/portal/settings/digital-learning-directory)

From here, you can toggle the Digital Learning Directory for your schools on and off. Clever automatically provides a link to your school’s Digital Learning Directory. Currently, this link is not customizable and is determined by the district shortname listed in your [Portal URL.](https://schools.clever.com/portal/settings/url)

To preview the Digital Learning Directory for your schools, turn the directory on, then navigate to the provided URL.

![Example Digital Learning Directory page](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000T2mP&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000NkUh0)

Here, you’ll see the Digital Learning Directory that Clever has automatically generated based on the learning applications you have in your Clever account.  The directory will display the following application types:

- SSO/Rostering
- SSO-only
- Rostering-only
- SSO (Saved Passwords)
- SSO (SAML)

---

You can provide access to the Digital Learning Directory by sharing the URL on your [Portal > Portal settings > Digital Learning Directory tab](https://schools.clever.com/portal/settings/digital-learning-directory). Depending on the group you are sharing the directory with, we also recommend sharing the following articles as well:

- [For Teachers: Digital Learning Directory](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001712)
- [For Families: Digital Learning Directory](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001713)

If you disable the Digital Learning Directory, users will receive the following error when navigating to the directory in the future:

![Digital Learning Directory disabled warning](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000T2mP&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000NBn6b)

---

title: For Clever Admins: Clever's Digital Learning Directory
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Clever's Digital Learning Directory
text:
**How should we share this link with families?**

- We recommend that you include your Digital Learning Directory link in any documentation that you have for families where you want to proactively share these resources with them.

**What types of applications will show in the Digital Learning Directory?**

- SSO/Rostering, SSO-only, rostering-only, SSO (Saved Passwords), and SSO (SAML) applications.

**Can we customize our Digital Learning Directory URL?**

- Not at this time.

**What will happen if we don’t have the directory setup but someone tries to navigate to our URL?**

- They will receive an error page notifying them that your school doesn’t have the directory setup.

**Can I print a list of Digital Learning Directory applications?**

- Not at this time

---

Clever works directly with our application partners using Clever LMS Connect to offer Google Classroom add-ons. Google add-ons simplify the login process for Google Education Plus customers, enabling students and teachers to access learning applications via single sign-on (SSO) directly in Google Classroom!

For the best experience, we suggest using [Clever LMS Connect](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001609) in your Clever account for the smoothest integration between your Google Classroom, applications, and Clever.

- Progress Learning

title: For Clever Admins: Google Classroom add-ons
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Google Classroom add-ons
Getting the add-on for an application
section: Getting the add-on for an application
text:
1. Navigate to your [Google Workspace Marketplace](https://workspace.google.com/marketplace) and search for the application. Ensure you’ve located the application that says **By: Clever. Inc.

![Example of add-on by Clever Inc.](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TBcn&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000QA7xK)**
2. Once you locate the application, select **Admin Install.**
3. You’ll receive a notification that you are about to install the application for your Google Workspace. Click **Continue.**
4. Review and agree to the application’s terms and conditions for accessing your Google Classroom data. During this step, you can select if you’d like to identify specific groups or organization units (OUs) that will have access to the add-on. Click **Finish.**
5. Configure the necessary settings if you’ve selected to add the application to specific groups or OUs and continue your setup.
6. You’ll complete the add-on installation by selecting **Done.** It can take up for 24 hours for the app to be installed for your entire Google Workspace domain, organizational units, or groups.

---

title: For Clever Admins: Google Classroom add-ons
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Google Classroom add-ons
text:
When you’ve completed the installation process for the Google add-on, you’ll want to inform your teachers that they can start using it in Google Classroom!

**Click here for a recommended email template to inform your teachers.**

Hi [teachers],

We’ve added *[application]* directly to Google Classroom! This means you can easily link directly to the application in your Google Classroom, and students won’t need to log in again. You won’t be able to link directly to specific content in the application, but it will provide easier access for your students to the app!

To add a direct link to the application to your Google Classroom:

1. Create a course item on your Google Classroom page, such as an assignment.
2. Under the add-ons, click*[application]*. 
 ![Example add-ons from a teacher assignment in Google Classroom](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TBcn&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000QAPe5)
3. Select **Sign in with Google**.
4. You'll receive a prompt to provide [Clever.com](http://clever.com) access to your Google Account. Please click **Allow** to provide access.
5. Click **Add attachment** on the application’s page, and you’ll successfully add a link to the application that students can use to log in without leaving Google Classroom!

This add-on is powered by Clever, so your students must be actively logged into their Clever Portal to be automatically logged into the app.

You can learn more in [Clever’s Help Center here](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001729).

We hope this makes your logins and classroom management smoother!

Best,

*[Name]*

---

title: For Clever Admins: Google Classroom add-ons
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Google Classroom add-ons
text:
**Can I use the add-on if we don’t use Clever?**

- No, your users must have a Clever account to utilize the Google add-on, as Clever’s single sign-on supports it.

**What will happen if a student attempts to use the add-on without a Clever Portal session active?**

- Clever will prompt them to login, then they’ll be able to access the add-on.

**Can teachers link directly to specific assignments, lessons, etc., in the application?**

- No, the add-on will not link to specific content in an application. It will sign in students and teachers without additional login steps.

**How will we be notified about new application add-ons?**

- This article will be updated with new partners that have built add-ons, and we’ll notify schools when apps they roster via Clever have new add-ons available!

**How can I let an application partner know that I’m interested in them utilizing Clever LMS Connect?**

- Navigate to the LMS Connect tab in your Clever Dashboard and click the **Submit app interest form** button. This will let the application know you’re interested in them using Clever LMS Connect.

 ![Example assignment with Google add-ons available](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000P4y5&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000QAX3l)
3. When prompted, select **Sign in with Google**.
4. If Clever powers the add-on, you’ll receive a prompt to provide [Clever.com](http://clever.com) access to your Google Account. Please click **Allow** to provide access.
5. Click **Add attachment** on the application’s page, and you’ll successfully add a link to the application that students can use to log in without leaving Google Classroom!

If Clever powers the add-on, your students must be actively logged into their Clever Portal so that Clever can automatically log them into the application. If a student attempts to access the add-on without an active Clever session, Clever will prompt them to log in.

text:
Title

For Teachers: Discontinuing Clever Messaging

URL Name

000001732

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001732?language=en_US#header1) 
2. [Why is Clever discontinuing Clever Messaging?](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001732?language=en_US#header2) 
3. [Timeline and changes](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001732?language=en_US#header3) 
4. [Next steps for teacher <> student communication](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001732?language=en_US#header4)

Clever will discontinue Clever Messaging on December 31, 2025. We’re proud to have built a teacher < > student messaging product in 2020 to support schools with urgent needs when learning was often pushed fully remote due to COVID-19. As digital tools for classroom communication have expanded, many districts have chosen to implement platforms dedicated to secure messaging, and fewer and fewer teachers and students regularly use Clever for their classroom messaging needs.

---

As the education technology landscape has evolved, many districts have implemented specialized communication platforms. To ensure Clever is devoting all our resources to delivering the most secure and robust identity platform for education, we have made the difficult decision to discontinue the built-in direct messaging feature between teachers and students. This will help Clever be better positioned to support schools with new, free classroom tools like [Substitute Access](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001672) on Clever, Teacher and Student Portals that adhere to accessibility standards, and a faster student iOS app.

---

Teachers and students can continue to message each other directly on Clever until December 31st, 2025. After that date, there will no longer be an option for direct messaging between teachers and students in the Clever Portal. However, your ability to communicate with your students through your Clever Portal isn’t going away entirely.

**The [Class Announcements](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360045714731?language) feature will remain available**. You can continue to post one-way updates, reminders, or general announcements to all of your students or classes at the same time.

---

Your district has been alerted to this change. If you have questions about how to communicate with students going forward, please reach out to your school's IT team. Many districts already have a dedicated tool in place for secure teacher-to-student messaging that they will continue to use moving forward.

---

title: Troubleshooting: Expired SAML certificates
text:
Title

Troubleshooting: Expired SAML certificates

URL Name

000001736

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001736?language=en_US#header1) 
2. [Why SAML certificates expire](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001736?language=en_US#header2) 
3. [How to update your certificate](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001736?language=en_US#header3) 
4. [Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001736?language=en_US#header4)

Clever can utilize **Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML)** to offer a secure and seamless **Single Sign-On (SSO)** experience for users through **identity providers (IdPs)** such as ADFS and Microsoft Entra ID. For this connection to remain secure and functional, Clever and your IdP must use valid security certificates to confirm the user attempting to log in and verify user identities.

If these certificates expire or Clever or one of your Clever admins rotates them without an update to your IdP, users may experience login failures.

---

You can think of SAML certificates as digital "padlocks" and "keys". Clever provides your IdP with a "padlock" (public certification), which your IdP uses to lock login data before sending it to Clever. Clever then uses its "key" (private key) to unlock it.

For security reasons, SAML certificates are only valid for a limited period (typically several years). When a certificate reaches its expiration date, it must be replaced with a new one to maintain a secure connection.

To avoid login errors, you should ensure you are always using the most up-to-date SAML certificate available via Clever.

---

title: Troubleshooting: Expired SAML certificates
text:
When Clever updates its security certificates in its public metadata.xml file, Clever Admins must ensure their Identity Provider (IdP) recognizes these changes. If the IdP is not updated, students and staff will be unable to log in via SAML.

Depending on your IdP, you may need to manually update your settings or ensure your system is automatically pulling the latest metadata from Clever. Below are the update methods available for each IdP:

- IdP: ADFS; Update Method: Federation Metadata URL; Automatic?: Yes (if configured; default is every 24 hours); IdP's support documentation on updating certificates and metadata: Learn about monitoring your certificate and automatic updates here
- IdP: Microsoft Entra ID; Update Method: Manual Field Edit; Automatic?: No; IdP's support documentation on updating certificates and metadata: Entra ID documentation
- IdP: Okta; Update Method: Manual Field Edit; Automatic?: No; IdP's support documentation on updating certificates and metadata: Okta documentation
- IdP: Duo SSO; Update Method: Manual XML upload; Automatic?: No; IdP's support documentation on updating certificates and metadata: Duo documentation
- IdP: Rapid Identity; Update Method: Manual XML paste; Automatic?: No; IdP's support documentation on updating certificates and metadata: RapidID documentation

Please see the instructions and documentation linked below for each IdP for updating Clever’s SAML certificate in their system. [You can find Clever’s most recent SAML Certificate here](https://clever.com/oauth/saml/metadata.xml). The recommended instructions are intended to be a guide for rotating your SAML certificate in your IdP. If you find that the instructions don’t match your exact experience, or if you have any questions regarding the navigation of your IdP system, please contact your IdP provider directly as Clever has limited insight into their systems.

ADFS

**Set ADFS to automatically pull updates from Clever**

title: Troubleshooting: Expired SAML certificates
text:
You can get a deep dive on monitoring your Relying Party Trust and setting up for automatic updates [here.](https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/blog/coreinfrastructureandsecurityblog/adfs-monitoring-a-relying-party-for-certificate-changes/259391)

1. Open AD FS Management > Trust Relationships > Relying Party Trusts. 
2. Right-click Clever > Properties > Monitoring tab. 
3. Ensure the Metadata URL is: <https://clever.com/oauth/saml/metadata.xml> 
4. Check Monitor relying party and Automatically update.

Microsoft Entra ID

Follow [Microsoft’s instructions here](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/entra/identity/saas-apps/clever-tutorial#configure-microsoft-entra-sso).

1. Go to Entra Admin Center > Enterprise Applications > **Clever**. 
2. Select **Single sign-on** > **Basic SAML Configuration** > **Edit**. 
3. Manually update the Identifier or Reply URL if they have changed in the metadata.

The URL should match the following: <https://clever.com/oauth/saml/metadata.xml>

Okta

[You can find Okta’s instructions here.](https://support.okta.com/help/s/article/Replace-SP-Signing-Certificate-In-OKTA)

Okta does not support metadata file uploads or URL polling for custom SAML apps.

Admins can manually extract information from Clever’s metadata.xml file and input that information into Okta’s admin UI.

1. In Okta Admin, go to Applications > **Clever** > **General** tab.
2. Under SAML Settings, click **Edit** > **Next**.
3. Manually update the Destination, Audience URI, or Certificate fields using data parsed from Clever's XML.

For the Clever-signing-certificate, admin must replace Clever’s certificate for Clever’s custom SAML app in Okta. You must navigate to the **Advanced Settings** of the Clever app in Okta.

title: Troubleshooting: Expired SAML certificates
text:
1. Log into the **Okta Admin Console.**
2. Navigate to **Applications** > **Applications** > Select **Clever**.
3. Go to the **General** tab.
4. Scroll down to **SAML Settings** and click **Edit**.
5. Click **Next** to reach the **Configure SAML** page.
6. Click **Show Advanced Settings**.
7. Find the **Signature Certificate** field.
8. Click **Browse files...**, select your clever.crt, and click **Upload Certificate**.

Click **Next** and then **Finish**.

Duo

Duo requires a manual file upload whenever Clever's metadata changes. You can find [Duo’s instructions here](https://duo.com/docs/sso-clever#enable-clever-for-sso).

1. Download the latest XML from <https://clever.com/oauth/saml/metadata.xml>. 
2. In the Duo Admin Panel, go to Applications > **Clever**. 
3. Under **Service Provider**, click **Choose File** and upload the new XML.

RapidID

RapidID supports copy and pasting Clever’s metadata.xml. [Find their instructions here.](https://help.rapididentity.com/docs/configuring-saml-sso-with-clever)

1. Copy the raw text from <https://clever.com/oauth/saml/metadata.xml>. 
2. In RapidIdentity, go to Configuration > Security > Identity Providers > Federation Partners. 
3. Edit the **Clever** partner, go to the **Metadata** tab, and [paste the new XML text into the field.](https://help.rapididentity.com/docs/configuring-saml-sso-with-clever#launch-the-identity-provider-configuration-workspace)

---

title: Troubleshooting: Expired SAML certificates
text:
**How do I find the latest certificate?**

- You can always find Clever's current public certificate and metadata at: <https://clever.com/oauth/saml/metadata.xml>.

**Do I need to update immediately?**

- To ensure users don’t encounter login issues, Clever recommends keeping your SAML certificate up-to-date with the most recent version.

**What if I update my certification and I’m still seeing login errors?**

- If your teachers or students are still experiencing Clever SSO login issues related to a SAML-based IdP after updating your certification, please check your [Clever Dashboard > Authentication > Access logs](https://schools.clever.com/access-logs) and see [this article for additional troubleshooting steps](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/209026697). If you’re unable to resolve the issue, please contact our support team at [support.clever.com](https://support.clever.com).

title: For Clever Admins: Custom MDM configurations for the Clever iOS App
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Custom MDM configurations for the Clever iOS App
text:
This article explains how to configure the Clever iOS app (version 6.1 and later) using a Mobile Device Management (MDM) solution such as Jamf or Mosyle. These settings allow you to customize the app's behavior for your school organization’s specific needs.

Common configuration options that can be deployed via your MDM's Managed App Configuration feature include:

- **SharedDeviceModeOn:** Automatically logs students out after they launch the first resource that takes them out of the Clever application.
- **BrowserPasswordLoginOn**: Opens Safari for password logins instead of the in-app login screen
- **DistrictId**: Pre-configures the app with your school organization’s custom Portal URL, skipping the school picker.

You can use your MDM to configure these settings for all your managed devices or for a specific subset.

---

This custom configuration can be enabled when students share iOS devices, and you want to ensure they log out of Clever between device swaps.

When a student launches a resource that takes them out of the Clever Portal (like a rostering/SSO application or an external link), the Clever app will automatically logs them out when they return. This helps younger learners who may not remember to log out manually.

title: For Clever Admins: Custom MDM configurations for the Clever iOS App
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Custom MDM configurations for the Clever iOS App
text:
When this configuration is applied, if a user (student, teacher, staff, etc.) opens the iOS application and selects the Password option to log in manually with a username and password, the application will automatically redirect the user to log in to Clever via the device's web browser. If you have a password manager set up in your web browser, user credentials will be automatically saved and entered for you to log in.

This configuration is best for school organizations:

- **That log in with external IdPs via the Password tab, and would like those credentials saved by their browser’s password manager:** Credentials for IdPs like Google are often saved by the device browser’s password manager. Using this configuration allows your users to continue using that device browser (and its autofill capabilities) to log in to the IdP.
- **Teachers who frequently use iPads to access Clever:** Teachers can log in to the Clever Teacher Portal via a web browser. The Clever app only supports the Student Portal.
- **That prefer students to manually enter login credentials:** Web browsers can autofill login credentials for younger students who may struggle to type them each time.

If your students log into their iOS devices with a username and password, enabling this setting will streamline their login process by removing the need to select their school organization on the login page. When a student taps **Password** on the login screen, they'll go directly to your district's login page.

You can find your school organization’s Clever ID via your Clever Dashboard. Navigate to your [Clever Dashboard > Data browser](https://schools.clever.com/data-browser), and you’ll find the ID at the top of the page.

![Example of where to locate your school organization ID](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000X1Gf&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000bFDvh)

---

title: For Clever Admins: Custom MDM configurations for the Clever iOS App
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Custom MDM configurations for the Clever iOS App
text:
These instructions provide general guidance on managing applications in your MDM. The Clever Support team does not have insight into your specific MDM setup. If you need additional support around setting up application configurations, we recommend reaching out to your MDM directly.

​You can use your MDM to configure these settings for all your managed devices or for a specific subset.

1. **Create the configuration profile:** In your MDM console, create a new **Managed App Configuration** (also called "App Configuration" or "Custom App Settings" depending on your MDM).
2. **Add the configuration keys:** Use the following Property List (plist) format for each example below. We recommend always setting all three keys, even if you're setting some to false. This ensures consistent behavior and properly overwrites any previous configurations on the device.
3. Copy and paste this plist provided for your preferred scenario below, then modify the values for your district:

SharedDeviceModeOn
Use this configuration when you want students logging in with a username and password to skip the school picker and they share iPads on which you want students to be automatically logged out after launching a resource:
```
<dict>
 <key>SharedDeviceModeOn</key>
 <true/>
 <key>BrowserPasswordLoginOn</key>
 <false/>
 <key>DistrictId</key>
 <string>YOUR_DISTRICT_ID_HERE</string>
</dict>
```

Replace YOUR\_DISTRICT\_ID\_HERE with your school organization's Clever ID found on your [Clever Dashboard > Data browser](https://schools.clever.com/data-browser) page (example: 51e76ab1d93412f47b000c32).

BrowserPasswordLogin

Use this configuration when your school org uses manual credentials for Clever logins, your teachers use iOS devices and the Clever application, or your schools use many Saved Passwords applications.
```
<dict>
 <key>SharedDeviceModeOn</key>
 <false/>
 <key>BrowserPasswordLoginOn</key>
 <true/>
 <key>DistrictId</key>
 <string>YOUR_DISTRICT_ID_HERE</string>
</dict>
```

Replace YOUR\_DISTRICT\_ID\_HERE with your school organization's Clever ID found on your [Clever Dashboard > Data browser](https://schools.clever.com/data-browser) page (example: 51e76ab1d93412f47b000c32).

DistrictID

Use this configuration to simply pre-configure the district, without changing logout or browser behavior:
```
<dict>
 <key>SharedDeviceModeOn</key>
 <false/>
 <key>BrowserPasswordLoginOn</key>
 <false/>
 <key>DistrictId</key>
 <string>YOUR_DISTRICT_ID_HERE</string>
</dict>
```

Replace YOUR\_DISTRICT\_ID\_HERE with your school organization's Clever ID found on your [Clever Dashboard > Data browser](https://schools.clever.com/data-browser) page (example: 51e76ab1d93412f47b000c32).

---

- Verify that the app version is 6.1 or later.
- Check that your MDM is targeting the correct app bundle ID: com.clever.InstantLogin
- Ensure the configuration profile is assigned to the correct device groups.
- Try force-closing and reopening the Clever app after the profile is deployed.

- Confirm that DistrictId is set to your correct district ID (not your district's shortname or URL)
- Verify the profile has been successfully installed on the device.

- Confirm that BrowserPasswordLoginOn is set to true (not false or missing).
- Make sure all three keys are present in your configuration, even if some are set to false.

---

title: For Clever Admins: Custom MDM configurations for the Clever iOS App
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Custom MDM configurations for the Clever iOS App
text:
**What if I don’t know where to find these settings in my MDM?**

- Clever Support has limited insight into your school organization’s specific MDM settings. If your MDM setup doesn’t match the instructions above, please reach out to your MDM directly to determine where you should set up App Configurations.

**What if I have followed the steps and troubleshooting tips above, and the application still isn’t behaving as expected?**

- Feel free to reach out to Clever Support! Please be sure to include:

- Your MDM solution (Jamf, Mosyle, Intune, etc.)
 - The configuration plist you're using
 - A description of the expected vs. actual behavior

**Can I customize the app behavior using the plist examples above?**

- Yes! Feel free to set any of the criteria as **True** or **False** to customize your user’s login experience. For the best login experience, we recommend including all three criteria, even if you set some to false.

title: Sharing Permissions: Share by Rules
text:

Choosing Share by Rules as a sharing type 3. How do I add a sharing rule? 4. Constructing sharing rules 5. Reverting to previous rules/Viewing who made changes 6. Multiple sharing rules and filters 7. Adding Notes 8. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
> Overview
> By configuring  sharing permissions for applications, Clever admins can determine what data will be shared with each district app, and which district users will be able to access the application from their individual Clever Portals. > When sharing by rules, Clever will only share data that meets the specific criteria you've set. This is the most recommended sharing type as it provides districts/schools with the flexibility in determining specifically what data should be included, or excluded, in the sharing. > Additionally, applications are dynamically updated as new data is synced to Clever from your district's student information system (SIS). The data shared with the application via sharing rules evolves based on the new data in Clever. >   For an overview of application sharing permissions, please visit:   Sharing Permissions: Sharing data with applications
>    
> What is a sharing rule? > A sharing rule allows districts to be specific about what data is being shared by data type (e.g. teacher, student, section, etc.). Once a sharing type is selected, district admins can continue to add filters to ensure only the data they want shared with applications is being shared.

title: Sharing Permissions: Share by Rules
text:
> For example, sharing rules might include:  
> All the math classes in a particular school The english classes for grades 3-6 in the district, except for in two schools One specific teacher’s 11th-grade homeroom class
> Think of a sharing rule as a sentence:  
> "Share all records where <attribute> <is one of> <value> ”
>  
> Choosing Sharing by Rules as a sharing type
> You can view and edit your sharing rules from your  Applications > My Applications page by clicking on the application's name to open the Overview tab. > Click Edit Sharing
>  
>  If you're not already Sharing by Rules , you can change the sharing type to Sharing by Rules. > If you are using Guided Sharing, click here for instructions on how to switch to Sharing by Rules. > Navigate into your sharing rules for the application. Click back to Step 1: Choose sharing method on the sidebar. Click Get started on the pop-up for Guided Sharing: How it works Select to share Specific sections, teachers, students, and/of staff  
>  
> If you are using Standard Sharing, click here for instructions on how to switch to Sharing by Rules. > Navigate into your sharing rules for the application Click on Change as shown below (in this example the school district was Sharing by Schools) Select Share by Rules to change your sharing type  
>  
> After changing to Sharing By Rules in either Guided Sharing or Standard Sharing, you will then be prompted to choose which method you want to use (e.g. Custom Share by Student):
>  
> Create your rules and filters. Click  here to learn more about the different types of rules and filters. Before saving your rules and filters, you can adjust them as many times as you’d like and preview data at the bottom of your screen before clicking save. This allows you to experiment and ensure the correct data is included in your sharing rules. For sharing rule recommendations, be sure to check out our tips & troubleshooting article . After creating each rule, select Done editing.

title: Sharing Permissions: Share by Rules
text:
Once you have finished adding all of your rules and filters, select Save Sharing Rules. >  
> How do I add or edit a sharing rule? > If you already use Share by Rules, go to your Applications > My Applications page and  click on the application name to  open the app overview page . From the app overview page, click  Edit Sharing . Use the Edit or Delete actions to update your sharing rules. >  
> Constructing sharing rules
> Types of sharing rules
> There are a few types of sharing rules available: 
>  
> - Sharing rule: Purpose
> - Custom Share by Teacher: Share specific teachers by one of their unique identifiers (e.g. email address, teacher ID). > When sharing by teacher, you'll have the option to select whether to share their associated student and section data. Custom Share by Teacher sharing rules will not share student contacts, however. > See a tutorial video of Guided sharing: Share by teacher or Standard sharing: Share by teacher. > - Custom Share by Staff: Share your non-instructional staff. If  Sharing by staff , you will have the option to select if you want to share their school associations. Clever recommends sharing "all associated schools." This will not share additional students, teachers, or sections. > See a tutorial video of Guided sharing: Share by staff or Standard sharing: Share by staff. > - Custom Share by Student: Use this sharing type to filter by student attributes such as grade, gender, ELL\_status, IEP, status, etc. > When sharing by student, you'll have the option to select if you want to share their associated section data. > See a tutorial video of Guided sharing: Share by student or Standard sharing: Share by student. > - Custom Share by Section: Use this sharing type to filter by section attributes such as subject, school, course, and term. > See a tutorial video of Guided sharing: Share by section or Standard sharing: Share by section. > Filters
> Rules are made up of  Filters.

title: Sharing Permissions: Share by Rules
text:
A  Filter is an individual requirement that must be met in order for a record to be shared. A rule may have multiple filters. Filters are created by creating a statement using the following:
> Properties are attributes that districts can use to either include or exclude data with the application sharing rules. The fields available are dependent on the type of sharing rule you selected (e.g. share by teacher, share by section, share by student) Operators  define how the property should be used. Available operators are:
> equals any of does not equal any of contains does not contain contains any of starts with starts with any of
> Values  are the actual values that the rule must meet in order to be shared. Values can be selected manually from the dropdown or by pasting multiple values separated by a semi-colon. Search for values is case-sensitive
> Note: When using the School or Schools properties, you may enter or paste lists with any combination of school names, school sis\_ids, or school Clever ids. > For a tutorial video of using filters with Guided sharing, click here . > For a tutorial video of using filters with Standard sharing, click here . In the below example, the filter has a requirement that a section has the subject of math in order to be shared:    In this example, the filter is excluding any sections with the subject of PE and Health by using the does not equal operator. This means that every section with a subject other than PE and Health  will  be shared with the application. > Reverting to previous rules/Viewing who made changes
> By clicking on the Past rules tab on the application's page, you can view the sharing rules history, including the date and time the rules were changed and who changed them. Under the  Past rules tab, you can click on View current rules (1)  to see the current sharing rules and view the sharing rules history by date and time.

title: Sharing Permissions: Share by Rules
text:
By clicking on one of the small arrows next to the time (2), it will open up to show you what the sharing rules were previously. You can revert a previous rule set by clicking on Revert to these rules (3). > Multiple sharing rules and filters
> An application can have an unlimited number of sharing rules. In the below example, the application has two rules. A record will be shared with the app if it meets the requirements for either rule: 
> Rule #1 (Share by section)
> Filter #1: School equal any of Discovery Middle School Filter #2: Subject equals any of Math
> In Rule #1 a section must meet both filter requirements in order for the section to be shared. > Rule #2 (Share by student)
> Filter #1: Grade equal any of 3;4;5
>  
> Please note: When you have multiple rules, the two rules are mutually exclusive. So, if you want to build off the existing rule, you'll want to add a filter to the rule itself rather than create a new rule entirely. >  
> Check out our tutorial videos for Guided sharing: Using multiple sharing rules or Standard sharing: Using multiple sharing rules . >  
>  Clever Tip: When having multiple sharing rules, there can be a lot of scrolling needed. To get to the top or bottom of the page faster, use the Jump to start/Jump to end buttons. When using Guided Sharing, this will be located on the left-hand side of your page, whereas when using Standard Sharing, you will find up and down arrows in the bottom right-hand corner of your screen. >  
>  
>  
> Adding Notes
> To help keep sharing permissions organized, Clever provides the ability for users to add Notes  to sharing rules. To add a note to a sharing rule, click  Add Note. Enter your note and click  Save. Notes support up to 500 characters. Once saved, the note will appear on the sharing rule. In addition, the note will display the date, time, and user that last updated the note. To edit a note, click  Edit Note. Any Clever Admin may edit an existing note, even if created by another user.

title: Sharing Permissions: Share by Rules
text:
>  
>  
> Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
> I updated the sharing rule and the new data I shared is not reflected in the application, what do I do? > Please wait at least 24 hours for sharing changes to be reflected in a connected application. If you need the data to show sooner, please contact the application team directly. > Can I switch between Guided Sharing and Standard Sharing? > Yes! You can change your sharing setup at any time using the toggle at the top of your screen. > Can I test application rules before applying them? > Yes. You can add rules and filters and preview the data that will be shared based off of the rule or filter at the bottom of the screen before saving your sharing rule. > Why am I receiving a prompt to add my application to a category? > When setting up sharing rules for any application not assigned to a category in your Portal (for example, a new application you’ve just added), you’ll also receive a prompt at the end of your sharing setup asking if you’d like to add the application to a category. If you’d like to add it to an existing category, choose one from the dropdown.

title: For Clever Admins: Co-teachers
text:
> Tip: Title For Clever Admins: Co-teachers URL Name 115000988748 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Adding co-teachers in SFTP syncs 3. Adding co-teachers in SIS managed syncs 4. Syncing co-teachers in Clever managed auto syncs 5. Manually adding existing teachers as co-teachers 6. Creating new custom teachers 7. Removing co-teachers 8. Co-teachers in applications
> Overview
> Co-teachers are additional teachers assigned to sections in your SIS but are not the primary teacher. Clever's ability to sync co-teachers depends on your sync type. Read on to learn more! >  
>  Please note: Some connected applications may not support co-teachers. Please contact the application partner directly to confirm whether they support co-teachers. >  
> If co-teachers are missing from your connected application, first check your data in Clever . If co-teachers are missing in Clever, please read the information below on how to add them to Clever. If co-teachers are syncing to your Clever account but missing from your connected application, please reach out to that application team to learn how their system handles multiple teachers. Clever supports a total of 10 teachers per section, including one primary teacher and up to 9 co-teachers. >  
> Clever Tip: Use co-teachers to give special education, intervention, and other unique teachers direct access to their students. >  
> Adding co-teachers in SFTP syncs
> The "Teacher\_id" column in the sections.csv file indicates the primary teacher for that section. Multiple teachers are added to sections through the columns "Teacher\_2\_id", "Teacher\_3\_id", and "Teacher\_4\_id", etc. Clever supports up to 9 co-teachers per section. A sections.csv file formatted for co-teachers looks like this:
> Please note: Each teacher\_id must correspond to a record in the teachers.csv file. Check out  Clever's SFTP spec  for more information on CSV formatting; page 13 outlines the multiple teacher\_id fields.

title: For Clever Admins: Co-teachers
text:
Once the multiple teacher\_id fields are added to the sections.csv file, as well as the teachers.csv file, upload the updated files to Clever. >  
>  
> Adding co-teachers in SIS-Managed Auto Syncs
> Please contact your SIS if you'd like co-teachers added to your sync. Similar to the process for SFTP syncs, your SIS will need to add multiple teachers through the "Teacher\_2\_id", "Teacher\_3\_id", and "Teacher\_4\_id" fields in the sections.csv sent to Clever. Click here to learn more about SIS-Managed Auto Syncs. >  
>  
> Syncing co-teachers in Clever-Managed Auto Syncs
> To learn if your Auto Sync supports co-teachers, please go to the Clever-Managed Auto Sync page  here  and select your SIS page. The Auto Sync's "Functionality" section at the top of that page will indicate if the Auto Sync can support co-teachers. Auto Syncs that support co-teachers will bring them into Clever automatically. For example:  
>  
> Manually adding existing teachers in Clever as co-teachers
> If your sync doesn't support the export of co-teachers, your district can manually add co-teachers to sections from a section's detail page. To do this, open the section's detail page and click Add a co-teacher . Sections can be easily accessed using the search bar at the top of your Clever dashboard. > Please allow up to 24 hours for manually added co-teachers to be synced by connected applications. If you don't see co-teachers appear in the application, you can contact the application's support team to confirm they support co-teachers on their platform. >  
>  
> Creating new custom teachers in Clever
> If you'd like to add a teacher who doesn't sync from the SIS, you can do this by clicking create a teacher  in the modal. > You'll enter basic demographic information about the user in the subsequent screen in order to create this user. > Please allow up to 24 hours for your custom-created teachers to sync by connected applications.

title: For Clever Admins: Co-teachers
text:
If you do not see custom-created teachers appear in the application, you can contact the application's support team to confirm they support co-teachers on their platform. >   
>  
> Removing co-teachers
> The process of removing a co-teacher from a section will depend on how the co-teacher was added to the section. If a co-teacher was added manually, admins will be able to remove the association directly from the section profile in Clever. > If this option is not available, the co-teacher association was synced directly from your student information system (SIS). To remove the co-teacher, the association will need to be removed in the SIS. Once removed, the co-teacher association will be removed on the next sync with Clever. >  
> Co-teachers in applications
> While all rostering applications on Clever have access to shared co-teacher data, it depends on the application partner whether they support co-teachers or not. The application partners also take care of managing permissions and access control for co-teachers within their app. > If you have any questions about co-teacher behavior in an application, please don't hesitate to reach out to the application's support team directly. They'll be more than happy to assist you!

>  
> Overview
> District admins can provide various staff and admin users with access to Clever at varying permission levels. For example, some users may be able to view and modify district-wide settings in Clever, while others may only be able to make modifications specific to their school. > In Clever, a "role" can only be assigned to a district admin or staff user. Teachers always have the same permissions, primarily access to their associated sections (i.e. courses/classes), students, and applications. > Clever Tip: This article runs through our default roles. You can also create custom roles with granular permissions, as outlined in this article . >  
> Determining the best role for a user 
> Clever roles should be based on an individual's position in the district and the level of permissions the district wants them to have in Clever. Users assigned district admin (i.e., Clever Admin, District Curriculum Lead, or District Help Desk) roles will have district-wide access with varying permissions, while users in staff roles will have more limited permissions. You can also offer highly granular permissions by creating a custom admin role . For detailed information about each role, please click on the links below. > District admin roles:  
> Clever Admin District Curriculum Lead District Help Desk
> Non-instructional staff roles :  
> School Tech Lead Portal Access
> Teacher vs. Non-instructional Staff A common question is whether a user should be added to Clever as a Teacher, School Tech Lead, or Staff (Portal Access Only). > If a user is responsible for teaching or assisting a student with educational content (i.e. substitute, teacher aide, instructional coach, etc.), we recommend adding the user as a Teacher .

text:

Testing successful logins 4. Testing unsuccessful logins 5. If anything goes wrong... 6. If everything goes right... > Overview
> Before you roll out a new Saved Passwords application to all users in your district, we recommend testing a few logins. In most cases, users will need to enter their login credentials the very first time they access the application but will be automatically logged in via single sign-on (SSO) each time thereafter. > For devices other than iOS, please make sure that you are using a  Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge, or Internet Explorer (2013 or later) browser , and have the  Clever browser extension  installed . For iOS devices, you will need to use the Clever app as it functions as the Clever browser extension for Saved Passwords apps. >   Visit these articles for details about the Clever browser extension ,  Saved Passwords apps on iOS devices , or managing user credentials ! > Testing functionality for different users
> To ensure students and teachers are being logged into the app successfully, you'll need credentials from both user types for Clever Portal and the Saved Passwords application you are testing. > Before testing, it is important to make sure the users are  shared with the application and have the app icon in their Clever Portals. To do this, navigate to your Clever Dashboard > Applications > My Applications page , and click on the application name to open the app overview page. Confirm the users you are testing are shared with the application via the Select Users tab. > Testing successful logins
> From your  Clever Dashboard , use the  Access Portal as feature to log in as a student or teacher. Click on the app icon and enter the correct credentials for the application.

title: SSO (Saved Passwords) Apps: Testing and Piloting
heading_path: SSO (Saved Passwords) Apps: Testing and Piloting
section: SSO (Saved Passwords) Apps: Testing and Piloting
text:
Once you click Save Login you should be brought to the application website and successfully logged in. > Clever Tip: If the application has different login URLs for each school, make sure to test a few different student and teacher accounts to make sure they all work as expected. If you are unsure how to set up school-specific login URLs, please contact  Clever Support! > Testing unsuccessful logins
> You'll also want to make sure you know what to do when things go wrong! To test what happens when a user is logged in unsuccessfully, use the   Access Portal as feature to log in as a student or teacher. Click on the app icon and enter the wrong credentials. You should see a page that looks like this:
> Enter the correct credentials, and select Update & Log in to reset the user's credentials. >   If you have any issues updating the credentials, or if you need additional instructions on troubleshooting logins, please visit  this article! > If anything goes wrong... > If any of the tests above don't go as expected, let us know ! We're always looking for ways to improve our Saved Passwords application integrations, so your feedback is very much appreciated. As always, any screenshots you can provide will make the troubleshooting process that much easier. > If everything goes right... > If the tests above work as expected, we recommend piloting the Saved Passwords application with a subset of students and teachers before rolling it out to the entire district. Here are a few quick steps for creating a successful Saved Passwords pilot:  
> First, you'll want to complete the steps above to ensure users are being logged into the Saved Passwords app successfully. If you run into any issues you can submit a ticket  to our support team. Choose a few classrooms to pilot the Saved Passwords application. We recommend choosing classes with students who are old enough to log into the application easily outside of Clever in case of any hiccups.

Provide them with login instructions, and allow them to test from their Clever Portals to ensure they are logged into the app successfully. > You can find more information about SSO (Saved Passwords) applications here .

title: Sharing Permissions: Enabling School Site Sharing for School Tech Leads

section: Sharing Permissions: Enabling School Site Sharing for School Tech Leads
text:
> Tip: Title Sharing Permissions: Enabling School Site Sharing for School Tech Leads URL Name 115001972366 Article Body This article contains the following:  1. Overview  2.  How do I enable school site sharing for School Tech Leads?
> Overview
> The School Tech Lead user type in Clever is able to navigate from the Portal to the Clever Dashboard to help manage schools they are associated with. School site sharing means that a School Tech Lead can manage data sharing permissions on a per-school basis. For more information on adding School Teach Leads, please see this article . 
>  
> How do I enable school site sharing for School Tech Leads?
> To allow sharing rules to be managed at the school level:  
> 1. Visit the application overview page and choose the Edit sharing button (for Saved-passwords apps click the Modify users button) and select Change next to the current sharing rule type.
>  
> 2. Change sharing rules to School Site Sharing.
>  
> 3. Click  Enable to allow School site sharing.  
>  
> Please note: Enabling school site sharing will remove any existing sharing rules that you have.
> Now your School Tech Leads can manage data sharing on a per-school basis! School Tech Leads will see the same interface that you do, except they will only see the schools that they are associated with in Clever. As a Clever Admin, you can also view and edit the same sharing rules.  
>  
> Clever Tip: For directions on how School Tech Leads can use School site sharing, please see: For School Tech Leads: What is School site sharing?
>  
> Related articles:
>  
> For School Tech Leads: Sharing data with apps

title: SFTP Syncs: OneRoster
text:
> Tip: Title SFTP Syncs: OneRoster URL Name 115001975103 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Preparing my Clever sync to accept OneRoster files 3. Syncing student contacts via OneRoster 4. Troubleshooting 5. Default field mappings
> Overview
> As a member of the IMS Global Learning Consortium, Clever supports the IMS Global OneRoster standard. Districts can send OneRoster 1.0 , 1.1 , or 1.2 formatted CSV files over Clever’s secure SFTP data pipeline. Clever is the easiest and most secure way for districts to support OneRoster - with the full confidence of our proven platform and without compromise in functionality or control of data security. >  
> Preparing my Clever sync to accept OneRoster files
> 1. Reach out to Clever Support  and our team will work with you to create a timeline and transition plan to OneRoster. Please let us know whether you will be using the OneRoster 1.0, 1.1, or 1.2 formats for your files. > 2. Whether you are new to Clever or transitioning your sync type, you will be provided with a field mapping document. This document will outline the OneRoster fields that will translate to the Clever fields required by your applications. > Please note: Clever supports receiving student data in OneRoster CSV 1.0, 1.1, or 1.2 formats. In order to ensure compatibility with the evolving standard, Clever is strict in its interpretation of OneRoster 1.0/1.1/1.2. Official formatting for 1.1 can be found here . Required files:
> academicSessions.csv
> classes.csv
> courses.csv
> demographics.csv
> enrollments.csv
> orgs.csv
> users.csv
> manifest.csv (Note that this file contains all the files Clever is expecting in the sync overall, which should be the 7 listed above.)
> 3. Automate the transmission of OneRoster CSVs to a folder in your Clever SFTP box. For OneRoster 1.0, the subdirectory should be titled oneroster . For OneRoster 1.1-formatted files, the subdirectory should be titled oneroster11 .

title: SFTP Syncs: OneRoster
text:
For OneRoster 1.2-formatted files, the subdirectory should be titled oneroster12 . 4. Once complete, you can leverage Clever’s data-sharing interface to scope student rosters with applications and personalize your Clever Portal. > Syncing student contacts via OneRoster
> Student contacts can be synced via the users.csv . To connect a contact to a student, use the agentSourceID as shown below:
>  The users.csv spec can be found here: https://www.imsglobal.org/oneroster-v11-final-csv-tables#\_Toc480293266
> Troubleshooting
> Below you can find solutions to common sync errors that may display in your Clever Dashboard if you are using a OneRoster SFTP sync. > - Error Message: Solution
> - "A manifest.csv file is required for a OneRoster v1.1 SIS data sync": Please ensure that the manifest.csv is present in the OneRoster zipped file and includes all of the following required files:
> • academicSessions.csv
> • classes.csv  
> • courses.csv
> • demographics.csv (optional - mark as absent if you're not using this file.) 
> • enrollments.csv
> • orgs.csv
> • users.csv
>  
> The files should all be compressed as a group. Please note that compressing the "folder" will trigger this error. > - Could not find orgs.csv file: Please ensure that the orgs.csv is listed as bulk in the manifest file and that the file is included in the OneRoster export with all required column headers and formatting. > OneRoster 1.0 CSV formatting and specifications
> OneRoster 1.1 CSV formatting and specifications
> OneRoster 1.2 CSV formatting and specifications
> If the error persists, please reach out to Clever Support to confirm your OneRoster version (1.0. 1.1, 1.2). > - Encountered zero enrollments data: Confirm you have student enrollments populated in your enrollments.csv. If it is a rollover period, you may not. > If enrollments exist, check the enrollment date format. It must be YYYY-MM-DD format per OneRoster specifications.

title: SFTP Syncs: OneRoster
text:
> Check your users.csv and confirm users are enabledUser field is set to “True.”
> - Invalid manifest.csv: Confirm your manifest.version in the manifest.csv is set to 1.0. > - A manifest.csv is required for a OneRoster 1.1 sync: Ensure your manifest.csv is present in the zipped file. > Ensure the manifest.version in the manifest.csv is 1.0. > Confirm all files in your manifest.csv are listed as either “bulk” or “absent”. > Ensure you have compressed (zipped) the files as a group. Compressing as a folder will cause this error. > - Failed to start decoding manifest.csv: Confirm manifest.csv is formatted per OneRoster specifications ( 1.0 , 1.1 or 1.2 ). Check file headers and files listed as “bulk” or “absent”. Manifest.version should be 1.0. > Confirm that the OneRoster file has been  compressed their OneRoster files as a group (instead of using a folder). >  
> Below you can find solutions to common solutions to general data issues that may occur if you are using a OneRoster SFTP sync. > - Error Message: Solution
> - User (student, teacher, etc.) missing from Clever: Please confirm all required fields are populated per the relevant OneRoster specification:
> OneRoster 1.0 CSV formatting and specifications
> OneRoster 1.1 CSV formatting and specifications
> OneRoster 1.2 CSV formatting and specifications
> Please confirm the username field is populated. This is required per OneRoster specifications. > If using OneRoster 1.1, ensure that the role field is populated in the users.csv. > If using OneRoster 1.2, ensure that the role field is populated in the roles.csv. > - Missing terms or enrollments: Please confirm any dates associated with the data are in YYYY-MM-DD format. OneRoster specifications require this format for data to process. > - Missing section or enrollment: Clever requires all sections to have a primary teacher and at least one student assigned.

title: SFTP Syncs: OneRoster
text:
> Check the enrollments.csv and make sure that the teacher and students have the following fields populated:
> status = active. If tobedeleted or inactive are marked, the enrollment will not sync to Clever. > schoolSourcedId = SourcedId (orgs.csv). This maps to the student's school\_id in Clever. > userSourcedId = SourcedId (users.csv). This maps to the student\_id and teacher\_id. > role = student or teacher
> Check the users.csv and make sure that the teacher and students are active (status = active & enabledUser = true). > - Student enrollments are persisting after the end date has passed: Clever doesn’t consider the end date or start date fields in the OneRoster enrollments.csv. To remove enrollments from Clever, please remove the enrollments from your enrollments.csv entirely. > - Missing demographic data - date of birth: Ensure the date is formatted as YYYY-MM-DD format per OneRoster requirements. > - Missing demographic data - race: Ensure you are using a value accepted by OneRoster and that each value is marked as “true” or “false” in your demographics.csv. > americanIndianOrAlaskaNative
> blackOrAfricanAmerican
> nativeHawaiianOrOtherPacificIslander
> white
> demographicraceTwoOrMoreRaces
> hispanicOrLatinoEthnicity
> If Hispanic\_Latino is missing in Clever, ensure that hispanicOrLatinoEthnicity is the only field marked as true for the student in the demographics.csv, all other values should be marked as false. > - Missing demographic data - gender: Confirm sex is populated in the demographics.csv. > For OneRoster 1.1 only male or female are accepted values. > For OneRoster 1.2 male, female, other, or unspecified are accepted values. > - Issues with lineitems.csv: Please mark as “absent” in the manifest.csv. This file cannot sync to Clever. > - Issues with the results.csv: Please mark as “absent” in the manifest.csv. This file cannot sync to Clever. >   If you have any questions, please reach out to  Clever Support ! We are happy to help!
