section: SSO (Saved Passwords): Converting external link apps to Saved Passwords apps
text:
Title

SSO (Saved Passwords): Converting external link apps to Saved Passwords apps

URL Name

115002016328

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/115002016328?language=en_US#h_eee83ada-24f1-40e3-b83e-309e87c22cd3) 
2. [Instructions](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/115002016328?language=en_US#h_c251ba87-f81b-41b9-a1ec-43bca0eb3e86)

So you're ready to start using [Saved Passwords applications](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/234746488) in your Clever Portal! You've [installed the Clever browser extension](https://support.clever.com/s/article/360019869511) for all of your students, added the apps you want in your [Clever Dashboard](https://schools.clever.com/), and tested them out to make sure everything's working like a charm.

But, if you're like many districts, you've already created [custom links](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/205875568) for some of the applications in your portal. How do you make a seamless transition from those links to the new, shiny Saved Passwords applications?

title: SSO (Saved Passwords): Converting external link apps to Saved Passwords apps
heading_path: SSO (Saved Passwords): Converting external link apps to Saved Passwords apps
text:
1. See who the link is shared with by going to your portal and clicking edit on the relevant link:

![Modify Link screen](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000Ti8v&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000004aq7s)
2. Add the app you'd like to change from a link to an app at [Clever Dashboard > Applications > Add Applications](https://schools.clever.com/applications/add). Click *Request App.* Set up the sharing rules, and [set the credentials for the app if an SSO (Saved Passwords) app](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/234746488) .

![Add app page with IXL shown, with highlight on Request app link](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000Ti8v&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000004aq8b)
3. Delete the link you replaced as an app in your Clever Portal by going to [Clever Dashboard > Portal > Organize district Portal,](https://schools.clever.com/portal/customize) clicking the three vertical dots next to the link, select **Edit link,** then select **Remove link** from the modal. 
 ![Modify Link screen with Remove Link highlighted](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000Ti8v&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000WxzZi)

Just like that, you've replaced your custom link with a Saved Passwords application! If you'd like to make your users' experience even more seamless, you can [bulk upload their credentials](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/234973187) so they don't even have to type them in the first time they use the application.

title: Troubleshooting: Issues with Shared Devices
text:
> Important: Title Troubleshooting: Issues with Shared Devices URL Name 115002315868 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Best practices for logging out of Clever and connected apps 3. Logging out of Clever on any device 4. Logging out of Clever and applications on iOS 5. Shared devices notifications 6. Time-out and inactivity
> Overview
> When logging out, it's important to remember that single sign-on (SSO) can actually be broken down to up to 3 (three) separate login processes behind the scenes:  
> Identity provider login (e.g. Google) Clever login Application login (e.g. Khan Academy)
> If a student is accessing a shared device, we recommend that they log out of each application and device after their session. Therefore users should log out of the application, the Clever portal, and the identity provider (Google, ADFS, etc.) per the steps below:  
> Best practices for logging out of Clever and connected apps
> To ensure that a user's user session is ended before logging another user in, please follow these steps: Step 1:  Log the user out of any learning applications
> Step 2: Log the user out of Clever  
> From the   Clever Portal , click on the user's name in top right corner, select   Log out
> Step 3: Log out of Google (if applicable) or the district's Identity Provider
> Step 4: Log in to Clever as new user  
> Navigate to   https://clever.com/login   and search for the new user's school. Once the school is located, they will log in with their Badge or credentials. They should now be successfully logged in to their account!

title: Troubleshooting: Issues with Shared Devices
text:
> Logging out of Clever on any device
> Users can log out of the Clever portal by navigating to the top right corner of their portal (where they can find their name), and then selecting 'Log Out':  
>    
> Please note: If your school organization is using Google as your identity provider (IdP), you can apply a setting from your Clever Dashboard > Authentication > SSO settings page that will automatically log users out of Google when they log out of Clever. This is helpful in situations where multiple users are logging into Clever on a shared device. For more information, see this article . > Logging out of Clever and applications on iOS
> On an iOS device, double-click the home button (on newer iPad Pros, swipe up from the bottom of the display) to expose the application thumbnails. Swipe up on the Clever app and any learning apps that were launched. This will end a user's session when the device is shared. > Shared devices notifications
> On certain devices, upon initial sign in to Clever, users will be asked whether or not they should be remembered on the device. If they select No, only I use it , then their Clever session will remain intact for 2 hours. > If the user selects Yes, Clever will treat the device as a shared device. In this case, users will be prompted with an option to sign in as a different user after 10 minutes of inactivity on the Clever portal. > Clever Tip: This feature gives users who share devices the option to log in to another account, in case logout best practices weren't followed. > Time-out and inactivity
> Logging out
>  
> Users are logged out of Clever automatically if:   
> If a user is inactive in Clever for 24 hours, they will automatically be logged out. Currently, there is no way to customize this behavior. The browser is  quit (e.g. "Quit Google Chrome " ). Closing the browser window will not log the user out of Clever. >   If you have any questions, please reach out to  Clever support ! We are happy to help!

title: For Clever Admins: Applications - What types of apps are on Clever?
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Applications - What types of apps are on Clever?
text:
Clever supports several types of district learning applications. This article outlines the differences between each type of application.

Most district applications are added by district admins to Clever via the [Clever Dashboard > Applications > Add Applications](https://schools.clever.com/applications/add) page. From this page, applications can be sorted by integration type to make it easier to locate the right one for your district.

![App types in Clever](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000T2BJ&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000004amaq)

Clever is available at no cost to schools and districts - they do not pay Clever to utilize our platform. However, some learning applications do require certain fees to use their products through Clever (e.g. licensing or subscription fees). The 'Request Applications' list can also be sorted by 'Free' which provides a list of learning applications that are completely free to districts.

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000T2BJ&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000288Lv) For more information, please visit: [How do I add or remove a district application?](https://support.clever.com/hc/en-us/articles/203114997)

The following application types can only be added by a Clever Admin:

- Rostering
- Single Sign-on (SSO)
- Rostering & Single Sign-on (SSO)
- SSO (SAML)
- SSO (Saved Passwords)

The following application types can only be added to Clever by a teacher:

- Library 
 *Clever Admins can recommend library apps. [Learn more](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360042933711).*

Once an application is launched or requested, you can find out what the application type is on the [Clever Dashboard > Applications > My Applications](https://schools.clever.com/applications) page under "App Type."

![App Type](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000T2BJ&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000VpsCb)

---

Rostering applications support [Secure Sync Rostering](https://support.clever.com/hc/en-us/articles/236113588). This means the rostering data from your district's student information system (SIS) is synced to Clever, which is then synced to your connected rostering applications. Up-to-date rostering data is maintained in your connected learning applications by the secure transfer of your SIS data from Clever to the applications.

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000T2BJ&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000003BUZG)

---

title: For Clever Admins: Applications - What types of apps are on Clever?
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Applications - What types of apps are on Clever?
text:
These applications are integrated with Clever and [support single sign-on](https://support.clever.com/hc/en-us/articles/203166807) (SSO). These applications do not receive rostering data from Clever.

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000T2BJ&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000003BUZV)

In addition to traditional SSO apps, we also offer SSO ([SAML](https://www.cloudflare.com/learning/access-management/what-is-saml/)) apps.

These apps are integrated with Clever for Single Sign-On (SSO) but require additional setup in order to authenticate users. Most SSO (SAML) applications have documentation available from Clever or the application partner to guide the setup process. SSO (SAML) applications do not provide applications access to rostering data.

If interested in rostering for the application, please search for the app partner's "Rostering" application if available, as some SSO (SAML) apps offer both SSO and Rostering. If offered they are two separate apps you must add to Clever.

---

These applications support both rostering and SSO! This means all rostering and single sign-on data is synced to the application by Clever.

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000T2BJ&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000003BUZp)

---

title: For Clever Admins: Applications - What types of apps are on Clever?
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Applications - What types of apps are on Clever?
text:
The [Clever Library](https://support.clever.com/hc/en-us/articles/360013488672) is a place for teachers to discover, add, and review new resources for their classrooms. Resources in the Library can be added by teachers to their [Teacher Pages](https://support.clever.com/hc/en-us/articles/360001158323) for easy access by students.

Library apps provide lightweight rostering and are able to create accounts for students/teachers! They are the easiest and most secure way for teachers to add applications for their classrooms and provide a seamless SSO experience.

District administrators have the ability to recommend and block Library resources, or disable the Library feature completely for their district. Information on managing the Library at the district-level can be found [here](https://support.clever.com/hc/en-us/articles/360015683471).

---

title: For Clever Admins: Applications - What types of apps are on Clever?
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Applications - What types of apps are on Clever?
text:
SSO (Saved Passwords) applications are apps that don't currently have a rostering or single sign-on (SSO) integration with Clever, but can still be accessed via SSO through the Clever Portal. This means districts can provide users with a seamless SSO experience for almost any learning application even if it is not an existing Clever partner.

With the SSO (Saved Passwords) option, rostering data and user accounts are not synced to the app by Clever. This means they must be created within the application in advance, and user login credentials need to be manually set by the district admin, or by the users themselves. Clever will securely store these credentials so district users are logged into the applications automatically via single sign-on through Clever.

[Click here](https://support.clever.com/hc/en-us/articles/234746488) to read more about SSO (Saved Passwords) applications.

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000T2BJ&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000003BUZg)

---

Custom external links work much like bookmarks by bringing district users directly to the application's login page where they can enter their credentials for that application. These types of applications are not integrated with Clever. 
[Click here](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115002942963?language=en_US) to read more about how to add custom external links.

---

If you have any questions about the types of learning applications in Clever, please reach out to [Clever Support](https://support.clever.com/hc/en-us/articles/360001041326)! We are happy to help!

title: Clever Badges: Piloting at your district
heading_path: Clever Badges: Piloting at your district
text:
[Clever Badges](https://clever.com/products/badges) make it even easier for your students to access their learning applications through Clever so that your teachers can spend more time instructing and less time troubleshooting username and password errors.

Clever Badges are offered at **no charge** to districts and only require that your student’s laptop or desktop device have a webcam enabled. Students will go to [clever.com/badges](http://clever.com/badges) or your district's login page and then hold their Badge up to the camera to log in.

If your students are using Chromebooks, or Windows devices with Active Directory logins, Clever Badges can be used to log students into their computer, Clever, and connected apps all at once! To set up these integrations, navigate to your [Clever Dashboard > Authentication > Badges](https://schools.clever.com/badges/overview) page. Then select the Chromebook or Windows tab depending, and follow the instructions in the wizard (this should take about 10 minutes).

title: Clever Badges: Piloting at your district
heading_path: Clever Badges: Piloting at your district
text:
1. **Start small**. Pick one or two elementary school sites at which you can initiate your pilot. Our distribution process allows you to select which schools should participate. Include a media specialist, school site leader, or teacher that embraces the adoption of new technology to help you champion this new tool!
2. **Educate your teachers.** [Using this helpful article](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/236004408), you can show teachers how to generate badges so that they can help maintain Badges for new students.
3. **Make them fun and easy.** Whether you place your badges on student folders or create lanyards for students to wear around their necks, ensure your Badges will be be easy to use and won’t be easily lost or damaged.

Start now! Get a head start so that you can roll out more broadly for next back to school.

title: For Clever Admins: Student Contacts
text:
> Important: Title For Clever Admins: Student Contacts URL Name 115002711943 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Syncing student contacts to Clever 3. SFTP and SIS-managed SFTP Syncs 4. Clever-Managed Auto Syncs 5. Duplicate Contacts 6. Contact types
> Overview
> Student contacts are typically parents, family, guardians or close friends of students who can be contacted by the school or district in the event of an emergency or other important communication need. Clever supports multiple contacts for each student. Once in Clever, this data can be synced to your district's connected applications. > To review student contact data in Clever, admins can navigate to the Clever Dashboard > Data Browser > Contacts tab. >  
> Syncing student contacts to Clever
> Depending on if your district is syncing rostering data to Clever via a Clever-managed auto sync, SIS-Managed auto sync, or SFTP sync, student contact data will vary. This section details the requirements and processes for the different sync types. > SFTP and SIS-managed SFTP Syncs
> For SFTP syncs  and SIS-managed SFTP syncs , the following seven fields (i.e. columns) can be added to the students.csv upload to Clever:  
> Required fields:
> Contact\_type  (required):   Primary, Secondary, Parent/Guardian, Emergency, Family, Other . Contact\_name (required):    The name of the contact. > Optional:
> Contact\_sis\_id: The unique identifier for the contact Contact\_relationship :  Parent, Grandparent, Self, Aunt/Uncle, Sibling, Other Contact\_phone : 10- or 11-digit phone number without any characters (e.g. parentheses, dashes) Contact\_phone\_type:   Cell, Home, Work, Other Contact\_email : Contact email address in the standard email format of username@demo.com  
> Multiple student contacts:
> For students with multiple contacts, create multiple rows for the student; one for each contact. Each row will contain the identical student details (e.g.

title: For Clever Admins: Student Contacts
text:
student\_id, student\_number, etc.), but will have different contact information on each row. >  
> Clever Tip:  There is no limit to the number of student contacts that can be synced to Clever via an SFTP sync! > Clever-Managed Auto Syncs
> These are the required and optional fields for syncing student contacts to Clever:
> Required:
> Contact\_type  (required):   Primary, Secondary, Parent/Guardian, Emergency, Family, Other . Contact\_name (required):    The name of the contact. > Optional:
> Contact\_relationship :  Parent, Grandparent, Self, Aunt/Uncle, Sibling, Other Contact\_phone : 10- or 11-digit phone number without any characters (e.g. parentheses, dashes) Contact\_phone\_type:   Cell, Home, Work, Other Contact\_email : Contact email address in the standard email format of username@demo.com  
>  Find your Clever-Managed Auto Sync below for instructions specific to your SIS! > Aeries
> We pull all contacts associated with a student from the following fields on the Student endpoints of the Aeries API:
> CON.FN + CON.LN CON.EM CON.CP CON.RL CON.OR
> Infinite Campus API Sync
> By default, the Infinite Campus API sync pulls student contacts from the following fields:
> - Clever Field: Infinite Campus Field
> - Contact\_name: identity.firstName + identity.lastName
> - Contact\_type: This is flagged within IC: Guardian/Relative = Census >  Relationships
> - Contact\_phone: contact.homePhone
> - Contact\_email: contact.email
> Customization of the IC API sync is not available at this time. > Illuminate
> If you have questions about student contact data for your Illuminate Auto Sync, please reach out to our support team for more information.

title: For Clever Admins: Student Contacts
text:
> PowerSchool
> By default, Clever pulls student contact info from the following fields in PowerSchool:
> Emerg Contact 1 Emerg Contact 2 Emerg Contact 3 Emerg Phone 1 Emerg Phone 2 Emerg Phone 3 Emerg 1 Ptype Emerg 2 Ptype Emerg 3 Ptype Emerg 1 Rel Emerg 2 Rel Emerg 3 Rel
> The PowerSchool Auto Sync can be customized so that Clever pulls student contacts from different fields than those listed above. Visit our PowerSchool Help Center article for instructions on requesting a custom mapping! > SchoolInsight
> If you have questions about student contact data for your SchoolInsight Auto Sync, please reach out to our support team for more information. > Skyward Auto Sync
> Clever pulls eight fields for Skyward emergency contact, forming cohesive student contacts in Clever:
> E1\_Full\_Name E1\_Relation\_Dsc E1\_Cell\_Phone E1\_Pri\_Phone E1\_Street\_Addr E1\_City E1\_State E1\_Zip\_Code
> It is not possible to have more than one contact record per student. However, we can customize the sync to pull from other fields instead. > For example: If you want to use Parent\_Name and Parent\_Phone instead of E1 Full Name and E1 Cell Phone, we can do that! >  
> Skyward API Sync
> Clever syncs student contacts from the guardian endpoint and pulls multiple contacts per student. We can customize the Auto Sync to pull student contact information from different fields, as long as those fields are accessible via Skyward’s API. Contact Clever support for more information! >  
> Duplicate Contacts
> Our system will attempt to merge contacts to prevent duplicate contacts in your Clever data. The best way to prevent duplicate contacts is to sync contact\_sis\_id for each contact.

title: For Clever Admins: Student Contacts
text:
If a contact\_sis\_id is not available, Clever will attempt to merge contacts in the following logic:
> If contact\_email is available, we will merge contacts by matching on:  contact\_name + contact\_email If email is not available and contact\_phone is available, we will merge contacts by matching on: contact\_name + contact\_phone If neither contact\_email or contact\_phone are available, we will try to merge contacts by matching on student\_id + contact\_name + contact\_type + contact\_relationship + contact\_phone\_type
> The above logic relies on exact alphanumeric matches, including case sensitivity. For example, Clever  will not  match "John Doe" and "john doe". > Contact types
> When Clever normalizes your contact data, we look to the following keywords to match to Parent/Guardian, Emergency, Primary, Secondary, Family, and Other in Clever:
> - Contact Type: Accepted keywords
> - Parent/Guardian: guardian mother father parent mom dad stepmother stepfather stepparent
> - Emergency: emergency
> - Primary: primary
> - Secondary: secondary
> - Family: family aunt uncle relative grandmother grandfather grandparent sibling
> - Other: other
> If Clever is unable to match a keyword to a contact type, that contact type will be blank in Clever.

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/115002717307?language=en_US#Overview) 
2. [New login page](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/115002717307?language=en_US#header2) 
3. [Login Directions](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/115002717307?language=en_US#LoginDirections) 
*•*[Log in with Clever](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/115002717307?language=en_US#LoginDirections) 
*•*[Log in with Google](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/115002717307?language=en_US#LoginWithGoogle) 
*•*[Log in with Active Directory](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/115002717307?language=en_US#LoginActiveDirectory) 
4. [Backup Codes](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/115002717307?language=en_US#BackupCode) 
5. [Setting up a backup login method for Active Directory, Entra ID, Google, or Clever passwords](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/115002717307?language=en_US#backup) 
6. [Logging out](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/115002717307?language=en_US#LoggingOut) 
7. [How do I get help?](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/115002717307?language=en_US#HowHelp)

This article is an overview of how students can get logged into Clever, and some basic steps for troubleshooting. If you are having trouble getting logged in, please reach out to your teacher directly. Clever’s support team can’t help if you don’t know your login credentials.

1. To get into Clever, go to your school’s Clever login page. If you don’t know the page, visit [clever.com/login](http://clever.com/login) and search for your school or district. If you can’t find it, ask your teacher for help!
2. To log in, use the username and password your school gave you. It might be your student number, ID, or email. If you’re not sure what they are, ask your teacher for help.
3. From your Clever Portal, click on the application icon you’d like to use!

---

Starting February 3, Clever is getting a new login page! If your login page looks a little different, don’t worry. Everything still works the same, so you can log in just like you always do. Check out the picture below to see what it could look like. Your screen might look a little different and that’s okay. You can still log in like usual.

![New login page with 2 panel view](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000WVlR&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000aNjcP)

---

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000WVlR&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028DQ8)

If you are using the **Log in with Clever** button, you’ll need to use the username and password from your school. It might be your student number, ID, or email address.

If you see the error ***Invalid username or password***, this means that the username and/or password you have entered aren’t correct for your Clever account. **Please ask your teacher for help.**

---

title: For Students: Troubleshooting - Logging in to Clever
heading_path: For Students: Troubleshooting - Logging in to Clever
text:
![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000WVlR&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028DQD)

If you are using the **Log in with Google** button, you’ll need to use your school Google email and password to log into your Clever account.

If you see the error message "*Wrong password. Try again'*, this means that either your email or password is incorrect. **Please ask your teacher for help.**

If you see a message saying **“We couldn't log you in, we can't find a Clever account for the email** ***[xxxx@example.com](mailto:xxxx@example.com)*****,”** it means the email you used isn’t the one linked to your Clever account. Make sure you’re using the email your school gave you. If you’re sure you’re using the email your school gave you, please reach out to your teacher directly for more help. Clever cannot provide your login credentials.

If you see any other message saying **We couldn’t log you in,** please contact your teacher for help. Provide them with as much information as you can about the error such as any other description of the error, the copyable Reference ID, and Admin troubleshooting steps. Clever **cannot** provide your login credentials.

---

title: For Students: Troubleshooting - Logging in to Clever
heading_path: For Students: Troubleshooting - Logging in to Clever
text:
![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000WVlR&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028DQN)

If you click the **Log in with Active Directory** button, you’ll be taken to sign in with your school account through Active Directory Federation Services or Microsoft360. Use the username and password your school gave you. This is usually the same email and password you use to log on to school computers.

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000WVlR&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028DQS)

If you see a message saying **We couldn’t log you in, We can’t find a Clever account for the email or username** it means the email or username you used isn’t linked to your Clever account. Make sure you’re using the email or username your school gave you. If you’re sure you’re using the email or username your school gave you, please reach out to your teacher directly for more help. Clever cannot provide your login credentials.

If you see any other message saying **We couldn’t log you in,** please contact your teacher for help. Provide them with as much information as you can about the error such as any other description of the error, the copyable Reference ID, and Admin troubleshooting steps. Clever **cannot** provide your login credentials.

If you click on **Log in with Active Directory** or **Log in with Office365** and the login page fails to load, try [clearing your cache](https://support.google.com/accounts/answer/32050?co=GENIE.Platform%3DDesktop&hl=en). If accessing Clever from a Chromebook, we recommend [signing out](https://support.google.com/chromebook/answer/3420029?hl=en) of the Chromebook and [restarting the device](https://support.google.com/chromebook/answer/3420029?hl=en).

---

If you don’t know your Clever login info, your teacher can give you a Backup Code to help you log in. Just click the **Get help signing in!** link on the Clever login page, then choose **Students: Log in with a Backup Code**. Enter the code from your teacher and click **Log in**.

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000WVlR&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028DRk)

---

If your school has set it up, you can use a backup method like email, security questions, or your phone number to get back into your Active Directory, Entra ID, Google Workspace, and Clever passwords accounts right from the Clever login screen! This helps if you’re having trouble with your password.

Find our step-by-step student guide for [account recovery and password resets here](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001663).

---

If your school has set it up, you can easily change all of your account passwords at one time through Clever! Read more about [resetting your passwords here](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001663).

---

To log out of Clever, navigate to the Clever Portal, hover over your name in the top-right corner, and click **Log out**.

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000WVlR&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028DQh)

Users are also logged out of Clever automatically after:

- 24 hours of inactivity
- The browser is *quit (e.g. "Quit Google Chrome**"**).* 
 Closing the browser window will not log the user out of Clever.

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000WVlR&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028DQr)

---

**Need help?**

Your school manages your login info. If you’re not sure of your login details, see an error message, or something isn’t working, ask your teacher or the district’s help desk for help.

You can find the tech support contact info on the Clever login screen, where you’ll see an email or phone number. If you don’t see it, reach out to your teacher.

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000WVlR&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028DQw)

**Still can’t log in?** Ask your teacher for help! They can help you using the directions found [here](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/222933888).

section: ¿Cómo iniciar una sesión en Clever como estudiante?
text:
1. Para iniciar sesión en el Portal de Clever, vaya a su página inicio de sesión Clever del Distrito. Si no sabe cuál es el distrito de la página de inicio de sesión de su Clever, usted puede ir a[Clever.com/login](http://www.clever.com/login) y buscar su escuela. Si no puede encontrar su escuela, **pregunte a su maestro dónde debe ir para iniciar una sesión en Clever.**
2. Inicie sesión con su nombre de usuario y contraseña del distrito. Su nombre de usuario y contraseña son configurados por su distrito escolar. Pueden ser su número de estudiante, identificación o dirección de correo electrónico. Para obtener instrucciones específicas sobre cómo usar las contraseñas de Clever, Google, o Active Directory, continúe leyendo.
3. Desde su Portal de Clever, haga clic en el icono de la aplicación que le gustaría usar.
4. ¡Empezar a trabajar!

A continuación se presentan instrucciones para iniciar sesión en Clever con métodos de inicio de sesión específicos: Contraseñas Clever, Googley Sistema Active Directory.

section: Iniciar sesión en Clever con contraseñas Clever
text:
Si está utilizando el botón '**Iniciar sesión con Clever**', ingrese su nombre de usuario y contraseña del distrito. Su nombre de usuario y contraseña son configurados por su distrito escolar. Pueden ser su número de estudiante, identificación o dirección de correo electrónico.

Si ve el error ('nombre de usuario ***o contraseña no válidos'), esto significa que el nombre de usuario*** y/o contraseña que ingresó no son correctos para su cuenta Clever.

Puede hacer clic en el enlace '¡**Obtenga ayuda para iniciar sesión!'para**  restablecer su contraseña utilizando el correo electrónico vinculado a su cuenta Clever. Por favor, tenga en cuenta que no todos los distritos le permiten a los estudiantes restablecer su contraseña. Si no ve la opción para restablecer la contraseña, o si esto no resuelve el problema, por favor, **póngase en contacto con su maestro o superior para obtener ayuda con su nombre de usuario y contraseña Clever**

Iniciar sesión en Clever con Google
section: Iniciar sesión en Clever con Google
text:
![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000WVn3&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000002lYnQ)

Si está utilizando el botón '**Iniciar sesión usando Google**', se le redirigirá para iniciar sesión en el correo electrónico de Google vinculado a su cuenta Clever (el correo electrónico de su escuela). Tenga en cuenta: el uso de su correo electrónico personal de Google no le hará iniciar sesión en Clever.

Si ve el mensaje de error ('***Contraseña incorrecta. Inténtelo de nuevo o haga clic en ' Olvidé mi contraseña' (para restablecerla***), esto significa que la contraseña que ingresó para su correo electrónico de Google es incorrecta. Deberá ingresar la contraseña correcta para su cuenta de Google o utilizar el enlace"¿**Olvidó su contraseña?**" para restablecer la contraseña de su cuenta de Google.

Tenga en cuenta que no todos los distritos permiten a los estudiantes restablecer su propia contraseña. Si no ve la opción para restablecer la contraseña, o si esto no resuelve el problema, **póngase en contacto con su maestro o principal para obtener ayuda con su correo electrónico y contraseña de Google**.

Si ve el siguiente mensaje de error (¡***Uh oh! No pudimos autenticarnos usando Google correo electrónico:**[**xxxx@example.com**](mailto:xxxx@example.com')'),* esto significa que el Google el correo electrónico en el que inició sesión no es el correo electrónico que está vinculado a su cuenta Clever. Asegúrese de estar utilizando la cuenta de correo electrónico de Google de su escuela.

Si todavía tiene problemas al usar su cuenta school Google, por **favor pregunte a su maestro o el director para hacerle saber el correo electrónico correcto de la escuela que debe usar para iniciar una sesión en Clever**.Si todavía están viendo un problema, pueden contactar a soporte de Clever.

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000WVn3&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000002lYnV)

Si está utilizando el botón '**Iniciar sesión usando el Sistema Active Directory**', será redirigido para iniciar sesión en su cuenta escolar a través de los Servicios de la Federación del Sistema Active Directory. El nombre de usuario y la contraseña para ADFS (Servicios Federales del Directorio Activo) son gestionados por la administración de su distrito.

Si aparece un mensaje similar a '***ID de usuario o contraseña incorrecta**'*, tendrá que comunicarse con su maestro o director para obtener ayuda con la información de acceso correcta para su cuenta.

section: Usar un código de respaldo para iniciar una sesión en Clever
text:
Si no conoce su información de inicio de sesión para Clever, su maestro puede darle un código de respaldo para iniciar sesión en su Portal de Clever. Para hacer esto, haga clic en '¡**Obtenga ayuda para iniciar sesión!** ' enlace desde la página de inicio de sesión Clever, luego haga clic **en 'Estudiantes: inicie sesión con un código de respaldo**'. Luego, puede ingresar el código de respaldo que obtiene de su maestro/a y hacer clic en '**Iniciar sesión**' para acceder a su Portal de Clever.

**¿Aún no puede iniciar sesión?** ¡Pida ayuda a su maestro! Ellos podrán ayudarle a usar las instrucciones que se encuentran [aquí](https://support.clever.com/hc/en-us/articles/222933888).

**Consejo de Clever:** si está buscando ayuda para iniciar sesión para otros usuarios, consulte lo siguiente:

text:
Title

Clever Portal: Overview

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/115002720807?language=en_US#header1) 
2. [What's the Clever Portal?](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/115002720807?language=en_US#header2) 
3. [How do students, teachers, and staff access Clever Portal?](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/115002720807?language=en_US#header3)

This article provides a brief overview of Clever Portal and how users access it. For detailed information on how to customize and use Clever Portal, please reference the [Related articles](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/115002720807?language=en_US#relatedarticles) section below.

---

title: Clever Portal: Overview
text:
Clever Portal gives students, teachers, and staff a single, secure login for all digital resources. Each student, teacher, and staff member can access a personalized Portal using a single set of login credentials, or for students, a [Clever Badge](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/220213907), to single sign-on (SSO) into every learning application they use—[even those that don't yet roster with Clever.](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/234746488)

Clever Portal:

- **Is intentionally designed for teachers:** Clever Portal is intuitive for teachers to navigate and quickly access the edtech the district has already purchased.
- **Works everywhere:** One username and password unlock any connection application or device. Clever offers SSO for thousands of resources, while personalized portals show only what’s relevant for each user.
- **Provides personalized, secure access:** Clever uses data directly from your student information system (SIS) to deliver a customized experience for each user, eliminating the need for extra setup steps. Students easily find resources and immerse themselves in the learning process.

![Example Clever Portal](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000SGLB&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000003BG6x)

---

Students, teachers, and staff can access their Clever Portal by:

1. Navigating to your district’s unique Portal URL.
2. Typing in their district username and password, or [using their Badge](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/220213907).
3. Users will be logged into their Clever Portal and can access all their resources with a single click - no additional logins are required.

You configure user's credentials for the Portal during SSO setup. [Click here](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/204982938) to learn how to set up SSO.

---

title: Custom Data: Sections
text:
> Important: Title Custom Data: Sections URL Name 115002764923 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Creating individual custom sections 3. Creating multiple custom sections via upload 4. Editing custom sections 5. Deleting custom sections 6. Sharing custom sections with apps
> Overview
> Custom sections are a great way to create rostering data within Clever that doesn't exist in your district's student information system (SIS). This can be helpful in cases such as summer school, intervention groups, after-school programs, and more! > Custom sections will  not  overwrite any sections being synced to Clever by a district's SIS, nor can they be overwritten by sections synced by the SIS. Custom sections are also indistinguishable from synced SIS sections in most Clever-integrated applications. >   Only Clever Admins or School Tech Leads can create custom sections in Clever. For more details about Clever roles, please visit:  Clever Roles: Overview of Roles & Permissions
>  
> Creating individual custom sections
> There are two ways to create custom sections in Clever. The first method is creating individual sections from the Clever Dashboard > Data sources > Custom data   page. > Step 1: Add section info
> Navigate to Data sources > Custom data. Click  Add custom data > Sections . > Begin by entering a section name and the associated school location. > We recommend being as descriptive as possible with section names (e.g., course\_name - teacher\_last\_name - period). > Enter the  class information (i.e., grade, subject, and period). > If desired, enter the optional  term and course information. These fields may be helpful with identifying the section in Clever and connected applications. > Enter an optional section expiration date if you want the section to be automatically deleted on the selected date. Once all required fields are populated, click  Next to proceed.

title: Custom Data: Sections
text:
>  
> Step 2: Add Teachers
> Click the primary teacher who should be associated with the section. Clever allows up to nine co-teachers for each custom section. > Please note: If a teacher is not yet in Clever or in your SIS, please see this article for instructions on creating a custom teacher in Clever:  Custom Data: Teachers. >  
> Clever Tip: To select teachers from a school location other than the one where the section is located, click the white search box to the right to bring up a list of schools. Select additional school location(s) to bring up a list of teachers from selected school(s). >         
> Click  Next to proceed. >  
> IMPORTANT  Note that not all applications support co-teachers. We recommend checking with the application’s support team to confirm if co-teachers are a supported feature. >  
> Step 3: Select Primary Teacher
> Next, indicate which of the teachers will be the primary teacher for the section. If an application does not support co-teachers, the primary teacher will be the one associated with the custom section in applications. Click  Next to proceed. > Step 4: Add Students
> Select which students should be enrolled in the section. > Please note:  Clever can support up to 10,000 students enrolled in a single section. However, Clever can only support up to 100 students enrolled in a single section for  Teacher Pages   to function correctly. > Clever Tip:  To select students from a school location other than where the section is located, click the white search box to the right to select students from other schools. You can further filter the list of students by selecting only certain grade levels. Please visit Custom Data: Students   if the student is not yet in Clever or your SIS. > Click  Next to proceed. > Step 5: Preview
> Review the custom section to ensure the details look correct before clicking  Create Section . > Please note: Please allow 10-15 minutes for custom data to process.

title: Custom Data: Sections
text:
Though Clever will not send an email notification that the data has been processed, the results will be viewable on the Sync page in the Clever Dashboard. > Step 6: Share with applications
> Once the custom section is available in Clever, you can share it with connected applications. Please see this article  for details. >  
> Creating multiple custom sections via upload
> Clever Admins can also create custom sections in bulk by uploading two CSV files ( sections.csv and enrollments.csv ) to Clever. The custom sections file will create the section, while the enrollments file will associate students to that section. > Please note: Bulk uploading custom sections will not impact custom sections that were created manually from the  Custom data  page. >  
> Step 1: Create your sections.csv and enrollments.csv
> Download the CSV file templates for uploading custom data by clicking  Download , and then use the instructions below to modify the sections.csv and enrollments.csv. Please ensure the files are named  sections.csv and enrollments.csv before uploading them, or Clever will not process them successfully. >  
> Sections.csv
> - Column Header: Notes
> - School\_id: Must match the school\_id (i.e., SIS ID) for a school that exists in Clever
> - Section\_id: Must be a unique ID that is not associated with other sections
> - Name: Unique name for the section (e.g., Algebra 101 - Jones - Period 1A)
> - Teacher\_id: Must match a teacher\_ID  (i.e., teacher SIS ID) for a teacher that exists in Clever
> - Course\_name: (e.g., Algebra, Geometry, English, Creative Writing, etc.)
> - Subject: Subjects should adhere to Clever's specifications
> - Term\_name: If creating custom sections for summer, include "Summer" in this field for easier data sharing
>   
>   The fields listed above are required , but you can also include additional optional fields listed in Clever's  SFTP specification  for the sections.csv .

title: Custom Data: Sections
text:
Please note that extension fields are not supported in the custom sections.csv. For information on how to add extension data to custom sections, please see our article For Clever Admins: Syncing custom (i.e. extension) fields to Clever . >  
> Enrollments.csv
> - Column Header: Note
> - School\_id: Must match the school\_id (i.e., SIS ID) for a school that exists in Clever
> - Section\_id: Must match the section\_id in the sections.csv file
> - Student\_id: Must match an existing student\_id (i.e., SIS ID) for a student in Clever
>  
>  
> Uploading the sections.csv and enrollments.csv 
> There are two ways for districts to upload  sections.csv and enrollments.csv  files to Clever. > Option 1 (Recommended): Manual Upload
> Navigate to the Clever Dashboard > Data sources > Custom data page. Click  Add custom data at the top right, and then choose Upload records . >  
> Option 2: Uploading the files to your district's SFTP folder
> The second option for uploading the sections.csv and enrollments.csv is to access your district's Clever SFTP folder and manually upload the files. > Please note:  This option is available to all schools. If your primary sync type is not SFTP sync type , please reach out to Clever support for assistance with gaining access to your own Clever SFTP Directory. Visit this article for additional details. > To upload files to your district's SFTP folder, please:
> Navigate to your Clever Dashboard > Data sources > SIS sync > Settings tab to locate your district's SFTP Settings and corresponding credentials. > Log in to your Clever SFTP box, and create a new subfolder named  customsections .

title: Custom Data: Sections
text:
> For instructions on accessing your district's SFTP folder, please visit: SFTP Syncs: Uploading data to Clever  
> Upload the  sections.csv and enrollments.csv to the customsections subfolder             
> Once the files finish processing (within 15-20 minutes), you'll be able to see the new custom sections from your Clever Dashboard > Data sources > Custom data   page. >  
> Editing custom sections
> You may need to edit a custom section for several reasons, such as changes to the student roster, teacher changes or removals from Clever, or adjustments to the sections term dates. If you remove the teacher assigned to a custom section from Clever, you'll need to edit the section to assign a new primary teacher. If you don't add a new primary teacher, the section will display an error stating  Teacher is not accessible. > To edit a custom section for any reason:
> Navigate to your Clever Dashboard > Data sources > Custom data page. From the Sections tab, click the pencil icon under the Actions column to the right of the section name. This will open a custom sections wizard which allows you to make any needed adjustments. >        
> Clever Tip:  Clever Admins can also edit sections by searching for them using the Clever search bar to locate the section and then clicking the  Edit section option. >  
> Deleting custom sections
> To delete a custom section, navigate to your Clever Dashboard > Data sources > Custom data page. From the Sections tab, click the trash icon under the Actions column to the right of the section name. > To delete All  custom sections in bulk, you can upload blank sections.csv and enrollments.csv  files, including the column headers , to your  custom data page  or your district's SFTP folder, if applicable. > Please note: Uploading blank files over custom data only deletes bulk uploaded custom data and not manually created custom data.

Manually created custom data will need to be deleted manually by clicking on the trash can under the Actions column in the Custom Records . >  
> Sharing custom sections with apps
> Custom sections are shared with applications in the same way that sections synced from your district's SIS are shared. Once a custom section is available (within 15-20 minutes of creating it), we recommend reviewing any application sharing permissions to ensure the section is shared as needed. For more information on sharing permissions, see this article . If you have any questions about custom sections, please contact  Clever support ! We are happy to help! >  
> Related Articles:
> Custom Data: Overview (i.e., sections, students, contacts, teachers, staff & fields) Custom Data: Students Custom Data: Teachers

This article contains the following:

3. [Deleting external links](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/115002942963?language=en_US#header3)

In addition to Clever applications, Clever Portal supports adding links to other digital resources that are used in the classroom. External links work just like bookmarks, providing one-click navigation to digital resources. You can customize external link visibility based on user type, grade level, and school sites.

External links do not authenticate users into the linked website. If you would like to authenticate users into the website, you can request Clever build a SSO (Saved Passwords) application by visiting [https://schools.clever.com/applications/request.](https://schools.clever.com/applications/request)

If you’d like to add links to any Google resources, [please see this article](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001597).

---

title: For Clever Admins: Clever Portal - Adding External Links (Hyperlinks)
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Clever Portal - Adding External Links (Hyperlinks)
text:
To add a link:

1. Navigate to your [Clever Dashboard > Portal > Organize district portal](https://schools.clever.com/portal/customize).
2. Click **Add to the Portal.**
3. From the dropdown menu select **Add a link.**
4. A modal will pop-up for adding the link. Select an icon or upload a custom icon (optimal icon size should be 200x200).
5. Fill out the required fields for the link Title and URL.
6. Select which user types, grades, and schools you would like to add the custom link for. Please note that if adding for selected schools, the link will only display for the user if the selected school matches the user's primary school association.
7. Choose one or multiple categories to organize the link into.
8. Click **Add.**
9. Be sure to also click ****Publish Changes** i**n the top right of the Organize district portal page to save your link.

![Add a link modal](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000Vdxx&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000XPLB8)

---

To delete a link:

1. Navigate to your [Clever Dashboard > Portal > Organize district portal](https://schools.clever.com/portal/customize).
2. Click the three vertical dots on the link you want to delete.
3. Select **Edit.**
4. Select **Remove link.**

**![Remove link](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000Vdxx&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000ZaAsj)**

---

text:
> Tip: Title For App Partners: Troubleshooting district data URL Name 115002947243 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Browsing District Data 3. Missing Data 4. Incorrect Data
> Overview
> If you hear from a district who is running into issues with missing or incorrect data in your app, these are the steps to view, troubleshoot, and help districts to resolve issues with their student information system (SIS) data. > Clever Tip: Enable App Sync Notifications to stay updated on school sync statuses. Utilize our API to verify the last successful SIS upload and proactively manage data updates. Reach out to our support team to request this feature be turned on for your account. > Browsing District Data
> To filter and view specific records that are shared with your app, click the  Data Browser  in the left-hand sidebar:
> Select the user or data type that you are searching for, and click  Add Filter to narrow down your results. You will only see data that has been shared with your application:
> Click on each record to view more information and to see the "Detail View":  
> Clever Tip:  You're able to debug instant login problems using the Detailed View as well by clicking "Log in as <user's name>" at the top! > Missing Data
> You will only see data that has been shared with your application. Districts control the data that is shared with your app by setting up  data sharing rules  and data access . > There are two potential reasons that district data is missing from your app dashboard:  
> 1. The district has not shared the data with your application. Check the Sharing Rules   to make sure that the data-sharing rules are configured correctly. > 2. The district's data has not made it from their SIS into Clever. You can pass along or view these SIS-specific articles for troubleshooting steps based on SIS-type.

If the district doesn't see the data in their own data browser, something specific to the SIS sync is likely keeping the data out of Clever:  
> Aeries Infinite Campus API Sync PowerSchool SchoolInsight Auto Sync Skyward Auto Sync Skyward API Sync SFTP
>  
> Incorrect Data
> If data is incorrect, Clever might be pulling the field (e.g. Course\_name) from the wrong field within the district's SIS. For most SIS Auto Syncs , Clever can customize the fields that we pull data from, or filter out unnecessary data. > Reach out to Clever support so that we can get that all set up!

text:
> Note: Title For Clever Admins: Apps - Set launch date URL Name 115002947643 Article Body This article contains the following:  1. Overview  2. How do I set up an SSO and/or Rostering application for future launch? > Overview
> When setting up a new application, the district is able to establish sharing permissions and resolve data quality issues weeks — or even months!— before the application launches. The launch date is the day that an application becomes available to teachers and students in the Clever Portal. This article will show you how to prepare apps for launch. > Please note:  If you'd like to adjust the current launch date of an application, please reach out directly to the application and they will be happy to help you! After the district initially sets the date (as explained below), adjustments are managed by the application's team. > How do I set up an SSO and/or Rostering application for future launch? > 1. Log in to your Clever Dashboard and select  Applications > Add Applications from the sidebar. > 2. Add the application you want to set up. > 3. You'll be brought to a page where you can authorize the request to add the app. Please share whether or not your district has already purchased licenses for the application. At the bottom, select  Request Launch Date. > :
> 4. Once the request has been approved by the application's team, go to your  Clever Dashboard  and click on the app you're setting up. >  For detailed information on your  Application's Status , please see " What is my application's status? "  Questions? Please reach out directly to the application's team for insight on the status. > 5. You can view the launch date that you set for your app. Click "Begin setup" to manage your district's sharing permissions with the app. >  
> Once the sharing permissions are set up and any  data quality issues  have been resolved, you're all done! No further action is required by the district.

On the day of the launch date, the new application will appear in the Clever Portal  for all shared users.

title: Sync Report error: Records not processed due to duplicate IDs
heading_path: Sync Report error: Records not processed due to duplicate IDs
text:
There are a number of errors that may surface on your **Last attempted sync page** related to individual data types. For example, you may see users fail to sync to Clever due to the use of duplicate IDs.

Clever requires a unique ID for every record we process, and each data type contains at least one unique record ID field value: 'School\_id', 'Teacher\_id', 'Section\_id', or 'Student\_id'. If two or more records share an ID value, Clever will only process one record with that ID. The following error may be surfaced: *duplicate 'section\_id (school\_id, teacher\_id, student\_id)' used'*

These unique IDs are used to make connections between data types and therefore need to be unique and consistent across all 5 files. For example, a school record in your ‘schools.csv’ file with 'School\_id' “12345” should be identified as “12345” for each student attending that school in the ‘students.csv’ file.

1. Visit the Sync Report in your Dashboard for detailed information about data that Clever was unable to process.
2. Click "Download Changes" to download a list of records affected by this error.

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000CQjV&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000002lzTh)
3. Correct these errors in your uploads by determining a truly unique identifier for all records, or filter the data before you upload to Clever.

To avoid receiving this duplicate ID error, teachers at multiple school sites should still only be listed once in the teachers.csv file with one school\_id as their primary school. However, they can then be associated with sections from multiple schools in the sections.csv file.

---

2. [How to troubleshoot this error](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/115003073643?language=en_US#header2)

There are a number of errors that may surface on your **Last attempted sync page** related to individual data types. For example, you may see sections not process due to missing enrollments. Sections must have active students enrolled to be processed into Clever. We use the ‘enrollments.csv’ file to associate students with sections using their unique IDs; each ‘Student\_id’ listed next to a ‘Section\_id’ means that student is enrolled in that section. You may see a “records not processed due to no students enrolled” because:

- A section’s ‘Section\_id’ is not present in the ‘enrollments.csv’ file; or
- A ‘Student\_id’ listed in the ‘enrollments.csv’ file is not present in the ‘students.csv’ file.

The error is often surfaced as: *invalid 'Course Roster' due to error 'no students'*

title: Sync Report error: Sections not processed due to missing students
heading_path: Sync Report error: Sections not processed due to missing students
text:
1. Visit the [Sync Report](https://schools.clever.com/sync) page of your Dashboard for detailed information about data that Clever was unable to process.
2. Click 'Download Changes' to download a list of records affected by this error.
3. Search for the ‘Section\_id’ of the affected section(s) in your ‘enrollments.csv’ file.
4. Make sure all sections with students enrolled are listed in your ‘enrollments.csv’ file.
5. If you can find the ‘Section\_id’ in the ‘enrollments.csv’ file, copy the ‘Student\_id’ of students enrolled in that section and search for them in the ‘students.csv’ file.
6. Make sure all students enrolled in sections are listed in your ‘students.csv’ file.

It’s also possible that certain records are not processed due to formatting errors in the CSV files. [Please see this article for troubleshooting CSV formatting errors.](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/218518698?language=en_US)

There are a number of errors that may surface on your **Last attempted sync page** related to individual data types. For example, you may see that students or teachers fail to sync to Clever due to being assigned to a school site that doesn't exist in your files and/or Clever.

All students and teachers must be assigned to a school in order to be synced with Clever. There are a few reasons you may see the error “records not processed due to missing school”:

- The ‘School\_id’ field is blank for some or all students/teachers; or
- The ‘School\_id’ field in the ‘students.csv’ or ‘teachers.csv’ file does not match a listed ‘School\_id’ field in the ‘schools.csv’ file.

---

1. Visit the [Sync Report page](https://schools.clever.com/sync) of your Dashboard for detailed information about data that Clever was unable to process.
2. Click the blue icon 'Download Changes' to download a list of records affected by this error. 
 ![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000CQmj&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000002lzTr)
3. Make sure that ‘School\_id’ is populated for all records in your ‘students.csv’ and ‘teachers.csv’ files.
4. Compare the ‘School\_id’ values in ‘teachers.csv’ and ‘students.csv’ to make sure they’re all present in ‘schools.csv’.

A common cause of mismatched IDs between files is a lost a leading zero - click [here](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/218518698) for more information on identifying and resolving this error.

text:
Title

SSO (Saved Passwords) Apps: School-Specific Login URLs for ThinkCentral

URL Name

115003232507

Article Body

The ThinkCentral [Saved Passwords application](https://support.clever.com/s/article/234746488) requires different login URLs for each school you'd like to use it with. Here's a quick guide (using Chrome) to finding the URLs for your schools:

1. Go to the ThinkCentral login page at <https://www-k6.thinkcentral.com/ePC/start.do>

2. Enter your State and District from the dropdown menus:

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TiIb&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000003BXA4)

3. Once your State and District are selected, right click on the 'School' dropdown menu and click 'Inspect' (or 'Inspect Element' on Firefox):

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TiIb&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028B6k)

4. A box will open at the bottom of the page. Click the arrow on the left of highlighted bar. A list of your district's schools will appear:

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TiIb&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028B6p)

5. Take note of the 8-digit values for each school. The login URL for each school should be <https://www-k6.thinkcentral.com/ePC/start.do?orgID=> *plus the 8 digit school code.*

- For example, if a school's code is 01234567, then the login URL for that school is <https://www-k6.thinkcentral.com/ePC/start.do?orgID=01234567>.
- You can use the school URLs from this process in your [credential uploads](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/234973187) for ThinkCentral.

text:
> Tip: Title For App Partners: Creating filters for district data URL Name 115003249203 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. How does app-side filtering work? 3. How do I filter district data? 4. What do districts see when data is filtered? 5. FAQs
> Overview
> Districts oversharing data is a common problem for applications on Clever. To help resolve this, applications can create filters to receive only the data you need, giving you control over data sharing and enhancing integration quality. > How does app-side filtering work? > Step 1:  Districts share data with the application . > Step 2: Applications apply filters on the district data to manage  exactly which data they are receiving, whereby ensuring that only relevant data is synced. >   Please note: if new schools are added to a district's sync or additional data needs to be shared, it will be necessary to update the app-side filters to allow this data to be accessible to you (the application). >  
> How do I filter district data? > Filtering is located on the District Profile page. > Click  Create a filter Determine if you would like to filter by school or more granular data using sharing rules (such as grade level, subject, etc.) Select the data that  should be included in the sync. If using sharing rules to select more granular data, see the Tips and best practices section below. When done, click  Next Preview data. If correct, click Save Clever will apply the filter to the district's data. The results are displayed under Final Data  once it's done processing. Filters can take up to 24 hours to apply, depending on the size of the district data set. > Tips and best practices for sharing rules
> If you select  Our data agreement requires more granular data sharing  in step two of the data filter setup, you'll select the data your app needs using sharing rules. Sharing rules allow you to select specific data using rules, such as all students in a given grade, subject, course name, etc.

title: For App Partners: Creating filters for district data
heading_path: For App Partners: Creating filters for district data
section: For App Partners: Creating filters for district data
text:
An example of an App Filter set up using sharing rules. Here are some tips when using sharing rules:
> You can include and/or exclude subsets of data. Data can be excluded by selecting the is not one of  modifier. For values, you can either type in any value you’d like, or use it as a search bar to find and click on the value you want. Some values will not be available in a dropdown as the district has not authorized an application to see them. If you’d like to filter down a rule further, you can select the  + AND  option to add new criteria. This will act as an "and" statement, rather than an "or" statement. > Example Rule with Filters: Share all sections located at Pineapple Elementary School AND their section grade level is 1 AND the section name must contain the text "homeroom". > Once you have finished creating your first rule, you can click Add Rule  to add more rules. When you have multiple rules, the two rules don’t interact with each other. This means if you want to build off the existing rule, you'll want to add a filter to the rule itself, rather than create a new rule entirely. See the example below that shows two separate rules:
> "Share all sections where grade is one of 6, 7, 8.” Also, "Match all staff where school is Pineapple Elementary.”
> Please note: Only one filter can be placed per school . If you need to further filter data for a school, please contact Clever Support, and our team will work with the district to adjust the initial data being shared to meet your specifications. >  
> What do districts see when data is filtered? > If an app-side filter is applied to a district, they will see an App Filters tab in the application area of the Clever Dashboard. Here they can view:
> Shared Data : the data shared with the application by the district. Filters : the filters that were applied to the district data by the application. Application Receives:  the resulting filtered data that will be synced by the application.

>  
>  
> FAQs
> Why is Clever unable to display a preview of allowed records? > Clever may be unable to provide a preview of allowed records for districts with large data sets or highly complex rules. When this occurs, Unable to display count of allowed records  or Sorry, there is too much data… may display. However, you may still safely save your app filters, and they will be applied as intended. > Can I filter data for a district if they have app sync pause enabled? > Yes! You can still filter data even if they have paused their sync to your app.

title: For Clever Admins: Primary school assignments
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Primary school assignments
text:
School association for students and teachers is based on **section enrollments.**If a student or teacher is enrolled in sections at multiple schools, Clever will associate the user with the related schools. A district should NOT attempt to connect a teacher or student with multiple schools by uploading the user multiple times in the students.csv or teachers.csv.

Additionally, Clever will assign a primary school association. This will be the school that displays in their Clever Portal. When an application accesses the data for the user, the application will have access to both the user's primary school association, as well as their secondary associations.

**Primary school is assigned based on where the user has the most section enrollments**.  For example: If a student is enrolled in 2 sections at School A and 4 sections at School B, their primary school assignment in Clever will be School B (regardless of the school assigned in the SIS).

You can see the primary school on the user's profile page, along with the other schools they're associated with listed in their sections.

![Image of teacher's profile page showing primary school](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TFBl&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl000001NTK5)

Additional details:

- **If a user has the same number of sections** at two or more schools, Clever will choose the school where the total number of students enrolled in the user's sections is the greatest.
- If a student or teacher's section enrollments change during the year, their primary school in Clever may also change.
- If a student or teacher is not enrolled in any sections, Clever will use the school the user is assigned to in your SIS data.
- A user will be shared with an application if either their primary *or* secondary school is shared.

---

If you'd rather Clever use student and teachers' primary school exactly as it's listed in your student information system (SIS), please contact Clever Support. We can disable our default logic for either students, teachers, or both. Once this logic is disabled, Clever will look to your SIS data as the source of truth for primary school assignments.

---

title: For App Partners: Setting Up License Usage Limits
heading_path: For App Partners: Setting Up License Usage Limits
section: For App Partners: Setting Up License Usage Limits
text:
> Note: Title For App Partners: Setting Up License Usage Limits URL Name 115003921667 Article Body Please note: Licensing only applies to Secure Sync applications. This feature is not available for SSO only applications.
> The licensing feature makes it possible for you to set license limits and to communicate more effectively with school districts about the number of licenses that they are using. This can help to prevent data oversharing and confusion about license limits!  
> Setting Up License Limits and Expiration Dates
> Licenses can be set on a district's overview page or when approving a district connection request. The approval email that is sent to the requestor will include information about the number of available licenses.  
>  
> Once the expiration date for a set of licenses passes, you and the relevant district will see a small alert on your Clever Dashboards. No other changes will result from the expiration.  
> Filtering and Viewing Districts Based on Licenses Exceeded or Expired
> You can also view and filter districts in your app developer dashboard, based on whether the available licenses have been exceeded or expired.  
>  
> Please note: it is only possible to set license limits based on the number of  students or schools.  Be sure to set an expiration date if you want the licenses to expire after a set period of time!
>  
> The licensing feature does not restrict a district from exceeding their licenses when they set data sharing rules. This feature makes it easier to manage and communicate with districts about licenses, but it does not limit how many students or schools can be shared.

If you have missing or incorrect data in Clever, you may want to have a data sync from your student information system (SIS) to Clever occur sooner than the scheduled time.  Pushing a sync can help resolve data errors faster than waiting for the next sync.  Learn more about manually starting a sync based on your sync type below.

title: Clever-managed Sync: How do I push a manual sync with my SIS?
heading_path: Clever-managed Sync: How do I push a manual sync with my SIS?
How do I push a manual sync with Clever?
section: How do I push a manual sync with Clever?
text:
If your district utilizes a [Clever-Managed Sync](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202042973), you can manually initiate a sync with your SIS from your Clever Dashboard! If your district has a [SIS-Managed Sync](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202042973), you'll need to contact your SIS rep for information on initiating a manual sync to Clever. If your district manages an [SFTP sync](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/205783078?language=en_US), you can trigger a sync whenever you like by uploading a new set of files to your SFTP directory. Uploading too many times in a short period may trigger a sync upload error.

For a Clever-Managed Sync, navigate to the [Data sources > SIS sync > Settings tab](https://schools.clever.com/sync/settings), click the **Sync Now** option under Sync Controls, and your SIS will start syncing with Clever. Syncs typically take around 10-15 minutes to process but could take up to 60 minutes depending on Clever's district sync traffic, the number of updates to be processed, and the time of year (e.g. Back to School season is often busier).

![Screenshot with sync now button highlighted](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000StPl&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000DJDOg)

After about 15 minutes, check your [Data sources > SIS sync](https://schools.clever.com/sync/settings) page to see if the sync has been completed. The sync notification will say "Successful" once the sync has been completed.  If it has completed, you'll see up-to-date information about your most recent sync as well as any data warnings that might need to be addressed!

![Screenshot of a successful sync](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000StPl&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000DJXjx)

For sync errors, please visit the following articles for guidance: [Clever Sync Errors](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/global-search/sync%20error?language=en_US).
