title: Clever Badges: Troubleshooting issues with Badges
heading_path: Clever Badges: Troubleshooting issues with Badges
section: Clever Badges: Troubleshooting issues with Badges
text:
> Tip: Title Clever Badges: Troubleshooting issues with Badges URL Name 115005208126 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Common Issues and Resolutions
> Overview
> This article details some troubleshooting tips districts can use when students have issues with Badges, including invalid and expired Badges and logging into Google Chromebooks using Clever Badges. > Common Issues and Resolutions
>  
> Badge is invalid
> This error message means that the student is no longer included in the scope of users who are assigned Badges. > Here's an example: Let's say your district's Badge scope is for students in third grade and below. At the end of the year, the third-grade students move on to fourth grade. If any of those new fourth-graders tried to use their old Badge, they would get this invalid message, since they are no longer included in the scoped users for Badges. >  
> Badge is expired
> If you see this error message when attempting to log in with a Badge, it means that the Badge's expiration date has passed. The student can generate a new Badge by clicking the Set up a new Badge button, or by asking their teacher for help. >   Please note: Beginning January 1, 2025, you will see expiration dates on any newly created or re-printed existing badges. By default, all Badges existing before June 30, 2026 will expire on July 1, 2026. New badges will be valid for 365 days from the creation date. Clever recommends that a Clever Admin void and reprint badges during your annual rollover period, such as the summer or winter. See  this article for more information. > A teacher can generate a new Badge for the student by:
> Logging into their Clever Portal > My Students > Student Roster . > Choose the class of the student you want to print a Badge for. > Click the student. > Select the  Create new badge button and print your student’s new Badge. This will reset the Badge’s 365-day expiration timeline.

title: Clever Badges: Troubleshooting issues with Badges
heading_path: Clever Badges: Troubleshooting issues with Badges
section: Clever Badges: Troubleshooting issues with Badges
text:
>  
> Your connection is not private error
> If your web filter is blocking access, you will see a "Your connection is not private" error when using a Clever Badge on the Chromebook login page. You may need to adjust your web filter in order to use Clever Badges with Chromebooks. > This occurs because Chromebooks do not load custom root certificates (for instance, those used by web filters) before sign-in occurs. Therefore, you will need to allowlist certain URLs so that they are not intercepted and the correct certificate is presented during the login process. >  
> Allow-listing Necessary Domains
> The following domains must be allow-listed for Clever Badges to function properly:
> \*. clever.com \*. s3.amazonaws.com accounts.google.com (if your district uses Clever Badges for Chromebooks)
> With these changes, we believe that districts using any common web filter (such as iBoss, Lightspeed, Cipafilter, Securly, ZScaler , and Fortinet) can use Clever Badges with Chromebooks. >  
> Popup window interrupting the login flow
> Occasionally Google will incorporate popup windows that can not be avoided and disrupt the login flow, requiring users to click through to close the popup in order to successfully log in. >  
> Zip file is invalid
> Occasionally Badge zip files on Windows devices produce an error that says Windows can’t open the zipped file. This happens when a school’s section names exceed the character limit Windows allows for file paths. You can fix the issue in one of two ways:
> Use a zip tool like 7-Zip or WinRAR to open your Badges for printing. > Update your Windows Registry to support longer file paths:
> Open RegEdit . Go to: Computer\HKEY\_LOCAL\_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\FileSystem Find the key: LongPathsEnabled . Set its value to 1 .

title: For School Tech Leads: Badges
text:
> Tip: Title For School Tech Leads: Badges URL Name 115005209686 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. What are Clever Badges? 3. How do Clever Badges work? 4. Technical requirements for Badges 5. How do I generate Badges from my Portal? 6. Devices without cameras
>  
> Overview
> Clever Badges are a great tool to ease logins in the classroom at your school site. This article will discuss how Clever Badges work, the technical requirements, and how you can generate Clever Badges for students at your school site. > What are Clever Badges? > Clever Badges allow students to use a physical Badge to log in to Clever in lieu of typing in credentials to authenticate users. Badges are an easier way for the youngest students to access their apps. School Tech Leads can print Badges for individual students, entire school sites, or sections, as long as Badges have been enabled by a Clever Admin. > Badges are tied to the student. As such, changes in school, teacher, or section will not affect the Badge. Grade-level access for Badges is managed by your district administrator. If Badges are not available for the desired grade level, please contact your district support contact . For more information about enabling Badges for your district, please see this Help Center article . >   Please note: Beginning January 1, 2025, you will see expiration dates on any newly created or re-printed existing badges. By default, all existing badges will expire on December 31, 2025 and new badges will be valid for 365 days from the creation date. Clever recommends that a Clever Admin void and reprint badges during your annual rollover period, such as the summer or winter. See this article for more information. >  
>  
> How do Clever Badges work? > Students navigate to clever.com/badges and click Allow in the browser prompt to give Clever access to their camera. They can also go to their district's Clever URL and click the Badges icon.

title: For School Tech Leads: Badges
text:
Clever Badges are designed to be used directly with Clever, and a QR reader won't log the student in to Clever. The webcam will activate and students should hold up their Badge to the camera. Once the code is scanned the screen border will flash green. Students will then be redirected to their Clever Portal. > Pro Tip: Security Badges provide direct access to a student's Clever account and should be protected just like a password. Anyone who has access to a Badge can sign in as a student and access their accounts in both Clever and connected applications. Please protect the security of your students and do not share images of the QR code publicly on social media. >  
> Technical Requirements for Badges
> You will need to following items to implement and use Badges:  
> Supported web browser (Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, Microsoft Edge, Safari) Printer Computers/devices with webcam
>  
> How do I generate Badges from my Portal? > Badges can be downloaded using the directions below. They can also be downloaded by teachers and parents/guardians using these directions: 
> How to download a Clever Badge as a teacher How to download a Clever Badge as a parent/guardian
> For School Tech Leads: Printing Individual Badges
> From your Clever Portal, navigate to your Dashboard Once in the Dashboard, search for the student in the search bar If the student does not have a Badge generated, select  Create Clever Badge on the right-hand side of their Profile If the student's Clever Badge is already generated, select a download option
>  Please note: If you select  Void Clever Badge the student's Clever Badge will no longer function and you will need to generate a new Badge for them. > For School Tech Leads: Printing school site and section Badges
>  1. From your Clever Portal, navigate to your Dashboard. > 2. Once in the Dashboard, choose Badges. > 3. In the "Overview" tab, you will have two options to generate Badges.

title: For School Tech Leads: Badges
text:
Whenever a new student joins your school (within the configured grade range for Badges), you can click  New  to generate Badges for only those new students at the school. > Or,  you can select  All  to generate Badges for all the students at your school. Clicking  All  will not void any existing Badges. It will simply regenerate any existing badges as well as create new badges for any students who did not yet have one. > 4. Once you select an option, the Badges will either be emailed to your or immediately start downloading, to a zip file with PDFs of the Badges. You'll have the option to either print by grade level or by section. >  
> Devices without cameras
> If a student doesn't have access to a device with a camera, they can log in using the district's normal login method. (e.g. Log in with Google, Log in with Active Directory, Log in with Clever). If you require assistance with identifying their username and password for one of these login methods, please reach out to your   district's tech support contact . >  
> Please let us know if you have any questions! You can always submit a ticket to Clever Support.

title: Portal Analytics
text:
> Important: Title Portal Analytics URL Name 115005292523 Article Body
> This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Filters 3. Metrics
> Overview
> At Clever, we understand how important it is to track application logins and usage for your district users. Using  Portal Analytics , district admins have access to graphs and statistics that show how many users are accessing their applications, how often they log in, and which schools or apps are being used the most! This article provides a breakdown of the available data and how it can be filtered. >   Portal Analytics includes data for all logins powered by Clever, including instant login links . >  
>  
> Filters
> First, let's take a look at the available filters. You can apply different filters to narrow down the usage data and focus on specific users, applications, and school sites. If the selected filters don't apply to a chart, the chart will temporarily be hidden. > Time & date range
> You can filter Portal Analytics by time and date ranges. Click the time range to choose from the las 7 days, 28 days, by school year, or Custom dates, which allows for a custom time range any time in the past year. The Export all data  button will download data associated with your selected filters. Choose thestart and end date to select a custom date range! > Units
> Select whether you'd like to view your data as a percentage (e.g., 75% of all students have logged in) or in absolute terms (e.g., 7,500 students have logged in). >  
> App
> Select All Apps  to view login data for all apps connected to your district's Clever account. To look more closely at a specific app's usage, select the application from the dropdown. When you select a specific app, the 'Usage by App' graph is disabled. > Users, Grades, and Schools
> Here you can select whether you want to see usage data for students, teachers, or both. >  
> To look at the Portal Analytics for specific grade levels, select the grade(s) from the dropdown.

title: Portal Analytics
text:
Grades are based on student grades, not the grade level for sections or teachers. > Please note: The teacher filter can't be used with the grade filter. >  
> To focus on a specific site instead of All Schools , you can select the school location from the dropdown. Multiple school sites can be selected from the dropdown as well. > Please note: The Usage by School graph is disabled when you select a single school. >  
> Metrics
> Now that we know how to use filters to focus on specific areas, let's look at the different measures! The statistics shown are based on the users being  shared with the apps . The metrics are not based on the total number of district users in Clever. > Usage by scoped users
>     
> Usage by scoped users:  This number reflects the number of users shared with the application. > Unique Users
>   
> Unique users:  This number reflects the unique number of shared users who have logged into the application. > Total Logins  
> Total Logins: This number reflects the overall number of user logins. >  
> Daily Unique Users
> Daily unique users: This chart reflects the unique number of users who have logged into an application per day. Hover your mouse over a date to see the number of daily unique users for that day. > Please note:   This chart is disabled if you're using the School year to date  time frame filter or Custom dates  filter. >  
> Logins by app
> Logins by App: This number reflects the number of unique user logins for an individual application. Select the Ascending  or Descending  option to order apps by the number of unique logins. >  
> Logins by school
> Logins by school: This number reflects the number of unique user logins from users at each school site. Select the 'Ascending' or 'Descending' option to order schools by the number of unique logins. > Login Method / Device / Browser
> Login Method : This number reflects the number of unique user logins by login type.

title: Portal Analytics
text:
Users will be counted twice if they log in using different login methods, but only once if they log in multiple times using the same Identity Provider (IDP). > Device : This number reflects the number of unique user logins for each device. Users will be counted twice if they are logging into different devices, but only once if they log in multiple times to the same device type. > Browser : This number reflects the number of unique user logins for each browser. Users will be counted twice if logging in through different browsers, but only once if they log in multiple times through the same browser. > Please note:   These charts are disabled if you're using the Custom dates  filter. >  
> Usage by Additional Resources
> If you've added any links to your district's Clever Portal , you can view the number of clicks each resource has gotten under the "Usage by Additional Resources" section! For instance, let's say you added a link to your Student Information System for teachers. You can see how many times this was clicked during a specific timeframe as set by the filters mentioned above. > Please note:   This section is disabled if you're using the Custom dates  filter.

title: Clever Badges: How do I enable Badges into Chromebooks with Zscaler?
heading_path: Clever Badges: How do I enable Badges into Chromebooks with Zscaler?
section: Clever Badges: How do I enable Badges into Chromebooks with Zscaler?
text:
Title

Clever Badges: How do I enable Badges into Chromebooks with Zscaler?

URL Name

115005401166

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/115005401166?language=en_US#header1) 
2. [Setting up Clever Badge logins with Zscaler](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/115005401166?language=en_US#header2)

This article is an overview of setup instructions for using Clever Badges with Zscaler.

---

Follow these outlined steps to ensure successful authentication of Clever Badges while using Zscaler services at your district.

The following update needs to be made in **Zscaler** in order to successfully use Clever Badges on Chromebooks:

- Change from Form-Based to configuring SAML Authentication type required in Zscaler Authentication settings

title: Clever Badges: How do I enable both ADFS and Badge logins for Chromebooks?
heading_path: Clever Badges: How do I enable both ADFS and Badge logins for Chromebooks?
section: Clever Badges: How do I enable both ADFS and Badge logins for Chromebooks?
text:
Title

Clever Badges: How do I enable both ADFS and Badge logins for Chromebooks?

URL Name

115005458126

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/115005458126?language=en_US#overview) 
2. [Requirements](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/115005458126?language=en_US#requirements) 
3. [Setup](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/115005458126?language=en_US#setup) 
4. [Customizing the Login Flow (optional)](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/115005458126?language=en_US#customize) 
5. [Chromebook Safety Feature](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/115005458126?language=en_US#safety)

Clever works seamlessly with Chromebooks, which allows students and teachers to access all of their learning applications while only logging in once per device. There are two methods to use Clever with Chromebooks:

1. **Users use Clever Badges to log into Chromebooks**
2. **Users log into Chromebooks, then access Clever**

Each method can be configured separately for different Organizational Units (OUs).

Since Clever integrates with many identity providers, including Active Directory, Clever can serve as the authentication pathway for both Badge and Active Directory users! See below for details on this integration.

---

- Clever enabled as the third party identity provider in the Google Admin Console (**Security Settings > Setup SSO with third party identity provider**)
- Active Directory enabled as an identity provider in Clever ([Clever Dashboard > Authentication > SSO settings > Login method tab)](https://schools.clever.com/instant-login/settings)
- Staff and students that'll use Chromebooks must be active users in Clever
- Staff and students who'll use Chromebooks must have their Google email address populated in Clever

---

title: Clever Badges: How do I enable both ADFS and Badge logins for Chromebooks?
heading_path: Clever Badges: How do I enable both ADFS and Badge logins for Chromebooks?
text:
**Step 1 - Setup Active Directory authentication into Clever** 
To pass through authentication for non-Badge users, we'll need to add Active Directory as a login method for Clever. Directions for adding Active Directory can be found here: [Single sign-on (SSO) with Active Directory Federation Services.](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202102576?language=en_US#h_b9bc4519-fbaa-4521-8b19-719c6b8ec9f2)

**Step 2 - Upload student/teacher Google emails to Clever** 
In order to authenticate both Clever Badge and Active Directory users into Chromebooks, the district will need to ensure that all students and teachers have Google emails synced to Clever. If these emails are't populated in the SIS, we can enable manual email uploads as described here: [How do I upload emails that are not in my SIS?](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115004455026?language=en_US)

**Step 3 - Customize login flow (optional)** 
Districts can adjust settings in the admin console to tweak the login flow to best meet the needs of your district. See below for more details!

**Step 4 - Apply settings and test logins** 
Apply the settings for Clever single sign-on (SSO) into Chromebooks as described here:

- <https://schools.clever.com/badges/chromebook/wizard>

For districts that are actively using Active Directory to sign users into Chromebooks, we recommend completing login tests at a time when most users are't utilizing their Chromebooks to reduce interruptions to learning.

---

title: Clever Badges: How do I enable both ADFS and Badge logins for Chromebooks?
heading_path: Clever Badges: How do I enable both ADFS and Badge logins for Chromebooks?
text:
**Option 1: Bypass badge login** 
By default, once users open the Chromebook and select "Next" they'll be presented with the badge login screen. If the district would prefer, this behavior can be adjusted so the district's general login page is presented first, facilitating faster logins for users logging in via Active Directory.

To implement this option, begin by navigating to the [Security Settings](https://admin.google.com/AdminHome?hl=en&pli=1&fral=1#SecuritySettings:flyout=sso) page in the Google Admin Console and scroll down to the **SSO** section. Under Setup SSO with third party identity provider, let's adjust the "Sign-in page URL"

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TTTF&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000003Bxtj)

Currently your sign-in URL should look something like this:

- *<https://samlidp.clever.com/chromebook-login/assert/582df1eb56619d0100000482?specify_auth=badges>*

This URL contains a parameter that forwards users directly to the badge authentication page:

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TTTF&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000003Bxu3)

Let's adjust the URL by removing: *?specify\_auth=badges* 
The result should look like this:

- *<https://samlidp.clever.com/chromebook-login/assert/582df1eb56619d0100000482>*

This will send all users to the general login page for your district! From there, users can select their preferred login method. Here is what the login page will now look like:

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TTTF&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000003BxuI)

**Option 2: Pass-through Google authentication into Clever Portal**

Pass through authentication ensures that all users are automatically logged into the Clever Portal when logged into a Chromebook.

title: Clever Badges: How do I enable both ADFS and Badge logins for Chromebooks?
heading_path: Clever Badges: How do I enable both ADFS and Badge logins for Chromebooks?
text:
To configure this setting, navigate to the "User Settings" page in the Google Admin Console. Depending on how you have applied the settings, you may need to adjust the Homepage, Pages to Load on Startup, or both. Currently the settings will look similar to below:​![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TTTF&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028CCK)

To enable pass-through authentication, add:*?skip=1&specify\_auth=google* to your district URL. Your district-specific URL can be found here: [https://schools.clever.com/portal.](https://schools.clever.com/portal)

The result should look like this: *<https://clever.com/in/cleverdemo?skip=1&specify_auth=google>*

**Login experience**

1. **Chrome OS 98 and below:** Open Chromebook, press “Next”![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TTTF&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028CCU)
2. If a user logs in using:
 - Badges: user selects 'Log in with Clever Badges'. 
 - The user scans their Badge and is authenticated into Clever and Google/Chromebook!
 - ADFS Credentials: 
 - User selects 'Log in with Active Directory.' The Active Directory login screen is presented. User logs in to ADFS. ADFS authenticates the user into Clever, Clever authenticates the user into Google/Chromebook.

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TTTF&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028CCe)

3. Clever portal launches and learning begins!

---

We'll soon offer an optional query param on the Badges login screen called `chromebook\_safety.' If it is present, the login screen won't show the "Alternate Login" button to allow non-Badge logins. This serves as a way to definitively prevent users from averting web filters and accessing websites outside of Clever.

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TTTF&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000003BxvL)

To enable this feature, add the following as a query param on the Chromebook Sign-On URL: <https://samlidp.clever.com/chromebook-login/assert/YourDistrictCleverID?specify_auth=badges&chromebook_safety=true>

---

**Related articles:**

- [Single Sign-on (SSO): multiple IDPs for Google Workspace](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001541?language=en_US#header2)

title: Clever Roles: Staff - How to log in to Clever
heading_path: Clever Roles: Staff - How to log in to Clever
section: Clever Roles: Staff - How to log in to Clever
text:
> Note: Title Clever Roles: Staff - How to log in to Clever URL Name 115005686266 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Logging in 3. Staff who are also teachers
>  See this article for information on how to add your staff members into Clever! > Overview
> Your district's non-instructional staff (i.e. non-teaching staff), or employees who do not have a designated roster in your district's Student Information System (SIS), are referred to as staff in Clever. Occasionally, they will also be referred to as school admins. The two terms are synonymous. > Here are some examples of the types of staff members Clever supports:  
> Curriculum Leads District Help Desk users School-specific Tech Leads Principals Nurses District members After-school Coordinators
>  
>   For information on the different types of staff members and their permissions in Clever, please see this article:  Clever Roles: Overview of Roles & Permissions
> Logging in
> Once you have set up staff in Clever, there are two ways for them to log in:  
> They can navigate to your district's Clever portal login URL  which is located in your Clever Dashboard > Portal > Portal settings  page. Staff will use the same single sign-on (SSO) method you've designated for your teachers and students (e.g., if your district uses Google, staff can log in with their Google credentials). Or from Clever.com . by selecting to log in as 'Teacher or Staff'. >         
> Please note:  If you're using ADFS, LDAPS, or any other Identity Provider (IDP) that requires manual setup, you'll need to edit your claims rules to allow staff members and school admins to access Clever. If you have any questions about claims rules please see this Help Center article. > Staff who are also teachers
> Clever supports users being both teachers and staff! If an individual is both a teacher and staff user in Clever, they'll log into Clever, and then select their name in the top right to toggle between accounts as needed.

>  
> If you have any questions about how district staff should access Clever, please reach out to  Clever support ! We are happy to help!

Can I add applications mid-year without losing progress or historical data?
section: Can I add applications mid-year without losing progress or historical data?
text:
You might be hesitant to add new application connections during the middle of the school year or semester. Fear not! With Clever you can connect to applications during the middle of the semester without losing progress or historical data within the app.

Clever provides a matchmaking tool to our partner applications, allowing them to migrate the data that you share in Clever with the existing historical progress in their application. You can seamlessly [add your applications](https://schools.clever.com/applications/add), share data, and we'll take care of the rest!

If you have any questions at all about connecting with applications, please don't hesitate to [reach out to our support team](https://support.clever.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).

For a full list of available apps, be sure to browse through [Clever's Application Gallery!](https://clever.com/app-gallery)

title: For App Partners: Managing district launch dates
heading_path: For App Partners: Managing district launch dates
section: For App Partners: Managing district launch dates
text:
Title

For App Partners: Managing district launch dates

URL Name

115005704686

Article Body

The "launch date" is the optional calendar date that your application-district connection goes live. On this date, students and teachers will begin to see and access your application from their district's Clever Portal.

When districts request your app, they can optionally request a specific launch date. When you invite a district to connect, you have that option as well. If you you leave this blank, the default is 30 days after the district accepts the invitation.

![Launch date modal](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka01P000000AkS1&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000062nyP)

title: For App Partners: Managing district launch dates
heading_path: For App Partners: Managing district launch dates
text:
You can manage, set, and reschedule launch dates for districts by navigating to your [app dashboard](https://apps.clever.com/learningaz/districts/overview)'s District Overview page and searching for the district you need to update. Click on their hyperlinked name to open the district's overview page.

Then click on the pencil icon to the right of the existing launch date.

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka01P000000AkS1&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000003BNJa)

From there you can select an updated date to **Re-schedule** or choose **Launch Now** if you want the district to go live immediately:

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka01P000000AkS1&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000003BNJk)

Prior to the launch date, the connection status will show as “Setting Up.” This means that you are able to see the data that the district has shared with you, but district users cannot yet view or access your application from their Clever Portal. During the “Setting Up” stage, no action is required, but the district admin can use the time to make sure they are sharing the correct data with you and check that they are not hitting any data warnings or errors.

You are able to modify a launch date up to the date of the launch. If you want to change a launch date after the original date has passed, you can [contact our support team](https://support.clever.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) for assistance.

title: For Teachers: Login Tools
text:
> Tip: Title For Teachers: Login Tools URL Name 115005941566 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Opening resources for your students 3. Logging students out of Clever 4. View student login status 5. Log in with Clever - Download student usernames 6. Classroom Multi-Factor Authentication (Classroom MFA) for students
> Overview
> In your Clever Portal, you'll have access to a variety of Login Tools. This article details the different Login Tools available to teachers, including:
> Opening resources for your students  Logging students out of Clever Reviewing student login status
> Clever Tip: Teacher tools are not currently supported on the Clever iOS application. > Opening resources for your students
> If students are logged into Clever using an internet browser window (e.g., Internet Explorer, Chrome, Edge, etc.), their teachers can open resources, such as applications, for them. This option is not currently available for students using the Clever iOS application. > Teachers can open a resource, such as an application, for their students, from either their Portal or any of their Teacher Pages (the process is the same). Opening a resource for students won't close out browser tabs or lock students into using only the opened resource. > To open a resource for your students:
> Navigate to your Portal on the Resources page or to one of your Teacher Pages (in this screenshot, we’re showing the Resources page). >    
> Choose a resource to open, click on the three blue buttons in the upper right of the icon, and click  Open for Students . > You can o pen the resource for an entire class, multiple classes, or a subset of students. >  
> Click Open after your selection and a green box will appear, letting you know the resource was successfully opened on student devices!

title: For Teachers: Login Tools
text:
> See below for a video showing the student view when a teacher has opened an resource for them:
> Please note: If a student doesn't have access to the resource you're opening, they'll see an error message. See  this article for troubleshooting steps. > Logging students out of Clever
> Teachers also can log students out of Clever! Log your class out of Clever by following the steps below:
> Navigate to My Students > Student Roster in the menu on the left side of your Portal Filter by class. Select More class tools > Log out class . >  
>  
> Clicking this button will log your students out of Clever. This will also be reflected under the Name column as students will appear as offline. >  
>  
> Please note: If students are using Google Chrome with the Clever Extension   installed, students will also be logged out of their applications. > Viewing student login status
> The My Students > Student Roster page shows which students have successfully logged into Clever. > Select your class by clicking the Filter by class drop-down. Review the student login status under the Name column. It will either say Offline or Online above the student's name. >  
>  
> Clever Tip: Want to learn more about resetting passwords? Check out this article: For Teachers: How to reset passwords for yourself and students
>  
> Log in with Clever - Download student usernames
> If your district uses Log in with Clever you'll have the ability to download a list of your students' usernames within your Clever Portal! You can download the list of usernames for each of your classes. > Step 1:
> From your Portal click on My Students > Student Roster on the left-hand side of your Portal. >  
> Step 2: 
> Click on More class tools on the right side of the page. >  
>  
> Step 3: 
> Click Download student usernames in the dropdown menu. This will download a CSV file containing the students' usernames along with each student's first and last name.

title: For Teachers: Login Tools
text:
> Note: Usernames can also be downloaded via the Classes tab at the top of your Portal. >  
>  
> Classroom Multi-Factor Authentication (Classroom MFA) for students
> If your school district requires Classroom Multi-Factor Authentication (Classroom MFA) for students, they will need to activate it to log in to Clever. You can view which students haven’t activated their MFA by navigating to your Clever Portal > My Students > Student Roster. If the student hasn’t activated their Classroom MFA, it'll be indicated by their name in the student roster. >  
>  
> You can find instructions for students to set up their Classroom MFA here: For Students: Setting up Classroom MFA . > If one of your students has lost their Classroom MFA Badge, you can void it and create a new one for them in your Student Roster by selecting a student and reviewing your options in the MFA column of the right sidebar. >  
>  
> Voiding and creating a new Badge will allow you to download the new Badge to your device, which you can print out for the student. The next time the student logs in, Clever will prompt them to follow a login flow to validate the Badge. >  
>  Be sure to visit this article  to learn about Teacher Analytics which provides specific details about students logging in to Clever, and accessing their connected applications!

title: What's Clever?
text:
> Important: Title What's Clever? URL Name 202000976 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Secure Sync 3. Single Sign-On (SSO) 4. Clever Portal 5. Clever Library 6. Clever Analytics 7. Add-ons 8. Who should sign up for Clever? >  
> Getting started with Clever? Check out our course Clever Academy for District Admin, Level 1 ,   available in Clever Academy! >  
> Overview
> Clever automates the secure transfer of student rosters to authorized parties. This enables continuously updated roster information in learning programs. Clever also offers single sign-on access for students and teachers via the Clever Portal. Clever's core features are  free for schools and districts in the United States and Canada! This means Clever doesn’t charge schools or districts to utilize our platform. For more information about Clever's pricing, please visit: How much does Clever cost districts and schools? > Clever replaces outdated systems that take away from learning time. Manual, vendor-speciﬁc processes, such as emailed CSV ﬁles or vendor-speciﬁc bulk transfers, are often insecure, inconvenient, or both. Clever is engineered to be the most secure and convenient way for districts to send vendors data. Additionally, Clever offers Single sign-on (SSO) which grants students and teachers access to all of their learning applications with a single set of credentials through the Clever Portal. >  
> Please note: If you are outside of the United States, check out our  international article  for more information. >  
> Accessibility We understand how important it is for all users to be able to easily use the Clever platform. To ensure that we are meeting the accessibility standards of all students and families, we undergo a voluntary audit every year and update the platform based on the latest guidelines. Please reach out to our support team if you would like more information. You can review our full accessibility statement here .

title: What's Clever?
text:
> Secure Sync
> Secure Sync maintains up-to-date roster information in your learning applications by securely transferring your roster uploads or connecting directly with your Student Information System (SIS) to provision student, teacher, and admin accounts. Data is shared with applications based on sharing rules that you set in your Clever Dashboard - keeping the control in your hands. Learning applications regularly update any changes to your enrollment information in Clever. Learn more about Secure Sync here . >  
> Single Sign-On (SSO)
> Single sign-on (SSO) allows students and teachers to use a single set of credentials to sign in to all of their learning applications. Clever integrates with your existing identity provider (Google, ADFS, and more) or accepts your own synced credentials to make this possible. Learn more about Single sign-on (SSO)  here . >  
> Clever Portal
> As part of Single sign-on (SSO), each student and teacher has access to a free personalized portal with every learning application they use. Through the Clever Portal, students and teachers can access all their learning programs with a single set of credentials. Students spend time learning—not searching for applications or remembering passwords. Students and teachers can access their learning programs through the Clever Portal in 3 easy steps:
> Navigate to your district’s custom unique Portal URL (i.e. Clever login page) Type in their credentials, or log in using a Clever Badge Be signed into their connected apps via single sign-on through Clever! >  For more information on using the Clever Portal, visit:  Clever Portal: Overview & Management . > Clever Library
> Clever Library is a place for teachers to discover, learn about, and adopt new resources for their classroom. Resources in the Library can be added to a teacher’s Teacher Page for easy access by students and teachers. You can read more about Clever Library here .

title: What's Clever?
text:
>  
> Clever Analytics
> As a Clever Admin, keep your finger on the pulse of students and teacher engagement with edtech programs. You can view the data as charts in Clever, or export the data as CSVs or even send them to your data warehouse via SFTP. Learn more here . We didn't forget teachers, either! They have access to Class Analytics to view engagement data for their students. >  
> Add-ons
> In addition to our free core features, we offer some paid add-ons based on requests from districts. > Identity Management (IDM) : we offer IDM for Google, Active Directory, and Entra ID. Classroom Multi-factor authentication (MFA) : We offer an MFA solution designed for K-12 schools that does not require a second device for logins. App Store : shop for Clever+ add-on products and Clever-exclusive bundles right in Clever. >  
>  
>  
> Who should sign up for Clever? > Clever is optimized to be managed at the district level. In order to create and administer a Clever account, you will need administrative access to your SIS and the authority to sign Clever’s Terms of Service. > Examples of individuals with sufficient access to manage a Clever account include Chief Technology Officers, SIS/Database Managers, and other district IT Administrators. Teachers, Academic Coaches, and Principals typically have insufficient SIS access to set up a Clever account. > If you're ready to sign up, please go here: clever.com/district-signup . We're looking forward to working with you!

title: Managed Auto Sync Overview
text:
> Note: Title Managed Auto Sync Overview URL Name 202042973 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Clever-Managed Auto Syncs 3. SIS-Managed Auto Syncs
>  
> Overview
> Clever offers two types of "Managed Auto Syncs" that districts can utilize to securely sync (i.e., transfer) rostering data from the district's student information system (SIS) to Clever. Clever Admins can then selectively share specific data with their district's connected learning applications. This article will detail the types of Managed Auto Syncs that Clever offers. > Please note:  If your district's student information system (SIS) is not listed below, or you would prefer to manually upload data, please visit this article for information on how to get started:  Which sync type should I choose? >  
> Clever-Managed Auto Syncs
> How does it work? > Clever-Managed Auto Syncs are automated daily syncs primarily managed by the Clever Support team. These syncs securely transfer rostering data from your district's student information system (SIS) to Clever. With these types of syncs:
> Clever integrates with your SIS to regularly export data and securely transfer it to Clever. Once SIS data is synced to Clever, Clever Admins can selectively share that data with the district's connected learning applications. The Clever Support team manages these types of syncs, so minimal help, if any, is needed from a district's SIS provider. Clever does not charge for SIS-Managed Auto Syncs! >  
> List of Clever-managed Auto Sync SISes:
> Aeries Blackbaud Infinite Campus API PowerSchool PowerSchool Plugin Skyward Skyward API
>  
>  
> Can I customize what rostering data is synced to Clever from our SIS? > In many cases, when setting up your Clever-Managed Auto Sync, the Clever Support team can assist with adding various filters or mappings to ensure the data in Clever reflects your district's needs. We can often remove unwanted fields or include additional fields in the sync.

title: Managed Auto Sync Overview
text:
However, there are some limitations regarding how much data we can filter or how many fields we can map. There are also ways for Clever Admins to determine which fields (e.g., student number, teacher email, staff ID) Clever should map to from the district's SIS so that the data populates correctly in Clever. This can be done from the Data sources > SIS sync > Settings > Sync Mappings box > View field mappings page. Please note that there are cases where Clever Support will need to map specific fields on behalf of districts. These fields will not show the option to Edit under the Actions column. Please contact Clever Support for more information or if a field is unavailable for mapping. > Please note:  OneRoster API syncs do not allow for customizations by Clever. Any customizations to these types of syncs would need to be configured by the district's SIS provider. > What are the next steps? > If your district is interested in setting up a Clever-Managed Auto Sync, the first step would be to identify if your district's student information system (SIS) allows for this. Please see the Student Information Systems (SIS) that support Managed Auto Syncs section of this article for more information. If your SIS is not listed, an alternative option would be to set up a secure file transfer protocol (SFTP) sync type to securely transmit data to Clever or to manually upload data to Clever via the Data sources > SIS sync > Upload  page. Please visit this article for more information:  Which sync type should I choose? > SIS-Managed Auto Syncs
> How does it work? > For SIS-Managed Auto Syncs, Clever partners directly with the district's student information system (SIS) provider to offer an automated sync option that the district's SIS provider would primarily manage. > Clever does not require credentials or access to your district's SIS directly. To take advantage of these SIS-managed syncs, please select your SIS from the Clever sign-up page when requesting a new Clever account.

Thank you for your interest! Clever is fully supported in the United States, UK, Ireland, Australia, and [Canada](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001519). Although we can support usage in other countries under the circumstances outlined herein, we are not able to fully ensure local compliance in places outside those named areas. If you have questions about compliance in your country, email [legal@clever.com](mailto:legal@clever.com).

---

Clever’s services are provided to schools in the European Economic Area (the “EEA”), the United Kingdom (the “UK”), Switzerland, Canada, and Australia in compliance with local requirements, including the European Union’s (“EU”) General Data Protection Regulation ( “GDPR”) and its UK GDPR counterpart, Canadian PIPEDA, and the Australia Privacy Principles. For more information, please see our Additional Terms for Schools:

- [European Data Processing Addendum](https://clever.com/trust/europe-data-processing-addendum)
- [Canadian Privacy Notice](https://www.clever.com/trust/privacy/canada)

title: Does Clever work with schools outside of the USA?
heading_path: Does Clever work with schools outside of the USA?
text:
Clever has not specifically localized our services or product offerings for other regions apart from Canada, the UK, EU/EEA, Australia, and the USA. Although some of the regions that we are compliant with are considered to be world-class in terms of consumer and privacy regulations, Clever may not be aware of unique compliance requirements from some international jurisdictions.

If your school is located in a region not named in the list above, Clever is open to providing services to you on an “as-is” basis and without any representation or warranty of compliance with local laws.

Before you use Clever’s services, you should familiarize yourself with our [Terms of Use](https://www.clever.com/trust/terms) and [Privacy Policy](https://www.clever.com/trust/privacy/policy) and confirm (a) that you are comfortable with the terms of our services; and (b) that they meet the requirements of your local jurisdiction. Notwithstanding the foregoing, please note that Clever is subject to relevant sanctions laws and Clever is not available in regions that are prohibited by various sanctions regulations.

---

title: Does Clever work with schools outside of the USA?

text:
**Canada**

Canadian schools can learn more about [Clever in Canada](https://www.clever.com/canada) and sign up for Clever [here](https://www.clever.com/district-signup).

Once your [account is created](https://www.clever.com/district-signup), your next step will be to sync your student data. Browse this [list](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202042973) to determine whether your student information system supports Clever.

- **If it does**, you can find instructions on how to sync [here](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202289278) or on your dashboard
- **If it does not**, you can sync your data by following our [SFTP file instructions](https://schools.clever.com/documents/clever-sftp-default-pdf)

Once your student data is synced, you can [add applications](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/203114997), [print Badges](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/220213907), and [design your Clever Portal](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/205875568).

**UK, Ireland, Australia, New Zealand, and other regions**

Learn more about Clever in your country [here.](https://www.clever.com/clever-global)

Once your [account is created](https://www.clever.com/district-signup), your next step will be to sync your student data. Browse this [list](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202042973) to determine whether your student information system supports Clever.

- **If it does**, you can find instructions on how to sync [here](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202289278) or on your dashboard
- **If it does not**, you can sync your data by following our [SFTP file instructions](https://schools.clever.com/documents/clever-sftp-default-pdf)

Once your student data is synced, you can [add applications](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/203114997), [print Badges](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/220213907), and [design your Clever Portal](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/205875568).

If you’d like Clever to be fully supported in your country, please contact us at [international@clever.com](mailto:international@clever.com).  We are working to expand our services into more countries and would love to hear from you.

2. [Personal details](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/202043053?language=en_US#h_944ead30-904d-4136-8386-3191d128f7fd)

4. [Multi-factor authentication](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/202043053?language=en_US#h_6a97fc35-d811-45f7-9666-2fd5504e5ce5)

On the [Profile page](https://schools.clever.com/profile) of your Clever Dashboard, you can edit your user information, change your password, and enable multi-factor authentication. To access your Profile page:

1. Log in to your [Clever Dashboard.](https://schools.clever.com/)
2. Click on your name in the upper right-hand corner and click **Profile**.
3. Under Account Information, click **Edit**.

---

From here, you can update your personal details.

![Admin edit profile screen](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TBuX&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000W9TYD)

---

To change your Clever account password, click **Change Password**. You'll be prompted to enter your existing password and then your new password twice. Click **Update** to save your changes.

---

Multi-factor authentication (MFA) adds an additional level of security to your account, and is required for Clever Admin who use a username/password to log in. With MFA, you'll add another factor (such as a text message code or security key) to verify your identity alongside your username/password.

![Clever Admin MFA screen](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TBuX&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000IWhgz)

This extra identity confirmation prevents unauthorized individuals from gaining access to your Clever District Administrator account even if your password is compromised. To learn more about MFA authentication, [read this article.](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202062333)

title: For Clever Admins: Apps - Data Warnings and Errors
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Apps - Data Warnings and Errors
section: For Clever Admins: Apps - Data Warnings and Errors
text:
> Warning: Title For Clever Admins: Apps - Data Warnings and Errors URL Name 202043083 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Types of data quality issues 3. Viewing data quality issues 4. Fixing data quality issues 5. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
>  
> Overview
> Even after your data syncs with Clever, there may be data quality issues that can affect application performance. The impact of these data quality issues varies by application. Reviewing data quality issues is an important troubleshooting step when user records are missing or users are experiencing problems within an application. If you have questions on how a data quality warning will impact usage of an application, please reach out to the application team directly. >  
>    Please note: For more information on how a data quality error or warning will impact the application's use, please contact the application team directly. The application team configures data quality errors and warnings. >  
>  
> Types of data quality issues
>  Data Errors Impact: High If a record is flagged by a Data Error, the user or section won't appear in the application. Data errors must be resolved for users or sections to be successfully processed by the application. Data Warnings Impact: Low If a record is flagged by a Data Warning, the user or section has a compatibility issue with the application that may result in a degraded app experience. We recommend contacting the application directly to determine the impact of a particular Data Warning . Data Warnings can often be ignored. > To contact the application team, navigate to your Clever Dashboard > Applications > My Applications and click on the application. If the application team has provided one, you may find a support contact on the app's overview page. If a support contact isn't provided, please search online for the app's contact information. >  
> Viewing data quality issues
> Data Warnings are specific to each application.

title: For Clever Admins: Apps - Data Warnings and Errors
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Apps - Data Warnings and Errors
section: For Clever Admins: Apps - Data Warnings and Errors
text:
You can view your Data Warnings via two methods:  
> To view all data warnings: Support Tools > Data Quality To view app-specific data warnings: Select an application, select  Data Quality
>  
>   Support Tools > Data Quality (recommended)
> On this screen you will see five pieces of information:  
> - Issue Type: The severity of the data quality issue; data error or data warning. More info can be found here .; Data Type: The record type affected (school, student, teacher, section, etc.).; Field: The field that is being flagged for data quality issues (ex: student\_email).; Number of issues: The number of records flagged for this data quality issue.; Impacted Applications: The applications that may be affected. >  
> To view the details of an issue, click on the number of issues. Here you'll see a description of the issue(s), the number of issues relating to that error, and the affected application(s). To view which specific records are related to the issue, click the download button to download a file containing a list of affected records. >  
> Clever groups issues by issue type, record type, and field. As such, when you select an issue from the main Data Quality screen, you may see multiple related issues on the detail screen. For example:   
>  
>  
> Fixing data quality issues
> First, let's quickly review which errors must be fixed and which are optional: 
>  Data Errors Impact: High - Must be fixed
> Data Warnings Impact: Low - Optional to fix. Contact the application directly to determine the impact on user experience. > To resolve most data quality issues, simply adjust the data in your student information system (SIS). Once the updated data is received in your next sync, the data quality issue will be removed. If the data was added via Custom Data in Clever, navigate to Clever Dashboard > Data sources > Custom data  and locate the record you'd like to edit.

title: For Clever Admins: Apps - Data Warnings and Errors
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Apps - Data Warnings and Errors
section: For Clever Admins: Apps - Data Warnings and Errors
text:
If you receive a data quality error about missing a specific field for all records:   
> SFTP syncs: Add the field to your CSV exports and upload the updated CSV files to Clever. Directions for formatting your data files can be found here . SIS-managed Auto Sync: R each out to your SIS and request that they add the field to your CSV exports. Once the updated data files are received, the data quality error will be resolved. Directions for formatting your data files can be found here. Clever-managed Auto Sync: Contact our support team  with the following information:
> Record Type: i.e. Student, Teacher, Sections, etc. Name of the field in Clever: i.e. Username, State ID, FRL\_status The exact name of the field in your SIS
>  
>  
> Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
>  
> What will happen if I don't fix a data quality error or warning? > If you don't resolve a data quality error, users may be unable to access the learning application. If you don't fix a warning, the application experience may be degraded. For specific details on how errors or warnings will impact the application's use, please contact the application directly. Clever's teams can't provide insight into how an app experience may change based on data issues. > Do I have to resolve a data quality error or warning? > To ensure application access and for the best application experience, we recommend resolving data quality errors and warnings. For specific details on how errors or warnings will impact the application's use, please contact the application directly. Clever's teams can't provide insight into how an app experience may change based on data issues. > How do I resolve any data quality errors or warnings? > Ensure the data is properly input in your SIS, and that the field it's in is exporting to Clever. If you use a manual SFTP or SIS-Managed Auto Sync, please work with your SIS directly to ensure data is included in the CSV files you are sending to Clever.

If you use a Clever-Managed Auto Sync, and you need additional fields added to your data sync, you can contact the Clever Support team for further assistance.

section: How to utilize the applications area of your homepage
text:
In the image above, you’ll notice that the **Applications** area of the home page contains a lot of valuable information about your applications. There’s a concise overview of the number of applications you’re currently sharing data with, pending application invites, and apps with no data shared. Your top six applications with the most users shared will appear by default, but you can also pin applications you’re interested in keeping an eye on. Additional actions you can take from the Applications box include:

- Clicking the icon above your pending app invites or apps without data shared will navigate to that application and complete the setup.
- Click **View all** to navigate to your [My Applications page](https://schools.clever.com/applications).
- Click the pin icon in the top right corner to select applications to pin in this area. Applications you pin are unique to you. Pinning applications can help you keep track of the application usage you’re most interested in for your schools. If you’d like to change the order of your pinned applications, please delete the app from your pins and re-add it.

---

Browse the articles linked below to learn more about the various features, tools, and products you can find in your Clever Dashboard.

title: For Clever Admins: How do I use the Clever Dashboard?

Finding more information on Clever’s features, products, and tools
text:
- Select **My applications** to view all your connected apps; select a specific application to view its [data warnings](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202043083) and [set sharing permissions](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/203115007).
- Select **Add applications** to [add a new application](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/203114997).
- Select **LMS Connect** to configure your [Clever LMS Connect](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001609) setup or review settings.
- Select **Teacher installs** to view the apps teachers have added via [Clever Library](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360015683471).
- Select **Library Settings** to determine how your district will manage sharing data from [Clever Library](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360015683471).

- Select SIS sync to view settings for the sync with your student information system and data created in Clever via the sync with your SIS.
- Select [Custom data](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360035757332) to manually create custom data that is not synced to Clever by your SIS.

- Select [Data browser](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202483068) to [view all your district's data](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202483068) being synced to Clever.

- Select **IDM** to set up or review your configuration for [Clever IDM](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001466), including reviewing recent syncs.
- Select [License manager](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001707) to manage any paid licenses for Google.
- Select **Admin team** to manage your [team settings](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202518038) and add [Clever admins](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/218547498)!

- Select [Access logs](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001698) to view users' single sign-on (SSO) attempts into your Portal.
- Select **SSO settings** to [set up how your users log into Clever](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/204982938).
- Select **Badges** to configure student Badges for your district students. With [Clever Badges](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/220213907), students can log in to Clever by holding up a physical Badge to the computer's webcam instead of typing in credentials!
- Select [Classroom MFA](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001616) to configure your Classroom MFA setup or review and edit user policies.

- Select **Organize district Portal** to view and make changes to your district's Clever Portal.
- Select **Portal settings** to edit your district's unique [Portal URL](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/205818838), configure [Substitute Access](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001675), setup your [Digital Learning Directory](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001711), or configure [Teacher Page Settings](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001723).
- Select **Communication** to [create notifications](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360025690932) for district users in Clever, or to manage your email communications from Clever.

- Select [Data quality](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202043083) to view application [data warnings](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202043083).
- The [Troubleshoot Login tool](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001477) is the perfect utility for quickly identifying root cause issues of login errors and missing icons in the portal.
- The [Troubleshoot Sharing tool](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001477) is great for identifying why or why not a user is shared with an application.

- Check out [Edtech Analytics](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360039420391) to see all of your district's app usage in one place down to the school and grade level - whether or not the apps are integrated with Clever.
- Using [Portal Analytics](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115005292523?language=en_US), you can see graphs and statistics that show how many users are accessing their resources, how often they log in, and which schools or apps are being used the most!
- Select [Reports](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360049642311) to view downloadable usage data that can also be shared with your data warehouse via SFTP.

- Select **Billing** to review details of any Clever purchases you have made such as Clever IDM or Classroom MFA subscriptions, premium support, or trainings and consultings.

- Clever Academy is our free online training and certification program for educators. Admins can access it through the District Dashboard and teachers can access it through their Clever Portal. > Sync Successful
> Your sync is fully functional. No action needed! >  
> Sync in Progress
> When the sync is pushed or started and being processed by Clever, you will see the “In Progress” label. Once the sync is completed, the label turns into “Successful”. Most syncs process within 10-15 minutes. This status also displays when a hold is released on an account. It means that Clever is processing the most current data and the account will be fully operational shortly! > Sync Pending

This article contains the following:

2. [How to fix this error](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/202058083?language=en_US#header2)

You may see a Sync Status error if the PowerSchool account you’ve provided for the Clever sync has an incorrect password - some districts’ PowerSchool settings will lock an account after a series of sign-in attempts with a wrong password.

If this has happened, you'll see this error on your District Dashboard:

Account locked due to sign in attempts with incorrect password. 
Please contact your SIS administrator to remove this restriction.

title: PowerSchool: How do I unlock my PowerSchool account if I made too many sign in attempts with incorrect password?
heading_path: PowerSchool: How do I unlock my PowerSchool account if I made too many sign in attempts with incorrect password?
text:
1. Log into PowerSchool from an administrator account (not the account you've shared with Clever).
2. Navigate to the System Administrator view (click on the left menu link for ‘System’).
3. Click on the link for ‘Security’.
4. Click on the link for ‘Locked Accounts’.
5. Verify that the account username shared with Clever is not listed here. If this account is listed, remove it.

Some PowerSchool systems also place IP restrictions on locked accounts for extra security. After removing the lock on the account, we recommend checking and removing additional IP restrictions with the following steps:

1. From the System Administrator view, click back to ‘Security’.
2. Click on the link for ‘Sign In Attempts Restrictions’.
3. At the bottom of this page you’ll see a link for ‘View Disabled IP Addresses’. Click the link and verify that Clever's IP addresses are ***not*** listed:

- *54.241.134.131*
- *50.18.217.135*
- *54.241.154.41*

If you are unable to resolve this error following the recommendations above, please contact Clever Support for additional assistance.

title: PowerSchool Auto Sync
text:
Please contact your district onboarding specialist for setup directions. If you have not yet connected with a district onboarding specialist, you can  sign up here . If you have an existing Clever account and would like to transition to the Clever-managed auto sync for PowerSchool, please contact our support team using support.clever.com for details on changing your sync type. Please note, the process of changing sync types can take 2-3 weeks. We highly recommend reviewing the conversion process as outlined  here . >  
> Customizations
> Your sync can be customized to sync nightly, instead of every four hours, but the time of day that the syncs occur is not customizable. Syncs can always be initiated/forced at any time from your Clever Dashboard > Data sources > SIS sync > Settings tab > Sync controls box > Sync Now button . Clever can filter exports from PowerSchool to limit the schools, teachers, or students included in the sync. Reach out to Clever Support if you would like to filter exports. To request customizations or filtering for your PowerSchool sync, please submit a request to Clever Support . > Syncing Student Emails
> For information on syncing student emails, please see this article . > Syncing PowerSchool Student Contacts
> Clever pulls student contact data from the Students table in the DDE in PowerSchool by default. For reference, here are the default contact fields:
> Emerg Contact 1 Emerg Contact 2 Emerg Contact 3 Emerg Phone 1 Emerg Phone 2 Emerg Phone 3 Emerg 1 Ptype Emerg 2 Ptype Emerg 3 Ptype Emerg 1 Rel Emerg 2 Rel Emerg 3 Rel
> However, if you're using PowerSchool version 12+, the student contact table resides in the Data Export Manager (DEM) and allows for unlimited student contacts. In order for Clever to sync these contacts from the DEM, you will need to first grant Clever access to the DEM. You can find more information here:  PowerSchool v12+: Student Contacts . Alternatively, you can upload student contacts directly to Clever.

title: PowerSchool Auto Sync
text:
With this option, your district can maintain maximum control and flexibility over which contacts you'd like to populate in Clever. You can upload contacts directly on your district dashboard. They will populate in Clever within about 15 minutes and should be available within your connected applications the following day. You can view instructions on how to upload contacts here: Manually Uploading Student Contacts to Clever . > School Year Rollover
> On July 2nd, Clever will begin syncing data for the next school year. If you would like to begin syncing enrollments for the new School Year before August, please request assistance from Clever Support. If you notice the previous academic year's data syncing alongside the current academic year data, please contact Clever Support requesting that the filters for TermID and DateLeft be updated for your configuration. > Troubleshooting
> Missing Records 
> If an entire record is missing, we recommend checking the following in PowerSchool:
> - Record Type: Troubleshooting Steps
> - Students: Clever will only sync students that meet the following conditions: 
> Record is active enroll\_status = 0
> - Teachers: Clever will only sync teachers that meet the following conditions: 
> Record is active ("Active" box is checked) Assigned to a school, not the district office (school\_id = 0) status = 1
> - Sections: Clever will only sync sections that meet the following conditions:
> Minimum of 1 active student enrolled No\_of\_students > 0 TermID >= 3200 (please refer to TermID for current academic year)
> - Staff: Clever does not automatically sync records from PowerSchool to the Staff role in Clever. There may be users such as administrators, custodians, and para-professionals who might not use PowerSchool directly but need access to applications through Clever. If those users are missing from your Clever data, there are two options to sync them to Clever.

title: PowerSchool Auto Sync
text:
Option A) Sync as teacher To sync the user as a teacher, confirm they meet the record requirements as outlined above. Option B) Manually add to Clever using Custom Data If the user requires access to teacher features or will need to be connected to a section, add the user as a Custom Teacher . If the user does not require teacher features and only will be using Clever for Single Sign-On (SSO), add the user as Custom Staff . >

title: For Clever Admins: Setting up multi-factor authentication (MFA) for Clever Admin
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Setting up multi-factor authentication (MFA) for Clever Admin
section: For Clever Admins: Setting up multi-factor authentication (MFA) for Clever Admin
text:
> Important: Title For Clever Admins: Setting up multi-factor authentication (MFA) for Clever Admin URL Name 202062333 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. What's MFA? 3. Setting up MFA 4. Adding authentication methods 5. Using MFA after setup 6. Viewing MFA activation status 7. Admin access control 8. Resetting MFA for admin users from the Team Page 9. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
> Overview
> Clever offers all Clever Admins complimentary multi-factor authentication (MFA) to provide an extra layer of security for admin accounts (Clever Admin, Curriculum Lead, or District Help Desk). This article explains MFA and how to set it up for your Clever account. > IMPORTANT Secure logins are required for all Clever Admins, either using multi-factor authentication (MFA) or single sign-on (SSO) Why is this required? Login credentials can be subject to malicious attacks, resulting in unauthorized access to personally identifiable information (PII). As a trusted guardian of sensitive data, we want to support you in curbing ever-evolving threats and keeping your logins safe. >    
> What’s MFA? > MFA is a way to log in to programs that requires you to use two methods (or factors) to prove your identity, like your username and password on your computer and a text message code sent to your phone. You likely already use MFA when signing in to other programs, such as your online bank account. > Please note: If you previously set up two-factor authentication in Clever for your admin account using the Authy authentication app or SMS, you can upgrade your authentication method to a more secure choice such as, Google and Microsoft authenticator apps, hardware tokens, and voice messages. > Having two methods makes it much harder for someone to hack into your account because they’d need to access to both your username/password  and the second method you used to prove your identity. The more protected your account credentials are, the safer your account!

title: For Clever Admins: Setting up multi-factor authentication (MFA) for Clever Admin
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Setting up multi-factor authentication (MFA) for Clever Admin
section: For Clever Admins: Setting up multi-factor authentication (MFA) for Clever Admin
text:
To use MFA, you’ll need to add an authentication method , such as a text message, phone call, or push notification to your phone. This second method is how MFA confirms your identity in addition to your username/password. > Setting up MFA
> Please note: If you’re an admin trying to set up Clever MFA for your district users (such as teachers and staff), please reference this article . >  
> Go to Clever Dashboard > Profile . Under the Multi-factor authentication section, click Activate MFA . If you previously had set up two-factor authentication (TFA/2FA), click Upgrade MFA . Clever's supported authentication methods will be presented. You can learn more about authentication options below . Choose a method and click Next step . Follow the instructions to set up the authentication method. Recommended: If you’d like to add more than one authentication method, click Set up another method to add another option. This will enable you to still log in should one of your second methods be unavailable (e.g., you don't have cell service for a text message). Click Exit settings . > Adding authentication methods
> You must add at least one authentication method to use MFA. Authentication method options are listed below. Adding at least one other authentication method as a backup method is good practice. This way, if you are not able to use one method for any reason (e.g., your cell phone is not charged, so you can’t receive a text message), you can use a backup method to log in successfully. Having multiple methods saves time by providing multiple options. > Please note:   Clever only supports US numbers for SMS and voice calls at this time. >  
> Text message (also called SMS) 
> Clever texts a numeric code to a cell phone number you choose. You then type this code into your Clever login screen. Setup tips:
> Text messages require cellular service. We do not recommend this authentication method if you do not have reliable cellular service in your work environment.

title: For Clever Admins: Setting up multi-factor authentication (MFA) for Clever Admin
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Setting up multi-factor authentication (MFA) for Clever Admin
section: For Clever Admins: Setting up multi-factor authentication (MFA) for Clever Admin
text:
Please consider a Mobile app. Be sure you can access your cell phone during the school day. You’ll need the code texted to this number to log in to Clever. A text message will not work for a landline. If you can only access a landline, consider an automated voice phone call. International phone number support: if your country code is not currently supported, please use an alternate method. >  
> Why doesn't Clever support email as an authentication method? You can reset your account password using your email. Using MFA with email would provide a single point of failure: a malicious actor could both reset your password and  access your account with your email account. >   
> Automated voice phone call  
> Clever sends a numeric code via an automated voice phone call to a number you choose (it can be a landline or cell phone). Then, you type this code into your Clever login screen. Setup tips:
> An automated voice call will be sent to the number added, so ensure you can answer the phone and hear the code shared. International phone number support : if your country code is not currently supported, please use an alternate method, like a Mobile app. The Mobile app method will work with most time-based one-time password (TOTP) apps. If you need to update the phone number, remove this factor and re-add the factor with the new number. > To remove an authentication method from MFA: 1. Click on Profile in the top-right of the Clever Dashboard   2. Under Multi-factor authentication, click Settings   3. Click on the authentication you would like to remove, click Remove , then click Confirm 4. When complete, click Exit settings
>    Mobile app 
> You install an app on a cell phone that provides you with a numeric code you type into your Clever login screen. Setup tips:
> Clever highly recommends using Mobile app as a second factor. It is highly secure and is available even if you do not have cell service. This is a great option if you do not have cell service at school.

title: For Clever Admins: Setting up multi-factor authentication (MFA) for Clever Admin
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Setting up multi-factor authentication (MFA) for Clever Admin

text:
To access this option, you’ll need to install an authenticator app to a cell phone and follow the MFA setup steps in Clever, so be sure you’ll have access to the phone during the school day. To set up the mobile app method, you will need to scan a QR code or use the authenticator key with your time-based one-time password (TOTP) mobile app. See the instructions for your mobile app for scanning QR codes or using authenticator keys. Clever supports one Mobile app configuration per account. Check the instructions for your mobile app to see if you can mirror your configuration across multiple devices. To use a different mobile app or reconfigure on a different device, you must remove the mobile app authentication configuration associated with your current device and re-add mobile app authentication using your new app or device. >   Setup steps, Google Authenticator App:
> On your cell phone , install the app by searching “Google Authenticator App” in the Google Play Store (Android) or the App Store (Apple). The app icon looks like this:
>  
> On your phone , you can also click the links below to access the download page for the apps:      
> On your computer , in the Clever Dashboard, navigate to Dashboard > Profile > MFA > Settings. Click  Mobile app and click Next step. A QR code will appear. On your cell phone , open the authenticator app and select Scan a QR code . You may need to grant permission for the app to use your phone’s camera. Using your phone's camera, scan the QR code on the computer screen. After scanning the code, click Next step on your computer. On your cell phone , the app will provide you with a code. On your computer , enter this code into the provided space on the MFA setup screen. Click Done . Click Exit Settings . > After this initial setup, when prompted to use MFA, you won’t need to scan a QR code: you’ll just open the Google Authenticator App and tap on the account you added . You’ll be provided with a numeric code to type into Clever.

> A security key (such as a USB device) is used to verify the login. Setup tips:
> To access this option, you’ll need a district-provided physical key or an enabled device (such as Touch ID for Macs) each time you need to verify your identity with MFA. You can set up to 4 biometrics or security keys (e.g., TouchID, FaceID, or 2 Yubikeys)

title: For Clever Admins: Setting up multi-factor authentication (MFA) for Clever Admin

text:
We’ll verify the security key and that the setup is complete. Click Exit settings . > After this initial setup, when prompted to use MFA, you’ll simply plug in your Security key (and touch it to verify fingerprint, if applicable). >
