> After initial setup, you will receive a prompt for MFA upon every login to Clever. > You can elect to have MFA remember a device for 7 days by clicking the checkmark. You’ll need to select this for each device and each MFA method separately. Remembering a device works when you are timed out or close a tab. Remembering will be reset any time you log out. > Whenever you are required to use MFA, you’ll need access to one of the methods you set up. If you receive a prompt to use MFA and don't have access to one of your second factors, you won’t be able to access your Clever account. If you have lost access to all MFA authentication methods, please contact Clever Support to request assistance with account recovery. Access logs on your Clever Dashboard show Clever Admin logins, including whether they used MFA and which MFA method they used. > Viewing MFA activation status 
> Once enabled, Clever Admins that have not activated MFA will see the following prompt on their next login:  The MFA status of any Clever Admin is available at the User management > Admin team page. Use this information to contact any Clever Admins who need to activate MFA to keep your Clever account as secure as possible! You won’t see any status for School Tech Leads on the Team page. If you’d like to add MFA for School Tech Leads, please consider the Classroom MFA. >    
> Admin access control
> To simplify account security, you can choose how users with admin roles should log into Clever. From your Clever Dashboard > User management > Admin team > Access Control tab , you can select from the following options by clicking Edit :
> Password login: 
> All admins can log into the Clever Dashboard with a Clever password.

text:
If this option is disabled, admin users must use a Clever-supported identity provider (IdP) to access their Clever Dashboard. Users with the Clever Account Owner role can use a password regardless of whether this setting is disabled and must use MFA. Examples of a district using Google SSO to access Clever:
> When enabled:  admins can use their email and password to log in at  schools.clever.com   or  can log in using Google at your  district's portal login URL When disabled:  admins must use Google to log in at your  district's portal login URL
> MFA with IdP (SSO):
> All admins will not use MFA through Clever when logging in with a Clever-supported IdP to Clever Dashboard. You can disable MFA through Clever so that admins can log in with a Clever-supported IdP to access their Clever Dashboard. Examples of a district using Google SSO to access Clever:
> When enabled:  admins will be required to use Clever MFA when accessing Clever using Google at your  district's portal login URL When disabled:  admins will not be required to use Clever MFA when accessing Clever using Google at your  district's portal login URL but may have been required to use Google MFA to access their Google accounts. Having MFA enabled on Google accounts is strongly recommended in this setup. >  
> Resetting MFA for admin users from the Team Page
> Clever Admins can reset the MFA settings for other admin user types, including Clever Admins, District Help Desk, and District Curriculum Leads. For security, the Clever Admin Owner account MFA settings can only be reset by contacting Clever Support. We strongly encourage Clever Admin Owners to set up multiple methods to provide backup access if their primary method becomes unavailable. See FAQ : "What are some good complementary methods to set up to provide a back-up access method for yourself?" Some device options to consider when choosing 2 or more:

title: For Clever Admins: How do I update sync settings?
heading_path: For Clever Admins: How do I update sync settings?
section: For Clever Admins: How do I update sync settings?
text:
Title

For Clever Admins: How do I update sync settings?

URL Name

202083526

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/202083526?language=en_US#OV) 
2. [Auto Sync Settings](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/202083526?language=en_US#SS) 
3. [SFTP Sync Settings](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/202083526?language=en_US#SFTP) 
4. [School year & pause dates](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/202083526?language=en_US#school-year-dates) 
5. [Sync hold thresholds](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/202083526?language=en_US#holds)

The [Data sources > SIS sync > Settings](https://schools.clever.com/sync/settings) page is where you can view and edit details pertaining to your Clever data sync. The features and editable fields on your Sync Settings page will vary depending on your sync type.

---

For Auto Sync districts, the Sync Settings page is where you can:

- View or edit your SIS URL (make sure that the URL you enter matches the one you use to log into your SIS)
- View or edit your SIS username
- Change your SIS Password
- View your sync schedule and initiate a new sync
- View default field mappings or request sync customizations
- [Schedule, adjust, or cancel a sync pause](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/205666507)

---

For SFTP Sync districts, the Sync Settings page is where you can:

- View your SFTP credentials to upload data to Clever via [FTP Client](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202494408)
- Upload files directly from your [Clever Dashboard](https://schools.clever.com/) via the [Web Upload Tool](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202494408)
- Download your district-specific SFTP Instructions (these instructions will automatically update as you continue to add learning applications to your Clever Dashboard - use them to determine which roster data to include in your uploads and [how to format your data files](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/203114867) )
- [Schedule, adjust, or cancel a sync pause](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/205666507)

---

Below your SIS Sync Settings, you can also adjust settings based on your school year, including:

- Share your school year dates with us (so we can best support you throughout the year)
- [Schedule, adjust, or cancel a sync pause](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/205666507)

---

Finally, at the bottom of the Sync Settings page, you'll see the Sync Hold Thresholds section. When your district's most recent attempted sync will change a significant amount of data in Clever, our system initiates an automatic sync hold. This hold prevents the changes from processing until reviewed and approved by a district admin or by Clever.

You can modify the thresholds that trigger a sync hold to prevent unnecessary holds. To prevent accidental data deletions, we do not allow for disabling delete thresholds completely. Learn more about [sync hold thresholds here](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/202494358).

Clever district admins can easily reset their passwords in case of a lost or forgotten one. This article details the process for resetting a district admin password.

When resetting your password, you'll also need access to the authentication method you've set up for [Multi Factor Authentication](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/202062333) (e.g. your cell phone to receive a text message code, Google/Microsoft authenticator app, etc.)

If you don't have access to the authentication method you set up, another Clever Admin at your district can [reset MFA for you](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/202062333#resetting). Alternatively, you can contact Clever support by clicking the chat icon in the bottom right corner.

---

To reset your District Admin password for Clever,

1. Visit schools.clever.com and click **Forgot your password?**
2. Enterthe email address associated with your admin account and click Send
3. An email will be sent with a link to reset your password. If you don't receive the email, please check your spam filter and make sure [no-reply@clever.com](mailto:no-reply@clever.com) is added as a contact to your email account.

**Quick link:**<https://schools.clever.com/reset>

title: For Clever Admins: How do I reset my password?
heading_path: For Clever Admins: How do I reset my password?
text:
**When attempting to log in to Clever, why do I see a note about my password being part of a public data breach?**

- Clever determines that a password is unsafe if it's been made public in an unrelated data breach. We perform privacy-preserving checks for passwords which have been leaked online. If a Clever Admin password matches any of these, we require the DA to reset their password.

![Login screen with a note explaining that the user's password was discovered in a breach and has been reset.](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TBph&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000005TSZm)

**Are there recommendations for choosing a secure password?**

- Use a password management solution like 1Password to use strong/unique passwords for all logins.
- Combine three or four random words. For example: “student-task-fish-fly”. These combinations are usually easy to remember and very secure.

title: Single Sign-On (SSO): "Log in with ADFS"
text:
> Important: Title Single Sign-On (SSO): "Log in with ADFS" URL Name 202102576 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Requirements 3. The user experience 4. Configuring ADFS 5. Configuring Clever SSO with ADFS
> Overview
> Clever single sign-on (SSO) enables users to be securely authenticated into connected applications via their Clever Portal. Users log in to Clever just once with one set of credentials, or using a Clever  Badge , and then click on the various app icons to be logged in automatically via SSO. Clever application partners rely on Clever's verification system of determining that a user is, indeed, who they say they are. Without Clever SSO, each application would need to maintain its own database of users and their credentials. > This article details the setup process for using ADFS as your district's Clever SSO method. > Requirements
> In addition to the basic single sign-on (SSO) requirements , you’ll need the following:  
> Active Directory Federation Services 2.x, 3.x or 4.x Metadata file accessible over HTTPS with a certificate signed by a valid certificate authority Make sure the following IP addresses are allow listed in your firewall:
> 54.241.134.131 50.18.217.135 54.241.154.41
> At least one real account to use to test the connection: In order to test the connection after set-up, you’ll need the credentials of a student or teacher. You won’t be able to test with other admin credentials; it needs to be someone whose information is also in Clever. If this is problematic, we recommend creating a test teacher or student in your SIS, syncing with Clever, and using that account instead of a real one to test the connection. >  
> The user experience
> When you set up Active Directory, you define usernames and passwords for your users.

title: Single Sign-On (SSO): "Log in with ADFS"
text:
When users access the Clever Portal  or a  single sign-on (SSO) link , they’ll be prompted to log in to Clever using these credentials by clicking Log in with Active Directory Once they click this button, they will be redirected to your Active Directory Federation Services (ADFS) login page. After users successfully log in to your Active Directory server, your ADFS instance will use claims rules  to tell us which user is logging in. >  
> Please note:   Because the credentials are entered only on the Active Directory login page, Clever will never know the usernames and passwords for your users. > Configuring ADFS
> You'll need to configure Active Directory to connect with Clever single sign-on (SSO). You'll need to update two areas:
> Relying Party Trusts Claim Rules
> Relying Party Trust
> In ADFS Management, open Trust Relationships > Relying Party Trusts . Click Add Relying Party Trusts and input https://clever.com/oauth/saml/metadata.xml where it asks for Federation Metadata address
> On the next page, you can leave the default display name ( Clever.com ) or change it to any display name you choose. > On the next page, select Permit all users to access this relying party
> Review your choices and click Finish . > Clever should now be listed as a Relying Party Trust. > Claim Rules Clever.com will now appear in the list of Relying Party Trusts. Right-click the display name and select Edit Claims Rules . These rules will ensure that Clever matches students and teachers appropriately when they log in. > Select Add Rule - the default on the first page should be Send LDAP Attributes as Claims On the next page, you can set the Claim Rule Name to anything you’d like. Select Active Directory as the attribute store - there will be two adjacent drop-down menus. For the first attribute, select SAM-Account-Name on the left and Name ID on the right. Two new drop-downs should appear.

title: Single Sign-On (SSO): "Log in with ADFS"
text:
Use the new row of drop-downs to define a claims rule - a field in your Clever SIS sync that contains the same unique identifier as a field in Active Directory. > The left drop-down will contain the attribute you’d like to send The right drop-down will contain the Clever field that we will match that data with. A list of supported entries for Outgoing Claim Type , as well as more information on Claims Rules can be found in our article:  Understanding Claims Rules . > Here’s an example of fully set up claims rules:
> In the above sample:
> SAM-Account-Name matches to sis\_id for students in Clever E-Mail-Addresses matches to emails for teachers in Clever. > This is what our systems will use to authenticate the user logging in and give them access to the correct applications through Clever. > Important Note: You'll need to personalize the LDAP attribute and Outgoing Claim Type based on the data available in Active Directory and Clever for your district. Regardless of the personalized claims rules for your district, you  must have the first claims rule pictured above (SAM-Account-Name -> Name ID). >  
> 6. Select Finish to finalize setup in ADFS! > Configuring Clever SSO with ADFS
>  
> Find your Metadata URL - in your ADFS Management Console, browse to Service > Endpoints > Metadata > Type: Federation Metadata. It should take the format: https://<ADFS server name>/federationmetadata/2007-06/FederationMetadata.xml Make sure your certificates are set up correctly - to do so, put your Metadata URL into SSL Checker . This tool will let you know if there are any issues that might prevent us from accepting your Metadata URL. > Inputting your Metadata URL  
> Take the following steps in the Clever Admin Dashboard:   
> Under your Clever Dashboard > Portal > Portal settings  page, c hoose the shortname for your SSO portal URL. The URL will be www.clever.com/in/ <shortname> . Remember to use something that your students and teachers will remember easily.

title: Single Sign-On (SSO): "Log in with ADFS"
text:
Under Clever Dashboard > Authentication > SSO settings page , click Add Login Method and select Configure SAML Authentication . Input your metadata URL in the text box and select  Save. To finish the setup process, add the contact details for the person that students and teachers should reach out to if they have trouble with logging in to Clever; this should be someone who can help them reset their Active Directory credentials and/or make sure they are shared with the application they’re trying to access through Clever. Add this at your Clever Dashboard > Authentication > SSO settings > Customize tab. > You should now be set up - try a few logins and see if you run into any issues! If you have questions about this process, please submit a request. >  
> Related articles:
> Clever SSO Policy

title: School year rollover: Overview, preparation & recommendations
heading_path: School year rollover: Overview, preparation & recommendations
section: School year rollover: Overview, preparation & recommendations
text:
> Important: Title School year rollover: Overview, preparation & recommendations URL Name 202118886 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. When a district's sync is paused 3. When a district sync pause ends or is canceled 4. Pause Dates 5. Rollover Date 6. Summer School 7. Troubleshooting data for new school year 8. Preparing for the first day of school 9. Changing your SIS, sync method, or SIS IDs
> Overview
> This article outlines Clever’s school year rollover process and how districts can prepare. For summer school recommendations, check out this article . > IMPORTANT  For 2025, Clever automatically pauses syncs on May 30 and removes pauses between July 28 and August 1 for schools in the USA. In Canada, we automatically pause syncs on  June 27 and remove pauses on August 15. For all other countries, we don't set default pause dates. You can modify these dates (or remove them altogether) under your Data sources > SIS sync > Settings page. >  
> During the pause, Clever stops processing data updates, letting districts update SIS (Student Information System) or CSV files without interrupting students, teachers, or staff access over the summer. > Current school year data will essentially be "frozen" in Clever for the duration of the district's sync pause. > Please note: If you'd like to pause syncing your data to a specific application, please see this article: For Clever Admins: Pausing your sync for a specific app . This tool is perfect for semester rollover and summer school, but it shouldn't be confused with a SIS sync pause. >  
> If the district wishes to freeze its data within Clever over the summer, we advise setting your sync pause to a date before the last day of school . Please note that a district’s SIS may attempt to delete current data on the last day of school. We recommend reaching out to your SIS to determine if this is the case so that you can plan accordingly.

title: School year rollover: Overview, preparation & recommendations
heading_path: School year rollover: Overview, preparation & recommendations
section: School year rollover: Overview, preparation & recommendations
text:
> Once the sync pause has ended, Clever will automatically resume the district's syncing with Clever-managed syncs and will resume processing SFTP data file uploads. > Unless specified otherwise by your district, Clever automatically removes pauses between July 28 and August 1 to allow Clever admins enough time for  review and testing (e.g. ensuring new users are able to log in, app sharing rules are correct, etc.) before the start of school. The 'Pause Start Date' and 'Pause End Date' can be viewed and modified by district admins from the Clever Dashboard > Data sources > SIS sync > Settings page. >  
>  
> Did you know? Application partners manage the app syncing process on their end, so each app sync could be unique. For questions about how apps handle school year rollover, please reach out to the app partner directly. >  
> When a district's sync is paused
> While your district's SIS sync to Clever is paused:
> All Clever admins with Sync pause email notifications turned on will receive an email notification the day before the pause begins. You can see all fellow Clever admins associated with your account at Clever Dashboard > User management > Admin team page. > Your sync status will show as Paused  in your Clever Dashboard. > Please note: Updates to data will not sync from your SIS to Clever during a pause, so changes made in your SIS will not interrupt student, teacher or staff access to Clever or their connected applications. SFTP uploads will not be processed, even if data is sent to Clever Clever-managed syncs will run but not process any data changes
> Applications may still be retrieving data from Clever over the summer even if a district's SIS sync is paused. > If you'd like your application(s) to stop retrieving data from Clever during the sync pause, you can pause app syncs in Clever using the App Sync Pause settings. For more on this, please see Pause your sync for a specific app . > Clever admins can still update sharing permissions for applications.

title: School year rollover: Overview, preparation & recommendations
heading_path: School year rollover: Overview, preparation & recommendations
section: School year rollover: Overview, preparation & recommendations
text:
>         
> When a district sync pause ends or is canceled
> When your district's sync pause ends or is canceled: 
> All Clever admin with Sync pause email notifications turned on will receive an email notification the day before the pause ends. You can see all fellow Clever admin at Clever Dashboard > User management > Admin team . Clever will once again resume:
> Syncing with your SIS (auto-syncs) Or processing your next SFTP upload (SFTP syncs)
> If the rostering data in Clever changes significantly once the sync resumes, your sync will be placed on an automatic hold as a safeguard to provide you time to review the rostering changes before they are processed. Of note, if Clever detects an unusual amount of potentially disruptive data changes, the Clever Support team will be notified when you attempt to approve these changes to assist you with review. Learn more about sync holds . > Admins can review sync changes before they are processed from the Clever Dashboard > Data sources > SIS sync page by using the Download Changes  option to the right of each data type. >  
>              
>  
> Pause Dates
> Admins can make adjustments to the sync  'Pause Start Date' and 'Pause End Date' from the Data sources > SIS sync > Settings page as follows:
> Pause Start Date : This will be the first day your sync goes on pause, which should coincide with the last day of the current school year. > Please note: Your current school year data should still be active in your SIS on this day. > Pause End Date : This will be the last day your sync is paused, which should be the day before your SIS data is active for the upcoming school year. > For example: If next school year's data will be active in your SIS on 8/15/25,  your Pause End Date should be set for 8/14/25 . This might also be your last day of summer. Sync pauses run from 12:00 AM on the pause start date to 11:59 PM on the pause end date, local time.

title: School year rollover: Overview, preparation & recommendations
heading_path: School year rollover: Overview, preparation & recommendations
section: School year rollover: Overview, preparation & recommendations
text:
For example, if you wish to resume syncing with Clever on August 10th, please set the Pause End Date to August 9th. > Please note: If possible, we recommend unpausing your district's sync a week or two in advance of the new school year to give you time to review the changes, see if there are any errors, and let your district know. >  
> Rollover Date
> In Clever, the rollover date marks the transition of district data from the previous school year to the upcoming one. This usually occurs during the summer when the data for the upcoming school year is live but before the first day of school. District admins will be prompted to choose the rollover date upon adjusting their sync pause dates in the Data sources > SIS sync > Settings page. >  
>  
>  You can also modify it by clicking  Edit rollover selection . >  
> Even if you don't plan to pause your sync, it's important to mark the new school year rollover date in Clever as it enables us to guarantee the seamless functioning of your applications. > If you do not set a rollover date, you risk applications showing sections and assignments listed under the previous academic year. > This proactive approach ensures that your Clever account is fully primed and operational for the upcoming school year! > Some districts (such as those that operate on a year-round schedule) may choose not to set a rollover date, but you should check with Clever Support if you're considering opting out of a rollover date. >  
> Summer School
> If you’re looking specifically for summer school recommendations, check out Summer School: Overview. >  
> Troubleshooting data for the new school year
> If you are not seeing the current school year data in Clever:  1. Confirm that your account is not on pause. Data for the new school year will not be able to sync to Clever until the pause is removed from your sync. You can adjust your pause dates from the bottom of the Sync > Settings page. >  
> 2.

title: School year rollover: Overview, preparation & recommendations
heading_path: School year rollover: Overview, preparation & recommendations
section: School year rollover: Overview, preparation & recommendations
text:
Confirm that data was synced to Clever after the pause was removed. You will not see data for the next academic year in Clever until we receive a set of data  after the pause is removed. If your new data was uploaded to Clever prior to the pause being removed, please re-upload the data to Clever. 3. Confirm your data is not on hold Since there are often major changes to data when transitioning school years, your data sync will likely go on hold. You can approve the data changes to release your hold from the Clever Dashboard > Data sources > SIS sync page. 4. Confirm your student information system (SIS) is sending new school year's data to Clever Rollover information for Clever-managed syncs  can be found in our Help Center. For all other sync types and SISs, please contact the support team for your SIS. > Preparing for the first day of school
> Here are some key recommendations to help you prepare for the new school year in Clever:
> 1. Student Information System (SIS)
> Confirm that the new rosters are active in your SIS so they'll successfully sync to Clever. If you'll be sharing data with Clever before you want students or teachers to see the new school year data, you can temporarily turn off access to Clever with Access Controls . > 2. Sync Hold
> Confirm that your SIS sync is no longer on hold from your  Data sources > SIS sync page. > 3. Applications
> Review all application sharing permissions   to ensure the appropriate data is shared prior to the start of school. > Please note: If your district is “sharing by section” with any applications, you may need to update your section sharing rules for app partners to retrieve the new data. > Confirm all district apps are launched , and the syncs are active. Navigate to your  District Dashboard  and click on the application name to open the app overview page to verify these details.

title: School year rollover: Overview, preparation & recommendations
heading_path: School year rollover: Overview, preparation & recommendations
section: School year rollover: Overview, preparation & recommendations
text:
> If the sync does not appear to be running, please check that any App Sync Pauses have been removed or reach out to the application support team directly for assistance
>                 
> For rostering/SSO applications, be sure you have spot-checked students and teachers to ensure they are being logged in successfully to the app(s) through Clever. This can be done using the  Impersonating a User: 'Access Portal as' Feature. If your district uses any SSO (Saved Passwords) applications, ensure you’ve provisioned accounts directly with the app, then configured the user credentials in Clever and tested them to make sure they’re working. For priority connections, we recommend communicating with the vendor when your data is ready to be synced for the new school year. > 4. Data Browser
> From your Clever Dashboard > Data browser , spot-check the following:
> Students:
> Ensure pertinent details are in Clever for your students (e.g. email address, student numbers, section enrollments, apps, etc.)
> Teachers:
> Ensure pertinent details are in Clever for your teachers (e.g. email address, section assignments, apps, etc.)
> Sections: 
> Ensure the updated sections for the new school year are in Clever and look correct. If co-teachers need to be manually assigned to sections in Clever, follow the instructions in this article . > Staff:
> Ensure any non-instructional staff who need access to Clever are showing under the 'Staff' tab and their pertinent details are present (e.g. email address, staff ID). See this article for more information about staff. > 5. Badges
> Clever recommends that you void and reprint badges during your annual rollover period, such as the summer or winter. Beginning January 1, 2025, you will see expiration dates on any newly created or re-printed existing badges. By default, all existing badges will expire on December 31, 2025 and new badges will be valid for 365 days from the creation date . See this article for more information.

title: School year rollover: Overview, preparation & recommendations
heading_path: School year rollover: Overview, preparation & recommendations
section: School year rollover: Overview, preparation & recommendations
text:
>  
>   Reusing Section IDs:  Clever refreshes all Clever IDs associated with section\_ids to ensure new sections do not retain data from the previous school year within connected applications. This shouldn't impact students and teachers retaining historical data in their apps because app partners expect all new sections for the start of the school year. When your district's sync unpauses, Clever automatically provisions all sections with new Clever IDs even if the section IDs stay the same. That said, some applications require that Section\_ids (not just the Clever IDs associated with the section IDs) be unique to the academic year. As such, Clever discourages reusing section\_ids between academic years. >  
>  
>  
> Changing your SIS, sync method, or SIS IDs
> Changing your Student Information System (SIS) If you are changing your Student Information System (SIS), please contact Clever Support to notify us of the upcoming change. Our team will partner with you to create a migration plan and timeline based on your new SIS and available sync methods. Please allow at least 2-3 weeks to complete the migration with Clever Support. We highly recommend starting this process at least a month before your first day of school. For more information on the transition process, please see this article: Changing Student Information Systems . Changing your sync method If your district is using the same Student Information System (SIS) for the upcoming year, but would like to change sync methods, please contact Clever Support for consultation. We will work with you to confirm the sync method provides access to the data required for your connected applications. Depending on the sync method, please allow up to 2 weeks for the migration to be completed. If moving to an SFTP method, we recommend a minimum of 3 weeks to ensure the CSV files sent to Clever are complete and formatted correctly. We HIGHLY recommend starting this process at least a month before your first day of school.

title: School year rollover: Overview, preparation & recommendations
heading_path: School year rollover: Overview, preparation & recommendations
section: School year rollover: Overview, preparation & recommendations
text:
When changing sync methods, we recommend maintaining the same primary identifiers (SIS IDs) for your students, teachers, schools, etc. This will ensure historical data is retained in Clever and connected applications. If SIS IDs are changing, our team will need to complete a matching process to preserve existing accounts. In addition to the time to set up the new sync method, please allow an additional 1 week for the account matching process. For more information on changing sync methods, please see this article . Changing SIS IDs Commonly, the need to change the SIS ID for users is due to a district needing to meet the data requirements for a specific connection. Clever Support may be able to help you meet this data requirement without disrupting your existing data in Clever. If you need to change SIS IDs to meet an application requirement, please contact our team with the following:  
> The name of the application that requires the data change The user record type that requires the SIS ID change (students, teachers, etc.) The name of the field from your SIS that you need in the SIS ID field in Clever
> Our team will review the requirements and communicate the next steps to ensure a successful connection to the application while minimizing disruption to your existing applications. For more information on changing SIS IDs, please see this article .

Title

For Clever Admins: Sync Reports

URL Name

202213756

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/202213756?language=en_US#h_bcaa61ce-bd39-4973-8aa5-14e0e7270b2e) 
2. [Reviewing your Sync Report](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/202213756?language=en_US#h_01EEE2G3DRAY1H2DDQEBS0N2TN)

By navigating to your [Sync Report](https://schools.clever.com/sync), you can see the details of the latest upload to Clever, including the number of records created, updated, and deleted as compared to the data previously in Clever.

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TJQf&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028Bnt)

title: For Clever Admins: Sync Reports
text:
**Last Sync** 
The date and time of the last successful sync for your data in Clever. If your account is paused or on hold, it will reflect the last sync to fully process into Clever. As such, the Last Sync date time may be different than the last time Clever received data from your SIS.

**Record Type** 
Record type describes the type of record being referenced. Please note, enrollments are rolled into *Sections* and will be reflected in the Sections change logs.

**Existing** 
The number of active records in Clever *prior* to the most recent sync.

**Created** 
The number of records created in Clever during the most recent sync.

**Updated** 
The number of records updated in Clever during the most recent sync.

**Deleted** 
The number of records deleted in Clever during the most recent sync.

**Errors** 
The number of errors related to the record type for the most recent sync.

**Download Changes** 
Click this button to download CSV files that outline the changes for each record type for the most recent sync. Also included are any errors for the record type.

title: For Clever Admins: Sync Reports
heading_path: Viewing data errors and change logs
section: Viewing data errors and change logs
text:
The Sync Report page offers the ability to review and resolve errors for the data sync to Clever. To view data errors:

- Navigate to your [Clever Dashboard > SIS sync](https://schools.clever.com/sync) page.
- Download a CSV file of the affected records by selecting the **Download changes** option for the desired record type.

The following articles may help with troubleshooting some of your district's sync errors:

- [Sync Reports: Error Messages](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001482)
- [Sync Report error: Records not processed due to duplicate ID's](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115003073603)
- [Sync Report error: Records not processed due to missing school](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115003095266)
- [Sync Report error: Sections not processed due to missing students](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115003073643)

If you have any questions about sync reports, please reach out to [Clever support](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360001041326)! We are happy to help!

title: Which sync type should I choose?
heading_path: Which sync type should I choose?
section: Which sync type should I choose?
text:
Title

Which sync type should I choose?

URL Name

202289278

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/202289278?language=en_US#overview) 
2. [Clever-Managed Auto Sync](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/202289278?language=en_US#clever_managed_sync) 
3. [SIS-Managed Auto Sync](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/202289278?language=en_US#sis_managed_auto_sync) 
4. [SFTP Syncs](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/202289278?language=en_US#sftp_syncs)

Clever is compatible with all Student Information Systems (SIS), and depending on the SIS we offer a Clever-Managed Auto Sync, an SIS-Managed Auto Sync, or an SFTP Sync. The following information helps to explain the three supported sync types:

---

title: Which sync type should I choose?
heading_path: Which sync type should I choose?
text:
How does it work?

- For Clever-Managed Auto Syncs, Clever has written an integration that exports data directly from the SIS and securely transfers it to Clever.
- For these syncs, Clever requires configured credentials to access your SIS. As with all Clever syncs, you will still have complete control over data sharing and management of your Clever account.

Can I customize what roster data is synced?

- The ability to customize data for Clever-Managed Auto Syncs is limited, but we may be able to remove unwanted fields or include additional fields in your sync to meet your district’s needs. [Contact our Support Team to request help](https://support.clever.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).

What are the next steps?

- Before signing up for a Clever account, create a Clever read-only account in your SIS.

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TmR3&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000287qs) Check out [this article](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202042973?language=en_US) for a complete list of Clever-Managed Auto Syncs!

---

title: Which sync type should I choose?
heading_path: Which sync type should I choose?
text:
How does it work?

- For SIS-Managed Auto Syncs, Clever has partnered directly with the SIS provider to offer an automated sync option. Clever does not require credentials or access to the SIS directly.
- To take advantage of these SIS-managed syncs, select the 'Automatic' option during signup, and Clever will provide instructions to initiate the sync from your SIS to Clever.
- In most cases, you will need to share Clever sync credentials with your SIS provider, and the SIS will generate and regularly upload data to Clever on your behalf. As with all Clever syncs, you will still have complete control over data sharing and management of your Clever account.

Can I customize what roster data is synced?

- If you have questions about customizing, please contact your SIS directly.

What are the next steps?

- After creating your Clever account, navigate to the [Data sources > SIS sync > Settings](https://schools.clever.com/sync/settings) tab for instructions on how to activate your SIS-Managed Auto Sync.

---

title: Which sync type should I choose?
heading_path: Which sync type should I choose?
text:
How does it work?

- The SFTP (Secure File Transfer Protocol) Sync option allows school districts to “push” data to Clever. Clever provides credentials for Secure File Transfer Protocol as well as a web-based upload option, and districts generate files to upload to their accounts.
- Clever recommends that you investigate automating the process for exporting and uploading data via SFTP; regular uploads to Clever mean current data in your apps.

Which student information systems (SIS) are available?

- SFTP Sync is available for all SISs.

Can I customize what roster data is synced?

- Because districts control exactly what data to include in their upload files, this option provides districts a greater level of customization but requires a more robust setup and management.

What are the next steps?

- To learn more about the data upload process for districts using SFTP Sync, see [SFTP Syncs: What is the sync process?](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/205783078?language=en_US)
- If you are interested in automating your SFTP uploads, Clever supports data ingestion via nightly SFTP transmission to a secure SFTP server. While this method does not allow for real-time data uploads and requires additional configuration, it may be a useful option for schools whose IT Departments have already prepared SFTP scripts. The SFTP data transfer to Clever requires the submission of multiple files in a specific [CSV format](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/203114867?language=en_US).

If you have any questions, please reach out to [Clever support](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360001041326)! We are happy to help!

title: How much does Clever cost districts and schools?
heading_path: How much does Clever cost districts and schools?
section: How much does Clever cost districts and schools?
text:
> Note: Title How much does Clever cost districts and schools? URL Name 202393278 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. How does Clever generate revenue? > Please note: If you are outside of the United States, check out our international article for more information. > Overview
> Clever is a free service for schools and districts in the United States and Canada! This means Clever doesn’t charge schools or districts to utilize our platform. > We offer the following services at no charge to districts! > Secure Sync Clever Portal Single-sign on (SSO) Clever Badges Clever Analytics Clever Library
> Optional paid add-ons:
> Clever IDM is an optional, paid add-on for school districts. School districts can add Clever IDM to their free Clever digital learning platform to automate identity management to help keep Google and Active Directory in sync with their SIS. Classroom Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) allows your students and teachers to securely MFA into Clever to protect all of your Clever applications without the requirement of a second device. This solution helps you stay ahead of cybersecurity threats without disrupting learning. You can add this as an optional, paid add-on. > How does Clever generate revenue? > Clever's partnerships with online learning providers (i.e. application partners) are what generate revenue for us. Our application partners pay Clever based on their usage of our  Application Programming Interface (API) . Essentially, they purchase Clever’s technology, including complex integrations with various Student Information Systems (SIS). This allows our partners to focus on their core business needs instead of dedicating time to complicated district setups. With a Clever integration, application partners avoid building and maintaining custom integrations for every district—freeing up resources and streamlining operations. >  For more information regarding application partner pricing, please visit our pricing page here.

>

2. [Full District Control](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/202393058?language=en_US#h_269ab97c-d25b-4f33-9092-d497b3393549) 
3. [Student Data Privacy at Clever](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/202393058?language=en_US#h_f4e00d03-509a-4e93-9ae5-f0b4789c8793) 
4. [Infrastructure](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/202393058?language=en_US#h_b43c44b3-b85c-46cc-8148-2dad99bb7d3f)

School districts across the nation rely on Clever to sync roster data with their applications, in part because security is a top priority. Clever keeps student information safe by ensuring:

- Full district control over data access rights at all times;
- A robust [privacy policy](https://clever.com/trust/privacy/policy) that governs our use of student data; and
- Protection through a tested and secure infrastructure.

Districts control data access at all points in the process, from signup all the way through account provisioning. Districts determine:

- What data Clever can access (always read-only);
- How often they sync data with Clever;
- Which applications can access data; and
- How much data each application can access (via [data sharing permissions](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/203115007)).

Districts can fine-tune these settings at any time through the Clever Dashboard. If a district chooses to discontinue their Clever sync, they can do so at any time. Clever will delete their account and remove any residual data immediately upon request.

Clever syncs basic information to manage user accounts in online learning applications, such as student and teacher identifiers, section names, and enrollment information.

All rostering data that is synced with Clever is protected by industry-leading infrastructure (see below). Clever will never use or sell student information for marketing or other purposes.

Additionally, Clever maintains FERPA compliance under the FTC's School Officials Exemption, meaning Clever provides a service on behalf of schools that the schools themselves would usually provide. Furthermore, all Clever-supported applications agree to adhere to FERPA requirements in the terms of our partnership.

To learn more about data privacy, you can read Clever's full [Privacy Policy](https://clever.com/trust/privacy/policy)

This article contains the following:

Clever Admins have two ways to review their district or school’s SIS rostering data in Clever. The first method Clever Admins can use is the search bar at the top of the page from the [Clever Dashboard](https://schools.clever.com/) to quickly find a specific school, student, teacher, section, staff member, or application in Clever.

The second method is the Data Browser. Clever Admins can use the Data Browser to view and filter the rostering data (schools.csv, teachers.csv, students.csv, sections.csv, and staff.csv) currently in Clever. This includes both custom data and data synced by your district or school’s student information system (SIS). Clever Admins can access the Data Browser from the left menu sidebar in the [Clever Dashboard](https://schools.clever.com/).

---

title: For Clever Admins: How do I browse and search data in Clever with the Data Browser or Search Bar?
heading_path: For Clever Admins: How do I browse and search data in Clever with the Data Browser or Search Bar?
text:
The first method for locating data or applications in your Clever account is utilizing the Search Bar at the top of your Clever Dashboard.

Begin typing in the Search Bar, and all possible related content will appear:

![Search bar displaying the search for "Sarah"](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TBmT&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000PfdVF)

Use the icons below the search bar to filter your results further. For example, if we only want students with the name “Sarah” to appear in our results, we can click the **Student** filter icon, and our search results will narrow to just students:

![Using Search Bar filters](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TBmT&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000Mh8kB)

You can also take actions such as viewing their profile for more information, accessing the user’s Portal, or resetting their MFA method directly from the Search Bar by clicking the user to view a dropdown menu.

![Search bar actions](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TBmT&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000MhYg5)

Actions you can take directly from the Search Bar will vary based on the user type or application you are viewing, as well as settings configured for that particular user type, but may include:

- Viewing a user’s profile in the Clever Dashboard
- Accessing the user’s Portal
- Resetting a password
- Updating a staff role from Portal Access Only to School Tech Lead
- Editing application sharing
- Requesting an application

In addition to viewing search results and taking actions directly from the Search Bar, you can also navigate to a full page of search results by selecting the **See all X results** text at the bottom of your search.

![See all X results button in Search Bar](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TBmT&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000Pfe9Z)

This option will bring you to a full page of search results, on which you can filter by data type and take actions similar to those within the Search Bar. The full-page results will allow you to review your search results more completely.

![Full page search results](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TBmT&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000PfeMT)

*An example of a full page for search results.*

---

The second method for viewing your district or school's information in Clever is to navigate to your [Clever Dashboard > Data browser](https://schools.clever.com/data-browser).

Once in the Data Browser, select the appropriate data tab at the top of the page to view district schools, students, teachers, staff, sections, terms, courses, or contacts.

After you've selected a tab, you can see context about each record, including:

- **Data source:** This is where the data came from, such as your SIS, a custom data upload, Active Directory, etc.
- **Last Modified:** The last time the record was changed or updated.

![Data browser](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TBmT&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000EDINF)

---

title: For Clever Admins: How do I browse and search data in Clever with the Data Browser or Search Bar?
heading_path: For Clever Admins: How do I browse and search data in Clever with the Data Browser or Search Bar?
Searching with filters in the Data Browser
section: Searching with filters in the Data Browser
text:
You can drill down further by clicking **Add Filter** to search for specific records using one or more filters. Once the list populates, click the name of a record to view the record's associated details.

Filters and hyperlinks allow you to easily review the data in Clever. From the appropriate tab, use the filter feature to search for specific records. Then, narrow your search results by adding additional filters. Finally, click the record name to open the user or record's details window.

There are additional features available to Clever Admins from the user or record's details card. For example:

- Voiding or generating Clever Badges for students (if enabled at your district or school).
- Navigating to a user or record's profile page in Clever.
- Impersonating users to access their Clever Portal(s).
- Troubleshooting login issues

---

You can easily export data from the data browser by clicking the **Export** button in the top right. The records will be emailed to the email address associated with your Clever account.

---

Clever Admins can determine which data is shared with the district or school's connected applications by [setting their sharing rules](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/115000392247). The Data Browser and Search Bar surface the district/school's entire set of rostering data in Clever, but not everything that is visible in Clever is necessarily shared with every application.

---

title: For Clever Admins: How often will my data sync to Clever?
heading_path: For Clever Admins: How often will my data sync to Clever?
section: For Clever Admins: How often will my data sync to Clever?
text:
Title

For Clever Admins: How often will my data sync to Clever?

URL Name

202491558

Article Body

To see when your data last synced to Clever, view the Sync Status on your Clever Dashboard:

![Sync status](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TDt7&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000WDltA)

The frequency of your uploads to Clever depends on your sync type, as outlined below.

For most Auto Syncs, data will sync from your SIS to Clever every 4-6 hours. You can initiate a new sync from the [Data sources > SIS sync > Settings](https://schools.clever.com/sync/settings) page of your Dashboard:

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TDt7&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000003BE1b)

Syncs can be customized to occur nightly instead. A nightly sync will occur sometime between 10 pm and 4 am ET, but we can't specify an exact sync time. Please contact Clever Support to request a nightly sync.

Your SIS will upload data to Clever once per day. If you have questions about the exact time of your data upload, please reach out to your SIS provider directly.

Data will update in Clever each time you upload new data. We recommend that you upload data at least daily.

If you schedule an automated SFTP upload, we recommend scheduling it to run before 7 pm EST because many applications update their data starting at 8 pm ET. If you have questions about the update schedule of a specific app, please reach out to the application directly.

text:
Title

Sync Error: How do I resolve "Invalid username/password specified?"

URL Name

202493868

Article Body

Many of Clever’s Auto-Syncs rely on a read-only SIS account to sync data. When the username and password for this account are incorrect, your sync cannot complete successfully.

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TjHt&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028DKF) 
![](/hc/en-us/article_attachments/115002137027/Screen_Shot_2017-01-11_at_1.51.42_PM.png)

title: Sync Error: How do I resolve "Invalid username/password specified?"
heading_path: Sync Error: How do I resolve "Invalid username/password specified?"
text:
1. Check your credentials by logging into your SIS with the username and password you've provided to Clever. (You can find these credentials on your [Data sources > SIS sync > Settings](https://schools.clever.com/sync/settings) tab. If you are unable to log in with the credentials it means they have expired, changed, or are no longer valid.
2. Update the credentials in your SIS. We strongly recommend creating a separate read-only account in your SIS, just for the Clever sync. You can confirm the required permissions for this account in the [Auto-Sync section](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/topic/0TO1P000000DZnTWAW/clevermanaged-syncs?language=en_US) of our Help Center.
3. Once you've updated the credentials, confirm that they are working by using them to log into your SIS.
4. With new credentials in hand, navigate back to your [Sync Settings](https://schools.clever.com/sync/settings) page and enter the new credentials required to connect to your SIS, including username and/or password.
5. Once entered, click ‘Update.' Clever will attempt another sync with your SIS as scheduled, so you should see your Sync Status update within a few hours.

text:
Title

Sync Error: How do I resolve "SIS is not currently available at the URL provided"?

URL Name

202493888

Article Body

Many of Clever’s automatic syncs rely on the URL for your SIS to sync data. When Clever is unable to access this URL your sync cannot complete successfully.

![](/hc/en-us/article_attachments/115002137107/Screen_Shot_2017-01-11_at_1.52.59_PM.png)![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TjJV&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028DKK)

Some common causes for URL errors include:

- URL includes a typo
- URL does not direct to a valid SIS login page
- URL is not accessible from outside of your district’s network/VPN
- URL access is blocked by firewall restrictions
- District needs to grant access to Clever's IP addresses

1. Find the URL you’ve shared with Clever on your [Data sources > SIS sync > Settings](https://schools.clever.com/sync/settings) tab.
2. Make sure that the URL you entered matches the one you use to log in to your SIS.
 - Note for PowerSchool users: Clever drops the "/admin" extension on PowerSchool URLs, so it's normal to not see this extension.
3. Confirm that you can use this URL to log in to your SIS *from* *outside of your district’s network/VPN.*
4. If you’re not able to access the URL you provided, determine the correct URL and update it in Clever (check for typos, adjust firewall, etc.).

1. Log in to your [Clever Dashboard](https://schools.clever.com/) and navigate to the [Sync Settings page](https://schools.clever.com/settings/system) to update your SIS URL in Clever.
2. When you click “Update” Clever will attempt another sync with your SIS, so you should see your Sync Status update within a few hours.

- 54.241.134.131
- 50.18.217.135
- 54.241.154.41

Your district may also need to make sure ports 443 and 80 are open.

title: Sync Error: How do I resolve "Security preferences need to be set for this account"?
heading_path: Sync Error: How do I resolve "Security preferences need to be set for this account"?
section: Sync Error: How do I resolve "Security preferences need to be set for this account"?
text:
Title

Sync Error: How do I resolve "Security preferences need to be set for this account"?

URL Name

202493908

Article Body

Some SISs periodically request security preferences to be updated for active accounts. These preferences safeguard your account and allow for recovery if a password is forgotten.

When Clever encounters this error, your sync will not complete successfully. You’ll notice the following Sync Status message on your Clever Dashboard:

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka01P0000005zHu&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028DKP)

How to fix this error:

1. Log into your SIS using the username and password you've shared with Clever.
2. Follow the instructions to update your security preferences.
3. Save your changes.
4. Log out of your SIS and log back in with the same credentials to confirm that the error is resolved.

Once the security preferences are set and you can log into your SIS, you should see your sync resume shortly.

Title

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/202493918?language=en_US#overview) 
2. [Fixing the error](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/202493918?language=en_US#fixing)

If you notice an error message on your Clever sync that says, "The password on the SIS account needs to be reset," this article is for you.

This may occur if you've updated the password for the Student Information System account shared with Clever. Some SIS accounts require users to set a new password after an administrator resets their password, and some require passwords to be changed periodically.

If your sync is experiencing this error, you'll receive an email and see this sync status on your Clever Dashboard:

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TjL7&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028DKU)

---

title: Sync Error: How do I resolve "The password on the SIS account needs to be reset"?
heading_path: Sync Error: How do I resolve "The password on the SIS account needs to be reset"?
text:
Step 1: Log in to your SIS as an administrator and reset the password for the Clever access account. You can see the username you’ve shared with Clever on your [Data sources > SIS sync > Settings](https://schools.clever.com/sync/settings) tab.

Step 2: In a new window, log in to your SIS with the Clever access account username and the new password.

Step 3: Enter the temporary password and create a new password.

![Example SIS password reset screen](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TjL7&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028DKZ)

Step 4: Update the [Data sources > SIS sync > Settings](https://schools.clever.com/sync/settings) tab in your Clever Dashboard with the new password.

Clever will try to sync at the next scheduled time, so you should see your sync status update within a few hours. You can also press **Sync Now** on your Sync Settings page to initiate a sync. You should see the next sync process within 30 minutes.

title: For Clever Admins: Sync Holds
text:
> Warning: Title For Clever Admins: Sync Holds URL Name 202494358 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Default hold thresholds 3. Custom hold thresholds 4. Reviewing sync reports           •    If the sync changes look good           •    If the sync changes look incorrect 5. School year and term rollovers
> Overview
> When a district's most recent student information system (SIS) sync to Clever will be changing a significant amount of rostering data, our system initiates an automatic sync hold to prevent the changes from processing until reviewed and approved by a Clever Admin. Sync holds are a safeguard to avoid potentially incorrect or undesired changes from being processed and synced to connected applications. These holds are essential to the sync process as they ensure that Clever Admins are aware of potentially significant changes to their Clever data. Without holds, a district could experience unintended changes to data, which could negatively impact users and connected applications. > Please note:  Significant changes to custom data can also trigger a hold. Holds are not limited to only your synced data. > As shown below, when a sync is on hold, Clever Admins can select the Review Hold option under the sync hold alert or can review the information from their Clever Dashboard > Data sources > SIS sync  page before accepting or declining the changes. An email will also be sent to the district's Clever Admins who have their  Sync emails enabled . >  
> If the deletions for schools, students, teachers, or staff exceed 95%, and the Clever Admin chooses to accept the changes, a Clever support ticket will be automatically created to be reviewed by a Clever Support agent. Support cases are not automatically created for the following record types: sections, contacts, and terms. >  
> Default hold thresholds
> A district's data automatically goes on hold when at least 75% of any data type (e.g.

title: For Clever Admins: Sync Holds
text:
schools, students, teachers, sections) is being updated, or over 10% is being deleted. These thresholds can be customized . >  
>  
> Custom hold thresholds
> Clever Admins can set custom hold thresholds for all record types (e.g. schools, students, teachers, sections) on the Data sources > SIS sync > Settings  page. Setting hold thresholds can be helpful for:
> Small districts where small changes in data may represent large percentage changes Clever Admins that plan to make large updates and want to avoid a hold for known changes
> Clever Admins can determine the percentage threshold for both updates and deletions for each record type. The following ranges are allowed:
> Updates
> 0 - 100% - Schools, Students, Sections, Teachers, Contacts, Terms
> Deletions
> 0 - 90% - Schools, Students, Sections, Teachers, Contacts 0 - 100% - Terms
> If desired, holds for updates may be disabled. Holds for deletions may not be disabled and have a max threshold of 90%. Example view of custom hold thresholds:
>  
>  
>  
>  
>  
>  
> Sync reports
> Clever Admins can review their sync reports from the Clever Dashboard > Data sources > SIS sync page. The report consists of a table summarizing the data changes that triggered the sync hold. These changes will not be processed in Clever until they have been approved by a Clever Admin. > Select  Download Changes to view updates, deletions, warnings, and errors for each record type. >              
> If the sync changes look good
> Great! Select Approve Changes. > If the changes are less than 95% deletions, Clever will immediately begin processing the new data. If the changes are more than 95% deletions or updates for any record type, a support case will be generated with Clever Support for final review. This is an extra safeguard for districts to ensure there is no negative effect on students, teachers, and applications.

title: For Clever Admins: Sync Holds
text:
Please include a message noting why significant changes are being made -- Clever Support will use this information to review the hold. If everything looks correct, the team will release the hold. If any concerns arise, they will contact you via email. >  
> If the sync changes look incorrect
> No problem! If the changes were not intentional, please follow these steps: For SFTP syncs :
> Select 'Discard Changes'. Depending on your district's sync type, you will: 
> SFTP syncs: Review and correct the CSV file(s) that triggered the hold, and then re-upload your CSV files to Clever via your SIS, or via the Data sources > SIS sync > Upload page. SIS-managed SFTP syncs:  Clever has little insight into how data is filtered and exported from a district's SIS, so we are not able to help troubleshoot beyond looking at the files we receive. If you are unable to determine why the data changes were incorrect, please reach out to your SIS rep to see if they can investigate the issue on their end. > Submit another upload: If the revised data matches your existing data in Clever closely enough, the new upload will override the hold, and the changes will process automatically. > For Auto Syncs :
> Select Discard Changes. Review the data in your SIS to see if you can determine why the synced data is changing so significantly. It may be necessary to loop in your SIS rep for assistance. Once the issues have been addressed in your SIS, you should be able to initiate a sync to Clever using the Sync Now option on the Data sources > SIS sync > Settings page. If the revised data matches your existing data in Clever closely enough, the new upload will override the hold, and the changes will process automatically. >  
> School year and term rollovers 
> When a school year or term rolls over, the sync updates from your district's SIS will typically trigger a sync hold, which is expected! In most cases, the rollover changes will contain significant updates to the rostering data in Clever.

Here are some changes that would be expected:
> Sections : 100% deleted, 100% created Students : 100% updated, 10-25% deleted, 10-25% created Teachers : 10-20% deleted, 10-20% created
> If you're not sure about the hold, navigate to the  Data sources > SIS sync page in the Clever Dashboard. From there, you can select the  Download Changes for each record type. This will download a .zip file which includes the creations, updates, deletions, warnings and errors for the related record type. >            
> For detailed information regarding school year and term rollovers, please visit:
> School Year Rollover: Overview, Preparation & Recommendations Term Rollover: Overview, Preparation & Recommendations

title: SFTP Syncs: Uploading data to Clever
heading_path: SFTP Syncs: Uploading data to Clever
section: SFTP Syncs: Uploading data to Clever
text:
> Note: Title SFTP Syncs: Uploading data to Clever URL Name 202494408 Article Body This article covers the following: 1. Overview 2. Option 1: Clever's Web Upload Tool 3. Option 2: FTP client 4. Locating your SFTP credentials 5. Clever’s SFTP Host Keys
> Overview
> This article will cover how to upload data to Clever for SFTP and SFTP SIS-Managed Auto Syncs. You have a couple of options for getting your school or district data into Clever (and, therefore, any other app you connect to Clever):
> Option 1: Manually uploading the data via the Data sources > SIS sync > Upload page. Option 2: Using an automated SFTP transfer ( see here for more information ). > Option 1: Clever's Web Upload Tool
>  
> Onboarding to Clever and want to learn about uploading CSV files? Check out our Onboarding - Getting your schools’ data into Clever course, available in Clever Academy! >  
> You can find the Web Upload tool from your Data sources > SIS sync > Upload page. From there you can drag and drop each file, or click the cloud to browse and attach each CSV file. Select Upload and wait until the top of the page displays Your files have been uploaded  before leaving the page. > Please note: While not always required, it is best practice to always upload the entire set of files ( schools.csv, teachers.csv, students.csv, sections.csv and enrollments.csv ) every time you do an upload. >  
> To learn more about this process and how you can map your fields to Clever fields, please review  this article . > Why is the Web Upload Tool Missing? > The Web Upload Tool is only available to districts that are SFTP. The Web Upload Tool page will redirect districts that use SIS-managed SFTP syncs or Clever-managed syncs to the Custom Data page:
>  
> How can I add staff?

title: SFTP Syncs: Uploading data to Clever
heading_path: SFTP Syncs: Uploading data to Clever
section: SFTP Syncs: Uploading data to Clever
text:
> If your school district uses an SIS-managed SFTP sync or a Clever-managed sync, you can upload staff on the Data sources > SIS sync > Staff Data page via the following options:
> Sync with your SIS auto sync Upload a staff.csv to your Clever SFTP directory Active Directory sync (if staff members have Active Directory accounts) Add additional staff as Custom Data on the Custom Data page
>  
>  
> Option 2: FTP client
> Another option for sending files to Clever is using the Secure File Transfer Protocol , also known as SSH File Transfer Protocol. The following outlines the process for manually uploading files through an FTP client . Many districts write a script to upload files via SFTP automatically. At this time Clever does not provide support for setting up these automations. > There are many FTP clients available (e.g. Transmit ,  FileZilla or WinSCP ). When you choose an FTP client, first confirm that it will support SFTP, as not all clients will. SFTP is not the same as FTP over SSH, FTP over SSL, FTPS or Simple File Transfer Protocol . > Each client's interface will look a little different, but each will involve similar steps. Check out this interactive tutorial , or follow the instructions below which show Filezilla's interface:   
> Download and install an FTP client program that supports SFTP. Log into your Clever dashboard and locate your SFTP credentials in the SFTP Settings box on the Dashboard > Sync > Settings page (see below for more information). Open the FTP client program, enter your SFTP credentials ("host" is the SFTP Upload URL), and click 'Quickconnect'; Note: some FTP clients will require a modified URL configuration such as sftp.clever.com . Please reference their help documentation. > Once the link between your 'Local Site' and 'Remote Site' is established, you should see the files already stored in the host site appear on the right side of the window.

title: SFTP Syncs: Uploading data to Clever
heading_path: SFTP Syncs: Uploading data to Clever
section: SFTP Syncs: Uploading data to Clever
text:
Browse the 'Local Site' (your computer's hard drive, on the left side of the window) until you find all five of the CSV files you would like to upload. Drag them from the 'Local Site' to the 'Remote Site' into the folder with your district's username. In the image below, the username is wise-information-1089. (Please note: our system will only process files that adhere to our naming protocol– schools.csv, teachers.csv, students.csv, enrollments.csv, sections.csv). Please be consistent with capitalization to avoid duplicate files. > This may prompt a pop-up to appear, pictured below. If so, allow the program to overwrite preexisting data in the host site with the incoming data. (You should only have 5 files in your 'Remote Site' at one time). > Clever will begin processing any updated files or new uploads approximately five minutes after they have been uploaded to your FTP box. Please note that it may take 30 minutes for the sync to fully complete. >   Clever does not move or delete files after processing, so please be sure your SFTP folder settings are configured to always write over existing files with newly uploaded files! >  
> Locating your SFTP credentials
> You can find these credentials on the Data sources > SIS sync > Settings page. To ensure the safety of your information, we will never send or request your SFTP password over email or on the phone. Please follow the instructions below to retrieve your SFTP username and password:  
> Log into your Clever account at http://schools.clever.com . You'll need to use the email and password that you created when you signed up for your Clever account. From the left sidebar, click  Sync . Click on the Settings tab. You'll see the SFTP username and password. We suggest copy/pasting the password into your FTP client to prevent any typos. > Please note:  
> Districts cannot change their SFTP usernames or passwords.

title: Clever Roles: Clever Admin
text:
> Tip: Title Clever Roles: Clever Admin URL Name 202518038 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Clever Account Owner 3. Transferring Ownership to a new Account Owner 4. Adding Clever Admins 5. Logging in as a Clever Admin 6. Removing or Updating Clever Admins 7. Switching between user accounts if you have multiple accounts in Clever
> Overview
> Districts or schools can provide multiple team members with Clever Admin access to assist with account management. Users who are assigned the Clever Admin role, will have account-wide access with varying permissions. This article will explain how to manage team members from Clever Dashboard > User management > Admin team page. > Please note: Clever Admins can't impersonate other Clever Admins via the Access portal feature . For more information, visit:  Impersonating a User: Access Portal as  Feature. >  
> Clever Account Owner
> Each Clever Portal has a single account owner. The owner is indicated by the word (Owner) following their name on the Admin team  page . The account owner’s name and email address are shared with applications connected to the district’s or school's Clever account and, therefore, they are the primary point of contact for all Clever-related issues. > The owner has unique privileges that are unavailable to Clever Admins which include the ability to:
> Transfer account ownership to another Clever Admin  Delete the Clever account
> With the exception of the above privileges, all  Clever Admins have equal permissions to view or modify the district Portal. This includes adding or removing applications, updating sharing permissions, managing Badges, and much more! > Transferring ownership to a new Account Owner
> Each Clever account may have only one owner at a time, and only the current owner can transfer the role to another team member. If you do not see the option to Change Account Owner , then you are not the account owner.

title: Clever Roles: Clever Admin
text:
The current Account Owner can transfer ownership to another Clever Admin by clicking the Add team member  button and selecting Change Account Owner in the dropdown from the Clever Dashboard > User management > Admin team page. This option will only be available if there are other Clever Admins on the Clever account. Once ownership is transferred, the options to add/remove Clever Admins or transfer ownership will only be available to the new Account owner. If you need to transfer the ownership to an individual who isn't currently a Clever Admin, you'll need to first create an Admin account for them. If the Clever Account Owner listed on the account is no longer with the district, please contact​ Clever Support for help. Here are the details about what we will need to make the update on your behalf:
> We will need written approval from a member of the district’s leadership team (e.g. Superintendent, Director of Technology, Curriculum Director, etc.) who is verifiable on the district's website. Please feel free to CC this administrator on the Clever support ticket so they can respond directly to the communication thread. Once Clever has written confirmation, we can transfer ownership of the district's Clever account. > Adding Clever Admins
> Any users who are assigned the Clever Admin role are also able to add other Clever Admins to Clever by following these steps:
> Log in to the Clever Dashboard Select User management > Admin team   from the left navigation menu Select Actions in the top right of the page Select Add team member from the options available Add the new Clever Admin 's information in the pop-up box Select Add
>  
>     Please note: Accounts utilizing an SFTP or SIS-Managed SFTP sync can sync, remove, and update Clever Admins via CSV. Please see here for more information, including steps for removing admins synced via CSV .

title: Clever Roles: Clever Admin

If you utilize a SIS-Managed sync and want to automate the syncing of your administrators.csv, you’ll need to work with your SIS directly to add this file to your exports. >

> All Clever Admins should use the District admin log in  option from the Clever login page to access their Clever Admin account. > Alternatively, Clever Admins can navigate to Clever.com and choose the District admin  option using the blue arrow dropdown at the top right of the page. >  
> Please note:  Clever District Admin can also use a Single Sign-on (SSO) Identity Provider (IDP)   to sign in (such as Google or Active Directory) that's powered by user email address. You'll just need to add the IDP to your district first. If you prefer that all District Admin be required to use SSO to sign in to Clever instead of a username and password, please contact Clever Support by clicking the message icon in the bottom right corner. You must be a Clever Admin (owner) to be able to make this request. >
