title: Aeries Auto Sync
text:
> Note: Title Aeries Auto Sync URL Name 203005016 Article Body This article contains the following:  1. Overview  2. Setting Up your Aeries Auto Sync  3. Aeries Auto Sync Requirements ​  4. Customization ​  5. School Year Rollover ​  6. Troubleshooting  7. Default field mappings
> Overview
> This article contains information on the setup, maintenance, and troubleshooting of the Aeries API sync. The Aeries API sync:
>  
> ✓ Runs every four hours, by querying the Aeries API
> ✓ Pulls all active students, teachers, and schools (“InactiveStatusCode” = blank)
> ✓ Syncs co-teachers by pulling the TeacherNumber1, TeacherNumber2, and TeacherNumber3 fields from the Sections table
> ✓ Supports Flex Scheduling (For schools using Flex Scheduling in Aeries, only a Staff record will be required)
> Setting up your Aeries Auto Sync
> Introduction
> Clever allows the student data in Aeries to automatically sync with authorized applications. This eliminates the need for manual CSV transfers or complicated SFTP uploads. > To sync data, Clever needs access to the Aeries API. The best practice when using Clever is to create a new Aeries API certificate for the Clever sync. > Create an API Certificate for Clever
> 1. Log into your Aeries administrator account for the current school year. 2. Select Security > API Security  from the menu on the left. 3. Add a new certificate named Clever . 4. Grant read permissions to the following items in the Student Data and Scheduling tables:
> Student Data Special Programs Contacts, Class Schedules/History Enrollment History Test Scores Teacher Data Staff Data Master Schedule Course Data Classes Schools Terms. > 5. Save the certificate. 6. Click Display Certificate Details? then copy/paste your API certificate into the Data sources > SIS sync > Settings tab  of your Dashboard.

title: Aeries Auto Sync
text:
>  
> Aeries Auto Sync Requirements
> For the Aeries Auto Sync to work properly, your setup and user data must meet these requirements:
> Your SIS must be connected to the internet. Teachers at your district must have a Staff (STF) record in Aeries and be tied to a section to show up as a teacher in Clever. For teachers, InactiveStatusCode must be blank ( TCH.TG / STF.TG = blank). Any value in this field will prevent the record from syncing. > Customization
> Aeries syncs can be customized to sync nightly, instead of every four hours, but the time of day that the syncs occur isn't customizable. Syncs can always be initiated at any time from your Clever Dashboard on the Data sources > SIS sync > Settings tab > Sync Controls box > Sync Now button. Syncs can also be customized to pull additional fields available through the Schools, Students, Courses, Sections, Staff, or Teachers tables. Clever can filter exports from Aeries to limit the schools included in the sync. Some districts create schools without master schedules - or schedule students without placing them in sections (typically elementary schools). Because Clever requires sections to process data, our system can automatically create sections for these students based on their teacher. Please submit a request to Clever Support with a list of your schools (name and school number) and we will program our system to create sections in these schools. To request customizations or filtering for your Aeries sync, request assistance from  Clever Support . >    Please note: If you’d like to sync additional data to Clever, you can do so via our automated custom data sync for auto sync districts and schools. Please reach out to Clever Support for access to your Clever SFTP Directory. You'll need to set up any automatic exports to the remote site, as Clever doesn't provide support for automation scripting.

title: Aeries Auto Sync
text:
>  
> School Year Rollover
> Clever will begin syncing new school year data when summer school ends and the Sections (SEC) and MasterSchedule (MST) tables are active and available. To activate these tables, schedules must be copied over (Scheduling Process > Functions > Copy Scheduling Results to SEC & MST). > Additionally, Clever filters out inactive enrollments. We use the enrollment's “DateEnded” field from the Aeries API to determine if an enrollment is expired, or inactive. An enrollment is considered inactive if the current date is one day past the "DateEnded" date. Of note, a section with no active enrollments on the Aeries API will appear on the Data sources > SIS sync > Last Attempted Sync  page as an error, and won't successfully sync to your Clever instance. > Troubleshooting
> Common sync errors and resolution steps
> Below are some sync errors you may see in your Clever Dashboard. We recommend the following steps to resolve. >  
> - Error: Resolution
> - There are no active enrollments in Aeries. This may be because your active calendar year has ended, in which case your sync will resume when the Sections (SEC) and MasterSchedule (MST) tables are active and available for the new school year.: Please confirm that rollover has been completed and published for the new school year. Ensure the MST tables (for each school) and CAR records (for all affected students) are available. > Once confirmed, trigger a re-sync with Clever on your Data sources > SIS sync > Settings tab using the Sync Now button. > If you have confirmed enrollments are active for the new year and the issue persists, please contact Aeries support. > Must have InactiveStatusCode set to null ( STU.TG = blank). Any value in this field will prevent the record from syncing. > Missing Records
> If an entire record is missing, we recommend checking the following:  
> - Record Type: Troubleshooting
> - Student: Must have InactiveStatusCode set to null ( STU.TG = blank).

title: Aeries Auto Sync
text:
Any value in this field will prevent the record from syncing. > - Teacher: Teachers at your district must have a Staff (STF) record in Aeries and be tied to a section to show up as a teacher in Clever. > InactiveStatusCode must be blank (any value in this field will prevent record from syncing)
> Must have all required fields on the teachers/staff table
> Make sure the records don't have a "Leave Date"
> Please note, any non-teaching staff that are assigned to sections in Aeries will automatically be associated with the Default District Office entity in Clever. They will still be connected to all associated sections, regardless of their primary school designation in Clever. > - Staff: Clever doesn't automatically sync records from Aeries to the Staff role in Clever. > There may be users such as administrators, secretaries, and para-professionals who might not use Aeries directly but need access to applications through Clever. If those users are missing from your Clever data, there are two options to sync them to Clever. > Option A) Sync as teacher
> To sync the user as a teacher, assign them to a section. > Option B) Manually add to Clever using Custom Data
> If the user requires access to teacher features or will need to be connected to a section, add the user as a Custom Teacher . > If the user doesn't require teacher features and only will be using Clever for Single Sign-On (SSO), add the user as Custom Staff . > - Sections: In order for a section to sync the school must have a master schedule. If a school doesn't use master schedules, Clever can auto-generate sections based on teacher/student assignments. Contact Clever Support if you would like this feature enabled. A section with no active enrollments won't sync to Clever. We use the enrollment's “DateEnded” field from the Aeries API to determine if an enrollment is expired, or inactive. An enrollment is considered inactive if the current date is one day past the "DateEnded" date.

title: Aeries Auto Sync
text:
>  
> Incorrect Records
> If the record (student, teacher, section) is in Clever but data is missing or incorrect for the record (i.e. incorrect email, missing username), navigate to the Data sources > SIS sync > Settings tab  in your Clever Dashboard. Under Sync Controls , click on View defaults. > Here you can view which fields Clever is pulling for each record and field. In the below example: 
> If a student's email address is incorrect, confirm the email is correct in the "STU.SEM" field in Aeries. If a student is missing FRL\_status, you'll see that Clever doesn't pull this data by default. Please contact Clever Support to see what options may be available to pull this data. > Some additional common errors are: 
>  
> - Record Type: Students; Error: Incorrect Grade; Troubleshooting: If a student's grade isn't correct in Clever, please contact Clever Support and provide the grade designation in Aeries and desired value in Clever. Our team will update your configuration to translate the value accurately. > - Record Type: Students; Error: Missing demographic data; Troubleshooting: If your account is missing ELL\_status, FRL\_status, or IEP\_status, please contact Clever Support. Our team can enable the export of these fields. > - Record Type: Teachers; Error: Incorrect Email; Troubleshooting: The email must be correct in the following three locations: - the Teacher table - the Staff table - the Security Table/User Record (UGN Table)
> - Record Type: Sections; Error: Missing Sections; Troubleshooting: Schools must be on a MasterSchedule for sections to export to Clever. If a school doesn't use MasterSchedule, please contact Clever Support and provide the site's SchoolCode ( LOC.CD ) so Clever can generate sections for the school. >  
> Default field mappings
> Below are the default field mappings for Aeries syncs that are managed by Clever. Please note:
> If a field is blank, the field is either not pulled by default, or not accessible to Clever.

If you want to change a field mapping, please contact Clever Support to learn what options are available. If a field isn't coming through with the correct value, Clever Support may need to complete a value mapping. This is common for grade, FRL\_Status, ELL\_Status, and IEP\_Status.

heading_path: SFTP & Manual Upload: How do I format my CSV files?
section: SFTP & Manual Upload: How do I format my CSV files?
text:
> Important: Title SFTP & Manual Upload: How do I format my CSV files? URL Name 203114867 Article Body This article covers the following: 1. Overview 2. What's a CSV file? 3. Creating CSV files 4. Required fields 5. What will my files look like? 6. Uploading multiple student contacts 7. Multi-site users (users at multiple schools) 8. Quote Surrounded Fields 9. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
> Overview
> If your schools are brand-new to Clever, we recommend going through our onboarding courses in Clever Academy to access step-by-step support on getting set up with Clever. >  
> This article describes how to set up the data files you'll send to Clever if you choose to manually upload your school or district's data or if you choose to set up an SFTP sync. As a refresher, you have a few options for getting your school or district data into Clever (and therefore any other app you connect to Clever):
> Option 1: Manually uploading the data via the Data sources > SIS sync > Upload page. Option 2: Using an automated SFTP transfer ( see here for more information ). Option 3: Use a managed automatic sync ( see here for more information ). > If you choose options one or two, you must properly format and upload five comma-separated value (CSV) spreadsheet files to get your data into Clever. All CSV files should follow Clever’s file formatting requirements, regardless of which applications you use. For more technical information, please refer to our  SFTP Instructions , which provide highly detailed directions for setting up your CSV files. You must be logged in to view the SFTP Instructions. In addition, you can  check out this article for CSV formatting errors. > What’s a CSV file? > CSV files store a line of text for each data record, where the field values for that record are separated by commas.

title: SFTP & Manual Upload: How do I format my CSV files?
heading_path: SFTP & Manual Upload: How do I format my CSV files?
section: SFTP & Manual Upload: How do I format my CSV files?
text:
Here’s what comma-separated values look like:  
> This data can also be represented in a table format, which is what you see when opening the file in a spreadsheet application like Excel. Here’s the same data represented as a table:  
>  
> Creating CSV files
> The best way to generate the five files you’ll upload to Clever is to export data directly from your Student Information System (SIS) in CSV format. Typing data by hand or manipulating data once it’s exported can lead to unexpected file formatting errors, which can prevent your data from being processed in Clever. > Excel is commonly used to view CSV files, but it often imposes formatting that skews data and results in SFTP Upload Errors. For error-free viewing and saving CSV files, we recommend using an application built for CSV compatibility, such as CSVEdit, Sublime Text, Apache OpenOffice, TextEdit, or Notepad. For more information about troubleshooting file format issues, see this help article . > The file names for the CSV files should be the following (all lowercase letters): 
> schools.csv students.csv teachers.csv sections.csv enrollments.csv
> The templates for these CSV files can be found here . This graphic is helpful to explain how your files work together: It is important that the file names are consistent in case (upper/lower case) in each upload. Uploading "Schools.csv" vs. "schools.csv" will result in two different files being stored in the district's SFTP box and can result in sync errors. If you will be manually creating your CSV files, we highly encourage you to view this playlist of videos . >  
> Required fields
> Our SFTP Instructions include all possible fields you can upload and indicate whether each is required by Clever (bolded in the SFTP specifications and marked “YES” or “NO” under “Required”). The screenshot below shows some of the possible fields for schools.csv, where ‘School\_id’ and ‘School\_name’ are required, but ‘State\_id’ is not required.

However, Clever recommends including as many fields as possible to take full advantage of reporting features in current applications, and to ensure compatibility with future app connections. Depending on which applications you connect your Clever account to, additional fields may be required beyond Clever’s minimum required fields. Check your district’s personalized SFTP instructions on your Data sources > SIS sync > Settings page to learn which fields are required by your connected applications. >   Please note: NCES\_id and MDR\_number are not accepted fields. If you need to populate NCES ID or MDR values for your schools or district please contact Clever Support using the blue chat box in the bottom right corner of the Help Center. >

Please note, the screenshots below do not show all possible fields for each file. Please refer to Clever’s SFTP Instructions to confirm all accepted fields. You can also download example files from the Web Upload page. > Please see our note under “How should I create my 5 CSV files?” - if you view files in Excel, we recommend closing without saving to avoid formatting errors. >

> Uploading multiple student contacts
> If you would like to sync more than one guardian/emergency contact for each student, you can list the student record multiple times in the students.csv file. Each row must have the same student information (student\_id, name, email address, etc.) but the contact columns will have different information for each contact.

text:
Even though the student\_id is listed multiple times, the student records will not receive a "duplicate id error" in the Sync Report for this particular instance. Please note - if providing student contacts, 'Contact\_type' and 'Contact\_name' columns are required. > Below is what student contacts look like in the students.csv file:
> Multi-site users (users at multiple schools)
> Users can be associated with multiple schools in Clever. Here's how that is done! > Students
> Each student should only be associated with one school\_id in the student.csv, otherwise you will receive a "duplicate sis\_id" error. Students will be associated with multiple schools via their enrollments. If a student has enrollments in sections at multiple schools, they will be associated with the respective schools. > Teachers
> Each teacher should have only have one record in the teachers.csv file, otherwise you will receive a "duplicate sis\_id" error. Additional school associations will be processed from the sections.csv file. Clever will process all of the teacher's section assignments, giving them access to sections at multiple schools. Additionally, they will be associated with the respective schools. >  
> Quote Surrounded Fields
> If a value for a field contains a comma or quotes, it will skew the CSV and result in one or more records not processing. To resolve the issue, export the CSV with quotes surrounding the fields. > For example: 
> - Before: After
> - Ford, Tom: "Ford, Tom"
> - Thomas "Tom" Ford: "Thomas "Tom" Ford"
> - Math, 2nd Period: "Math, 2nd Period"
> - 123 Baker Street, Apt. 102: "123 Baker Street, Apt. 102"
> Many SISs will have the option to surround field values in quotes upon export. For example, in PowerSchool's Data Export Manager, it is located under  Export Options:
> For information on how to surround field values in quotes upon export, please contact your SIS directly.

title: SFTP & Manual Upload: How do I format my CSV files?
heading_path: SFTP & Manual Upload: How do I format my CSV files?
section: SFTP & Manual Upload: How do I format my CSV files?
text:
> Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets If manually constructing your file in Excel or Google Sheets, they do not have an automated way to export a field surrounded with double quotes. As such, the easiest way to add quote surrounds is on a field-by-field basis. For example, if you would like to surround Column B with double quotes, insert a blank column to the right (C), and enter the following formula in C2: =CONCATENATE("""",B2,"""") Copy cell B2 and paste it to the rest of the desired cells to apply the concatenate formula. You can then "Hide" Column B prior to export to ensure the desired data is exported only once, surrounded in double-quotes. > Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
>  
> For a complete list of all SFTP FAQs, please see this article. > What CSV files are required to sync with Clever? > The  Clever SFTP Specifications  outline the five required CSV files for a data sync to complete: 
> schools.csv teachers.csv students.csv sections.csv enrollments.csv. > The staff.csv is an optional additional file for adding non-teaching staff to Clever. >  
> Do I need to include a schools.csv file if we are a single school? > Yes! The schools.csv is required even if you’re a single school. This is how Clever’s sync system will know to associate your teacher and students with the school. > Do I need to include a sections.csv file? > Yes! The sections.csv file is how Clever syncs your classes and assigns students to their class(es). Even if you only have one section/class per grade, a sections.csv is required. The section\_id can be any unique value that is kept consistent across the section.csv and enrollments.csv. If you’re making your own files, our team recommends keeping it simple and using single numbers (section\_id = 1, section\_id = 2 for each section/class). > How do I know if my data upload went through? > A sync will occur any time data is successfully uploaded to Clever. They generally take 15-30 minutes to complete.

If you’ve uploaded new data to Clever, please give the sync at least 30 minutes to complete. Once 30 minutes have passed, please review your Clever Dashboard > Data sources > SIS sync page for the status of your sync. You should also receive an email to the email address in your Clever profile. Click here  to learn more about your sync status! >  
> Related articles
> SFTP Syncs: SFTP Sync FAQ SFTP Syncs: Uploading data to Clever SFTP Syncs: Troubleshooting CSV formatting errors

>  
> Getting started with adding applications? Check out our guide,  Onboarding - Adding Applications to Clever , available in Clever Academy! >  
> Overview
> Clever single sign-on (SSO) enables users to be securely authenticated into connected applications via their individual Clever Portals. This article explains how district admins can add or remove an online learning application to their district's Clever Portal in order to share the app with district users. To learn about the different types of Clever applications, please visit this article . >   For specific details about each of the Clever-integrated SSO, Rostering or Library applications, visit our application gallery here . >  
> Adding an application
> Navigate to your Clever Dashboard > Applications > Add Applications   page. > The application search bar and filters
> Using the filters at the top of the page, you can search for applications by:
> Type (e.g. Rostering, SSO, Free)
> Please note: Some learning applications do require certain fees to use their products through Clever (e.g. licensing or subscription fees). Sorting by 'Free' provides a list of learning applications that are completely free to districts. > Subject   (e.g. Assessment, Communication, Math, Reading) Name (e.g. i-Ready, SeeSaw, Big Ideas Math, Achieve3000)
>   If the app you are looking for is not available to request, please review this section . > Once you locate the desired application, select 'Request App' to the right of the selection.

text:
>          
> Once you click Request App, you'll be taken to a page where you can view more information about the application, including its Edtech quality indicators if available. You will then be prompted to authorize the request of the application. You will need to first:
> Select whether or not your district has already purchased the application, or would like to try a free trial of the app (if applicable). Select a preferred Launch Date for the application. Please note:
> The Custom Launch Date   you enter is a suggested or preferred date of launch that may later be updated by the application partner if it is not feasible. Please contact app partners directly to adjust app Launch Dates. The Launch Date is the date the app will become available to all shared district users   in their Clever portals. For rostering apps, view the fields required by the application under the Required fields section. You can determine if your sync can meet these requirements. >             Example of a rostering application  Example of an SSO application
> Once you've made the appropriate selections, select Send integration request  to submit the request to the application provider. The application has now been requested! Please see this article  to understand the application's status as it progresses to the Launch Date. >  
>  
> Application sharing permissions
> Once the application has approved your connection, you will then  specify which sharing type you would like to use in order to share data with the application. These settings will also determine which of your district users will have the application available to them in their individual Portals. Please   follow the steps outlined in this guide   to set up your sharing permissions for the first time.

title: For Clever Admins: Apps - Add/request or remove apps
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Apps - Add/request or remove apps
section: For Clever Admins: Apps - Add/request or remove apps
text:
> After the application has been connected, district admins can add or modify the app sharing permissions to determine what district data should be shared with the app, and which district users should have access to the application from their Clever Portals after the Launch Date . The options available are:  
> Share by District : All district data in Clever will be synced to the application. This includes district admins, schools, teachers, students, staff and sections. Share by Schools : Clever will only share any data associated with the schools you've selected (e.g. students, teachers, sections, staff). Share by Rules : Clever will only share data that meets the specific criteria you've set. This is the most recommended sharing type as it provides districts with the flexibility in determining specifically what data should be included, or excluded, in the sharing. Read this article  to learn more about how to Share by Rules! School Site Sharing : If your district has designated  School Tech Leads  in Clever, you can provide them with the ability to configure application sharing permissions for their associated schools. More info here! Copy Sharing : This option will copy the same sharing permissions from another application that has already been set up. > Applications will not have access to any district data in Clever that has not been specifically shared with them via the application sharing permissions. Please visit this article   for detailed instructions. >  
>   What if my desired application isn’t listed? > If your desired application is not available to request per the process outlined above:
> SSO or Rostering integrated apps:
> This means the app provider has a specific policy that requires them to send districts an invite rather than districts requesting their app (e.g. BrainPOP). Please contact the app partner directly to request their app. > Clever Library apps: 
> Most Library apps can only be added individually by teachers to their Clever Portals.

title: For Clever Admins: Apps - Add/request or remove apps

section: For Clever Admins: Apps - Add/request or remove apps
text:
In most cases, these types of apps are  not  available as district-wide applications. For details, please visit this article . > Non-Clever integrated apps: 
> Clever can build a secure connection for almost any application through our SSO (Saved Passwords) product. SSO (Saved Passwords) applications are apps that don't currently integrate directly with Clever, but can still be accessed through the Clever Portal providing users with a seamless single sign-on experience for the app. To add an SSO (Saved Passwords) application, select the 'Request [ApplicationName]' below the search results. >              
> Then, enter some important details to help us configure this SSO (Saved Passwords) application before selecting the 'Request' option. You will receive an email once the app is ready for your district. For more, please visit:  SSO (Saved Passwords) Apps: Overview & Setup . > We also encourage you to contact non-Clever integrated application providers directly to let them know you’re interested in syncing your data through Clever. Your voice is extremely important as they consider working with us! If you do have a contact at the vendor, feel free to email us at application-interest@clever.com , and we can follow up about building an integration. For any app that doesn't require a per-user login, you can also consider adding a link to your Clever Portal for district users. Learn more about adding links here ! >   What's my application's status? > You can view the status of all district applications from your Clever Dashboard > Applications > My Applications page   or by clicking on the application name to open the app overview page. In the Dashboard you can see the App Status column which lists the status for each of your applications. Next to that is the Next step column which lists the next step that needs to be taken.

title: For Clever Admins: Apps - Add/request or remove apps

text:
Here's a list including every application status:
> Requested : We're waiting for the application's team to accept your request and proceed with the implementation. If you need to expedite the request process, please reach out to the application provider directly as Clever does not have insight into their review and acceptance process. Invited by app : The app has invited you to connect! They're waiting on you to accept the invitation in your Clever Dashboard. Waiting On Approval: We are still waiting for the application's team to accept your request and proceed with the implementation. District admins can select the 'Remind App' option to the right of the application name to remind the application partner of the request. >         
> No Data Shared : The next step is yours! Complete the setup guide to enable data sharing with the application. No Users Selected : The next step is yours! Select which users you want to share with the application. No Credentials Set:  The next step is yours! For SSO (Saved Passwords) apps, you will need to set up your district users' login credential requirements for the application. Please see  this article  for details. Setting Up : Hang tight! The application partner is preparing your district for launch. Users will not be able to access the application until the Launch Date. If you need to expedite the setup process, please reach out to the application partner directly. Launched : Your integration is live! If the application supports SSO, the application is available to users in the Clever Portal. > If you need to contact the application partner for more information on the application’s status, navigate to the app overview page. If the application has provided a Support Contact, you'll find it at the top of this page. >  
>   Removing an application
> If you would like to remove an application from your district's Clever Portal:
> Navigate to your Clever Dashboard > Applications > My Applications   page.

text: Click on the application name to open the app overview page. Select the arrow icon on the upper right-hand corner of the page. Choose Disconnect App . A dialogue box will open, asking you to select OK  to confirm the deletion. > The application icon will no longer be available in Clever for your district, and your data will be unavailable to the application immediately. If it was a Clever-integrated app, an email notification will be sent to Clever’s main contact from the application's team, informing them that you are no longer sharing your data with them. > Please note: • The Clever team cannot restore deleted applications. You'll need to re-add the application and set up your sharing rules again. • If you decide to re-add this application to your  Clever Dashboard , your user accounts will likely not be restored automatically. title: Sharing Permissions: Overview
text:
> Important: Title Sharing Permissions: Overview URL Name 203115007 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. What data is shared with apps? 3. Guided vs Standard Sharing view 4. Sharing data with an app 5. Viewing the data being shared with an app 6. Editing app sharing permissions 7. FAQs
> Overview 
> With the Sharing Permissions feature in Clever, you can share the exact users who need access to an application in Clever. Whether your whole district/school uses the application or just a handful of users (e.g., four 3rd-grade math sections), you can share the application with just the users who need access to the resource from their Clever Portal. Sharing permissions allow you to fully control what the application receives from Clever to roster and maintain your users' accounts. > We know that not all applications are utilized by the same subset of users, so you can set up sharing permissions on an app-by-app basis. Sharing permissions are often set up for each unique application based on its type, licensing contingencies, and who needs access to the application. >  
> Please note: Clever Admins are shared by default with all connected learning applications. Admins must explicitly share staff, teachers, and students with each application to enable data sharing for each account type. > What data is shared with apps? > Clever provides each application with only the data necessary for its operation. Clever admins can view and modify what data is being shared by navigating to their Clever Dashboard > Applications > My Applications page and then clicking on the application's name to open the app overview page. Here, you can click the download icons next to each data type to see the exact data the application receives. > Guided vs Standard Sharing view
> The first step when setting up your sharing permissions is determining which setup view you’d like to use. Clever offers two options for sharing your data: Guided Sharing and Standard Sharing.

title: Sharing Permissions: Overview
text:
Choose which view is easier for you to operate! > Guided Sharing is best for new users or those who don't set sharing settings often. It guides you through the process with prompts and examples. For a preview of what Guided sharing can look like, see this video . > Standard sharing is best for experienced Clever users or those who need to use School Site Sharing. For a preview of what Standard sharing can look like, see this video . > Users can switch between these two experiences at any time by selecting  Edit Sharing for an application and selecting Switch Sharing setup view in the top right. Your choice in sharing experience will be remembered and used anytime you edit sharing permissions for an app. > Please note: Whether you use Guided Sharing or Standard Sharing, you’ll always be able to fully review what data is included in your sharing settings before finalizing and saving your rules. This means that you can make adjustments to your rules freely to test including the data you need before hitting save! > Sharing data with an app
> When sharing data with your applications, it’s essential to understand the sharing permission options to ensure you are only sharing the users who need access. Review the six different options below:
> App’s recommended sharing : Applications can recommend sharing settings to communicate sharing best practices directly to your district in the Clever Dashboard . If the application has recommended sharing permissions, they will display when you set up sharing. Use these recommendations as a starting place for determining your district's sharing permissions. Share by District : All district data in Clever will sync to the application. This includes district admins, schools, teachers, students, staff, and sections. Share by Schools : Clever will only share any data associated with the school(s) you've selected (e.g., students, teachers, sections, staff).

title: Sharing Permissions: Overview
text:
Share by Rules : Clever will only share data that meets the specific criteria you've set. Share by Rules is the most recommended sharing type as it allows districts to determine precisely what data should be included or excluded in the sharing. Read this article to learn more about how to Share by Rules! School Site Sharing :  If your district has designated  School Tech Leads in Clever, you can provide them with the ability to configure sharing permissions for their associated schools. More info here! Copy Sharing:  Copy the sharing permissions from another application that has already been set up. > Check out this article to see step-by-step directions on setting up sharing permissions for apps that you have added. We understand that sharing permissions can be tricky to think through, so make sure to also check out our  sharing permission tips and tricks ! And remember, you’ll always be able to preview the data your rules will share before hitting save! > Once you share data with the application, the application will dynamically update based on the sharing permissions configured. Please allow up to 24 hours for any sharing changes to be reflected in the learning application. If you need changes reflected sooner, please contact the application directly. > When setting up sharing rules for any application not assigned to a category in your Portal (for example, a new application you’ve just added or an app in the default More Apps category), you’ll also receive a prompt at the end of your sharing setup asking if you’d like to add the application to a category. If you’d like to add the application to one of your existing categories, choose the category from the dropdown. >    
> Viewing the data being shared with an app
> Once you've configured your sharing permissions for an application, you can download CSV files containing the schools, students, teachers, staff, and sections being shared with the application through Clever.

title: Sharing Permissions: Overview
text:
By default, district admins are always shared with applications! > Navigate to your  Applications > My Applications page , and then click on the application's name to open their overview page. In the Application Receives box, you’ll be able to click the blue icon to download a file of data the application is receiving. > The Application Receives files only provide a few basic details about the  records shared with the application. They may have access to additional fields for each record based on your field access settings. For example, the  students.csv does not include student email addresses, but the application partner might be receiving them. For details on which data is each application is syncing for each record, visit:  What data is available to my connected applications? >  
> Editing app sharing permissions
> To edit sharing permissions, from your Applications > My Applications page , click on the application's name to open the overview page. Then, select Edit sharing  under the Shared Data  section. > If you have any questions about setting up your sharing permissions or what data is being shared with your district applications, please reach out to Clever support. We are happy to help! >  
>  
> FAQs
> Why is Clever unable to display the count of shared records? >          
> Clever may be unable to provide a preview of the count of shared records for districts with large data sets or highly complex rules. When this occurs, " Unable to display count of shared records " or " Sorry, your rules are too complex to display shared records"  may display. To view the count of shared records, please use the  Application Receives  section on the app overview page. > How do I add NCES IDs and/or MDR Numbers for schools in Clever? > Reach out to our support team and provide a list of the numbers/IDs that need to be added and their corresponding schools. > How do I check to see which school is being shared as the users’ primary location?

title: Sharing Permissions: Overview
text:
> For one-off users, you can search for the user in the search bar of your Clever Dashboard to locate their profile and look at their primary school site. > For multiple users, you can click on the application in your Clever Dashboard and click the download button under Application Receives for the user type in question. > Why does the data my application is receiving include a school that is not explicitly shared in my sharing rule? > This is common in Share by Schools rules since they share all data associated with teachers, sections, and students. If a teacher or student is associated with multiple schools, this additional school will be implicitly shared as data associated with the student or teacher. This can also happen in Share by Rules if a student or teacher's primary school site is a school not explicitly shared, it will still be implicitly shared as their primary site. > How do I share co-teachers with applications? > First, be sure to ask the application if they support co-teachers, as some applications don’t. If they confirm that they do support syncing co-teachers, check in Clever to ensure that they are added to the correct sections. To learn more about adding co-teachers in Clever, check out this article . Once you have confirmed they are co-teachers to sections in Clever and the application supports co-teachers, they will be shared as long as they meet the sharing permission criteria set up for the application. You can use the Troubleshoot Sharing tool to confirm if a co-teacher or any user is shared with an application. > Why isn’t the user shared with the app? > Sharing permissions can be tricky! Check out our tips & troubleshooting article to help guide you to make sure the user is shared. You can also use the Troubleshoot Sharing tool to confirm if a user is shared with an application and analyze which sharing rules they don’t meet criteria for. > The data is correct in Clever, but is not correct in the app. What do I do?

> This could be happening for various reasons, so it’s important to make sure everything checks out. Check out our app troubleshooting article to guide you in troubleshooting the issue. > Related Articles:
> Sharing Permissions: Share by Rules Sharing Permissions: Guided Sharing

title: Single Sign-On (SSO): What is SSO?
text:
> Tip: Title Single Sign-On (SSO): What is SSO? URL Name 203166807 Article Body This article contains the following:  1. Overview 2. How does SSO authentication work? 3. Single sign-on (SSO) Requirements 4. Additional SSO options
> Overview
> Clever single sign-on (SSO) enables users to securely authenticate into connected applications via Clever Portal. Users log into Clever just once with one set of credentials, or using a Clever  Badge , and then click on the various app icons to be logged in automatically via SSO. Clever application partners rely on Clever's verification system of determining that a user is, indeed, who they say they are. Without Clever SSO, each application would need to maintain its own database of users and their credentials. > How does SSO authentication work? > A user logs in to Clever via the district's Identity Provider (IDP) (e.g. Active Directory, Google, etc.) from the Clever login page. Clever authenticates the user through the district's IDP. If the user is verified, Clever creates a "token" (i.e. a piece of data) that identifies the user and then logs them in successfully. The user then clicks on the appropriate application icon to open an application, and Clever provides the user's token to the application which authenticates the user. This means the user does not need to enter login credentials a second time. The user is logged into the application successfully! > Clever Tip: The Clever Portal also supports universal single sign-on for non-integrated Clever applications via SSO (Saved Passwords) authentication. Read more about this here ! > Who can use single sign-on (SSO)? > The following users can access applications through Clever single sign-on (SSO):
> Students Teachers Staff District admins
> Please note that each individual learning application determines which of the user types listed above they support. Some apps only support two or three user types.

title: Single Sign-On (SSO): What is SSO?
text:
> To find out which user types are supported by an application, navigate to your Clever Dashboard > Applications > My Applications page, and click on the application name to open the app overview page. If a user type is not listed under SSO Supported User Types , users of that type won't be able to access the application through Clever. > Single sign-on (SSO) Requirements
> There are certain requirements that should be met in order to ensure a seamless Clever single sign-on (SSO) experience for users:
> 1. Users must have a record in Clever (via Secure Sync)
> In order for users to be able to log in, they must have an existing record in Clever. For more information on syncing rostering data to Clever, please see  What is Secure Sync? > Please note:  For best results, make sure that there is only one record for each user in Clever. If there are multiple records in Clever for the same user, users may not be able to log in. The only caveats to this are teachers who are also considered staff and have both a teacher and staff account in Clever , or district admins who are also teachers or staff. > 2. District Portal URL
> Each district has the ability to customize a unique Clever login page URL to share with district users. This URL is a direct way for users to log in rather than navigating to Clever.com and selecting their school. Custom URLs are in the format of  https://clever.com/in/<YOUR  CUSTOM SHORTNAME>  (e.g. https://clever.com/in/northernschooldistrict)   Your district's Portal URL can be customized from the Clever Dashboard > Portal > Portal settings page in Clever. Visit this article  for additional instructions. > 3. Configure your Clever SSO login method (Identity Provider)
> For help determining which Identity Provider (IdP) your district should use and how to set it up, please see these articles: 
> Single Sign-On (SSO): Identity Provider (IdP) Options Single Sign-On (SSO): Setup & Configuration
> 4.

title: Single Sign-On (SSO): What is SSO?
text:
Tech Support Contact
> To abide by Clever's stringent security and data policies , Clever support will never provide user login credentials through any of our communications channels if a district user reaches out to us direct. For this reason, each district should have a Tech Support contact for users to contact in case of Clever login issues. This information can be updated  from your Clever Dashboard > Authentication > SSO settings page. >

> Single sign-on (SSO) is designed to work with your existing district portal or website. Some districts have firewalls or web filters in place that only allow outbound connections to certain domains.  If your network uses systems like these, you will need to grant access to Clever's domains so that your district will be able to successfully use Clever.

---

The list of domains your district should grant access for Clever users are:

1. \*.[clever.com](http://clever.com)
2. \*.[s3.amazonaws.com](http://s3.amazonaws.com)
3. [accounts.google.com](http://accounts.google.com) (if your district uses Clever Badges for Chromebooks)
4. \*.[twilio.com](http://twilio.com)

The exact syntax to use will depend on your network.

If you have any questions, please reach out to [Clever support](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360001041326)! We are happy to help!

title: SFTP Syncs: Sync status errors
text:
Title

SFTP Syncs: Sync status errors

URL Name

203257407

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
 1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/203257407?language=en_US#overview) 
​ 2. [Received export with no headers](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/203257407?language=en_US#noheaders) 
​ 3. [Received export with zero data](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/203257407?language=en_US#zerodata) 
​ 4. [Unknown Column Names](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/203257407?language=en_US#Unknown Column Names) 
 5. [Bad headers](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/203257407?language=en_US#badheaders) ​ 
 6. [Missing Required SFTP File](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/203257407?language=en_US#required)

This article provides insight into the various sync status errors you might see on your [Clever Dashboard > Data sources > SIS sync](https://schools.clever.com/sync) page. Sync errors will typically prevent future syncs from processing successfully until the error is addressed.

---

title: SFTP Syncs: Sync status errors
text:
All five CSV files require column headers as listed in Clever’s SFTP Instructions. Uploading a CSV file without column headers will result in an error message like this:

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TVmn&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028D3E)

You can take the following steps to fix this error:

1. When you export data directly from your Student Information System (SIS) or through an SQL query, double-check that the export includes a header row.
2. Headers must match Clever’s header names exactly in the SFTP Instructions.
3. If you’re having trouble exporting data from your SIS, please contact your SIS directly; Clever is unable to troubleshoot exporting data from your SIS and SQL for SFTP Syncs.

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TVmn&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028D3J) If you need help formatting your CSV files, see the following Help Center article: [How do I format my CSV files?](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/203114867?language=en_US)

Once your files include header rows according to Clever’s specified file format, upload all five files again. Your sync status should change once your data is processed.

---

title: SFTP Syncs: Sync status errors
text:
Clever requires all five CSV files to process your data upload. If one of your files is empty, you’ll see an error like this:

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TVmn&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028D3O)

You can take the following steps to fix this error:

1. When exporting data directly from your SIS or through an SQL query, double-check that all active schools, students, sections, teachers, and enrollments are exporting.
2. If you’re having trouble exporting data from your SIS, please contact your SIS directly; Clever is unable to troubleshoot exporting data from your SIS and SQL for SFTP Syncs.
3. If your semester or school year has recently changed, check that the correct term is selected to export.
4. For more helpful tips on semester and school year rollover, [click here](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202118886)
5. Once all five files include active data, upload all files to Clever again. Your sync status should change once your data processing completes.

---

Clever only recognizes column headers that exactly match those listed in our [SFTP Instructions](https://schools.clever.com/files/clever-sftp.pdf). If your file contains a header that Clever doesn’t recognize, you’ll see a similar error in your Dashboard:

![Image of sync error](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TVmn&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl0000044fBx)

To resolve this error:

- Click on the link in the error message if you'd like to map the fields you synced to fields in Clever.
- Check that all column header names in the identified file match those listed in the [SFTP Instructions](https://schools.clever.com/files/clever-sftp.pdf).

---

Clever sometimes encounters unreadable headers and you’ll receive an error. This error usually occurs when the number of fields in the CSV header row is different from the number of fields in data rows.

Common causes of this issue are:

- Trailing commas
- Extra commas in field values

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TVmn&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028D3x) For more information on troubleshooting CSV formatting errors see this article: [How do I troubleshoot CSV formatting errors?](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/203114867?language=en_US)

---

title: SFTP Syncs: Sync status errors
text:
Clever requires all 5 CSV files in each SFTP upload (schools.csv, students.csv, teachers.csv, sections.csv, and enrollments.csv). If you are missing one of these 5 files, you will receive this error in your Dashboard:

![](/hc/en-us/article_attachments/115001687407/Screen_Shot_2017-01-09_at_9.18.12_AM.png)![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TVmn&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028D47)

To resolve this error:

- Upload all 5 files to Clever in your next upload
- Because every sync overwrites the data currently in your Clever account, each file needs to contain the previous data that should remain in Clever, as well as any desired changes.

If you have any questions about sync errors, please reach out to [Clever support](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360001041326)! We are happy to help!

title: For Clever Admins: Assigning "subject" to sections
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Assigning "subject" to sections
section: For Clever Admins: Assigning "subject" to sections
text:
Title

For Clever Admins: Assigning "subject" to sections

URL Name

203448663

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/203448663?language=en_US#header1) 
2. [How does Clever determine ‘subject’?](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/203448663?language=en_US#determine) 
3. [What if my sync doesn’t include a ‘subject’ field?](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/203448663?language=en_US#include) 
4. [How can I ensure Clever chooses the correct subject?](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/203448663?language=en_US#ensure) 
5. [Miscategorized Subjects](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/203448663?language=en_US#Miscategorized)

Syncing subjects accurately is essential to getting the most out of Clever. Many learning applications require sections to have subjects, and assigning subjects correctly will also make it easier to share data by sections. This article outlines how Clever determines ‘subject’ for each section and how to sync ‘subject’ with Clever to ensure accuracy.

---

title: For Clever Admins: Assigning "subject" to sections
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Assigning "subject" to sections
text:
If your data sync includes a ‘subject’ field, Clever categorizes sections into subject categories based on the values you provide. For example, ‘subject’ field values “English”, “Reading”, and “Writing” are all sorted into “english/language arts”. Everything that can’t be sorted (including blanks) will be assigned to the subject “other”.

All sections will be assigned one of the following subject values:

- arts and music
- english/language arts
- homeroom/advisory
- interventions/online learning
- language
- math
- PE and health
- science
- social studies
- technology and engineering
- other

If Clever can't determine the subject based on the values given in the 'subject' field, then our system looks to values in the section 'name' field, and lastly, to values in the course\_name field.

---

If you aren’t syncing a ‘subject’ field, Clever categorizes sections into the subject categories above based on what terms are included in the ‘section\_name’ field. For example, sections with section\_name values of “Algebra II Honors 3A”, “5th Grade Mathematics”, and “P4 - Calc - Johnson” are all assigned the subject “math”.

If Clever can’t determine the subject based on section 'name’, Clever will look at the ‘course\_name’ field for terms that indicate subject.

Any section whose subject cannot be determined will be assigned the subject “other”.

---

title: For Clever Admins: Assigning "subject" to sections
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Assigning "subject" to sections
How can I ensure Clever chooses the correct subject?
section: How can I ensure Clever chooses the correct subject?
text:
There are two ways to make sure Clever chooses the right subject for each section:

**1. Add ‘subject’ field to your sync**

Syncing a ‘subject’ field to Clever with values that exactly match the subject categories listed above is the best way to make sure subjects are accurate in Clever. As long as you provide one of Clever’s accepted subject values, Clever will use the exact value you provide.

If you’re syncing data with Clever via Auto Sync, you’ll want to determine which field is used to sync subjects to Clever, then populate that field with the above subject values.

- If you’re using a [Clever-Managed Auto Sync](https://support.clever.com/hc/en-us/articles/202289278#Clever-Managed%20Automatic%20Sync), contact [Clever](https://support.clever.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) Support to determine which SIS field is used for subject. You can also tell us if you’d prefer to pull a different subject field from your SIS.
- For [SIS-Managed Auto Syncs](https://support.clever.com/hc/en-us/articles/202289278#SIS-Managed%20Automatic%20Sync), please reach out directly to your SIS to determine which fields can be used to send subject values to Clever.

For [SFTP Syncs](https://support.clever.com/hc/en-us/articles/202289278#SFTP%20Sync), add a column with header “Subject” and include a value for each section that exactly matches one of the subject categories listed above.

**2. Change the value of section ‘name’ or ‘course\_name’**

If you’re not able to sync a ‘subject’ field to Clever, we will make our best guess based on the terms included in the section ‘name’ and ‘course\_name’ fields. To improve accuracy, try some of these tips:

- Include one of Clever’s subject values in your section or course names.
- Use full terms whenever possible. For example, “comp” is interpreted as “composition” (subject: “english/language arts”), not “computers” (subject: “technology and engineering”).
- Creative names can sometimes be miscategorized, so opt for simple and commonly used terms. For example, “astronomy” gets matched to “science”, whereas “rocket ships” would be matched to “other”.

---

Clever makes the best-educated guess to sort each section into the above subjects. If you see a large number of sections assigned the wrong subject value, please [request help from our Support Team](https://support.clever.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).

title: Does Clever require third-party "write access" to my SIS?
