section: Does Clever require third-party "write access" to my SIS?
text:
Title

Does Clever require third-party "write access" to my SIS?

URL Name

203512033

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/203512033?language=en_US#h_4b1e7df4-3e3f-4333-8d03-c8bfee9097ec) 
2. [Auto Syncs](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/203512033?language=en_US#h_70047873-47e9-45b2-ada3-4b20b52e9b61) 
3. [SFTP Syncs](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/203512033?language=en_US#h_1453c70d-030c-49a4-9082-24fe51fe87e0)

[Security and privacy](https://clever.com/security) are top priorities at Clever. All roster data synced with Clever is protected by industry leading infrastructure and strict adherence to FERPA. Please read Clever's [security whitepaper](https://clever.com/about/security/practices) for more information on our privacy and security policies.

Clever does not require write access to your SIS. See below for specifics SIS access for your sync type, and [click here](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202289278?language=en_US) to learn more about Clever’s sync options.

Clever supports the guidance to not grant write access to third parties – which is why Clever is a **read-only service**. As a result, the permissions you should grant Clever for your student information system (SIS) are **read-only**.

If you are syncing via [SFTP (Secure File Transfer Protocol)](https://support.clever.com/hc/en-us/sections/200431637), Clever does not have any access to your student information system (SIS). SFTP Syncs require you to compile all roster data you upload to Clever, and you control which fields are included in your data uploads. Clever provides credentials for Secure File Transfer Protocol as well as a web-based upload option, and districts generate files to upload to their accounts. You will not be asked to provide Clever with your SIS’s URL or credentials, and Clever has no way of directly exporting data from your SIS.

If you have any questions about how to properly set up Clever, please [request assistance](https://support.clever.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) from Clever Support.

title: Term Rollover: Overview, Preparation & Recommendations
text:
> Important: Title Term Rollover: Overview, Preparation & Recommendations URL Name 204059586 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. SFTP sync rollover procedure 3. Auto Sync rollover procedure 4. Recommended district actions 5. Changing SIS IDs (student\_id, teacher\_id, etc.) 5. Badge Invalidation
>  
> Overview
> This article covers how Clever handles class roster data as the term/semester changes during a school year. These processes may vary depending upon your sync type and student information system (SIS). Recommended district actions in the Clever Dashboard for rollover periods are listed below. > For information about rolling over to the next school year, please see:  How does Clever handle school year rollover? > SFTP sync rollover procedure
> Clever will import the second term rosters as soon as you include them in the CSV files you regularly upload. As the data in your SIS changes, you can expect to see the following behavior with your sync:
> When your CSV files no longer include first term classes or enrollments, Clever will place your sync on hold because the number of student-class enrollments will change significantly. To review the hold, navigate to your Clever Clever Dashboard > SIS sync > Last Attempted Sync page. If the data looks correct, click Approve . Once the hold is cleared, your new term rosters will begin populating in Clever as they become active in your SIS. If the the data looks incorrect, please contact  Clever Support  for assistance. > For more information on clearing holds, please see:  How do I release a hold? > Auto Sync rollover procedure
> Clever pulls the students, teachers, and rosters that are active in your SIS.

title: Term Rollover: Overview, Preparation & Recommendations
text:
As the data in your SIS changes, you can expect to see the following behavior with your sync:
> When first-term classes are no longer active in your SIS, or as enrollments change, your Clever sync may go on hold: "pending significant changes in the data." To review the hold, navigate to your  Clever Dashboard > SIS sync > Last Attempted Sync page. If the data looks correct, click Approve . Once the hold is cleared, your new term rosters will begin populating in Clever as they become active in your SIS. If the data looks incorrect, please contact  Clever Support  for assistance. > For more information on clearing holds, please see:  How do I release a hold? > Recommended district actions:
> 1. Review your district's sync information
> For SFTP syncs: Check your inbox for emails from Clever. > If you receive any error message in your email such as, "Error Processing Clever SFTP Upload" please review the sync status on your Clever Dashboard > SIS sync > Last Attempted Sync page. See this article to resolve any sync status errors you may have: "How do I resolve SFTP sync status errors?" If your sync is still "On Hold", navigate to your Last Attempted Sync page to approve the changes. > For Auto Syncs: Review your Clever  Last Attempted Sync page as soon as your term data rolls over in your SIS. > If your sync is still "On Hold", navigate to your Last Attempted Sync page to approve the changes. > 2. Review your sharing permissions
> If you are currently utilizing sharing by rules for any applications, we recommend reviewing  any sections where rules that filter on Term Name . If a rule contains a filter for Term Name, you may need to adjust your sharing permissions to ensure the desired sections for the new term are available to the application. In the example below, the account will want to update the  Term Name  filter when transitioning from the Fall → Spring term.

title: Term Rollover: Overview, Preparation & Recommendations
text:
> You can review and edit your sharing permissions by selecting the link near your listed application under the "Sharing" section. In the screenshot below, the links to review are those with "Sharing by rules" :
>  
>   Please note: If you want to pause syncing your data to a particular application, please see this article: For Clever Admins: Pausing your sync for a specific app. This is a perfect tool for semester rollover and summer school, but shouldn't be confused with an SIS sync pause. > 3. Review section\_ids
> For term rollover, it is important to make sure that the ID #s for sections (the section\_id field in Clever) are different after a term or school year rollover. This is because Clever's system 'remembers' sections that have been deleted, based on their section\_id. If you have any questions about where to find your section\_id based on your sync type, please do not hesitate to contact Clever Support! >   4. Changing SIS IDs (student\_id, teacher\_id, etc.)
> During term rollovers, there are many districts that approach Clever about changing the primary identifiers (commonly called SIS IDs) for one or more record types. The following values are SIS IDs in Clever: 
> Student\_id Teacher\_id Staff\_id School\_id Section\_id
> Clever highly advises against changing these values in the middle of a school year. Doing so presents a significant risk of loss of historical data for users mid-year. If your district has a critical need to adjust SIS IDs mid-year, please reach out to Clever support for consultation. Commonly the need to change the SIS ID for users is due to a district needing to meet the data requirements for a specific connection. Clever Support may be able to help you meet this data requirement without disrupting your existing data in Clever. If you require changing SIS IDs mid-year and cannot wait until the summer academic rollover, please see this article: Changing SIS IDs .

title: Term Rollover: Overview, Preparation & Recommendations
text:
Please note, it may take up to 2 weeks to complete the migration process. If you intend on changing SIS IDs, please plan accordingly to ensure minimal disruption to students and teachers. >  
> Badge invalidation
> If your district uses Clever Badges, please review your Badge policy and ensure you void and regenerate all Badges before they expire. This will keep your district’s Badge policy secure and up to date. > As of January 1, 2025 , all Clever Badges will include an expiration date. Any Badges existing  before June 30, 2026,  will be active until  July 1, 2026 , giving you the flexibility to choose when you want to void and reprint Badges annually. If you generate Badges after June 30, 2026, please check your Badges for their 365-day expiration date. > We suggest voiding and reprinting Badges during your district’s natural transition period, such as summer or winter rollover (e.g., void and reprint Badges in July 2026 and annually in July after that). > If you would like to learn how to void all Clever Badges and generate new Clever Badges, please see this article: Clever Badge Invalidation.

title: Single Sign-On (SSO): Setup & Configuration
text:
> Tip: Title Single Sign-On (SSO): Setup & Configuration URL Name 204982938 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Portal Configuration 3. Identity Providers (IDPs) 4. Customizations and Login Hints 5. Updating your Tech Support Contact 6. Rolling out Single sign-on (SSO) to your district
>  
> Getting started with SSO? Check out our guide,  Onboarding - Setting up your schools' Clever login method , available in Clever Academy! > Overview
> ​Clever Single Sign-On (SSO) enables users to be securely authenticated into connected applications via their Clever Portals. Users log in to Clever just once with one set of credentials, or using a Clever  Badge , and then click on the various app icons to be logged in automatically via SSO. Clever's application partners rely on Clever's verification system of determining that a user is indeed who they say they are. Without Clever SSO, each application would need to maintain its own database of users and their credentials. > Clever Admins can set up Clever SSO from their Clever Dashboard > Authentication > SSO settings page. This article details the four main steps required to enable Clever SSO. > Portal Configuration
> The first step is to set a custom Portal URL for your district, which your students and teachers will use to access Clever and their connected applications. To set a custom Portal URL for your district, navigate to your Clever Dashboard > Portal > Portal settings page. The Portal URL will be www.clever.com/in/<shortname> ; . Remember to use something that your students and teachers will remember easily. To change your district's Portal URL, click the URL text box to edit the short name. Make sure to click Save . For more resources on managing the Portal, click here. >  
> Identity Providers (IdPs)
> Clever SSO allows students and teachers to access education apps with the username and password they already use in your district.

title: Single Sign-On (SSO): Setup & Configuration
text:
To add a login method for Clever, navigate to your Clever Dashboard > Authentication > SSO settings . In the top right corner, click Add Login Method and select the login method you wish to add for Clever. > Please visit the articles listed below for specific details about configuring Clever SSO for your district's Identity Provider (e.g. Google, Active Directory, Canvas, LDAP, etc.)  
> Clever Passwords Google Active Directory (LDAPS) Active Directory (SAML) Entra ID / Office 365 Canvas NCEdCloud Lenovo Stoneware / webNetwork
>   ​
>  
>  
> Customizations and Login Hints
> Here are some key customizations to help ensure your district users experience a seamless login experience with Clever:  
> Login Hints  
> Clever admins can customize login hints that will appear on the district's Clever login page to help users with their login credentials. Some examples include:
> Student Password = 10-digit student ID number Teacher Username = Teacher number Staff Username = Staff ID
> To add login hints, navigate to the Clever Dashboard > Authentication > SSO settings > Customize tab . In the example below, hints have been provided for Login with Clever , but not for Login with Google or Log in with Canvas . > Customize Login Buttons  
> The Clever login page can be further customized by:
> Editing the login method text (e.g. 'Log in with Google' can be updated to 'Log in as Teacher') Editing the login method order
>  
>  
> Updating your Tech Support Contact
> To abide by Clever's stringent  security and data policies , Clever Support will never provide user login credentials through any of our communications channels if a district user reaches out to us directly. > For this reason, each district should have a Tech Support contact for users to contact in the event of Clever login issues. This information can be updated  from your Clever Dashboard > Authentication > SSO settings page.

title: Single Sign-On (SSO): Setup & Configuration
text:
>  
> The Tech Support contact information will be displayed on your district's Clever login page. >  
>  
>  
> Rolling out single sign-on (SSO)
> Clever has provided some helpful resources for when your district is ready to roll out Clever single sign-on (SSO) at your district:  
> Distributing login information to teachers  
> Once you've configured your single sign-on (SSO) settings, we recommend sending an email letting your teachers and staff know how to log in to Clever to access their connected applications. > Clever provides a downloadable PDF with login instructions (1) and an email template (2) for each connected application so that district admins can easily share login information with teachers. > To locate these resources, navigate to your Clever Dashboard > Applications > My Applications page  and click on the name of the specific application to open the app overview page. > The Login Instructions PDFs include:
> Your district's Portal URL Basic instructions for how to log in to Clever Instructions on how to access the application from their Clever Portals. > The email contains:
> Your district's Portal URL Your district's Tech Support contact Basic information about the app A link to a video providing an overview of Clever SSO
> If you select V iew Email , you'll see a preview of the email that will be sent to your teachers letting them know they now have access to that particular application. Select Send to send the email to teachers. > Clever Tip: The Troubleshoot login tool can help you identify and diagnose common login issues for your users. > If you have any questions, please reach out to  Clever support ! We are happy to help! >  
> Related articles:
> Clever SSO Policy

title: Single Sign-On (SSO): Instant Login links
text:
> Tip: Title Single Sign-On (SSO): Instant Login links URL Name 205546348 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. How do Instant Login links work? ​​​​​​​ 3. Finding an app's Instant Login Link ​​​​​​​
> Overview
> Instant Login Links allow districts to embed application login URLs directly into their district's Single Sign-On portal, website, or Learning Management System (LMS). This allows district users to access Clever applications via your district portal using their Clever credentials. When district users click on an app's Instant Login Link, they are logged directly into the app via single sign-on (SSO) rather than into their Clever Portal. >  
> How do Instant Login links work? >  
> When a user clicks on an app's Instant Login link from your district portal, they are redirected to your SSO Identity Provider (e.g. Google, Active Directory, etc.) to sign in. For additional information about Identity Providers (IDPs), visit:  Single Sign-On (SSO): Identity Provider (IdP) Options . Once the user is successfully authenticated, they will be logged in and taken to the application. They will not see their Clever Portal. >  
> Please note: If a user has already authenticated with your Identity Provider (IdP) and is currently logged in, they will skip the IdP login screen and be taken directly into the app. If there are multiple login methods available for accessing Clever, users may need to re-authenticate when using an instant login link. >  
> Finding an app's Instant Login Link
> District admins can locate an app's Instant Login Link from the Clever Dashboard > Applications > My Applications   page by clicking on the name of the application to open the app overview page. Then navigate to the app Settings tab to locate the link under Application Information . Copy the Instant Login Link to embed into your district portal, website, or LMS.

> If you'd like to use the app icon in your district Portal, you can download the application icon image from this page as well. > Please note that Instant Login links are not available for SSO (Saved Passwords) applications and that  each individual learning application determines which of the following user types they support:  
> Students Teachers Staff Clever District Admins
> If a user type is not listed under SSO Supported User Types in the app Settings tab, users of that type won't be able to access the application from your district portal via the Instant Login Link.

title: For Clever Admins: Pausing the sync with your SIS
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Pausing the sync with your SIS
section: For Clever Admins: Pausing the sync with your SIS
text:
> Important: Title For Clever Admins: Pausing the sync with your SIS URL Name 205666507 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. When a district's sync is paused 3. When a district sync pause ends or is cancelled 4. Scheduling or Initiating a pause 5. Modifying a scheduled pause 6. Removing a pause
> Overview
> Clever allows districts to pause the sync from their student information system (SIS). When a sync is paused, the c urrent rostering data is essentially "frozen" in Clever for the duration of the district's sync pause. > IMPORTANT  For 2025, Clever automatically pauses syncs on May 30 and removes pauses between July 28 and August 1 for schools in the USA. In Canada, we automatically pause syncs on June 27 and remove pauses on August 15. For all other countries, we don't set default pause dates. You can modify these dates (or remove them altogether) under your Data sources > SIS sync > Settings page. > The two primary use cases for pausing data are school year rollover, and planning for summer school. Please see the following articles for details:
> School Year Rollover: Overview, Preparation & Recommendations Summer School: Sync settings
>  
> Please note: If you want to pause syncing your data to a particular application, please see this article: For Clever Admins: Pausing your sync for a specific app. This is a perfect tool for semester rollover and summer school, but shouldn't be confused with an SIS sync pause. >  
> When a district's sync is paused
> When your district's SIS sync to Clever is paused:
> Rosters will  not  sync from your SIS to Clever: SFTP uploads will not be processed, and automatic syncs will not run (this means that changes made in your SIS will not interrupt student and teacher access to applications) Applications  may still sync   rosters from Clever, allowing them to sync records updated via custom data.

title: For Clever Admins: Pausing the sync with your SIS
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Pausing the sync with your SIS
section: For Clever Admins: Pausing the sync with your SIS
text:
If you'd like your application(s) to stop pulling data from Clever, please reach out to the application partner directly to learn more about the options available. You can continue to update sharing permissions with applications Your sync status will appear as “Paused” in your Clever Dashboard All team members on the account will receive an email notification the day before the pause begins All team members in your Clever Dashboard > User management > Admin team page will receive an email notification the day before the pause ends. >       
> When a district sync pause ends or is canceled
> When a district's sync pause ends or is canceled: 
> Clever will resume syncing with your SIS (auto-syncs), or process your next upload (SFTP syncs) If your data has changed significantly, your account will go  on hold You can confirm that your account is syncing correctly by checking the  sync status  on your Dashboard All team members on the account will receive an email reminder on the last day of the pause
>              
> Scheduling or Initiating a pause
> A sync pause can be initiated or canceled by an admin from the Data sources > SIS sync > Settings page by entering pause start and end dates. > Pause Dates
> Pause Start Date : This will be the first day your sync goes on pause. Pause End Date : This will be the last day your sync is paused. > To schedule an indefinite pause:
> Enter a Pause Start Date Leave Pause End Date blank Select Update To  begin syncing again, select Clear at any time. > Sync pauses run from 12:00 AM on the pause start date to 11:59 PM on the pause end date,  local time. >  
> ☀️ Summer Pause: Clever recommends the following dates when pausing your sync: Pause Start Date: the last day of the spring term. This will ensure data from the normal school year is not deleted. Pause End Date: the day  before  you want to resume syncing data. For example, if you wish to resume syncing with your sis on August 1st, set the Pause End Date to July 31.

>   
>  
> Modifying a scheduled pause
> To modify a sync pause that has already been scheduled, navigate to your  Sync Settings  page:
> Click within the box next to Pause Start Date  or Pause End Date . Select the desired date(s). Select Update  to confirm the change. >  
> Removing a pause
> To remove a sync pause and resume syncing data to Clever at any time, navigate to the  Data sources > SIS sync > Settings page. Under  Schedule Sync Pause,  click  Clear.

title: SFTP Syncs: Overview
text:
> Tip: Title SFTP Syncs: Overview URL Name 205783078 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Review SFTP instructions 3. Export data 4. Format files 5. Upload data 6. Update your data 7. How often can you sync your data? > Overview
> The secure file transfer protocol (SFTP) sync allows school districts to “push” data to Clever. Districts generate five required CSV files ( schools.csv, teachers.csv, students.csv, sections.csv,  and enrollments.csv ) from their student information system (SIS), or manually create the files according to Clever's specified file format . These files include fields required by learning applications for each of the required five data types. You may include the optional staff.csv  file for your non-instructional staff , but it isn't required. The district then securely transfers these files to Clever. > Review SFTP instructions
> Review Clever’s SFTP Instructions to learn how to format your CSV files , and to identify which fields are required by Clever and your learning applications. Please note that fields in bold are required by Clever, and fields highlighted in yellow must remain consistent across all CSV files. The templates for these CSV files can be found here . If you’ve already signed up for a Clever account, select your sync type on the Clever Dashboard > Data sources > SIS sync > Settings page. If you'll be using an SFTP sync, you'll find the Clever SFTP Specifications specific to your district which include fields required by your connected applications. Not yet  signed up ? Take a look at our general SFTP instructions here . If you have questions about the instructions, please request help before proceeding by clicking the chat icon in the bottom right corner of this page. >  
> Export data
> Export your data from your student information system (SIS). Be sure to export all required fields. Data can be exported directly from your SIS or through an SQL query.

title: SFTP Syncs: Overview
text:
If you’re unable to produce the required fields, please contact your SIS directly. Clever is unable to troubleshoot data exporting from SIS and SQL for SFTP Syncs. We also recommend automating the process of exporting data from your SIS and uploading it to Clever. >  Please note: If you do not utilize a SIS, you can manually create the required CSV files for syncing data to Clever in a program such as Excel or Google Sheets. >  
>  
> Format files
> Format the five required CSV files ( schools.csv, teachers.csv, students.csv, sections.csv,  and enrollments.csv ) according to Clever’s specified file format . If you're including the optional staff.csv file, make sure to format that as well. If you run into any issues, see Troubleshooting CSV formatting errors  for help! >  Clever Tip: Making your files yourself? Check out our tutorial videos for each file type: Schools.csv , students.csv , teachers.csv , sections.csv , enrollments.csv. >  
> Upload data
> Securely transfer the data to Clever using one of these two options:
> Admins can upload files manually via the Data sources > SIS sync > Upload page. Need help using the Web Upload tool? See this article . Or, district admins can upload district data directly to the district's Clever SFTP folder using an FTP client (e.g., Transmit, FileZilla, or WinSCP). Click here for instructions on uploading data using an FTP client, or check out our clickable tutorial . You’ll need your SFTP credentials from your Clever Dashboard > Sync > Settings page. This SFTP option also allows districts to write a script that automates the upload process. > Onboarding to Clever and want to learn about uploading CSV files? Check out our Onboarding - Getting your schools’ data into Clever course, available in Clever Academy! >    
> Update your data
> Repeat the steps above to update the data in Clever when student, teacher, or roster information changes.

title: SFTP Syncs: Overview
text:
Be sure to include all five files in your upload, and include ALL records for each file type. Your files should always contain all data. Clever will handle necessary additions, deletions, and updates. You can always check your sync status on your  Clever Dashboard  homepage - here are some common error messages . >  
>  
> How often can you sync your data? > You can sync as often as you want! However, if your sync has been automated it may be set to sync once a day. When a new set of files is sent to your SFTP directory we will automatically trigger a sync. Uploading too many times in a short period of time may trigger a sync upload error. > Please note: Files cascade and depend on one another. If there are no schools, then we cannot process students or teachers. If there are no students, we cannot process enrollments. If there are no enrollments, then we cannot process sections. title: For Clever Admins: Updating the Clever login URL for your district
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Updating the Clever login URL for your district
section: For Clever Admins: Updating the Clever login URL for your district
text:
> Note: Title For Clever Admins: Updating the Clever login URL for your district URL Name 205818838 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2.  Instructions
> Overview
> Every Clever district has the ability to customize a unique Clever login URL to share with district users in order to simplify the Clever login process. This URL is a direct way for users to log in to your district's Clever portal rather than navigating to  Clever.com  to locate and select their school from a drop-down menu. 
> Custom Clever Portal URLs are in the format of:  https://clever.com/in/ <YOUR CUSTOM SHORTNAME>  
> For example:   Northern School District might use  https://clever.com/in/northernschooldistrict
> Instructions
> Please note:  If you are changing your Portal URL, Clever will not redirect users from the old URL to the new one. Please be sure to communicate accordingly with students, teachers, & staff if changing the URL shortname so they can log in successfully with the new one.
> To update your district's Clever Portal URL, navigate to your Clever Dashboard > Portal > Portal settings page:
> Click on the URL shortname in the 'Clever Portal URL' box to edit it. The shortname is the part after https://clever.com/in/ . Update the editable text to the new shortname you'd like to use.
> For example : Updating the shortname to NorthernSchoolDistrict would change your Portal URL to: https://clever.com/in/northernschooldistrict
> Select 'Update' to save your changes. Share the updated Portal URL with your district users so they can navigate directly to your district's Clever login page!
>        
> If you have any questions about customizing your district's Clever login Portal URL, please reach out to  Clever support ! We are happy to help!

title: For Clever Admins: Managing Clever Portal
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Managing Clever Portal
section: For Clever Admins: Managing Clever Portal
text:
> Tip: Title For Clever Admins: Managing Clever Portal URL Name 205875568 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Managing your school organization's Clever Portal           •    Adding & editing categories           •    Adding custom external links           •    Moving application icons           •    Adding a custom school icon 3. Previewing the Clever Portal 4. Why Clever updated the Portal management and SSO experience 5. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
>  
> Getting started with Clever Portal? Check out our course Quick Start - Setting up your Portal   available in Clever Academy! > Overview
> From an admin perspective, there are two primary components in Clever; the Clever Dashboard and the Clever Portal . > The Clever Dashboard is where you’ll manage your school organization’s Clever account, from setting up applications, to troubleshooting logins, to configuring tools like Classroom MFA. > The Clever Portal is where you and your end users (teachers, students, and staff) will securely access applications. > In Winter 2025, Clever made updates to the Portal management experience to provide Clever Admins a more efficient way to organize the Portal for end users that also adheres to a least-privileged access model. Previously, admins had one spot to access their applications and organize the district Portal. Now, admins have their own Portal where they can find all of the digital resources scoped for Clever Admins, and in their Clever Dashboard they can organize the end user’s Portal experience to ensure that each individual can easily find and access just the tools they need. This approach ensures that managing a student’s resources doesn't inadvertently grant an admin unnecessary permissions or data exposure within those third-party apps. > If you want to learn more about your Clever Dashboard, check out our  article here . > If you’re interested in learning more about organizing your school’s Clever Portal, keep reading below!

title: For Clever Admins: Managing Clever Portal
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Managing Clever Portal
section: For Clever Admins: Managing Clever Portal
text:
> Want to try out organizing your Clever Portal without making changes? Check out our interactive tutorial here! >  
> Managing your school organization's Clever Portal
>  Please note: Previously, Clever Admins both managed the district Portal and accessed applications through SSO directly from the Portal. With the new experience, district Portal management now occurs in the Clever Dashboard, while the Portal itself is reserved for SSO access only. Learn more about this change here. If you are missing application icons in your Portal due to missing SSO user scopes, and you’d like to re-add these links, please see here. > Adding & Editing Categories
> From your Clever Dashboard > Portal > Organize district portal page , Clever Admins can create custom categories to group applications, making it easier for users to locate the applications they need (i.e., Google apps, math applications, reading applications, and newly added applications). To create a new category:
> Navigate to your Clever Dashboard > Portal > Organize district portal page. > Select the Add to the Portal button. > From the dropdown menu choose Add a category . > Click the pencil icon next to the New Category to name the category. > After naming your category, either:
> Use the three vertical dots next to an existing resource to move it into the category
> Drag and drop an existing resource into the new category or
> Select the Add links button to add a new external link to the category. Each category must contain at least one resource for changes to save. > When you’re done adding your category and adding resources to it, click Publish changes. > To edit existing categories:
> Navigate to your Clever Dashboard > Portal > Organize district portal page. > From here, you can edit category names by clicking the pencil, delete a category by clicking the trashcan icon, or rearrange categories using the drag & drop modal on the right side of your screen.

title: For Clever Admins: Managing Clever Portal
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Managing Clever Portal
section: For Clever Admins: Managing Clever Portal
text:
You can also rearrange categories one at a time using the up and down arrows next to the trashcan icon. > Click the blue checkmark next to your category name to confirm it, then select  Publish changes to complete any changes you’ve made. >   Please note: When setting up sharing rules for any application not assigned to a category (in the default More Apps section), you’ll receive a prompt asking if you’d like to add the application to a category. For a category to appear in this dropdown, you must first create it via your Organize district portal page . > Adding custom external links
> Custom external links are URLs that you can add to your Clever Portal for end users to easily locate. This may include resources like a school website or calendar, as well as links to other resources or applications. If a login is required, external links don’t automatically log users in to the resource. To add a custom external link:
> Navigate to your Clever Dashboard > Portal > Organize district portal . > Click Add to the Portal. > From the dropdown menu select Add a link. > A modal will pop-up for adding the link. Select an icon or upload a custom icon (Note: Optimal icon size should be 200x200)
> Fill out the required fields for the link Title and URL. > Select which user types (audience), grades, and schools you would like to add the custom link for. Please note that if adding for selected schools, the link will only display for the user if the selected school matches the user's primary school association. > Choose one or multiple categories to organize the link into. > Click Add. > Be sure to click  Publish Changes on the top right of the page to finalize your updates. > To delete a link:
> Navigate to your Clever Dashboard > Portal > Organize district portal . Click the three vertical dots on the link you want to delete. Select Edit. Select Remove link.

title: For Clever Admins: Managing Clever Portal
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Managing Clever Portal
section: For Clever Admins: Managing Clever Portal
text:
>   Moving an duplicating application icons
> To help organize your district's resources to make it easy for students and teachers to find what they need, you can move or duplicate application and resource icons to different categories in your Clever Portal. To do so, follow the steps below:
> Navigate to your Clever Dashboard > Portal > Organize district portal page. > Click the three vertical dots in the top right corner of the icon. > Select Move to new category from the dropdown, and select the category that you’d like to move the application to. If you’d like to include the resource in multiple categories, select Copy resource and then move the duplicated resource to the new category. You can also drag and drop resources to organize them if you prefer. > Select  Publish Changes to the top right of the page once you are finished making updates. > Clever Tip:  If you are experiencing issues dragging and dropping the application icons, please try adjusting your browser zoom settings to a smaller size and try again! >   Adding a custom school icon
> Clever admins can upload a custom icon for your schools’ Clever Portal. Having a custom icon helps users quickly identify that they are logging into the correct Portal. You can set your icon by going to Clever Dashboard > Portal settings > Customization tab . These are the required image specs:
> Upload your icon in .png format only Maximum image size is 200px by 200px Can be color or black & white Should be high-quality, non-blurry, or distorted For best results, upload a square image
>   Once you have uploaded the icon, click Update . Now users will be able to view the icon on your school district’s login page. >  
>  Please note: Since School Tech Leads are staff users with a school association, they have the unique ability to organize the Portal of a specific school. Clever Admins can only edit the Portal for all of their schools, i.e., the district Portal.

title: For Clever Admins: Managing Clever Portal
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Managing Clever Portal
section: For Clever Admins: Managing Clever Portal
text:
If you are a Clever Admin that would like to edit individual school Portals, you can add yourself to Clever as a STL. You can have both Admin and STL accounts in Clever. Learn more about how to create a staff account for yourself here . >  
> Why Clever updated the Portal management and SSO experience
> One of the ways Clever builds security into our platform is by moving toward a least-privileged access model. This approach minimizes the attack surface of your district’s data by ensuring users only have access to the specific tools they need. To support this, we have intentionally separated Portal Management from Admin SSO Access: Portal management: This functionality is now available in the Admin Dashboard. Icons in the “Organize District Portal” tab are intentionally non-clickable to prevent administrative accounts from having "blanket access" to applications by default. The Admin Portal: This remains the Admin hub for SSO into resources provisioned to Admin accounts. If you need personal access to a specific application, it must be scoped to your account. Once provisioned, it will appear as a clickable icon in your personal Portal. Why the change? By decoupling these experiences, we ensure that managing a student’s resources doesn't inadvertently grant an admin unnecessary permissions or data exposure within those third-party apps. > If you notice that applications you previously accessed via your Portal are no longer present, please follow these troubleshooting steps in our FAQ . > To take a look at the previous Portal management experience compared with the updated experience, check out the video below:
> Previewing the Portal
> As is mentioned above , only School Tech Leads can edit individual school Portals, however, administrators can view school Portals. To view a specific school’s Portal, click the Preview Portal as button and select the school Portal you’d like to view.

title: For Clever Admins: Managing Clever Portal
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Managing Clever Portal
section: For Clever Admins: Managing Clever Portal
text:
> You may wish to view a specific school's Portal to see what categories or links an STL has added. > When previewing the Portal as a specific school, all resources will appear in gray, as you cannot manage or edit an individual school's Portal. To return to editing the district Portal, select the Previewing as dropdown again and choose District Portal View. > An example of previewing a specific school as an administrator with resources grayed out. > If you’d like to view the Portal of a specific student or teacher:
> Search for the user using the search bar at the top of your Dashboard. > Hover over their name and select Portal as user. > This will enable you to access their Portal and preview what their Clever experience is. Please be cautious as your actions or changes will impact the teacher’s experience. > Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
> Why did the Clever Portal management and organization setup change? > To provide Clever Admins with a more efficient way to organize the Portal for end users and access their own resources. > Why is an application missing from my personal Clever Portal? > There are a couple of reasons why an application may not appear in your Portal. > Check the Supported SSO User Types to confirm the application supports administrator logins. If the app doesn't support District admin logins, it won't appear in your Portal. If you still want to access the resource via your Portal, you can add an external link to the resource and set the audience to District admins only. Check the data that the application is receiving on the Application Overview page to confirm that Clever Admins are shared. If Clever Admins aren't shared, adjust your field access settings to share admins. Learn more here. > What if there is a link in my teacher's or student's Portal that I don't see on my Organize district Portal page? > An STL likely added the link! You can confirm this by using the View Portal as...

feature and selecting the school where the student or teacher is seeing the link. If the link is visible when you view the Portal as the school, an STL added it. An STL associated with the school will need to update or remove the link. >  
> Related articles:
> For Clever Admins: How do I use the Clever Dashboard? For Clever Admins: Clever Portal - Adding External Links (Hyperlinks) For Clever Admins: Clever Academy Course Catalog - Learn more about Clever!

title: Single Sign-On (SSO): "Log in with Office 365/Entra ID"
heading_path: Single Sign-On (SSO): "Log in with Office 365/Entra ID"
text:
If you haven't finished signing up for a Clever account yet, you can choose Google to start. Once you have access to the [Clever Dashboard](https://schools.clever.com/), take the following steps:

1. Navigate to your [Clever Dashboard > Authentication > SSO settings.](https://schools.clever.com/instant-login/accesscontrol)
2. Choose **Add Login Method**
3. Choose **SAML Authentication**
4. Enter your metadata URL (you can find out how to obtain your metadata URL below)
5. Check the box for **Allow unencrypted SAML assertions**
6. Click **Save**
7. Add the contact information for whom students and teachers should reach out to if they have trouble with logging in to Clever - this should be someone who can help them reset their Entra ID credentials and/or make sure they are shared with the application they're trying to access through Clever.

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TXLZ&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000003BiBN)

8. Next, navigate to [Portal > Portal settings](https://schools.clever.com/portal/settings/url) and choose your district's Portal URL. The URL will be *[www.clever.com/in/<shortname>](http://www.clever.com/in/<shortname>);*. Remember to use something that your students and teachers will remember easily.

title: Single Sign-On (SSO): "Log in with Office 365/Entra ID"
heading_path: Single Sign-On (SSO): "Log in with Office 365/Entra ID"
Setting up Entra ID SSO into Clever
section: Setting up Entra ID SSO into Clever
text:
For single sign-on to work, Entra ID needs to know what the counterpart user in Clever is to a user in Entra ID. In other words, a link relationship between an Entra ID user and the related user in Clever needs to be established.

In Clever, assign the value of the **user name** in Entra ID as the value of the **Username** to establish the link relationship.

**Configure Entra ID single sign-on**

In this section, you enable Entra ID single sign-on in the Entra ID portal and configure single sign-on in your Clever application.

**To configure Entra ID single sign-on with Clever, perform the following steps:**

1. In the [Entra ID portal](https://portal.azure.com/), on the **Clever** application integration page, find the **Manage** section and select **single sign-on**.
2. On the **Select a single sign-on method** page, select **SAML**.
3. On the **Set up single sign-on with SAML** page, click the edit/pen icon for **Basic SAML Configuration** to edit the settings.

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TXLZ&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000003Bi9w)

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TXLZ&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000003BiCV)
4. On the **Basic SAML Configuration** section, enter the values for the following fields:

a. In the **Identifier (Entity ID)** text box, type a URL using the following: `https://clever.com/oauth/saml/metadata.xml`

b. In the **Reply URL (Assertion Consumer Service URL)**text box, type a URL using either of the following: `https://clever.com/*`or `https://clever.com/oauth/saml/assert`
5. c. In the **Sign on URL** text box, type a URL using the following pattern: `https://clever.com/in/<shortname>;`
6. ![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TXLZ&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000003BiCp)
8. 5. Next, open the **User Attributes & Claims** section.

title: Single Sign-On (SSO): "Log in with Office 365/Entra ID"

Setting up Entra ID SSO into Clever
section: Setting up Entra ID SSO into Clever
text:
There will be required claims that you will not need to adjust at all.

**Additional Claims** rules are used to allow Clever to determine which student or teacher is logging in. To do this, we match Entra ID attributes to data in Clever. *Claim name*will be the [Clever field](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/215176617) and the *value* is the field in Entra ID*.*

In order for users to be able to log in, there needs to be an attribute for each user type that exactly matches data in a field in Clever. We recommend adding three claims - one each for:

- Students
- Teachers
- Staff

To view the possible Clever *Claim name* attribute values for each user type, see [this article](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/215176617?language=en_US#h_0b0fa0fb-6c9f-41f3-b90a-d03342830537).

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TXLZ&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000S6psX)

6. To generate the Metadata URL, navigate to **SAML Signing Certificate**and copy the **App Federation Metadata URL.**

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TXLZ&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000003BiDi)

**Grant users access to Clever**

In this section, you will enable students and teachers to use Entra ID single sign-on by granting access to Clever.

To assign users to Clever, perform the following steps:

1. In the Entra ID portal, open the applications view, and then navigate to the directory view and go to **Enterprise applications** then click **All applications**.

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TXLZ&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000003BiE2)
2. In the applications list, select **Clever**.

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TXLZ&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000003BiEM)
3. In the menu on the left, click **Users and groups**.

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TXLZ&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000003BiER)
4. Click the **Add** button. Then select **Users and groups** on **Add Assignment** dialog.

The signed in user is blocked because they are not a direct member of a group with access, nor had access directly assigned by an administrator."

To resolve this error, please review the steps above and ensure the user is in a group assigned to Clever.

title: SFTP Syncs: Recommended tools (e.g. FTP Clients, CSV editing tools)
heading_path: SFTP Syncs: Recommended tools (e.g. FTP Clients, CSV editing tools)
text:
Clever recommends using CSV and text editors to avoid file formatting errors. [See this help article](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/218518698) about formatting errors, and [this article](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/203257407) about sync status errors due to formatting.

- CSVEdit: We love using CSVEdit to view CSV files without worrying about dropping leading zeros!
- Sublime Text: If you need to modify your data before uploading your CSV files to Clever, Sublime Text is an easy-to-use text editor. Text editors are also great for identifying trailing comma issues.
- TextEdit: If you’re a Mac user, TextEdit is your Mac’s default text editor. We recommend using a text editor to safely view and save CSV files without skewing data.
- Notepad: Notepad is a simple text editor that you’ll find on your PC if you’re a Windows user; it’s a helpful tool to view CSV files.
- Notepad++: A free Windows-based text editor, Notepad++ is great for viewing and editing CSV/text files. You can use tabs to open multiple files, and we love the search function!

---

FTP Clients allow you to safely transfer files via Secure File Transfer Protocol. For more information about uploading data to Clever with an FTP client, [see this help article](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202494408).

- OpenSSH: OpenSSH is a suite of security-related network-level utilities based on the Secure Shell (SSH) protocol.
- WinSCP: WinSCP is a free FTP client designed for Windows.

title: For Clever Admins: How do I access Clever?
heading_path: For Clever Admins: How do I access Clever?
text:
District admins can access the [Clever Dashboard](https://schools.clever.com/) by going to the Clever login page (<https://schools.clever.com>) and entering your email address and the password you set when you signed up for Clever. Once here, District admins do the following in Clever:

- Manage the flow of data from their student information system (SIS) to Clever to their district’s connected applications
- Modify account settings for the whole district, such as the [sync settings](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202083526) between the SIS and Clever, [sharing permissions](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/203115007) with connected applications, and single sign-on (SSO) credentials
- Use [Single sign-on (SSO)](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/203166807) to access learning applications as a district admin

If you were the one to sign up for Clever for your district, congratulations, you are the "owner" of the account! This means you are the first Clever district admin. The owner of the account can add new district admins, and any administrator can add new school admins. For more information on how to add new admins, please see [this article on how to manage your team](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202518038).

The [Clever Dashboard](https://schools.clever.com/) is where you can manage your district's data and account settings. You can access the [Clever Dashboard](https://schools.clever.com/) by going to the Clever login page (<https://schools.clever.com>) and entering your email address and the password you set when you signed up for Clever, or when you were added to your district’s account. [Read this article](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202043093) to learn how to use the [Clever Dashboard](https://schools.clever.com/).

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl0000002J4z&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028B8W)

title: For Clever Admins: How do I access Clever?
heading_path: For Clever Admins: How do I access Clever?
text:
The Clever Portal is where users in your district access connected applications. To access your Clever applications as a district admin, you’ll use a [customized portal URL](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/205818838) for your district that your students and teachers will use to access the Clever Portal. Usually, this URL follow the format: <**[clever.com/in/<district](http://clever.com/in/<district) shortname**>. Once there, you have two options for accessing the Portal:

- **Log in with your** [Identity Provider (IDP)](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/203166787) **credentials**
 - If your single sign-on (SSO) setup is configured to allow for district admin access (e.g. your Google Apps email address is the same as your district admin email address), you can use the ‘Log In’ button on this screen to sign in to the Clever portal. Please note that for some IDPs this may take some custom configuration.
- **Log in with your Clever credentials**
 - Admins can also log in using the ‘Log in as a district admin’ link at the bottom of the page. This will allow you to use the same username and password you use to access the [Clever Dashboard](https://schools.clever.com/) to access your applications. If you ever need to update your email or password, you can do so in the top right-hand corner of your account and click [*Profile*](https://schools.clever.com/profile). From here you will select *Edit* under Account Information to update your credentials.

If you have any questions, please reach out to [Clever support](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360001041326)! We are happy to help!

title: Single Sign-On (SSO): "Log in with Canvas"
text:
To set up Canvas as a login method for Clever, navigate to your [Clever Dashboard > Authentication > SSO settings](https://schools.clever.com/instant-login/accesscontrol) page. In the upper-righthand corner, click the **Add Login Method** button. From there, select Canvas Authentication and enter your Canvas instance URL. If you run into any issues with this, put [in a request to Clever Support.](https://support.clever.com/hc/en-us/requests/new)

A connection will be set up to match Canvas fields against Clever fields and authenticate users. Here are the default matches:

**Canvas field - [Clever fields]**

email -> [email] 
login\_id -> [email, username] 
sis\_user\_id -> [sis\_id] 
unique\_id -> [email, credentials.district\_username, sis\_id, student\_number]

If these default matches do not work for your district, please let us know in your support request.

title: Single Sign-On (SSO): "Log in with LDAPS"
text:
> Note: Title Single Sign-On (SSO): "Log in with LDAPS" URL Name 207090387 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Setup 3. Notes
> Overview
> Clever can connect to your district's existing LDAPS provider to log students and teachers into their Clever Portal account. LDAPS is a more secure variant of LDAP that uses Transport Layer Security (TLS) to ensure that usernames and passwords are transmitted securely. For security reasons, Clever does not support using non-secure LDAP with single sign-on (SSO). We cannot provide support for upgrading your existing LDAP system to LDAPS at this time, but this guide may be helpful if you are using Active Directory. > Setup
> To provision accounts, Clever needs permission to connect to your LDAP server. To establish a successful connection with Clever, you will need to provide the following information for your LDAP server:  
> LDAPS URL SHA-256 fingerprints of server’s SSL certificate Base Distinguished Name (Base DN) One of:
> Username prefix/suffix and the field in the LDAP server we use to find the user once we have access, or Username and password for a bind account, a field in the LDAP server we use to find the user once we have access, and the field in the LDAP server used as the end user’s username. > The property in your LDAPS accounts that we can match with data in Clever - if you're not sure what this could be, please see this article about claims rules. >  
> In addition to providing the information above, if you use a firewall please give access to the Clever external IP addresses ( 54.241.134.131 , 50.18.217.135 , 54.241.154.41 ) on port 636 to ensure a successful connection with your server. > Once you're ready, navigate to your Clever Dashboard > Authentication > SSO settings , and click Add Login Method on the top right. Select LDAP Authentication to open the setup wizard.

title: Single Sign-On (SSO): "Log in with LDAPS"
text:
> Please note:  Changing the certificate on the LDAPS server without updating the SHA1 fingerprint here will cause logins to fail until resolved. >  
> Notes
>  
> If using a BIND account, the account will need read and search permissions on the base DN. We recommend you limit BIND account permissions to minimize the exposure of sensitive directory information. If using a BIND account, the BIND Account Search Attribute and the BIND Account Username Attribute should NOT be the same. If a district is using sAMAccountName and userPrincipalName, there is a high likelihood that their server is Active directory. Use the "Match Automatically" tool to see what user objects look like. >  
> As always, feel free to contact Clever Support  if you run into any issues or have any questions about setting up LDAPS as your identity provider! >  
> Related articles:
> Clever SSO Policy

title: Troubleshooting: Google login issues
text:
> Tip: Title Troubleshooting: Google login issues URL Name 208333098 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Troubleshooting checklist 3. Google Login Flow 4. Troubleshoot login tool 5. Common errors
> Overview
> This guide if for district admins familiar with Google SSO through Clever. Use this information to troubleshoot login issues. If you're just getting started with Google and Clever, take a look at the article on Single Sign on (SSO) with Google . > Troubleshooting checklist
> - : Does the user have an active Clever account? > - : Is the email field populated in Clever for the user? > - : Is the email address in Clever correct? (up-to-date and no typos)
> - : Are there any other users in Clever with the same email address? Their email address must be unique . > - : Is the user entering the correct email address? i.e. their school-provided email address, not their personal email address
> Google login flow
> When a user clicks Log in with Google from your district's Clever login Portal URL , Clever sends the user to Google where they'll enter their district-provided Google email address and password. > Clever doesn't have access to Google passwords for users; however, once the user has entered their credentials, Google will redirect the user back to Clever providing a "token" that tells Clever this user has successfully logged in. If it's the users first time logging into Clever via Google, the user may be prompted to approve Clever as a Google SSO application. > Once the user is logged in, Clever shares the user's token with any associated applications they attempt to log into. This allows the user to access their Clever apps via single sign-on (SSO) through Clever without needing to enter their credentials again. > Please note:  When a Clever admin accesses the Portal as a user, they are not actually logged into Clever via Google. >  
> Troubleshoot login tool
> There are occasional login issues that come up with district users.

title: Troubleshooting: Google login issues
text:
The first step in investigating a user login issue is to use the Troubleshoot login tool . >  
> Common errors
> Here are the most common errors, and how to resolve them:
> The email used during login doesn't match any user in Clever  
> The unique identifier passed to us from Google didn’t match any user in Clever. In essence, a user (let's call her "Susan") was successfully able to prove who she was to Google, but when Google came to tell Clever "Hey, can you log Susan in for me?", we responded "Sorry, we don't have a Susan here". The most common cause of this is a user trying to log in that isn’t yet synced to Clever, but it could also be that the field we match on, say student number or email address, is missing in the SIS upload for the user in question. We show the matches we tried to make in your Access logs , so check there and then look up the corresponding information in your SIS and/or Clever Data browser to see what might be going on. > A user didn't grant permission to use Clever
> When a user logs in to Clever for the first time using Google, they're asked to give permission. If they deny permission, we don't get a valid code to log them in with, and show this error. Ask the user to try again, and accept the permissions to use Clever. > Google encountered an issue during login. If this happens frequently, contact Clever Support for help
> A fairly rare error, this indicates Google had an issue while we were attempting to log the user in. This can indicate that Google had a temporary network glitch, or that there is a bug. If you are seeing this error occur frequently, please reach out as soon as possible to Clever Support so we can work with Google and help you troubleshoot. > The email used during login matches to multiple users in Clever. > Multiple users in Clever have the same email address. For example, siblings Sarah Smith and Samantha Smith both have the email address sarah.smith@example.com .

title: Troubleshooting: Google login issues
text:
Samantha’s email address will need to be updated to the correct email in the data syncing to Clever. > Google is not enabled as a login method for this user
> A user attempted to login using an identity provider (IdP) that is not configured for their user type. For example, a student tried to login using Google credentials when they should login with Clever Passwords. >  
> User signs into their Chromebook and clicks to log into Clever with Google, but the screen spins or bounces them back to the login page. > This error typically occurs if Clever is blocked in the security settings on the user's device. We recommend confirming that Clever is not blocked in the user's content settings at chrome://settings/content . > If you have any questions, please reach out to  Clever support ! We are happy to help!

title: Troubleshooting: Canvas Login Issues

title: Troubleshooting: Canvas Login Issues
text:
This guide is meant for district admins to troubleshoot issues their users are experiencing while attempting to access Clever with their Canvas credentials.

If you're just getting started with Canvas and Clever, please take a look at the article on [Setting up single sign-on (SSO) with Canvas](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/206629117). To identify issues in your single sign-on (SSO) setup, view your [Clever Dashboard > Support tools > Troubleshoot login](https://schools.clever.com/troubleshoot-login) tool.

When a user selects **Log in with Canvas**, Clever will send the user to Canvas where they will enter their username and password. Clever never sees these credentials, but Canvas will redirect the user back to Clever with a token confirming the user logged in successfully.

If it's the user's first time logging into Clever with Canvas, they may have to also approve Clever as an app they want to use. Clever will then match the Canvas user with a user in Clever, and log them into their app.

---

title: Troubleshooting: Canvas Login Issues
text:
Here are the common errors that we identify, and how to resolve them:

- **We couldn’t log you in. We can’t find a Clever account for the email or username.**

- The unique identifier passed to us from Canvas doesn’t match any user in Clever. Most commonly, this is a user who isn’t yet synced to Clever. Alternatively, a field we match on (e.g. student number or email address) is missing in the SIS upload for the user in question. Please review your [Access logs](https://schools.clever.com/access-logs) to see which user matches we tried to make and then verify the correct information in your SIS and within Clever.

- **We couldn’t log you in. Additional permissions are required.**

- When a user logs in to Clever for the first time using Canvas, they are asked to give permission. If they deny permission, we don't get a valid code by which to authorize the user into Clever. Ask the user to try again, this time accepting the permissions to use Clever.
- If the user is receiving an error message when logging in, try logging into your Canvas administrator dashboard and enabling “Clever Instant Login” under Developer Keys > Inherited.

- **We couldn't log you in.**

- This may indicate Canvas had an issue while we were attempting to log the user in. This can indicate that Canvas had a temporary network glitch or that there is a bug. If you are seeing this error occur frequently, please reach out as soon as possible to [Clever Support](https://support.clever.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) so we can help you troubleshoot.

- **We couldn’t log you in. Multiple accounts are linked to the email or username**

- Please check your data in Clever to ensure that each user has a unique username for Canvas logins.

If you have any questions, please reach out to [Clever support](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360001041326)! We're happy to help!

This guide is meant for people familiar with SAML and Active Directory who are trying to troubleshoot issues their users are seeing while using single sign-on (SSO). If you're just getting started with ADFS and Clever, we suggest accessing the article on [Setting up single sign-on (SSO) with ADFS](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202102576). title: Troubleshooting: ADFS, Office365, and SAML Login Issues
heading_path: Troubleshooting: ADFS, Office365, and SAML Login Issues
text:
Normally, when a user selects 'Login with ADFS', Clever will send the user out to your AD or another SAML server where they will enter their username and password. Clever never sees this username and password, but your server will redirect the user back to Clever with a token confirming the user logged in successfully. Clever will then "match" the user in your AD or another SAML system with a user in Clever, and log them into their app.

Occasionally errors do occur. Here are the common errors that we identify, and how to resolve them:

- **The ID used during login doesn't match any user in Clever** or **LDAP data provided during login doesn't match any user in Clever**
 - The unique identifier passed to Clever by the SAML server did not match any user in Clever. In essence, a user (let's call her "Susan") was successfully able to prove who she was to the district's identity provider (IdP), but when the IdP spoke to Clever and said, "Hey, can you log Susan in for me?", Clever responded, "Sorry, we don't have a Susan here." The most common cause of this is a user trying to log in that is not yet synced to Clever, but it could also be that the field we match on, say student number or email address, is missing in the SIS upload for the user in question. We show the matches we tried to make in your [Clever Dashboard > Authentication > Access logs](https://schools.clever.com/access-logs), so please check there first and then look up the corresponding information in your student information system (SIS) or Clever [Data browser](https://schools.clever.com/data-browser) to see if you can determine the issue.

title: Troubleshooting: ADFS, Office365, and SAML Login Issues
heading_path: Troubleshooting: ADFS, Office365, and SAML Login Issues
text:
- **No matching account found. The SAML server did not provide any login attributes**
- **We did not receive any LDAP data that we could use to match a Clever user**
- **We were unable to find an LDAP user for the user who logged in** 
 - This is similar to when a user can’t be matched (explained above), however these errorsmean that we didn't get any value that we could match on. For instance, say you are matching on email. If your server sent us "[sue.smith@espid.edu](mailto:sue.smith@espid.edu)" and we couldn't find that user, Clever would return an IDerror. If your server didn't send us any attributes at all, or if Sue didn't have an email on the SAML server*,* then we didn't receive any data to match on. Check in the SAML server to see that the impacted user has all the right attributes, and also take a look at your [claims rules](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/215176617) to make sure all your claims rules are set up and mapped to valid attributes on your server.

- **Configuration issue. The 'Name ID' attribute is not set in the claim rules.**
 - A somewhat misleading error message, but easy to solve. While technically correct, what this error really means is that you should check your claims rules and ensure that the "Name ID" attribute is set, as indicated in the [Help Center docs](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202102576).

- **The SAML response didn't include an encrypted assertion**
 - This error indicates there is something wrong with how Clever and your SAML server talk securely. This may be an issue with the certificate on your server. We recommend verifying your SSL certification installation using [this tool](https://www.sslshopper.com/ssl-checker.html).
 - If using Office365 or another SAML connection, under **SSO Settings > Login Method > Active Directory Authentication > Edit Settings,** please try checking the box to **Allow unencrypted SAML assertions (recommended with Entra ID)**and test another login.

title: Troubleshooting: ADFS, Office365, and SAML Login Issues
heading_path: Troubleshooting: ADFS, Office365, and SAML Login Issues
text:
- **SAML certificate doesn't match. Update the SAML certificate in Clever to match the one used by your SAML server**
- **Your LDAP server used an SSL certificate we did not recognize.**
 - This error indicates the certificate stored in Clever does not match. We recommend uploading a new metadata.xml file in your [SSO settings](https://schools.clever.com/instant-login/settings).
 - To resolve these errors automatically in the future, you can use a metadata URL rather than a manually uploaded file.

- **No success code received from your SAML server**
 - A fairly rare error, this indicates that the status code we received back from your AD or SAML server wasn't a **success** status code. Often this is a rate-limiting issue, but it can also indicate your server is misconfigured, the network is down, or another server bug. We recommend checking that your AD or SAML server is operational and responding to authentication requests.

- **Unknown error. Please contact Clever Support with the error reference ID for assistance.**
 - This is an error with unknown origin. Please reach out to Clever Support.

- **LDAP data provided during login matches to multiple users in Clever**
- **Multiple accounts are linked to the LDAP data we received**
- **SAML attributes received matches to multiple users in Clever**
 - Please check your data in Clever to ensure that each user has a unique username for LDAP or SAML logins.

title: For Application Partners: Viewing information about a connected district
heading_path: For Application Partners: Viewing information about a connected district
section: For Application Partners: Viewing information about a connected district
text:
> Note: Title For Application Partners: Viewing information about a connected district URL Name 215115268 Article Body Viewing District Data
> This article describes how to find and view key details about districts that are connected to your app through Clever. >  
> On your homepage, you’ll see a list of your districts. The tags under each district indicate whether the district is:  
> No Data Shared - the district has approved your invitation, the launch date is in the future, but the district still needs to setup their sharing permissions. No action is required on the app-side unless you would like to recommend any sharing rules for the district. Setup Wizard Complete - the district has completed their setup (i.e. the setup wizard you created and sharing permissions) and the connection is now pending the launch date. During this phase, your team has the opportunity to confirm that you're receiving the data you need ahead of the launch date (i.e. when the icon will appear on user Portals and allow logins). You can also choose to move the launch date up if you're ready to launch earlier. Launched - this district is ready to use your app through Clever! Setting Up - during this phase, teachers and students cannot see or access your application. Licenses Exceeded - the district has overshared students or schools with your application and need to adjust their sharing permissions. Requires Review  - references the data safety thresholds your team has placed (Clever Dashboard > Settings > District Setup page ). This tag indicates the district's data has changed significantly according to your thresholds. The changes will not sync until a member of your team has had a chance to review and approve them. Sync Paused - the school district has paused the data sync with your application. This temporarily disables data updates.

title: For Application Partners: Viewing information about a connected district
heading_path: For Application Partners: Viewing information about a connected district
section: For Application Partners: Viewing information about a connected district
text:
>  
> Please note: The licensing feature makes it easier to manage and communicate with districts about licenses, but it does not limit how many students or schools can be shared. >  
> When you click on a district’s name, you'll see a few key details about that district. At the top of the page, you’ll find the following information:  
>  
> Sync Status: The icon indicates the status of the district's sync. For details on possible sync statuses, please see: District Sync Statuses . Sharing type: This indicates how a district has scoped their data for your application. Any permissions updates must be made by a district administrator. Possible descriptions include:
> Sharing no data Sharing all data Sharing selected schools Sharing selected sections Sharing data by rules
> Shared schools : This is the number of schools shared by the district. Here, you are also able to set the number of licenses that you have allotted to the district. For more information on using the license feature in Clever, see Set Up License Usage Limits . Launch date : This is the date that end-users will have access to your application. Usually, this date is agreed upon by you and the district, but the Launch Date in Clever is set by your team. For more information about managing launch dates, reference Setting and managing launch dates . > Further down on the overview page, you will see the following 3 sections:  
> District Info Sync Info Instant Login Info
>  
>  
> District Info:
> In this section, you can find contact information for the district administrator maintaining the Clever account, in addition to the district’s Clever ID, MDR number, and OAuth token. > Sync Info:
> Here, you can view which SIS and sync type (SFTP, Auto-Sync, etc.) the district is using to sync data into Clever and if the sync from Clever is paused by the school district. The last successful sync date indicates when the district has last synced fresh data with Clever.

If the district's syncs are configured to occur nightly or hourly, you’ll also find the predicted next sync time. > Instant Login info:
> This section provides information on the district’s Clever Portal URL, as well as their login method into Clever. If the district does not use the Clever Portal, they can use the listed Instant Login Link to embed Clever authentication for your application into a different SSO portal. (Note: the district has access to the Instant Login link for your application in their Clever dashboard, as well)

You can see whether the district is already utilizing Clever, their sync status, and how well their data matches up against your application's schema. Learn more about data compatibility here . > This will allow you to send these communications with the name and email of your choice from any user without creating and maintaining a shared email account. > This contact will also surface to Clever Administrators in their Dashboard if they utilize your application, providing them with a quick reference for who to contact should they need help with the application.
