title: Single Sign-On (SSO): Lenovo Stoneware / webNetwork
text:
> Important: Title Single Sign-On (SSO): Lenovo Stoneware / webNetwork URL Name 215140667 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Single sign-on (SSO) with Stoneware 3. Can I use the Clever Portal instead of the Stoneware Portal? 4. Setup Preparation 5. Configuring the Public webApp for Clever 6. Finishing setup with Clever support 7. Adding applications to the Stoneware Portal
> Overview
> Clever’s single sign-on (SSO) allows students and teachers to safely access education apps with a single username and password. You can rely on your existing user management system - single sign-on (SSO) supports common user management systems like Lenovo Stoneware. > To use single sign-on (SSO) with Stoneware, you’ll need the following:
> Active SIS sync with Clever webNetwork version 6.3.0.167 and above
> Before you start setting up single sign-on (SSO) with Stoneware, it’s important to look at the attributes in Stoneware and the data that’s synced to Clever - in order for users to be able to authenticate, there needs to be an attribute in Stoneware that matches the user’s sis\_id. Additionally, we recommend having your users’ mail attribute match the email address in Clever, though this is not mandatory. > Single sign-on (SSO) with Stoneware
>  
> When you set up Stoneware, you define usernames and passwords for your users. When you set up single sign-on (SSO) with Stoneware, you create a hidden SAML application on your Stoneware portal, so when students authenticate to Stoneware, they are logged in to the hidden SAML application. When users click on an single sign-on (SSO) link, Clever queries the SAML application to see which user is logged in. The SAML application uses claims rules to identify the user, and we grant them access to the application if they are correctly set up in Clever and in Stoneware.

title: Single Sign-On (SSO): Lenovo Stoneware / webNetwork
text:
> Please note: Because credentials are only entered on the Stoneware Portal log in screen, Clever will never know the usernames and passwords of your users. > Can I use the Clever Portal instead of the Stoneware Portal? > It’s possible to log in to the Clever Portal using your Stoneware credentials once single sign-on (SSO) with Stoneware is set up. However, as the Stoneware set up process requires adding single sign-on (SSO) links to the Stoneware Portal in order for users to be able to log in, districts generally prefer to use the existing Stoneware Portal. > Setup Preparation
> If you haven't finished signing up for a Clever account yet, you can choose "Custom Username & Password" and "Synced Passwords" to start. Once you have access to the Clever Admin Dashboard, take the following steps:  
> Navigate to your Clever Dashboard > Portal > Portal settings page. Choose the shortname for your ingle sign-on (SSO) portal URL. The URL will be www.clever.com / shortname . Remember to use something that your students and teachers will remember easily. Keep Identity System set to  Google Apps or Clever Passwords for now Add the contact information that students and teachers should reach out to if they have trouble with logging in to Clever - this should be someone who can help them reset their Stoneware credentials and/or make sure they are shared with the application they're trying to access through Clever. Click  Save . > Configuring the Public webApp for Clever
> You’ll need to configure Stoneware to connect with Clever single sign-on (SSO). In order to do so, you’ll need to set up a public webApp for Clever. > Creating a Public webApp  
> Open webAdmin, right-click Applications Admin , Create Public Application , and enter Clever SSO as the webApp name.

title: Single Sign-On (SSO): Lenovo Stoneware / webNetwork
text:
Open the Clever SSO Properties tab and set the following properties:
> Description:  CleverSSO Application Type:  Public Context Path (Alias) /CleverSSO
> You may need to refresh the page for this option to appear
> Assigned Relay(s): This should assign the app to each relay in your environment by default. //More complex setup? Reach out to StonewareUse the green ‘+’ icon to assign the app to each relay in your environment Please note that Assigned Link should be blank
> Setting up Single-Sign-On to the Clever webApp Open the Clever SSO Authentication Tab and set the following properties:  
>  
> Type: ADFS Identity: Use the Wizard to add an attribute that matches data in Clever SAML Initiation: Service Provider Assertion Consumer: https://clever.com/oauth/saml/ PFX Certificate: Click on the Wizard button
> Set Algorithm to RSA and Strength to 2048 Click the Generate button, then the Overwrite button
> Certificate: Use the wizard to configure the certificate as you would any other self-signed certificate. SAML Logout Behavior: Full Logout
> Setting up Attributes for single sign-on (SSO)
> Open the CleverSSO  Attributes  or  Provisioning  tab and set the following properties:  
> Attribute Assertion: Enabled Type: SAML Attribute Assertion Parameters: Use the green ‘+’ button to add the following attributes:
> clever.any.sis\_id = <the Stoneware Attribute that matches Clever sis\_id> clever.any.email = @@attr:mail@@
> This attribute is optional but recommended! > Once you’re done here, hit save and reload the page! > Testing the Public webApp Navigate to https:// <dns of your webNetwork system>/swPublicSSO/SAMLMetadata/CleverSSO - this should display a page like this:  
> You’ll want to double-check that the two attributes at the bottom match the attributes you set up in the CleverSSO webApp. > If this page does not load or does not properly display the attributes, double-check your webApp configuration and assignments, and try reloading this page.

title: Single Sign-On (SSO): Lenovo Stoneware / webNetwork
text:
> Finishing setup with Clever support
> Once you’ve finished the above, please contact Clever Support  and provide the following information:  
> The URL that you used to test your CleverSSO webApp An application that you’ve added to your Portal
> We’ll help you finalize setup and test your first logins! > Adding applications to the Stoneware Portal
> You can add Clever apps to the Stoneware Portal using single sign-on (SSO) links - this allows users to access applications seamlessly, thanks to the public webApp you’ve set up. Once you’ve acquired the direct link from your Clever Dashboard, you can add it to the Portal by adding a new Link Object to your portal for each application and assigning it to the appropriate users. > The Link Object should look like this:  
> Please note:  single sign-on (SSO) will only work for users who both have access to this Link Object and are shared with the application in question through Clever. > If you have any questions about setting up Clever SSO, please reach out to  Clever support ! We are happy to help!

title: Single Sign-On (SSO): Active Directory - Claims Rules
heading_path: Single Sign-On (SSO): Active Directory - Claims Rules
section: Single Sign-On (SSO): Active Directory - Claims Rules
text:
> Tip: Title Single Sign-On (SSO): Active Directory - Claims Rules URL Name 215176617 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. How do I use claims rules? 3. Defining the Field in Clever 4. Applying the claims rules to single sign-on (SSO)
> Overview
> When users sign in to their Identity Provider to use single sign-on (SSO), the identity provider sends us a piece of data and tells us which field in Clever contains matching data. Using this, we can identify the user and give them access to their applications. > Claims rules define which attributes are sent to Clever from the identity provider and which fields Clever should use to perform the match. You will need to find a claims rule for each user type (e.g. students, teachers, staff, etc.) that you want to use single sign-on (SSO). > Please note:  Claims rules are only necessary for Active Directory, Lenovo Stoneware / webNetwork, LDAPS, and Office 365 / Entra ID. > How do I use claims rules? > Picking the right identity provider attribute  
> First, look at the data in your Clever account - you can click on a record in the Clever Dashboard > Data browser   to view all the information that’s currently synced in Clever. > Next, compare the data in Clever to the data attributed to users in your identity provider (IdP). Are there matches? In order for users to be able to log in, the data in the IdP attribute and the data in the field in Clever must match exactly. > Additionally, make sure you’re picking something that’s unique across all users. If a claims rule matches multiple users, Clever won't know which user to match it against and the login attempt will fail. > If you can find a match, great! That’s the attribute you should use for that user type. If not, you’ll want to sync additional data from your SIS in order to be able to create a match. > Defining the Field in Clever
>  
> Once you’ve found a match, you’ll want to take note of the field in Clever it matches to.

title: Single Sign-On (SSO): Active Directory - Claims Rules
heading_path: Single Sign-On (SSO): Active Directory - Claims Rules
section: Single Sign-On (SSO): Active Directory - Claims Rules
text:
What’s the name of the field in the left column of the user's Detail view? Make a note of it! >  
> Please note: Extension fields can't be used as an option at this time. >  
> The field in Clever is expressed in the claims rule “clever. <user type or any> . <field name> ” Here are a few commonly used fields:  
> - Students: clever. student . email clever. student . s is\_i d clever. student . student\_number clever. student . credentials . district\_username
> - Teachers: clever. teacher . email clever. teacher . sis\_id clever. teacher . teacher\_number clever. teacher . c r edentials . district\_username
> - Staff (Previously: School Admins): clever. staff . email clever. staff . staff\_id clever. staff . credentials . district\_username clever. school\_admin . email   (outdated) clever. school\_admin . staff\_id (outdated) clever. school\_admin . credentials . district\_username (outdated)
> - District Clever Admins: clever. district\_admin . email
>  
> You’ll notice that users share multiple fields - to match on the same field for multiple user types, you can use ‘any’ in place of the user type to try matching against all user types. > clever. any . email clever. any . sis\_id clever. any . credentials . district\_username
> Applying the claims rules to single sign-on (SSO)
> Click the link below to jump to Instant Login setup for your identity provider! > Active Directory Lenovo Stoneware / webNetwork LDAPS Office 365 / Entra ID

> Warning: Title For App Partners: Navigating the Clever Dashboard URL Name 215800557 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Search 3. Profile and Email settings
> Overview
> From the Clever application dashboard, you can review requests from districts, manage your existing accounts, and troubleshoot issues. > Home: This will display an alphabetical list of the districts currently using your application. You can also search for users or view a district's data warnings. Clever Academy: Here you can access our free online training and certification program, Clever Academy. Alternatively, users can go directly to Clever Academy here: https://clever.academy . Data Browser : View and filter the data being shared with your application. This page aggregates login data from all of your active districts—find out what all the charts mean in this  article . text:
In the Clever Dashboard, the Districts Overview page displays an alert if your application has new requests from districts that would like to connect through Clever.

![Screenshot of District Overview page on Clever Dashboard](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl0000002uan&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl0000044XxZ)

By clicking on *Invited Districts*, you can view more details about these recent requests. District requests are divided into three types:

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl0000002uan&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000286GK)

- **Sales Lead**: These districts may not already use your app, but are interested in connecting through Clever.

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl0000002uan&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000286GP)

- **Existing Customer**: These districts already use your app and have requested to connect through Clever.

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl0000002uan&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000286GZ)

- **Free Trial Request**: This district is interested in a free trial of your app.

By clicking on *Invited Districts*, you can view more details about the districts that *you* have invited to connect with Clever. See our article about [Finding and connecting with districts](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/215120718)  for more information.

You can also click on the district name to view information about that district, as well as a district contact:

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl0000002uan&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000286Ge)

Once you are ready to start receiving data from a district, you can approve their request. The district will need to set sharing permissions for your application if they haven't already.

If you decide not to integrate a district via Clever, click the *Decline Request* button to remove the request from your dashboard. This will send an email to the district with a message explaining the reason you are rejecting the request. This message is required in the message box when you reject a request.

If you are unsure whether or not you will be using Clever to integrate with the district, we recommend that you neither approve nor decline the request until you've settled on next steps.

You can view and filter through your Pending Requests on the District Overview page:

Districts are able to request applications for a future date. That way they can set sharing permissions in preparation for going live. You can set the launch date in your application dashboard by clicking on the hyperlinked district name under Pending Requests on the District Overview page. You are able to insert a date to launch for the district or choose Launch now if you want the district to immediately go live:

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl0000002uan&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000286Gj)

**On the District Overview page you can filter and order districts based on their launch dates:**

heading_path: For App Partners: Verifying district data quality
section: For App Partners: Verifying district data quality
text:
> Warning: Title For App Partners: Verifying district data quality URL Name 215806337 Article Body
>  
> Overview
> Clever has minimum requirements in order to sync a district's data to our system. If your application has additional fields you require (or even prefer), we can flag a district's data with either Data Errors  or Data Warnings. These let a district know their data needs to be further optimized for your application. > To add additional fields to your data errors, or warnings, reach out to Clever Support ! >  
> Data Errors vs Warnings
> Data Errors are fields that don't meet the requirements you specified. Records with data errors won't be sent to your application at all, but they will show up under the Data Errors table in app and district dashboards. Please note: records with Data Errors won't be present in your API responses. Data Warnings are fields that, if missing, will prevent your users from having an optimal experience with your application. > For example, if you prefer student contact information but creating users isn't dependent on these fields being populated, student contact fields will be listed as Data Warnings. > Where to Find Data Warnings/Errors
> From the home page of your Dashboard, click on the name of a school district. Click on the Warnings  tab:
>  
>  
> Types of Data Warnings
> Missing Information  
> Your application requires specific fields to be populated in Clever. Issues related to missing information show the number of records without data in those fields. To resolve these issues, the district must update its data to include the missing values. They'll need to input the missing data into their student information system (SIS). If the school uses a manual SFTP or SIS-Managed sync, they'll need to work with their SIS to ensure that the data is exported as part of the CSV files they're sending to Clever.

title: For App Partners: Verifying district data quality
heading_path: For App Partners: Verifying district data quality
section: For App Partners: Verifying district data quality
text:
If they utilize a Clever-Managed Auto Sync, they can contact Clever Support for assistance with adding fields missing from their sync. > Non-unique Information  
> Issues related to non-unique information will be listed in Data Warnings for the fields below. The issue will include every record that shares each non-unique field value. For example, users with duplicate usernames. To resolve these issues, the school will need to update data in its SIS to provide a unique value for each record. Once the data is updated in their SIS and syncs to Clever, the error or warning will resolve. > Resolving Data Warnings
> To download details about a district's data warnings click on the Download  hyperlink next to the number of affected records:  
> For schools to resolve data warnings they will usually need to make changes directly in their SIS. >   Please note: For a school to resolve a data warning or error, they'll need to make updates in their student information system (SIS). The error or warning will resolve once they edit data in their SIS and it syncs to Clever. If a school is missing a data field entirely and uses a manual SFTP or SIS-Managed sync, they'll need to work with their SIS directly to add fields to the CSV files they are sending to Clever. If they use a Clever-Managed Auto Sync, they can contact Clever Support to explore options for adding additional fields to their sync. >  
> If you have any questions about helping resolve data warnings for a specific school, please  contact Clever Support!

title: For App Partners: Transferring existing districts to Clever
heading_path: For App Partners: Transferring existing districts to Clever
section: For App Partners: Transferring existing districts to Clever
text:
> Tip: Title For App Partners: Transferring existing districts to Clever URL Name 215806767 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Matchmaker 3. How it works 4. Input CSV guidelines 5. Output CSV format 6. Privacy
> Overview
> This article will go over how to convert your existing district customer accounts to Clever user accounts and includes information on our Matchmaker tool, as well as CSV file formatting and guidelines. >  
> Matchmaker
> When converting your existing district customers to Clever user accounts, you'll need to match your existing records to records in Clever. Doing this preserves historical data and ensures that records are not deleted and then re-created. > Clever's Matchmaker is a tool that takes records from your application and matches them with records in Clever. You can access Matchmaker by logging into your Clever dashboard and clicking Matchmaker  on the left menu bar. >  
> Please note: Matchmaker is currently only enabled for applications that support Secure Sync since it requires access to full district records. >  
> How it works
> A district authorizes your application through Clever and shares records. You upload a CSV with your existing student, teacher, admin, school, or section/enrollment records. Clever's Matchmaker matches the records you uploaded with the records shared with your application in Clever. Clever emails you a CSV with a list of both matched records and a list of unmatched records. >  
> Input CSV guidelines
> When creating an input CSV to upload to Clever's Matchmaker, follow the guidelines below to help produce accurate matches. Use this example CSV  as a guide.

title: For App Partners: Transferring existing districts to Clever
heading_path: For App Partners: Transferring existing districts to Clever
section: For App Partners: Transferring existing districts to Clever
text:
> It must be a valid CSV file (in accordance with RFC 4180 )—that means:
> Every row should have the same number of columns, separated by commas Any values with commas in them should be surrounded by a matching set of quotes
> It must contain a column header for each field It should contain as many fields as possible—the more information you provide about each record, the better chance it will have of being matched It must contain a unique internal identifier for each record—you should use this identifier to associate matched records with the original accounts in your application It should contain exactly one record for each user—if a user has multiple accounts in your application, please choose one to match with Clever since duplicate records will not be matched
>  
> Output CSV format
> Clever's Matchmaker outputs a CSV containing all of the fields from your input CSV, including additional identifying fields from Clever:  
> Column headers for your input fields will begin with app  (e.g. app.email ) Column headers for Clever fields will begin with clever  (e.g. clever.id ) The matchmaker\_results column will contain a string telling you whether or not the record was matched. There are five possible values for this column:
> match:  The record was matched from app, no match:  The record from your application could not be matched to any record in Clever from app, duplicate: The record from your application was a duplicate of another record in your application. To match these records, we recommend you pick one record to serve as the representative for all groups of duplicate records, remove the rest, and re-run Matchmaker. from Clever, no match:  The record in Clever could not be matched to any record from your application from Clever, duplicate: The record from Clever was a duplicate of another record from Clever. To match these records, you may need to work with the district and Clever Support to clean up their data.

> Once you receive your matching output, you can associate the matched records in your application with the corresponding Clever ID (found in the clever.id column). >  
> Privacy
> Matchmaker will only match application records against district records that have been shared with your application in Clever. Matchmaker input and output CSVs are purged from Clever's system 30 days after upload. > If you have further questions about Clever's Matchmaker, please submit a ticket to our support team.

title: Single sign-on (SSO): Configure a SAML-based IDP for access to Clever
heading_path: Single sign-on (SSO): Configure a SAML-based IDP for access to Clever
section: Single sign-on (SSO): Configure a SAML-based IDP for access to Clever
text:
> Tip: Title Single sign-on (SSO): Configure a SAML-based IDP for access to Clever URL Name 218050687 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Requirements 3. Next Steps
> Overview
> You can add any SAML connection as an identity provider (IdP) into Clever! We offer support for Active Directory Federation Services ( AD and Entra ID ), Okta, and Rapid ID . However, any SAML connection can be created by following the same steps outlined in this article. Clever only supports one SAML IdP setup per account. >  
> Requirements
> Here's what your Identity Provider (IDP) must have:   
> Support for SP-initiated sign on using a Redirect Binding Response must be sent to a specified POST Binding ( https://clever.com/oauth/ saml /assert ) Response must contain an assertion encrypted using Clever's public key (found in the metadata file) The assertion must be signed with a private key owned by the IDP The assertion must contain an AuthnStatement with a SessionIndex The assertion must contain at least one attribute which can uniquely identify a Clever user Multiple attributes are allowed and only one needs to match a user, but only one user must be matched. Attributes should be in the form clever.[user type].[field] and contain the field they wish to match on. > For example, an attribute with the name clever.student.sis\_id with a value of 12345 will attempt to find a student with the SIS ID of 12345. A user type of 'any' may be used to match both students and teachers with the same field. > A LogoutRequest must be accepted at a Redirect Binding. The LogoutResponse should be sent to the specified HTTP-Redirect Binding ( https://clever.com/oauth/ saml /assert ) There cannot be a trailing whitespace or a newline at the start and end of the certificate. >  
> Please note: Clever doesn't have insight into the configurations or set-up steps that allow your IDP to meet the above requirements for custom SAML connections.

title: Single sign-on (SSO): Configure a SAML-based IDP for access to Clever
heading_path: Single sign-on (SSO): Configure a SAML-based IDP for access to Clever
section: Single sign-on (SSO): Configure a SAML-based IDP for access to Clever
text:
You can find more information here:  Single Sign-On (SSO): Identity Provider (IDP)/Login Method Options
> Next Steps
> Once you have verified the above requirements and have either the URL or .xml file, you can navigate to your Clever Dashboard > Authentication > SSO settings . > Click Add Login Method in the top right corner, then select SAML Authentication . This will allow for a SAML connection to Clever. >  
> Input your metadata URL in the text box. > Select your Identity Provider from the dropdown. If your Identity Provider is not available, select SAML IdP . >  
> Select Save . To finish the setup process:
> Go to your Clever Dashboard > Authentication > SSO settings > Customize tab  and customize your login screen by clicking on the gray pencil icons. Add the Tech Support Contact details for the person that students and teachers should reach out to if they have trouble logging in to Clever; this should be someone who can help them reset their credentials and/or make sure they are shared with the application they’re trying to access through Clever. Add any login hints for your login methods (e.g., if you’re using one login method for students and one for teachers). >  
>  
> You should now be set up! Try a few logins and see if you run into any issues. If you have questions about this process, please contact our  support team.

title: SFTP Syncs: Troubleshooting CSV formatting errors
heading_path: SFTP Syncs: Troubleshooting CSV formatting errors
section: SFTP Syncs: Troubleshooting CSV formatting errors
text:
> Note: Title SFTP Syncs: Troubleshooting CSV formatting errors URL Name 218518698 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Error codes 3. Trailing commas 4. Extra commas in field values 5. Leading zeros
>  
> Overview
> When you upload a CSV that contains one or more errors, you’ll see error messages in Clever. This article runs through errors and how to fix them for both automated SFTP and manual CSV uploads. When uploading data on the Data sources > SIS sync > Upload page, you’ll see the errors listed shortly after uploading the CSV file(s). You can find Clever's CSV file templates here . > Please note: If you want to download the most recent CSV files uploaded to Clever, you can do so at the Clever Dashboard > SIS sync > Last Attempted Sync page. Learn more here ! >   When errors occur from an SFTP sync, you’ll see the errors listed in the Status section on the Clever Dashboard > Data sources > SIS sync page. > One way to avoid some common errors is to understand how your files work together. This graphic is helpful to explain this:    
> Please note: To avoid CSV formatting errors, we recommend exporting data from your SIS directly in CSV format, and uploading those files directly to Clever without manipulating them. Excel is commonly used to view CSV files, but it often imposes formatting that skews data and results in SFTP upload errors. For error-free viewing and saving of CSV files, we recommend using an application built for CSV compatibility, such as CSVEdit, Sublime Text, Apache OpenOffice, TextEdit, or Notepad. >  
> Error codes and how to handle them
> The table below lists the errors you may see when you run into an SFTP error and how to resolve the errors. > Of note, it is common for schools to see specific data errors on the Last Attempted Sync page, and these errors do not need to be fully resolved for the Clever sync to continue operating.

title: SFTP Syncs: Troubleshooting CSV formatting errors
heading_path: SFTP Syncs: Troubleshooting CSV formatting errors
section: SFTP Syncs: Troubleshooting CSV formatting errors
text:
These errors indicate a specific record that failed to sync to Clever, and as long as these errors are not directly impacting user access or applications it is typically safe to ignore these errors. Error counts may change and resolve over time as data changes in your SIS throughout the school year. >  
> - Error:: Step(s) to take:
> - The following required file is missing: [file]: Upload the required missing file(s). > - The following required file is empty: [file]: Ensure the file(s) in question contain the required data. The file should have a row of headers followed by at least one row of data. See the SFTP spec for the list of required data. > - The following required file contains no data: [file]: Ensure the file(s) in question contain the required data. The file should have a row of headers followed by at least one row of data. See the SFTP spec for the list of required data. > - The following file is missing required headers: [file] [missing header]: Double-check the file(s) have the missing header(s). See the SFTP spec for the list of required headers. > - The following file includes unsupported headers: [file] [incorrect header]: Double-check the header(s) in the file(s) are spelled correctly and do not contain any characters other than letters. See the SFTP spec  for the list of supported headers. > - The headers in the following file could not be parsed: [file]: Check that the file is in CSV format. > - The following file includes missing commas: [file] [lines]: Ensure there are no missing commas in the file. > - The following file includes extra commas: [file] [line]: Ensure there are no extra commas. Jump to this section for more information. > - The following file is missing required values: [file] [column header] [line]: Add required value(s) for files. > - The following students are in the enrollments.csv but missing from the students.csv: [student\_id]: Add respective students to the students.csv file.

title: SFTP Syncs: Troubleshooting CSV formatting errors
heading_path: SFTP Syncs: Troubleshooting CSV formatting errors
section: SFTP Syncs: Troubleshooting CSV formatting errors
text:
> - The following sections are in the sections.csv but missing from the enrollments.csv: [section\_id]: Add respective sections to the enrollments.csv file. > - The following teachers are in the sections.csv but missing from the teachers.csv: [teacher\_id]: Add respective teachers to the teachers.csv file. > - The following schools are in the students.csv but missing from the schools.csv: [school\_id]: Add respective schools to the schools.csv file. > - The following schools are in the teachers.csv but missing from the schools.csv: [school\_id]: Add respective schools to the schools.csv file. > - The following schools are in the sections.csv but missing from the schools.csv: [school\_id]: Add respective schools to the schools.csv file. > - The following schools are in the enrollments.csv but missing from the schools.csv: [school\_id]: Add respective schools to the schools.csv file. > - The following schools are in the admins.csv but missing from the schools.csv: [school\_id]: Add respective schools to the schools.csv file. > - The following students are in the guardians.csv but missing from the students.csv: [student\_id]: Add respective students to the students.csv file. >  
> Trailing commas
> Saving an Excel file as a CSV file can create extra commas at the end of each row. Trailing commas can result when columns are deleted or column headers removed. When the file is uploaded to Clever, an extra trailing comma will skew subsequent rows of data, preventing them from being processed. > To identify this issue, we recommend opening the file in a text editor (like Notepad for PC, or TextEdit for Mac). You’ll see trailing commas at the end of each row, like this:  
>  
> Take these steps to resolve the issue:  
> Open a new, blank spreadsheet in Excel. Type in only the column headers for the data you will include in your upload. Save the file as MS-DOS Comma Separated with a new name (e.g., “students2.csv”).

title: SFTP Syncs: Troubleshooting CSV formatting errors
heading_path: SFTP Syncs: Troubleshooting CSV formatting errors
section: SFTP Syncs: Troubleshooting CSV formatting errors
text:
Open the old file (with the extra commas) and copy the rows below the column headers. Paste the rows into the new file under your typed column headers. Save your new file as MS-DOS Comma Separated again. Once you’ve saved the data into the new file, you can close it and rename it to “students.csv” (the required file name for uploading to Clever). >  
> Extra commas in field values
> Your data may sometimes include a comma within a field value (e.g., if a student’s last name is “Potter, Jr.”), and the comma-separated values file will treat the comma as a field separator unless the entire field value is enclosed in double quotation marks. > The following record would NOT be processed to Clever. The three commas in the data row separate that record into four fields, but there are only three fields in the header row. > This record would get skewed to look like this:
>  
> The following record WOULD be processed to Clever. Enclosing the "Potter, Jr." field value in double (straight) quotation marks tells Clever that the entire last name is "Potter, Jr."
>   This record would be processed as:
> Leading zeros
> Numerical values (in fields like ‘school\_id’, ‘student\_id’, and ‘teacher\_id’) often begin with “0”, but Excel removes these leading zeros, which changes the value listed for that field. For example, student\_id “009844” becomes “9844”. When uploaded, Clever no longer recognizes that student: student “009844” is deleted and a new student, “9844”, is created. Once this incorrect data, caused by leading zeros, is uploaded to Clever, it may cause a hold due to changes in data. If the hold is approved, those unique SIS IDs can cause many issues, such as users or sections being re-created and losing their associated historical data in connected apps. If you need to open your CSV file in Excel, import your data as text to avoid dropping leading zeros:  
> In Excel, click Data > Get External Data > Import Text File… Browse to select your CSV file and click  Get Data.

Choose Delimited as the file type and click  Next. Check the “Comma” box as the delimiter and click  Next. Select all columns in the data preview and change their column data format to “Text”. Click  Finish. >  Please note: Leading zeros are not permitted in the "grade" column. Our specifications will error out the value "01" and only accept "1" in the grade field. >

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/219324877?language=en_US#Overview?) 
2. [What if a district wants to add summer school rosters to Clever over the summer?](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/219324877?language=en_US#What if a district wants to add summer school rosters to Clever over the summer?) 
3. [FAQs](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/219324877?language=en_US#FAQs)

title: For App Partners: School year rollovers
heading_path: For App Partners: School year rollovers
text:
Clever auto-schedules SIS "sync pause dates" for all districts at the end of each school year, or districts can choose to customize their own sync pause dates based on their respective school year schedule. Clever provides districts with end-of-year and rollover guides to help them to plan for summer and the new school year rollover. No data from the district's student information system (SIS) will be synced to Clever during a sync pause. Essentially, the data in Clever will be "frozen in time" during the sync pause period. Depending on the district's school year dates, data will typically begin syncing again between August 1st and August 12th.

- **First [Pause] Day**: This will be the first day the district’s sync is paused, which should coincide with the district’s last day of the school year.
- **Last [Pause] Day**: This will be the last day the district’s sync is paused, which should be the day before the district’s SIS data is active for the new school year.

While a district's sync is paused, Clever will not process any data, allowing the district to make rostering changes to their SIS without interrupting student or teacher access to your application(s). The prior school year's data will be "frozen" in Clever for the duration of the district's pause, allowing the previous school year's users to continue logging into your application without disruption.

While pausing a sync prevents SIS-synced data from processing in a district's Clever account and, therefore, updating in their applications, Clever does provide the ability for Clever Admins to create custom data directly from their [Clever Dashboard > Data sources > Custom data](https://schools.clever.com/custom-data) page during a sync pause. This includes custom students, teachers, staff (i.e., school admins), and sections. Custom Data is the method we recommend to districts who would like to continue adding data to Clever during a sync pause.

For more information, please visit: [Custom Data: Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360035757332?language=en_US)

title: For App Partners: School year rollovers
heading_path: For App Partners: School year rollovers
text:
**How can we see a district’s pause dates?**

Check out a district’s modal on the District Overview page of your Clever Dashboard to view their school year and pause dates!

**Can districts still adjust their sharing permissions while their sync is paused?**

Yes!

**What does it mean when a district’s sync pause ends?**

Clever will resume the district's scheduled syncs with their student information system (SIS). Each SIS handles rollover differently, so we encourage districts to check out their SIS-specific information. Districts can learn more about school year rollover [here](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/202118886?language=en_US). Once a district's pause has ended and the data for the new school year has synced to Clever, their sync will be placed on an automatic hold, allowing Clever Admins the opportunity to review the data updates before the changes process in Clever. Once reviewed, the district can submit a request to release the sync hold from their [Clever Dashboard > Data sources > SIS sync](https://schools.clever.com/sync) page. Please note that if the changes are above a certain threshold, a ticket will then be created with Clever Support to review the changes before the sync hold is officially released. This is an added security precaution to ensure massive amounts of data changes do not impact connected applications until they have been thoroughly reviewed by a district's Clever Admin and Clever Support.

**What should we do if we need to offer summer school access?**

Have the district contact Clever Support to determine the best way for them to sync summer school data with your application.

**What does it mean for a district to be syncing over the summer?**

Clever will continue to sync their data throughout the summer for districts that opt out of using Clever's pause feature. However, during this time, applications will likely see a decrease in the number of students, teachers, staff (i.e., school admins), and sections syncing from Clever.

title: For App Partners: School year rollovers
heading_path: For App Partners: School year rollovers
text:
**How can we ensure our districts are ready for the new school year?**

We encourage districts to check 3-4 things once their pause has ended to confirm they’re ready for the new school year:

1. Browse their data from their [Clever Dashboard](https://schools.clever.com/) > [Data browser](https://schools.clever.com/browser) in Clever to check that the new school year's rostering data looks correct.
2. Review the sharing permissions for each connected application to ensure they are correct.
3. Review their section\_ids to confirm that the ID #s for sections (the section\_id field in Clever) are different after a term or school year rollover. We ask districts do this because Clever 'remembers' the sections that have been deleted based on their section\_ids changing.
4. If applicable, we ask Clever Admins to review their Clever Badges to ensure they are ready for the new school year.

---

**Related articles:**

- [For Clever Admins: Sync Holds](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202494358?language=en_US)
- [Summer School: Sync settings](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360027745731?language=en_US)
- [For Clever Admins: Troubleshooting Tools - How do I browse district data in Clever?](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/202483068?language=en_US)
- [School Year Rollover: Overview, Preparation & Recommendations](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/202118886?language=en_US)

title: Clever Badges: Overview and setup
text:
> Warning: Title Clever Badges: Overview and setup URL Name 220213907 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Setup Requirements & Instructions 3. Generating & Printing Clever Badges 4. Logging in with Clever Badges 5. Voiding Badges 6. Badge Invalidation 7. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
>  
> Overview
> With Clever Badges, districts can allow students to use a physical Badge to log in to Clever without needing to enter login credentials (i.e., a username and password). Instead, students can simply hold their Clever Badge up to their device webcam to be logged in automatically. By default, Clever Badges are intended for younger students or those with special needs. However, if your district would prefer to use Badges for older students as well, please visit this article for information on setting up Badges that include pin requirements:  Clever Badges: How do I manage Badge PINs? Please check out the following short video to see how Clever Badges can save both teachers and students time in the classroom! UI is outdated. >  
> This article is to help you set up your Clever Badges. If you need help troubleshooting an issue, please see the following:
> Clever Badges: How do I troubleshoot issues with Badges into Chromebooks? Single Sign-On (SSO): Chromebooks - Setup & Troubleshooting
>  
> Setup Requirements & Instructions 
> Setup Requirements
> You will need the following items for the implementation and use of Badges:
> Compatible devices and/or internet browsers:
> Chromebooks iOS devices (e.g., iPads, iPhones) Windows devices Browsers : Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge, and Internet Explorer (2013 or later) Android devices with a webcam and a compatible mobile browser: Chrome, Firefox, Edge, or Internet Explorer
> A printer to print physical Badges on paper or labels Computers and devices with webcams
> Please note that any variation of webcams will work as long as they are compatible with student devices.

title: Clever Badges: Overview and setup
text:
>   This video is incredibly helpful for helping you set up Clever Badges for your schools. >  
> Setup Instructions
> To begin, on your Clever Dashboard, please navigate to Clever Dashboard > Authentication > Badges > Settings tab. Under the  Access  box, click Edit
> Step 1: Specify students 
> Please begin by choosing which grade levels and students you would like to enable for Badges. The drop-down menu will allow you to select specific grades. Clever will also  automatically provide you with the option to include students with  IEPs or students who are ELL . > Please note that Clever will automatically invalidate badges as students age out of their district’s policy. For example, if badges are enabled for Grade 2 and below, once a student is promoted from 2nd grade to 3rd grade, their badge will be invalidated. > Step 2: Add Schools
> You can now choose all schools or the specific schools you would like to enable for Badges, which will work in conjunction with the student grade settings you selected in the first step. Once done, select Save  to generate your student Badges! >    
> Generating & printing Clever Badges
>  
> Clever Tip: If Badges aren't available to print for a school or grade level, navigate to Clever Dashboard > Authentication > Badges > Settings tab > Access box   and confirm if Badges are enabled for the correct school and grade levels. >  
> Please note: Badges printed to PDF will match the Avery label template size for 2” square Avery labels  perfectly! Additionally, printing Badges on sticky labels is a great way to ensure students don't lose them, which is more likely to occur when printed on paper. Clever also highly recommends providing students with Badge holders such as those seen  here . > Generating and printing Badges in bulk
> By navigating to Clever Dashboard > Authentication > Badges , you can select to download the Badges for individual schools, multiple schools, or all enabled schools.

title: Clever Badges: Overview and setup
text:
Clever Admins can choose to download active Badges or those that are associated with new users who have never had Badges generated previously. >  
> Depending on the file size, Clever will either download the Badges directly to your computer or email you a secure .zip file  that can be downloaded to your desktop if the file exceeds our standard download limitations. The file will contain the following:
> Folders with the names of each school 
> Subfolders with student Badges by grade level, including the Badge QR codes and names of each student. > PDF of the grade level Badges PNG images of Badges
> Subfolders with student Badges by sections (i.e., courses/classes), including the Badge QR codes and names of each student. > PDF of the grade level Badges PNG images of Badges
>  
> Generating Individual Student Badges
> Badges can also be generated or voided on a per-student basis. To do this, please begin by searching for the student using the Clever Dashboard search bar or by navigating to the Clever Dashboard > Data browser > Students tab . Once you've located the student's record to access their profile page, select  Support Tools in the top right to void their Badge or generate a new one. > Please note: If the option to void or generate a Badge isn't available for a student, the student isn't included in the scope specified when you or another admin set up Clever Badges. > Badge pins can also be updated from a student's profile page in Clever. For more information, please visit:  Clever Badges: How do I manage Badge PINs? > Logging in with Clever Badges
> Below is the expected login flow for a student using their Badge to authenticate with Clever:
> The student will navigate to either  clever.com/badges  or the district's custom Clever login page . Clever Badges are designed to be used directly with Clever, and a QR reader won't log you in to Clever. They will select the Clever Badge login option.

title: Clever Badges: Overview and setup
text:
If they haven't previously provided access, they will be prompted to allow Clever access to their device camera so they can scan their Badge. At this point, their webcam will activate so they can hold their Badge up to the camera. Once Clever's sensors recognize the Badge, the user will see a green check mark and be logged in successfully. > Please note that if the student sees a red X, their Badge login was unsuccessful. >  
> Please note: Clever Badges are an independent login method, separate from other login methods such as Google, Active Directory, and Clever Passwords, which means Clever does not have access to your students' login credentials for alternative Identity Providers (IdPs). Please get in touch with your district's tech support for issues with student usernames and passwords. >  
> Voiding Badges
> Clever Badges can be voided and regenerated if needed. If a student loses their Badge, the best practice would be to direct them to immediately reach out to their teacher, IT support, or a Clever Admin. The missing Badge should be voided to protect the student's information. After you void a badge, you can issue a new one. Voiding Clever Badges is a safeguard for protecting students. Therefore, this isn't a feature that can be disabled. Clever Badges are comparable to a student's login credentials. If their login credentials or Clever Badge are compromised, they should be reset. To void a student's Clever Badge, Clever Admins can navigate to the student's profile page using the Clever Search bar at the top of the Clever Dashboard . Choose the Support Tools option to the right of the page to void the student's Badge. A new Badge can also be generated from the Support Tools menu. > Clever Badges can also be voided in bulk for district school locations by navigating to Clever Dashboard > Authentication > Badges . Once voided, new Badges can be generated.

title: Clever Badges: Overview and setup
text:
> Badge Invalidation
> Beginning January 1, 2025, you will see expiration dates on any newly created or reprinted existing Badges. By default, all existing Badges will expire on December 31, 2025, and new Badges will be valid for 365 days from the creation date . Clever recommends that you void and reprint Badges during your annual rollover period, such as the summer or winter. See this article for more information. > While we recommend that administrators manage the yearly Badge refresh, if you don’t void and reprint Badges during a rollover, and a student’s Badge is nearing its expiration date, the teacher will receive a warning in their Clever Portal that the student’s Badge is expiring soon. The teacher will have the ability to void and create a new Badge via their Portal to refresh the expiration date. > Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
> I downloaded a set of Badges, and there are some Badges missing. What do I do? > If you're noticing there are students missing a Badge in your download, make sure to double-check that they meet the criteria you set in your Badge settings . Once you've confirmed the students meet the criteria, you can download the new Badges for these students. > Our school district is changing SISs; do we need to create new Clever Badges? > If the students' SIS IDs aren't changing, then you don't need to create new Badges. This is because Clever Badges are tied to the students' Clever ID, which is created based on the SIS ID. So, if the SIS ID doesn't change, the Clever ID won't change, and there's no need to create new Badges. Keep in mind that students in custom sections will need to have Badges generated individually. > How do I download a Badge for a custom section? > Students in custom sections will need to have Badges generated individually. >  
> Looking for additional support setting up the Clever Portal?

Check out our Clever Academy Quick Start - Setting up your Portal course
>

> For School Tech Leads: Badges For Teachers: Clever Badges for students How to download a Clever Badge as a parent/guardian Clever Badges: How do I troubleshoot issues with Badges into Chromebooks? Single Sign-on (SSO): multiple IDPs for Google Workspace

text:
> Tip: Title For App Partners: What is single sign-on (SSO)? URL Name 221208767 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. How does single sign-on (SSO) work? 2. How do users log into the IdP? 3. Logging in to Clever 4. Logging in to your App 5. T roubleshooting
>  
> Single sign-on (SSO) allows students and teachers to log in to your application through Clever. This means that as an application partner, you support every Identity Provider (IdP) that Clever supports! > How does single sign-on (SSO) work? > While users may see logging into your application to Clever as one quick step, behind the scenes, single sign-on (SSO) actually consists of three separate logins:
> A user logs in to Clever via the district's Identity Provider (IDP) (e.g. Active Directory, Google, etc.) from the Clever login page. Clever authenticates the user through the district's IDP. If the user is verified, Clever creates a "token" (i.e. a piece of data) that identifies the user and then logs them in successfully. The user then clicks on the appropriate application icon to open an application, and Clever provides the user's token to the application which authenticates the user. This means the user does not need to enter login credentials a second time. The user is logged into the application successfully! > How do users log into the IdP? > When users access the Clever Portal or an Instant Login Link, they’ll be taken to their district’s login page. When they click on one of the “Log in with <IdP>” buttons, they’ll be redirected to their identity provider to log in. >  
> If users are already logged into their IdP, they will not need to log in again - they’ll skip right to the “Logging in with Clever” step. > Please note: If a district's IdP for Clever is LDAPS, a user is authenticated to Active Directory locally, and their district’s chosen identity provider is LDAPS, they will need to enter in their Active Directory credentials to log in to Clever.

This is a limitation of the LDAP protocol. >  
> Can users skip the 'Log in with IdP' page? > Users can skip this page by appending
> ‘?skip’
> to the end of the Clever Portal or Instant Login Link URL (ex. https://clever.com/in/<shortname>?skip ). > Please note: The above is for districts with a single IdP. If a district has multiple IdPs, they should  contact Clever Support. >  
> Logging in to Clever
> Once the user is logged into their IdP, it will securely send a piece of identifying information to Clever and tells us what that data should match in our records. This is generally non-PII information such as student number, sis id, or email. More information on this can be found in our article on Claims Rules . > Please note: The identifying information that we receive is never the users' IdP credentials. >  
> Logging in to your App
> The user can then log in to your application by clicking on the icon in their Clever Portal (or if they’re using Instant Login links, they’ll automatically start the login process). > Instant Login uses the OAuth2, an open standard for securely accessing information. Here’s how it works:  
> Clever redirects the user to a special URL for your application, along with a code. Your application automatically uses the code to ask Clever for a token that grants additional access to our API. Clever checks the code and the application credentials to make sure they are valid before returning an API token. Your application uses the API token to get basic information about the user - at the very least, it will get the district id, user Clever id, and user type. Depending on your implementation, your app may then search for the user in your existing database and/or provision an account for the user. >  
> Troubleshooting
> While it looks simple to the end user, there’s definitely a lot of moving parts! For help with login issues, check out our Troubleshooting Resources.

> Note: Title For App Partners: Common Single sign-on (SSO) issues URL Name 221231247 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 1. Triaging Login Issues 2. Logging into an IdP 3. Issues Logging in to Clever 4. Issues Logging in to Your Application
>  
> Overview
> As mentioned in our article on  For App Partners: What is single sign-on (SSO)? , SSO has many moving parts, which means many things can cause logins to fail. This article will help you navigate these issues and get your users logged in quickly and efficiently! >  
> Triaging Login Issues
> First, we’ll want to narrow down where the issue is. > What are the exact steps the user is taking to log in? > Are they logging in with SSO or app-specific credentials (or are they entering credentials for one method into the other’s login page)? This step allows us to check the user is attempting to use Clever correctly. The correct login flows are:  
> Clever Portal
> Go to the Clever Portal URL for your district ( https://clever.com/in/<shortname> ). Click the “Log in with <Identity Provider (IdP)>” button. Enter in their IdP credentials. They’ll see a loading screen with a book, followed by the Clever Portal. > Instant Login Links
> Click on the link provided by the district. Click the “Log in with <IdP>” button Enter in their IdP credentials. They’ll see a loading screen with a book, followed by your application’s page. > Log in with Clever Button
> Click on the "Log in with Clever" Button. Enter the name of your school in the search. Click the “Log in with <IdP> button.” Enter in their IdP credentials. They’ll see a loading screen with a book, followed by your application’s page. > Are they seeing any error messages? > Error messages can help determine at which login stage the issue is occurring. Clever error messages look like this:
> We’ll go into specific error messages below. As part of the troubleshooting process, we recommend providing screenshots of any errors.

title: For App Partners: Common Single sign-on (SSO) issues
heading_path: For App Partners: Common Single sign-on (SSO) issues
section: For App Partners: Common Single sign-on (SSO) issues
text:
>  
> Logging into an IdP
> If a user is having issues logging in to their Identity provider (IdP), they should contact their district support contact. The user can find the contact information on their portal login page. You can also see the contact in their SSO Settings. To see their settings, click on the district in your  Dashboard . The SSO info for each district will be available on the Overview page. > Here are some common issues in this category:
>  
> Incorrect Portal
> Sometimes, your Clever users, especially young students using  Log in with Clever buttons, will end up at a different district's Portal URL and won't be able to log in. To ensure they’re using the correct Portal URL, have them check the district's name at the top of the page. Does it match their district's name? If not, you can provide them with their Portal URL or have them click the Not your district  button to try their search again. > Invalid SSO link
> SSO links are great for embedding in district portals or distributing as bookmarks! However, sometimes, these URLs are incorrectly added. The correct format is https://clever.com/oauth/instant-login?client\_id=<your client id>&district\_id=<district id>
> “Not successfully authenticated by your identity provider”
> This error occurs when the IdP sends us a code representing a login failure. Although it is relatively rare, we have noticed that most cases are caused by saved/cached passwords in Google Chrome . Clearing the browser history usually resolves this issue. > Incorrect Username / Password
> If the user can't log in with their credentials, direct them to their district support contact, who should be able to help them get their correct credentials. > Please note:  Clever cannot provide users with their credentials or reset passwords for users. >  
> Issues Logging in to Clever
> Once the user successfully logs into their IdP, the IdP attempts to send information to Clever and find a matching user.

text:
If we find a match, we’ll log the user in. The two most common login issues are listed below. If you see something else, direct the user to their district support contact, who will work with Clever to resolve the issue. > Not Authorized
> Some IdPs, like Google and Canvas, require the user to allow Clever to receive identifying information such as email addresses. If the user does not grant Clever access, we can't log them in. The user will need to log in again and authorize the data access. > Unable to find Matching User
> The majority of login issues stem from missing data in Clever; either the user needs to be synced with Clever, or their record needs to include the identifying information needed to make a match with their IdP data. > If the IdP setup is misconfigured, this error can also occur. We recommend directing the user to their district support contact for further investigation. >  
> Issues Logging in to your Application
> If the user is able to log in to their IdP and Clever but isn’t able to log in to your application, this usually suggests that something has interrupted the OAuth2 flow. Clever has provided the ability to replicate the login flow from Clever to your application in the Clever Dashboard. To recreate the login error: 
> Select the district for the user. Search for the user reporting the error. Verify the user is shared by the district. Click on the name of the user to load their  Detail View . Select Log in as [student name]  to test the connection with your app. > If the login to your application fails, this suggests that something has interrupted the OAuth2 flow. Here are the most common issues:
> App Icon Missing / “Ask your administrator to add this app to your Portal”
> Users can only log in to applications if their data is shared with the application. If their data isn't shared, the app icon won't appear in the Portal, and they will see the above error if they attempt to use an SSO link or Log in with Clever button.

title: For Teachers: What's Clever?
text:
Title

For Teachers: What's Clever?

URL Name

222633468

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/222633468?language=en_US#header1) 
2. [What is Clever?](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/222633468?language=en_US#header2) 
3. [How can I sign up for Clever?](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/222633468?language=en_US#header3)

![Clever Academy.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000DsSP&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000035fcv) 
Getting started with the Clever? Check out our course [**Clever Academy for Teachers: Level 1**](https://clever.academy/level-1-getting-started-with-clever?user_type=teacher) available in Clever Academy!

This article provides general information on what Clever is and how you can sign up to use Clever in your classroom.

---

Clever is your school’s digital learning platform, one friendly place for resources, communication, and instruction.

There are three core features to Clever:

- Single sign-on (SSO)
- Rostering of programs
- Clever Portal

title: For Teachers: What's Clever?
text:
Clever includes **single sign-on (SSO)**, meaning you and your students can log into hundreds of programs, or apps, just by logging into Clever.

![Single Sign on graphic showing steps to use SSO](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000DsSP&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000EhNqv)  
*How single sign-on (SSO) works: You and students sign in to Clever, then have one-click access to your apps!*

For instance, you and students can securely sign into popular apps like Newsela, Flocabulary, Khan Academy, NoRedInk, XtraMath, and thousands of others, simply by logging in to Clever! Best yet: it works the same at school and at home.

No more saving lists of passwords for every single program you use—just sign into Clever!

Using Clever, you can also log your entire class in (or out) of a specific app, saving time when you want to get students going on an app.

title: For Teachers: What's Clever?
text:
Clever connects your school’s student information system (SIS), like PowerSchool or Infinite Campus, with thousands of edtech programs, or apps, to share data and support SSO.

So, all of your students are automatically added to the apps you use every day. Yup, your programs are automatically rostered! And if a student leaves your class or is added, we’ll automatically update your roster overnight.

![Graphic showing the three steps of how rostering works](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000DsSP&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000EgbSw)  
*How rostering works with Clever: Your sections (like ELA Period 2 or Music Class) are sent to Clever, which shares them with your apps.*

You don’t need to worry about rostering—your district handles that! If you ever notice a student isn’t in a section in Clever, you should reach out to your IT folks to make sure that the student is being shared with Clever.

You’ll access all of your apps via Clever Portal, which gives students, teachers, and staff a personalized page to securely log in to all their digital resources. Think of Clever Portal as your digital classroom: where you and students can find all of your apps, along with any other resource you want to add.

![Clever Portal](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000DsSP&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl0000049pXG)  
*An example Clever Portal!*

Under the District Page tab, you’ll see any apps your district has added for you and your students to access.

---

Clever is managed at the district level. To create and administer a Clever account, you need administrative access to your Student Information System (SIS) and authority to sign Clever’s [Terms of Service](https://clever.com/about/terms).

Teachers typically have insufficient SIS access to set up a Clever account. Therefore, we recommend reaching out to a colleague at the district level for assistance! Please feel free to send them this article: [How do I sign up for Clever?](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202083506)

text:
> Tip: Title For Teachers: Troubleshooting - Student logins URL Name 222933888 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Backup Login Codes 3. Problem logging into Clever 4. Problem logging into an app 5. Clever Badges 6. Reset a student's password 7. Logging out 8. How do I get help? >  
> Overview
> First, please ensure the student is using a Clever-compatible device. Clever's system requirements can be found here . > If your student is using a compatible device or browser and is receiving an error when attempting to log in to Clever, please ensure they are listed in your roster by navigating to My Students > Student Roster in your Clever Portal. This is to confirm the student has an active record in Clever. If the student is missing, please see this article . >  
> Looking for additional support on quickly getting up to speed on Clever? Check out our  Clever Academy Quick Start videos
>    
> Backup Login Codes
> Backup codes are temporary codes that allow students to log in to Clever when their login credentials are not working. These codes can be generated multiple times per day by various teachers, ensuring the student can log in continually until the primary login issue is resolved. Backup codes expire after 15 minutes , therefore the student does need to log in before the expiration time, or another backup code will need to be generated. >     To generate a backup code:
> From your Clever Portal, click the My Students drop-down on the left-hand side and select Student Roster     Select the class the student is in from the Filter by class drop-down Locate the student record from the list and click Get backup login code on the right-hand side
> A seven-digit backup code will be provided. Write this code down and pass it along securely to your student. The code will expire in 15 minutes . >  
> Clever Tip: Want a downloadable PDF for backup login code instructions? Find it in the work aid section here .

title: For Teachers: Troubleshooting - Student logins
text:
>  
> How does a student log in using a Backup Code? > The student will go to your district's Clever Portal login page and select Get help logging in! They will then select Students: Log in with a Backup Code            They will enter the backup code, and select Log in. >           
>   For more information on  login errors , please see For Teachers: How do I troubleshoot logging into the Clever Portal? >  
> Problem logging into Clever
> Login errors can occur for several reasons. The most common issues are:
> The student inputs the incorrect login credentials The  student doesn't have an account in Clever There is an issue with the district's login setup
>  
> If a student is having difficulty logging in with their credentials, i n the short term, you can log your student in using a Clever  backup code . However, for third-party accounts (Active Directory, Entra ID, or Google, your school may have enabled it so that you can reset the student's password. Please learn more here: For Teachers: How to reset passwords for yourself and students . > If your student receives a login error and your district's login method is Clever Passwords (i.e. 'Log in with Clever'), please ensure the student is using the correct credentials. If you have confirmed they are using the correct credentials but the login is still unsuccessful, you may be able to  reset their password  if your district has enabled teachers to do so. > If you do not have the ability to reset the student's password, please have them log in to Clever using a  backup code , and  contact your   district's technology support contact directly for assistance with the login issue. > Clever Tip: Your district may have login hints viewable from your district's Clever login page. If so, these may help you determine what credentials your students should be using to log in to Clever. >  
> Problem logging into an app
> If a student is encountering an error when trying to access an application, please see this article .

title: For Teachers: Troubleshooting - Student logins
text:
>  
> Clever Badges
> Badges allow students to hold up a physical badge to their device's webcam to get logged in, instead of typing in login credentials. Teachers get more time to teach and students get more time to learn! Please note, that Badges must be enabled by your district before they can be used. > For information and instructions, please visit:
> For Teachers: What are Clever Badges? For Teachers: How do I print Clever Badges? >  
> Reset a student's password
> If your district's students see an option that says Log in with Clever or a third-party account such as Active Directory, Entra ID, or Google on their Clever login screen, like the screenshot below, you may be able to reset your student’s password. >  
>   You can only reset students' passwords if your  district has enabled it for teachers. To learn more about resetting passwords, check out this article: For Teachers: How to reset passwords for yourself and students . > Logging out
> To log out of Clever, navigate to the Clever Portal,  hover over your name in the top-right corner, and click Log out . >  
> Users are also logged out of Clever automatically after: 
> 24 hours of inactivity  The browser is  quit (e.g. "Quit Google Chrome " ). Closing the browser window won't log the user out of Clever. >   How do I get help? > L ogin credentials for Clever are managed by the school district. If you are unsure of your login credentials or receive an error, please reach out to your district support contact or the district's help desk for assistance. > You can find your district's technology support contact information on the Clever login screen. In most cases, districts provide an email address, phone number, or instructions guiding users to the appropriate contact person or department for assistance. >
