title: Single Sign-On (SSO): Chromebooks - Troubleshooting
text:
This article has troubleshooting tips for common Chromebooks setup issues and provides Clever Admins with a brief overview of how Clever can be used to simplify Google Chromebook logins for your end users. There are two methods for using Clever with Google Chromebooks:

**1) Users use Clever Badges to log into Chromebooks, then access Clever.**

- Students open their Chromebooks and scan their Clever Badge.
- This automatically logs the students into their Chromebooks and Clever Portals (they do not need to log in again).
- Students can click on any learning application to begin their learning session.

**2) Users log into Chromebooks manually, using credentials, and then access Clever.**

- Students open Chromebooks and log in with their district-provided Google login credentials.
- After logging in, the district’s Clever Portal is automatically opened for them (i.e., students do not need to log in again).
- Students can click on any application icon to begin their learning session.

Depending on your preferences, each method can be configured separately for different Organizational Units (OUs) in your Google Admin Console.

For either of the login flows above, Clever can be configured as either an organization-wide identity provider (IdP) for Google or an SSO Profile. Clever does recommend using the SSO Profile setup. For instructions on setting up Clever as an SSO Profile in Google, please see [this article](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001645).  For instructions on setting up Clever as an organization-wide IdP, please see [this article](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001541).

---

Below are some troubleshooting tips we put together in case you see unexpected issues logging into Chromebooks with Clever Badges.

1. Create a test Organizational Unit (OU) and apply the Clever Badges settings to the OU.
2. Choose a student to test and generate a Clever Badge for them. Note, this must be a real student unless you have a test user with a Google account syncing with Clever.
3. Move that student to the test OU.
4. Move the Chromebook you’re using to the test OU.
5. Log into the Chromebook using the student’s Clever Badge.

- ***Require a change of password on the next sign in*** 
 Users are unable to log in using SSO when the **reset password on first login** functionality in the Admin Console is active. Make sure you're not using this functionality for any users accessing Google using SSO, including a Clever Badge login to a Chromebook. This is a limitation of Google SSO Using 3rd Party IdPs. For more details on this topic see[**this article from Google**.](https://support.google.com/a/answer/60224?hl=en)
- *Generate Clever Badges.* Make sure you’ve generated Clever Badges for your users. You can find instructions for generating Clever Badges **[here](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/220213907?language=en_US)**.

title: Single Sign-On (SSO): Chromebooks - Troubleshooting
text:
***If Chromebooks do not prompt users to log in with Clever Badges:***

- Check the OU settings for your devices. The Chromebooks you want to set up to use Clever Badge logins should be in an OU with the Clever Badges settings applied.
- Check your device settings. Kiosk mode and public sessions should be turned off for the Chromebooks you want to use with Clever Badges.
- Check your version of Chrome. You should be using Chrome OS version M52 or later.

***If an error message appears after the Clever Badge is scanned:***

- Check the Chromebook OU settings for your students. Students who log in with Clever Badges should be in an OU with the Clever Badges settings applied. If students are not in the correct OU, their badges cannot authenticate into Chromebooks.
- Validate the Clever Badge is working. Test the Clever Badge by using it to log in at <https://clever.com/in/badges>. If that login isn’t working, the badge is likely invalidated. You may have to generate a new Clever Badge for the student.
- Check your Clever sync for Google email addresses. Students using Clever Badges to log into Chromebooks should have Google email addresses synced to your Clever account. Clever uses this information to match users with their Google accounts. You can always check your synced data via the [Clever Dashboard > Data browser](https://schools.clever.com/browser#%7B%22sidebar%22:%22schools%22%7D).
- Confirm if Google is allowed in your network filters, including <http://accounts.google.com/signup/oauth>**.**

---

title: Single Sign-On (SSO): Chromebooks - Troubleshooting
heading_path: Context on required and recommended settings
section: Context on required and recommended settings
text:
Some districts have asked us why certain settings are required when setting up Clever Badges, and if there’s any flexibility in what’s required or recommended. This section provides context on why settings are required, and any flexibility.

**Setup single sign-on**

- All of these settings are **required** in order to set up SSO.

**Chrome User Settings**

- Lock screen and idle settings are **required** to avoid a local device password prompt, which users don’t have access to. The password is encrypted and part of the process that powers Clever SSO into the Chromebook.
- Single sign-on setting is **required** to enable SSO for Chromebooks
- SAML single sign-on login frequency settings are **recommended** to be every two weeks, but you can change this without causing issues.
- Homepage URL and Startup pages are **recommended** to send the user directly to Clever on device startup. If you prefer another URL, that won’t affect SSO functionality.

**In Chrome Device Settings:**

title: Single Sign-On (SSO): Chromebooks - Troubleshooting
heading_path: Context on required and recommended settings
section: Context on required and recommended settings
text:
- Disable guest mode is **recommended** to avoid confusion on student devices as guest mode will not work with Badges.
- Set Sign-in Screen to**Never show user names and photos**. is **recommended** to avoid confusion. Enabling this will show previously logged-in users but will prompt for the local password instead of the Badge or Clever credential.
- Set Single Sign-On IdP Redirection to **Allow users to go directly to SAML SSO IdP page** is **recommended** to eliminate the need for users to type their Google username prior to logging in. It may be **required** in some deployments depending on OU assignments
- Set Single Sign-On Cookie Behavior to **Enable transfer of SAML SSO Cookies into user session** is **recommended** to allow user to be signed in to Clever already once signed in to the device
- Single sign-on camera permissions is **required** to enable Clever to access the device camera if you plan to use Clever Badges.
- Set Managed guest session to **Do not allow managed guest sessions** is **recommended** to avoid confusion on student devices as guest mode will not work with Badges.

---

Below are a list of common errors you may run into either with Badges or credentials-based logins. Steps for troubleshooting are also provided.

title: Single Sign-On (SSO): Chromebooks - Troubleshooting
text:
- Error/Issue: OU-based login errors; Behavior: Logins not working for Badges or credentials. Errors may say "Couldn't sign you in, contact domain admin" or "Error 400"; Resolution: It is extremely common that districts/schools apply settings to a student OU, but not a device OU. Please make sure that whatever settings you apply to your device OUs are also applied to your student OUs, and if you change settings for one OU you change them for the other as well.
- Error/Issue: Login loop; Behavior: When a user tries to log into their Chromebook it brings them back to the sign in page without displaying any errors. This most commonly occurs for credentials-based logins, but can also occur for Clever Badges.; Resolution: Toggle options in the SSO Profile assignment section of the Google Admin Console. Under Manage SSO Profile assignments, in the SSO Profile, change settings from Have Google prompt for their username, then redirect them to this profile's IDP sign-in page to the option Require users to enter their Google username and password to sign in and then back again. Restart a Chromebook and test the login again. It may take up to 10 minutes for the policy updates to apply on the device.

title: Single Sign-On (SSO): Chromebooks - Troubleshooting
text:
- Error/Issue: Couldn't sign in. Contact domain admin.; Behavior: User receives an error that states Couldn't sign in. Contact domain admin.; Resolution: If this error is occurring for all users: This error is typically caused by missed settings in the OU setup. Generally, some settings are still being applied from the Parent OU if they have created Sub OUs. You should create a new "Test" OU and follow the setup instructions again. Then, place a Chromebook and student in the OU to test the flow. If the Test OU works, you can either move all students and devices to that OU that will use Clever Badges, or run through the setup guide on your current OUs and make sure the settings are not inherited from another OU in the Inheritance settings for SSO Profiles.
If this error is occurring for one or a few students: Move the affected user(s) to a different OU, wait for at least a minute, and then move them back to their original OU.

---

title: Single Sign-On (SSO): Chromebooks - Troubleshooting
text:
**"Erase all local user data" - Is this setting required or recommended?**

- **Erase all local user data** is not required or recommended for the Clever Badges into Chromebooks integration for most deployments, as it can cause issues with available device storage space.

**Can Clever Badges be used to log into Chromebooks without an internet connection (offline)?**

- No. To facilitate logins, Chromebooks must be connected to the internet so Clever’s system can authenticate them. A user may elect to change the settings for their device to ensure a device is not locked upon idle or lid close. As long as the user does not power off the device or manually log out, their active session will be preserved.

**Can we use Clever Badges if our students and devices are on separate domains?**

- If the domains are in the same Google Workspace, yes. The Badges into Chromebooks settings can be applied to each OU for the users and devices and will work for logins if configured correctly. If the students and devices exist on separate domains in different Google Workspaces you won't be able to configure Badges into Chromebooks.

**Do we need to require forced logout upon idle or lid close?**

- No. These settings are recommended if devices are being shared by multiple users. If your district is 1:1, you can change these idle settings to **Sleep.** For more information on this topic, [click here](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/224420247?language=en_US#idlesettings).

**Students receive the following error when logging in: *Assertion must contain at least one subject or attribute list***

- This error means that the student doesn't have an email address synced to Clever. To resolve the issue, please confirm their email is populated in your SIS and synced to Clever.

**Students receive the following error when logging in:*****Sorry! This user does not have a Google email address associated with their Clever account. Please populate their email address and try again!***

- This error means that the student does not have an email address synced to Clever. To resolve the issue, please confirm their email is populated in your SIS and synced to Clever.

title: For App Partners: Predicted next sync times
heading_path: For App Partners: Predicted next sync times
text:
On the district’s overview page of your Clever Dashboard, you can view the last time a district's SIS synced with Clever, as well as the next time our system predicts it will sync:

![Sync info displaying last successful sync and the next predicted sync](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl0000002iBR&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000004yfvV)

You can also view a detailed Sync Report on the Warnings tab on the district’s overview page.

![detailed sync report on the Warnings tab](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl0000002iBR&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000004yfva)

Many districts sync data to Clever on a regular schedule, so by looking at their previous syncs, we can infer when they will next sync. This is not guaranteed, as the district could change its sync pattern or miss a sync. Other districts sync data in an irregular pattern, and in those cases, we cannot predict the next sync.

Understanding a bit about the different sync types provides clarity on a district's sync frequency as well.

---

An Auto Sync with Clever involves a basic initial setup. It requires minimal IT support from a district, as Clever syncs directly with the district's SIS to securely transfer student roster data. These auto syncs typically run every two to three hours, although some districts are set to sync daily (per their request).

A Secure File Transfer Protocol (SFTP) Sync allows school districts to “push” data to Clever. Districts generate .csv files in a Clever-specific CSV format and submit them to Clever using SFTP. Many districts automate the export of their files sent to an FTP client daily, but SFTP Syncs are more challenging to predict, as the district pushes the data to Clever.

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl0000002iBR&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000285e6) For additional details on sync types, please see [this article](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202289278), which helps district admins choose which sync type is right for them.

title: Infinite Campus API Sync
text:
> Once students and other record types are marked "Active" in Infinite Campus for the next school year, the sync will resume as expected. To preserve access for your users between school years, Clever recommends that you put your sync on pause  during the summer to prevent deletions. > Default Field Mappings

If you need an example file, click Download example files . > Please note: DO NOT REMOVE any staff users you want to be able to access Clever. Removing a user from the staff.csv before re-uploading it will cause their record to be deleted. Instead, add the additional user information to the file before re-uploading. >  
> For additional information about Clever's SFTP and CSV formatting specifications, click here . >  
> Important Upload Tips
> When uploading staff to Clever, there are a few important details to consider:  
> Each unique staff member requires a unique staff\_id. Always include all staff in the staff.csv file if you still want them to have access to Clever. Removing a user from the staff.csv before re-uploading the file will cause their record to be deleted.

title: SSO (Saved Passwords) Apps: Overview & Setup
text:
> Tip: Title SSO (Saved Passwords) Apps: Overview & Setup URL Name 234746488 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Getting started 3. Setup 4. Frequently Asked Questions
> Looking for additional support setting up Clever Portal? Check out our  Clever Academy Quick Start - Setting up your Portal course
> Overview
> SSO (Saved Passwords) applications are apps that don't currently have a rostering or single sign-on (SSO) integration with Clever, but can still be accessed via SSO through Clever Portal. This means di stricts can provide users with a seamless SSO experience for almost any learning application even if it is not an existing Clever partner. With the SSO (Saved Passwords) option, rostering data and user accounts are not synced to the app by Clever. This means they must be created within the application in advance, and user login credentials need to be manually set by the district admin, or by the users themselves. Clever will securely store these credentials so district users are logged into the applications automatically via single sign-on through Clever. This article and the video below provides a detailed overview of SSO (Saved Passwords) applications and the setup process for launching these apps at your district. >  
>  
> Getting started
> District user accounts and credentials for the app:
> The first step is to confirm your district users have accounts and login credentials for the SSO (Saved Passwords) application. This would be done by working with the app partner directly before setting the app up in Clever. > Non-iOS devices:
> The second step is confirming the Clever browser extension is installed on all non-iOS devices that will be used to access the application through Clever. This includes home devices for users who will be accessing this app from home. The Clever browser extension facilitates single sign-on for SSO (Saved Passwords) apps. Please visit this article for more.

title: SSO (Saved Passwords) Apps: Overview & Setup
text:
> The Clever browser extension is not required for iOS devices (e.g. iPads, iPhones) as these devices use the Clever app which acts as the browser extension. Please visit this article for more. > Please note: For devices where the browser extension cannot be downloaded (e.g. Android, Kindle Fire), Saved Passwords apps will not be accessible. For details, visit:  Clever Browser & Device Compatibility
>  
> Setup
> After configuring the above, there are three steps to set up any application for universal single sign-on (SSO) from your Clever Portal. > 1. Find and add an application
> Visit the Clever Dashboard > Applications > Add applications page in your Clever Dashboard to find the application you would like to use. Once identified, click Request App . >  
> Next, select if you would like to request that the application provider begin supporting rostering via Clever Secure Sync. The more requests Clever receives, the more likely it is to happen in the future. > Finally, select Request Application . > 2. Configure user access
> The next screen will provide you with an option to share the added application with particular schools. You can select the schools as listed and select Request with sharing  or choose  Request and share later . > Sharing rules can always be changed from the individual application's page under Modify user selection . > Clever Tip: For more information on setting up your sharing permissions, check out How do I set my sharing permissions for applications? > 3 . Provide your login information
> Selecting an example user Provide your login information
> Once you have added the application and set up sharing rules, you'll need to provide information on how Clever should log in your users. > First, select Begin matching  on the added application's page: 
> Some applications require district specific information for logins to work. If this is the case, the first step will prompt you for the information Clever needs.

title: SSO (Saved Passwords) Apps: Overview & Setup
text:
You will need to obtain the information in these fields from the application. Please see the example below: 
> You can then choose whether credentials for this application will be set at a district level or if individual users will set their own credentials. > If you choose to have individuals set their own credentials, take note of the flow diagram that details the process, and click Confirm . > Next, you'll need to provide login information: 
> 1. Selecting an example user
> To begin matching credentials, select an existing user for the specified user type (e.g. student, teacher, staff). This step is meant to provide you with an example as you configure the credentials for this resource. We suggest entering a user for whom you already have the username and password. Once you have selected a user, you will see the data that’s synced from your SIS populated in the box below. > 2. Choosing a formula type
> Next, you'll choose a formula type for both Username and Password. > You can choose from the following:
> Exact user attribute
> This setting will pull data fields from a user’s profile as it is synced from your SIS. If we are not currently pulling in the fields you need, then reach out to Clever support to investigate possible alternate mappings. > Manual input from user at first login
> This setting allows users to input their own credentials the first time they access the Saved Passwords resource via the Clever Portal. These credentials will be saved for all future logins. > Custom Formula
> You can use existing fields in the user’s profile to form custom strings for the Username/Password. Please see this Help Center article:  How do I manage Saved Passwords application credentials? > CSV via SFTP
> When a user's credentials are uploaded via CSV, they will not be asked to log in the first time they access the application through Clever. Upload a file containing each user’s credentials using SFTP.

title: SSO (Saved Passwords) Apps: Overview & Setup
text:
You can find the SFTP credentials on your   Clever Dashboard > Data sources > SIS sync > Settings   page in the SFTP Settings - Saved Passwords Applications box . > One time CSV upload
> Upload a file containing each user’s credentials directly to the site using drag and drop. > You may choose any combination of these options for your username and password configurations. Once you have completed both fields, you will see a preview of the credentials in the card on the left. Click Confirm to save those changes. You can return and edit your formulas by clicking on the corresponding card on the left. > For additional instructions, please visit:  How do I manage Saved Passwords application credentials? >  
>  
> Frequently Asked Questions
> Why do these applications require a lengthy setup? > SSO (Saved Passwords) applications are not formally integrated with Clever. Our engineering team works to create a connection that will serve your users in the most seamless way possible! In order for our connection to work smoothly, we require you to set up the application beforehand and ask that you provide us with credentials. While these applications do take a bit more setup time, your users will enjoy a seamless experience once everything is done. > What device(s) can I use with Saved Passwords applications? > Applications with Saved Passwords can be used on any devices that support browser extensions with Chrome, Firefox, or Edge. Desktop computers, laptops, Chromebooks, and Windows devices are all supported. Saved Passwords is also supported on iOS devices running on iOS 9.0 and above with the most up to date Clever app installed. > Saved Passwords functionality on iOS For more information on how to set this up, please see  Clever Saved Passwords for iOS. > Can we use Google / Active Directory / Entra ID / Office365 to log into an application via Clever? > SSO (Saved Passwords) apps will only function properly with applications that allow for a standard username and password.

title: SSO (Saved Passwords) Apps: Overview & Setup

They will not work with any applications where the district uses a third-party identity provider  (e.g. Google) to log in to the application directly. If your district uses Google to log into Clever, you can add the application as an external link  on your Clever Dashboard. Since there is an active Google session on the device, the user should not need to re-authenticate when they click Log in with Google  on the application's website. > What if I don't see an application I want? > Check out  Requesting a single sign-on (SSO) application. > What if the application requires a specific login URL for my district? > If the application has a specific login URL for your district, follow the steps below to enter that URL

> 4. Enter the login URL. > 5. Click Save . > 6. This URL will now automatically be the URL Clever uses for SSO for your users. You can always come back and update this URL as needed by following the same steps above. > Where are some additional resources for SSO (Saved Passwords) apps? > SSO (Saved Passwords) Apps: Testing and Piloting SSO (Saved Passwords): Converting external link apps to Saved Passwords apps SSO (Saved Passwords) Apps: Troubleshooting issues

title: SSO (Saved Passwords) Apps: Troubleshooting issues
text:
Every now and then you may have users who have trouble logging into [Saved Passwords applications](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/234746488?language=en_US), or they need to update their credentials for the app. Here are some tips for troubleshooting these issues which will make the process as painless as possible.

If your current district [settings for the Saved Passwords application](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/234973187?language=en_US) allow your users to manually enter their credentials the very first time they log into the app through Clever, Clever will save those credentials for the future providing a single sign-on (SSO) experience for users.

The challenge is that sometimes users will enter the incorrect credentials the first time around, and those are what gets saved to Clever. Thegreat news is that those credentials can be updated in Clever!

In the vast majority of cases, if users are unable to log into a Saved Passwords application, they'll see a message like the one below:

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl00000052pB&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000288VC)

title: SSO (Saved Passwords) Apps: Troubleshooting issues
text:
To update a student's credentials, please follow these steps:

1. Go directly to the application's website login page outside of Clever, and confirm if the user's credentials are successful.
 - If the credentials are not successful, please contact the application provider directly to correct the error.
 - If credentials are successful, attempt to enter those same credentials again in the screen shown above and then select 'Update & Log in'. Then, confirm the credentials work by accessing the application again through the Clever Portal.

If for some reason, the 'Update & Log in' option in the screenshot above did not work with resetting the user's credentials, the student's teacher or a district admin can assist by following these steps:

- The teacher will log in to Clever.  District admins can utilize the 'Access Portal As' feature from their [Clever Dashboard](https://schools.clever.com/) to access the teacher's account in order to do the following:
 - Click on the 'Help​ a Student' option.
 - Locate the student who needs their credentials updated.
 - The prompt will ask if you want to update the student's Clever login or generate a backup code. Click 'No' where it asks if this solved the problem.

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl00000052pB&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000003Bx4N)

- Locate the Saved Passwords application.
- When asked if the student has the app icon in their portal, say 'Yes.'
- Then update the Saved Passwords credentials.

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl00000052pB&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000003Bx4C)

- Finally, have the student test their login to the app to see if it works correctly (or district admins can 'Access Portal As' the student to test it for them).

District admins can also set credentials for Saved Passwords apps [through a bulk upload](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/234973187) in the Clever Dashboard.

title: SSO (Saved Passwords) Apps: Troubleshooting issues
text:
If a staff member or teacher inputs incorrect credentials for an SSO (Saved Passwords) application, they can update them by following these steps:

1. Log in to the Clever Portal.
2. Select the application that has incorrect credentials.
3. Enter the correct username and password for the application, and click 'Update & Log in'.

If for some reason the above steps do not work, please reach out to [Clever Support](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360001041326) for assistance.

**![](https://theme.zdassets.com/theme_assets/364037/af574183f2df705f2c75ac31fc7ab01b1a5a3d9a.png) Clever Tip****:** If you are still having trouble, please confirm that the username and password you've entered work to log into your account directly on the application's page. If you can successfully access the app directly through their website, but not through Clever, please reach out to [Clever Support](https://support.clever.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) for help!

title: SSO (Saved Passwords) Apps:  Managing Credentials
text:
Title

SSO (Saved Passwords) Apps: Managing Credentials

URL Name

234973187

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/234973187?language=en_US#Overview) 
2. [Managing Credentials](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/234973187?language=en_US#Header1) 
3. [Manual input from user at first login](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/234973187?language=en_US#Header2) 
4. [Matching Credentials](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/234973187?language=en_US#Header3) 
5. [Custom Credentials](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/234973187?language=en_US#Header4) 
6. [Uploading Credentials](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/234973187?language=en_US#creds) 
7. [Reset or Remove credentials for users](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/234973187?language=en_US#Header7)

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TiFN&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000288Tk) Read [SSO (Saved Passwords) Apps: Overview & Setup](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/234746488?language=en_US) first to learn how to add SSO (Saved Passwords) applications to your Clever Portal!

SSO (Saved Passwords) applications have the ability to provide your users with a seamless SSO experience despite Clever not having a formal integration with the application you have added. In order for SSO to work properly with your SSO (Saved Passwords) applications, you will need to ensure that you have set up credentials correctly. This article will describe the options that you have as well as provide you with directions on how you can manage credentials.

---

Once an application has been added to your [Clever Dashboard > Applications > Add Applications](https://schools.clever.com/applications/add) page, the next step is to input username and password information for your users to log into the SSO (Saved Passwords) application. You can manage credentials by navigating to the 'Settings' tab of the specific application's[Manage Credentials](https://schools.clever.com/applications/ilpro-type-to-learn/configure) page. This article will go over multiple options for setting up your users' credentials for the specified application.

![HC_shadow_box_updates_-_Google_Slides-9.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TiFN&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000003BSLH)

---

By default, we will request that users enter their credentials manually the first time. After the first time, they will be automatically logged into their application with one click.

---

If usernames and passwords can be found in your SIS information, you can select which field this information is contained in by selecting the drop-down menu.  The field options are as follows:

- District username, district password, date of birth, email, SIS ID, student number & state ID

![Drop-down displays available fields that district can match credentials with.](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TiFN&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl000000gzaA)

>

---

title: SSO (Saved Passwords) Apps:  Managing Credentials
text:
To match the usernames/passwords created outside of Clever for SSO (Saved Passwords) applications, you can use the "Custom" option in the dropdown and use a formula from below. More information about custom formulas can be found [here](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360035539131?language=en_US).

Available fields:

- {{credentials.district\_username}} = username from SIS sync
- {{credentials.district\_password}} = password from SIS sync
- {{name.first}} = first name from SIS sync
- {{name.last}} = last name from SIS sync
- {{email}} = email from SIS sync
- {{student\_number}} = student number from SIS sync
- {{\_id}} = Clever ID
- {{sis\_id}} = SIS ID from SIS sync (student\_id, teacher\_id, staff\_id)
- {{graduation\_year}} = graduation year from SIS sync
- {{dob}} = birthday from SIS sync

title: SSO (Saved Passwords) Apps:  Managing Credentials
text:
- Desired username or password: Username from the sync plus my district's email domain; Formula [fill in portions in brackets]: {{credentials.district\_username}}[add domain name here]; Example formula: {{credentials.district\_username}}@ cleverusd.edu; Sample result for an example user: skelly19@cleverusd.edu
- Desired username or password: A specific word/phrase that's the same for every student; Formula [fill in portions in brackets]: [add that word/phrase here]; Example formula: apple; Sample result for an example user: apple
- Desired username or password: Insert the whole contents of a field from either the SIS sync or the .csv upload; Formula [fill in portions in brackets]: {{FIELD NAME}}; Example formula: {{graduation\_year}}; Sample result for an example user: 2030
- Desired username or password: First initial, last name; Formula [fill in portions in brackets]: {{substr name.first 0 1}}{{name.last}}; Example formula: {{substr name.first 0 1}}{{name.last}}; Sample result for an example user: skelly
- Desired username or password: Their email without the domain; Formula [fill in portions in brackets]: {{textBefore email "@"}}; Example formula: {{textBefore email "@"}}; Sample result for an example user: sykelly
- Desired username or password: Last 4 digits of a field; Formula [fill in portions in brackets]: {{substr FIELDNAME -4 4}}; Example formula: {{substr student\_number -4 4}}; Sample result for an example user: 5678
- Desired username or password: Something else...; Formula [fill in portions in brackets]: Contact us via the form in our Help Center and we'll create a formula for you! Custom formulas are complicated and are most easily communicated via email.

---

title: SSO (Saved Passwords) Apps:  Managing Credentials
text:
When a user's credentials are uploaded via CSV, they will not be asked to log in the first time they access the application through Clever. If a user is not included in the credentials upload, the expected behavior is they will be prompted to manually enter their credentials at their first login, and then will be automatically logged in each time thereafter.

**Method 1: Upload via Clever**

You can securely upload credentials directly from the 'Settings' tab of the specific application's[Manage Credentials](https://schools.clever.com/applications/ilpro-type-to-learn/configure)page. To do so, first select **Manual upload from .csv** as the username and password which will enable a web upload tool to upload your CSV file. This does state "not recommended", this is due to the complexity of creating the files and managing the credentials on the district's end.

![HC_shadow_box_updates_-_Google_Slides-10.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TiFN&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000003BSMZ)

Upload the file and select **Save**. We have also provided a downloadable template for reference.

![Notification_Center-18.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TiFN&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000003BSO1)

**Method 2:** **SFTP Upload**

You can upload user credentials via the Credentials SFTP server. Files should be in the form of `students.csv`, `teachers.csv`, or `staff.csv` and uploaded to the appropriate folder for the application (e.g. /career-cruising). [See tips to format your files](https://assets.clever.com/website/files/Configuring_SSO_Accounts.pdf) to successfully upload credentials or [download template files](https://assets.clever.com/example-data/credentials.zip).

text:
SSO (Saved Passwords) applications in the Clever Portal accept three files for setup: students.csv, teachers.csv, and staff.csv. Please find the specification on formatting below.

Separate setup files are required for every SSO (Saved Passwords) application, even if the credentials used are the same for all applications.

**Uploading credentials: special cases**

Some applications require more than just a username and password. For example, the application may require a school code or a pin number. For these applications, you will need to include an additional column in your credential upload. The required fields will be reflected on the 'Upload Credentials' page and will look something like this:

You will also use an extra column when your users sign into an application from multiple URLs (i.e. URLs that are unique for each school in a district).

**Troubleshooting upload issues**

Once you upload credentials, you'll receive a confirmation email with a summary of your upload. If there are any issues, the email will also list the number of rows that could not be processed. Here are some of the most common issues that prevent rows from being processed and how to resolve them:

title: SSO (Saved Passwords) Apps:  Managing Credentials
text:
1. **Missing data:** All of the fields listed on the 'Upload Credentials' tab of an application are required. Double-check that you're not missing any additional rows (see "Uploading Credentials: Special Cases" above) and that none of your rows have empty cells in them.
2. **Incorrect user IDs:** Each User\_ID must exactly match the **SIS\_ID** of the user you are uploading credentials for. You can check each user's SIS\_ID in your [Clever Dashboard > Data browser](https://schools.clever.com/data-browser).
 - ***Please note***: Leading zeros (i.e. the "000" in "000123") **do** matter. If your users' SIS\_IDs have leading zeros, make sure the zeros aren't getting stripped in your upload file.
3. **Duplicate rows:** Clever will only process the first set of credentials for each User\_ID. If a User\_ID is included in multiple rows, all rows past the first will be listed as errors.
4. **Formatting errors:** Sometimes simple formatting errors such as incorrect capitalization can cause errors. Make sure your headers match exactly what is listed on the 'Uploading Credentials' tab. Also, make sure you are saving the file as a CSV.

---

1. Navigate to the application in the Clever Dashboard

5. Select **Confirm**
6. *(Optional)* Adjust student credentials if needed. Select***Confirm***
7. Select **Done**
8. Check the box labeled **Delete these credentials and apply new settings**
9. Click **Match credentials**

text:
> Tip: Title For Staff: What is Clever? URL Name 235962868 Article Body What is Clever? > Clever is a secure pipeline between your district's data and the learning applications that you and your students use. We help your district's IT office provide applications with all the information they need to be seamlessly set up for your school. > Clever Single sign-on (SSO) allows users to log into applications with a single set of credentials, configured at the district level. With the ease of only one username and password, Clever can help teachers reclaim valuable class time. Students and teachers can open their devices, sign into the Clever Portal, and click on their connected applications to automatically access the online learning program! > Clever Tip: If you notice that data is missing or incorrect in Clever or one of your connected learning applications, you’ll want to reach out to your district tech support contact to verify that the data is syncing from your Student Information System (SIS) and included in the sharing permissions for the application. Clever is unable to make changes on the district's behalf. > Who can sign up for Clever? > We recommend creating one Clever account for your school district that’s managed at the district level. In order to create and administer a Clever account, you need administrative access to your SIS and authority to sign Clever’s Terms of Service. > Examples of individuals with sufficient access to manage a Clever account include Chief Technology Officers, SIS/Database Managers, and other district IT Administrators. Non-teaching staff, such as Principals, typically do not have the access to the SIS that is needed to set up a Clever account, therefore we recommend reaching out to a colleague at the district level to create your district’s Clever account. > How can I access my district's Clever account? > If you’d like access to Clever as a non-teaching staff member, we encourage you to reach out to your district’s tech department.

The Clever account owner must upload your non-teaching staff record to the Clever dashboard. If they need guidance in creating your non-teaching staff account, feel free to pass on this article .

Before Clever can help students and teachers access learning applications at your school, the Clever account needs to be set up by a district administrator. Clever supports all US and Canadian school districts. Clever is a no-cost, secure integration solution that is available to both public and private institutions.

Clever allows international districts to create Clever accounts, but these accounts are [self-service](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202043013). Please reach out to your IT or Curriculum Director to set up Clever today. Here is a template email to send to your district administrators:

Hi [*admin name*],

My name is [*your name*] and I am a staff member at [*school name*]. Please consider deploying Clever at [*district name*], because [*your reason*].

Clever's single sign-on (SSO) will help students and teachers at my school access online learning apps, without needing to remember a new username or password.

Clever is a no-cost, secure integration solution that is used by over 60,000 schools and takes just minutes to roll out.

You can sign up our district by visiting Clever.com. If you have any questions, the Clever team will be happy to help. Just email [success@clever.com](mailto:success@clever.com).

Thank you for your help, 
[*your name*] 
[*your email*]

title: What is Secure Sync?
text:
> Tip: Title What is Secure Sync? URL Name 236113588 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Auto Syncs 3. SFTP Syncs 3. Changing Syncs
> Overview
> Think of Clever Secure Sync as a bridge between your Student Information System (SIS) and online learning applications. Secure Sync maintains up-to-date roster information in your learning applications by securely transferring your roster uploads or connecting directly with your SIS. Clever is engineered to be the most secure and convenient way for districts to send vendors data and grant access to learning applications. > The Secure Sync process can be summarized in four steps:
> Your school district’s data syncs to your Clever account through an Auto Sync or an SFTP sync. Sharing permissions with each connected application are set up to determine which data to share with that application. Applications pull all available data from your Clever account, typically on a nightly basis. Student, teacher, and staff accounts are automatically created in the applications. From that point on, applications regularly update any changes to your enrollment information as indicated in your Clever account. > Continue reading to learn about Clever’s different sync types. With all Clever sync types, the school district has complete control over data access and management of the Clever account. > Please note: Clever can only connect to one student information system (SIS) per district account. If your district uses more than one SIS, you will need to set up more than one Clever account. > Auto Syncs
> An Auto Sync with Clever involves basic initial setup and requires minimal IT support from your district because Clever syncs directly with your SIS to securely transfer student roster data. There are two types of Auto Syncs: Clever-Managed and SIS-Managed Auto Syncs. Curious if Clever offers an automated sync with your SIS? Check out this article.

title: What is Secure Sync?
text:
> SFTP Syncs
> This option allows school districts to “push” data to Clever. Districts generate multiple files in a Clever-specific CSV format and submit them to Clever using Secure File Transfer Protocol (SFTP). The SFTP sync allows districts to upload data using an FTP client or Clever’s Web Upload tool. Districts control exactly what data to include in their upload files, therefore this option provides districts a greater level of customization but requires more robust setup and management. Clever also recommends automating the process of exporting data from your SIS and uploading it to Clever. For more information on SFTP syncs, read this article. >  Changing Syncs
> Moving to a new student information system (SIS)? No worries—Clever has you covered! Clever can assist in keeping your downstream application data clean and ready-to-go. For more information on what this process of changing syncs will entail, read this article . > If you have any questions about Secure Sync, please reach out to  Clever Support ! We are happy to help!

4. [Is Clever safe for my child to use?](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/236113708?language=en_US#h_ab5dbcb4-dd21-4dad-ab09-1e687aa06717)

Clever is an easy way for your child to log in and learn with all of the online programs they use at school. With their own personal portals, students can learn with resources selected by their teacher and district.

Schools use Clever so students can have all of their digital resources in one place. Clever also eliminates the need to remember multiple usernames and passwords.

---

Your student can visit [clever.com/login](https://clever.com/login) to find their school and log in to Clever with their school-provided username and password. If your child has a Clever Badge, they can use their Badge to sign in at [clever.com/badges](http://clever.com/badges).

Your school district may create a parent/guardian account that you can use to help your child log in. Learn more about parent/guardian accounts.

---

If your child is unable to log in to Clever or if you encounter a problem with one of the programs on Clever, please contact your school. Your school will be able to help your child access their account, and can help troubleshoot any issues you may have run into.

Similarly, if you'd like more information on the applications and tools your child has access to, or believe they should have access to additional learning materials, please contact your school directly. The Clever team can't assist with student access to learning materials as your school manages this.

---

Clever has worked with school districts and learning applications to create a safe, secure, private, experience for every student. Clever is set up and managed by schools - so every resource your child sees on Clever has been selected by their school. The data in Clever is only used to support your child’s education - it is never sold or used for advertising.

Detailed information about Clever’s privacy, security and compliance policies and practices can be found in the [Trust Center](https://clever.com/trust).

Sharing permissions and data updates or changes
section: Sharing permissions and data updates or changes
text:
When you set [sharing permissions](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/203115007) for an application, you are choosing what data from your account to make available to the application through Clever’s API. Applications then pull the data from Clever to use in their system.

If you make an update to your Clever data (including modifying your sharing permissions), you can expect this change to be reflected in the application **within 24 hours**. If after 24 hours there is no change in the application, please review the troubleshooting steps in this article: [Troubleshooting: App issues](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360014923052)

If the data is correct in Clever but incorrect in an application, please reach out to the application directly! Their team may need to complete another sync with Clever to get your most recent data into their system. While applications each have their own sync schedules with Clever, most applications sync with Clever on a nightly basis. If you need a manual sync with the application initiated, please contact the application's support team. They may be able to push a manual sync to pull the most current data from Clever.

If you need to contact the application partner for more information, navigate to the app overview page. If the application has provided a Support Contact, you'll find it at the top of this page.

![Screenshot of the outreach contact on the app overview page](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000NI97&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000NoeWU)

---

title: For Clever Admins: Apps - Sync times
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Apps - Sync times
text:
**How often do applications pull data from Clever?**

- While each application manages its sync times with Clever, most applications pull data nightly.

**When can I expect changes in my data in Clever to be reflected in connected learning applications?**

- Typically within 24 hours. If you do not see data changes reflected in the learning application within 24 hours, please contact the application team directly. If you need changes implemented sooner than 24 hours, we recommend contacting the application directly to see if they may be able to sync data from Clever sooner.

**What steps should I take if data is correct in Clever, but incorrect in a learning application?**

- Please reach out to the learning application directly to troubleshoot further.

**What does the last sync time on the application overview page indicate?**

- The last sync time on the application overview page indicates the last time an application queried the API. The last attempted sync time doesn't indicate completion of a complete data sync, so if you see data missing in the application, please contact their team directly.

> Learn more in this article about how to log in to Clever as a staff (non-teaching) user in your school organization. >

Your username and password credentials are set up by your school district. They may be your teacher number, ID, or email address. > If you are both a teacher and a staff member in Clever, you can access both user accounts using the same set of credentials in most instances. After logging in, you'll be able to toggle to switch between accounts using the Profile button in the top right of your Portal. > An example of the dropdown menu of a user who can switch accounts within their Portal. > Please note:  If your district uses custom usernames and passwords for single sign-on (SSO) (rather than through a third party like Google), you may have two distinct set of credentials: one for your teacher account and one for your staff account. This means your Username will be different between your two accounts. Please check with your district admin for more information on what your credentials should be for your teacher account and staff account. > Once logged in to your Clever Portal, you can access your applications! >  What to do if you've forgotten your password
> There are a few different methods districts can choose for how you log into Clever. See below for more information.

title: Clever Technical Requirements & Supported Devices
text:
Clever is compatible with all computer devices (e.g., Microsoft Windows, macOS, Chrome OS/Chromebooks), but we have certain recommendations to provide users with the most optimized experience. Clever supports the following internet browsers.

- Google Chrome
- Microsoft Edge
- Mozilla Firefox
- Apple Safari (we support this browser for general use with Clever, but not for SSO (Save Passwords) apps, as we do not currently offer a Safari Extension)

While these browsers are compatible with Clever, we recommend using the Chrome browser for the best user experience.

Please visit the following articles for specifics around using Clever on Chromebooks:

- [Single Sign-On (SSO): Chromebooks - Setup & Troubleshooting](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/224420247?language=en_US)
- [For Teachers: Chromebooks - the student experience](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/236004628?language=en_US)

---

title: Clever Technical Requirements & Supported Devices
text:
The Clever browser extension is required for specific applications to work correctly on computers and Chromebooks. Specifically, [single sign-on (SSO) applications](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/203166807?language=en_US) that are integrated with Clever do not require the Clever browser extension, but the browser extension is needed for [SSO (Saved Passwords) applications](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/234746488?language=en_US) to function correctly.

- The Clever browser extension is not required for iOS devices (e.g., iPads, iPhones) as these devices use the [Clever app](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/236226387?language=en_US#ios), which is downloadable from the device App Store and functions in the same way as the Clever browser extension.
- For devices where the Clever browser extension cannot be downloaded (e.g., Android), some applications may not be accessible.

Please see the links below for information and instructions for installing the Clever browser extension for your browser:

- Google Chrome:  [Install](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/clever/nopfnnpnopgmcnkjchnlpomggcdjfepo)  |  [Directions](https://support.google.com/chromebook/answer/2588006?hl=en)
- Microsoft Edge (New):   [Install](https://microsoftedge.microsoft.com/addons/detail/clever/innfnjgighoafebohpiamhnchmkoilgj?source=sfw)  |  [Directions](https://www.howtogeek.com/411830/how-to-install-google-chrome-extensions-in-microsoft-edge/)
- Firefox: [Install](https://crx.clever.com/firefox/download) | [Directions](https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/find-and-install-add-ons-add-features-to-firefox)

---

The Clever app is compatible with iOS devices (e.g., iPads, iPhones) versions 9.0 or later and is available for download from the device App Store.

See the following article for more information regarding the Clever iOS app: [iOS devices (e.g. iPads, iPhones)](https://support.clever.com/hc/es/articles/360024746971)

title: Clever Technical Requirements & Supported Devices
text:
Clever does not currently have an app for Android devices. However, users can still use their Android devices to access Clever! Users log in to Clever from [Clever.com](http://Clever.com) or their district's custom Clever login page using their internet browser just as they would when using a computer or laptop. Clever recommends using the Google Chrome browser for the best user experience. Users must manually log in to [SSO (Saved Passwords) applications](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/234746488?language=en_US) when using Android devices.

Amazon Fire tablets provide the same user experience as Android.

For students to access Clever on the Amazon Kids web browser, you must [add Clever.com as an allowable domain](https://www.amazon.com/gp/help/customer/display.html?nodeId=201957100#:~:text=7.%20How%20can%20I%20permit%20access%20to%20additional%20web%20videos%20and%20websites%3F).

Learn about several of the available settings available to application partners to help your districts succeed! This includes setting up recommended data sharing permissions for your districts. As a best practice, we recommend configuring these settings before inviting districts to your application; however, these settings can also be updated at any time in the future.

Please visit this article for instructions on how to invite districts to your application in Clever here: [For App Partners: Inviting & connecting districts to your app](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/215120718?language=en_US)

---

To access your **District Setup** page to modify the settings detailed in this article, please:

- Navigate to your [Clever Dashboard](https://apps.clever.com/amplify/districts/overview) > [Settings](https://apps.clever.com/amplify/settings/general) page.
- Select the **District Setup** tab.

The **District Setup** tab includes the following options:

title: For App Partners: District Data Sharing Permissions & Recommended Settings
heading_path: For App Partners: District Data Sharing Permissions & Recommended Settings
text:
- **Globally Recommended Sharing**: This feature allows application partners to configure recommended data sharing permissions so districts will share the correct data with your application. Essentially, you are providing your districts with data-sharing best practices when connecting with your application for the first time.
 - Please visit the **District Experience** section of this article for details about the different options available for districts when sharing their data with your application. The information in the **District Experience** section will help you to provide the appropriate recommend sharing permissions. For detailed setup instructions, see [our guide to global recommended sharing settings](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360046189771?language=en_US).
- **Custom setup wizard**: This feature allows you to add a custom message which will display for district admins in Clever who are adding your application for the first time and have configured their data sharing. We recommend using this feature to inform district admins about additional setup steps for successfully launching your application, providing them with other specifics they might need, or just letting them know you'll be in touch! Utilizing this feature to inform district admins will help mitigate potential challenges for districts that are setting up your application in Clever. Once you've saved your updates, you will have the option to preview your changes. 
 ![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka01P0000005zK0&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000036fer)

title: For App Partners: District Data Sharing Permissions & Recommended Settings
heading_path: For App Partners: District Data Sharing Permissions & Recommended Settings
text:
- **Enable safety thresholds**: This featurehelps to ensurethat significant data changes from a district (e.g., updating their sharing permissions for your application) will place the next application sync on an automatic hold before processing the data, giving your team time to review the changes before they update your application. For detailed instructions, see [our guide to safety thresholds](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360044699192?language=en_US).
- **Request API V3 Migration CSVs**: This optionwill map the legacy "role-based" Clever IDs to the more recent API v3.0 User IDs. When choosing this option, a zip file containing one CSV for every one of your connected districts will be provided for download for one week after being created. In the rare case that a district mapping cannot be completed, there will be an error file created documenting this information.

---

title: For App Partners: District Data Sharing Permissions & Recommended Settings
heading_path: For App Partners: District Data Sharing Permissions & Recommended Settings
text:
When a district either requests your application or is sent an invite by you, they have the option to create "sharing permissions" to determine what district data they want synced to your application.

District admins can configure application sharing permission in any one of the following ways:

- **Share by District**: All district data in Clever will be synced to the application, including district admins, schools, teachers, students, staff, sections, and enrollments.
- **Share by Schools**: Clever will only share any data associated with the schools the district has selected for your application.
- **Share by Rules**: Clever will only share data that meets the specific criteria the district sets. This is the most recommended sharing type as it provides districts with the most flexibility in specifically determining what data should be included, or excluded, in the sharing. [Read this article](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/115000392247?language=en_US) to learn more about how to Share by Rules!
- **School Site Sharing**: If the district has designated [School Tech Leads](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/115003207663?language=en_US) in Clever, a district admin can provide them with the ability to configure application sharing permissions for their associated schools. [More info here!](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/203115007?language=en_US)
- **Copy Sharing**: Clever will copy the sharing permissions from another application that has already been set up.

Clever is a no-cost data integration and single sign-on service that gives back hours of teaching time to districts and schools all over the country. Clever is designed to work for districts with multiple schools, but charter and private schools can also create Clever accounts.

title: Can small districts, charters, parochial, and private schools use Clever?
heading_path: Can small districts, charters, parochial, and private schools use Clever?
text:
**Charter and private schools:**

- Student Information System (SIS): Clever is designed to sync student data from your SIS, but we understand that many private and charter schools do not have an SIS. You can find a list of our SIS partners [here](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202042973). If you do not have an SIS or do not see your SIS on the list, you will have to create CSV files and [upload them via SFTP](https://schools.clever.com/documents/clever-sftp-default-pdf).

**Local school district:**

- If your private school or charter school is not managed by a local school district, you will likely not find your school name on the drop-down menu when signing up. If this is the case, please “Add” your school name and do not sign up as a district.

**Districts with six schools or fewer:**

- Syncing**:** When completing your first sync, you can find more information in these articles:
 - [SIS Partners](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202042973)
 - [Which sync option should you choose?](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202289278)
 - [Sync Error: What are "Insufficient Permissions"?](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/206830627)
 - [Sync Error: How do I resolve "Invalid username/password specified"?](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202493868)
 - [All other Secure Sync topics](https://support.clever.com/hc/en-us/sections/207400687)

title: Can small districts, charters, parochial, and private schools use Clever?
heading_path: Can small districts, charters, parochial, and private schools use Clever?
text:
Clever setup is most successful when there’s a dedicated technology team managing the account. Before signing up, it’s important to consider who will set up and run your account. You can get an overview of the different roles and permissions that exist in Clever [here](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115001733726?language=en_US).

Think you’ll need a little extra support? We’ve got you covered. Clever offers Consulting and Premium Support for districts looking for a higher level of guidance. As your partner in simplifying digital learning, we provide VIP dedicated support and expert coaching tailored to your needs. Check it out [here](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001646?language=en_US).

If you are still interested in using Clever and ready to sign up, please visit our Self-Service Guides on [Secure Sync](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/topic/0TO1P000000V0y0WAC/secure-sync?language=en_US) and [Single Sign-on (SSO).](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/topic/0TO1P000000V0xxWAC/single-signon-sso?language=en_US)

title: 학부모용: 문제 해결- Clever 로그인
text:
标题

학부모용: 문제 해결- Clever 로그인

URL 名称

360000067006

Article Body

이 글은 다음 내용을 포함하고 있습니다. 
1. [개요](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360000067006?language=ko#h_719d2eaa-7bb6-4396-8813-34780be24a68) 
2. [로그인 방법](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360000067006?language=ko#h_d7e34a55-513d-47ee-a3b3-dfb7502ec330) 
*•*[Clever로 로그인](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360000067006?language=ko#h_ce74c2b3-824e-4876-abf9-f048b9263b88)*•*  [Google로 로그인](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360000067006?language=ko#h_8be95b9a-d13c-4b6b-98dd-797cc2d021a0) 
*•*[Active Directory로 로그인](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360000067006?language=ko#h_e8ea1b0b-0f2e-47f7-97d1-e36b66d36cf9) 
*•* [Badge로 로그인](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360000067006?language=ko#h_abace790-5e7f-4e6d-9803-dbdcbcf93814) 
3. [로그아웃](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360000067006?language=ko#h_01EEZZP50G3GWHVTAYVATA4A3G) 
4. [도움을 받을 수 있는 방법은 무엇인가요?](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360000067006?language=ko#h_ffa9b241-1ab9-4cc4-bc4d-677ae0ece396)

Clever에 학생을 로그인하기 위해서는 먼저 Clever와 호환되는 장치 또는 브라우저를 사용하고 있는지 확인합니다. 본 글을 확인한 후 해당 학군의 Clever 로그인 페이지 또는 [clever.com/login](http://clever.com/login)으로 이동하여 로그인을 위해 학생의 학교를 찾을 수 있습니다.

- 참고 사항: 같은 이름을 가진 여러 개의 학교가 있을 수 있습니다. 학생의 학군과 연결된 학교를 선택하세요! 학생의 학교를 찾을 수 없는 경우, 선생님에게 Clever 로그인 방법을 문의하세요.

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000NZ8O&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000002lYgU)

학생 로그인에 대한 추가 도움이 필요한 경우 읽어주세요. 해당 학군의 특정 로그인 방법(예: Google, Active Directory 등)에 대한 지침을 보시려면 아래의 적절한 섹션으로 이동하십시오.

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000NZ8O&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000002lYgZ)

- 학생이 'Log in with Clever(Clever로 로그인)' 옵션을 사용하거나 사용자 이름과 비밀번호를 입력하는 옵션만 있는 경우 해당 학군의 자격 증명을 입력합니다. 
 - 학생이 Clever 계정에 잘못된 자격 증명을 입력한 경우, 'Invalid username or password(잘못된 사용자 이름 또는 비밀번호)'라고 표시된 오류 메시지를 받습니다.

해당 학군이 허용하는 경우, 학생은 'Get help signing in!(로그인 도움 받기!)' 또는 'Get help logging in!(로그인 도움 받기!)' 옵션을 선택하여 비밀번호를 재설정할 수 있습니다.

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000NZ8O&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000002lYge)*참고 사항: 모든 학군에서 학생들이 비밀번호를 재설정할 수 있도록 허용하는 것은 아닙니다. 비밀번호 재설정 옵션이 보이지 않거나 비밀번호 재설정 옵션을 통해 문제를 해결할 수 없는 경우, 학생의 선생님 또는 학교 관리자에게 연락하여 Clever 자격 증명에 대한 도움을 요청하세요.*

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000NZ8O&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000002lYgj)

- 학생이 'Log in with Google(Google로 로그인)' 옵션을 사용하는 경우, 학교가 제공한 이메일 주소와 비밀번호를 사용하여 로그인하도록 리디렉션됩니다. 개인 Google(@[gmail.com](http://gmail.com)) 이메일 주소를 사용하여 로그인하지 않습니다.
- 학생이 아래의 오류 메시지 중 하나를 받게 되는 경우, 다음 방법을 따릅니다. 
 - 잘못된 비밀번호. 다시 시도하거나 비밀번호 찾기를 클릭하여 비밀번호를 재설정합니다. 이는 학생이 학교가 제공한 이메일 주소에 잘못된 비밀번호를 입력했음을 의미합니다. 계정에 올바른 비밀번호를 입력하거나 해당하는 경우 비밀번호를 재설정해야 합니다.
 - 이런! 다음 Google 이메일을 사용하여 인증할 수 없습니다. [xxxx@example.com](mailto:xxxx@example.com): 이는 학생이 입력한 학교가 제공한 이메일 주소와 Clever 계정에 연결된 이메일 주소가 동일하지 않음을 의미합니다. 학교가 제공한 이메일 주소를 사용하고 있는지 확인하십시오.

*참고 사항: 학생의 로그인 자격 증명은 학군에서 구성합니다. 로그인 정보가 확실하지 않거나 학생의 비밀번호를 재설정할 수 없는 경우, 이 섹션을 참조하시길 바랍니다.*

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000NZ8O&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000002lYgo)

- 학생이 'Log in with Active Directory(Active Directory로 로그인)' 방법을 사용하는 경우, Active Directory 페더레이션 서비스(Active Directory Federation Services, ADFS)를 통해 해당 학군의 계정에 로그인하도록 리디렉션됩니다. ADFS에 대한 학생 사용자 이름과 비밀번호는 학생의 학군 관리부서에서 관리합니다. 학생의 자격 증명은 보통 학생이 학교에서 컴퓨터에 로그인할 때 사용하는 이메일과 비밀번호입니다.

- Clever Badge Log in(Clever Badge 로그인)' 옵션을 선택합니다. [clever.com/badges](http://clever.com/badges)로 바로 이동할 수도 있습니다.

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000NZ8O&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000002lYgB)

- 인터넷 브라우저에서 [clever.com](http://clever.com)이 해당 장치의 카메라를 사용할 수 있도록 허용할 것인지 물을 수 있습니다. 'Allow(허용)'을 선택합니다.

- 학생의 Badge를 장치의 카메라에 갖다 대고 녹색 확인 마크가 나타날 때까지 기다려 학생이 Clever에 로그인할 수 있도록 하세요!

Clever에서 로그아웃하려면 Clever Portal로 이동하여 우측 상단 코너에 있는 이름에 마우스를 올려 ‘Log out(로그아웃)’을 클릭합니다.

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000NZ8O&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000002lYgy)

다음의 경우 사용자는 Clever에서 자동으로 로그아웃됩니다.

- 24시간 동안 활동하지 않은 경우
- 브라우저를 종료한 경우(예 "Quit Google Chrome(Google Chrome 종료)"). 
 브라우저 창을 닫는 경우, 사용자는 Clever에서 로그아웃되지 않습니다. 
 ![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000NZ8O&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000002lYh3)

Clever의 로그인 자격 증명은 학군에서 관리합니다. 학생의 로그인 자격 증명이 확실하지 않거나 로그인 시 오류 메시지를 받았거나 학생의 로그인이 갑자기 작동하지 않는 경우, 선생님 또는 학군의 지원 센터에 연락하여 도움을 요청하십시오. 일반적으로 해당 학군의 Clever 로그인 페이지에서 'Get help logging in(로그인 도움 받기)!'를 선택하여 연락처 정보를 찾을 수 있습니다.

대부분의 경우, 학군에서 이메일 주소, 전화 번호를 제공하거나 사용자를 도움을 요청할 수 있는 적절한 담당자 또는 부서로 안내하는 지침을 제공합니다.

지원팀의 연락처를 찾을 수 없다면 학생의 선생님에게 문의하시길 바랍니다.

​![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000NZ8O&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000002lYh8)

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000NZ8O&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000002lYhD) 해당 학군에서 학부모와 학생이 Clever에 로그인할 수 있도록 Family Portal을 활성화했는지 확인하세요! 자세한 내용은 이 글을 참조하십시오.

heading_path: 对于家庭：故障排除 - 登录 Clever
section: 对于家庭：故障排除 - 登录 Clever
text:
标题

对于家庭：故障排除 - 登录 Clever

URL 名称

360000067006

Article Body

本文包含以下内容： 
1. [概述](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360000067006?language=zh_CN#h_719d2eaa-7bb6-4396-8813-34780be24a68) 
2. 登录说明[概述](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360000067006?language=zh_CN#h_d7e34a55-513d-47ee-a3b3-dfb7502ec330) 
*•*[用 Clever 登录](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360000067006?language=zh_CN#h_ce74c2b3-824e-4876-abf9-f048b9263b88)*•*  [用 Google 登录](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360000067006?language=zh_CN#h_8be95b9a-d13c-4b6b-98dd-797cc2d021a0) 
*•*[用活动目录登录](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360000067006?language=zh_CN#h_e8ea1b0b-0f2e-47f7-97d1-e36b66d36cf9) 
*•* [用 Badge 登录](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360000067006?language=zh_CN#h_abace790-5e7f-4e6d-9803-dbdcbcf93814) 
3. [退出](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360000067006?language=zh_CN#h_01EEZZP50G3GWHVTAYVATA4A3G) 
4. [如何获取帮助？](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360000067006?language=zh_CN#h_ffa9b241-1ab9-4cc4-bc4d-677ae0ece396)

让您的学生登录 Clever 的第一步是确保您使用的是一个与 Clever 兼容的设备或浏览器。请访问这篇文章获取详情。确认这一点之后，您就可以导航到您所在学区的 Clever 登录页面，或者到 [clever.com/login](http://clever.com/login) 搜索您学生的学校进行登录。

- 请注意：可能有多个学校同名，所以请务必选择与您学生所在学区相关联的学校！如果您找不到他们的学校，请联系他们的老师了解如何登录 Clever。

请继续阅读，获取关于如何让您的学生登录的额外帮助。请导航至以下适当的部分，获取您所在学区特定的登录方法说明（例如：Google、活动目录等）

- 如果您的学生正在使用“用 Clever 登录”选项，或者只能输入用户名和密码，请输入他们的学区凭证。如果您的学生收到“无效的用户名或密码”的错误提示，这意味着您的学生为他们的 Clever 帐户输入的凭证不正确。

如果您的学区允许，您的学生可以选择“Get help logging in!（获取登录帮助！）” 或者“Get help logging in!（获取登录帮助！）” 选项来重置他们的密码。

*请注意：并不是所有学区都允许学生重新设置自己的密码。如果您未看到密码重置选项，或者密码重置未能解决问题，请联系您学生的老师或学校管理员，以获取关于他们的 Clever 凭证的帮助。*

- 如果您的学生使用“用 Google 登录”选项，他们将被转到使用学校提供的电子邮件地址和密码登录。他们不会使用个人 Google（@[gmail.com](http://gmail.com)）电子邮箱地址登录。
- 如果您的学生收到以下错误，以下是解决方法：
 - 错误密码。重试或点击“Forgot password（忘记密码）”进行重置：这意味着他们输入的学校提供的电子邮件地址的密码不正确。他们将需要为他们的帐户输入正确的密码，或重置密码（如果适用）。
 - 哦哦！我们无法使用 Google 邮箱：[xxxx@example.com](mailto:xxxx@example.com) 进行身份验证：这意味着，他们输入的学校提供的电子邮箱地址不是与他们 Clever 帐户关联的地址。请确保您使用的是学校提供的电子邮箱地址。

*请注意：您学生的登录凭证由学区配置。*

- 如果您的学生使用“用活动目录登录”方法，他们将被转到通过活动目录联合服务 (ADFS) 登录到他们所在学区的帐户。ADFS 的学生用户名和密码由学生所在的学区管理部门进行管理。他们的凭证通常是他们在学校登录电脑时使用的电子邮箱和密码。

- 选择“Clever Badge 登录”选项。您也可以直接访问 [clever.com/badge](http://clever.com/badge)。

- 您的网络浏览器可能会要求您允许 [clever.com](http://clever.com) 使用您设备的摄像头。选择“Allow（允许）”。

- 将您学生的 Badge 举到设备的摄像头前，等待绿色的勾选标记，让您的学生登录到 Clever！

要退出 Clever，请导航到 Clever Portal，将鼠标悬停在右上角您的名字上，然后点击“Log out（退出）”。

用户也会在以下时间之后自动退出 Clever：

- 24 小时不活动
- 浏览器退出（例如，“退出 Google Chrome”)。

How do I print a Badge for a student? 4. How do I void a Badge for a student? 5. Logging in with a Clever Badge 6. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
>  
> Overview
> Badges allow students to hold up a physical badge to their device's webcam to get logged in, instead of typing in usernames and passwords. Badges are perfect for students who have trouble typing or remembering complex passwords - especially younger learners. Teachers get more time to teach, and students get more time to learn! > Badges are tied to the student. As such, changes in school, teacher, or section will not affect the Badge. > If the administrators on your district's Clever account have enabled Badges there are several ways you can manage Clever Badges as a teacher. You can print, regenerate, and void Badges for individual students, print Badges for whole classes, and even void Badges for all students en masse at the end of a school year. >  
> Please note: If you do not see the option to download student Badges, from your Student Roster tab, this means that Badges are not enabled for your district, school, or grade level. Please reach out to your district's tech support for more information. >   
> Pro Tip: Security Badges provide direct access to a student's Clever account and should be protected just like a password. Anyone who has access to a Badge can sign in as the student and access their accounts in both Clever and connected applications. Please protect the security of your students and do not share images of the Badge publicly on social media. >  
> How do I print Badges for a class? > Navigate to the  Student Roster tab under My Students in the left-hand menu 
>    
> Select the desired Class. Click  Download class badges . This will download all Badges for eligible students in your class.

If your student does not have access to a Clever Badge and will need one, please reach out to your district's tech support contact . > Can teachers and staff login using Clever Badges? > No. Clever Badges are only available for students as a primary login method. text:
> Warning: Title For App Partners: District data Access URL Name 360000216886 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Setting up Data Access 3. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
> Overview
> Data access allows you to select which fields are available to your application via Clever’s API. The feature helps districts audit the fields each of their connected applications ingests and ensures you and our other application partners only receive and sync data relevant to your integration. Only application partners with the Rostering (Secure Sync) integration should expect to see the "Data Access" settings in their App Dashboard. Learn more about app integration options with Clever here . >   If your app requires fields outside of Clever's API, you can have them upload them as extension fields. Learn more here . >  
> Data access is broken into two categories for sensitive records types:  
> Required: Fields that are marked as required must be sent by the district to your application Optional: Districts can select which optional fields they want to send to your application
> For non-sensitive record types please select all fields that your application can ingest. Districts cannot opt out of sending these fields if they are included from their SIS to Clever. >  
> Setting up Data Access
> Start with your developer application! By setting and testing changes on your developer application, you can avoid any disruptions for your end users. > 1. Navigate to the  Data Access tab under  Application Settings . Here, you’ll see separate modules for each data type, with the option to edit both required and optional fields for sensitive data types and non-sensitive data types. > 2. Click  Edit Required or Edit Optional (only available for student-related collections) to adjust the data access settings for your application. On the left hand side, you’ll see all fields available for the specific data type.

title: For App Partners: District data Access
heading_path: For App Partners: District data Access
section: For App Partners: District data Access
text:
Click on a field name to move it over to the  Required field list. Fields under Required fields are made available to your application via the API. Fields saved under Available fields will no longer be available for your application once saved. You will be able to come back to this page and add those fields at a later date if you need them. >  
> Please Note: - A field can be marked as either required or optional, but not both. - Fields that are greyed out under ‘Required fields’ are required by Clever to be made available to every application. - If you don’t utilize an entire record type (ex. Student contacts), simply click the Disable [data type]  option for the specific data type. > 3. Click  Save  and repeat for other data types. > 4. Test the settings with your developer application and sandbox district before adjusting them in your production application. >  
> Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
>  
> How is data access different from data validation? > Data access changes the fields that are available to your application via Clever’s API. > Example: Student DOB is not marked as a required or optional field in your dashboard, so it won’t be available to your application via the API even if the district includes it in their feed to Clever from their SIS. > Data validation is a way to check that the data available to your application meets the requirements of your integration. > Example: Student number must be unique within a district. Please read "What are Data Warnings?" for more information on data validation. > Can I adjust field requirements on a district-by-district basis? > No. The field requirements set in your dashboard apply to all connected districts. Districts can select which optional fields they make available to your application via Clever, so the fields available to you via the API may differ slightly from district to district. > How are districts notified of changes to field requirements?

title: For App Partners: District data Access
heading_path: For App Partners: District data Access
section: For App Partners: District data Access
text: > Districts will receive a notification within their Clever dashboard if you make any updates to the required or optional fields once the connection is launched. > What is the difference between sensitive collections and non-sensitive collections? > Sensitive collections are data that pertains directly to students (student + student contacts). Districts have more autonomy to exclude or include fields for these collections on a per app basis. > Some of my fields are missing, how can I get them? > If your application requires ell\_status, iep\_status, or frl\_status let us know and we'll be happy to add those fields for you! > What if I want some of this data in the future? > These settings will be available for you in your dashboard. If your application requires a piece of data in the future you'll simply be able to navigate here and add it. For the majority of districts, that data field will be available upon next sync.

Clever admins have the ability to edit email preferences from their [Clever Dashboard](https://schools.clever.com/) in order to manage the types of emails they will receive from Clever.

**Step 3:** Update your email preferences as desired. When disabling a category of emails, the 'Disabled'  box for an email category should appear as a blue box with white text.

**​Step 4:** Select 'Save' to update your email preferences.

If you have any questions, please reach out to [Clever support](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360001041326)! We are happy to help!
