Hiding SSO or SSO (Saved Password) applications 4. How Clever Admins and School Tech Leads hide resources in the Clever Portal 5. How do hidden applications appear in Clever Portal
> Overview
> This article is an overview of the various methods for preventing logins and hiding applications in Clever. A district may wish to hide applications in a Clever Portal for many reasons, from scheduling an application launch to hiding resources during testing periods. Clever's visibility settings allow districts to manage application access with ease. > Hiding apps vs disabling logins
> There are several options for Clever Admins and teachers to hide or limit access to applications through Clever. > If you only want to hide the application from the Portal but don’t want to prevent logins to Clever, adjust your App Visibility Settings . If you’re looking to block user access to Clever altogether, use  Access Control . > To better understand this, we have created a table that provides insight into these options. > Please note that n one of the features listed in the table below will block direct access to apps rostered through Clever (e.g. users can still log into the app at the app's website outside of Clever if the application supports this). >  
> - Feature: About the feature; Access Control: Clever Admins can temporarily block Clever Portal access so that users can’t access Clever and their applications through Clever.; App Visibility Settings: Clever Admins can hide specific applications in Clever and prevent users from using Log in with Clever (LIWC) buttons.

The app will show up as disabled on Teacher Pages.; Hiding in Portal: Clever Admins and School Tech Leads (if enabled) can hide specific apps and links on the District Page, but applications that are on Teacher Pages are still visible and can be used.; Teacher Page Category Hiding: Teachers can enable this to hide categories and resources within the category on a Teacher Page. This doesn’t affect visibility outside of the specific category on that Teacher Page.

title: For App Partners: Viewing district usage metrics

text:
> Important: Title For App Partners: Viewing district usage metrics URL Name 360000312543 Article Body ​ This article contains the following: ​ 1. Overview  2. Filters ​ 3. Key Metrics ​ 4. District Analytics ​ 5. Sharing
>  
> Overview
> At Clever, we understand how important it is to have insight into how your application is used. With Clever Analytics , you can see graphs and statistics that show how your users are accessing your application and drill down into district usage! This article will give you a breakdown of the available data and how you can use filters to narrow down the information you see. >  
> Filters
> First, let's take a look at the available filters:
>  
> You can use the filters to narrow down the usage data and focus on specific users, applications, and school sites. Different filter sets will cause charts to change- if the filters chosen do not apply to a chart, the chart will temporarily be hidden. > ​ Time Range
> Units
> Here you can select whether you'd like to view your data as a percentage (75% of all students have logged in) or in  absolute terms (7,500 students have logged in). > Users and Grades
>  
> Here you can select whether you want to see usage data for students, teachers, or both. > To look at the analytics for specific grade levels, select the grade(s) from the dropdown. Grades are based on student grades, not the grade level for a section or a teacher. Please note: the teacher filter cannot be used with the grade filter. >  
> Key Metrics
> Now that we know how to use filters to focus on specific areas let's take a look at the different measures! The statistics shown are based on the users who are being shared with apps. The metrics are not based on the total number of users in your Clever account. >       
> Usage by scoped users: This number reflects the number of logins from the users that are shared with your application. > Unique users: This number reflects the unique number of users who have logged into an application.

title: For App Partners: Viewing district usage metrics
heading_path: For App Partners: Viewing district usage metrics
section: For App Partners: Viewing district usage metrics
text:
> Total Logins: This number reflects the overall number of user logins. > Daily unique users
> Daily unique users: This chart reflects the unique number of users who have logged into an application per day. Hover your mouse over a date to see the number of daily unique users for that day. Please note that this chart is disabled if you are using the School year to date time frame filter. > Logins by district
>  
>  
> Logins by district: This number reflects the number of unique user logins to an individual district. Click on Ascending or Descending to order districts by the number of unique logins. Click on the bar for a district to view analytics for that district. > Logins by school  
>  
> Logins by school: This number reflects the number of unique user logins from users at each school site. Click on Ascending or Descending to order schools by the number of unique logins. > Login Method/SIS Type
>  
> Login Method: This number reflects the number of unique user logins by login type. Users will be counted twice if they log in using different login methods- but only once if logging in multiple times using the same identity provider. > District SIS Type : This number reflects the number of your districts syncing to Clever with each SIS type. >  
> District Analytics
>  
>  
> Analytics are also available at the district level, in "Analytics" tab on the district profile. >  
>  
> Sharing
> Export data: This button will download a csv of the data you've currently filtered in your analytics view. > Share: Share insights with members of your team by inviting them to Clever. These users will be given read-only permissions. Your app admin can adjust these permissions on the Team page.

text:
> Tip: Title Clever Badges: How do I enable Badges into Active Directory On-prem managed Windows devices? URL Name 360000384086 Article Body This article contains the following:  1. Overview ​  2. Setup steps       a. NetBIOS domain     b. Locating user credentials     c. Downloading software
> Please note: These instructions only apply to Windows devices that accept Active Directory user credentials. If your users use Entra ID credentials to access Windows devices, please follow the steps listed in our Setup guide for Clever SSO into Entra ID . When using the Entra ID instructions, ensure you do not have the MSI file for this AD On-prem configuration installed on your Windows devices. > Overview
> Clever Badges make accessing apps simple for young students by logging them in to Clever without requiring a username and password. Students hold their physical Clever Badge up to their device camera to log in. However, students often still need to enter a username and password in order to access their device to get to Clever. To simplify that experience, we also offer Badges into Windows for devices that utilize Active Directory logins. When you set up Badges into Windows, students can log in to their device and  Clever with just their Badge. > Student experience
> For students, the login experience is simple. The device's login screen prompts them to scan their Clever Badge. They hold the Badge up to the camera, which instantly logs them into the device, Clever, and all of their Clever applications. > If your district or school is using shared Windows devices for students, the device will remember the login option the previous user selected. Thus, if a user selects  Other user , as shown in the image below, the Windows device will provide that same option for the following user who logs into the device. Ensure the user selects the correct login method from the device login page.

title: Clever Badges: How do I enable Badges into Active Directory On-prem managed Windows devices?
heading_path: Clever Badges: How do I enable Badges into Active Directory On-prem managed Windows devices?
section: Clever Badges: How do I enable Badges into Active Directory On-prem managed Windows devices?
text:
>  
>  
> Setup Steps
> There are three basic steps to setting up this configuration:
> Provide your NetBIOS domain Locate user credentials Download software
> The setup process should take no more than 10 minutes, and you won’t need to configure settings within Active Directory. > Clever’s setup wizard will guide you through the Badges setup. Navigate to the wizard by going to Clever Dashboard > Authentication > Badges > Windows tab . >  
> Finding your NetBIOS domain
> Each Active Directory instance has a NetBIOS domain, which is different from your DNS domain name. To retrieve your NetBIOS domain, open Windows PowerShell as a user logged into the domain and paste in the command below:
> Command: $ENV:USERDOMAIN
> The result will look like this:
> Paste that domain into Clever , and you’re ready to move on to the next step. >  
> Locating User Credentials
> To log students into Windows devices equipped with Active Directory logins, Clever needs the student's Active Directory (AD) credentials. Student AD credentials in Clever must stay in sync with actual student AD credentials. If they get out of sync, students can still log in to the devices with Active Directory, but won’t be able to utilize the Badge login option. >  
> Clever Tip: We recommend disabling password changes in Active Directory for students who will be using this setup. > There are three different ways that you can locate user credentials:
> Select them from the dropdown (recommended) Use a custom configuration (recommended) Upload a csv (not recommended)
> Select from dropdown (recommended)
> The easiest and most reliable way to provide those credentials is to indicate where they are within your existing SIS sync. For example, if student AD usernames are their email addresses, and passwords are their student numbers, and those fields are already syncing to Clever, you would select those fields in the dropdowns within the Badges into Windows configuration wizard.

Instead of selecting a single field, you’ll choose “Custom” in the appropriate dropdown list and paste a formula as pictured below:

> - Student AD usernames or passwords are...: A specific word/phrase that's the same for every student; Formula [fill in portions in brackets]: [add that word/phrase here]; Example formula: apple; Sample result for the student above: apple

title: Clever Badges: How do I manage Badge PINs?
heading_path: Clever Badges: How do I manage Badge PINs?
section: Clever Badges: How do I manage Badge PINs?
text:
> Note: Title Clever Badges: How do I manage Badge PINs? URL Name 360000411306 Article Body This article contains the following:  1. Overview ​ 2. Setting Badge PINs  3. Troubleshooting forgotten PINs
> Overview
> As a security precaution, some districts require students to enter a secure PIN when logging in to Clever with a Badge. In addition, Clever requires a Badge PIN for all students in seventh grade or above who log in using a Badge, minus students with an IEP or ELL status. Clever Admins can disable Badge PINS for students in these grades levels on an individual basis, but not for a group of students. > A district can choose to adjust the PIN requirement settings for Badges to begin at an earlier grade. This can be managed from the Clever Dashboard > Authentication > Badges > Settings tab. >  
> Please note: Classroom MFA users who are in seventh grade or above won’t be required to enter a PIN when using a Badge to log into Clever if they are enrolled in an active policy. >  
>  
> Setting Badge PINs
> To set a PIN, students will navigate to  clever.com/badges , hold their Badge up to the camera, and then be authenticated to the page displayed below. The first time a student uses a PIN-enabled Badge, they will see the screen below prompting them to set a PIN. On this screen, the student will enter their new PIN twice and then be signed in to Clever! After this initial setup, your students will be able to log into Clever using their Badge and their PIN. > Badge PINs can be manually enabled or disabled from a student's details card in the Clever Dashboard > Data browser or from the student profile page using the  Support tools drop-down arrow. These Badge management options are available to Clever Admins, District Help Desk, and School Tech Leads. > Please note: Pin requirements are set when a Badge is first generated. As such, if a student's ELL or IEP status changes later, Clever will not automatically update the requirement for a Badge Pin.

Also,  any student who has a Badge outside the scoped Grades with Badges  setting will need a PIN (including IEP or ELL students who are set to Create individually rather than Auto include in Step 1 of the Badges settings ). To reset the student's pin requirements, their current Badge should be voided and a new Badge generated for them. >  
> Troubleshooting forgotten PINs
> Students : Here is a resource to share with students who need help with their PIN:  For Students: How do I log in to Clever using a Badge? Teachers : Here is how teachers can help their students log in using a backup PIN: For Teachers: How do I help my student log into Clever?

This article contains the following:

3. [What counts as a billable school?](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360000508126?language=en_US#WhatCountsBillableSchool) 
4. [What is the billing frequency for app partners?](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360000508126?language=en_US#HowOftenAmIBilled)

     •[Using licensing to monitor sharing](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360000508126?language=en_US#tools2)

     •[Recommending sharing permissions](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360000508126?language=en_US#tools4) 
     •[Modifying launch dates](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360000508126?language=en_US#tools5) 
9. [I see schools shared with apparently no teachers, students, or sections. Why might this be happening?](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360000508126?language=en_US#NoData) 
10. [What if there are discrepancies between school data in Clever and MDR data?](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360000508126?language=en_US#WhatIfDescrep)

This article contains Frequently Asked Questions about billing. The answers to these questions will vary depending on the terms of your current contract. Most contracts follow the same general structure but reach out to [accounts-receivable@clever.com](mailto:accounts-receivable@clever.com) with any questions.

---

Clever bills by billable schools or users shared depending on your contract. For questions, [contact support](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/contactsupport).

---

We only charge for schools that are explicitly shared and launched.

**Explicitly shared:** This excludes any schools that are shared via dually enrolled users. For example, student X is enrolled in classes at both Clever Middle School and Clever High School. Clever Middle School is shared with your application, but Clever High School isn't. We'll provide access to both school objects via the API, but will only bill for Clever Middle School.

**Launched:** We only bill for launched connections, giving you time to test and get set up! Read more about setting launch dates [here](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115005704686).

---

Partners are billed annually upfront for the contracted annual platform fee. For partners that exceed the amount included in the agreement (overage), these will be billed based on the number of connections at the time of overage multiplied by months left in your contract. You'll receive an invoice that covers how much your overage is.

---

You're billed for any schools or users shared through **launched** district connections on the last day of the month that haven't been filtered out from within your Clever Dashboard. If a school is connected midway through the month, you will still be charged full price for that school for the month.

---

View the number of schools or users you’ll be billed for any given month on the **Billing** tab of your Clever dashboard.

Within the billing tab, you can select a billing period by navigating to **Billing period as of**.

- This is updated nightly.
- This data represents the total number of shared schools and users in launched district connections.
- The number excludes any schools or users you’ve filtered out from within your Clever dashboard.
- Schools or users shared multiple times are only counted once for billing purposes.

From the billing tab, you can:

1. Change the billing period to see what you were billed for in previous months.
2. Request to have a CSV emailed to you for all of the schools or users you're currently being billed for to keep for your records.

---

title: For App Partners: Billing FAQs
heading_path: What do I do if a district overshares data?
section: What do I do if a district overshares data?
text:
Use the billing tab to check the number of schools each connected district shares with your application via Clever. We recommend looking at the tab monthly to avoid any over-sharing issues before your monthly invoice.

If a district shares too much data, there are two ways to remedy this.

1. Reach out to the district to request that they [adjust their sharing settings](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/203115007) so that the appropriate amount of data is shared with your application. If the district needs assistance, they can submit a ticket to our Support Team [via the Help Center form](https://support.clever.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).
2. You can also use the application-side filtering tool to remove excess data from the API. Any schools filtered out using this tool will also be removed from all future invoices. For more information on how to filter excess data, please see this article: [Creating filters for district data](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115003249203?language=en_US)

Finally, you can use our License feature to flag those districts that are oversharing so that you can check this in a programmatic way through your Clever dashboard. For more information on how to set up licenses for a district in your dashboard please see this article: [Setting Up License Usage Limits](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115003921667)

---

We have a few tools that help surface when a district shares too much data with your application.

The first is the licensing feature. This feature allows you to set the number of school or student licenses a district has purchased for your application. If a district exceeds the number of licenses, you and the district will be notified in the Clever dashboard. For more information on the licensing feature, please see [this article](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115003921667).

Applications can now create filters to receive only the needed data, giving you control over data sharing and enhancing integration quality. For instructions on how to set up filters, please see [this article](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115003249203?language=en_US).

Smarter data sharing allows you to recommend sharing settings to districts that are connected with your app. You can send updated recommendations even after districts have enabled data sharing with you. [This article](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360046189771?language=en_US#h_f723888c-6033-4cba-b3fa-f30388209a1b) covers how to send sharing recommendations to a district.

As mentioned above, you are only charged for launched connections. If a district isn't ready to launch, you can modify the launch date to be further into the future until they are set up to begin using the application. This will allow them to set sharing permissions, resolve data quality errors, and complete all their steps on the district end before you begin getting billed for the shared data. More information about setting launch dates can be found here: [For App Partners: Managing district launch dates](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115005704686?language=en_US).

---

We provide access to schools that aren't explicitly shared with your application for users who are associated with multiple schools in Clever. As a result, you might see a school with very limited teacher, section, and student data. You aren't billed for schools not explicitly shared with your application via Clever.

---

You're invoiced based on the number of unique schools shared with your application via Clever. ‘Shared schools’ is defined by the total number of unique Clever IDs available to your application via the API, not by the total number of unique MDR numbers. This data doesn't always align perfectly with MDR data, depending on how the district has structured their schools in their SIS.

---

Need help? For more information, refer to your contract or reach out to [accounts-receivable@clever.com](mailto:accounts-receivable@clever.com)

This article contains the following:

2. [Features](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360000781723?language=en_US#Features)

Schools and districts use Clever as a repository for digital learning resources and applications, providing easy access for staff, teachers, and students. Teachers can add assignments, links, applications, and other resources to their Clever Portals and share them with students. This article highlights some of the main features of the Clever Portal for teachers while also providing links to associated articles that provide more detailed information about each.

![Clever Academy.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000Lo3R&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000035fcW) 
Getting started with the Clever Portal? Check out our course [Clever Academy for Teachers: Level 1](https://clever.academy/level-1-getting-started-with-clever?user_type=teacher)  available in Clever Academy!

---

When first logging in to Clever, teachers are directed to their Clever Portal, which allows them to access their Teacher Pages, Announcements, Clever Library, student support tools, and more!

![Teacher Portal](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000Lo3R&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000MFVQE)

title: For Teachers: Overview of the Clever Portal
heading_path: For Teachers: Overview of the Clever Portal
text:
Teachers can create multiple personalized Teacher Pages to house a variety of learning resources for themselves and their students. Once a teacher has designed their Teacher Page(s), and they've added applications and resources (e.g., learning applications, links to various websites, PDF files, etc.), teachers can share their page(s) with students. Teachers can design multiple Teacher Pages and can even create a different Teacher Page for every class or subject if desired. Teachers in the same school can also share their Teacher Pages with each other to view.

Examples of the resources that can be added to Teacher Pages include:

- District-wide applications
- Various [Clever Library](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360015683471?language=en_US) applications
- Links to online tools (e.g., [Wikipedia.org](http://Wikipedia.org), [Dictionary.com](http://Dictionary.com))
- Homework or assignments
- Community websites (e.g., local public library)
- And more!

Teachers can also create private Teacher Pages for accessing resources and applications that they do not wish to share with students.

For detailed information about Teacher Pages, please visit:

- [Clever Portal: Teacher Pages](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360001158323?language=en_US)

title: For Teachers: Overview of the Clever Portal
heading_path: For Teachers: Overview of the Clever Portal
text:
If your district has this feature enabled, the Clever Library provides a place for teachers to discover, research, and adopt new classroom resources. The resources in the Clever Library can be added to individual Teacher Pages for easy access by teachers and students. Teachers can browse a catalog of over 500 popular resources that they can then add to their Teacher Pages quickly and easily. The Clever Library is organized by grade level and content area and contains descriptions and screenshots of available resources. The search can also be filtered by grade, category, and more!

![Clever Library](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000Lo3R&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl0000044hdZ)

For detailed information about adding applications from the Clever Library, please visit:

- [For Teachers: Library - adding applications](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360013488672?language=en_US)

Announcements are perfect for when teachers have a message to send to an entire class of students. Teachers can send announcements to all students enrolled in a single class or to all students in all classes. Students can then securely view and reply to their teacher's announcement directly from their Clever Portals.

![Announcements](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000Lo3R&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl0000044hgn)

For detailed information about Announcements, please visit:

- [For Teachers: Announcements](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360045714731)

With many schools and districts implementing distance learning for students, Clever's Teacher Analytics allows teachers to more closely monitor how their students are using Clever (e.g., logging in to clever, accessing associated applications, etc.).

![Class Analytics](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000Lo3R&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000MFUxB)

text:
> Tip: Title For App Partners: Troubleshooting Application Logins URL Name 360000900323 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. User Clever login issues 3. Users who do not have access to your app 4. Users who cannot log in to your app through Clever 5. Student accounts are not correct in your app
>  
> Overview
> This article will walk you through helpful tips to troubleshoot user login issues with your application – for both district and Library-enabled connections. Library-enabled teacher sign-ups are much simpler than district connections - there are no sharing rules to configure or overnight syncs, and teachers can make changes directly regarding which of their classes are shared, rather than having to go through a district admin. However, as with any integration, there are potential things that could go wrong. > User Clever login issues
> The first step in troubleshooting a login issue is to verify that the user can log in to Clever. To do this, follow the steps outlined in our Common Single-Sign On (SSO) issues   article to triage the issue and identify where the issue is occurring. Login methods are configured by the district, so if the user has issues logging in to Clever, we recommend directing the user to their district support contact for further investigation. >  
> Clever Tips: • Occasionally, school districts may hide applications in their Clever Portal, which causes users to lose access to the app. You can find out more here: Clever Portal: Hiding Applications • School districts can pause the app sync, which could cause potential login issues (e.g., a new student’s account won’t be synced if on pause).

> Users who do not have access to your app
> District-enabled connections
> For district-enabled connections, you can identify whether a teacher or student is configured to have access to your product by searching for their name in your Clever Dashboard. > First search for the name of the district, and then search for the name of the user:  
> Library-enabled connections
> Please note:  S ince Clever does not share sensitive information with Library applications, the user search feature is only available to district-enabled connections. > If a user has trouble logging into your Library application, they should reach out to their Clever Admin for further assistance (helpful articles to reference: For Clever Admins: Clever Library , Troubleshooting: Logging in to applications ). Your app’s Library integration can also always be tested on the Integration guide page found in your dashboard, under Library > Integration Guide . >  
> Users who cannot log in to your app through Clever
> If teachers or students can click on your product’s icon, but are not logged in successfully, there is likely an issue with how your product processes the login. For district-enabled connections, to allow your team to reproduce and identify the issue, you can initiate a Clever log-in to your application as a specific student or teacher by clicking the Log in as… button on the user’s profile page (accessed by searching for the user by name):
>  
> This kicks off the same OAuth process that occurs when that user logs in via Clever, and should surface any issues that the user is seeing. For Library-enabled connections, verify your Library integration is working as expected by navigating to Library > Integration Guide  in your dashboard.

> Student accounts are not correct in your app
> This issue most commonly occurs when your product has not synced the latest information from Clever. We recommend either syncing data on each teacher log-in, or adding a Sync with Clever or Import from Clever  button to the page in your product where teachers manage their classes, for example:  
> In your Clever Dashboard, you can navigate to the profile page for a student or teacher to see the current information that has been synced from the district’s Student Information System (SIS):
> If the data in Clever for a teacher is incorrect, for example if they are missing a student, it is likely that the district’s SIS is not accurate. In this case, direct the teacher to check with the person at their school who manages the SIS, often referred to as the school secretary or the school registrar.

title: How do I contact Clever Support?
heading_path: How do I contact Clever Support?
text:
IMPORTANT

Please **do not** share sensitive data with Clever Support, such as Personally Identifiable Information (PII), including: 
• Students' names 
• Any credentials (such as usernames and passwords) 
• API Tokens for applications

When you need to specify a user running into trouble, please instead share their Clever ID, or, if that's unavailable, their Student Information System ID.

When in doubt, please contact us first and clarify if it's safe to share data before sending anything.

Clever Support is most efficient at quickly solving issues submitted via the **Support** button, which is available at the bottom right of the Clever Help Center.

![support button](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000VASv&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl0000040Nbp)

**⚠️** If you do not see the button for support, please contact your district IT department. They will need to [allow network access to IP addresses associated with Zoom Contact Center](https://support.zoom.com/hc/en/article?id=zm_kb&sysparm_article=KB0060548#contact-center). For additional network questions, please contact ipaddresses @ [clever.com](http://clever.com)

Select your Clever user type. Once selected, select a common question or enter your own in the chat.

To get the best results, please try to provide a short description of your question or problem. This helps us deliver the most accurate answer possible. For example, instead of writing "**Login",**a better entry would be "**Students using Google can't log in to Clever"** or "**I am a teacher that can not access Newsela".**

![chat bot dialogue](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000VASv&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl0000040NiH)

Once your question is submitted, you will be presented with directions or knowledge related to the question. Use the scrollbar to the right to scroll through the articles provided. To view an article, select **Read more**

When prompted, if the provided information was helpful, select **Yes** 
If the provided information did not answer your question, select **No**

Our virtual assistant will attempt twice to assist with your problem or question. If it's unable to help, select how you would like to contact support to submit a request with our support team. Clever Support is open Monday - Friday, 7am - 8pm ET.

section: Ensure you can receive emails from Clever
text:
In order to ensure you can properly receive mail sent from Clever's help desk platform (Salesforce), please check with your IT department to ensure that:

- Antivirus system is not blocking Salesforce emails (including how your rules and filters are set up)
- SPF, DKIM, and DMARC are properly configured
- Firewall is not blocking IPs
- Mail is not arriving in the SPAM folder
- [Issues with TLS](https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=000326722&type=1&mode=1&language=en_US) - notes Salesforce currently only supports TLS 1.2 for email encryption
- [TLS Mail Delivery - Supported TLS Cipher suites](https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?language=en_US&type=1&id=TLS-Mail-Delivery-Supported-TLS-cipher-suites)

Additional information such as **IP Addresses** and **Domains to Allow** can be found in [this article](https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=000321501&type=1).

> Overview
> Single sign-on (SSO) allows you and your students to access hundreds of applications with one click using your existing Clever account. This way, you only need to remember one set of login credentials. > There are a few options to use Clever's SSO based on your school or district's setup, listed below. >  
> Single sign-on from your district’s Clever Portal
>   With your Clever account, you can log in to your district’s Clever Portal, a single page with all of the SSO applications and links set up for you by your district. > To access an application, simply click on the icon, and you’ll be taken to the application and logged in automatically. > Please note: You and your students will only see the applications your district has set up for you - if your portal or a student’s portal is missing an app, contact your district support contact . >  
> For more information on how to access your Clever Portal, see How do I log in to the Clever Portal as a teacher ? >  
> SSO from a district website
>

> In addition to the Clever Portal, your district might also embed Clever SSO links into other websites, such as a district website or an alternative portal like Stoneware or Encore. In these cases, after clicking on the Clever SSO link, you may be asked to log in to Clever. Once you have logged in to your Clever account, you will be taken directly to the application and logged in.

> Many applications will have a way that you can use Clever SSO directly from their login page - you and your students may simply click  Sign In with Clever ” or Log In with Clever  to log in to the application using your Clever account. > If this is your first time signing in to the application via Clever, and if your district has not already created an account for you in the application, the application may ask to create a new SSO account for you based on your existing Clever account. Similar to what you may have experienced before when using “Log in with Google” or “Log in with Facebook,” Clever will ask you if you are okay sharing information with the application about yourself and the classes you teach for the purposes of creating SSO accounts:

title: Clever Portal: Teacher Pages
text:
> Tip: Title Clever Portal: Teacher Pages URL Name 360001158323 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Creating a new Teacher Page 3. Adding & managing resources o n my Teacher Pages 4. Organizing my Teacher Page 5. Sharing with students and the student experience 6. Sharing resources with other teachers and viewing shared resources 7. Deleting a Teacher Page 8. Transitioning to a new school year   9. Troubleshooting   10. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
>  
> Getting started with Teacher Pages? Check out our  Product Spotlight: Building culture in your classroom with Teacher Pages , available in Clever Academy! >  
> Overview
> Teachers can create personalized Teacher Pages to house a variety of learning resources they want their students to access. Some examples include:
> District-wide applications  Various Clever Library  applications  Links to online tools (e.g., Schooltube, Wikipedia.org , Dictionary.com ) PDFs for vocab lists, booklets, permission slips, etc. Homework or assignments in Google Drive, Office Online, or Google Classroom Community websites (e.g., local public library)
> Before we talk about building Teacher Pages, let's talk about the Pages tab. From your Clever Portal > Pages, you'll see three options: 
> My Teacher Pages , which house:
> Your Teacher Pages! All teachers start with two Teacher Pages:
> One that is private and not visible to students, which can house various resources that are not student-facing. One that is scoped to students. Page visibility can be modified to include students in just one class, multiple classes, all students, and so on! You can make more pages (more on that below). > Any resources you’ve favorited by hovering on the icon and clicking the heart. All resources you’ve added to Clever via your Teacher Pages (such as Clever Library apps, links, and PDFs). > District Page , which houses any apps, programs, and links your district has shared with you.

title: Clever Portal: Teacher Pages
text:
Shared with Me Pages , which houses any Teacher Pages that other teachers at your school have shared with you. > Creating a new Teacher Page
> In the Clever Portal, click the Pages tab from the left-hand side menu and select My Teacher Pages from the drop-down Click  Add in the top right-hand corner
> Edit the page title, add a description, add class resources, and personalize your icon. > Design your Teacher Page by adding your desired  resources , categories , and content. Once you're ready to publish your page to make it visible to students, click More page actions > Share at the top of your page, then select the classe(s) you’d like to share the page with. > Click Update . >           
>   Teacher Login Tools will become available to teachers once they have shared their Teacher Page with students. Visit this article  for more! >  
> Adding & managing resources to my Teacher Pages 
> There are a variety of different resources that can be added to your Teacher Page! > Adding resources  
> You can add four types of resources to your Teacher Page(s):
> Clever Library applications District-added applications Links to websites Uploaded PDFs
> Library resources:
> Clever Library is where teachers can find and adopt new classroom resources. If your district has enabled Clever Library, follow these instructions to add Library apps to your Teacher Page. >  
>    
> District-provisioned applications: 
> Apps your district has added to your Clever Portal say “District” below the app. Adding these to your Teacher Page can make them easier for you and your students to find and access. To add a district app to your Teacher Page:
> Click Add at the top-right of your Teacher Page. Click App A menu will display where you can search for the application and select it. Please note: If you can’t find a district-provisioned application, please contact your Clever district admin to request that they share it with you. Click Add <app name> to add it to your Teacher Page.

title: Clever Portal: Teacher Pages
text:
> If you notice an app on your Teacher Page has turned gray, this means that your district has removed your access to the app. To remove the app icon from your Teacher Page, click ⋮ (The three vertical dots) >    Remove. >  
>    Please note: If you don't see the ability to add links or PDFs to your Teacher Page, your Clever administrator may have disabled this setting. Please reach out to your IT team or administrators directly for assistance. > Links:
> You can add links to any website you want students to access. Links are a great way to provide easy access to websites, videos, Google docs, and more! To add a link:
> Click Add in the top right-hand corner of your Teacher Page and click Link . A menu will display allowing you to paste the URL for the page this link should direct to, which should always begin with HTTPS:// Enter a Title to help your students locate the link. Choose a category for your link. Select one of the provided icons to represent your link, or upload your own icon! To upload your own icon, click Upload to search for the appropriate image from your desktop. Images must be in the .png file format and less than 2 megabytes. Click Add link
> When you add a link, the icon will have a little link icon in the top right corner, so you'll know it's a link. This little identifier on the icon isn't visible to students. >  
> PDFs
> If you have a PDF file, you can add that to your Teacher Page. Simply:
> Click Add in the top right-hand coner of your Teacher Page Click PDF . Select the file to be uploaded from your device. The max file size is 10 megabytes. Enter the File name  to display to students. Select the Category where you want the file displayed on your Teacher Page. Select the desired Icon or upload your own. Once the file has been successfully uploaded to Clever (Cloud is Green), click Add PDF The file is now accessible to students on your Teacher Page! > The icon will have a red PDF icon in the top right corner so you’ll know it's a PDF.

title: Clever Portal: Teacher Pages
text:
This little identifier on the icon isn’t visible to students. > Need help downloading your resource as a PDF to upload to Clever? Directions for popular programs can be found below: 
> Google Docs File > Download > PDF Document (.pdf) Google Slides File > Download > PDF Document (.pdf) Microsoft Word File > Save as > File Format: PDF > Export Microsoft PowerPoint File > Save as > File Format: PDF > Save
>   When the student clicks on the file from your Teacher Page, the PDF will open in their web browser (e.g., Google Chrome). They can download or print the PDF using the tools in the top-right corner: 
>  
> Organizing Teacher Pages
> To keep your Teacher Page neat and easy for students to navigate, you can organize resources into different categories. Categories provide a way to separate your resources by unit, topic, etc. Please note:
> Create new categories by clicking the Add button in the top right of your Teacher Page and then selecting Category . Categories can be reordered or deleted by using the arrow and trash icons next to the category name. Resources can be reorganized by dragging and dropping them into the appropriate categories. If you have a category that you don’t want students to see just yet (such as your next unit of study that’s starting in a few weeks), you can hide the category by clicking the eye icon in the top right of the category! When you’re ready for the category to be visible, click on the eye icon again. If a student is already on your page when you hide/unhide a category, they’ll need to refresh the page to see the change. >    
> Modifying links and resources
> Deleting content Links and resources can be deleted from Teacher Pages by following these instructions:
> From your Teacher Page, hover over the resource or link you'd like to remove and click the three vertical dots (⋮) .

title: Clever Portal: Teacher Pages
text:
In the menu that opens, click Remove
> Copying content to another page You can also copy any link or resource to another Teacher Page that you've created:
> From your Teacher Page, hover over the resource or link you'd like to remove and click the three vertical dots (⋮) . In the menu that opens, click  Edit and choose the page to which you want to add the resource at the bottom of the pop-up. > Sharing with students and the student experience
> Once you've created a Teacher Page, be sure to preview what it looks like for students by clicking More page actions > Preview Page at the top of your Teacher Page. > After confirming it looks great, you can share it with students by following these steps:
> Click Share at the top of your Teacher Page, and select the appropriate student access. Click Save . > You can remove student access anytime by returning to the Share button. When students log into Clever, they’ll see an icon in their Portal for each Teacher Page that has been shared with them:
> When students click on your Teacher Page icon, they’ll be directed to your page and can access all associated resources. >  
>    Please note: For security reasons, Clever admins can disable Teacher Pages for students for up to 90 days. You will see a notification in the Teacher Pages area of your Portal stating the dates for which pages are disabled. Students will see a note that their Teacher Pages will be right back! You'll still be able to access and edit your page, but students won't be able to see it during this timeframe. >  
> Sharing resources with other teachers and viewing shared resources
> You can share your Teacher Pages and individual resources with teachers in your school and view others’ resources when they share them with you. Learn more here! > Deleting Teacher Pages
> Clever requires at least one Teacher Page per teacher account. If you determine you don’t want students to access a page, you can modify the student sharing, so the page is only visible to you.

title: Clever Portal: Teacher Pages
text:
If you have multiple Teacher Pages and would like to delete one of them, navigate to your My Teachers Pages tab, then click Delete . Please know that there is no way to undo deleting a Page . If you have a page you might want to use in the future, we recommend unsharing it with students and keeping it for future use. > Transitioning to a new school year 
> Great news: Teacher Pages are preserved across academic years! You don't need to recreate Teacher Pages for your students. When your school transitions to a new school year in Clever, our system automatically updates any Teacher Pages shared with specific sections to Just me sharing. This excludes pages set to Only You or All students you teach  as the sharing setting. This update ensures that Teacher Pages are consciously shared with your students. As such, students won't see a section-specific Teacher Page until you decide to share it with them. As a teacher, you’ll see an Attention Needed message for any Teacher Page that’s affected. When you click on the Teacher Page, you’ll be guided through re-sharing it with students for the new academic year. >  
>    Please note: To prevent schedule exposure during school year rollovers, Clever admins may disable Teacher Pages for students for up to 90 days. You will see a notification in the Teacher Pages area of your Portal stating the dates for which pages are disabled. Students will see a note that their Teacher Pages will be right back! You'll still be able to access and edit your page, but students won't be able to see it during this timeframe. >  
>  
>  
> Troubleshooting
> New School Year If your students can't see your Teacher Page, you may need to reshare the page at the start of the new school year. See: Transitioning to a new school year
> New Teacher\_ID (SIS\_ID) If you can't see your Teacher Pages, please check with your school to see if your teacher ID has changed. If it has, you won't be able to access your previous Teacher Pages.

title: Clever Portal: Teacher Pages
text:
If your district can revert your teacher ID to its previous value, your Teacher Pages will be restored. If your district cannot revert your teacher ID to its previous value, Clever cannot restore the Teacher Pages. If you are unsure why a user's teacher\_id has changed, please contact your SIS provider. Clever is unable to troubleshoot why a teacher\_id value may have changed in the data being synced to Clever. >  
> Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
> Can Teacher Pages be shared with individual students or custom groups of students? > Teacher Pages cannot be shared with individual students/select groups of students. You can only share Teacher Pages with whole classes or all students you teach. > Can I copy resources from one Teacher Page to another? > Yes, once a resource is added to a Teacher Page, you can add it to another Teacher Page by clicking the 3 dots (⋮) in the corner of the resource > Edit, and then select the page you want to add the resource to under Add to another page at the bottom. > Can I duplicate my Teacher Page? > No, Teacher Pages cannot be duplicated. > When creating a resource, can I select multiple Teacher Pages to add it to? > No, but you can add it to other Teacher Pages after the resource has been created. Once created, click the 3 dots (⋮) in the corner of the resource > Edit, and then select the page you want to add the resource to under Add to another page at the bottom. > Why am I unable to add PDFs or links to my Teacher Page? > For security reasons, Clever admins can turn off the option for teachers to add links and PDFs to their Teacher Pages. If you are unable to add PDFs or links, please contact your IT team or administrator. > Why are my links and PDFs missing from my Teacher Page? > For security reasons, Clever admins can turn off the option for teachers to add links and PDFs to their Teacher Pages. If you are unable to add PDFs or links, please contact your IT team or administrator.

> Why do I see a notification that my Teacher Pages are disabled? > Clever admins can disable Teacher Pages for up to 90 days. You'll still be able to access and edit your page, but students won't be able to see it during this timeframe. > How many Teacher Pages do I need to create? > Whatever works best for you and your students! If you have multiple classes you teach, it can be helpful to have a Teacher Page for each class you teach. However, if that's too much to manage, you can have one Teacher Page and organize it by class using categories. > Can I transfer my Teacher Page to my new school district? > No, at this time you aren't able to transfer your existing Teacher Page to a new school district.
