heading_path: For App Partners: Updating my email preferences
section: For App Partners: Updating my email preferences
text:
Title

For App Partners: Updating my email preferences

URL Name

360001188006

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360001188006?language=en_US#Overview) 
2. [Instructions](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360001188006?language=en_US#Instructions)

Application partners have the ability to edit their email preferences in Clever in order to manage which communications they will receive related to district connections. Application email preferences do not include marketing emails from Clever!

To update your email preferences, follow these steps:

From the application dashboard, click on your name in the top right corner and select 'Email Settings'.

![Red arrow pointing to email settings link from dropdown menu](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka01P000000QluP&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000004y7gb)

title: For App Partners: Updating my email preferences
heading_path: For App Partners: Updating my email preferences
text:
Update your email preferences as desired. A category of emails will be disabled if 'Disabled' appears as white text with a blue background.

There are five types of email options that can be enabled or disabled:

1. **Sharing:** Notifications are sent when districts change their data sharing permissions
2. **Connected districts:** Notifications are sent when a connection to a district is updated (ex. if a district disconnects your application, you will receive a notification about it)
3. **Requests and invite changes:** Notifications about status updates on your requests and invitations to districts
4. **Requests and invite initiations:**Notifications about new requests from districts
5. **Disconnects:**Notifications about districts disconnecting from your app

![Email preferences toggles with save button](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka01P000000QluP&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000004ZgfN)

**Select 'Save'** to save your updated email preferences.

title: For Teachers: Rename a Class
text:
> Note: Title For Teachers: Rename a Class URL Name 360001199243 Article Body This article contains the following: 1.  Overview 2.  Renaming steps
> Overview
> Teachers can rename classes within their Clever Portal. By default, your class names will be what is listed in your district's student information system (SIS).
> Renaming a class is especially useful if your class names are long and difficult to remember (e.g. "Grade 5 Reading, Class 501 - 501 (14\_10)").  
> Please note:  Renaming of classes will only apply to classes  within the Clever Portal . If you would like to rename your classes within an application, please reach out to your Clever administrator or check in with the application's support team to see if they can help!
>   Renaming steps
> 1. From your Clever Portal, head to My Students > Student Roster.
> 2 Choose the class you want to rename.
> 3. Click Edit class nickname , update the name, and click  Save .

title: Single Sign-On (SSO): Testing User Logins
text:
Title

Single Sign-On (SSO): Testing User Logins

URL Name

360012704892

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360012704892?language=en_US#Overview) 
2. [How to test single sign-on (SSO) logins](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360012704892?language=en_US#TestingSSOLogins) 
3. [Tips and Troubleshooting](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360012704892?language=en_US#TipsTroubleshooting)

You’re almost ready to roll out Clever single sign-on (SSO) at your district saving students and teachers hours of class time each week! Before you do, you will want to run one last test to make sure your setup is working properly. This step should only take a few minutes to complete.

---

title: Single Sign-On (SSO): Testing User Logins
text:
- First, make sure you have the Clever login credentials for a few students and teachers.
- Then, navigate to your [Clever Dashboard > Authentication > SSO settings](https://schools.clever.com/instant-login/accesscontrol) page to copy your district's unique Clever login Portal URL. For instructions on customizing your Portal URL, visit [this article](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/205818838).
- Open an incognito browser window (e.g. [Chrome](https://support.google.com/chrome/answer/95464?co=GENIE.Platform%3DDesktop&hl=en), [Firefox](https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/private-browsing-use-firefox-without-history#w_how-do-i-open-a-new-private-window) & [Edge](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/4026200/microsoft-edge-browse-inprivate)).
- Paste your district's Portal URL in the address bar and hit enter. This will lead you to your district's unique Clever login page.
- Attempt to log in as various users to see if you are successful.

---

title: Single Sign-On (SSO): Testing User Logins
text:
- If you can't use an incognito window, a regular browser window is fine. You will just need to make sure you’re logged out of Clever, and any other Identity Providers (e.g. Google, Active Directory), before attempting to log in as another user. Otherwise, you will continue to be logged in to your account rather than the one you are testing.
- If you don’t have access to student or teacher login credentials, have a small group of teachers test their own logins to see if they are successful. You can share the [login instructions](https://schools.clever.com/portal/settings) with them that are downloadable from your [Clever Dashboard > Portal > Portal settings](https://schools.clever.com/portal/settings/url) page.
- Utilize your [Clever Dashboard > Authentication > Access logs](https://schools.clever.com/access-logs) to make sure logins are successful, and find information about any errors you’re seeing. You can search for specific users and see more details on what caused the issue. For more about Login Logs, visit [this article](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202113063).

![Details.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000ThzF&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000004aq9Z)

Once you’ve tested Clever SSO, and have confirmed successful logins, make sure to let your district users know they can log in! Track the success of your user logins and Portal usage from your [Clever Dashboard > Analytics > Portal analytics](https://schools.clever.com/analytics/sso-usage) page.

If you continue to have issues, please visit [these helpful troubleshooting articles](https://support.clever.com/hc/en-us/sections/201466977)!

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000ThzF&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028Dxv) If your tests have been successful, see [this article](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360012942731) for details on launching Clever at your district!

title: For Admins: Navigating the new login experience
heading_path: For Admins: Navigating the new login experience
section: For Admins: Navigating the new login experience
text:
> Important: Title For Admins: Navigating the new login experience URL Name 360012942731 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Timeline 3. What to expect 4. Why Clever updated the login experience 5. Email templates for communication with your schools about the new login page 6. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
>  
> Overview
> We know how important smooth logins are for your users. Clever’s new login experience simplifies logging in to minimize challenges and get to learning quickly. This article explains what’s changing, when changes will roll out, and how to prepare and communicate with users who may be impacted. >  
> Please note: All updates listed in this article do not apply to all schools. Please review the notes listed in each phase to determine which users or schools will be impacted. >    
> Timeline
> Clever’s login experience will be rolled out in six phases between February 3rd and June 2026. This timeline is a rough estimate of when updates will occur, and some dates may shift as we continue to refine the experience. Districts can also choose to opt in to more frequent communications about ongoing login changes here . Learn more about what these changes will look like below. >  
>    
> What to expect
> Two panel view
> This is an example school configuration with Google and Badges, but each school’s screen will vary based on your login methods. > This is an example school configuration with Microsoft and Badges, but each school’s screen will vary based on your login methods. >  
> Impacted users: All Clever users 
> Clever’s login page is getting a refreshed look with two panels and new photography, while keeping the same familiar login flow. These updates are designed to make logging in easier, more secure, and more intuitive for all users.

title: For Admins: Navigating the new login experience
heading_path: For Admins: Navigating the new login experience
section: For Admins: Navigating the new login experience
text:
>  
> New District login flow
>                      
>  
> Impacted users: Users who do not log in with a custom portal URL and instead go to clever.com/login  
> Users who log into Clever without a district portal URL will see a new, student-friendly login page. > Badge users will no longer need to search for their school. They can simply click the Badge icon to log in faster. > All other users will click the Password icon, then select their school, and follow the preferred login process from there. > This update helps students and staff get where they need to go more quickly, with fewer steps. >  
> Login and Help pages
>  
> Impacted users: All Clever users
> All users will see a new district/school login screen with the district’s pre-configured login options. Users will also be able to see their district’s default custom icon if one has been uploaded. If an icon has not been uploaded, users can expect to see a pre-populated icon. > If users need help with logging in, they will no longer see the Having trouble? prompt on their login screen. Now, users will click Get help to be taken to their new Help page where users can find everything they need on one screen. > Clever will only support login hints for Clever Passwords. Login hints will no longer be supported for any other Identity Providers (IDPs). > New Badge flow
>  
> Impacted users: Clever Badge users
> Badge users will begin to see and hear a new success animation when they log in with a Clever Badge. If a login attempt is unsuccessful, users will see a clear error message explaining what went wrong. >  
> Clever Passwords flow
> Impacted users: Clever Passwords users
> Clever Passwords users will first enter their email address or username. Once verified, they will be asked to enter their password. If there's a typo or the account doesn't exist, the user is notified right away, so they don't have to enter a password to find out.

title: For Admins: Navigating the new login experience
heading_path: For Admins: Navigating the new login experience
section: For Admins: Navigating the new login experience
text:
This change makes the login experience clearer and easier for users and aligns with industry standards. >  
> Admin login flow
> Impacted users: Clever Admins
> The Clever Admin login page is getting a refreshed look to help simplify logins. This new login screen will include Google and SSO options so that admins have a designated login screen. > Why Clever updated the login experience
> Our goal with the new modernized login experience is all about getting learners, especially your youngest ones, to learning faster while reducing login-related help desk tickets that jam up your cues. >  
> The login is the secure gateway to learning where trust is verified. We want every login experience, regardless of which user type or how old the user is, to feel as seamless as using the rest of Clever is. But over the years, we’ve received a lot of feedback around how our diverse community accesses Clever and the challenges they face. That’s why we’re doing this overhaul of the login. It started in 2025 with improvements we made to error messages so students and staff can better understand what the issue is and address it quickly. We also added multi-role logins making it easy to toggle between your teacher and staff accounts without having to log out and back in. >  
> The changes you’ll see in 2026 are a continuation of this effort. We’ve examined every step of the login flow, worked through every common login challenge, and of course, rigorously tested our changes with all types of end users so we know it works. The changes you will see over the first half of 2026 will result in a modern, seamless, and secure login experience that prioritizes your students and helps them focus on learning above all else.

title: For Admins: Navigating the new login experience
heading_path: For Admins: Navigating the new login experience
section: For Admins: Navigating the new login experience
text:
> Email templates for communication with your schools about the new login page
> Click here for an email template to inform teachers of the two panel view update
> Subject:  Important Update about change to Clever login look 
> Hi everyone,
> I'm writing to let you know that starting on February 3rd , the Clever login page is getting a fresh now look. The background picture is being updated to a new image that will only take up the left side panel (see example image below). There will be a few more small visual changes to the Clever login over the following months too. > Here is the important part: This is a visual update only . The login process itself is not changing. > Clever Badges still work exactly the same way. > Passwords/Google/SSO logins still work exactly the same way. > You do not need to do anything to prepare. > Why the change? Clever is redesigning the login screen to be more focused and faster, making it easier for our younger students to find their login path and get to learning quickly. > What to expect: Because the screen looks different, students might ask if they are in the right place. Please assure them that this is the official, secure Clever login page. > Here is a preview of what this initial new login screen looks like so you can recognize it:
>    
> If you run into any issues, please reach out to our help desk as usual. > Best,
> [District Administrator Name]
>  
> Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
> Why can’t schools opt out of this visual design? > Even though Clever has allowed schools in the past to opt in/out of certain visual changes for a period of time, the nature of these login visual changes don’t allow us to do that. The initial login screens aren’t tied to a specific district/school org instance and so the experience will be universal. > Even though schools can’t opt out, we’re confident that the changes are relatively minor and won’t provide major disruption to learners.

title: For Admins: Navigating the new login experience
heading_path: For Admins: Navigating the new login experience
section: For Admins: Navigating the new login experience
text:
We’ve validated each of the new screens via rigorous user testing with students and adults. >  
> Why release in phases rather than all at once? > Adopting a phased roll out helps us prevent large-scale bugs by actively testing each release as it goes out. > For example, if we released all at once over the summer and we have a mix of old and new code in the login code base, it could result in bugs during Back to School. We want to make sure users get in the first time, every time - so we need to release this universally. >  
> Will any core login functionality be changing? > No, the login redesign is mostly a new visual treatment for each of the login screens in today’s flow. Students and teachers will login the same exact way they did before. > The only “change” will be for admins as we give you a more direct route to access Clever. Your admin login screen will now have SSO/3rd Party IdP sign in options so you can quickly and easily navigate to Clever. >  
> What should districts/school organizations do if they notice a suspected bug? > They should write into Clever support and let our support team know. They will work with our engineering team to resolve the bug as fast as possible. >  
> How can districts best stay informed of the ongoing changes? > Districts can choose to opt in to more frequent communications about ongoing login visual changes throughout the first half of the year. Otherwise, admins can reference back to this article and the product releases page to see which updates have recently been rolled out. >  
> How can students and teachers see the new changes? > Students and teachers can reference the following articles to see the latest update to their login page. > For Students: Troubleshooting - Logging into Clever
> For Teachers: Logging into Clever

title: For Teachers: Clever Library - adding applications
heading_path: For Teachers: Clever Library - adding applications
section: For Teachers: Clever Library - adding applications
text:
> Note: Title For Teachers: Clever Library - adding applications URL Name 360013488672 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Locating resources in the Library 3. Installing resources from the Library 4. What will my students see? 5. How do I remove a resource installed from the Library? 6. Why might my school system restrict the Library? > Overview
> Clever Library is a safe way for teachers to explore new classroom tools. Instead of finding new applications that may have varied data privacy standards, teachers can try new apps from the Library with data-privacy guardrails and admin oversight. When a teacher adopts a Library application with SSO, Clever shares only the absolute minimum information: student first name, last initial, grade level, and course enrollment. The resources in the Library can be added to individual Teacher Pages for easy access by students and teachers. > Locating resources in the Library
> To find resources in Clever Library, please follow these steps:
> Log in to your Clever Portal. From there you can either:
> Select the Library tab on the left sidebar to browse for resources and install apps for your students and classes. Or, use the search bar at the top of the page to locate specific resources to install. > If you follow the steps above and you are unable to locate Clever Library or locate a specific resource, either:
> Your Clever Admin has disabled the Library. You won’t see a Library tab in your Clever Portal. If you attempt to add an application directly via their website using a Sign Up with Clever button, you’ll see a notification that “Your district has disabled sign up with Clever”. > The app isn’t available in Clever Library and may be a district-level application that your Clever Admin must add. > The application isn’t a Library application, and you must add it to your Teacher Page  as a link. > Installing resources from the Library 
> Adding resources from the Library is quick and easy!

title: For Teachers: Clever Library - adding applications
heading_path: For Teachers: Clever Library - adding applications
section: For Teachers: Clever Library - adding applications
text:
However, before installing a new resource, please be sure to follow your district and school policies for vetting new applications. This may include taking steps with your IT or administrative team to confirm the application abides by your district’s security and data privacy policies. > Once confirmed, locate the resource in Clever Library, and select the blue Install  button at the top right corner. >  
> Please note: If you navigate to a Library application and see the Install button is grayed out, your school has blocked this application. You can read more about Library restrictions below or reach out to your IT team or Clever Admin for more information. If a Clever Admin blocks an application you’re already using, the application will be removed for your Teacher Pages and student Portals. >  
> Installing an application will add it to your Teacher Page and also automatically set up single sign-on (SSO) accounts for you and your students. There is no need to manually input student information, or print out password cards! > Library applications require certain data points from Clever in order to set up single sign-on for you and your students. This includes data such as first name, last initial, grade. Library applications only receive a limited set of data from Clever, however, when installing a Library resource, Clever may ask you to verify that you want to share this data with the application. > An example of the prompt you may receive to share data with a Library app  
> What will my students see? > Students don't have access to browse resources in Clever Library. However, they will see any Library resources you made visible to them in your Teacher Page! > When your students click on your Teacher Page icon from their Clever Portal, they'll be presented with your designed page and associated applications. > For more information, please visit:  For Teachers: What are Teacher Pages? >  
> How do I remove a resource installed from the Library?

title: For Teachers: Clever Library - adding applications
heading_path: For Teachers: Clever Library - adding applications
section: For Teachers: Clever Library - adding applications
text:
>  
> If you no longer want a Clever Library app to show up on one of your Teacher Pages, head to the Teacher Page where you added the Library app. > Then, click the  three vertical dots and then select Remove from your Teacher Page. > A pop-up will appear confirming you'd like to remove the app. Click Remove . >  
> The app will be removed from your Teacher Page and will no longer be visible to students on that Page. >  
> The library app will continue to appear on your Resources page unless you Uninstall it by going to Clever Library, finding the app, removing it from any Teacher Pages, and clicking Uninstall . >  
> For more information about Teacher Pages, please visit:  For Teachers: What are Teacher Pages? >  
> Why might my school system restrict the Library? > Your school system’s Clever Admin can block specific applications in the Library or disable the Library entirely. Clever gives admins this control because school systems often have different policies about which applications can be used with students, and they must comply with student data privacy and cybersecurity laws that vary by state. > With cyber threats on the rise—and attacks becoming more sophisticated through AI—some school systems are taking a stricter approach. This allows them to oversee where and how student data is shared. Since school systems, not teachers, are ultimately responsible for any student data breaches, many are tightening control over which applications students can access to better protect sensitive information. > If you have questions about why a Library application has been blocked or why the Library is disabled, we recommend contacting your IT team. They can explain any review or approval processes in place for the applications you’d like to use with students.

title: Troubleshooting: App issues
text:
> Important: Title Troubleshooting: App issues URL Name 360014923052 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. App is missing 2. User clicked on app, and received an error 3 . User c licked on app, and Clever asked for a username and password 4. Data incorrect in apps 5. Problems within apps
> Please note: It's important to distinguish between an issue logging into Clever (a user can't access Clever) and an issue accessing an application from within the Clever portal (e.g after the user has successfully logged into Clever). If a user can't access Clever, that is a separate troubleshooting issue from what we cover here. Please see this article to help troubleshoot users' access to Clever: Troubleshooting: Troubleshoot Login tool . For more information about what team you should contact for support, we have a great video resource that can provide more insight: Getting support for district admin . > Overview
> Occasionally users run into issues with their applications. This can be due to a user not being shared with an app to errors occurring within the application (which would need to be addressed by the application's support team). This article will go over some of the common issues and guide you on how to troubleshoot. > App is missing
> If a user is missing an app in the Clever Portal, please confirm the user is shared with the application. The most common reasons a user is not shared with an app are:
> The user does not have any sections in Clever. The user does not meet the filter criteria for sharing rules (usually section grade level or subject)
> In both cases, you will want to confirm they are enrolled in sections in your student information system (SIS) and that the data is synced to Clever. Alternatively, you may need to adjust the sharing permissions for the application to ensure the user is shared. You can learn about sharing permissions here:  Sharing Permissions: Overview .

title: Troubleshooting: App issues
text:
> ​​
>  
> User clicked on app, and received an error
> Clever has an excellent tool for debugging this scenario. Please see this article for information on using the "Troubleshoot Login" tool. In general, if a user clicks on an application in the Clever Portal and receives an error on the application's page, please reach out to the application's support team for help . Most login issues must be resolved by the application's support team. > Clever Tip: If they are seeing an error at a web URL that is  not a Clever address, it's likely that the application's team is best equipped to help fix the issue. Please reach out to the application's support team to investigate further! > Here are examples of common errors you might see for specific applications:  ​  
>  
> Clicked on app, Clever asked for a username and password
> If a Clever page asks a user to enter their username and password for an application, enter the correct login information for that application, and click Save Login. If the device has the Clever browser extension downloaded, Clever will save this information and automatically log the student in next time they click the icon from the Portal! >  
> If a user clicks on an application and sees the page below, this means we were not able to log in the user with the username and password they provided. Please have them enter their correct username and password for the application, and click ' Update & Log in '. >  
> If they are still having trouble, please confirm that the username and password they entered will allow them to successfully log into their account directly on the application's page (i.e. at schoology.com ). If you can access the app directly through the app's website but not through Clever, please contact Clever Support for help! > Did you know? Applications that prompt users to manually enter credentials as shown above are called SSO (Saved Passwords) applications.

title: Troubleshooting: App issues
text:
Learn more about these applications in this Help Center article:  For Teachers: What are Saved Passwords applications? >  
>  
> Data incorrect in apps
> If the data in an application is incorrect (e.g. rosters, students, and school associations), please see this article . > Please note:  Most applications sync with Clever daily. Please allow up to 24 hrs for newly updated or shared data in Clever to be reflected in your connected applications. For more information, visit:   How often will my applications sync with Clever? >  
>   
> Problems within applications
> After a user clicks on an application from the Clever Portal, their experience within the app is controlled by that app. Clever does not have any insight into the inner workings of an application. A good analogy would be to think of Clever as the key to opening the door to the application, but once that door is open, we do not go inside. If a user is running into an issue within the application,  please contact the application’s support team for help. > Here are common examples of when an application’s team will be best equipped to provide support:
> You are receiving an error message on the application’s website You are seeing incorrect data within the application, but correct data within the Clever You are having trouble accessing grades, homework, textbooks, videos, resources, or running reports within the application Your sections have access to the incorrect content within the application You have questions about features within the application The application does not save a student’s progress The application is frozen The application logs or kicks you or your students out You need to merge or match an old or preexisting account with the one created through Clever

title: For Clever Admins: Clever Library
text:
> Tip: Title For Clever Admins: Clever Library URL Name 360015683471 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Viewing Library installs 3. Blocking Resources 4. Turning off Library 5. Supporting teachers when restricting the Library 6. Recommending Resources 7. How recommendations appear to teachers
>  
> Overview
> Clever Library is a safe way for teachers to explore new classroom tools. Instead of finding new applications anywhere on the internet that may have varied data privacy standards, teachers can try new apps from the Library with data-privacy guardrails and admin oversight. Resources in the Library can be added to a teacher’s Teacher Page for easy access by students and teachers. > As a Clever Admin, you have primary control over what teachers can access in the Clever Library. You’re able to block Library applications that your district hasn’t approved or may not want teachers utilizing, and similarly you can leave approved apps accessible to teachers. > When a teacher adopts a Library application with SSO, Clever shares only the absolute minimum information: student first name, last initial, grade level, and course enrollment. > Clever does not share any sensitive information with Library applications, including student number, SIS ID, email, state ID, school/district information, or any demographic information about the student. All Library applications sign a universal data privacy agreement . >  
> Viewing Library Installs
> To view applications that have been installed by teachers, navigate to your Library controls > Applications tab . Here you'll see a column next to each application that shows you how many Teacher Installs the app has. > To view installs with greater detail, scroll to the bottom and select Export teacher install data.

title: For Clever Admins: Clever Library
text:
> The information provided in the downloadable CSV is described below:
> - Field: Description
> - teacher\_id: The Clever ID of the teacher that installed the resource
> - first\_name: The first name of the teacher that installed the resource
> - last\_name: The last name of the teacher that installed the resource
> - email: The email address of the teacher that installed the resource
> - school: The school of the teacher that installed the resource
> - app\_id: The Clever ID of the resource installed
> - app\_name: The name of the installed resource
> - install\_date: The date the teacher added the resource
>  
> Blocking Resources
> If your district prohibits particular resources, you may also add them to a block list. For instance, if your district’s firewall blocks specific websites, you can also block them in the Library as well. Blocking a resource will prevent teachers from adding it to their Clever Portal. It’ll also remove the application from the Portal and Teacher Pages of any teachers who had already added it. When they search for and attempt to add the application, the Install button will appear gray and unclickable, with a note to contact their Clever Admin for more information. > Clever recommends checking the teacher installs for an application before blocking to ensure that no teachers are currently using it. You can check which teachers are using a Library application via the Library controls > Applications tab and clicking the Export teacher install data button. > If teachers are currently using an application you wish to block, you should notify them. See our section below on supporting teachers for more information. > To edit the list of resources currently being blocked by your district, please navigate to the Clever Dashboard > Applications > Library Controls > Applications tab . To block a single application, click the  Block button and confirm you want to block and remove the application for teachers.

title: For Clever Admins: Clever Library
text:
To block multiple applications, check the boxes next to each application you’d like to block, then click the Block X selected button to block all selected applications. > If a teacher searches for or tries to install a blocked resource, Clever will gray out the install button and display the message below that the application has been blocked. > To block all applications and select only approved apps:
> Click the top checkbox next to the Application Name column to select all apps. > To preserve the installs of any allowed apps, use the search bar to individually search for and uncheck these applications. If you do not remove these applications from the list, they’ll be deleted from Teacher and student Portals. > Once you have unchecked any applications you’d like to allow and preserve data for, click the Block X selected applications button to block all other applications. See the video below for a quick tutorial on how to allow only specific applications:
>  
> Note: Blocking a resource does not prevent teachers or students from going around the safety of the Clever Portal and accessing the resource directly. >  
> Turning off Library
> If your district would like to disable all Library data sharing, you can do so by navigating to Clever Dashboard > Applications > Library Controls > Settings . You’ll see the option to Disable Clever Library. > Clever will request that communication be sent to teachers to alert them of the upcoming changes to their accounts. Once complete, our team will securely remove the Library resources from their Clever Portal. >  
> Supporting teachers when restricting the Library
> Some teachers may depend on applications available in the Clever Library. If you plan to block certain applications or turn the Library off entirely, we recommend informing teachers in advance. > Clever doesn’t notify teachers directly in advance about Library changes made by your school organization.

title: For Clever Admins: Clever Library
text:
Instead, we suggest you share the update internally because:
> You can choose the timing and secure any necessary team approvals. > Clever can’t email every user due to subscription preferences. > Teachers are more likely to read an email from your school system than from Clever. > Hearing about changes directly from your team builds trust. > You can find and download a list of Library applications your teachers are using on your Clever Dashboard's Applications > Teacher installs page. You can use this list to inform teachers of applications you plan to block or to tell only teachers currently using the Library that you plan to disable it . > Below are talking points you can use when preparing your message to teachers about changes to the Clever Library. >  
> Balancing teacher autonomy with security and data privacy 
> The Clever Library gives teachers the flexibility to discover and quickly start using new applications with their students. While every Library application signs a universal data-sharing agreement, some school systems have stricter requirements. These districts or schools may review Library applications more closely before allowing them to be used with students. > In many cases, this approach is driven by state legislation or the school system’s own risk assessment. As a result, certain applications may be removed from the Library until they have completed the school system’s security review or other application procurement and vetting processes. >  
> Protecting student data
> The Clever Library includes safeguards to protect student data. All Library applications sign a universal data-sharing agreement , and when a teacher installs an app, only the minimum necessary student data is shared (see details below). > However, school systems—not teachers—are ultimately responsible for protecting student data. With schools largely seeing an increase in cyberattacks, some are seeking greater oversight of classroom applications.

title: For Clever Admins: Clever Library
text:
This helps them understand where and how student data is being shared and better defend against cybersecurity threats. >  
> Data shared with Clever Library apps:
>  
> Teachers
> Clever ID
> Name
> Email
>  
> Students
> Clever ID
> Name (first name, last initial)
> Grade
>  
> Sections
> Clever ID
> Name
> Subject
> Grade
> Section number
> Teachers
> Students
>  
> Why some school systems choose to block Library apps  
> Many school systems are tightening controls around digital resources given the increased threat of cyberattacks on school systems, state legislation mandating increased security and oversight, and evolving technology (AI) complicating the nature of attacks. With districts and schools being accountable for protecting student data, some are implementing stricter policies to ensure any resource a student uses in class has been vetted from a cybersecurity perspective. This helps districts and schools account for keeping student data safe. >  
> Recommending Resources
> To recommend resources, go to Clever Dashboard  > Library settings > Recommend . > Recommend a resource by searching for it by name. We also encourage adding notes to your recommendations to highlight to teachers why and for what purpose a resource is recommended. You may also delete a recommendation at any time. >  
>  Please note: The Clever Library is a place for teachers to find and adopt resources - therefore, the only resources that can be recommended are those that support teacher sign-ups. School or district-adopted resources, such as Dreambox, Lexia, or iReady, aren't available in the Library. > If you’d like to recommend a resource that isn't yet in the Library, send us a note at library-suggestions@clever.com with the name and URL so that we can create the appropriate entry. >  
> How Recommendations Appear to Teachers
> Resources that are recommended will appear front and center when a teacher visits the Library.

> When a teacher visits a recommended resource, your recommendation and associated notes are featured prominently.

section: For Clever Admins: Apps - Integration status
text:
Title

For Clever Admins: Apps - Integration status

URL Name

360016204711

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360016204711?language=en_US#header1) 
2. [What's my application's status?](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360016204711?language=en_US#status)

This article will walk you through sharing data with an application once the application has accepted your request to connect via Clever.

title: For Clever Admins: Apps - Integration status
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Apps - Integration status
text:
In your [Clever Dashboard > Applications > My Applications](https://schools.clever.com/applications) page, you can view each application's integration status:

- **Hiding enabled:** An administrator at the district has hidden the application from users in Clever Portal. Follow the [directions outlined here](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360045814792) to disable hiding.
- **Incomplete SAML Setup**: This indicates you will need to finish configuring the settings for an SSO (SAML) application. To finish the setup, click the application in your dashboard and click on the **Settings** tab. Under **SAML details**, click **Edit** and enter any missing information. The application will change to Launched once the SAML details are complete and users are shared.
- **Invited by app:** Applications you are already using at your school organization may invite you to connect via Clever to simplify rostering. [Learn more here](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360045084272).
- **Launch Date: XX/XX/XXXX**: This is the date the application will go live. If you need the launch date adjusted, reach out to the app directly as any changes to this are controlled by the app.
- **Launched**: Your integration is live! If the application supports SSO, the application is available to users in the Clever Portal.
- **No Credentials Set:** The next step is yours! Set the credentials that the SSO (Saved Passwords) app should use to log in users. More info [here](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/234973187).
- **No Data Shared**: The next step is yours: set your [sharing permissions](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/203115007)!

title: For Clever Admins: Apps - Integration status
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Apps - Integration status
text:
- **No Users Selected**: The next step is yours! Select which users you want to share with the application.
- **Requested**: This means that we are waiting on the application's team to accept your request and proceed with the implementation. If you need to expedite the request process, please reach out to the application directly as we do not have insight as to the application's review and acceptance process.
- **Requires App Review:** Some applications have set safety thresholds to prevent unintended changes in data from affecting users in their platform. If you see this message, please reach out to the application partner requesting they review and approve the changes. Information for our application partners on managing safety thresholds can be found [here](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360044699192).
- **Setting Up**: Hang tight! The application is preparing your district for launch. You can view the Launch Date by clicking on the application. Users will not be able to access the application until the Launch Date. If you need to expedite the setup process, please reach out to the application directly.
- **Waiting On Approval:** This means that we are still waiting on the application's team to accept your request and proceed with the implementation. You can click 'Remind app' to remind the application partner's team of your request.

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000VWlB&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000288R0)

- You will also see the ability to remind the app from the application's profile page:

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000VWlB&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000288R5)

title: Clever + Lightspeed Setup Guide
text:
Title

Clever + Lightspeed Setup Guide

URL Name

360016556271

Article Body

In order for your Lightspeed and Clever integration to be optimized, you’ll need to send Lightspeed your users’ directory services usernames. This may be the same as your AD usernames, your emails, or something completely different. You’ll be able to choose or create the format needed by your district with this tool. If you don’t know your DSU you should contact your IT department within your district for the format. You can find the link to create and send your DSU field on the “Settings” page of Lightspeed’s profile.

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka01P0000005zEj&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000288FE)

There are two different ways that you can locate user credentials:

1. Select them from the dropdown
2. Use a custom configuration

title: Clever + Lightspeed Setup Guide
text:
The easiest and most reliable way to provide your directory services username is by indicating where they are within your existing SIS sync. For example, if student directory services usernames are their email addresses and those fields are already syncing to Clever regularly, you would select those fields in the dropdowns within the directory services username tool linked on the “Settings” page for Lightspeed.

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka01P0000005zEj&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000288FJ)

**Custom configurations**

If student directory services usernames are syncing to Clever already, but aren’t neatly contained in a single field, we’re still able to get you set up! You can use a custom configuration to provide those credentials. Instead of selecting a single field, you’ll select “Custom” in the appropriate dropdown list and paste in one of the formulas below:

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka01P0000005zEj&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000288FO)

Example student: Scott Kelly

Email: [sykelly@cleverusd.edu](mailto:sykelly@cleverusd.edu)

Username: skelly19

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka01P0000005zEj&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000288Fd)

Once you’ve entered the appropriate formula, make sure that the credentials for the sample student match the directory services username you have on file.

Have questions or need help creating a custom formula? [Contact us](https://support.clever.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).

title: For Clever Admins: Installing the Clever browser extension
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Installing the Clever browser extension
section: For Clever Admins: Installing the Clever browser extension
text:
> Tip: Title For Clever Admins: Installing the Clever browser extension URL Name 360019869511 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Browser Compatibility and Access 3. Clever browser extension installation & directions 4. Pushing out the Clever browser extension to all district users 5. Clicking the Clever browser extension
>  
> Overview
> The Clever browser extension is the key to ensuring that SSO (Saved Passwords) applications  function properly because it facilitates the secure storing of user login credentials for these types of applications. In addition, the extension provides users with a seamless single sign-on (SSO) experience to these applications through Clever. If the Clever extension is not present on a device, the user will need to manually enter their login credentials when accessing SSO (Saved Passwords) applications through Clever. Single sign-on (SSO) is available for integrated applications in Clever without the browser extension. To find out which type of application an application is, Clever Admins can navigate to their list of applications from the Clever Dashboard > Applications > My Applications page to locate the application and look under the App Type column. > For more about the different types of applications in Clever, please visit: For Clever Admins: Apps - Types of apps
>  
>  
> Browser Compatibility and Access
> Clever supports the following internet browsers:
> Chrome Firefox Microsoft Edge Apple Safari (we support this browser for general use with Clever, but  not   for SSO (Save Passwords) apps, as we do not currently offer a Safari Extension) 
> The Clever browser extension is not required for iOS devices (e.g., iPads, iPhones) as these devices use the Clever app, which acts as the browser extension.

title: For Clever Admins: Installing the Clever browser extension
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Installing the Clever browser extension
section: For Clever Admins: Installing the Clever browser extension
text:
For details, visit:  SSO (Saved Passwords) Apps: iOS Devices For devices where the browser extension cannot be downloaded (e.g., Android, Amazon Fire tablets, Safari), users will need to manually enter their login credentials for SSO (Saved Passwords) applications when accessing them through Clever. For additional details, visit:  Clever Technical Requirements & Supported Devices. > It is expected that when a user clicks on the Chrome Extension, it will take them to clever.com /login. To streamline your login flow, Clever suggests directing your students and teachers to use your district’s portal URL which can be found in the Clever Dashboard > Portal > Portal settings. >  
> Please note:  If users are accessing SSO (Saved Passwords) applications from home due to remote learning, we recommend standardizing credentials for SSO (Saved Passwords) applications (e.g., student number as the required username and date of birth as the password). Doing this will make it easier for students and families to remember their login credentials when logging in to these types of applications. >  
> Clever browser extension installation & directions
> Please see the links below for information and instructions for installing the Clever browser extension:
> Google Chrome:   Install   |   Directions Microsoft Edge (New):    Install  |   Directions Firefox: Install | Directions
>  
> Pushing out the Clever browser extension to all district users
> Please see the following articles for details on pushing out the Clever browser extension to all district users:
> Chrome extension instructions Microsoft Edge Mozilla Firefox extension instructions
> Clever Tip: If you are experiencing difficulty deploying or pushing out the Clever browser extension to your users, or need further instruction, please contact the browser provider's support team directly.

title: For Clever Admins: Installing the Clever browser extension
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Installing the Clever browser extension
section: For Clever Admins: Installing the Clever browser extension
text:
>  
> Clicking the Clever browser extension
> The primary function of the Clever browser extension is to facilitate logins for SSO (Saved Passwords) applications. > When the extension is clicked, the following actions will occur based on the user's browser state:
> When already logged into the Portal in another tab, clicking the extension will take the user to their Portal When logged out, but using a browser where the user has logged into the Clever Portal before, clicking the extension will take the user to the district Clever Portal login URL When in an incognito window, new browser, or after clearing browser history, a click will take the user to the Clever school selection screen
> To streamline your login flow and provide a consistent experience, we suggest directing your students and teachers to use your district’s Portal URL, which can be found in the Clever Dashboard > Portal > Portal settings page. >  
> Related articles:
> Clever Technical Requirements & Supported Devices SSO (Saved Passwords) Apps: iOS Devices For District Admins: Apps - Types of apps

title: Custom Data: Teachers
text:
> Note: Title Custom Data: Teachers URL Name 360020051691 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Manually creating custom teacher 3. Bulk uploading custom teachers 4. Viewing custom teachers 5. Deleting custom teachers 6. Logging in as a custom teacher
> Overview
> If you would like to add teachers to Clever that don't currently sync from your district's SIS, you can create custom teacher accounts for them in Clever on an individual basis or by bulk upload. Custom teachers can be added to existing sections using the Add co-teacher  feature in Clever or can be added to custom sections . Custom teachers can only be added as the  primary  teacher to  custom sections  and as  co-teachers  to  SIS-synced sections . >  
> Please note: Please allow up to 24 hours for your custom teachers to sync with connected applications. If you are not seeing your district's custom teacher accounts appear in applications they are shared with, you can reach out to the application's support team directly to confirm whether they support co-teachers on their platform. >  
> Manually creating a custom teacher
> If you'd like to add a teacher to Clever that is not being synced from your district's student information system (SIS), you can create them as a custom teacher directly from your Clever Dashboard  using one of the following methods:
> 1) From a section's profile page:
> Navigate to a section's profile page by searching for the section using the search bar at the top of the  Clever Dashboard . Under the Details  tab of your section, select  Add co-teacher  from the right side of the page. Select Create a teacher. Then, enter basic demographic information about the user in the subsequent pop-up box to create their custom teacher account. > 2) From the Custom Data page. > Navigate to Data sources > Custom data  > Add custom data > Teachers. Enter basic demographic information about the user in the subsequent pop-up box to create their custom teacher account.

title: Custom Data: Teachers
text:
>  
> Bulk uploading custom teachers via a CSV upload
> Formatting the file
> The file must be named  teachers.csv and saved in the CSV (Comma Separated Value) file format. The  minimum  header requirements are the following:
> school\_id teacher\_id last\_name first\_name teacher\_email
> Please see our  spec section 3.3  for more detailed information on formatting the file, the field values that are accepted, and information about additional headers. Sample files can be downloaded here . > Uploading the file
> To use the web upload option:
> From the left-hand navigation, click  Data sources > Custom data. Select  Add custom data  and then  Upload Records . Select  teachers.csv  and then choose the file from your device. Once the upload icon displays a green checkmark  , select  Upload . > Clever will automatically trigger a sync within the next five minutes to begin processing the new data, taking about 15-20 minutes to complete. The newly uploaded data will not be fully available in Clever until then. > SFTP Upload
> SFTP Upload is available to all schools. If your primary sync method is not SFTP, please reach out to Clever support for assistance with gaining access to your own Clever SFTP Directory. > To manually upload files to your district's SFTP folder, please:
> Navigate to your Data sources > SIS sync > Settings  page to locate your district's SFTP Settings and corresponding credentials. >  
> Log in to your Clever SFTP box, and create a new subfolder named customteachers . > For instructions on accessing your district's SFTP folder, please visit: SFTP Syncs: Uploading data to Clever  
> Upload the teachers.csv to the customteachers subfolder            
> Once the files finish processing (within 15-20 minutes), you will be able to see the new custom sections from your Clever Dashboard > Data sources > Custom data page. >  
> Please note: Please allow 10-15 minutes for custom data to process.

title: Custom Data: Teachers
text:
Though Clever will not send an email notification that the data has been processed, the results will be viewable on the Sync page in the Clever Dashboard. >  
> Viewing custom teachers
> Clever admins can view up to 200 successfully created custom teachers through the Clever Dashboard > Data sources > Custom data  page. If your district has more than 200 custom teachers, all records can be viewed from the  Data Browser  or by using the search bar at the top of the  Clever Dashboard  to locate individual custom teacher records. > Please note: If the custom teacher(s) will be joining the district's account in the Fall through the normal SIS sync, the T eacher\_id  used for the custom account should match their Teacher \_ id  in the SIS. > Deleting custom teachers
> To remove  all custom teachers at once, please upload a blank teachers.csv file to the  Data sources > Custom data  page >  Upload Records  option. However, please note that  the file must contain column headers . Please feel free to use the teachers.csv file contained in this sample file set to remove teachers in bulk:  Download. To remove only some teacher records via the bulk upload, simply upload a file using one of the formats listed above. Please be sure to include all records in the file that you do not want to be deleted. As long as the record is present in the file, it will not be deleted from Clever. If a record is missing from the file, it will be deleted. To remove an individual custom data record, please navigate to the Clever Dashboard > Data sources > Custom data page. > Select the corresponding tab for the record type   you would like to remove. Locate the record, and under the  Actions  column, click the  icon to delete the record. > Please note: Manually deleting teachers individually using the trash icon will delete the user entirely from Clever.

title: Custom Data: Teachers
text:
However, if the teacher was bulk uploaded to the Clever Dashboard > Data sources > Custom data   pag e, they would still be present in the custom teachers.csv file even after the trash icon is selected. If the user is still present in the following uploaded custom teachers.csv file with the same teacher\_id (i.e., teacher SIS ID), the user will be re-added to Clever. Conversely, uploading blank files over custom data only deletes bulk uploaded custom data and not manually created custom data. Manually created custom data will need to be deleted manually by clicking on the trash can under the Actions column in the Custom Records . >  
> Logging in as a custom teacher
> Custom teachers will log in to Clever the same way teachers syncing from your SIS log in. Just make sure to add any details (e.g., email, teacher\_id, etc.) required by your selected login method. To check to see what your login method is, navigate in your Clever Dashboard to SSO & Portal > SSO Settings > Login method. >

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [What is data sharing?](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360020281091?language=en_US#Header1) 
2. [Which applications am I able to share data with?](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360020281091?language=en_US#Header2) 
3. [Sharing data](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360020281091?language=en_US#Header3)

The final step in adding an application to your district's Clever Dashboard is setting your sharing permissions. Sharing rules let Clever know which of your data you'd like to make available to an application, and which users should be able to access an application via Clever. Clever will not share data with an application until your district sets the application’s sharing permissions. The application will only appear on the Portal for teachers, students or staff that have been shared with the application.

---

As a School Tech Lead you are only able to update sharing rules for applications that say, **School site sharing**, under the *Sharing* column on the [Applications](https://clever.com/oauth/district_admin/login?target=%3BbzRrcGh2aDJ5Z252eDgzdnhjNjQ%3D%3BaHR0cHM6Ly9zY2hvb2xzLmNsZXZlci5jb20vYXV0aC1jYWxsYmFjaw%3D%3D%3BYTdiYWZhYWUxZDM1YjNmZjQ5ZmFhNDc4ZTkwYWU3M2IyN2FkNDE4YWUyZTY5Y2I2ZGRmYTUwYTZmM2M0ZGM1Mg%3D%3D%3BY29kZQ%3D%3D%3BZGlzdHJpY3RfYWRtaW4%3D) tab. This setting is configured by your district's Clever Admins.

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000GHXx&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028DP5)

For applications with **School site sharing** enabled, you can adjust the sharing permissions for these applications to grant or remove access for specific users and classes.

---

When school site sharing is enabled, School Tech Leads will be able to share data for their school by creating **sharing rules.** Examples of sharing rules include:

- All the math classes in a particular school;
- The math classes for grades 3-6 in the district, except for in two schools; or
- One specific teacher’s 11th-grade homeroom class.

For information on creating sharing rules, please see [this article](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115000392247).

---

**Related articles:**

[Sharing Permissions: Enabling School Site Sharing for School Tech Leads](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115001972366)

section: تشخيص مشاكل تطبيق Clever iOS وإصلاحها
text:
*يرجى الملاحظة: يتطلب تطبيق Clever iOS نظام iOS 9.0 أو أحدث وهو متوافق مع أجهزة iPhone و iPad و iPod touch. إذا كنت تستخدم جهازاً يعمل بنظام iOS 11 أو أحدث، فيجب عليك التحديث إلى أحدث إصدار من تطبيق Clever.*

إذا واجهت أنت والطالب مشكلة في استخدام تطبيق Clever iOS على جهاز iPad، يمكنك التحقق من خطوات تشخيص الأخطاء وإصلاحها:

- تأكد من عدم تمكين "الوضع الخاص" في Safari على جهاز iOS
- تأكد من أن جهاز iOS لديه اتصال بالإنترنت من خلال الانتقال إلى صفحة الويب في تطبيق Safari
- تأكد من تمكين Javascript على جهاز iOS
- تأكد من عدم حظر ملفات ارتباط Clever على جهاز iOS. يتضمن هذا إعداد على مستوى الجهاز وأيضًا لنطاق Clever ([clever.com](http://clever.com))
- تأكد من السماح للوصول إلى الكاميرا في إعدادات Safari
- تأكد من عدم وجود أي برنامج يؤثر على طريقة عمل Safari، مثل تقييد كيفية إدارة ملفات ارتباط Safari
- تأكد من عدم تمكين القائمة البيضاء لشبكة iOS على الجهاز. يتم الوصول إلى ذلك بالانتقال إلى الإعدادات> عام> القيود> مواقع الويب
- تأكد من أن الطلبات إلى خوادم Clever لا يتم حظرها أو تصفيتها بواسطة جدار حماية أو برنامج تصفية الشبكة
- قم بإيقاف تشغيل الجهاز وتشغيله مرة أخرى
- قم بإلغاء تثبيت / إعادة تثبيت تطبيق Clever
- حاول تسجيل الدخول عبر <https://clever.com/badges> في Safari وأبلغ عما إذا كان هذا ناجحًا أم لا
- محاولة استخدام التطبيق خارج شبكة المدرسة (ربما على شبكة منزلية)

إذا استمرت المشكلة، فلا تتردد في فتح تذكرة مع دعم Clever!

**![](https://theme.zdassets.com/theme_assets/364037/af574183f2df705f2c75ac31fc7ab01b1a5a3d9a.png)**Por **favor, tenga en cuenta:** La aplicación de Clever para iOS requiere iOS 9.0 o posterior y es compatible con iPhone, iPad y iPod touch. Si está utilizando un dispositivo que ejecuta iOS 11 o posterior, debe actualizar a la versión más reciente de la aplicación Clever.

Si usted y su estudiante tienen problemas para usar la aplicación Clever iOS en un iPad, pueden verificar los siguientes pasos para la solución de problemas.

---

title: Para familias: Solución de problemas con la aplicación de Clever para iOS.
heading_path: Para familias: Solución de problemas con la aplicación de Clever para iOS.
text:
- Antes de comenzar, asegúrese de que su dispositivo utilice la versión iOS 9.0 o superior.
- Apague y encienda el dispositivo y vuelva a intentarlo.
- Desinstale, luego vuelva a instalar la aplicación Clever y vuelva a intentarlo.
- Intente iniciar sesión a través de <https://clever.com/badges> en la aplicación Safari.
- Intente utilizar la aplicación Clever fuera de la red de su escuela (como en una red doméstica o un punto de acceso móvil).
- Asegúrese de que el dispositivo iOS tenga conectividad a Internet navegando a cualquier página web en la aplicación Safari.
- Asegúrese de que en el dispositivo, la lista blanca de la red de iOS no esté habilitada. Para acceder a esto, vaya a Configuración > General > Restricciones > Sitios web.
- Asegúrese de que el "Modo privado" no esté habilitado para Safari en el dispositivo iOS.
- Asegúrese de que las cookies estén habilitadas para Safari. Esto incluye la configuración para todo el dispositivo, así como para el dominio Clever ([clever.com](http://clever.com)). Configuración > Safari Bloquear todas las cookies. Asegúrese de que Bloquear todas las cookies esté desactivado; sabrá que está desactivado cuando el control deslizante se vuelva gris.
- Asegúrese de que Javascript esté habilitado para Safari. Puedes ajustar esto navegando a Configuración > Safari > Javascript.
- Asegúrese de que el acceso a la cámara esté habilitado para Safari. Puedes ajustar esto navegando a Configuración > Safari > Cámara.

---

title: Para familias: Solución de problemas con la aplicación de Clever para iOS.
heading_path: Para familias: Solución de problemas con la aplicación de Clever para iOS.
text:
- Asegúrese de que en el dispositivo la lista de denegación de red iOS no esté habilitada. Puede ajustar esto navegando a Configuración > General > Restricciones > Sitios web.
- Asegúrese de que las solicitudes a los servidores Clever no estén bloqueadas ni filtradas por un firewall o software de filtrado de red. Consulte nuestro artículo del Centro de ayuda: [¿A qué dominios de Clever debería otorgar acceso mi red?](http://which%20clever's%20domains%20should%20my%20network%20grant%20access/?)
- En iOS 13, Safari tiene una nueva opción de configuración que está habilitada de forma predeterminada después de actualizar un iPad desde iOS 12. Asegúrese de que la configuración de Safari para "Solicitar sitio web de escritorio" esté deshabilitada. Puede ajustar esto navegando a **Configuración > Safari > Solicitar sitio web de escritorio.**
- En iOS 14, los usuarios tienen la posibilidad de elegir un navegador predeterminado distinto de Safari. Asegúrese de que Safari sea el navegador predeterminado para cualquier dispositivo que se utilizará con la aplicación Clever. Puedes ajustar esto navegando a **Configuración > Navegador > Safari.**
- Asegúrese de que ningún otro software afecte el funcionamiento de Safari.

Si el problema persiste, no dude en abrir una solicitud con el soporte de Clever.

text:
*참고 사항: Clever iOS 앱을 사용하려면 iOS 9.0 이상의 최신 버전이 필요합니다. Clever iOS 앱은 iPhone, iPad, iPod touch와 호환됩니다. iOS 11 이상인 버전의 장치를 사용하는 경우, 최신 버전의 Clever 앱으로 업데이트해야 합니다.*

학부모님과 학생이 iPad에서 Clever iOS 앱을 사용하는 데 문제가 있는 경우, 다음 문제 해결 단계를 확인하세요.

- iOS 장치의 Safari에서 “비공개 모드”가 비활성화되어 있는지 확인합니다
- Safari 앱의 웹페이지로 이동하여 iOS 장치에 인터넷이 연결되어 있는지 확인합니다
- iOS 장치에 Javascript가 활성화되어 있는지 확인합니다
- iOS 장치에 Clever 쿠키가 차단되어 있지 않은지 확인합니다. 장치 전체 설정과 Clever 도메인([clever.com](http://clever.com)) 모두 해당합니다.
- Safari 설정에서 카메라 접근이 활성화되어 있는지 확인합니다
- Safari의 쿠키 관리 제한과 같이 Safari 실행에 영향을 주는 소프트웨어는 없는지 확인합니다
- 장치에서 iOS 네트워크 허용 목록이 비활성화되어 있는지 확인합니다. 설정 > 일반 > 제한 > 웹사이트로 이동하여 확인할 수 있습니다
- Clever 서버를 향한 요청을 방화벽 또는 네트워크 필터링 소프트웨어가 차단하거나 필터링하지는 않았는지 확인합니다
- 장치의 전원을 껐다가 다시 켭니다
- Clever 앱을 삭제하고 다시 설치합니다
- Safari에서 <https://clever.com/badges에> 로그인을 시도하고 로그인 성공 여부를 보고해 주십시오
- 학교 네트워크 외부(예: 가정 네트워크)에서 로그인을 시도합니다

여전히 문제가 해결되지 않는다면 언제든지 Clever 지원팀에 문의하세요!

section: Dépannage des problèmes avec l'application iOS Clever
text:
***Remarque :** l'application iOS Clever nécessite iOS 9.0 ou une version ultérieure et est compatible avec iPhone, iPad et iPod touch. Si vous utilisez un appareil qui exécute iOS 11 ou une version ultérieure, vous devez effectuer la mise à jour de la dernière version de l'application Clever.*

Si vous et votre élève rencontrez des difficultés à utiliser l'application iOS Clever sur un iPad, vous pouvez suivre les étapes de dépannage suivantes :

- Assurez-vous que le 'private mode' (mode privé) n'est pas activé dans Safari sur l'appareil iOS
- Assurez-vous que l'appareil iOS est connecté à Internet en accédant à une page Web dans l'application Safari
- Assurez-vous que Javascript est activé sur l'appareil iOS
- Assurez-vous que les cookies Clever ne sont pas bloqués sur l'appareil iOS, y compris le paramètre au niveau global de l'appareil et pour le domaine Clever ([clever.com](http://clever.com))
- Assurez-vous que l'accès à la caméra est activé dans les paramètres de Safari
- Assurez-vous qu'aucun logiciel n'affecte le fonctionnement de Safari, par exemple en limitant la gestion des cookies Safari
- Assurez-vous que la liste blanche du réseau iOS n'est pas activée sur l'appareil. Vous pourrez la trouver dans Settings > General > Restrictions > Websites (Paramètres> Général> Restrictions> Sites Web)
- Assurez-vous que les demandes adressées aux serveurs Clever ne sont pas bloquées ou filtrées par un pare-feu ou un logiciel de filtrage réseau
- Éteignez puis rallumez l'appareil
- Désinstallez / réinstallez l'application Clever
- Essayez de vous connecter via <https://clever.com/badges> dans Safari et signalez si cela a réussi ou non
- Essayez d'utiliser l'application en dehors du réseau scolaire (peut-être sur un réseau domestique)

Si le problème persiste, n'hésitez pas à ouvrir un ticket auprès du support Clever !

section: Mga isyu sa pag-troubleshoot sa Clever iOS app
text:
*Mangyaring tandaan: Kinakailangan ng Clever iOS app ng iOS 9.0 o mas bago at compatible sa iPhone, iPad, at iPod touch. Kung gumagamit ka ng device na gumagamit ng iOS 11 o mas bago, dapat mong i-update sa pinakabagong bersyon ang Clever app.*

Kung nagkakaproblema ka o ang iyong estudyante sa paggamit ng Clever iOS app sa iPad, puwede mong tingnan ang mga sumusunod na hakbang sa pag-troubleshoot:

- Tiyaking hindi naka-enable ang “Private mode” sa Safari sa iOS device
- Tiyaking may koneksyon ng internet ang iOS device sa pamamagitan ng pag-navigate sa isang webpage sa Safari app
- Tiyaking naka-enable ang Javascript sa iOS device
- Tiyaking hindi naka-block ang cookies ng Clever sa iOS device. Kasama rito ang pang-device na setting, pati narin para sa Clever domain ([clever.com](http://clever.com))
- Tiyaking naka-enable ang access sa camera sa mga setting ng Safari
- Tiyaking walang software na nakakaapekto sa paraan ng pagtakbo ng Safari, gaya ng paghihigpit sa kung paano pinapamahalaan ang cookies ng Safari
- Tiyaking sa device na iyon, hindi naka-enable ang whitelist ng network ng iOS. Ina-access ito sa pamamagitan ng pagpunta sa Mga Setting > Pangkalahatan > Mga Paghihigpit > Mga Website
- Tiyaking hindi naka-block o naka-filter ang mga kahilingan sa mga server ng Clever ng firewall o software na nagfi-filter ng network
- I-uninstall/i-reinstall ang Clever app
- Subukang mag-log in sa pamamagitan ng <https://clever.com/badges> sa Safari at iulat kung matagumpay ito o hindi
- Subukang gamitin ang app sa labas ng network ng paaralan (malamang sa isang network ng bahay)

title: 家长参阅：解决使用Clever的iOS应用中的问题
heading_path: 家长参阅：解决使用Clever的iOS应用中的问题
section: 家长参阅：解决使用Clever的iOS应用中的问题
text:
标题

家长参阅：解决使用Clever的iOS应用中的问题

URL 名称

360020343092

Article Body

*请注意：Clever的iOS应用程序需要iOS 9.0或更高版本，同时与iPhone、iPad和iPod touch兼容。如果您使用的是运行iOS 11或更高版本的设备，您必须更新到最新版本的Clever应用程序。*

如果您和学生在iPad上使用Clever的iOS应用程序时遇到问题，请按照以下步骤解决问题：

- 确保在iOS设备上的Safari中未启用“无痕浏览模式”
- 在Safari应用程序中打开任意网页，确保iOS设备已接入互联网
- 确保Javascript在iOS设备上已启用
- 确保Clever的cookie在iOS设备上未被拦截。这既要针对[clever.com](http://clever.com)，同时要在设备上进行全局设置。
- Safari的设置中允许使用摄像头。
- 确保其他软件的设置不会影响Safari运行，例如，其他软件限制Safari中的cookie管理。
- 确保设备上没有启用iOS网络白名单。网络白名单可以在设置>常规>限制>网站中查看
- 确保防火墙或网络过滤软件不会阻止或过滤对Clever服务器的请求
- 关闭并再次打开设备
- 卸载并重新安装Clever应用程序
- 尝试在Safari中通过<https://clever.com/badges登>录，并报告是否成功
- 尝试在学校网络之外（例如在家庭网络里）使用应用程序。

如果问题仍未解决，请与Clever支持团队联系，新建问题解决需求单！
