title: For School Tech Leads: View usage data
heading_path: For School Tech Leads: View usage data
section: For School Tech Leads: View usage data
text:
> Important: Title For School Tech Leads: View usage data URL Name 360020383911 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 1. How to use filters 2. Description of available data 3. How to export data
> Overview
> At Clever, we understand how important it is to track logins and application usage among your students and teachers. Using Portal Analytics , you can see graphs and statistics that show how many users are accessing their resources, how often they log in, and which schools or apps are being used the most! This data is provided as a general overview and is not viewable "by student" or "by teacher". This article will give you a breakdown of the available data and how you can use filters to narrow down the information you see. > Please note: As a S chool Tech Lead, you will only see the specific data for your assigned school sites. As such, you will not see the "Logins by school" list unless you are connected to multiple schools in Clever. If you do not see one of your school sites, please contact your district help desk. >  
> To get to the Portal Analytics page from your School Tech Lead Portal, you can navigate to the Clever Dashboard, by clicking Dashboard  from the top menu  
> Once in the dashboard, select the blue  View details  button to the right of, Clever in your school  
>  
> How to use filters
> First, let's take a look at the available filters. You can use the filters to narrow down the usage data and focus on specific users, applications, and school sites. Different filter sets will cause charts to change- if the filters chosen do not apply to a chart, the chart will temporarily be hidden. > Time Range Here you can select the time ranges that you want the charts to show. Select  School year to date if you'd like to see the usage data for the entire school year so far.

title: For School Tech Leads: View usage data
heading_path: For School Tech Leads: View usage data
section: For School Tech Leads: View usage data
text:
> Units Here you can select whether you'd like to view your data as a percentage (75% of all students have logged in) or in  absolute terms (7,500 students have logged in). > Schools All Schools - an overview of the data for the entire district If you want to focus on a specific site instead of All Schools , you can select it from the drop-down. Multiple school sites can be selected from the drop-down. Please note: the "Logins by School"  graph is disabled when you select a single school. > App Select All Apps if you want to view login data for all the apps connected to your Clever account. To look more closely at a specific app's usage, select it from the drop-down. When you select an app, the "Usage by App" graph is disabled. > App Type Here you can select whether you want to see usage data for teacher-added, district-added, or both. > Grades To look at the analytics for specific grade levels, select the grade(s) from the drop-down. Grades are based on student grades, not the grade level for a section or a teacher. > Users Here you can select whether you want to see usage data for students, teachers, or both. > Please note: the "Teachers"  filter cannot be used in conjunction with the grade filter  
> Description of available data
> Now that we know how to use filters to focus on specific areas, let's take a look at the different measures! The statistics shown are based on the users who are being shared with apps. The metrics are not based on the total number of users in your Clever account. > Usage by scoped users: This number reflects the number of logins from the users that are shared with your applications. > Unique users: This number reflects the unique number of users who have logged into an application. > Total Logins: This number reflects the overall number of user logins. > Daily Unique Users
> Daily unique users: This chart reflects the unique number of users who have logged into an application per day.

title: For School Tech Leads: View usage data
heading_path: For School Tech Leads: View usage data
section: For School Tech Leads: View usage data
text:
Hover your mouse over a date to see the number of daily unique users for that day. Please note that this chart is disabled if you are using the School year to date time frame filter. >  
> Logins by app
> This number reflects the number of unique user logins to an individual application. Click on  Ascending or  Descending to order apps by the number of unique logins. > Logins by school
> This number reflects the number of unique user logins from users at each school site you administer. Click on  Ascending or  Descending to order schools by the number of unique logins. > Please note: you will only see the number of logins by school for the sites you administer. >  
> Login Method / Device / Browser
> Login Method : This number reflects the number of unique user logins by login type. Users will be counted twice if they log in using different login methods- but only once if logging in multiple times using the same identity provider. > Device : This number reflects the number of unique user logins for each device. Users will be counted twice if logging into different devices but only once if logging in multiple times to the same device type. > Browser :  This number reflects the number of unique user logins for each device. Users will be counted twice if logging in through different browsers- but only once if logging in multiple times through the same browser. >  
> How to export data
> Located at the top right of the Portal Analytics page, the Export all data  button will download a CSV of the data you've currently filtered in your analytics view.

title: For Families: Troubleshooting - Shared Devices
text:
> Tip: Title For Families: Troubleshooting - Shared Devices URL Name 360020614031 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Directions - General 3. Directions - Log in with Google 4. Directions - Chromebooks 5. Need additional help? > Overview
> If your household has multiple students with Clever accounts using this same device, this article will help make sure that your children are properly logged out before the other logs in! >  
> Directions - General
> To ensure that your child's user session has ended before logging the other in, please follow these steps: Step 1: Log out of Clever
> From the Clever Portal , click on the student's name in the top right corner, select Log out. > Step 2: Log in to Clever as new user
> Navigate to https://clever.com/login and search for your school. Once your school is located, click on the Google button ​and enter your school email address and password. You should now be successfully logged in to the new user's Clever account! > Directions - Log in with Google
> Step 1: Log out of Clever  
> From the Clever Portal , click on the student's name in the top right corner and select Log out. > Step 2: Log out of Google  
> Pro tip: you can  click on this link to sign out! > Step 3: Log in to Clever as a new user  
> Navigate to https://clever.com/login and search for your school. Once your school is located, click on the Google button ​and enter your school email address and password. You should now be successfully logged in to the new user's Clever account! > Directions - Chromebooks
> If your students share a Chromebook, we recommend setting up multiple profiles on the device. Once configured, each student should use their personal profile to prevent conflict between accounts. > Step 1: Set up multiple profiles. Directions can be found here . > Step 2: Sign in to the additional profile(s)  
> Before you can sign in another person, be sure you've   added the second person   to your Chromebook.

title: For Families: Troubleshooting - Shared Devices
text:
Then follow these steps:  
> Sign in to your Google Account. At the bottom right, select the time. Select your Google Account email. Select  Sign in another user . You'll see a reminder to use the feature only with people you trust. Select   OK . Pick a person, then enter their password. You can add up to 5 users. > Switch between accounts you're signed in to  
> After you've added multiple people, you can switch between them:  
> Sign in to your Google Account. At the bottom right, select the time. Select the person you'd like to switch to. > All active people share some settings, such as networks. Other settings, like profile pictures and bookmarks, are specific to each person. > Need additional help? > We recommend clearing the browser history (cookies, cache, etc.). For Chrome, you can clear the cache by following these steps:  
> On your computer, open Chrome. At the top right, click More   . Click   More tools  >   Clear browsing data . At the top, choose a time range. To delete everything, select   All time . Next to "Cookies and other site data" and "Cached images and files," check the boxes. Click   Clear data . > If you are using an alternate browser, please see the following documentation:  
> Apple Devices Windows Devices
> If the above steps have been completed but the login does not work, please have your students log in using a private window. This will ignore all existing user sessions, allowing other users to log in:  
> On your computer, open Google Chrome . At the top right, click More    New Incognito Window . A new window appears. In the top corner, check for the Incognito icon . Navigate to https://clever.com/login and log in using the instructions outlined in Step 3. > If you are still running into issues, feel free to contact Clever Support !

Este artículo contiene lo siguiente: 
1. [Descripción general](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360020614031?language=es_MX#Description) 
2. [Direcciones - Generales](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360020614031?language=es_MX#h_e0b953c4-37d8-4781-a616-6fe136aa6458) 
3. [Direcciones: Iniciar sesión con Google](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360020614031?language=es_MX#h_f723888c-6033-4cba-b3fa-f30388209a1b) 
4. [Direcciones: Chromebooks](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360020614031?language=es_MX#h_de7aed1d-cd7b-44ef-93cb-2769693f6799) 
5. [¿Necesita ayuda adicional?](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360020614031?language=es_MX#h_58aab7a5-42eb-4e5f-b5ae-655fb8e0860f)

Si en su hogar hay varios estudiantes con cuentas Clever que utilizan el mismo dispositivo, este artículo lo ayudará a asegurarse de que sus hijos cierren la sesión de forma correcta antes de que los demás inicien sesión.

---

Para asegurarse de que la sesión de usuario de su hijo haya finalizado antes de que el otro inicie sesión, siga estos pasos:

**Paso 1: Cerrar sesión en Clever**

- Desde [Clever Portal](http://clever.com/login), haga clic en el nombre del estudiante en la esquina superior derecha y seleccione **Log out** (Cerrar sesión).

**Paso 2: Iniciar sesión en Clever como un usuario nuevo**

- Vaya a <https://clever.com/login> y busque su escuela. Una vez que encuentre la escuela, haga clic en el botón de Google e ingrese la dirección de correo electrónico y la contraseña de su escuela. Ahora debería haber iniciado sesión correctamente en la cuenta de Clever del usuario nuevo.

---

title: Para familias: Solución de problemas: dispositivos compartidos
heading_path: Para familias: Solución de problemas: dispositivos compartidos
text:
Si sus alumnos comparten un Chromebook, le recomendamos configurar varios perfiles en el dispositivo. Una vez configurado, cada estudiante debe usar su perfil personal para evitar conflictos entre cuentas.

Paso 1: Configurar varios perfiles. Puede encontrar las instrucciones [aquí](https://support.google.com/chromebook/answer/1059242?hl=en).

Paso 2: Iniciar sesión en los otros perfiles

Antes de poder iniciar sesión con otra persona, asegúrese de agregar a la [segunda persona](https://support.google.com/chromebook/answer/1059242) a su Chromebook. Luego, siga los siguientes pasos:

1. Inicie sesión en su cuenta de Google.
2. En la parte inferior derecha, seleccione la hora.
3. Seleccione el correo electrónico de su cuenta de Google.
4. Seleccione **Sign in another user** (Iniciar sesión con otro usuario).
5. Verá un recordatorio para usar la función solo con personas de su confianza. Seleccione **OK** (Aceptar).
6. Elija una persona, luego ingrese su contraseña. Puede agregar hasta cinco usuarios.

**Cambie entre las cuentas con las que inició sesión.**

Una vez que agregue a varias personas, puede alternar entre ellas:

1. Inicie sesión en su cuenta de Google.
2. En la parte inferior derecha, seleccione la hora.
3. Seleccione la persona a la que le gustaría cambiar.

Todas las personas activas comparten algunas configuraciones, como las redes. Otros ajustes, como las imágenes de perfil y los marcadores, son específicos de cada persona.

---

title: Para familias: Solución de problemas: dispositivos compartidos
heading_path: Para familias: Solución de problemas: dispositivos compartidos
text:
Recomendamos borrar el historial del navegador (cookies, caché, etc.). En Chrome, siga los siguientes pasos para borrar la caché:

1. En la computadora, abra Chrome.
2. En la esquina superior derecha, haga clic en **More** (Más) ![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl0000001q9S&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000002lSXM)
3. Haga clic en **More tools** (Más herramientas) y luego **Clear browsing data** (Borrar datos de navegación).
4. En la parte superior, elija un intervalo de tiempo. Para eliminar todo, seleccione **All time** (Desde siempre).
5. Marque las casillas junto a “Cookies and other site data” (Cookies y otros datos de sitios web) y “Cached images and files” (Archivos e imágenes almacenados en caché).
6. Haga clic en **Clear data** (Borrar datos).

Si utiliza un navegador alternativo, consulte la siguiente documentación:

- [Dispositivos Apple](https://clear-my-cache.com/apple-mac-os.html)
- [Dispositivos Windows](https://clear-my-cache.com/windows.html)

Si se completaron los pasos anteriores pero el inicio de sesión no funciona, haga que los estudiantes inicien sesión usando una ventana privada. Esto ignorará todas las sesiones de usuario existentes, lo que permitirá a otros usuarios iniciar sesión:

1. En su computadora, abra [Google Chrome](https://www.google.com/chrome/).
2. En la esquina superior derecha, haga clic en **More** (Más) ![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl0000001q9S&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000002lSXM) y luego New Incognito Window (Nueva ventana de incógnito).
3. Aparecerá una nueva ventana. En la esquina superior, busque el ícono de incógnito.![](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/ijcidTpqWgtkjN0azDJbXnh5I2b83D65HHi2N7SqGXCXYM4-MYEcCCibdKBGNKTiug=w18-h18)
4. Vaya a <https://clever.com/login> e inicie sesión siguiendo las instrucciones descritas en el Paso 3.

Si todavía tiene problemas, no dude en [contactar al servicio de soporte de Clever](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/contactsupport).

Article Body

Si votre foyer compte plusieurs élèves avec des comptes Clever qui utilisent le même dispositif, cet article vous aidera à vous assurer qu'un élève est correctement déconnecté avant qu'un autre ne se connecte !

Pour vous assurer que la session utilisateur de votre enfant est terminée avant de vous connecter, veuillez suivre les étapes suivantes :

**Étape 1 : Déconnectez-vous de Clever**

- Dans le [portail Clever](http://clever.com/login), cliquez sur le nom de l'élève dans le coin supérieur droit, sélectionnez '**Log out**' (Déconnexion).

**Étape 2 : Déconnectez-vous du fournisseur d'identité de votre district (par exemple, Google, Active Directory, etc.)**

- Si votre district utilise Google, vous pouvez [cliquer sur ce lien pour vous déconnecter.](https://mail.google.com/mail/logout?hl=en)

**Étape 3 : Connectez-vous à Clever en tant que nouvel utilisateur**

- Accédez à <https://clever.com/login> et recherchez votre école. Une fois votre école localisée, cliquez sur le bouton Google et saisissez votre adresse e-mail et votre mot de passe. Vous devez maintenant être connecté au compte Clever du nouvel utilisateur !

Si les étapes ci-dessus sont terminées mais que la connexion ne fonctionne pas, nous recommandons à vos élèves de se connecter à l'aide d'une fenêtre privée. Elle permet d'ignorer toutes les sessions utilisateur Google existantes, permettant à d'autres utilisateurs de se connecter :

title: "학부모용: 문제 해결 - 공유 장치 "
text:
제목

"학부모용: 문제 해결 - 공유 장치 "

URL 이름

360020614031

Article Body

이 글은 다음 내용을 포함하고 있습니다. 
1. [방법 - 일반](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360020614031?language=ko#h_e0b953c4-37d8-4781-a616-6fe136aa6458) 
2. [방법 - Google로 로그인](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360020614031?language=ko#h_f723888c-6033-4cba-b3fa-f30388209a1b) 
3. [방법 - Chromebook](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360020614031?language=ko#h_de7aed1d-cd7b-44ef-93cb-2769693f6799) 
3. [추가로 도움이 필요하신가요?](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360020614031?language=ko#h_58aab7a5-42eb-4e5f-b5ae-655fb8e0860f)

이 글은 가정에서 여러 명의 학생이 동일한 장치에서 Clever 계정을 이용하는 경우, 한 자녀가 다른 자녀가 로그인하기 전에 제대로 로그아웃했는지 확인하는 데 도움을 줍니다.

한 자녀가 로그인하기 전에 다른 자녀의 사용자 세션이 종료되었는지 확인하려면 다음 단계를 따르세요.

**1단계: Clever 로그아웃**

- **[Clever Portal](http://clever.com/login)에서 우측 상단 코너에 있는 학생의 이름을 클릭하여 로그아웃을 선택합니다.**

**2단계: 새로운 사용자로 Clever에 로그인**

- <https://clever.com/login>으로 이동하여 학교를 검색합니다. 학교를 찾으면 Google 버튼을 클릭하고 학교 이메일 주소와 비밀번호를 입력합니다. 이제 새로운 사용자의 Clever 계정에 성공적으로 로그인할 수 있습니다!

![mceclip0.png](/hc/article_attachments/360054322172/mceclip0.png)

**1단계: Clever 로그아웃**

- [Clever Portal](http://clever.com/login)에서 우측 상단 코너에 있는 학생의 이름을 클릭하여 로그아웃을 선택합니다.

**2단계: Google 로그아웃**

- 전문가 팁: [이 링크를 클릭하여 로그아웃할 수 있습니다!](https://mail.google.com/mail/logout?hl=en)

**3단계: 새로운 사용자로 Clever에 로그인**

- <https://clever.com/login>으로 이동하여 학교를 검색합니다. 학교를 찾으면 Google 버튼을 클릭하고 학교 이메일 주소와 비밀번호를 입력합니다. 이제 새로운 사용자의 Clever 계정에 성공적으로 로그인할 수 있습니다!

학생이 Chromebook을 공유하는 경우, 장치에 여러 개의 프로필을 설정하는 것을 권장합니다. 프로필을 구성한 후 각 학생은 개인 프로필을 사용하여 계정 간의 충돌을 방지해야 합니다.

1단계: 여러 개의 프로필을 설정합니다. [여기에서 방법을 찾을 수 있습니다.](https://support.google.com/chromebook/answer/1059242?hl=en)

2단계: 추가 프로필로 로그인합니다

다른 사람으로 로그인하기 전에 두 번째 사람을 Chromebook에 추가했는지 확인하십시오. 그리고 다음 단계를 따릅니다.

1. Google 계정에 로그인합니다.
2. 우측 하단에서 시간을 선택합니다.
3. Google 계정 이메일을 선택합니다.
4. 'Sign in another user(다른 사용자로 로그인)'을 선택합니다.
5. 신뢰하는 사람에게만 기능을 사용하라는 알림이 나타납니다. 'OK(확인)'을 선택합니다.
6. 사용자를 선택한 후 비밀번호를 입력합니다. 최대 5명의 사용자를 추가할 수 있습니다.

**로그인한 계정 간 전환**

여러 명의 사용자를 추가한 후 다음과 같이 계정 사이를 전환할 수 있습니다.

1. Google 계정에 로그인합니다.
2. 우측 하단에서 시간을 선택합니다.
3. 전환하고자 하는 사용자를 선택합니다.

활성화된 모든 사용자는 네트워크와 같은 일부 설정을 공유합니다. 프로필 사진과 북마크와 같은 기타 설정은 각 사용자에 따라 다릅니다.

title: "학부모용: 문제 해결 - 공유 장치 "
text:
브라우저 기록(쿠키, 캐시 등)을 삭제하는 것을 권장합니다. Chrome의 경우 다음 단계를 따라 캐시를 삭제할 수 있습니다.

1. 컴퓨터에서 Chrome을 엽니다.
2. 우측 상단에서 'More(더 보기)'를 클릭합니다.
3. 'More tools(도구 더 보기)'를 클릭하고 'Clear browsing data(인터넷 사용 기록 삭제)'를 클릭합니다.
4. 상단에서 기간 범위를 선택합니다. 모든 기록을 지우려면 'All time(전체 기간)'을 선택합니다.
5. 다음으로 "Cookies and other site data(쿠키 및 기타 사이트 데이트)"와 "Cached images and files(캐시된 이미지
6. 및 파일)"을 삭제하려면 상자를 체크합니다.
7. 'Clear data(인터넷 사용 기록 삭제)'를 클릭합니다.

다른 브라우저를 사용하는 경우 다음 문서를 참조하시길 바랍니다.

- [Apple 장치](https://clear-my-cache.com/apple-mac-os.html)
- [Windows 장치](https://clear-my-cache.com/windows.html)

위의 단계를 완료했지만, 로그인할 수 없는 경우, 학생이 비공개 창을 사용하여 로그인할 수 있도록 합니다. 비공개 창을 사용하면 기존의 모든 사용자 세션을 무시하고 다른 사용자가 로그인할 수 있도록 합니다.

1. 컴퓨터에서 Google Chrome을 엽니다.
2. 우측 상단에서 'More(더 보기)', 'New Incognito Window(새 시크릿 창)'을 클릭합니다. ![](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/ijcidTpqWgtkjN0azDJbXnh5I2b83D65HHi2N7SqGXCXYM4-MYEcCCibdKBGNKTiug=w18-h18)
3. 새 창이 나타납니다. 상단 코너에서 시크릿 아이콘을 확인합니다.
4. <https://clever.com/login으>로 이동하여 3단계에서 설명한 지침을 따라 로그인합니다.

여전히 문제가 발생하는 경우, 언제든지 Clever 지원팀에 문의하세요!

title: 对于家庭：故障排除 - 共享设备
heading_path: 对于家庭：故障排除 - 共享设备
section: 对于家庭：故障排除 - 共享设备
text:
标题

对于家庭：故障排除 - 共享设备

URL 名称

360020614031

Article Body

本文包含以下内容： 
1. [说明 - 通用 说明 - 通用](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360020614031?language=zh_CN#h_e0b953c4-37d8-4781-a616-6fe136aa6458) 
2. [说明 - 用 Google 登录](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360020614031?language=zh_CN#h_f723888c-6033-4cba-b3fa-f30388209a1b) 
3. [说明 - Chromebooks](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360020614031?language=zh_CN#h_de7aed1d-cd7b-44ef-93cb-2769693f6799) 
3. [需要额外帮助？](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360020614031?language=zh_CN#h_58aab7a5-42eb-4e5f-b5ae-655fb8e0860f)

如果您的家庭有多个学生的 Clever 帐户使用相同的设备，这篇文章将帮助确保您的孩子在其他人登录之前正确退出！

为了确保您孩子的用户会话在其他人登录之前已经结束，请遵循以下步骤：

**步骤 1：退出 Clever**

- 从 Clever Portal，点击右上角的学生姓名，选择退出。

**步骤 2：作为新用户登录 Clever**

- 访问 <https://clever.com/login> 并搜索您的学校。找到您的学校后，点击 Google 按钮并输入您的学校电子邮箱地址和密码。您现在应该成功登录到新用户的 Clever 帐户！

![mceclip0.png](/hc/article_attachments/360054322172/mceclip0.png)

**步骤 1：退出 Clever**

- 从 Clever Portal，点击右上角的学生姓名，选择退出。

**步骤 2：退出 Google**

- 专业提示：[您可以点击这个链接退出！](https://mail.google.com/mail/logout?hl=en)

**步骤 3：作为新用户登录 Clever**

- 访问 <https://clever.com/login> 并搜索您的学校。找到您的学校后，点击 Google 按钮并输入您的学校电子邮箱地址和密码。您现在应该成功登录到新用户的 Clever 帐户！

如果您的学生共享了一台 Chromebook，我们建议您在该设备上设置多个个人资料。配置完毕之后，每个学生应该使用他们各自的个人资料，以防止帐户之间出现冲突。

步骤 1：设置多个个人资料。[可以在这里找到说明。](https://support.google.com/chromebook/answer/1059242?hl=en)

步骤 2：登录到其他个人资料

在您让另一个人登录之前，确保您已经把这个人添加到您的 Chromebook 上。然后遵循以下步骤：

1. 登录到您的 Google 帐户。
2. 在右下角，选择时间。
3. 选择您的 Google 帐户电子邮箱。
4. 选择“Sign in another user（让另一个用户登录）”。
5. 您将看到一个提示，提醒您只让您信任的人使用这个功能。选择“OK（确定）”。
6. 选择一个人，然后输入他们的密码。您最多可以添加 5 个用户。

**在您登录的帐户之间切换** 
在您添加了多个人之后，您可以在他们之间切换：

1. 登录到您的 Google 帐户。
2. 在右下角，选择时间。
3. 选择您想要切换到的人。

所有活动的人都共用一些设置，比如网络。其他的设置（比如个人资料图片和书签）都是每个人特定的。

title: 对于家庭：故障排除 - 共享设备
heading_path: 对于家庭：故障排除 - 共享设备
text:
我们建议清除浏览器的历史记录（cookie、缓存等）。对于 Chrome，您可以通过以下步骤清除缓存：

1. 在电脑上打开 Chrome。
2. 在右上角，点击“More（更多）”。
3. 点击“More（更多）”工具 Clear browsing data（清除浏览数据）。
4. 在顶部，选择一个时间范围。要删除所有内容，请选择“All time（所有时间）”。
5. 在“Cookies and other site data（Cookie 和其他网站数据）”和“Cached images and files（缓存的图片
6. 文件）”旁边，勾选这些选项。
7. 点击“Clear data（清除数据）”。

如果您正在使用其他浏览器，请参阅以下文档：

- [苹果设备](https://clear-my-cache.com/apple-mac-os.html)
- [Windows 设备](https://clear-my-cache.com/windows.html)

如果以上步骤已经完成，但登录不起作用，请让您的学生使用一个专用窗口登录。这将忽略所有现有的用户会话，从而允许其他用户登录：

1. 在电脑上打开 [Google Chrome](https://www.google.com/chrome/)。
2. 在右上角，点击“More（更多）” New Incognito Window（新无痕浏览窗口）。
3. 将出现一个新窗口。在左上角，选择无痕浏览图标。![](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/ijcidTpqWgtkjN0azDJbXnh5I2b83D65HHi2N7SqGXCXYM4-MYEcCCibdKBGNKTiug=w18-h18)
4. 导航至 <https://clever.com/login>，并使用步骤 3 中列出的说明来登录。

如果您仍然遇到问题，请随时联系 Clever 支持部门！

title: For Students: Troubleshooting - Apps
text:
> Tip: Title For Students: Troubleshooting - Apps URL Name 360020618731 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. App is missing 3. Clicked on app, received an error 4. Clicked on app, Clever asked for a username and password 5. Problems within apps
>  
> Overview
> Here are some steps you can take if you are having trouble logging in to applications from your Clever Portal. If you still are experiencing issues, please ask your teacher for help. > App is missing
> If you are missing an application from your Clever Portal, please ask your teacher for help . Your district will need to add the application to your Clever Portal. >  
> Clicked on app, received an error
> If you click on an application in your Clever Portal and get an error on the application's page, please ask your teacher to contact your district administrator or the application's support team for help . Clever Tip:  If you are seeing an error at a web URL that is  not a Clever address, it's likely that the application can help you fix the issue. Please have your teacher reach out to the application's support team to investigate further! > Here are examples of common errors you might see for specific applications:
> Clicked on app, Clever asked for a username and password
> If a Clever page asks you to enter your username and password for an application, enter the correct login information for that application, and click Save Login . Clever will save this information and automatically log you in next time you click the icon from the Portal! > If you click on an application and see the page below, this means we were not able to log you in with the username and password you provided. Please enter your updated username and password for the application, and click  Update & Log in . > If you are still having trouble, ask your teacher to make sure you have the right username and password. They can contact Clever Support if they still need help!

> Problems within apps
> After you are logged into an app successfully through Clever, any issues within the application would need to be addressed by the application's support team. > Clever is not able to resolve issues within applications . Some example issues the Clever cannot help with are: 
> The app freezing Not being able to access grades or textbooks Your student runs out of time during a test The app suddenly logs your student out Missing lessons or assignments Accessing the microphone or camera
> I f you are running into an issue within the application, please ask your teacher to contact the application's support team for help.

text:

**![](https://support.clever.com/hc/article_attachments/115018504583/mceclip1.png)Consejo de Clever:** Si ve un error en la URL de una web que **no** es una dirección de Clever, es probable que la aplicación pueda ayudarle a solucionar el problema. Por favor, pídale a su maestro que se comunique con el equipo de soporte de la aplicación para investigar más a fondo.

Aquí tiene ejemplos de errores comunes que puede ver para determinadas aplicaciones: 
![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl0000001pdB&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000002lYo4)

title: Para estudiantes: Estoy teniendo problemas con una aplicación

section: Una página de Clever me pide el nombre de usuario y la contraseña de mi aplicación
text:
Si una página de Clever le pide que ingrese su nombre de usuario y contraseña de una aplicación, ingrese la información correcta de inicio de sesión para esa aplicación y haga clic en "**Guardar inicio** de sesión". ¡Clever guardará esta información e iniciará sesión automáticamente la próxima vez que haga clic en el icono del Portal!

![](https://support.clever.com/hc/article_attachments/360018316672/mceclip3.png)

Si hace clic en una aplicación y ve la página de abajo, esto significa que no pudimos iniciar sesión con el nombre de usuario y la contraseña que usted proporcionó. Por favor, ingrese la información actualizada de su nombre de usuario y contraseña de la aplicación, y haga clic **en 'Actualizar e Iniciar** sesión'.

![](https://support.clever.com/hc/article_attachments/360018316592/mceclip2.png)

Si aún tiene problemas, pídale a su maestro que se asegure de que usted tenga el nombre de usuario y la contraseña correctos. ¡Pueden contactar al soporte de Clever si aún necesitan ayuda!

Después de hacer clic en una aplicación en el Portal de Clever, lo que ve está controlado por la aplicación Si tiene un problema en la **aplicación (ejemplo: la aplicación se cuelga, no puede acceder a las calificaciones o a los libros de texto, se le acaba el tiempo durante una prueba, la aplicación cierra la sesión), por favor, pídale a su maestro que se comunique con el equipo de soporte de la aplicación para recibir ayuda.**

title: For Families: Clever Badges
text:
> Tip: Title For Families: Clever Badges URL Name 360020790571 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Logging in with a Badge 3. Using a 6-digit Badge PIN 4. What if my student forgot their Badge PIN? 5. What if I cannot print my student's Badge? 6. Devices without cameras
> Overview
> Clever Badges are an easy and secure way for your student to log in to Clever by scanning a Badge into a device's webcam rather than needing to enter a username and password! Badges are tied to the student. As such, changes in school, teacher, or section will not affect the Badge. > Logging in with a Badge
> 1. Your student will first need to obtain a Clever Badge from their teacher or school. > 2. Then, they will navigate to the Clever login page for your student's district, or go directly to clever.com/badges. Please do not attempt to use a QR reader to log your student in. Clever Badges are designed to be used directly with Clever and a QR reader won't log your student into Clever. > Please note:   There may be multiple schools by the same name, so please be sure to select the school associated with your student's school district! > 3. Select the Clever Badge Log in  option. >           
> 4. Your internet browser may ask you to allow clever.com to use your device's camera. Select Allow . >           
> 5. Hold your student's Badge up to the device's camera and wait for the green checkmark to log your student into Clever! If the Badge is about to expire, please ask your teacher for a new one. >          
>  
> 6. Once your student is logged into their Clever Portal, they can click on the application icon they'd like to use:         
>  
> Please note: Beginning January 1, 2025, you will see expiration dates on any newly created or re-printed existing badges for your student. By default, all Badges existing before June 30, 2026 will expire on July 1, 2026. New badges will be valid for 365 days from the creation date . See  this article for more information.

title: For Families: Clever Badges
text:
>  
>  
> Using a 6-digit Badge PIN
> If your student's school district has enabled Badge PINs for your student's account, your student will be asked to create or enter a 6-digit PIN. Be sure to have your student create a PIN that they will remember! >  
>  
> What if my student forgot their Badge PIN? > 1. If your student forgot their 6-digit Badge PIN, please contact your student's teacher or school to help them log in to Clever. > Please note: If you are unsure who to reach out to at your student's school, you can typically locate the appropriate contact information by selecting the 'Get help signing in' or 'Get help logging in!' option from your district's Clever login page. > 2. Once your student is logged into their Clever Portal, they can reset their 6-digit PIN by clicking on their name in the top-right corner, and selecting Reset your Badge PIN . >  
> Clever Tip:  Teachers can help students log into Clever using a backup code, or by resetting the student's password! Check out this Help Center article for more information: For Teachers: How do I help my student log into Clever? >  
>  
> What if I cannot print my student's Badge? > If you do not have access to a printer, try the following: 
> Save the Clever Badge to the photo app on your phone Open the website  clever.com/badges  on your student's computer or device. Open the photo of the Badge on your phone, turn your phone's screen to face the computer, and hold it up to the camera. The badge should successfully scan! Tip: If it does not scan at first, try adjusting the distance and angle from the camera! >  
>  
>  
> Devices without cameras
> If a student does not have access to a device with a camera, they can log in using the district's normal login method (e.g. Log in with Google, Log in with Active Directory, Log in with Clever). > If you require assistance with identifying their username and password for one of these login methods, please reach out to your district's tech support contact .

title: Setting up Clever: Overview
text:
Title

Setting up Clever: Overview

URL Name

360020721271

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360020721271?language=en_US#one) 
2. [Connect your student information system (SIS)](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360020721271?language=en_US#two) 
3. [Add Applications](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360020721271?language=en_US#ADDAPPS) 
4. [Choose your identity provider (IdP)](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360020721271?language=en_US#three) 
5. [After onboarding, roll out Clever to your schools!](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360020721271?language=en_US#six) 
6. [Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360020721271?language=en_US#FAQs)

![Clever Academy.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TVMz&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000035fec) 
Getting started with the Clever? Check out our [onboarding courses](https://clever.academy/path/onboarding?user_type=district_admin), available in Clever Academy!

Welcome to Clever! We’re so excited to get you set up. Clever offers many features, and getting started with the basics is easy.

For the best onboarding experience, we encourage you to access the onboarding courses listed above in Clever Academy once you have set up your Clever account. It’s a comprehensive resource to guide you in setting up Clever!

Below is a summary of the four essential steps to get your Clever account running. The first three steps are part of your onboarding journey, and the fourth is to get your schools using Clever so they can benefit from it!

---

title: Setting up Clever: Overview
heading_path: Step 1: Connect your student information system (SIS)
section: Step 1: Connect your student information system (SIS)
text:
To start, you need to connect your SIS to Clever so we can help you share data you designate with relevant apps. Syncing data with Clever can be done with any SIS. Your sync is what sends information from your SIS to Clever so that we can share the data you authorize with the applications you specify.

Navigate to the [Data sources > SIS sync](https://schools.clever.com/sync/settings)page in the dashboard and find your SIS from the drop-down menu. If you can’t find your SIS listed here, choose *Other*.

There are three ways to sync data to Clever:

- [Clever-managed Auto Sync](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202042973?language=en_US)
- [SIS-managed Auto Sync](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202042973?language=en_US)
- [SFTP Sync](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/205783078?language=en_US)

For any SIS-Managed or SFTP syncs, our teams have limited insight into the export processes within your SIS. Please work with your SIS team directly for any questions on how to export data from their system.

If you need guidance on what sync type you should use, you can learn more here: [Which sync type should I choose?](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202289278)

---

title: Setting up Clever: Overview
text:
Clever seamlessly syncs data with any of your schools' applications, or apps, that you connect to Clever. Examples include Newsela, Reading A-Z, and Mathspace.

To [add an application](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/203114997), navigate to your [Clever Dashboard > Applications > Add applications page](https://schools.clever.com/applications/add),and then request your desired application(s).

Once you’ve requested a learning application, each app partner has its own approval process. If you have questions about getting your request approved, impacts on existing application data, or changes to the login flow for your students and teachers, please reach out to the application partner directly.

**Sharing Data**

After you have added a new application to Clever, you’ll need to set data sharing permissions for the application. Sharing permissions specify what data you want to make available to a specific application.

- From the [Applications page](https://schools.clever.com/applications), find your newest application(s) from your list of connected learning applications.
- On the right side, choose **Share data now**.

![Screenshot of the Application page showing “No data shared”](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TVMz&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl0000024z0Y)

Find more information about sharing data with new applications here: [Sharing Permissions: Sharing data with new applications](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360043482712?language=en_US).

---

title: Setting up Clever: Overview
text:
If you decide to utilize the Clever Portal, you'll choose how students, teachers, and staff will log into Clever and access all your online learning applications in one place with a single click!

To set up single sign-on (SSO):

1. Navigate to your [Clever Dashboard > Authentication > SSO settings](https://schools.clever.com/instant-login/accesscontrol) page.
2. Choose the identity provider (e.g. [Google](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202084503), [Active Directory](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202102576), [LDAP](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/207090387), etc.) that works best for users in your school district. Find more information here: [Single Sign-On (SSO): identity provider (IdP) Options](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/203166787?language=en_US).

Our Help Center offers step-by-step instructions for how to set up each login method within your Clever Dashboard: [Single Sign-On (SSO): Identity Provider (IDP)/Login Method Options](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/203166787).

---

Woohoo! Now it’s time to share the exciting news with your teachers and make sure they’re all set.

If you’ve chosen to use Clever Portal with your district, navigate to the [Clever Dashboard > Portal > Portal settings](https://schools.clever.com/portal/settings/url) page to provide instructions on how they will access Clever. You can find instructions to download on your Clever Dashboard as shown in this screenshot:

![Screenshot of the Portal settings page](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TVMz&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl000000obys)

If you’re using Clever just for rostering, make sure all apps your schools are using are added to Clever, and ensure teachers know how to log in to them.

---

title: Setting up Clever: Overview
text:
**Is there a quick list to walk me through the steps of setting up my Clever account?**

- Yes! We’ve created customized resources for districts and schools just getting started with Clever. Check out our [Clever Admin Onboarding checklist and Onboarding Quick Start Guides](https://clever.academy/path/onboarding?user_type=district_admin) for a handheld approach to setting up your account.

**Who do I contact if I have questions as I work on setting up my account?**

- You should have received a welcome email with detailed setup instructions when your Clever account was created. Please respond directly to this email with any questions and your dedicated Onboarding Specialist will respond to assist you. If you cannot find the email or any other emails from your onboarding specialist, please feel free to reach out directly to our support team at [support.clever.com](http://support.clever.com) and they will put you in touch with your Onboarding Specialist.

**Can I add other administrators to help with account setup?**

- Yes! Navigate to the [Clever Dashboard > User management > Admin team](https://schools.clever.com/team/members) page of your Clever account and follow the steps in our article: [Clever Roles: Clever Admin](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202518038).

**What if I don’t know how to export data from my SIS?**

- Check out our onboarding resources in Clever Academy, or reach out to your district/school’s onboarding specialist and they can share where you can find additional instructions.
- With SFTP syncs, we have limited insight into how to export data from your SIS. We recommend reaching out directly to your SIS for the best assistance with any SIS-specific export instructions for your SFTP sync.

**What if I don’t have a SIS?**

- You can manually create and upload CSV files to sync your data to Clever.

**How long does it take to set up my Clever account?**

title: Setting up Clever: Overview
text:
- This varies for each district and school depending on your SIS, sync type, and the applications you hope to set up. Most schools can have their data sync and first application launched for rostering within a week!

**How do I know when I have completed onboarding with Clever?**

- You can expect a congratulatory email from your Onboarding Specialist when you have completed Clever onboarding. This email will provide next-step resources and instructions on how to reach our support team for any further assistance needed beyond onboarding.

**What are my next steps after syncing data, setting up an application, and adding a login method?**

- Check out [Clever Academy](https://clever.academy/?user_type=district_admin) for more information on Clever Core and Clever+ tools! Once you have completed the onboarding process, please reach out to our [support team](http://support.clever.com) with any questions about troubleshooting or resources to help you further utilize Clever.

title: Para familias: ¿Cómo ayudo a mi estudiante a iniciar una sesión en Clever con un Badge?
heading_path: Para familias: ¿Cómo ayudo a mi estudiante a iniciar una sesión en Clever con un Badge?
Iniciar una sesión en Clever usando una Badge
section: Iniciar una sesión en Clever usando una Badge
text:
1. Su estudiante primero deberá obtener un Clever Badge de su maestro o escuela.

2. Luego, navegue a la página de inicio de sesión Clever para el distrito de su estudiante. Si no conoce la página del distrito de inicio de sesión de Clever, por favor, vaya a [clever.com/badges](https://clever.com/badges) y busque la escuela de su estudiante.

**![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000UD4f&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028BpB) Tenga en cuenta:** puede haber varias escuelas con el mismo nombre, así que asegúrese de seleccionar la escuela asociada con el distrito escolar de su estudiante.

3. Seleccione la opción "**Clever Badge Log in**" (Iniciar sesión conClever Badge).

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000UD4f&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000002lYna)

4. Su navegador de Internet puede pedirle que permita que [clever.com](http://clever.com/) use la cámara de su dispositivo. Seleccione "**Allow**" (Permitir).

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000UD4f&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000002lYnf)

5. Mantenga la Badge de su estudiante frente a la cámara del dispositivo y espere a que la marca de verificación verde registre a su estudiante en Clever!

![Una captura de pantalla de un inicio de sesión de Clever Badge](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000UD4f&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000005Tbav)

6. Una vez que su alumno haya iniciado sesión en su Portal de Clever, puede hacer clic en el icono de la aplicación que le gustaría usar:

![Una captura de pantalla de un Clever Portal](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000UD4f&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000005TbbK)

---

Si el distrito escolar de su estudiante ha habilitado Badge PINs para la cuenta de su estudiante, se le pedirá que cree o ingrese un PIN 6 dígitos. ¡Asegúrese de que su estudiante cree un PIN que recordarán!

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000UD4f&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000002lYnk)

---

title: Para familias: ¿Cómo ayudo a mi estudiante a iniciar una sesión en Clever con un Badge?
heading_path: Para familias: ¿Cómo ayudo a mi estudiante a iniciar una sesión en Clever con un Badge?
¿Qué pasa si mi estudiante olvidó su PIN de credencial?
section: ¿Qué pasa si mi estudiante olvidó su PIN de credencial?
text:
1. Si su estudiante se olvidó del código PIN de Badge de 6 dígitos, por favor, póngase en contacto con el/la maestro/a de su estudiante o escuela para ayudarles a iniciar una sesión en Clever.

![Una captura de pantalla de un inicio de sesión fallido](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000UD4f&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000005TbbP)

**![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000UD4f&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028BpB)Tenga en cuenta:** Si no está seguro de a quién comunicarse en la escuela de su estudiante, normalmente puede localizar la información de contacto adecuada seleccionando "Get help signing in" o "Get help logging in!" ('Obtener ayuda para iniciar sesión' o '¡Obtener ayuda para iniciar sesión!') opción desde la página de inicio de sesión Clever de su distrito.

![Una captura de pantalla de dónde puede obtener ayuda para iniciar sesión](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000UD4f&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000005TbbU)

2. Una vez que su estudiante esté en su Portal de Clever, puede restablecer sus 6 dígitos PIN haciendo clic en su nombre en la esquina superior derecha y seleccionando **Reset your Badge PIN** (Restablecer su Badge PIN).

![Una captura de pantalla de dónde puede restablecer su pin Clever Badge](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000UD4f&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000005TbbZ)

**![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000UD4f&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028DZF) Consejo de Clever:** ¡Los profesores pueden ayudar a los estudiantes a iniciar sesión en Clever usando un código de respaldo o restableciendo la contraseña del estudiante! Consulte este artículo del Centro de ayuda para obtener más información: [Para profesores: ¿Cómo ayudo a mi estudiante a iniciar sesión en Clever?](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/222933888)

---

Si no tiene acceso a una impresora, intente lo siguiente:

1. Guarde el Clever Badge en la aplicación de fotos de su teléfono
2. Abra el sitio web [clever.com/badges](https://clever.com/badges) en su computadora o dispositivo de su estudiante.
3. Abra la foto del Badge en su teléfono, gire la pantalla de su teléfono hacia la computadora y sosténgala frente a la cámara.
4. ¡El Badge debería escanearse con éxito!

**Consejo: Si no escanea al principio, ¡intente ajustar la distancia y el ángulo desde la cámara!**

![Una captura de pantalla del código QR de Clever Badge](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000UD4f&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000005Tbbe)

---

title: Para familias: ¿Cómo ayudo a mi estudiante a iniciar una sesión en Clever con un Badge?
heading_path: Para familias: ¿Cómo ayudo a mi estudiante a iniciar una sesión en Clever con un Badge?
text:
Si un estudiante no tiene acceso a un dispositivo con cámara, puede iniciar sesión utilizando el método de inicio de sesión normal del distrito (por ejemplo, iniciar sesión con Google, iniciar sesión con Active Directory, iniciar sesión con Clever).

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000UD4f&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028DZP)

Si necesita ayuda para identificar su nombre de usuario y contraseña para uno de estos métodos de inicio de sesión, comuníquese con el contacto de [soporte técnico de su distrito](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360000067006).

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000UD4f&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028DZU) Consulte con su distrito escolar para ver si han habilitado el Portal Familiar para ayudar a las familias y a los estudiantes a iniciar sesión en Clever. Many of the nation’s largest school districts rely on Clever to sync student information with learning applications, in part because security is a top priority. Clever keeps student information safe by ensuring:

- Full district control over data access rights at all times;
- A robust [privacy policy](https://clever.com/trust) that governs Clever's use of student data; and
- Protection through a tested and secure infrastructure.

---

Districts control data access at all points in the process, from signup all the way through account provisioning. Districts determine:

- What data Clever can access (always read-only);
- How often they sync data with Clever;

- How much data each application can access (via [data sharing permissions](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/203115007)).

text:
Title

للعائلات: هل معلومات الطلاب آمنة في Clever؟

360020791011

Article Body

تعتمد العديد من أكبر المناطق التعليمية في البلاد على Clever لمزامنة معلومات الطلاب مع تطبيقات التعلم، ويرجع ذلك إلى أن الأمان يمثل أولوية قصوى. يحافظ Clever على أمن معلومات الطالب من خلال ضمان:

- السيطرة الكاملة للمنطقة على حقوق الوصول إلى البيانات في جميع الأوقات؛
- [سياسة الخصوصية قوية تحكم استخدام Clever لبيانات الطلاب؛](https://clever.com/about/privacy-policy)
- الحماية من خلال بنية تحتية مجربة وآمنة.

تتحكم المناطق في الوصول إلى البيانات في كافة النقاط، بدءًا من الاشتراك حتى توفير الحساب. تقرر المقاطعات ما يلي:

- البيانات التي يمكن لـ Clever الوصول إليها (دائمًا للقراءة فقط)؛
- عدد مرات مزامنة البيانات مع Clever؛
- التطبيقات التي يمكنها الوصول إلى البيانات؛
- [ومقدار البيانات التي يمكن لكل تطبيق الوصول إليها (عبر إذن مشاركة البيانات).](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360020791011)

يمكن للمقاطعات تحسين هذه الإعدادات في أي وقت من خلال لوحة معلومات Clever. إذا اختارت المنطقة إيقاف مزامنة Clever، فيمكنها القيام بذلك في أي وقت. سيقوم Clever بحذف حسابه وإزالة أي بيانات متبقية عند الطلب.

يقوم Clever بمزامنة المعلومات الأساسية لإدارة حسابات المستخدمين في تطبيقات التعلم عبر الإنترنت، مثل معرفات الطالب والمعلم وأسماء الأقسام ومعلومات الالتحاق.

جميع بيانات قوائم الانتظار التي تتم مزامنتها مع Clever محمية بواسطة بنية تحتية رائدة في الصناعة (انظر أدناه).

بالإضافة إلى ذلك، يلتزم Clever بامتثال FERPA بموجب إعفاء مسؤولي المدارس في FTC، مما يعني أن Clever يقدم خدمة نيابة عن المدارس التي توفرها المدارس نفسها عادةً. إضافة إلى ذلك، توافق جميع التطبيقات المدعومة من Clever على الالتزام بمتطلبات FERPA في شروط شراكتنا.

[لمعرفة المزيد حول خصوصية البيانات، يمكنك قراءة سياسة الخصوصية لـ Clever الكاملة.](https://clever.com/about/privacy-policy)

title: للعائلات: هل معلومات الطلاب آمنة في Clever؟
heading_path: للعائلات: هل معلومات الطلاب آمنة في Clever؟
text:
أمضى Clever سنوات عديدة في تطوير واحدة من أفضل البنى التحتية الأمنية في التعليم من الروضة حتى الصف الثاني عشر. الميزات الرئيسية للبنية التحتية الرائدة للصناعة في Clever هي:

- تشفير بيانات AES256 للبيانات في حالة الراحة؛
- TLS مع تشفير قوي، بالإضافة لتفضيل لأولئك الذين يتمتعون بسرية تامة، للبيانات أثناء النقل؛
- تصديق متعدد العوامل؛
- عمليات تدقيق الأمان ومراجعة التعليمات البرمجية للأطراف الثالثة؛
- برنامج الإفصاح المسؤول ("فضل الأخطاء") ؛
- مسؤول أمن بدوام كامل؛
- تحقيقات خلفية للموظف.

[يتم تشفير عملية المزامنة في جميع الأوقات باستخدام تشفير 256 بت، وهو ضعف المعيار المستخدم في صناعة الخدمات المصرفية للمستهلكين. بالإضافة إلى ذلك، فإن بيئة إنتاج Clever معزولة تمامًا عن الإنترنت، ويتم تسجيل الوصول وتأمينه باستخدام تصديق متعدد العوامل.](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202062333).

يعمل Clever على ضمان التحسين المستمر لبروتوكولات الأمن من خلال توظيف مدير أمن بدوام كامل و كذلك الاستثمار في إجراء التدقيق من قبل طرف ثالث بشكل دوري.

[إذا كنت مهتماً بمعرفة المزيد، فيرجى قراءة تقرير الأمان.](https://clever.com/about/security/practices)

- Una [política de privacidad](https://clever.com/trust) sólida que rige el uso de Clever de los datos de los estudiantes

Los distritos controlan el acceso a los datos en todos los puntos del proceso, desde el registro hasta el aprovisionamiento de la cuenta. Los distritos determinan:

Privacidad de datos de estudiantes en Clever
section: Privacidad de datos de estudiantes en Clever
text:
Clever sincroniza información básica para gestionar las cuentas de usuario en aplicaciones de aprendizaje en línea, como los identificadores de estudiantes y profesores, los nombres de las secciones y la información de inscripción.

Todos los datos de la lista que se sincronizan con Clever están protegidos por una infraestructura líder en la industria (véase más abajo). Clever nunca usará o venderá la información de los estudiantes con fines de marketing u otros propósitos.

Además, Clever cumple con FERPA según la Exención de funcionarios escolares de la FTC, lo que significa que Clever brinda un servicio en nombre de las escuelas que las propias escuelas normalmente brindarían. Además, todas las aplicaciones compatibles con Clever aceptan cumplir con los requisitos de FERPA en los términos de nuestra asociación.

Para obtener más información sobre la privacidad de los datos, puede leer la [política de privacidad](https://clever.com/trust/privacy/policy) completa de Clever.

title: Para familias: Políticas de seguridad en Clever para los datos de los estudiantes
heading_path: Para familias: Políticas de seguridad en Clever para los datos de los estudiantes
text:
Clever ha pasado años desarrollando una de las mejores infraestructuras de seguridad en la educación K-12. Las características clave de la infraestructura líder en la industria de Clever son:

- Cifrado de datos AES256 para datos en reposo,
- TLS (seguridad de la capa de transporte) con cifrados fuertes, con preferencia por aquellos con perfecta-discreción hacia adelante, para datos en tránsito;
- Autenticación de múltiples factores;
- Auditorías de seguridad de terceros y revisiones de código.
- Divulgación responsable ("error de software programa de recompensas").
- Administrador de seguridad a tiempo completo.
- Verificaciones de antecedentes de los empleados.

El proceso de sincronización se encripta en todo momento con un cifrado de 256 bits, que es el doble del estándar utilizado por la industria bancaria del consumidor. Además, el entorno de producción de Clever está completamente aislado de Internet, y todo el acceso se registra y se protege mediante la [autenticación de múltiples factores](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202062333).

Clever cuenta con un administrador de seguridad a tiempo completo e invierte en auditorías periódicas de terceros para garantizar la mejora continua de los protocolos de seguridad.

---

**Recursos adicionales:**

- Para obtener más información sobre nuestras prácticas de seguridad, puede leer nuestro [programa de seguridad integral](https://www.clever.com/trust/security).

section: 家长参阅：学生在Clever上的信息是否安全？
text:
标题

家长参阅：学生在Clever上的信息是否安全？

URL 名称

360020791011

Article Body

我国多个大型学区都依赖Clever在各个学习应用程序上同步学生的信息，部分原因是考虑到信息安全。Clever通过以下措施保证学生信息的安全：

- 学区全权、全时掌控数据准入权限；
- [Clever对学生数据的使用受强效的隐私政策控制;](https://clever.com/about/privacy-policy)
- 技术基础安全性经过验证，有效提供保护。

从登入到账户设置，学区在整个流程中都对数据准入进行控制。学区可以决定：

- Clever可以访问哪些数据(总是只读)；
- 与Clever同步数据的频率；
- 哪些应用程序可以访问数据；
- [每个应用程序可以访问多少数据（数据分享许可）。](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/203115007)

学区可以随时在Clever的控制面板上对这些设置进行调整。如果某个学区决定不再与Clever进行数据同步，他们随时可以中断同步。Clever在收到请求后将删除他们的账户并移除所有剩余数据。

Clever仅同步在线学习应用程序用户账户管理所需的基本信息，例如学生和老师标识、课堂名称、注册登记信息等。

所有与Clever同步的名册均在业内领先的基础技术保护之下。Clever绝不会处于营销或其他原因使用或出售学生信息。

此外，Clever遵守联邦贸易委员会（FTC）学校官员条件豁免下《家庭教育权利和隐私法》（FERPA）的要求，意思是，Clever以学校的名义提供一般由学校提供的服务。此外，Clever支持的所有应用程序在与我们达成伙伴关系时，均同意遵守FERPA的要求。

[如要了解数据隐私的更多信息，请参阅Clever的隐私政策全文。](https://clever.com/about/privacy-policy)

多年来，Clever已经开发出一套最佳的K到12年级教育安全技术基础。Clever的技术基础业内领先，具有以下特色：

- AES256静态数据加密；
- 具有强密码的传输层安全协议（TLS），优先选择那些具有完美转发保密性的TLS用于传输数据；
- 多重要素验证；
- 第三方安全审计和代码审查；
- 负责任的披露(“漏洞奖励”)计划；
- 专职安全管理员；
- 员工背景调查。

[同步流程全部使用256位加密技术加密，该技术是零售银行业相关技术标准的两倍。此外，Clever的生产环境完全与互联网分离，所有准入均有记录并使用多重要素验证保证安全性。](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202062333)

Clever设有一位专职安全管理员，并聘请第三方进行定期审计，目的也是确保安全协议的持续改进。

[如您有兴趣了解更多信息，请参阅我们的《安全白皮书》。](https://clever.com/about/security/practices)

title: For Clever Admins: Syncing demographic data/sensitive fields
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Syncing demographic data/sensitive fields
section: For Clever Admins: Syncing demographic data/sensitive fields
text:
> Tip: Title For Clever Admins: Syncing demographic data/sensitive fields URL Name 360020926771 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Syncing demographic data to Clever 3. Clever-Managed Auto Syncs 4. SIS-Managed Auto and SFTP Syncs 5. Sharing sensitive data with applications
> Overview
> Clever can sync a variety of demographic data, such as  ELL status, IEP status, and Free/reduced-price lunch (FRL) status, among others. Because the data in these fields is considered sensitive, Clever doesn't automatically share this data with any district-connected applications. Still, these fields can be included in the application sharing if needed. > Clever Tip: Not all apps support all demographic data/sensitive fields. If you have specific demographic data you need to share with an app, please contact the app directly to check if they support syncing that field. >  
> Syncing demographic data/sensitive fields to Clever
> The first step is to ensure that sensitive fields are synced to Clever. Please navigate to your Clever Dashboard > Data browser > Students tab  to verify if these data points are available. Use the filter option to filter students by the demographic field in question. Then, select the value drop-down menu. If this search is not available, it likely means the data is not in Clever, and therefore, you can't search using these fields. > Clever-Managed Auto Syncs
> Districts that utilize the  Clever-managed auto-sync can  customize their sync from the Data sources > SIS sync > Settings > Sync Mappings box > View field mappings > Students tab . If the SIS field you wish to export is not available in the dropdown, please contact Clever Support for assistance. > Please note: OneRoster API syncs cannot sync ell\_status, frl\_status, and iep\_status. They can be manually uploaded via Custom data. Visit this article for instructions .

title: For Clever Admins: Syncing demographic data/sensitive fields
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Syncing demographic data/sensitive fields
section: For Clever Admins: Syncing demographic data/sensitive fields
text:
>  
> SIS-Managed Auto and SFTP Syncs
> Districts that utilize an  SIS-managed SFTP Auto Sync  or an  SFTP sync  will need to contact their SIS, or whoever configured the SFTP export, directly to begin syncing these data points to Clever. This data will need to be added to the students.csv export for the district with the column headers:
> ell\_status iep\_status frl\_status preferred\_last\_name preferred\_middle\_name preferred\_first\_name  gifted status home\_language ( see this section for a list of available languages) section\_504\_status disability\_status  disability\_type ( see here for a list of possible disability types)
> Please also review Clever's general SFTP guidelines  here . These instructions contain information about Clever-supported column headers and formatting requirements. >  
> Supported home languages
> Check out this article for all of the possible options for home languages. Given the number of languages supported, this list is not included in our  general SFTP guidelines . > When designating the home language within the students.csv file, you can use either the home language or the home language code. >  
> Sharing sensitive data with applications
> Sharing demographic data/sensitive fields with applications
> You can locate the  Field Access  information by navigating to a specific application's overview page from your  Clever Dashboard  and choosing the application  Settings  tab. Currently, Field Access gives you an overview of the data your applications have indicated they are using. Each learning application partner configures its required/optional fields for district data. Please get in touch with the application support teams directly if you have questions. Select the  Advanced settings  option, and then  Customize fields shared with. You can customize the student data available to the application from the  Edit Student Fields  tab. > The list on the left shows the fields available to share with the application.

title: For Clever Admins: Syncing demographic data/sensitive fields
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Syncing demographic data/sensitive fields
section: For Clever Admins: Syncing demographic data/sensitive fields
text:
The list on the right shows the list of fields currently being shared with the application. > Move field(s) from the left to right to share the sensitive data with the application. Once your changes have been made, select Next and Save . The application should be synced the newly shared data within the next 24 hours. Setting up sharing rules to share data based on demographic data/sensitive field information
> By configuring application  sharing permissions , districts can determine what data they would like to make available to applications. Sharing permissions also help districts to determine which users (e.g., teachers, students, staff) will have access to different applications in their Clever Portals. > Custom sharing rules allow districts to share only data that meets certain criteria. Once the field data has been synced to Clever and is available in the Clever Dashboard , sharing rules can be configured to share by the data associated with fields. For example:
> Share only students whose ELL\_Status is 'Y' Share only students whose gifted\_status is 'N'
> Configuring sharing rules to share using field data is completed by creating a sharing rule to 'Custom share by student.' From there, districts can select the field they would like to use for sharing data. Please visit Sharing Permissions: Share by Rules  for more information about setting up sharing rules. >  
> Related articles:
> Sharing Permissions: Share by Rules

> Tip: Title For Families: Troubleshooting - Apps URL Name 360021573031 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. App is missing 3. Clicked on app, received an error 4. Clicked on app, Clever asked for a username and password 5. Problems within apps
> Overview
> Occasionally, students will have issues with their applications (i.e. apps) in Clever. Here are some steps you can take to help your student if they are having trouble with a specific application. > App is missing  
> If your student is missing an application in Clever, please ask your student's teacher for help. Your student's school or district will likely need to add the app to their Clever Portal for them. >  
> Clicked on app, received an error
> If your student clicks on an app icon in their Clever Portal and receives an error from the app's website page, please ask your student's teacher to contact the district administrator or the application's support team for help . > Please note: If your student has recently changed schools or classes, please allow 24 hrs for their connected applications to be updated so they can log in. > Clever Tip:  If you are seeing an error at a web URL that is  not a Clever address, it will be necessary to contact the application to fix the issue. Please have your student's teacher reach out to the application's support team to investigate further! > Here are examples of common errors you might see for specific applications:
> Clicked on app, Clever asked for a username and password
> Did you know? Applications that show a Clever prompt to enter usernames and passwords require the Clever browser extension. Please see  this article for details. > If a Clever page asks your student to enter a username and password for an application, enter the correct login information for that application, and click 'Save Login'. Clever will save this information and automatically log your student in next time they click the icon from the Portal!

title: For Families: Troubleshooting - Apps
text:
> If your student clicks on an application and sees the page below, this means the login credentials they entered are incorrect. Please enter your student's correct username and password for the application, and then select  Update & Log in . > If you are still having trouble, ask your student's teacher to make sure you have the right username and password. They can contact Clever Support if further help is needed! >

> Problems within apps
> After your student is logged into an app successfully through Clever, any issues within the app would need to be addressed by the app provider. > Clever is not able to resolve issues within the various applications . One way to think of it is, Clever helps a student "get in the door" of an application but, once inside, we have little insight into any issues that come up. Some issues might include:  
> The app freezing Not being able to access grades or textbooks Your student runs out of time during a test The app suddenly logs your student out Missing lessons or assignments Accessing the microphone or camera
> I f your student is running into an issue within the application, please ask your student's teacher to contact the application's support team for help.

title: For Staff: Searching & favoriting apps
text:
> Note: Title For Staff: Searching & favoriting apps URL Name 360022982852 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2.  Favoriting resources 3. Searching for resources
> Overview
> This article provides an overview of how teachers and staff can easily locate applications and categorize their favorite apps in Clever!  
>   Locating and favoriting applications are features that are also available to your students !
> Favoriting applications
> Here's how to favorite an application:
>  
> Log into your Clever Portal from your district's Clever login page, or from  Clever.com . Locate your favorite app icon, and click the heart in the upper right-hand corner of the icon. This will add the app to the 'Favorites' section at the top of your Portal.  To remove an app from your ‘Favorites’, simply click the heart again in the top right corner!
> Please note: Favoriting resources is only reflected in individual portals. Resources that teachers favorite will not be favorited for their students.
>        
> Finding apps
> Users can search for district-wide applications or district-wide app links from their Clever Portals. Simply navigate to the search bar at the top of your Clever Portal to search for the app.
> Depending on the app, when the result is selected you will be either:
> Logged in to the app if it is a district-wide application Be redirected to the app login page to log in (if a non-integrated app)
> If you are unable to locate the app via the Clever search bar, this means it is either not a Clever-integrated app nor a district-wide linked app.

Clever Academy is our free online training and certification program for educators. District Administrators can access it through the district dashboard, and School Tech Leads and teachers can access it through their Clever Portal. Alternatively, users can go directly to Clever Academy: [https://clever.academy](https://clever.academy?user_type=district_admin)

By completing courses, you can learn how to get the most out of Clever for your district (in addition to certifications and badges)! After all, you're already the go-to person for all things edtech. We just make supporting educators a little easier. This content is designed to help you create a smooth, friendly experience with edtech for everyone in your district.

You can also access materials to lead trainings for your district, helping to spread the word about Clever’s useful features.  Feel free to share these with relevant team members so they too can live the Clever life!

- Clever's time-saving tools
- How we protect your district's data
- How your district’s users will interact with Clever

- Organizing your district's Clever Portal
- Adding applications and team members

Complete this course and you’ll earn a badge for Level 2: Clever Coach. This course is a prerequisite to Level 3 and beyond.

You’ll learn about:

- Working with Advanced District Admin tools
- Adding custom data

text:
> Important: Title For Clever Admins: Syncing custom (i.e. extension) fields to Clever URL Name 360024370912 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Uploading custom fields to Clever 3. Formatting your custom fields file(s) 4. Uploading custom fields via your district's SIS sync 5. Viewing and managing custom field data in Clever 6. Using custom fields in app sharing rules 7. Sharing custom fields with apps
>  
> IMPORTANT:  Please check with your application partners to see if they have the ability to sync custom data (extension) fields from Clever. Not all applications support extension fields. > Overview
> If your district would like to send data fields outside of the standard fields listed in our  Data Specifications ,  you can do so by uploading custom/extension fields either directly through your  Clever Dashboard , or through your district's existing sync. > District admins have the ability to add custom fields for the following data types:
> Schools Sections Students Teachers Staff
> Our system doesn't accept custom fields for enrollments or student contacts at this time. >  
> Uploading custom fields to Clever
> Custom fields can be uploaded through the Clever Dashboard > Data sources > Custom data page. Select Add custom data > Fields . A window will pop up allowing you to upload a CSV file for each data type that you would like to create custom fields for. When you upload custom extension data, it will take about 15 minutes for the new data to sync to Clever. The sync may also go on hold due to large changes in data. Click here to read more about holds and how to resolve them. > Please note: If your district already syncs the same custom field through your SIS sync or another custom data sync, those values will take precedence over this custom field upload.

title: For Clever Admins: Syncing custom (i.e. extension) fields to Clever
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Syncing custom (i.e. extension) fields to Clever
section: For Clever Admins: Syncing custom (i.e. extension) fields to Clever
text:
>       
>  
> Formatting your custom fields file(s)
> The CSV format is the same for students, teachers, schools, and sections: sis\_id, {custom fields}
> sis\_id, {custom fields}
> The CSV format for staff is:
> staff\_id, {custom fields}
> Custom fields columns must be prefixed with 'ext.'
> For example,  a custom field named 'nickname' should be labeled 'ext.nickname'. Please refer to the example below for students:
>              
> Extension headers may only contain one period. For example, a file with 'ext.favorite.food' will not process (ext.favorite\_food is valid). Extension headers may not contain spaces. > Please note: Extension field files that are uploaded directly to a district’s SFTP folder must be named with all lowercase letters (e.g., schools\_ext.csv, students\_ext.csv, etc.). >  
> Uploading custom fields via your district's SIS sync
>  
>   Extension fields cannot be added to the Infinite Campus API or OneRoster syncs. To add extension fields, please upload the extension field data directly in the Clever as Clever as outlined here or learn about using an SFTP folder here . >  
> SFTP and SIS-Managed Auto Syncs:
> There are a couple of options for uploading custom field data to Clever via SFTP/CSV files:
> Districts can add a custom/extension field column to one of the existing rostering files being synced to Clever ( schools.csv, teachers.csv, students.csv, sections.csv, enrollments.csv, and staff.csv ). The column name must begin with ' ext' . > For example: Fields such as 'Program Code' or 'Gifted Status' could be added to the students.csv with columns named 'ext.program\_code' or 'ext.gifted\_status' to your CSV files. Don't create an extension field with a space in the name. For example, a name like  ext.iep status can fail, so you'd want to use ext.iep\_status .

title: For Clever Admins: Syncing custom (i.e. extension) fields to Clever
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Syncing custom (i.e. extension) fields to Clever
section: For Clever Admins: Syncing custom (i.e. extension) fields to Clever
text:
> If your district only syncs data to Clever via SFTP, you can also upload custom fields via CSV files directly to your Clever SFTP folder by uploading to a subdirectory named /extensionfields. The files should be named:
> schools\_ext.csv sections\_ext.csv students\_ext.csv teachers\_ext.csv staff\_ext.csv
> All Syncs:
> All schools can upload custom fields via CSV files directly to your Clever SFTP folder by uploading to a subdirectory named /extensionfields. > If your primary sync type is not  SFTP sync type , please reach out to Clever support for assistance with gaining access to your own Clever SFTP Directory. > Once the /extensionfields subdirectory is created, you can upload the following files inside it:
> schools\_ext.csv sections\_ext.csv students\_ext.csv teachers\_ext.csv staff\_ext.csv
>  
>     For information about uploading data via SFTP, please visit: SFTP Syncs: Uploading data to Clever. >   
> For the following auto-syncs, custom fields can also be added and customized via your Clever Dashboard:
> Illuminate Auto Sync Aeries Auto Sync SchoolInsight Auto Sync iNow Auto Sync PowerSchool (legacy) PowerSchool Plugin Sync Infinite Campus Auto Sync
> For the following syncs, custom fields can also be added and customized by reaching out to Clever support:
> Blackbaud API sync Infinite Campus API sync Skyward Auto Sync   Skyward LMS API
>  
> Viewing and managing custom field data in Clever
> You can take a look at your most recently uploaded custom fields by navigating to your Clever Dashboard > Data sources > Custom data > Reports . Here, you can view details about the record type, the fields that were added, and the time of the last update. This page also includes an error report detailing any errors in the files. You can also download your district's current custom field files.

> You can view custom field data for each record type on the Profile Page for the school, student, teacher, staff, or section it is associated with, or by exporting all data for a record type from your Clever Dashboard > Data browser . > Using custom fields with app sharing rules
> You can use custom extension fields to create unique sharing rules for an easier, more seamless sharing process with your connected applications. Whether an application accepts extension fields or not, you can still use extension fields in sharing rules! You can use multiple extension fields in a single sharing rule to create more specificity, and extension fields can be used in any share by rule (share by student, share by teacher, share by section, and share by staff). >  
>  
> Sharing custom fields with apps
> Many applications allow or require custom field data. To share custom fields with apps, follow these directions:
> Navigate to the overview page for the app and click on the  Settings tab Under  Field Access , select Advanced Settings Select  Customize fields shared with {app}   and click  Customize fields On the  Edit Student Fields page, select  Next On the Edit Contact Fields page, select Next On the Edit District Admin Fields page, select  Next You are now on the Edit Extension Fields page. Any extension fields that you have uploaded to Clever will be found in the left column under Fields. Click on the fields you wish to share with the app to bring it to the right column under Share with {app}. Once you have selected the desired fields to share, select  Save. > For more information on editing field access for applications, please see this article .

title: Clever Badges: Chromebook login flow
text:
> Note: Title Clever Badges: Chromebook login flow URL Name 360024681032 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Badge login flow 3. Recommend login flow for logging in with Google
>  
>  For more information on how Clever works with Chromebooks, please see Single Sign-On (SSO): Chromebooks  or navigate to the  Badges into Chromebook Set up Guide in your district dashboard. > Overview
> Clever Badges can be generated for any students to utilize as an easy login method that requires no typing. This article demonstrates the different login flow options available to students who use a Clever Badge to log into their Chromebook. > Badge login flow
> Please note: The login flow for users is dependent upon the Chrome OS. The login flow for most users (Chrome OS 99 and above) is outlined below. Since the login flow for third-party IdPs is managed by Google, it is not possible for Clever to alter the login flow or revert to the previous behavior of Chrome OS 98 and lower. Occasionally Google will incorporate popup windows that can not be avoided and disrupt the login flow, requiring the users to click through to close the popup. >  
> Students who are using Badges will go through the following login flow:  
> 1. Upon device power on, users will be directly taken to the Clever Badge login screen. >  
> 2. The Clever Badge login screen will appear. If prompted, grant access to the device camera and scan your Clever Badge. > If the Clever Badge is valid, a green checkmark will appear and the Clever Portal will launch on the student's Chromebook. If a red "x" appears, please follow these directions  to void and generate a new Clever Badge. > Recommended login flow for logging in with Google 
>  
> Please note: The button to log in with Google cannot be removed. > Though the primary login method for Chromebooks may be Clever Badges, users can still log in using their Google email and password.

Users should experience the following login flow when they want to log in with their Google credentials:  1. Chrome OS 98 and below: Select Sign in with a different account
>   Chrome OS 99 and above: In the bottom right, select Enter Google Account info
>  
> 2. Enter your Google email and password. Click  Next. The user is now logged in to the device.

title: For Clever Admins: iOS devices & the Clever app
heading_path: For Clever Admins: iOS devices & the Clever app
section: For Clever Admins: iOS devices & the Clever app
text:
> Tip: Title For Clever Admins: iOS devices & the Clever app URL Name 360024746971 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. How do I add the Clever iOS app? 3. How do I update to the new Clever iOS app in January 2026? 4. Expected Login Behavior 5. What happens when a user selects a learning application? 6. Best practices for using multiple apps in one session 7. Best practices for logging out of Clever 8. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
> Overview
> Students can log in to Clever on iPads using the Clever single sign-on (SSO) application. In January 2026, Clever released its new iOS application. This application differs from the existing iOS app in that it allows students to access the Clever Portal and their Teacher Pages directly in the application, rather than launching Clever in a web browser. This article outlines the process of adding the app or updating from the previous version, as well as its functionality for students. >

section: Adding offices or departments to Clever
text:
If you are syncing via the SFTP method, you can edit the schools.csv file to include district offices or departments that will appear as a "school" in Clever.

Clever Admins syncing staff members to Clever must associate the staff with a particular school or schools. Most staff (i.e., Principals, APs, Dean of Students, etc.) are admins related to specific schools.

However, some staff members don't serve specific schools. In this case, we’ll want to create "schools" in Clever that are actually district-level departments or offices. For example, a school could be named **Office of the Superintendent,** **Department of Secondary English Language Arts**, or **Division of Instructional Technology.** As long as the School\_ids are unique and consistent across syncs, they don't have to be real.
