title: For Teachers: Troubleshooting - Data (e.g. rosters, classes, and school association)
heading_path: For Teachers: Troubleshooting - Data (e.g. rosters, classes, and school association)
text:
Your district's data is synced to Clever from your school's Student Information System (SIS). If you are noticing incorrect information in Clever, **please contact your school's tech support contact.**

Here are examples of incorrect data you might see in Clever that your District Administrator can help with:

- Missing / incorrect students on your roster
- Incorrect, duplicate, or missing classes in Clever
- Wrong school association
- Adding a co-teacher to your class
- Incorrect information for yourself or a student (a misspelled name, email, grade level, etc.)
- Updating a Clever username for yourself or a student
- Duplicate accounts

![Screenshot of login screen showing where to get help logging into Clever](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000FiyP&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl000002xxyz)

Records cannot be edited or manually created in Clever by teachers. We cannot assist with updating rosters, editing names, or adding classes. Please contact your district's tech support contact for assistance with these requests.

---

Application partners manage syncing data from Clever and implementing it in their system. If you notice that information is incorrect in an application but is correct in Clever. **Please contact the application's support team directly.**

We recommend providing the following information:

- District name + state
- School name
- Teacher email address
- Description of problem

*Example:*

- *Clark County School District, NV*
- *Boulder City High School*
- *[sample@nv.ccsd.net](mailto:sample@nv.ccsd.net)*
- *Missing class roster - Algebra I, 6th period*

Please note, most applications sync data from Clever on a daily basis. If the missing or incorrect data was recently changed in your SIS, please allow at least 48 hrs for the data to be updated in applications.

3. [I already have a teacher account in Clever. How can I have admin privileges?](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360025400151?language=en_US#header3)

We're excited to hear that you're interested in using Clever! Student, teacher, and staff accounts are created when your district syncs information into Clever from your Student Information System (SIS). Your district administrator manages this process. Clever Support is not authorized to create accounts for users in your district manually.

---

If you are a teacher and want access to your district's Clever account, **you will need to contact your District Administrator**. They can ensure that your teacher account is created through the sync from the SIS or manually within Clever.

If you'd like your students to have access to Clever accounts, you should also contact your District Administrator.

If your district doesn't have a Clever account, your District Administrator or technology staff can [sign up for one](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202083506) at no cost.

---

If you already have a teacher account in Clever, but you'd like to have admin privileges, **please contact your District Administrator.** Clever Support cannot change these permissions for your account.

---

For more information on user roles, click here . > Announcement preview
> When a selected user logs in to Clever, they will see a bell icon in the top-right corner with the number of unread notifications. They can click on the bell icon to open the announcement. > Setting a priority notification

text:
> Note: Title Sharing Permission: View sharing permission history URL Name 360025766151 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Where can I see past sharing permissions? 3. How do I revert sharing to a previous configuration?
>  
> Overview
> Clever Admins are now able to view historical changes made to an application’s data sharing permissions. This is available for every application a district is connected to on Clever.  
> Where can I see past sharing permissions?
> Historical sharing configurations can be seen in the Past Rules tab when viewing an application’s profile page in the dashboard:  
> The sharing history is broken up by date and exact timestamp, and the page is limited to showing the 20 most recent historical rules.  
> How do I revert my present data sharing permissions to a previous configuration?
> Navigate to the specific application’s profile page Click on the  Past Rules  tab at the top Identify the exact date and timestamp of the previous sharing configuration you’d like to bring back for the application Click the blue  Revert to these rules  button to replace the current sharing configuration with this previous one For final confirmation, hit the  Revert sharing  button to push this change into production
>  
> As with normal sharing changes, this reversion should go into effect instantly and thereafter alter what data an app can sync for your district.  It typically takes up to 24 hours for data changes to be reflected in an application once sharing permissions are altered.   
> Please note: For more information on setting sharing permissions, please see: How do I set my sharing permissions for applications?

If your school district has enabled  Active Directory (AD), Entra ID, Google, or Clever passwords as a login method for Clever, you may be able to reset your passwords from Clever. Please note that this setup will only be available to you if your district-level admin has enabled this.

In your Clever Portal, if you click on your name and do not see the **Account recovery** or **Set new password** in your Clever Portal, you must contact your district to reset your Google, Active Directory, Entra ID (i.e., third-party), or Clever password.

If you do see the option for password reset, you can reset your Google, Active Directory, Entra ID, and Clever passwords from within the Clever Portal. To ensure you can reset your password outside of the Clever Portal, you will need to set up an account recovery method.

heading_path: For School Tech Leads: Account recovery and password reset for Google, Active Directory, Entra ID, and Clever passwords

![Account recovery Portal screenshot](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000QNll&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000ElJIT)

Once clicked, a modal will pop up where you can select your preferred account recovery method. Depending on what your school district has enabled, you may have the option to enter an email address, a phone number, or answer security questions when you need to reset your password.

![Clever___Portal.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000QNll&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl000002Lig2)

It’s also possible that your school organization may have provided a recovery method for you using information in their records. For example, if your schools collect personal email addresses, they may set up your account recovery email as your personal email address. If you’d like to update the information your school organization provides, you can do so using the recovery method setup described above.

![Account recovery page](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000QNll&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl000008rDCD)
4. You’ll be prompted to confirm your identity using a method you set up in your Portal settings. Select how you’ll confirm your identity. 
 ![Confirm identity screenshot](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000QNll&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000ElQev)
5. You can now set up your new password for both your Clever and third-party accounts by inputting a new password. Your school may have password requirements, which can be viewed by clicking on **See requirements**. Once completed, you can use your new password for your third-party account(s).

title: For School Tech Leads: Account recovery and password reset for Google, Active Directory, Entra ID, and Clever passwords
heading_path: For School Tech Leads: Account recovery and password reset for Google, Active Directory, Entra ID, and Clever passwords
Recovering your account and resetting your password on the Clever login page
text:
1. Navigate to your district's login page and select **Get help logging in. 
 ![Get help logging in](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000QNll&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl000008rD2X)**
2. Click **Reset only your Clever password.

![Screenshot of resetting only a Clever password](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000QNll&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000Elwms)**
3. Please enter your school email address. If you are unsure of the email address to utilize, please contact your district support contact. Clever Support cannot provide this information to you.\
4. After you enter your email, Clever will send you a verification code through the method selected when setting up account recovery. Once you enter the verification code, you can set a new password:

![Set a new password screen](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000QNll&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000EmE8g)

The password must match the requirements set by your district and Clever. Here are some of the requirements from Clever:

- Passwords cannot start/end with a space
- Characters cannot repeat more than 3 times
- Passwords cannot contain any part of the user’s name

Once you've reset your password, you will be prompted to log in to the Clever Portal using your new password.

---

To reset your password while in the Clever Portal:

1. Click on your name then **Set new password**. 
 ![Set new password drop down](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000QNll&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000ElIuH)
2. Input your new password, confirm the new password, and click **Set new password** to save.

![Set new password screen](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000QNll&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000EmGws)

The password must match the requirements set by your district (example: minimum of 10 characters, including 1 number).

---

If you're a Clever School Tech Lead trying to reset a student or teacher's password, please [check out this article](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360044867112)!

---

> Note: Title Single sign-on (SSO): "Log in with NCEdCloud" URL Name 360026143131 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Configuring NCEdCloud IAM 3. Customizing your Clever login option 4. Clever Portal URL
> Overview
> Clever single sign-on (SSO) allows North Carolina students and teachers to log in using their NCEdCloud IAM credentials. This article details the configuration process for setting up Clever single sign-on (SSO) with NCEdCloud IAM. >   North Carolina Districts that are not currently on Clever should sign up for Clever here! > Configuring NCEdCloud IAM
>  
> Navigate to your Clever Dashboard > Authentication > SSO settings page. Select Add Login Method to the right-hand side. Select Active Directory Authentication as your Identity Provider (IdP). >  
> Please note: This option establishes a SAML connection with NCEdCloud IAM. This will not establish Active Directory as your Clever SSO login method. > Enter the NCEdCloud IAM Metadata.xml file URL:
> https://s3.amazonaws.com/assets.clever.com/SAML/NCEdTest.xml
>        
>   
>  
> Select Save . > Customizing your Clever login option
> To customize the login option from your district's Clever login page :
> Navigate to your Clever Dashboard > Authentication > SSO settings page. Select the Customize tab. Click on the pencil icon to change the Login with Active Directory label to Login with NCEd Cloud . >          
> Select Save . > Clever Portal URL
> Every Clever district has the ability to customize a unique Clever login URL   to share with district users in order to simplify the Clever login process. This URL is a direct way for users to log in to your district's Clever Portal rather than navigating to  Clever.com  and selecting their school from a drop-down menu. To do this:  
> Navigate to your Clever Dashboard > Portal > Portal settings page. Click on the URL shortname in the Clever Portal URL box to edit it. The shortname is the part after   https://clever.com/in/ .

Update the editable text to the new shortname you'd like to use. > For example : Updating the shortname to NorthernSchoolDistrict would change your Portal URL to:   https://clever.com/in/northernschooldistrict
> Select Update to save your changes. Share the updated Portal URL with your district users so they can navigate directly to your district's Clever login page! > If you have any questions, please reach out to  Clever Support ! We are happy to help!

text:
> Note: Título For Students: What is Clever and how to use it Nombre de URL 360026162691 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. What is Clever? 3. What is single sign-on (SSO)? 4. What is the Clever Portal? 5. Favoriting resources 6. Searching for resources
> Overview
> In this article, you can learn more about what Clever is and how to use it in your class. If you are struggling to log into Clever, try reviewing this article . If you are experiencing any other type of issue, please reach out to your teacher. > What is Clever? > Clever is an easy way for you to access all your learning applications. With Clever, you only have to remember one username and password, or use a Clever Badge , to log into all your applications. > What is single sign-on (SSO)? > Single sign-on (SSO) is what Clever uses to log you into all your learning applications. You only have to sign in once (a single sign-on) to the Clever Portal, then you can click on your learning applications without signing in again! > What is the Clever Portal? > The Clever Portal is where you can access all your learning applications. Here is an example of a student's Clever Portal:
> Your Clever Portal might look different, depending on the applications your school has added to Clever. If you are missing an application you need in your Clever Portal, contact your teacher! > If your Portal has a lot of icons and resources, consider “favoriting” and searching for the icons and applications you use the most! > Favoriting applications
> Here's how to favorite an application:
> Log into your Portal at your district specific URL (ask your teacher if you need help with this step!)  Scroll to the appropriate application icon and click the heart in the upper right-hand corner of the icon This will add the application to the 'Favorites' category at the top of your Portal
> To remove an application from your ‘Favorites’, simply click the heart again in the top right corner!

> Please note: Favoriting resources is only reflected in individual portals. Resources that teachers favorite will not be favorited for their students. >  
> Searching for resources
> You can also search for district added resources and links and your teachers' pages. Simply navigate to the search bar at the top of your Clever Portal. When a result is clicked, you will be able to immediately be logged into the resource or redirected to the link or teacher page.

title: Para los estudiantes: ¿cómo encuentro mis recursos en el portal?

text:
**Aquí le mostramos cómo marcar una aplicación como favorita:**

1. Inicie sesión en su Portal en la URL específica de su distrito (¡consulte con su maestro si necesita ayuda con este paso!).
2. Desplácese hasta el ícono de la aplicación correspondiente y haga clic en el corazón en la esquina superior derecha del ícono .

Para eliminar una aplicación de sus 'Favoritos', simplemente haga clic de nuevo en el corazón en la esquina superior derecha.

*![](https://support.clever.com/hc/article_attachments/115018340306/mceclip0.png)***Tenga en cuenta que:** los recursos marcados como favoritos solo se reflejan en portales individuales. Los recursos que los profesores marquen como favoritos no se marcarán como favoritos para sus estudiantes

![student_favorite_high_def_.gif](https://support.clever.com/hc/article_attachments/360034599011/student_favorite_high_def_.gif)

También puede buscar recursos y enlaces agregados por distrito y las páginas de sus maestros. Simplemente navegue a la barra de búsqueda en la parte superior de su Portal de Clever. Cuando se hace clic en un resultado, podrá iniciar sesión en el recurso o redirigirse al enlace o a la página de maestro inmediatamente.

title: For Teachers: SSO (Saved Passwords) applications
text:
> Tip: Title For Teachers: SSO (Saved Passwords) applications URL Name 360026789592 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. How does my district provide user credentials for SSO (Saved Passwords) applications? 3. How do I reset my student's SSO (Saved Passwords) credentials? 4. How do I reset my SSO (Saved Passwords) credentials? > Overview
> Single Sign-on SSO (Saved Passwords) applications are icons in the Clever Portal that automatically log students and teachers into websites that do not currently have a formal integration with Clever. From a user's experience, these icons appear to be the same as other resources in the Portal. In order for an SSO (Saved Passwords) application to automatically log users into a website, you and your students' must already have existing accounts with the website . Your district will provide Clever with credentials for these accounts, then Clever's system securely saves this login information to help users automatically sign into the website from the Portal! > Clever Tip: Make sure the Clever browser extension is downloaded on your school's devices to ensure users are able to log into these Saved Passwords applications! >  
> How does my district provide user credentials for SSO (Saved Passwords) applications? > Your district administrator manages the process of adding SSO (Saved Passwords) applications to your Clever account. They also configure settings that determine how user credentials for the website are provided to Clever. > If they have chosen to have users manually provide their credentials, you will see a prompt to enter login information the first time you click on the SSO (Saved Passwords) application in the Clever Portal. > Once you enter the correct login information for your account with this application, click 'Save Login' . Clever will save this information and automatically log you into the application next time you click the icon from the Portal!

title: For Teachers: SSO (Saved Passwords) applications
text:

Please enter your updated username and password for the application, and click ' Update & Log in '. > If you'd like to learn about how Clever securely stores user credentials for Saved Passwords applications, feel free to read our blog post here ! >  
> How do I reset my student's SSO (Saved Passwords) credentials? > If your student has trouble with an SSO (Saved Passwords) application, you can help them troubleshoot! Log into your Clever account, then follow these steps:
> Go to Clever Portal > My Students > Student Roster > Select the class of the student having trouble. Click Troubleshoot app login . > Search for the app that requires new student credentials. > Determine if the student can see the application from their Clever Portal. If they can't, you'll need to contact an Admin for help. > Click Update credentials . > Enter the correct username and password. Click Set credentials . > If you still need help, you can contact our Support Team by clicking the chat icon in the bottom right corner of  Support.Clever.com . > How do I reset my SSO (Saved Passwords) credentials? > If incorrect credentials are inputted for one of your SSO (Saved Passwords) applications, you are able to update them by:
> Log in to your Clever Portal Select the application that has incorrect credentials Enter your updated username and password for the application, and click  Update & Log in . > If for some reason the above steps do not work for you, please follow these steps to update your credentials in an incognito window:
> On your computer, open   Google Chrome . At the top right, click More      New Incognito Window . A new window appears. In the top corner, check for the Incognito icon   . Log in to Clever:   clever.com/login Click on the <<App Name>> ap p. You should be prompted to update your username and password. Click Save .

>  
> Clever Tip: If you're still having trouble, please confirm that the username and password you've entered work to log into your account directly on the application's page (i.e. at schoology.com ). If you can successfully access the app directly through their website, but not through Clever, please reach out to Clever Support for help!

title: Custom Data: Non-teaching staff
text:
> Important: Title Custom Data: Non-teaching staff URL Name 360026950471 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Creating custom staff in Clever      a. Adding custom staff individually via Clever      b. Bulk uploading custom staff to Clever 3. Staff permissions in Clever 4. Updating staff roles 5. Removing staff 6. Connecting staff to sections
> Overview
> A district's non-teaching staff (e.g., principals, counselors, front desk, etc.), including any employees who do not have a designated roster in a district's student information system (SIS), are referred to as staff in Clever. > Individual staff users can be added directly to Clever, bypassing a district's SIS sync. Once added to Clever, they can log in using the district's existing login methods and leverage Clever single sign-on (SSO). > Please note: Only  Clever Admins  have permissions to create custom staff in Clever. For details, please visit:  Clever Roles: Overview of Roles & Permissions. >  
> IMPORTANT  Custom staff  cannot  be assigned to sections. However, if a staff member needs co-teacher access to sections from a teacher's perspective, Clever Admins can create a custom teacher  record for them to associate them with sections. Please visit this article for more:  For Clever Admins: Co-teachers. >  
> Creating custom staff in Clever
> Custom staff can be created individually directly within Clever, or uploaded as a csv in bulk. Custom staff accounts are independent of a district's student information system (SIS) sync. So, for example, if a district's SIS is syncing staff to Clever, or they're being uploaded manually per  this article , this staff data will not overwrite custom staff added directly via the Clever Dashboard > Data sources > Custom data page. > Adding custom staff individually via Clever
> To add a custom staff member individually in Clever, please:
> Navigate to the  Clever Dashboard . Select Clever Dashboard > Data sources > Custom data.

title: Custom Data: Non-teaching staff
text:
Select  Add custom data. Select  Staff. >             
> Please fill out the form, which begins by associating the staff member with their   school(s). > For all schools, click the switch icon under the Schools section. For one school, begin typing the name in the search box to select it. For multiple schools, type and select each school from the search bar. >  
> Clever Role
> For an overview of the  Portal Access Only  vs. School Tech Lead  roles,  please see our Clever article visit:  For Staff: School Tech Lead vs. Portal Only Permission. > Username & Password
> These fields are only required if:
> Your district uses Clever Passwords , and the district username or password is needed for users to log in to Clever. An application partner requires a username or password to be populated within their integrated application(s). > Expiration Date   ​​​​​​
> Enter an optional Expiration date  if you want the record to be automatically deleted on the selected date. > Notifying custom staff of their new account via email 
> If you would like the user to be notified via email that their account has been created, check the optional   Also notify custom staff of their new account via email  box. The notification email can also be sent after their custom staff record has been saved using the envelope icon under Actions . >                   
>  
> Bulk uploading custom staff to Clever
> To bulk add multiple custom staff, please:
> Prepare your Staff.csv file. You can download a staff.csv template here . Navigate to the  Clever Dashboard . Select  Clever Dashboard > Data sources > Custom data. Select  Upload records. Upload your Staff.csv file. > Associating staff to multiple locations via bulk upload
> To associate a staff member with multiple school sync one row to provision the account and then assign additional schools directly from the Clever Dashboard by following these steps. > Navigate to  Data sources > Custom data > Staff tab then click the pencil icon under Actions .

title: Custom Data: Non-teaching staff
text:
Select additional schools that should be associated with custom staff >  Save Changes. > Please note:  Uploading a custom staff.csv file will not override/delete any staff members you've added manually via the steps in the previous section! >  
> Next steps after creating staff
> It will take between 10-15 minutes for the new record(s) to be created in Clever. This process is complete when:
> The user's name is hyperlinked in blue on the  Custom data  page . Or, they can be located by using the Clever search bar at the top of the  Clever Dashboard . > Please note: Please allow 10-15 minutes for custom data to process. Though Clever will not send an email notification that the data has been processed, the results will be viewable on the Sync page in the Clever Dashboard. >  
> Finally, please be sure to share any needed applications with them! For instructions, visit:  Sharing Permissions: Sharing staff with applications. > Staff permissions in Clever
> By default, custom staff are assigned a Portal Access Only  role in Clever which means they will only have access to the applications that have been shared with them on a district level. > The alternative Clever staff role that provides greater permissions within Clever is the School Tech Lead  role. >  
> Updating staff roles
> Most staff updates happen by uploading an updated  staff.csv to Clever (see this article  for details). This includes changes to name, email address, title, and so on. However, if you wish to update the role of a staff user from Portal Access to   School Tech Lead :
> Use the Clever search bar at the top of your  Clever Dashboard to locate the user and open their profile page. Click the drop-down arrow to the right and select  Update Clever Role. A pop-up will appear, allowing you to select the role of School Tech Lead. Select Save.

title: Custom Data: Non-teaching staff
text:
>  Once staff have been added to Clever, visit this article to see how to share applications with them:  Sharing Permissions: Sharing staff with applications
>  
> Removing staff
> To remove individual custom staff from Clever:
> Navigate to your Clever Dashboard > Data sources > Custom data page. Select the Staff  tab at the bottom of the screen. Locate the user, and under  Actions , click  to delete. > To remove all custom staff from Clever: 
> Navigate to your Clever Dashboard > Data sources > Custom data page. In the top-right corner, click Delete all staff. On the next screen, click Confirm. >  
> Connecting staff to sections
> Staff cannot be connected to sections in Clever. To associate a user with an existing section:
> Add the user as a custom teacher. Connect the custom teacher to a section using the Add co-teacher feature . >  
> Related articles:
> For Staff: School Tech Lead vs. Portal Only Permissions Sharing Permissions: Sharing staff with applications Custom Data: Overview (i.e., sections, students, contacts, teachers, staff & fields) Clever Roles: Staff - How to add to Clever

>  
> Overview
> Occasionally, you or your students will have issues with your applications (i.e. apps) in Clever. Here are some steps you can take if you or your students are having trouble logging in to applications from the Clever Portal. > ​​
>  
> Troubleshoot app login tool
> The Troubleshoot App Login tool helps you quickly solve student app issues. Use it to:
> Find out why a student can’t see or log into an app
> Report a login issue to your Clever Admin
> Set student credentials for SSO Saved Passwords apps
> Connect with Clever Support if the issue needs more investigation
>  
>  
> App is missing
> If you or your student is missing a district-provided application,  please reach out to your district's admin support using the Troubleshoot app login tool. Your district's Clever Admin manages which applications teachers and students have access to in the Clever Portal. > To reach out to your administrator: 
> Navigate to My Students > Student Roster > select the student who is missing an app. > Click Troubleshoot app login
> Click the dropdown to select the app that is missing. > Provide additional details for your admin. > Click  Send email to district admin . >   ​​
>  
> Clicked on app, received an error
> If you or your students click on an application in the Clever Portal and receive an error, please reach out to the application's support team for help . > Clever Tip:  If you are seeing an error at a web URL that is  not a Clever address, it's likely that the application's team is best equipped to help fix the issue. Please reach out to the application's support team to investigate further!

title: Summer School: Sync settings
text:
> Important: Title Summer School: Sync settings URL Name 360027745731 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. If you choose to pause your SIS data sync (Recommended) 3. If you choose not to pause your SIS data sync 4. Rollover Date 5. Frequently Asked Questions
> Overview
> Clever can support multiple sync configurations for summer school, each with its own benefits and possible limitations. We recommend thinking through the following points to help you make informed decisions about the best summer school options for your district:
> Who will specifically need access to Clever and connected learning applications over the summer? (e.g. all students, teachers, and staff, or only a subset of users, etc.)? Which Clever resources do district users need to access or utilize over the summer? Will your district need to add new users over the summer or before the start of the new school year? Will data need to be dynamically updated in Clever via your student information system (SIS) sync, or will a Clever admin be managing the manual summer school updates in Clever? If you're using Clever IDM, please also review Clever IDM: Summer rollover . > Please review the rest of this article to learn of the options available to you based on your district's needs during the summer months! For specific details about school year rollover, please visit  this article . > IMPORTANT  For 2025, Clever automatically pauses syncs on May 30 and removes pauses between July 28 and August 1 for schools in the USA. In Canada, we automatically pause syncs on June 27 and remove pauses on August 15. For all other countries, we don't set default pause dates. You can modify these dates (or remove them altogether) under your Data sources > SIS sync > Settings page. >  
> If you choose to pause your SIS data sync (Recommended)
> For 2025, Clever automatically pauses syncs on May 30 and removes pauses between July 28 and August 1 unless you specify otherwise.

title: Summer School: Sync settings
text:
You can modify these dates (or remove them altogether) under your Sync > Sync Settings page. During the pause, Clever will stop processing data updates. This allows districts to make changes to their student information system (SIS) data or CSV data files without allowing those changes to flow into Clever and interrupt student, teacher, or staff access to Clever or their connected applications over the summer. Current school year data will be "frozen" in Clever for the duration of the district's sync pause. > We recommend using this option if:
> Your district won't need to update summer rosters often and/or there are minimal changes that need to be made in Clever over the summer. District users need to access their connected applications and associated data from the previous school year during the summer (e.g. students who need to complete summer homework in apps). > This option allows:
> Clever admins to supplement existing roster data during the pause via Clever's custom data feature . Custom data can be used for creating summer school sections, intervention groups, after-school programs, adding out-of-district students, and more! Custom data does not overwrite data synced from the SIS, nor can data from the SIS overwrite custom data. This is a perfect option for summer school! Visit this article for details. Clever admins to make updates for the upcoming school year in the SIS without the updates affecting Clever or applications during the sync pause. Clever admins to continue adjusting application sharing permissions  for district-wide apps to meet application vendor needs. District users to continue logging in to Clever, and connected applications, to access their data from the previous school year. >  
> If your district is moving forward with initiating a sync pause, please see  this article  for instructions.

title: Summer School: Sync settings
text:
The next step of the process is Stage 3: Uploading custom data
>  
> Please note:  If you'd like to pause syncing your data to a particular application, please see this article: For Clever Admins: Pausing your sync for a specific app . This is a perfect tool for semester rollover and summer school, but shouldn't be confused with an SIS sync pause. >  
>  
> If you choose not to pause your SIS data sync
> If your district prefers to continue syncing SIS data to Clever over the summer, the first step is to Clear the sync Pause Start and End Dates on the Sync > Settings page. Once removed, data will continue to sync automatically for Clever-managed auto syncs or whenever your district uploads CSV data files to your SFTP directory for SFTP syncs. > Clever admins will still be able to utilize the custom data feature in Clever to add any supplemental rostering data that is not available in the SIS. > We recommend using this option if:
> Your users need access to their resources and learning applications over the summer, but not historical data from the previous year or semester. You anticipate a large number of students entering your district over the summer will need access to Clever before the new school year. You would prefer their accounts to be created directly from your SIS sync instead of manually uploading the students using custom data . Your summer school data changes often in your SIS, and you would like a more automated process for updating Clever. > This option allows:
> Clever admins to create and manage custom rostering data  in Clever. Clever admins to continue adjusting  application sharing permissions  for district-wide apps. Your district's SIS to continue dynamically updating Clever with ongoing rostering updates daily. New students, teachers, sections, and staff to be added to Clever via the SIS sync. This data will continue to be synced to connected applications. > Please note:  Some application(s) stop syncing to Clever over the summer.

title: Summer School: Sync settings
text:
Please reach out to the app partner(s) directly to understand their summer rollover process. >  
> Important things to consider:
> Access for students and teachers between school years may be impacted as the data in Clever is updated over the summer via the SIS sync. Therefore, the content that is available to them in their applications, or their ability to access applications, might change. > For example:
> If a student's grade is updated from 4 to 5, depending on the application, they may no longer have access to their 4th-grade data. A teacher may not be able to access their rosters from the previous school year. > For more detailed information about how this might affect your connected applications, please reach out to the app support teams directly. >  
> The next step of the process is Stage 3: Uploading custom data  
> IMPORTANT  If you do not pause your SIS data sync over the summer, any new rostering data in your SIS will replace the previous school year's data in Clever. This means that students and teachers who are not attending summer school may lose access to Clever and their connected applications over the summer! >  
>  
> Rollover Date
> In Clever, the rollover date marks the transition of district data from the previous school year to the upcoming one. This usually occurs during the summer when the data for the upcoming school year is live but before the first day of school. District admins will be prompted to choose the rollover date upon adjusting their sync pause dates in the Data sources > SIS sync > Settings. The default date for 2025 is July 28 for districts that don't modify the default sync pause dates. >  
>  You can also modify it by clicking  Edit rollover selection . >  
> Even if you don't plan to pause your sync, it's important to mark the new school year rollover date in Clever as it enables us to guarantee the seamless functioning of your applications.

title: Summer School: Sync settings
text:
> If you do not set a rollover date, you risk applications showing sections and assignments listed under the previous academic year. > This proactive approach ensures that your Clever account is fully primed and operational for the upcoming school year! > Some districts (such as those that operate on a year-round schedule) may choose not to set a rollover date, but you should check with Clever Support if you're considering opting out of a rollover date. >  
> Frequently Asked Questions
> When can I enter new school year dates for the upcoming school year? > The school year dates will be updated to the following school year in mid-summer. The start and end dates need to be entered by a Clever admin in the School Year Dates section on the Sync page under the settings tab . > However, there's no need for schools to worry about setting these dates until closer to the start of the next school year. >  
> Can we pause data syncs to specific applications? > You can pause syncing data to any app using App Sync Pause . The SIS sync pause in Clever freezes all data in Clever. This ensures that data synced to all connected applications will remain the same over the summer if your SIS sync is paused. >  
> How does Clever determine the primary location for a user? > By default, Clever assigns users' primary schools where the majority of their sections are located. For more details on this logic, please see this article . >  
> What if we are switching our district's SIS, sync type, or SIS IDs over the summer? > Please contact  Clever support if you are planning on changing any of this information! We highly encourage districts  not to change SIS IDs for data types (excluding sections) because historical data is tied with SIS IDs which will impact all connected district applications. For details on changing your SIS, sync type, or SIS IDs, please see this article . > The next step of the process is Stage 3: Creating data

title: For Clever Admins: Staff Setup - Syncing staff from Active Directory (AD)
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Staff Setup - Syncing staff from Active Directory (AD)
section: For Clever Admins: Staff Setup - Syncing staff from Active Directory (AD)
text:
> Tip: Title For Clever Admins: Staff Setup - Syncing staff from Active Directory (AD) URL Name 360028781552 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Requirements 3. Active Directory staff sync preparations 4. Setting up the sync to Clever 5. FAQs
> Overview
> This article is an overview of how Clever admins can set up an automated sync with the district’s Active Directory server to sync non-instructional staff and school admins to Clever as  staff users. > This sync between Active Directory and Clever will supplement any existing syncs between the district’s SIS and Clever and will  only be used to sync non-instructional staff users (i.e. non-teaching staff). > Requirements
> Your district utilizes an Active Directory server to manage non-instructional staff and school admins. The Active Directory Sync toggle has been enabled from your Data sources > SIS sync > Staff  tab. >   Once the Active Directory Sync toggle is enabled, non-instructional staff and school admins cannot be created through a manual CSV upload. Clever will thereafter ignore any staff.csv or admins.csv files that may continue to be uploaded by the district. However, the custom staff feature will continue to work for individual account creation. Staff already uploaded to Clever via CSV will be preserved, and migrated to custom staff. >  
> Active Directory staff sync preparations
> Staff sharing rules in Clever
> If you already have non-instructional staff in Clever, make sure your staff and school admin sharing permissions are in a good place for all of your district’s connected applications, so we’re not unintentionally sharing new users en masse. > For additional information, please visit:   Staff Setup: Sharing staff with applications
> Existing staff in Clever
> If your district has already synced staff to Clever via a staff.csv or admins.csv file, please make sure their 'Staff\_id' stays the same if you'd like to preserve their historical data in Clever.

title: For Clever Admins: Staff Setup - Syncing staff from Active Directory (AD)
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Staff Setup - Syncing staff from Active Directory (AD)
section: For Clever Admins: Staff Setup - Syncing staff from Active Directory (AD)
text:
This field is the key identifier for staff members in Clever so, if an existing user is synced from Active Directory with a different 'Staff\_id', a new account will be created for them in Clever. > Create a new bind account
> Create a new bind account with read-only permissions that Clever can use to query your LDAP server. Once created, take note of the account's userDN (i.e. users distinguishedName) and password found in the Attribute Editor - you’ll need that for setup! > Review your OU structure in Active Directory
> Identify whether classroom teachers are grouped in Organizational Units (OUs) together with non-instructional staff members. > If not, that’s great! Take note of the OU names that include only non-instructional staff. If so, there’s a risk of creating additional user accounts in Clever for those who are already in Clever as teachers! This means that users would have both a teacher and a staff account in Clever. To counter this:
> We suggest bulk-adding an extension attribute to staff member’s profiles that would distinguish these two staff types from one another in your server (e.g. extensionAttribute =  staff if non-instructional and teacher  if instructional). Once the extension attribute is added, the attribute can be used in an LDAP filter during step 2 of the setup below - The staff query. > Create a one-time school mapping CSV file
> We need a one-time upload to map existing schools in Clever to school names in Active Directory.

title: For Clever Admins: Staff Setup - Syncing staff from Active Directory (AD)
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Staff Setup - Syncing staff from Active Directory (AD)
section: For Clever Admins: Staff Setup - Syncing staff from Active Directory (AD)
text:
The file should have two columns:
> School\_sis\_id  (as it appears in Clever) Active\_directory\_name ( should correspond to the field your query will be pulling for  school)
> You can locate the school\_sis\_id or school\_id in Clever on the school's profile page:
> Setting up the sync to Clever
> Navigate to your Data sources > SIS sync > Staff Data tab Toggle on Active Directory Sync   to reveal a new setup tab  Select set up active directory sync to configure the Active Directory sync in 4 steps
>          
> Step 1: Configure the connection between Clever and your district’s Active Directory server by entering your district’s LDAP URL and port, certificate fingerprints, and the users DN and password for the read-only bind account set up in preparation. All of these steps are required to establish the connection. Step 2: Add staff queries to designate the OUs from which Clever should sync staff user accounts. Districts can set up multiple queries if needed, as well as set up filters to scope down the information pulled. For help writing your LDAP filter, see this article . An example is shown below: During this step, you’ll also indicate which Active Directory user attributes should map to the available Clever staff fields. Step 3: Optionally configure a sync for staff extension/custom fields such as security group, building code, etc. The Clever extension field will always begin with ‘ext.’ Step 4: Upload your prepared school mapping CSV so we will be able to link the existing school sis\_ids in your district’s Clever account with the appropriate school names in Active Directory. > Please note:   If you'd like to add staff with multiple school associations in Clever, you can select a field in Active Directory that contains multiple values separated by commas. As long as these values are contained in the school mapping CSV from step 4, our system will parse these out and assign the staff user accordingly to the multiple schools within Clever.

title: For Clever Admins: Staff Setup - Syncing staff from Active Directory (AD)
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Staff Setup - Syncing staff from Active Directory (AD)
section: For Clever Admins: Staff Setup - Syncing staff from Active Directory (AD)
text:
> After the sync is configured and a first sync runs, you can view the results on the Data sources > SIS sync > Staff Data > Active Directory sync page . Syncs will run automatically every 24 hours but can be triggered from the Active Directory tab as needed. Like your normal SIS  Sync report, you can track staff account creations, updates, deletions, and errors from this tab. >   By default, if a user account from Active Directory does not have a school association, Clever will assign the staff member to the Clever-generated 'Default District Office' school site. To prevent this, please populate a school in the user attribute chosen for the staff school field mapping in step 2 above. >  
>  
> FAQs
> If syncing staff from Active Directory is enabled, what will happen to existing staff accounts? > If enabled, existing staff accounts that were uploaded via a staff.csv will be preserved and will be transitioned to  Custom Staff . These records will display under  Data sources > Custom data > Staff tab . All custom staff that were created prior to Active Directory being enabled will also be preserved. > If syncing staff from Active Directory is disabled, what will happen to existing staff accounts? > If disabled, any staff added to Clever via Active Directory will be removed from Clever upon the next sync with your district's student information system (SIS). The only staff that will remain in Clever are those that were created as Custom Staff: Data sources > Custom data > Staff tab. > If syncing staff from Active Directory, can I manually add custom staff? > Yes. If Active Directory sync is enabled, staff can still be manually created by navigating to Support tools > Custom data > Staff
> How often does the Active Directory staff sync run? > Once daily, but on your Data sources > SIS sync > Staff Data tab , you'll have the option to manually sync data at any time if you need a user to be updated immediately.

> What happens during a sync pause if I am syncing staff from Active Directory? > Your staff will continue to sync from Active Directory even during a pause. > What should I do if a staff user is not syncing via the Active Directory sync and is missing in Clever? > Please be sure to review your OUs to ensure that the staff user is in an OU that is set to sync to Clever. If you've confirmed the user is in a selected OU, please contact support. > Can I sync staff via Entra ID instead of Active Directory? > Clever does not currently provide instructions or support for syncing staff users via Entra ID.

title: Custom Data: Students
text:
> Important: Title Custom Data: Students URL Name 360029599131 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Individually create custom students 3. Bulk create custom students 4. Removing custom students 5. Viewing custom students 6. School year rollover
>  
> Overview
> If you would like to add a student that doesn't sync from your district's SIS, you can create a custom student account in Clever on an individual basis or bulk upload through a CSV file. > IMPORTANT  Custom students cannot be added to sections synced from your Student Information System (SIS). They can only be added to custom sections. >  
> Individually create custom students
> To create an individual custom student, navigate to the Clever Dashboard > Data sources > Custom data page. Click Add custom data   > Students  and a “Create student” form will appear . Once created, custom student accounts can be treated like an SIS-synced student account. >  
> Bulk create custom students
> How do I format the file? > The file will need to be titled "students" and saved as a CSV file type. The minimum  header requirements are the following:
> school\_id student\_id last\_name first\_name
> Please see our spec section 3.2 for more detailed information on the file format, what values are accepted, and information about additional headers. A sample file can be downloaded here:  Download. > Please note:  C ontacts for custom students cannot be uploaded in the custom students.csv file. They need to be uploaded in a separate custom contacts.csv file. Instructions on how to do so can be found here. > Web Upload
> If you would like to use the web upload option:
> From the left-hand navigation, click  Support tools > Custom data From the top-right, click  Add custom data and select  Upload records
> Once uploaded, you will see the following status message:
>  
>  
> SFTP Upload
> SFTP Upload is available to all schools.

title: Custom Data: Students
text:
If your primary sync method is not SFTP, please reach out to Clever support for assistance with gaining access to your own Clever SFTP Directory. > To manually upload files to your district's SFTP folder, please:
> Navigate to your Data sources > SIS sync > Settings page to locate your district's SFTP Settings and corresponding credentials. >  
> Log in to your Clever SFTP box, and create a new subfolder named  customstudents . > For instructions on accessing your district's SFTP folder, please visit: SFTP Syncs: Uploading data to Clever  
> Upload the students.csv to the customstudents subfolder            
> Once the files finish processing (within 15-20 minutes), you will be able to see the new custom sections from your Clever Dashboard > Data sources > Custom data page. >  
> Please note: Please allow 10-15 minutes for custom data to process. Though Clever will not send an email notification that the data has been processed, the results will be viewable on the Sync page in the Clever Dashboard. >  
> Removing custom students
> Removing individual custom students
> Navigate to your Clever Dashboard > Data sources > Custom data page. Select the Students  tab at the bottom of the screen. Locate the record, and under  Actions , click   to delete
>  
> Removing custom students in bulk
> Custom students can be removed in bulk by uploading a blank students.csv file under  Support tools > Custom data > Add custom data > Upload records . The file must contain column headers. Please feel free to use the students.csv file contained in this sample file set to remove students in bulk:  Download 
> This is to prevent a "duplicate identifier" error when the student eventually comes through the normal SIS sync with the same sis/student\_id. > Please note: Uploading blank files over custom data only deletes bulk uploaded custom data and not manually created custom data.

title: Custom Data: Students
text:
Manually created custom data will need to be deleted manually by clicking on the trash can under the Actions column in the Custom Records . >  
> Viewing custom students
> Five minutes after the file is uploaded, Clever will automatically trigger a sync in order to process the custom students into our system. Once the sync has successfully completed - around 10-15 minutes after initial file upload - districts can view up to 200 successfully created custom students through the Custom Data page in the dashboard. If the district has 200+ custom students, all can be viewed in the Data browser or via the search bar in the dashboard. > Please note: If the custom student(s) will be joining the district's account in the Fall through the normal SIS sync, the student\_id used for the custom account should match their student\_id in the SIS. >  
> School year rollover
> Once the normal SIS sync is running for the next school year, Clever recommends deleting all custom students from the previous academic year. To remove custom students, please follow the directions outlined here .

title: For Clever Admins: Clever’s email policy for teachers
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Clever’s email policy for teachers
text:
This article details Clever's policy around teacher email communications.  If enabled from the [Clever Dashboard > Portal > Portal settings > Communication](https://schools.clever.com/portal/communication/notifications) page, there are three types of emails Clever may send to teachers:

- **Professional development:** Emails about training, certification, webinars, tutorials, and [Clever Academy](http://clever.academy/?user_type=district_admin), our free online training and certification program for educators.
- **News and product updates:** Emails that cover new feature announcements, partnerships, new product resources, and Clever seasonal programs just for teachers.
- **Service-related:** Emails that facilitate the teacher's login and use of Clever according to the features enabled by their district. Examples of these emails include:

1. Shared district resources
2. Password retrieval
3. Changes in terms of service
4. Product notifications

title: For Clever Admins: Clever’s email policy for teachers
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Clever’s email policy for teachers
text:
Teachers will only receive **professional development** and **news and product update** emails from Clever if:

- Their district has subscribed them to receive emails from the [Clever Dashboard > Portal > Portal settings > Communications](https://schools.clever.com/portal/communication/notifications) page.
- They have a teacher account in Clever.
- The teacher has not unsubscribed themselves from receiving Clever emails.
- Their district has committed to using the Clever Portal throughout the school year.

**Service-related emails** are critical for account functionality; for this reason, they are not subject to the district or teacher's email subscription settings. However, teachers can disable service-related emails by using the unsubscribe link in the email(s) they receive. In addition, teachers will only receive service-related emails from Clever if their user account is synced with Clever.

**Unsubscribe:** Every teacher email will contain a clear unsubscribe link providing the ability to opt out of receiving Clever emails.

**Third-parties:** Clever promises to never rent, sell or share teacher email addresses with third-party vendors for marketing purposes, per [Clever's privacy policy](https://clever.com/about/privacy-policy).

title: For Clever Admins: Clever’s email policy for teachers
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Clever’s email policy for teachers
text:
Clever receives frequent requests from teachers and districts for more information about Clever utilization best practices. Our email content helps equip teachers with the knowledge and tools they need to succeed, whether teaching from school or remotely. Our goal is to help teachers save time while managing their digital classrooms and staying connected with students and families or guardians. In addition, we provide them with resources that enable them to address questions and issues quickly and independently.

Aside from professional development and news/product updates, Clever also sends service-related emails or account alerts to teachers (e.g., resetting password emails, downloading Clever Badges, etc.). These transactional emails facilitate the teacher's login and use of Clever according to the features contracted and enabled by the district and are often critical to account functionality.

We're excited to help teachers get the most out of the Clever Portal for their classroom and continue to save them valuable teaching time!

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360031356852?language=en_US#overview) 
2. [How to add tags to your application](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360031356852?language=en_US#h_3063269a-7528-4527-9b68-6938ed714ab2)  
3. [Tips and best practices for tagging](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360031356852?language=en_US#h_888ea907-96af-4d74-83be-bbf4597c8e08)  
4. [Examples of common edtech search terms](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360031356852?language=en_US#h_28fe74d0-e536-4b9a-ab0e-d28d6a7aee5b)

Teachers can search for applications in the Clever Library by name and using keywords. To improve their applications' discoverability, partners can add up to 10 tags directly in your [Clever App Dashboard > Library > Marketing Collateral.](https://apps.clever.com/clever-academy-dev/library/collateral)

Adding tags will give partners the opportunity to provide additional definitions and characteristics about their application, making it easier for teachers to find the right application for their needs.

---

1. Sign into your Clever Dashboard
2. Go to the **Library** tab in the left-hand menu
3. Go to **Marketing Collateral** in the left-hand menu
4. Scroll down to **App details** and click Edit
5. Create tags for your app, then save your changes

The changes will go live on your app detail page as soon as you save. To see the results on and test the new search results, you can impersonate a teacher via your demo account.

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000ULgX&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028EOw)

---

- To optimize search, make sure your tags are less than 24 characters each.
- Add tags that reference specific skills (i.e. ‘addition’, ‘subtraction’) , features and capabilities (‘student-paced’, ‘gamified’) , or curriculum requirements (‘experimental method’, ‘earth and space science’). These are typical search terms that teachers query with.
- Add non-Library categories as tags since the Library has 10 official categories. Do not repeat your existing categories as tags because the Clever search algorithm already surfaces your app based on its category. The 10 official categories include: Assessment, Authoring, Classroom Management, English, Math, Presentation, Science, Social Studies, Technology, Other.

---

- SEL

- MTSS
- ELL
- Adaptive Learning
- Reading comprehension
- Classroom management
- Offline access
- Group activities
- Game-based learning
- Computer science
- Puzzles
- Design
- SPED
- SAT
- PSAT
- Bilingual
- Standards
- Video
- Inclusion
- Common core
- Fluency

For more examples, [click here](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1a9RW2b5E9aovnNgVv7-n5DTbSiCS7nGH1zGusmrsT34/edit?usp=sharing).

title: Clever Roles: Staff vs. Teachers
text:
> Tip: Title Clever Roles: Staff vs. Teachers URL Name 360032149791 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Teachers 3. Staff 4. Can a user be both staff and teacher? 5. What features are available to teachers and staff? 6. Clever Portal: Differences for staff vs. teachers
> Overview
> This article discusses the differences between teachers and non-instructional staff in Clever and provides details about district users who might be considered both staff and a teacher. > Teachers
> Teacher is the term Clever uses to refer to your district's teaching staff. These are the individuals who directly manage a classroom and students. Teachers in Clever have unique tools and features that allow them to facilitate digital learning in the classroom. Some resources available to teachers in Clever include:
> Clever Library Login Tools Teacher Pages   Teacher Analytics
>  
> Staff
> "Staff" is the term Clever uses to refer to staff who are not directly in charge of a classroom (e.g., principal, front desk, counselor, etc.). Clever has two user roles associated with the staff user type:
> Portal Access :  This is the default role provided to staff members in Clever. This role provides permissions to access the Clever Portal and any shared applications. School Tech Lead : This role in Clever has additional permissions that allow them to manage the Clever Portal on a school-by-school basis. >  
> Can a user be both staff and teacher? > Yes! An individual can be both a teacher and staff in Clever. In most instances, these users can access both user accounts using the same set of credentials. Districts can link teacher and staff accounts as long as the email for each record matches (this includes case sensitivity). If the user has one account syncing from your student information system, and you need to make a custom account for another role for that user, that's totally fine! You will just need to be sure to use the same email.

title: Clever Roles: Staff vs. Teachers
text:
To check to see if the user's accounts are linked, you can search for the user in the search bar in the Clever Dashboard. If the accounts are linked you will see the teacher/staff toggle button (shown below). > The user will log in to Clever using one set of credentials. As long as the teacher and staff accounts are linked, the user can easily toggle between accounts by clicking their name and selecting the account they want to be logged in to. >  
> An example of the dropdown a user with multiple accounts will see when clicking their name. >  
> You can learn more about switching between accounts here . >    Clever Tip: If you're accessing Clever via a login method other than the Clever login page (ex: links in another Portal) you may have a different role choosing experience. In this scenario, Clever will prompt the user to select the role they want to login with: As a security measure, users with both a teacher and a staff account will be asked to re-enter their username and password after selecting the account they want to access. This is to protect your account in case there is a delay between your initial login attempt and selecting your account type. >

text:
> Note: Title SSO (Saved Passwords) Apps: iOS Devices URL Name 360033063711 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. How it works 3. Unsupported device errors 4. Troubleshooting
> Overview
> SSO (Saved Passwords) applications are available to use with the Clever iOS application (versions 6.0 and above). Provided that the user has the Clever application installed on their device and is connected to SSO (Saved Passwords) applications in their account, once logged into Clever, they will enjoy a seamless single-sign-on experience for more of their favorite education applications! Please note that the Clever iOS application only works on devices on iOS version 16.6 and up. > Please note: SSO (Saved Passwords) applications on iOS are not yet available for Clever Admins. >  
> How it works
> Clever iOS app for students
> When using the Clever iOS application, users can log into their SSO (Saved Passwords) applications. > Once the student selects the Clever application and logs in, they’ll see their student Portal. From here, they can click on any Saved Passwords application, and the app will load within the Clever application. > Please note: For SSO (Saved Passwords) applications on iOS, they'll always open in the Clever app and never redirect to the native application downloaded on the device. > iOS device in a web browser
> If a teacher, staff, or admin user is utilizing an iOS device to access Clever, they’ll need to access it via a web browser. Once logged into Clever in the web browser, the user can choose an SSO (Saved Passwords) application just like they would choose any other SSO application. The user will then be taken to the application's web page in the Clever app and their credentials will be entered for them, providing a single-sign-on experience for SSO (Saved Passwords) applications on their mobile device.

For more information, please visit:  How do I add custom external links to the Clever Portal? >   For more about SSO (Saved Passwords) applications, please see For Teachers: What are SSO (Saved Passwords) applications? > Troubleshooting

> Is your mobile device running on iOS 16.6 or above? Is your Clever app updated to version 6.x or above? > If you've confirmed both of these details, please move on to check:
> Can the user log into the SSO (Saved Passwords) application successfully on a computer (non-mobile device)? Have users confirmed they can access the application outside of Clever? > If the user can't log into the application successfully on a computer, please reach out to the application directly to troubleshoot login credentials. > If the user can log in on a computer or access the application at Clever, please feel free to contact  Clever support. Please avoid sending personally identifiable information (PII) in any pictures or videos you provide.

> Overview
> Custom data allows Clever Admins to create rostering data, including fields and records, directly from the Clever Dashboard that doesn't exist in the district's student information system (SIS) or aren't being synced to Clever. Common uses of custom data include:  
> Adding summer school information Organizing unique groups of students into sections (e.g., afterschool programs) Adding non-teaching staff members who are not in the district's SIS Maintaining historical data that was deleted from the SIS
> For example, if a section is deleted when a teacher leaves midyear, but you want to preserve historical app data for that section. You can build a custom section in Clever using the original SIS section data so app data is preserved. >  
> IMPORTANT  Please note that custom data can't be used until you start running a sync with your Student Information System (SIS) . In addition, if Clever has not synced with your SIS in more than 6 months, you won't be able to add new custom data to Clever. Also, Custom data will run during a sync pause (such as during summer school) but not a sync hold (when your sync has stopped due to unexpected changes to data) . >  
> Clever Admins can upload  custom fields for any data type to track data not currently being synced by the district's SIS (e.g., IEP status, Dietary Requirements, Extracurricular Activities, etc.). The types of records that can be created using custom data can either be associated with or include:
> Students Teachers Staff Sections & Enrollments Student Contacts Custom fields
> Custom data won't overwrite any rostering data being synced to Clever by your district's SIS, nor can it be overwritten by your SIS-synced data.

text:
Custom data is also indistinguishable from your synced SIS data to most Clever-integrated applications. >   Clever Tip: When creating custom records, we recommend using the unique SIS identifier known as the SIS ID (i.e., teacher\_id, student\_id, contact\_id, section\_id, or staff\_id, respectively) if one exists for each record in your SIS. This way, if, at some point, your district's SIS begins sending those same records in the standard SIS data sync, the SIS record will take precedence over the custom data record. Failure to match SIS IDs will result in duplicate records in Clever. >  
> Adding custom data
> Clever supports creating custom records in Clever for the following record types:
> Students Teachers Staff Sections & Enrollments
>  
> Custom schools cannot be created in Clever. To add schools, districts must sync them from their SIS. Summer school locations should be included in the standard SIS sync before pausing the sync over summer. Please visit  For District Admins: Pausing the sync with your SIS for more about sync pauses. >  
> Admins can create custom data records either individually or in bulk using CSV uploads via the Clever Dashboard > Data sources > Custom data page. To upload data:
> Download  CSV templates . Navigate to your Clever Dashboard > Data sources > Custom data . Click Add custom data in the top right-hand corner. Choose to add records individually by clicking on the corresponding selection or in bulk by clicking Upload records . When creating the file(s), make sure to use the School\_ID field and not the School\_number field. >  
> Please note: Please allow 10-15 minutes for custom data to process. Though Clever won't send an email notification that the data has been processed, the results will be viewable on the Sync page in the Clever Dashboard. >  
> Custom data won't overwrite SIS-synced records and will appear in Clever with a "Custom" label on their Clever profile page.

title: Troubleshooting: Expired LDAP SSL Certificates
text:
Title

Troubleshooting: Expired LDAP SSL Certificates

URL Name

360037825791

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360037825791?language=en_US#header1) 
2. [Expired SSL certificates](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360037825791?language=en_US#header2) 
3. [Downloading new certificate fingerprints](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360037825791?language=en_US#header3) 
4. [Frequently Asked Questions](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360037825791?language=en_US#header4)

Clever will alert you ahead of when your LDAP SSL certificate is approaching expiration. A current SSL certificate is necessary to support [LDAPS login methods](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/207090387) and [account recovery that relies on LDAPS](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360025854292). The Clever Admin owner of the account will receive an email notification 2 weeks ahead of expiration and there will be an alert visible on the [SSO settings page](https://schools.clever.com/instant-login/settings) in the Clever Dashboard. You must [update your certificate](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360037825791?language=en_US#header3) to ensure continued access to Clever using your LDAPS login method.

---

According to standard requirements, SSL certificates may have a lifespan of **at most 2-3 years.**As such, you may see examples of the following LDAP login error when your certificate expires.

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TmE9&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028EKf)

---

title: Troubleshooting: Expired LDAP SSL Certificates
text:
To download the new SHA-1 fingerprint for your SSL certificate, navigate to your [Clever Dashboard > Authentication > SSO settings > Login method tab](https://schools.clever.com/instant-login/settings) and click **Edit Settings** in the **LDAP Authentication** box.

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TmE9&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028EKp)

If your LDAP server is connected to the Clever account via the LDAP URL, you should be able to click **Download From Server** to get an SHA-1 fingerprint for the latest SSL certificate on the server.

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TmE9&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028EKu)

Click **Test Connection**. If you see the message below, then it worked and you can now test a login. If you do not see this message or if your users are still having trouble logging in, please contact Clever support to troubleshoot.

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TmE9&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028EKz)

Be sure to exit and save your new settings!

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TmE9&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028EL4)

---

**Will I be alerted if my LDAP Certificate has expired?**

- The Clever Admin account owner, which can be seen on the [Clever Dashboard > User management > Admin team](https://schools.clever.com/team/members) page, will receive an email from [no-reply@clever.com](mailto:no-reply@clever.com) with the subject: *There are issues with your LDAPS Certificate*, informing them that we have detected issues with your current LDAPS certificate. If your LDAPS certificate is managed by another member of your team, we recommend setting up an automatic forward based on the subject to the right member of your team.

title: Clever + Newsela Setup Guide
text:
1. Make sure your district is set up with Clever! If your district has not been set up with Clever, you can get started by going to this link: <https://clever.com/signup>
2. If your district is already on Clever, you can add Newsela by following these instructions:
 - Log into your Clever Dashboard and select [**Applications > Add Applications.**](https://schools.clever.com/applications/add)
 - Search for Newsela.
 - You'll also be asked if you'd like to request a custom Launch Date. The Launch Date is the first day users can access the application through Clever.
 - Once you have made your selections, click **Request**.
3. Once you have made your request, it will be sent to the Newsela team for approval. This process usually takes one business day but may take as long as a week during peak periods.
4. Once the request is accepted, Newsela recommends logging in a few users to confirm that they can sign in and import classes.

---

Newsela recommends **sharing data by school**. You can share data for all your schools - including schools that may not have Newsela PRO licenses yet. Any users not covered by a Newsela PRO license who log in with Clever will be taken to Newsela's free product.

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000Ssez&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000002887P) For more information on sharing data with applications, please see: [How do I set my sharing permissions for applications?](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/203115007)

---

Newsela's [Binder](https://support.newsela.com/item/supportArticle/types-of-admin-access) feature provides school and district leaders with the ability to aggregate student performance data. School and district leaders will need to be set up in Clever and log into Newsela with Clever to ensure Binder access.

- Any administrators who need district-wide binder access should be added to Clever in the [District Curriculum Lead](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115003207703) or [District Administrator](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202518038) role.
- Any school administrators who need school level binder access should be added to Clever in the [Staff](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360026950471) role.

---

Newsela supports co-teachers and will import co-teachers from Clever. If you are using the Clever integration, Newsela [co-teachers have to be set up in Clever](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115000988748?language=en_US) by a system administrator and cannot be set up by individual teachers in Newsela.

---

title: Clever + Newsela Setup Guide
text:
Many teachers create free Newsela accounts before their district purchases Newsela and are concerned about retaining data associated with their free accounts.

Newsela automatically merges user accounts with matching email addresses. If a teacher sets up a free Newsela account with their district email address, the system will recognize and merge their account the first time they log in to Newsela with Clever using that email address. As long as the email addresses match in all systems, users can easily change authentication methods. Users who log in using accounts associated with different email addresses will create duplicate accounts.

Newsela's support team can merge accounts if users provide both email addresses. Teachers who need accounts merged should contact Newsela's support team at <https://support.newsela.com/hc/en-us>

---

title: Clever + Newsela Setup Guide
text:
**Why am I getting a "data warning" or a "data requirement" error?**

- A **data requirement**error occurs when the record is incompatible with Newsela's integration with Clever. In this case, the user or section will not appear in the application. Data requirements must be resolved for users or sections to be successfully processed by the application.
- A **data warning** error occurs when the user or section has a data compatibility issue with the application that may result in a degraded experience within the application. We recommend addressing these issues or contacting the application directly to determine the impact of a particular data warning.

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000Ssez&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000002886N) For more information on data compatibility, please see: [What are data warnings and data errors?](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202043083)

**Why is my student or teacher missing from Newsela?**

- Please check to see if this user meets the following requirements before reaching out to Newsela:
 - Student or teacher is present in your SIS data
 - Student or teacher is present in our Clever data and shared with Newsela
- If the user is missing from your Clever data, but in your SIS, please contact [Clever Support](https://support.clever.com/hc/en-us).

**Why are classes missing from Clever?**

title: Clever + Newsela Setup Guide
text:
- Newsela only imports current classes from Clever. If a teacher attempts to sync a Clever class before the term start date, the class will not import.
- Teachers might be missing classes because the classes have either not been imported or because they've been archived. Teachers can resolve this by following these steps:
 - In Newsela, click on the **Archived Classes** tab.
 - Select "Restore" to reactivate the missing classes. If there are no classes in the page, skip to the next step.
 - Navigate back to the **Classes** tab.
 - Click "Sync with Clever"
- If the class is missing from your Clever data, but in your SIS, please contact [Clever Support](https://support.clever.com/hc/en-us).

**Who should I ask for help with this issue?**

- If the issue is related to data within Clever or data coming from Clever, please contact [Clever Support](https://support.clever.com/hc/en-us).
- If the issue is related to functionality within Newsela, please contact [Newsela Support](https://support.newsela.com/contact).
