section: For App Partners: Browsing district data
text:
> Warning: Title For App Partners: Browsing district data URL Name 360038554692 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Searching the district's shared data 3. Using the Data Browser to view data shared by a district 4. Differences between v2 & v3 API 5. Downloading data shared by a district
> Overview
> The Data Browser is a great tool for application partners to view district data. This article will go over how to use the Data Browser and its' features, including viewing data using Clever’s v2 API or v3 API. > Please note: This feature is only available for applications with a Secure Sync integration. > Searching District Data
> From the district's profile in your Clever dashboard, you can use the search bar at the top of the page to find any record that the district is currently sharing with your application:
> Using the Data Browser
> Another way to view the district's data in Clever is by clicking the  Data Browser in the left-hand sidebar. Here, you can browse the district's data by record type, and use the  Add Filter  button   to narrow down your results. You can also click on each record to view a full list of the fields that the district is sharing for the record. > Differences between v2 & v3 API
> Clever now offers access to the v3 API as well as v2. These are some updates to note:
> Version Switcher
> The Version Switcher allows apps to toggle between the v2 and v3 Clever APIs, thus better understanding how Clever's API works, which can benefit app developers. For applications that have access to the v3 API, they’ll see a label on the top right indicating what version they're on and that they can switch to the other version. Clicking on this button will open a new tab with the different version of the data browser and preserve all other states, such as any current collection being viewed as well as any filters currently applied.

title: For App Partners: Browsing district data
heading_path: For App Partners: Browsing district data
section: For App Partners: Browsing district data
text:
> Data updates
> While the v3 API contains similar information to v2, the data browser will now display additional record fields when clicking any record in any collection. When viewing v3 data for a user type, the ID field refers to the v3 user ID which is used for identifying users with multiple roles. Any similarly named or ambiguous fields related to v2 data are prefixed with legacy\_, such as legacy\_id on a teacher record. In the Detail view, you'll see both the ID field for a specific teacher, representing their user Clever ID, their v2 Clever ID, and their sis\_id. > If you want to know more about the differences between v2 and v3, please take a look at our API documentation: https://dev.clever.com/docs/new-in-api-v3
> Downloading data shared by a district
> From the Data Browser, you can also download the data the district has shared with your application. This feature can come in handy if your team would like to manipulate the district's data, or perform a manual matching of existing accounts for your application. > To use this feature, navigate to the record type you'd like to download information for (e.g. schools, students, teachers, sections, etc.), and click the ' Download ' button:  
> The export will include all data that the district has shared for the record type you've selected and is also based on API type. For example, if downloading a list of student records in the v3 data browser, they will have both user and legacy IDs, whereas downloading from v2 will only contain relevant v2 API data. Any filters applied to view data in the Data Browser tab will not be reflected in the final data export. > After clicking the Download  button, a warning will appear to notify you that the CSV file being exported may contain PII. Please keep in mind that files containing sensitive student information must be treated carefully.

text:

- If your district is already on Clever, you can add GradeCam by following these instructions:

 - Search for GradeCam
 - You'll then be brought to a page where you can request the application. When requesting an application, select whether or not your district has already purchased the application. When you click "Haven't Purchased" for applications that have free trials, you'll receive a prompt asking if you'd like to try a free trial.
 - You'll also be asked if you'd like to request a custom Launch Date. The Launch Date is the first day users can access the app through Clever.
 - Once you've made your selections, click Request!
- GradeCam supports rostering and single sign-on (SSO) for **teacher** users. Upon first SSO login through Clever, GradeCam will prompt teachers to either enter existing GradeCam login credentials or create new ones, allowing SSO ongoing. (SSO through Clever isn't required by GradeCam as teachers can log in directly at app.gradecam.com.)
- Once districts have shared data with GradeCam, the GradeCam team will set up the initial sync - they’ll reach out to let you know when that’s finished!

---

GradeCam requires **Term Name** for sections, and they would prefer to have **Term Start** and **Term End** dates as well. Depending on your SIS, setting this up can be a little tricky, so here are some general guidelines:

title: Clever + GradeCam Setup Guide
text:
For our **Aeries, Infinite Campus API, PowerSchool, Illuminate, Skyward API and Skyward Auto Syncs**, Clever pulls these fields by default. If the default field Clever is using isn’t the best for your district, you can set up a custom mapping by following the instructions in this Help Center article: [How do I customize my auto-sync?](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115003630803)

If you’re having trouble setting up the custom mapping, please reach out to [Clever Support](https://support.clever.com/hc/en-us)!

For our **Infinite Campus Auto Sync**, mapping the term dates from the SIS can pull dates for the full year, which doesn't allow the classes to show correctly in GradeCam. For Infinite Campus Auto Sync districts, please make sure that each term shows the correct dates. Ex: a Q1 term may have a start date of 8/1/2021 and an end date of 10/15/2021 but it should NOT have a start date of 8/1/2021 and an end date of 7/1/2022 (full year). Please check your data browser to see if dates have synced correctly and reach out to Clever Support with questions.

Please reach out to your SIS vendor and let them know that you'd like to have Term Name, Term Start, and Term End dates added to your sync.

A full list of Clever-managed and SIS-managed auto syncs can be found here: [Which SISs support an auto sync?](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202042973)

Your district will need to add the Term\_name, Term\_start, and Term\_end fields to your Sections CSV file. You can use this Help Center article to help you format your file: [SFTP: How do I format my CSV files?](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/203114867)

---

- A**data requirement**error occurs when the record is incompatible with GradeCam's integration with Clever, and the user or section will not appear in the application. Data Requirements must be resolved for users or sections to be successfully processed by the application.
- A**data warning**error occurs when the user or section has a compatibility issue with the application that may result in a degraded app experience. We recommend addressing these issues or contacting the application directly to determine the impact of a particular Data Warning.
- For an in-depth look into any existing GradeCam data warnings or errors, please refer to the [Data Quality](https://schools.clever.com/data-quality) page of the Clever dashboard.

- Make sure that the teacher has sections in Clever - GradeCam won't import teachers without section assignments. You can check this by searching for the teacher in the [Data browser](https://schools.clever.com/browser).
- GradeCam only supports primary teachers. If a section has co-teachers, they won't be synced to GradeCam.

---

Lexia Support is happy to help districts using Clever who have any trouble or questions about Lexia.

title: Clever + Lexia: Contacting Support
text:
District staff can contact Lexia or Clever Support when they need help.

- If the issue is related to data within Clever, or data being sent to Lexia Learning from Clever, please reach out to [Clever Support.](http://support.clever.com)
- If the issue is related to a feature within a Lexia Learning program, please reach out to [Lexia Support.](https://help.lexialearning.com/s/)
- If Clever Support is contacted first the Clever team will send the inquiry to Lexia's support email address. In order to provide the quickest resolution possible, Clever's support ticket and Lexia's support ticket are then tied together and all replies are tracked by both support teams.
- Clever will then assign the ticket to a Clever Support agent that works closely with the Lexia integration, this facilitates a quick response time.

All Lexia Support team members have access to a Clever data dashboard in order to assist districts in resolving Clever related issues. If an issue is complex, the Lexia support ticket is immediately escalated to a senior Lexia Support team member for assistance.

In addition to as-needed support, Lexia and Clever have regular meetings to discuss the best ways to support districts. We have a mutual goal of assisting districts as quickly and efficiently as possible to minimize disruption to teachers and students.

title: Clever + EVERFI Setup Guide
text:
**Why am I getting a “data warning” or a “data requirement” error?**

- A **data requirement** ​error occurs when the record is incompatible with EVERFI’s integration with Clever, and the user or section will not appear in the application. Data Requirements must be resolved for users or sections to be successfully processed by the application.
- A **data warning** ​error occurs when the user or section has a compatibility issue with the application that may result in a degraded app experience. We recommend addressing these issues or contacting the application directly to determine the impact of a particular Data Warning.

**Why is a student or teacher missing from EVERFI?** 
Please check to see if this user meets the following requirements before reaching out to EVERFI:

- In your SIS data
- In your shared Clever data with EVERFI

**What if a teacher (and/or student) already has an EVERFI account outside of Clever?** 
When existing EVERFI users (both teachers and students) login through Clever, they will be prompted to type in their previous EVERFI username and password. Once users merge their old account with the new account, all past progress will show up on their new account.

**Can teachers and students be assigned to multiple school locations?** 
Yes, EVERFI does allow teachers and students to be assigned to multiple school locations. However, all schools must be shared in order for the sync to work accurately.

**Can multiple teachers/staff be assigned to the same course/section?** 
EVERFI does not currently support multiple teachers or staff to be assigned to the same course/section.

**How are building administrators provided access to the system and to building level location?** 
Admin can log in via Clever to access the EVERFI courses and resources.  Admin will have the same access any teacher has and be able to create courses.  EVERFI does not currently have an Admin role to oversee the entire school/district.

**Who should I ask for help with an issue?**

If it’s related to data within Clever, or data coming from Clever, please contact [Clever Support](https://support.clever.com/hc/en-us).

EVERFI Team

Alice Wagner, Vice President and Dakota Rubin, Operations

[clever@everfi.com](mailto:clever@everfi.com)

> Below are some common questions about EdTech Analytics If you have more questions not answered in this article, please feel free to reach out to support! > What devices and browsers are supported? > Clever's extension is available for Chrome and Edge browsers. Districts using MacBooks can access Edtech Analytics as long as they run Chrome with the extension enabled. > Where can I find a copy of Clever's privacy policy?

title: Edtech Analytics - Overview and FAQs
text:
> In Step 2 of the guide, you'll find the Clever Edtech Analytics Addendum . We also recommend checking out our Trust Center for more information on how Clever handles student data privacy as a whole. >  
> Should I apply the policies to User and Device OUs? > Your district can apply the settings to either user or device OUs, and we recommend applying the policies to both. >  
> How many users or devices should I set this for? > We recommend applying this to at least 500 devices or 10% of students. The Edtech Analytics dashboard will not appear until data is collected at that threshold. >  
> Do I need to complete both guides? > The first guide is for Chromebooks and the second guide is for Windows Devices. If your district is only using one type of device, then you can skip ahead to complete the guide. >  
> Which extension should I delete? > The Clever Plus extension (ID -  dikiaagfielfbnbbopidjjagldjopbpa ) provides the functionality for both Saved Passwords and Edtech Analytics. We recommend removing the Clever extension (ID -  nopfnnpnopgmcnkjchnlpomggcdjfepo ), but having both will not affect the normal user flow. >  
> Can I export EdTech Analytics data? > Yes! Data can be exported by clicking  Export all data  in the top right. Clever does not support the automatic export of EdTech Analytics data (i.e. to a SFTP directory)

This article contains the following:

For best security practices, your district requires a secure PIN for older students to log into Clever when using a  Badge. Clever requires a PIN for all students grades 7 and above that login using a Badge. A district can choose to adjust this setting to require PINs for Badges beginning at an earlier grade.

---

To set a PIN, students will navigate to [clever.com/badges](http://www.clever.com/badges), hold their Badge up to the camera, and then be authenticated to the page displayed below.

The first time a student uses a PIN-enabled Badge, they will see the screen below that will prompt them to set a PIN.

On this screen, the student will enter their new PIN twice and then be signed in to Clever! After this initial setup, your students will be able to log into Clever using their Badge and their PIN!

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000SmOH&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000002lxvt)

title: For Teachers: Clever Badges - PINs
text:
In order for your student to reset their Badge PIN they will need to be logged in to their Clever Portal. If your student has forgotten their PIN, they can log in to Clever by using a *Backup Login Code*. You are able to generate a *Backup Login Code* from your teacher Portal.

From the teacher’s Clever Portal:

1. Log into your Clever Portal and navigate to **My Students** > **Student Roster**
2. Choose the student you wish to help
3. Click **Get backup login code** on the right-hand side for that student. You will see a six-digit backup code. Write this code down and pass it along securely to your student. **The code will expire in 20 minutes.**

![Backup login code](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000SmOH&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000TYPbC)

How does a student log in using a Backup Code?

1. The student will go to your district's Clever Portal login page and click “Get help signing in” under the password field
2. The student will then click “Log in with a Backup Code”

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000SmOH&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000002lxw3)

3. The student will then enter the Backup Code on the next screen, and click Log in. This will log them into their Clever account

Once the student is logged into their Clever Portal, they can reset their 6-digit PIN by clicking on their name in the top-right corner, and selecting '**Reset your Badge PIN**'.

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000SmOH&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000002lxw8)

> This article will cover the expected student experience for the Clever iOS app on iPads or mobile devices running on iOS version 16.6 or later. If your students' experience doesn’t match what is described below, please reach out to your Clever Admin or IT team about updating your district to the latest version of the Clever App from the Apple App Store  found here. >

> Students who log in using Clever Badges
> These are the instructions for students who will be logging in to Clever using Badges on iOS devices:
> Download the Clever app on your students’ iOS device. Select the Clever application. Display the student's Badge to the camera (your students have the ability to toggle between the front-facing and back-facing camera). If the student is using a valid badge, a green checkmark should appear with sparkles to signify a successful login! The student will be logged into the Clever Portal and all of its features, including Teacher Pages, directly in the Clever app. When they select a learning application, the app will either open in a web browser or via the iOS application. The app itself determines this behavior and it can’t be changed by Clever. >  
> Logging in using credentials
> The Clever iOS app works best for students using Badges. Students and teachers who are not using Badges can log in to Clever directly from a Safari web browser. > When opening the Clever app, users will see the Badge Camera. They’ll select the Password option at the bottom of the screen.

text:
The user will locate their school from the Clever login page. They’ll then select the method they want to use to login (ex: Login with Google or Login with Clever). The user will type their credentials and then be logged into the Clever application and their Clever Portal. Please see our section below on what happens when a user selects a learning application to learn more about the user experience beyond logging in. >  Clever Tip: The Clever app will remember the user's school organization after their first login on the device, so this user won’t need to go through the process of selecting their school again if the Clever app was never fully closed, and device history has not been deleted. >

> After a student logs into the Clever iOS application, they’ll be able to click on one of their connected applications. The application or external link will open either in a web browser or the iOS application for the app. The app itself determines this behavior. > If a student wants to go back to their Portal, they should navigate back to the Clever app. From here they can click a new app icon to launch a new app, or access the same app again by clicking its icon. >  
> For details about multiple users on a shared device, visit this article ! > Logging out of the Clever app
> Students that share iOS devices will need to log out of the Clever application and any learning applications in order to ensure the next student can successfully log in to their own accounts. > Users can log out of Clever by clicking their name in the top right corner, then Log out . > For security reasons, it's best that users on 1:1 devices also log out of the Clever application and any learning applications when they are done using the device. > If a student doesn’t log out, they will remain logged in as long as their session is valid (~24 hours). >  For more troubleshooting tips, please see this Help Center article: Troubleshooting issues with the Clever iOS app.

> Please note:  The Clever iOS app requires iOS 9.0 or later and is compatible with iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch. If you are using a device that is running iOS 11 or later, you must update to the newest version of the Clever app. > Overview
> If your student is having issues with their iOS device and Clever, here are some recommended troubleshooting steps you can try to help. > Basic Troubleshooting
> Before you begin, please make sure your device is using iOS version 9.0 or above. Turn the device off and on again, then try again. Uninstall, then re-install the Clever app, then try again. Attempt logging in via  https://clever.com/badges  in the Safari app. Attempt using the Clever app outside of your school network (such as on a home network or mobile hotspot). Ensure that the iOS device has internet connectivity by navigating to any webpage in the Safari app. Ensure that “Private Mode” is not enabled for Safari on the iOS device. Ensure cookies are enabled for Safari. This includes the device-wide setting, as well as for the Clever domain ( clever.com ). Settings > Safari Block All Cookies . Make sure Block All Cookies is toggled off -- you will know it is off when the slider turns grey. Ensure Javascript is enabled for Safari. You can adjust this by navigating to  Settings > Safari > Javascript . Ensure camera access is enabled for Safari. You can adjust this by navigating to  Settings > Safari > Camera . >  
> Advanced Troubleshooting
> Ensure that on the device, the iOS network deny list is not enabled. You can adjust this by navigating to  Settings > General > Restrictions > Websites . Ensure that requests to Clever servers are not blocked or filtered by a firewall or network filtering software.

See our Help Center article:  Which Clever's domains should my network grant access ? In iOS 13, Safari has a new setting option that is enabled by default after updating an iPad from iOS 12. Please ensure that Safari's setting for “Request Desktop Website” is disabled. You can adjust this by navigating to  Settings > Safari > Request Desktop Website . In iOS 14, users have the ability to choose a default browser other than Safari. Please ensure that Safari is the default browser for any device that will be used with the Clever app. You can adjust this by navigating to  Settings > Browser > Safari . Ensure that no other software affects the way that Safari operates. > If the issue still persists, feel free to open a ticket with Clever Support!

>  
> Overview
> Clever has partnered with Zoom to create a seamless way to provide account creation, as well as Single Sign-On (SSO) access for teachers, staff, and Clever admins. To set up SAML SSO for Zoom, please follow the directions below. > To configure Single Sign-On (SSO) for Zoom, you must have a paid account (Edu/Business) or a Free "Licensed" Trial account provided by Zoom. You can check your account type in Zoom by selecting Account Management > Account Profile . > Setup Directions
> Confirm you have a Zoom Edu or Business account by logging in to zoom.us/signin and navigating to:  Account Management > Account Profile . Under your  Account Profile in Zoom, apply for a “Vanity URL.”  To ensure your Vanity URL is approved, please follow Zoom's guidelines for Vanity URL requests . > You won't be able to proceed to Step 3 until you have received an email from Zoom confirming your Vanity URL. > Once your Vanity URL has been approved by Zoom, add the Zoom application to your Clever account by clicking on this link  and selecting  Request application . Select which schools to share with Zoom and click  Request with sharing . > Tip: You can easily select all schools in the district by using the checkbox in the top left. >   Navigate to:  https://schools.clever.com/applications/saml-zoom/settings        •   Under 'SAML Details' copy the Metadata URL Enter the copied Metadata URL in a new browser tab and press Enter. •  Copy the value found between the tags: <ds:X509Certificate>             Navigate to: https://zoom.us/account/sso and select  Enable Single Sign-On. Choose to “Configure SSO Manually” and set the following values.

text:
> Our partnership has been designed and tested using the Clever > Zoom integration. Clever is not able to support district users who access Zoom by any other methods. > Will cloud storage for recordings be provided? > Cloud storage will be dependent upon your license type. The features associated with each meeting plan can be reviewed here:  https://zoom.us/pricing. > Can Staff users in Clever use Zoom? > Yes! Staff can log in via Clever and host virtual meetings through Zoom. A full guide for staff to sign in to Zoom and create virtual meeting links can be found here . > My district has multiple email domains. > Important: Title For Teachers: Troubleshooting - Shared devices URL Name 360040646931 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. How should students log out of Clever and connected apps? 2. How do students log out of the Clever Portal on any device? 3. How do I log out of Clever and applications while using an iPad? 4. What is the shared devices notification? 5. What about time-out and inactivity? >  
> How should students log out of Clever and connected apps? > When logging out, it's important to remember that single sign-on (SSO) can actually be broken down to up to three separate login processes behind the scenes:
> Identity provider login (e.g. Google or Active Directory) Clever login Application login (e.g. Khan Academy)
> If a student is accessing a shared device, we recommend that they log out of each application and device after their session. Students should log out of the application, the Clever Portal, and the identity provider (Google, ADFS, etc.). >  
> How do students log out of the Clever Portal on any device? > Users can log out of the Clever Portal by navigating to the top right corner of their Portal (where they can find their name), and clicking Log out. >  
>  
> How do I log out of Clever and applications while using an iPad? > On the iPad, double click the home button (on newer iPad Pros, swipe up from the bottom of the display) to expose the application thumbnails. Swipe up on the Clever app and any learning apps that were launched. This will end a student's session when the device is shared. >  
> What is the "shared devices notification"? > On certain devices, upon initial sign-in to Clever, students will be asked whether or not they should be remembered on the device. If they select No, only I use it , their Clever session will remain intact for 2 hours. > If the user selects Yes , Clever will treat the device as a shared device.

In this case, users will be prompted with an option to sign in as a different user after 10 minutes of inactivity on the Clever portal. >  
> Clever Tip: this feature gives users who share devices the option to log into another account, in case the best log-out practices were not followed 
>  
> What about time-out and inactivity? > Users are logged out of Clever automatically if: 
> If a user is inactive in Clever for 24 hours, they will automatically be logged out. Currently, there is no way to customize this behavior. The browser is  quit (e.g. "Quit Google Chrome " ). Closing the browser window will not log the user out of Clever.

title: Clever + Amazon Business Setup Guide
heading_path: Set up Clever SSO via SAML
section: Set up Clever SSO via SAML
text:
Amazon Business utilizes a secure technology called SAML for SSO. It requires a couple of additional setup steps. If you have not yet heard from the Amazon Business team and would like assistance with the steps listed below, please contact [Clever-SSO@amazon.com](mailto:Clever-SSO@amazon.com).

1.  In your Clever Dashboard, click the [Amazon Business](https://schools.clever.com/applications/saml-amazon-business) app, click on '[Settings](https://schools.clever.com/applications/saml-amazon-business/settings)', and scroll to ‘SAML Details’. Copy the ‘Metadata URL,’ which you’ll enter in your Amazon Business admin account.

a.  Copy the **Metadata URL** field and open that address in a new tab. 
b.  Right-click the page and save the Metadata file.

2.  Log into your Amazon Business administrator account and navigate to the ‘Business Settings’ page

a.  Select **Clever** as your identity provider (IDP). 
b.  Select the default group and default buying role for new SSO users. 
c.  Enter the Clever Metadata URL, which you found under ‘SAML Details’ in Clever. 
d.  Select the attribute mappings listed in the table below:

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000Fpwf&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000002881M)

e.  Click **Publish** in the **Status** section  
f.   Copy the **SP Initiated Login URL,** which you’ll need to enter in Clever

3.  In your Clever Dashboard, click the Amazon Business app and scroll to ‘SAML Details’

a.  Enter the ‘SP Initiated Login URL’ (from your AB account) in the ‘Login URL’ field 
b.  If necessary, update the default ‘attribute’ field for each user type. \*Please note that the default attribute fields will likely be correct, so we recommend leaving them in place unless instructed otherwise.\*

---

> With so many digital learning tools in use in school, it can be hard for teachers to keep track of student engagement and activities. Class Analytics in the Clever Teacher Portal gives you key information about which students are logging in to Clever and when they last logged in. > The Student activity tab includes data and tools that allow teachers to easily view and manage student participation in one central location. It includes the most recent login for each student and which resources they utilized for the previous seven days. > This data can be filtered by class, resource, and level of activity. >  
>  
> Please note: This feature only shows the students' most recent logins. If a student has logged in multiple times, only their most recent login to Clever will appear. >  
> Weekly overview
> The Weekly overview tab shows student login history for the previous seven days and the resources that they have been using.

2. [Guiding questions for summer school setup](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360042615332?language=en_US#header2) 
3. [Steps for success](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360042615332?language=en_US#header3)

We're here to help ensure that your schools have the best summer with Clever yet. Each of our summer school Help Center articles listed in the steps for success below has guiding questions and resources for you to review to ensure that your rosters and applications are ready for summer school.

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000OoYL&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000004YsyZ) 
For more robust support, including activities, email templates for teachers, and more, check out [Prepping for Summer School](https://clever.academy/quick-start-prepping-for-summer-school?reg=1?user_type=district_admin) in Clever Academy!

This guide is designed to be useful for all schools regardless of their summer school plans.

---

The first step to prepare for summer school is to ask three key questions:

- Which applications will you be using over the summer?
- Will you need to add new students, teachers, staff, or sections to your Clever sync?
- How does my district generate summer school rosters?

---

title: Summer School: Overview
text:
Summer school is unique because most districts need to have two sets of rostering data:

1. Rostering data from the previous school year (Spring, second semester, Q4, etc.) is typically paused over the summer to preserve access to learning applications and resources for students, teachers, and staff not enrolled in summer school.
2. Rostering data for summer school. To maintain both rosters in Clever, we recommend that districts pause their regular Clever sync and supplement their summer school rosters using custom data.

To set up your Clever account for summer, you'll need to review:

- Step 1: [Application requirements](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360042616652)
- Step 2: [Sync settings](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360027745731)
- Step 3: [Creating data](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360042615912)
- Step 4: [Final details](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360043055471)

All steps must be completed in order to ensure student, teacher, and staff access during the summer.

To get started configuring your Clever account for summer school, please move on to Step 1: [Application requirements](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360042616652?language=en_US).

---

**Related articles:**

- [Summer School: Application requirements](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360042616652)
- [Summer School: Sync settings](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360027745731)
- [Summer School: Creating data](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360042615912)
- [Summer School: Final details](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360043055471)

title: Summer School: Creating data
text:
> Important: Title Summer School: Creating data URL Name 360042615912 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. What is custom data? 2. How does custom data support rostering for summer school? 3. How can I upload custom data? > What's custom data? > Custom data is a way to create data records within Clever that don't exist in your district’s SIS (Student Information System) or CSV data files. This can be helpful in cases such as creating summer school data, organizing unique groups of students, and adding staff members who are not in the district’s information system. Custom data can be created, edited, and browsed from the Custom Data page at Clever Dashboard > Data sources > Custom data. > Please note:  Custom data should not duplicate data that is already in Clever that is synced by your SIS. If a user or a section is already in Clever, do not add it to your custom data. >  
>  
> How does custom data support rostering for summer school? > We know that many districts house summer school data outside of the SISs or CSV data files used during the school year. Custom data enables you to easily upload new summer rosters into Clever without reconfiguring the regular school-year sync. Custom data also allows you to consistently update summer school data while "freezing" previous school-year data in Clever via the sync pause . > If you plan to add new summer school users and sections to Clever and share them with learning applications after your sync is paused you’ll need to use custom data. Please note, you will only need to upload custom students, teachers, and staff if the users are not already synced to Clever. >  
> Please note: If you pause your sync for specific app(s) , custom data will not be shared with any apps you pause the sync for. >  
> How can I upload custom data? > The easiest way to upload custom data is usually by   manually uploading custom data in the Clever Dashboard.

title: Summer School: Creating data
text:
> You can also upload data via your SFTP client if you use the SFTP sync type by following these directions: 
> Log in to your SFTP client. Enter your Clever SFTP credentials. If you don’t have them handy, you can access them in Clever under Data sources > SIS sync > Settings . Upload your custom data. If you’re new to adding custom data, reference the following Help Center articles: 
> Custom Data: Sections   Custom Data: Teachers Custom Data: Staff Custom Data: Students
> Before getting started, there are a few important points to keep in mind: 
> Schools cannot be added via custom data. Please ensure all necessary school sites are syncing from your SIS before any sync pauses. You can bulk upload custom teachers, staff, students, sections, and enrollments via the Clever Dashboard or SFTP. Custom students cannot be added to existing non-custom sections. Co-teachers can be added manually to custom sections. You can bulk upload  extension fields . Adding extension fields may help with setting up sharing rules. > Learn more about how to upload custom data here . > The final step of the process is Stage 4: Final details

title: Summer School: Application requirements
text:
> Tip: Title Summer School: Application requirements URL Name 360042616652 Article Body Every application that your schools will want to use during the summer has different considerations for how they support Summer School. This section breaks down some of the common circumstances and suggests guiding questions you can ask your app partner to make sure your district has all the information you need to offer that app this summer. > Please note: If you want to pause syncing your data to a particular application, please see this article: For Clever Admins: Pausing your sync for a specific app. This is a perfect tool for semester rollover and summer school, but shouldn't be confused with an SIS sync pause. >  
> ⚙️ Integration details
> You will want to speak with your application partners about their Clever integrations as part of preparing for summer school. Certain realities of summer school (such as students transferring to a new campus) can provide difficulties for the ways in which applications process your data. Your district will want to reach out to your application partners as soon as possible to plan for any of these considerations. > Questions for your app partners:
> Does your application accept students enrolled at multiple schools and/or sections? Does your application accept Clever’s extension fields? Does your application recommend specific sharing permissions? >  
> ⚠️ Data requirements
> Every application has slightly different data requirements. While some require just first name, last name, and class associations, others may require further data points. > Make sure to ask your vendors what data is required for summer school and if it is different than during the rest of the year to avoid needing to make last-minute changes to your rosters to meet requirements. > Questions for your app partners:
> What data is required for accounts to be generated? What data is recommended to take full advantage of your application features?

title: Summer School: Application requirements
text:
>  
>  
> 📑 Contract
> Check with your procurement department and/or the application “owner” at the district to confirm your contract terms. Some contracts are due for renewal during the summer which might mean a new contract is needed to maintain service, even if your sync is paused. Other contracts might limit the number of users your district has access to and assigning that application over summer school might exceed that limit. Have a conversation within your district to ensure you are ready for these limitations. > Questions for your app partners:
> When does our contract for your service expire? Does it include summer school? How many licenses have we purchased for this service? Do we have remaining licenses for summer school? >  
>  
> 📚 Content Mapping
> Certain textbooks require a manual content mapping process after rostering through Clever is complete to ensure the right students get the right books. Reach out to your application partner to understand if and how they map content and get tips from their experts on best practices for the summer. > Most apps will require a specific class or course codes to help with that content assignment that may need to be passed to your summer school staff for activation. Questions for your app partners:
> Do you require content mapping from Clever? >  
>  
> To continue setting up Clever for summer school, proceed to Step 2: Sync settings

section: For Clever Admins: Zoom - Secure Experience
text:
> Tip: Title For Clever Admins: Zoom - Secure Experience URL Name 360042696791 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Directions 3. Testing the Zoom Secure Experience 4. Student Experience
> Overview
> We’ve heard from districts that want to improve Zoom security to ensure the safety of students and teachers. In response, we have  worked with Zoom to develop a new solution for schools called the Zoom Secure Experience. This new experience “locks down” meetings in your domain – only teachers, staff and admins can create meetings, and only verified users (including students) in your domain can join these Zoom meetings. > Additionally, usernames for individuals joining will be locked. Students will have the default name: "First Name + Last Name" (Example: John Smith) as displayed in Clever. Notably, this Secure Experience does not require students to have Zoom accounts! > We think this is a great experience and now recommend it to our districts as a best practice. If you’d like to enable Zoom Secure Experience for your district, please follow the steps below. > Things to Note: 
> The Zoom Secure Experience requires all users to authenticate via Clever before joining a Zoom meeting   This experience does not give Zoom accounts to students   These instructions assume you’ve already set up Zoom + Clever SSO for your teachers & staff. If you have not already done so, please start by following the instructions here. If there are any users in your district who want to join Zoom meetings and aren't in Clever, you'll want to add them to your Clever upload (e.g. staff.csv). > If certain users in your district need to continue hosting unauthenticated meetings, you can allow this by creating multiple  Zoom User Groups  and applying the settings below on a group-by-group basis.

title: Summer School: Final details
text:
> Important: Title Summer School: Final details URL Name 360043055471 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Sharing permissions 3. Notify teachers 4. Update tech support contact 5. Review Clever Badge expiration
> Overview
> This article outlines the final steps to ensure a smooth transition to summer school. We'll walk you through reviewing application sharing permissions, including recommended best practices for sharing summer school data. Additionally, you'll find essential reminders on communicating plans to teachers, updating your tech support contact information, and managing the annual review process for Clever Badges. > Sharing permissions
> Once you finalize your summer school rosters in Clever, ensure that all of your users have access to the correct applications. In your Clever Dashboard , review the sharing rules for each application, taking care to ensure that you are sharing the new sections, students, teachers, and staff with the applications they need. > Questions to ask: 
> Which applications do we need to use over the summer? Who needs to use these apps? How can we easily identify and share summer school users? (Recommended:  extension fields )
> View instructions for adjusting sharing permissions here . Please note, when using a Sharing by Schools rule, s ections with a school association that is different from a teacher's primary school won't be shared. For example, a teacher has sections at two schools: School A and School B. If you set the sharing permissions for the application to share School A, only the teacher's section at School A will be shared. This is important for teachers who will be providing instruction at an alternate school location during summer school. > Clever Tip: We recommend using a  Share by Rules sharing type for summer school data. >  
>  
> Notify teachers 
> We highly recommend notifying teachers of your summer school plan! You can use templates found here .

title: Summer School: Final details
text:
> Please note: When you start your new school year in Clever, our system will automatically update any Teacher Pages shared with specific sections to Just me sharing. This excludes Just Me and All sections pages. We recommend you notify your teachers so they can take action. Learn more here . > Clever's announcements tool is available to all districts and delivers notifications directly to students and teachers in the Clever Portal. To learn more about announcements, please see this article . >  
>  
> Update tech support contact 
> Changes in personnel and procedures often occur at the end of the school year. Please review your  tech support contact to ensure that students and teachers can receive help from your team if needed. You can find directions for updating your tech support contact here . If new administrators are joining your Clever team, have them check out our quick start guides  in Clever Academy ! > Review Clever Badges
> Starting January 1, 2025, all newly created Clever Badges will feature an expiration date and be valid  365 days  from their creation date. For example, a Badge created on April 18, 2025, will expire on April 18, 2026 at the same time it was originally created. > Any Badges existing before June 30, 2026  will be active until  July 1, 2026 , giving you the flexibility to choose when you want to void and reprint Badges annually. If you generate Badges after June 30, 2026, please check your Badges for their 365 day expiration date. Clever recommends that you void and reprint badges during your annual rollover period, such as the summer or winter. See this article for more information. > If your rollover period is in the summer, we recommend voiding and reprinting all Badges during the summer of 2026 so that your Badges will expire annually each summer moving forward. This will prevent Badges from expiring in the middle of the school year moving forward.

title: Clever + ANet Setup Guide
text:
Title

Clever + ANet Setup Guide

URL Name

360043425531

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360043425531?language=en_US#header1) 
2. [New Clever districts](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360043425531?language=en_US#header2) 
3. [Existing Clever districts](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360043425531?language=en_US#header3) 
4. [Initial setup process](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360043425531?language=en_US#header4) 
5. [Recommended sharing rules](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360043425531?language=en_US#header5)6. [Teacher emails](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360043425531?language=en_US#header6) 
7. [How to set up single sign-on](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360043425531?language=en_US#header7)8. [Additional considerations](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360043425531?language=en_US#header8) 
      •   [Creating Custom Sections](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360043425531?language=en_US#subhead1) 
      •   [Term Changes](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360043425531?language=en_US#subhead2) 
      •   [Maintaing Student Rostering Information](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360043425531?language=en_US#subhead3)9. [Who to contact for support](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360043425531?language=en_US#header9)

This article is a guide to help connect the ANet learning application.

---

1. If your district has not been set up with Clever, you can get started by going to this link: <https://clever.com/signup> or accept your invite to set up with Clever by clicking the **Set up with Clever** link in your email invitation from ANet.
2. Set your password and log in to the Clever Dashboard (your username is your email address).
3. Connect your student information system (SIS) data to Clever by going to [Data sources > SIS sync](https://schools.clever.com/sync/settings) and choosing your SIS from the dropdown menu.

The instructions to connect your SIS data will appear once you’ve selected your SIS and will vary depending on your sync type. Check out this article for more information: [Which sync option should I choose?](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/202289278)

---

If your district already uses Clever, connecting to ANet can take only a few clicks! These are the steps you can expect:

- Accept ANet’s invite to connect or request to connect with ANet.
- Accept ANet's sharing suggestions or share the applicable roster data.

---

title: Clever + ANet Setup Guide
text:
Here are your steps to get started:

1. Connect with the ANet application by either accepting our invite or requesting our application.

2. Share your data with ANet.

Now it’s time to set your sharing permissions for the ANet application. If you accepted our “recommended sharing” you’re probably already done or nearly there! If you choose to decline ANet’s “recommended sharing” read [this article](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/203115007) to learn more about setting sharing permissions. More information about sharing permissions can be found below. *Please note, you can always update data sharing at any time!*

**3.Review your data**

Review your ANet overview page to see what data you’ve approved to share. For an even deeper look at your data in Clever, review the data in the [Data browser](https://schools.clever.com/data-browser) or simply search for a record in the “Search” box, located on the top of your Dashboard screen.

If you need to make any updates to the data you are sharing with ANet, use the **Edit sharing** link on the ANet Overview page.

**4. Check your launch date**

Once you’ve confirmed the right data is being shared, make sure that students can start logging into ANet at the right time by checking your launch date.

Your launch date is the day that the ANet icon (pictured below) will appear in the Clever Portal for students to login. If you need the launch date updated, please request that action from ANet Support. For more on launch dates, [see this article](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115002947643).

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000SrEH&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000002880Y)

---

title: Clever + ANet Setup Guide
text:
ANet recommends you share your data **by rules.** This ensures Clever is only sharing the data that ANet needs, and additional data isn’t being shared unnecessarily. If you are accepting ANet’s invitation to connect, we will already have suggested sharing rules set up through the invitation. **Accepting ANet’s invitation is the recommended process**. If you are requesting to sync with ANet, you'll need to set up your own sharing rules. [Read this article](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115000392247) to learn more about how to Share by Rules or follow the guidance below:

There are a number of 'Fields' districts can use to either include or exclude data with the application sharing rules. The fields available are dependent on the type of sharing rule you selected (e.g. share by teacher, share by section, share by student)

- The modifiers available are:
 - equals any of
 - does not equal any of
 - contains text
 - does not contain text
 - starts with text

You should only share the classes that will be administering ANet assessments (subjects and grade levels). This is typically limited to only classes that are labeled ELA and/or Math in your SIS, and grades 2 through 12.

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000SrEH&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000002880d)

If your special education or gifted classes are listed as something other than ELA and/or Math, and are administering ANet assessments, you will want to share these classes as well.

---

Please note, ANet cannot process rostering information for classes whose teacher’s do not have school email addresses in Clever. Please confirm all teachers have unique school emails when sharing your rostering information with ANet.

If you have any teachers without email addresses, these will appear in your data warnings, illustrated below.

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000SrEH&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000002880i)

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000SrEH&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000002880n)

---

Students can use Clever SSO to log into their ANet application. To set up student SSO, please view [this resource](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/204982938). We recommend [testing student SSO](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360012704892) prior to their ANet administration to limit unforeseen challenges. At this time the ANet application does not support Clever SSO for teachers.

---

title: Clever + ANet Setup Guide
text:
Clever Custom Sections allow district administrators to create and manage sections manually within the Clever Dashboard. Once custom sections are created in Clever, administrators can share them with ANet through the Clever sharing permissions interface. You can read more about Clever custom sections [here](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115002764923).

A few examples for when you’d want to create Custom Sections are:

- <High School Only> One class period contains multiple courses. ANet can only assign one course per period, so if students take different courses in the same class, you will need to create Clever Custom Sections for each course within the period
- If you want to view your data differently than is currently coming through Clever (e.g. view data by homeroom as opposed to ELA and/or Math class)
- If there are students who do not need access to ANet products (assessments or quiz tool).

In your SIS, some sections may be assigned to a specific term. Students in a given section will have an active enrollment in Clever during the dates of that term. When a term ends, students in those sections no longer have an active enrollment. When this occurs, a student may not have access to ANet through Clever for 1-2 business days while the ANet team shifts the student from their old section to their new section.  Please reach out to ANet Support in advance to coordinate logistics.

[This resource](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/204059586) provides additional information about terms.  If you have any questions or concerns about the ability for a student to view their ANet interim during a term rollover, please contact ANet Support so we can strategize with your district.

Throughout the year, ANet will automatically receive any student or enrollment changes that are made in your SIS through Clever. Please ensure that your Student Information System is up-to-date so students are properly enrolled at the time of their administration. You should expect these changes to be reflected in ANet within 48 hours of the update in your Student Information System. If you have questions about maintaining your student roster, reach out to [ANet Support](https://achievementnetwork.freshdesk.com/support/tickets/new).

---

- If the issue is related to data within Clever or data coming from Clever, please contact [Clever Support](https://support.clever.com/hc/en-us).
- If the issue is related to functionality within ANet, such as assessment availability, please contact [ANet Support](https://achievementnetwork.freshdesk.com/support/tickets/new).

---

text:
> Warning: Title Sharing Permissions: Sharing data with new applications URL Name 360043482712 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. What are application sharing permissions? 3. How do I start sharing data with an application? 4. How do I edit the sharing permissions for an application once the setup guide has been completed? 5. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
> Overview
> This article will walk you through sharing data with an application once the application has accepted your request to connect via Clever. >  
>  
> What are application sharing permissions? > Once an application has been added to a district's Clever Portal, Clever Admins configure sharing permissions in order to determine what data should be shared with the app, and which users should be able to access the application from their Clever Portals. > Applications will not have access to any district data in Clever that has not been specifically shared with them via the application sharing permissions. > How do I start sharing data with an application? > Clever acts as a repository that stores the data from a district's student information system (SIS) which is then shared with each application. A district might share different data with each unique application depending on the application type, licensing contingencies, and so on. In Clever, this is done by setting up sharing permissions. Clever offers two experiences for sharing data: Guided Sharing and Standard Sharing . > Guided Sharing is best for new users or those who don't set up sharing settings often. Standard sharing is best for experienced Clever users or those who need to use School Site Sharing. > The choice in experience is custom to each user -- a new admin at your district can choose to use Guided Sharing while an admin with more Clever experience may choose Standard Sharing.

title: Sharing Permissions: Sharing data with new applications
heading_path: Sharing Permissions: Sharing data with new applications
section: Sharing Permissions: Sharing data with new applications
text:
Users can choose to switch between these two experiences at any time by selecting Edit Sharing for an application and selecting Switch Sharing setup view in the top right. Your choice in sharing experience will be remembered and used anytime you edit sharing permissions for an app. > Here’s how to set your data sharing permissions for an application for the first time:
> From your Clever Dashboard > Applications > My Applications page , click on an application name to be directed to the application’s overview page. Select Begin setup and follow the steps in the guide to finalize your connection with the application. > For your convenience, we are providing sharing instructions for both Standard and Guided sharing. >  
> Whether you are using Standard Sharing or Guided Sharing, you have the option to test sharing rules and filters to configure and reconfigure multiple times and preview the data that will be shared. Your sharing rules will not change until you click Save . > Standard Sharing
> Standard Sharing is recommended for users familiar with configuring sharing permissions or those who need to set up School Site Sharing. Click here to learn more about the steps of Standard Sharing. > Step 1: Set sharing
> You’ll specify which sharing type you would like to use in order to share data with the application. These settings will also determine which of your district users will have the application available to them in their individual Portals. > You have five options for how to share data:
> 1. Use the application’s sharing recommendation
> 2. Copy sharing rules from another app
> If you select this option, all records that are shared with the chosen application will also be shared with the one you're currently setting up. Please   note: copying the sharing only happens once - if you make changes to sharing with the original application, they will not be reflected in the app you're currently setting up (or vice versa)
> 3.

title: Sharing Permissions: Sharing data with new applications
heading_path: Sharing Permissions: Sharing data with new applications
section: Sharing Permissions: Sharing data with new applications
text:
Share all records in the district  
> If you select this option, all schools, students, teachers, and sections in the district will be shared. You will also have the option to include staff in the data sharing with the application. > 4. Share all records for specific schools
> If you select this option all students, students, teachers, sections, and staff associated with the selected schools will be shared with the application. > 5. Customize your sharing
> Select Click here to customize your sharing to navigate to the data sharing page to configure customized sharing rules. Read this article to learn more about how to share by rules. Once you've selected your sharing type, select 'Save' to move on to step 2. > Step 2: Data validation
> Once you’ve shared data, we’ll check for issues that might prevent a record from being synced. Please note that you may need to wait a few minutes while we process your sharing settings. Any data error and warnings will appear on this page when processing is completed. > If you see an error, this means that the flagged records will not be accessible in the application - users will not be able to log in and data will be missing. If you see a warning, this means that the flagged records will be accessible but users may have a degraded experience within the application. If you have data that is flagged, please review the impacted records carefully. We recommend resolving as many of these data quality issues as possible to ensure that all of the data is successfully synced with the application and all desired users are able to access the application. > For more information on resolving these data warnings and errors, check out our guide to data warnings and errors. > Once you've reviewed any data quality issues, select 'Next' to move on to step 3. > Step 3: Finalize Setup
> Now that you have enabled data sharing with the application and resolved any data quality issues, the application connection is complete!

title: Sharing Permissions: Sharing data with new applications
heading_path: Sharing Permissions: Sharing data with new applications
section: Sharing Permissions: Sharing data with new applications
text:
For some applications, you will need to take additional steps to finalize the app connection. Those additional steps will be outlined on this page. For any application with single sign-on (SSO), users will be able to access the application on the launch date. > Once you have read the instructions to finalize your app connection, select Finish . You’ll receive a prompt to add the application to a category. Choose a category from the dropdown if you’d like. If you need to go back to edit the sharing rules for an application, feel free to reference this guide   for more information about the different types of sharing permissions. > Guided Sharing
> Guided Sharing is recommended for users less familiar with sharing rules or for those who want a more guided experience. Click here to learn more about the steps of Guided Sharing. > Step 1: Choose sharing method
> Choose your sharing method. There are multiple data sharing options. > Create new sharing settings specific to the application Use the application’s suggested data sharing template (if provided) Copy another app’s data sharing rules
> Step 2: Choose who needs access
> Set up access for specific sections, teachers, students, and/or staff
> Step 3: Preview & share user data
> You can preview your sharing rules and, if everything looks correct, share your schools’ data with the application
> You’ll receive a prompt to add the application to a category. Choose an existing category from the dropdown if you’d like. > How do I edit the sharing permissions for an application once the setup guide has been completed? > To edit sharing permissions, from your Clever Dashboard > Applications > My Applications page , click on the application's name to open its overview page. Under  Shared Data , select  Edit sharing . You can  reference this guide   for more information about the different types of sharing permissions. > Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
> Why is Clever unable to display the count of shared records?

title: Sharing Permissions: Sharing data with new applications
heading_path: Sharing Permissions: Sharing data with new applications
section: Sharing Permissions: Sharing data with new applications
text:
> Clever may be unable to provide a preview of the count of shared records for districts with large data sets or highly complex rules. When this occurs, "Unable to display count of shared records" or "Sorry, your rules are too complex to display shared records" may display. To view the count of shared records, please use the Application Receives section on the app overview page. > How do I add NCES IDs and/or MDR Numbers for schools in Clever? > Reach out to our support team and provide a list of the numbers/IDs that need to be added and their corresponding schools. > How do I check to see which school is being shared as the users’ primary location? > For one-off users, you can search for the user in the search bar of your Clever Dashboard to locate their profile and look at their primary school site. > For multiple users, you can click on the application in your Clever Dashboard and click the download button under Application Receives for the user type in question. >  
>  
> How do I share co-teachers with applications? > First, be sure to ask the application if they support co-teachers, as some applications don’t. If they confirm that they do support syncing co-teachers, check in Clever to ensure that they are added to the correct sections. To learn more about adding co-teachers in Clever, check out this article . Once you have confirmed they are co-teachers to sections in Clever and the application supports co-teachers, they will be shared as long as they meet the sharing permission criteria set up for the application. You can use the Troubleshoot Sharing tool to confirm if a co-teacher or any user is shared with an application. > Why isn’t the user shared with the app? > Sharing permissions can be tricky! Check out our tips & troubleshooting article to help guide you to make sure the user is shared. You can also use the Troubleshoot Sharing tool to confirm if a user is shared with an application and analyze which sharing rules they don’t meet criteria for.

> The data is correct in Clever, but is not correct in the app. What do I do? > This could be happening for various reasons, so it’s important to make sure everything checks out. Check out our app troubleshooting article to guide you in troubleshooting the issue. Depending on the root of the issue, you may need to reach out to the Clever Support team, or the application’s support team directly. > Related Articles:
> Sharing Permissions: Guided Sharing Sharing Permissions: Share by Rules

section: For App Partners: District setup recommendations
text:
> Warning: Title For App Partners: District setup recommendations URL Name 360043514192 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Globally Recommended Sharing 3. Custom Setup wizard 4. Data quality settings 5. Enable safety thresholds 6. Request App Sync Notifications for your account 7. Populate a District Outreach Contact 8. Request API V3 Migration CSVs  
> Overview
> Application partners can provide recommendations for districts that are adding your application(s) to Clever for the first time. To do this, please navigate to your Clever Portal > Settings > District Setup page to configure the requirements and recommended settings for connected districts. The available options include:
> Globally Recommended Sharing Custom Setup wizard Enable safety thresholds Request API V3 Migration CSVs
> Globally Recommended Sharing 
> Configure your application's recommended sharing settings to include best practices for sharing district data with your application. For detailed information about sharing permissions, please visit  Sharing Permissions: Overview . > Custom Setup wizard
> The custom setup wizard allows you to create suggested steps to help guide districts that recently launched your application in Clever. This is the perfect place to detail recommended setup instructions and settings for district Clever Admins. Examples include:
> Recommendations for how to share data with your application. Click here  for more. Instructions on how to resolve data quality errors. Click here  for more. Additional recommended setup steps. >           
> This feature can also be used to link to external setup instructions located on your district's website, manage district expectations for finalizing their connection with your application, and more! Once your customized setup is configured, it will display to districts on the last step of the setup wizard within their Clever Dashboard.

title: For App Partners: District setup recommendations
heading_path: For App Partners: District setup recommendations
section: For App Partners: District setup recommendations
text:
> Data quality settings
> Data validation is key to ensuring that districts resolve data issues before their official launch date for your application! These settings should accurately reflect your application's data quality requirements. For more information, please visit  our guide to verifying district data quality . > Enable safety thresholds
> Safety thresholds ensure that significant data changes made by your districts in their student information systems (SIS) are placed on an automatic hold before syncing to your application, giving you time to review the changes before they process in your application. For more, please visit our  guide to safety thresholds . >  
> Request App Sync Notifications for your account
> For the most accurate information and data regarding a district’s last sync, please contact our support team to enable App Sync Notifications. Use our API to confirm the last successful SIS upload from a school organization to:
> Minimize your nightly syncs to only the school organizations that have had data changes or
> Proactively sync data changes throughout the day to prevent support tickets and minimize friction for school organizations. > Populate a District Outreach Contact
> If you haven’t already, provide a district outreach contact on your Settings > General page to increase efficiency and minimize customer frustration. This contact will surface to Clever Administrators in their Dashboard if they utilize your application, providing them with a quick reference for who to contact should they need help with your application. >  Clever will also use this contact for school communications, such as app invites, sync requests, etc. > If you’d only like the contact to appear only on direct communications, and not in the Clever Dashboard for Clever Admins, you can check the box for Don’t show District Outreach Contact as a support option for districts .

> Request API V3 Migration CSVs
> This tool maps legacy role-based Clever IDs to the new API v3.0 user IDs. A zip file with one CSV for every connected district will be available to download for one week after its creation. In the rare case that a district mapping cannot be completed, Clever will send an error file detailing the issues to you. > Clever Tip:  Please make sure that your application's data quality warnings and errors are current by navigating to the 'Warnings' tab of any district in your Clever Dashboard. Contact your Application Success Manager or Clever Support if updates are needed.

title: For App Partners: Staff vs. School Admin
heading_path: For App Partners: Staff vs. School Admin
section: For App Partners: Staff vs. School Admin
text:
> Note: Title For App Partners: Staff vs. School Admin URL Name 360043911831 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. How do districts sync staff to Clever? 3. What districts see 4. What applications see   5. How are staff shared with applications? > Overview
> A common point of confusion in Clever is the difference between School Admins and Staff users in Clever. These are the same user type in Clever but are represented with different titles depending on if you are a district or application partner. >  
> In early 2019, we re-branded the "School Admin" user type to "Staff" for our district partners. This included updated titles in the district dashboard, deprecation of our admins.csv file, and introduction of the staff.csv file. >  
> How do districts sync staff to Clever? > The staff role is designed for users that are not connected to rosters but need access to applications, including school admins! By default, all staff users are created as  Portal Access only users, meaning they'll have access to the Clever Portal for Single Sign-On (SSO) into applications just as students and teachers do. However, staff can be assigned the role of School Tech Lead which offers additional administrative capabilities. > Depending on a districts sync type, there are four ways that districts can sync staff users to Clever:  
> Uploading staff via CSV Sync staff with Active Directory Using Infinite Campus API or Skyward API syncs Custom data: staff
> What districts see
> The district-facing Data Browser  shows staff under a single tab titled  Staff . Selecting the  Staff  tab will show a list of staff/school admins that currently exist in Clever for the district. >  
> What applications see
> The application-facing Data Browser  shows staff/school admins under the  School Admins  tab. > Selecting the  School Admins tab will allow applications to apply a filter and view staff/school admins associated with your connected school districts.

> How are staff shared with applications? > Staff and school administrators can use SSO to access learning applications as administrators. Staff users abide by explicit sharing logic so that only staff that are intentionally shared with an application through a sharing rule will gain access to the program. This aligns with existing behavior for sharing all other data types. > Please note: The  Staff  tab on the district Dashboard and the  School Admins tab on the application Dashboard reflect the same data.
