title: For Teachers: Getting Started with Khan Academy in the Clever Library
heading_path: For Teachers: Getting Started with Khan Academy in the Clever Library
text:
Khan Academy can now be found in the [Clever Library](https://clever.com/library) for free! The Clever Library is a place for teachers to discover, learn about, and adopt new resources for their classrooms.

Teachers that have access to Clever and the Library can install Khan Academy and gain the benefit of automatic rostering of their classes for them, and their students gain Single Sign-on (SSO), so no new username or password to remember! If your district uses Clever, you’ll have access to these benefits whether you’re new to Khan Academy or already using us.

This article is for teachers new to using the free Clever Library app with Khan Academy. It is not for teachers in districts with a [Khan Academy Districts](https://districts.khanacademy.org/) partnership and roster at the district level using Clever Secure Sync.  Below are the steps for new or existing Teachers and Students to get started via Clever Library.

---

title: For Teachers: Getting Started with Khan Academy in the Clever Library
heading_path: For Teachers: Getting Started with Khan Academy in the Clever Library
text:
Log in to Clever, choose the **Library** tab, and find Khan Academy by browsing or using the search bar at the top of the Library.

![Clever Library with highlight of Khan Academy app](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000EAcD&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000Bxw4r)

Next, click on the blue **Install** button for Khan Academy. Then, choose which of your Teacher Page(s) you'd like to add Khan Academy.

![Khan Academy account creation screen](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000EAcD&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000286rL)

Then you’ll be taken to Khan Academy. You'll be asked whether you want to create a new Khan Academy account or if you already have an existing school account you want to use:

![Welcome to Khan Academy](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000EAcD&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000286rQ)

Here's an example of what Khan Academy will look like once added to a Teacher Page:

![Khan Academy on a Teacher Page](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000EAcD&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000BxqCM)

---

title: For Teachers: Getting Started with Khan Academy in the Clever Library
heading_path: For Teachers: Getting Started with Khan Academy in the Clever Library
text:
If you don’t already have a Khan Academy account through your school, click **Create a new account**, confirm or enter your school email, and then click **Sign up**.

![Teacher account creation screen](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000EAcD&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000286rV)

This will create your new account, and your classes will automatically be rostered for you (this can take a few minutes the first time). After the rostering process is complete, you’ll be taken to your Teacher Dashboard:

![Khan Academy teacher dashboard](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000EAcD&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000286rf)

You can also go to the Khan Academy website and sign up directly. To do this, click on the **Sign up** link in the upper right corner of the home page, and then choose the sign up as a **Teacher** button. Click on the **Continue with Clever**:

![Khan Academy log in screen](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000EAcD&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000Bxpg7)

If you choose that option and are already logged into Clever, you’ll be asked to confirm that you want to share your class data with Khan Academy:

![Class data sharing screen](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000EAcD&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000286rp)

If you’re not logged into Clever, you’ll be asked to do that first.

![Clever Login Screen](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000EAcD&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000286ru)

There’s one final step you’ll want to complete if you’re creating a new Khan Academy account via Clever Library, which is to verify the email you provided when you signed up. You’ll receive an email that looks like this:

![Khan Academy verify email screen](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000EAcD&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000286rz)

Click on the **Link this email address** button in the email. You’ll be brought to the Khan Academy login screen; click on the **Continue with Clever** option:

![Khan Academy login screen](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000EAcD&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000BxvlV)

This will enable you to verify your email with us, which will add it to your Settings under Email.

---

If you already have a Khan Academy account through your school, click **Log into your existing account**. You can log in to that existing account using Google (click on **Continue with Google**) or by entering your school email address and your password.

![Khan Academy log in to existing account screen](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000EAcD&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000286sE)

Once you’ve logged into your Khan Academy account, you’ll be taken to your Teacher Dashboard, where you’ll see your Clever-rostered classes, as well as any other classes you had previously created.

![Khan Academy teacher dashboard with classes](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000EAcD&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000286sJ)

---

title: For Teachers: Getting Started with Khan Academy in the Clever Library
heading_path: For Teachers: Getting Started with Khan Academy in the Clever Library
text:
Note that there is no class code, and **you should not give one out**; your students need to complete their registration by logging into Clever and choosing the Khan Academy tile in their portal, then go through the steps to create or sign into their account.

Once in your Teacher Dashboard, you’ll see that, your classes have been created and your students have been rostered, but the class student count will show as zero. Once your students complete their registration and access the Khan Academy through the Clever portal, you’ll see them in your Student Roster as normal.

Until then, if you select one of your newly rostered classes, you’ll see that the students are listed as pending:

`![Khan Academy student roster with students pending](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000EAcD&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000286sO)`

Please also note there is no class code, and **you should not give one out**; your students need to complete their registration by logging into Clever and choosing the Khan Academy tile in their portal, then go through the steps to create or sign into their account.

Once your students have completed this process, the number of students in your Khan Academy class(es) will match what you see in Clever for your roster and you will be able to give them assignments or mastery goals. This is easy to do; to start assigning you just open “Assignments” and select “Assign” in the left-hand navigation and you’ll be asked to add a course, like this:

![Assign content screen](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000EAcD&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000286sT)

If your students haven’t completed signup by logging into Clever and choosing the Khan Academy tile, they won’t be reflected in your student count, and they’ll still show as pending in your Student Roster.

---

There are a few other helpful things to know about how Khan Academy works with the Clever Library:

title: For Teachers: Getting Started with Khan Academy in the Clever Library
heading_path: For Teachers: Getting Started with Khan Academy in the Clever Library
text:
Your student and class data in Khan Academy will sync with your Clever roster each time you log into your Khan Academy account, so if you’re missing updates, try logging out and back in again.

Information only syncs one way, from your school district’s SIS to Clever to Khan Academy. In other words, the Clever roster “rules”; we consider your Clever roster the source of truth. This means that any student additions made to your district or schools’ SIS will flow through to Clever, and then on to Khan Academy, and **you should not take any additional action in Khan Academy to add students.** Additions to your rosters will automatically refresh the next time you log in.

Khan Academy receives very limited data on your students (first name and last initial only, and no email via the roster data). This means that you will see limited data on your students in your Teacher Dashboard, and email address updates made in Clever won’t flow through to Khan Academy.

---

title: For Teachers: Getting Started with Khan Academy in the Clever Library
heading_path: For Teachers: Getting Started with Khan Academy in the Clever Library
Students: How do my students get started with Khan Academy through the Clever Library?
section: Students: How do my students get started with Khan Academy through the Clever Library?
text:
Since the Clever Library is for teachers to discover applications they may want to use with their classes, students don’t have access to it directly.

Students see the Khan Academy tile in their student portal (through your teacher’s page) after you’ve found Khan Academy in the Clever Library, installed it, and completed your activation process. It’ll look something like this:

![Clever Teacher Page with Khan Academy added](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000EAcD&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000286sY)

Students can favorite Khan Academy so it’s easy to find within their portal, and also search for it within their portal. Once your students find Khan Academy in their student portal, they select the tile to begin their activation process.

They’ll be able to create a new account for Khan Academy or (if they’re 13 or older) log into an existing school account (a Khan Academy account that has their school email associated with it).

---

title: For Teachers: Getting Started with Khan Academy in the Clever Library
heading_path: For Teachers: Getting Started with Khan Academy in the Clever Library
text:
The first time a student selects the Khan Academy tile, they’ll see a welcome message urging them to create a new account or log into their existing account.

![Khan Academy student's create account screen](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000EAcD&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000286sn)

They’ll be asked to enter their birth date and to sign up with their school email.

![Screenshot of request to enter student birthday](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000EAcD&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000286ss)

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000EAcD&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000286t2)

After they’ve clicked **Sign up**, they’ll be taken to their newly-created account, and their Clever ID will be attached to their account (this is behind the scenes, but helpful for understanding how it works).

They’ll see a welcome message that will explain that they won’t see anything to do on their Learner homepage until their teacher (you!) has made an assignment.

![Welcome to Khan Academy screen](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000EAcD&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000286t7)

When they dismiss the message by clicking **Onward,** they’ll see their Learner home, ready to display your class once you give assignments.

![Student view of Khan Academy courses](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000EAcD&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000286tH)

If the student chooses **Teachers** (the bottom option in the left-hand navigation bar) they’ll see you linked as their teacher (specifically, your first name and last initial) which validates that they have completed their part of the process, and can wait for you to give them an assignment.

---

title: For Teachers: Getting Started with Khan Academy in the Clever Library
heading_path: For Teachers: Getting Started with Khan Academy in the Clever Library
​​​​​​​Students: Logging into an Existing Account (13 years and older)
section: ​​​​​​​Students: Logging into an Existing Account (13 years and older)
text:
Students who are 13 years of age or older have the option to use an existing Khan Academy school account instead of creating a new one. To do this, they’ll choose the bottom option **Log in to your existing account**.

![Create a new account screen](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000EAcD&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000286tM)

Then they’ll enter the school email address and password for their account:

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000EAcD&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000286so)

Our system will check that the account belongs to a student who is at least 13 years old. If the account belongs to a student who isn’t at least 13 years old, the system will recognize that they are attempting to use an under 13 account, and they’ll receive an error message directing them to go back and create a new account instead.

If the student is indeed at least 13 years old, they’ll see a screen asking for permission to link their Clever account to their Khan Academy account, like this:

![Screenshot of the prompt to use an existing account](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000EAcD&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000286tR)

The message will explain that by using their existing account, all teachers linked to it will be able to see any activity on assignments, as well as any activity they’ve done independently (outside of a class).

They’ll either sign in or create a new account, and then they’ll be brought to their Learner Home in Khan Academy.

title: For App Partners: How to enable safety thresholds

section: For App Partners: How to enable safety thresholds
text:
> Important: Title For App Partners: How to enable safety thresholds URL Name 360044699192 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. What are safety thresholds? 3. How to enable safety thresholds 4. How to customize safety thresholds 5. How to approve districts that require a review
>  
> Overview
> When a district’s student information system (SIS) syncs to Clever or the district makes a change to their sharing permissions with your application, this can result in significant changes to the rostering data available in Clever’s API for this district. > If you enable safety thresholds, Clever will check to see if there are major data changes every time a district syncs or changes their sharing settings, If there are large changes, we’ll prevent district data from being updated in Clever’s API until the changes are reviewed and approved by your team. > Enabling safety thresholds is an important part of syncing rostering information for a district as it ensures that your app team is aware of any potentially significant changes to a district’s data. Safety thresholds are a safeguard to prevent potentially incorrect or undesired changes from being synced to your application. > What are safety thresholds? > If a district’s most recent sync or an update in their sharing permissions results in significant changes, a safety hold will be triggered. The district will go into the ‘Requires Review’ state. Data for that district will not be updated in Clever until the changes are either reverted by the district or approved by a member of your team. > Please note:  Only application team members with the Admin role in Clever will receive and will be able to approve Safety Threshold notifications
>   Clever will send a daily digest of any districts that are 'awaiting review' to users who have subscribed to emails about sharing changes and connected districts.

title: For App Partners: How to enable safety thresholds
heading_path: For App Partners: How to enable safety thresholds
section: For App Partners: How to enable safety thresholds
text:
Syncs requiring a review will need to be manually approved on a per district basis for these changes to be synced, which can be done in the district profile page, Sync Status  tab. Once a safety hold is approved, the district’s data will be fully available in Clever’s API. >  
> How to enable safety thresholds
> To enable safety thresholds, navigate to Settings > District Setup tab in the dashboard. Once safety thresholds are enabled, Clever will begin checking for major changes any time a district syncs or changes their sharing settings. You can enable or disable this setting at any time, but if there are districts that are awaiting review when you disable the feature, their data will not be updated until their next sync or sharing change. > How to customize safety thresholds
> By default, a district will enter the ‘Requires Review’ state if:
> Over 75% of any data type (e.g. schools, students, teachers, sections) being updated Over 10% of any data type (e.g. schools, students, teachers, sections) being deleted
> You might find that these thresholds don’t quite meet your needs -- and if so, you can easily change them in Settings > District Setup . Here, you can change the percentages of updates and deletes that will trigger a safety threshold. Additionally, you can choose whether you would like creation events to also send a district to the "Requires Review" state. If you leave any box unchecked, we'll ignore that type of data change (such as data creations or deletions). So, for instance, if you leave the creations box unchecked for Teachers, we'll ignore any data creations for teachers. >  
> How to approve districts that require a review
> When you log into your dashboard, we’ll let you know if there are any districts that are awaiting review. You can click on this alert or filter for districts where Sync Status is ‘Requires Review’ to see all districts that have major data changes.

title: For App Partners: How to enable safety thresholds
heading_path: For App Partners: How to enable safety thresholds
section: For App Partners: How to enable safety thresholds
text:
> Once you click into a district’s profile, you will see an alert that the district has major data changes that require your team’s review. You can click on this alert or on the 'Sync Status' tab to view the changes. >  
> If the changes look good - they’re expected, or won’t cause major issues - you can click the ‘Approve changes’ button. Once the changes are approved, Clever will process the latest data changes and update the API accordingly. > If you’re not sure if the changes are intentional or if the changes could cause major issues, you can use the ‘Email district’ link to reach out to the district’s team. If the approval button is greyed out, please reach out the district and ask they push another sync with Clever. The following message will show in when you attempt to click the greyed-out button if the data from the district is stale: "The district's data is out of date - please reach out to the district and have them re-sync with Clever."  
> Please note: While a district has the status of ‘Requires Review', no changes will be processed unless the district reverts changes or you approve them.

title: Sharing Permissions: Sharing staff with applications
heading_path: Sharing Permissions: Sharing staff with applications
text:
Staff must be shared explicitly by creating an additional sharing rule.

Follow the steps below if you’re using the [**Guided sharing view**](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001514) to share your staff members and [see a tutorial video here](https://clever-for-schools.wistia.com/medias/pwbjs3rpiy):

1. Navigate to [Clever Dashboard > Applications > My Applications](https://schools.clever.com/applications) and select the application
2. Under **Shared Data**, select **Edit Sharing****![Edit sharing](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000Hkkn&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl000001fmCz)**
3. Select **Add Another Rule****![Add another rule](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000Hkkn&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl000001fmMf)**
4. Select **Staff members need access** in the drop-down menu 
 ![Drop-down menu of staff members need access](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000Hkkn&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000GGqeC)
5. Select the desired staff utilizing the filters provided. You can select staff based on their email, schools administered, staff ID, or title.
6. Select which school-association information you would like to share. Please note that this does not share additional students, teachers, or sections. This selection only determines which school-associations are available to the application for the shared staff members.

If you would like to sync the staff to the application without a school association, select **no associated schools. 
 ![Screenshot of "also share no associated schools"](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000Hkkn&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000GHYqT)**If you would like to sync the staff to the application with specific school associations, select **these associated schools** and choose the desired schools.

text:
If you would like to sync the staff to the application with all their synced school associations included, select **all associated schools.**
7. Select **Done Editing**
8. Select **Save Sharing Rules**
Follow the steps below if you’re using the **Standard sharing view** to share your staff members and [see a tutorial video here](https://clever-for-schools.wistia.com/medias/idcglw53d5):

section: Sharing a user that has both a teacher and a staff account
text:
Users can have both a teacher and a staff account in Clever. This can get tricky if you want to specify which, or if both, accounts are shared with a particular application. If you need to ensure a specific staff user account is shared, we recommend adding **a staff sharing rule** that specifies the user’s Staff ID or email.

![Screenshot of sharing rule based on staff ID](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000Hkkn&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000GHdzp)

To confirm if a specific account type (teacher or staff) is shared with an application, use the [Troubleshoot sharing tool](https://schools.clever.com/troubleshoot-sharing) and pay specific attention to which user account you select.

![Troubleshoot sharing tool](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000Hkkn&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000GHeO1)

*Be sure to select the account type (teacher or staff) that you want to ensure is shared with a particular application.*

---

title: Sharing Permissions: Sharing staff with applications
heading_path: Sharing Permissions: Sharing staff with applications
text:
**How can I confirm if a staff user is shared with an application?**

- Use the [Troubleshoot sharing tool](https://schools.clever.com/troubleshoot-sharing) and input the user’s name. If there is a chance the user has both a teacher and a staff account, be sure that you select the staff account.

**What types of sharing do I need to add staff users to?**

- Whether you share by district, share by school, or set sharing rules, you’ll need to check a box, or create a specific rule to share staff users.

**Can I share both a teacher and staff account for a single user with an application?**

- Yes! Clever allows you to share both teacher and staff accounts with applications, however, how the application handles that data may vary. For example, some applications can only sync one account type.

**What permissions will my staff user have in their applications?**

- This varies based on application. The Clever team can not advise what specific permissions or roles a staff user will have within a learning application. Please reach out to the application team for more information.

> Overview
> As a School Tech Lead, you have numerous troubleshooting tools at your disposal! These tools will help you locate student, teacher, section, and school records in Clever to allow you to support users with login issues. > Clever Tip: The search bar on your Clever Dashboard is a great tool that allows you to easily search for teachers, students, sections, and your school site for troubleshooting missing or incorrect data. Incorrect data can prevent a user from logging in to Clever and may result in incorrect data within their scoped applications. >  
>  
> Reset student and teacher passwords
>   If your district uses Log in with Clever or a Third-Party account such as Active Directory, Entra ID, or Google as your login method, you may be able to reset student and teacher passwords. > Please note: This feature will only work if your district uses Log in with Clever or a Third-Party account (Active Directory, Entra ID, or Google) as a login method to Clever and your district admin has enabled the password reset feature. >  
> Resetting student and teacher Clever passwords:
> Log in to your Clever Portal, and from your Dashboard, search for the user. Click Support Tools , then Change password in the top right-hand side of their profile. Input new password and select Save. >  
>   Troubleshoot Login tool
>  
> Troubleshoot Login is the perfect tool for quickly identifying root cause issues of login errors and missing icons in the portal. Often, your teachers and students may come to you with questions about logging in to Clever or applications.

title: For School Tech Leads: Student & teacher login errors, password resets

text:

> Navigate to the Troubleshoot Login tool. Select a user using  Clever ID, SIS ID, Name, or Email,  and select the name of the application they having problems accessing. The tool will complete a root cause analysis of the issue. Review of the summary of checks   Review the Recommended Action This will indicate  who will need to take action to resolve the issue. There are 3 possible options: District, App, or Clever. Review the Issue Details shown underneath the Recommended action. This will provide information on how to address any issues that have been flagged by the tool. To make communication simple, we have provided a  Copy issue description function to allow you to easily include this information in your communication with the district, app, or Clever. Additionally, the tool will highlight related Help Center articles that can be leveraged to assist with resolving the issues detected. Please note, there may be multiple issues that will need to be addressed to restore the login for a user. >

>   View a teacher’s Clever Portal
>  
> Please note:  You will only have access to this feature if it has been enabled by your district admin

text:
Title

For Clever Admins: Apps - App invites

URL Name

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360045084272?language=en_US#overview) 
2. [Viewing app invites](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360045084272?language=en_US#view) 
3. [Accepting app invites](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360045084272?language=en_US#accept) 
4. [Declining app invites](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360045084272?language=en_US#decline)

Did you know you can save time setting up applications for your schools by accepting app invitations? If you already have an established relationship with an app partner, and it's also available on Clever, you may receive an invitation from the app partner to roster via Clever in your dashboard.

By accepting the invitation, you can set up automated rostering and students can have a seamless learning experience through Clever.

---

When sent an invitation, the district account owner will receive an email with the invitation request.

The email will have the subject "Set Up {App Name}". It will provide useful information such as the name of the app, a custom message from the app, and a link to accept the invitation.

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl0000001PHJ&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000288Nr)

Additionally, you will also receive the invite in your [Clever Dashboard](https://schools.clever.com/). You can find the invite by navigating to your dashboard and clicking **View invite** in the Applications tab.

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl0000001PHJ&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000288Nw)

---

If you choose to accept an app invite, you can do so by clicking **Accept Your Invitation** in the email (which will redirect you to the invite in Clever) or the **Accept** on the application invite in the Clever Dashboard.

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl0000001PHJ&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000288O1)

Once you accept the invite, you can begin the setup process and start sharing data with the app. You can learn more about our setup process in our article about [Sharing Permissions](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360043482712).

---

title: For Clever Admins: Apps - App invites
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Apps - App invites
text:
If you would like to decline an app invite, you can do so by clicking the **Decline** button on the application invite in Clever.

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl0000001PHJ&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000288O6)

When you decline the invite, you'll see a brief survey from Clever. We request a short note as to why you are declining the app invite, which is only visible to Clever. You can also choose to send a message to the application explaining why you declined the invite.

Once you've declined the invite, the app will disappear from your Dashboard. If the application has questions about your decision to decline the invite, they'll be provided with the email for your district contact.

If an app invite is declined in error, contact Clever Support with the name of the district and application. Our team can restore the invite so the district may accept.

title: PowerSchool v12+: Student Contacts
text:
> Note: Title PowerSchool v12+: Student Contacts URL Name 360045111611 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Enabling Access to Data Export Manager (DEM) 3. Enabling Page-Level Permissions to Data Export Manager (DEM) 4. Default Student Contact Fields for v12+
>  
> Overview
> PowerSchool version 12+ now supports unlimited student contacts. These contacts no longer live on the Students table in Direct Data Export. As a result, Clever requires additional permissions to sync these contacts. > Please note: Enabling the sync with PowerSchool v12 contacts will result in previously added student contacts being deleted from your Clever account. Additionally, if the district's data sync is on pause, new student contacts will not be reflected in your District Dashboard until a successful sync occurs after the pause ends. >  
> Process
> Enable access to Data Export Manager (DEM) for the Clever PowerSchool account. Enable page-level permissions to Data Export Manager (DEM). Contact Clever Support to enable the new contacts export for your account. >  
> Enabling Access to Data Export Manager (DEM)
> From the main menu, click  System on the left sidebar Under Security, click Users by Group Select the Clever access account from the list of users Go to the Admin Access and Roles tab Click the edit button (pencil icon) for the role for District Office (Home School) Enable Data Export Manager Access for this role by choosing  Data Export Manager/Export/Edit Access (No Group Defined) Click  Submit
>  
> Enabling Page-Level Permissions to Data Export Manager (DEM)
> 1. Navigate to  System > Security > Access to Page Permissions  (/admin/security/changepageaccesspriv.html). Set  Turn modify permissions = On  and click  Submit 
>

heading_path: For Clever Admins: Zoom - transitioning from Upgraded to Basic accounts
text:
If your district participated in the free Zoom upgrade during school closures, the district Zoom account will revert to Zoom Basic on Wednesday, July 1, 2020 if your district does not upgrade to a Business or Education account. If your account reverts to Zoom Basic on Wednesday, your teachers will encounter two primary changes: **SAML SSO through Clever will no longer work, as Zoom provides SAML SSO only to premium customers, and meeting length will be capped at 40 minutes.**

If you plan to use Zoom through its Basic service after July 1st, we recommend that you:

1. Communicate the above changes to teachers for awareness.
2. Let teachers know they can set a password to log in manually to their account with their email address by using the directions below.
3. Remove the SSO app from teacher dashboards by clicking “disconnect app” on the Zoom page in your Clever dashboard. This will prevent teachers from becoming confused if they attempt to SSO into Zoom after July 1st and receive an error message

section: For teachers: adding a password login for Zoom
text:
If you have previously logged in SSO via Clever, on [**Profile**](https://zoom.us/profile), you will see icons indicating SSO, but no icon for email.

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl00000019CX&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000286Mm)

Unless restricted by your Account owner, you can easily add an email and password login for the same account.

1. Sign out of your Zoom existing account.
2. Go to [**zoom.us/signup**](https://zoom.us/signup)
3. Enter your school-provided email address that matches your email in Clever.
4. Click **Sign Up**.
5. You will receive an email with Sign Up instructions. Click to **Activate Account.**
6. Enter your desired password twice. 
 **Note**: Make sure your password meets the [requirements](https://support.zoom.us/hc/s/articles/115005166483).
7. Click **Continue**.
8. You can enter in email addresses of contacts to invite or choose **Skip this Step.**
9. Click**Go to My Account.**
10. This will take you to **My Profile** of the existing Zoom account. It should now show the SSO icon that it showed previously, as well as an email icon to indicate that you can log in with email address and password.

title: For Teachers: Messages & Announcements
text:
> Tip: Title For Teachers: Messages & Announcements URL Name 360045714731 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Enabling Messages 3. Sending a message 4. Deleting a message 4. The student experience 5. Message notifications 4. Viewing responses from an announcement 6. FAQs
> Overview
> Please note: Clever will be discontinuing Clever Messaging by December 31st, 2025 . Teachers will still be able to make announcements. This will allow our teams to focus on features that enhance our identity platform offerings including new and improved free tools like Substitute Access , Clever Badges , and coming soon, a more streamlined iOS app for students. >  
> Clever offers two ways for teachers to communicate with students:  Messages and Announcements . Messages allow direct one-on-one conversations, while Announcements are ideal for reaching all students in a class or across multiple classes. Teachers can manage both features from their Clever Portal. >  
> Enabling Messages
> To begin, teachers will navigate to the Messages button in the top right-hand corner of their Portal and select Get started . >  
> Teachers can customize how their accounts are displayed to students. They can change the  display name and profile picture. >  
>    
>  
> Sending a message
>  
>  Clever Tip: Press the "shift + return" keys to move to the next line without sending the message! >  
> Individual message
>  
> To send an individual message to a student, follow the steps below:
> To begin, navigate to your Clever Portal. > Click the Messages button in the top right-hand corner. > Select the student you want to message by entering the student’s name in the search bar or choosing their name from the list on the left-hand side. > Type your message in the text box of the chat. > Click  Send to send your message. >  
>  
> Announcement to one class
>  
> To send an announcement to one class, follow the steps below:
> Navigate to your Clever Portal .

title: For Teachers: Messages & Announcements
text:
> Click the Messages button  in the top right-hand corner. > Click the plus icon to the right of Announcement to create your  "Announcement Channel."
> Select the class you'd like to create a channel for. > Enter a name. > Select or upload an icon that will be associated with your channel. > Click Create . > Type your message in the text box of the chat. > Click  Send to send your message. >  
> Announcement to all students
> To send an announcement to all students, follow the steps below:
> Navigate to your Clever Portal. > Click the Messages button in the top right-hand corner. > Select the All classes option and click on the class that has your name followed by "Students." Make sure that the highlighted text under your page name shows All students. > Type your message in the text box of the chat. > Click Send to send your message. >  
> Deleting a message
> If you need to delete a message, hover over the message you want to delete and select the Delete button that appears (note: deletion is permanent and cannot be undone). This will prevent the message from being seen by you and your students. However, if a student has replied, you will still see that reply. >  
> The student experience
> Learn more about the student experience here. > Message notifications
> Teachers can customize their Messages settings to allow for sound and browser notifications. When you receive a message from a student you can choose to be notified by a sound, through your browser, or both! > Browser notifications
> By default, browser notifications will be set to 'off'; however, you can update this at any time! > If you'd like to enable browser notifications, go to 'Settings" and toggle the 'Browser notifications' button to 'on'. >  
> When enabling browser notifications in Chrome, a browser pop-up window will open asking if you'd like to allow these notifications. Select  Allow for this site .

title: For Teachers: Messages & Announcements
text:
>  
>  
> Block notifications
> If you choose to block notifications via the pop-up window, the toggle will become disabled. To enable browser notifications in the future, you will need to go to your browser preferences and enable them from there. (See these resources for Chrome , Firefox , Safari , and Edge ). When you're done, select Save and your settings will be updated! >  
>  
> Sound notifications
> By default, sound notifications are enabled. To adjust sound notifications, navigate to Settings  >   Sound Notifications. Green = enabled, Grey = disabled. > Click  Save. >  
> Email notifications
> If a message is unread after three hours, Clever will send a notification email with a link to the unread message. Notifications for unread messages can be disabled by clicking on the profile button in the right corner of the Clever Portal and selecting Change Email Preference . Click the toggle   for Clever Messages and select Save Preferences. >  
>  
> Turning messages on/off
> You can turn Messages on or off at any time. > Click Settings next to your name Click Turn off Click Save  
>  
> If a student tries to send you a message while your Messages are turned off, they'll be notified and won't be able to send you a message until you have turned Messages back on. > ​​​​​​​
> Viewing responses from an announcement
> To view and respond to the student, click on the student’s name. Teachers will see the student replies paired with the corresponding announcement. By clicking the Show more link, you can expand to see the entire announcement. >  
>  
> To collapse the message, select the Show less option. To respond to the student and continue the conversation, simply reply to their response in the direct message thread and click Send . >  
>  
> Frequently Asked Questions (FAQS)
> How can I confirm a message has been received? > When a message has been viewed by the recipient, the word Read will appear underneath the message.

title: For Teachers: Messages & Announcements
text:
>  
> Can I send a message to multiple students at once? > You can send messages to one student, or an entire class via Announcements. >  
> Who has access to my message history? > Clever Admins for your school can access message transcripts. Clever Admins for your school can also opt into a full deletion of messaging data on an annual basis. > Can messages be deleted or edited? > Yes! Messages can be deleted by hovering over the message and selecting  Delete. > ​​​​​​​
> ​​​​​​​What happens to messages when the school year rolls over? > When the new school year starts, if you no longer have classes with the previous year's students, you will not be able to message those students and will no longer have access to their message history. > How do I view unread messages? > Unread messages will remain in bold on the left-hand side, with a blue marker signifying that they are unread. When you click an unread message, your chat thread with the recipient will open and you can read the message. Once read, the red notification number at the top of the screen will decrease to the total number of unread messages that remain. > Is there a character limit for messages or announcements? > Messages are limited to 8,000 characters. > How does Clever promote respectful messaging? > If a student sends a message that contains a swear word, a dialogue will display that prompts the student to confirm they would like to send their message. They can choose to select Don't send and edit their message or to select Send and the message will be delivered to their teacher. > At this time, Clever cannot detect swear words that appear within another word or if appended by a punctuation mark. Example: " word!"
> Why does a message have an alphanumeric string instead of a name? > If a student's name is an alphanumeric string instead of their actual name, it is because the student has been unenrolled from your class or they have left the district.

We provide access to these historical messages as they may have content that is of value to teachers. >    
> Are there any limitations to teacher messages due to the number of overall students enrolled in the teacher's sections? > Yes, teachers with greater than 2000 student associations will not have access to Clever Messages. > Can students message one another using Clever Messages? > No, Clever Messages was specifically designed for student communications with teachers. Students do not have the ability to send messages to other students. > Related articles: 
> Messaging - Sending Attachments For Students: Messages

Title

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360045770232?language=en_US#h_b1931707-7878-4e19-8cb9-6b1d21597554) 
2. [Accept or decline a sharing recommendation](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360045770232?language=en_US#h_f723888c-6033-4cba-b3fa-f30388209a1b)

Recommended sharing settings allow an application to communicate sharing best practices directly to your district or school in the dashboard. Even if you have already configured your sharing permissions with an application, they can recommend an update to these settings. You then have the option to accept or decline the application’s recommended sharing settings directly in your Clever Dashboard.

---

title: Sharing Permissions: App-recommended sharing permissions
heading_path: Accept or decline a sharing recommendation:
section: Accept or decline a sharing recommendation:
text:
If one of your connected applications has recommended an update to your sharing rules, you’ll receive an email notification.

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000GQD3&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000003BOTl)

Additionally, you will see the status of **Sharing requested** under Applications in your dashboard, as well as on the Overview page of the application.

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000GQD3&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000003BOU0)

To review the application’s recommended update to your sharing rules, select **Click here** on the profile page of the application or **View sharing request** on the Applications page. Selecting either of these will open up a popup window displaying the recommended update.

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000GQD3&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000003BOUZ)

To accept the update to your sharing rules, select **Share.**

IMPORTANT If you select **Share,** the application’s recommended sharing settings will replace any current sharing rules that your district has configured for this application.

If you would not like to update your sharing rules at this time, select **Decline**and your sharing settings for the application will remain the same.

If you are not sure about the application’s reasoning behind the recommended sharing rules, please reach out to the application’s team directly as they’ll be best able to work through with you what should be shared and make any necessary adjustments to their recommendation.

text:
> Warning: Title For App Partners: Sending custom sharing recommendations to districts URL Name 360045770492 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. What is a sharing recommendation? 3. How to recommend custom record sharing 4. Constructing custom record recommendations 5. Tips and best practices 6. Editing or deleting a sharing recommendation
>  
> Overview
> By configuring custom sharing recommendations for districts, applications can suggest, as closely as possible, the correct users and rosters you need to set up your district customers. > When choosing to “share custom records”, once the recommendations have been accepted by the district, they will only share the rostering information that meets the specific criteria you've set. Please make sure all the data you need is included in the recommendation! > The data shared with the application via sharing rules updates based on the data synced to Clever by the district. > What is a sharing recommendation? > A sharing recommendation is a request for specific data that you can send to a district to ensure only the data you want to receive is being shared. A district administrator can review the recommendation and immediately accept (or decline) the sharing update. > For example, a sharing recommendation might include:
> All the math classes in a particular school The math classes for grades 3-6 in the district, except for in two schools One specific teacher’s 11th-grade homeroom class
> Think of a custom recommendation as a sentence:
> "Share all sections where <a field in Clever> <is/is not/contains/does not contain> <value>”
> How to recommend custom record sharing
> To request a sharing update for a district, go to the district’s profile page in your dashboard and use the ‘Request sharing’ button in the upper right. Alternatively, you can navigate to the Sharing tab from the district profile and select ‘Edit’.

title: For App Partners: Sending custom sharing recommendations to districts
heading_path: For App Partners: Sending custom sharing recommendations to districts
section: For App Partners: Sending custom sharing recommendations to districts
text:
>  
> Once you select 'Edit' to recommend sharing for a specific district, select 'Share custom records' to configure specific data sharing rules. >  
> For other sharing types, see our guide to sending sharing recommendations for specific districts . >  
> Constructing custom record recommendations
> Our interface allows you to create recommendations with the same structure as outlined in the ' What is a sharing recommendation? ' section above (e.g. share all sections where <a field in Clever> <is/is not/contains> <value>). > There are a number of 'Fields' that applications can request to either include or exclude data with the sharing recommendation. Fields include teachers, sections, students, and school admins (staff) We recommend adding non-school constraints first as the larger the district, the longer the school list can be! The modifiers available are:
> Is Is not Is one of Is not one of Contains text Does not contain text
>  
> Tips and best practices
> You can include and/or exclude subsets of data. Data can be excluded by selecting the 'is not one of' modifier. For values, you can either type in any value you’d like, or search to find and click on the value you want. Some values will not be available in a dropdown as the district has not authorized an application to see them. > Warning: if you are typing an option in a text field, you must click 'Add: [value]’ or else the value will not be saved
> If you’d like to filter down a rule further, you can select the ‘+ADD' option to add new criteria. This will act as an 'and' statement, rather than an 'or' statement. > Example Rule with Filters: Share all sections that are located at Pineapple Elementary School AND their section grade level is 1 AND the section name must contain the text 'homeroom'. > If you recommend sharing specific students, you will also have the option to select which of these students' subjects or courses you'd like to receive. You can even choose to share no sections at all!

title: For App Partners: Sending custom sharing recommendations to districts
heading_path: For App Partners: Sending custom sharing recommendations to districts
section: For App Partners: Sending custom sharing recommendations to districts
text:
If sections are shared, you will also receive the sections' associated teacher(s). > Once you have finished creating your first rule, you can click “Add Rule” to add more sharing recommendations. > When you have multiple rules, the two rules don’t interact with each other. This means if you want to build off the existing rule, you'll want to add a filter to the rule itself, rather than create a new rule entirely. If a rule is a sentence, having multiple rules is a paragraph: "Share all sections where grade is one of 6, 7, 8.” Also , "Match all staff where school is Pineapple Elementary.”  
> We highly recommend adding a message so that the district administrator can easily understand the request being made
> Once you have finished creating the rules and associated filters, select ‘Next', add a message, and then 'Save' to send the recommendation to the district. You can only have one open sharing recommendation for a specific district at a time. > Please note:  A district administrator must accept your sharing recommendation in order for their sharing to be updated. They may also choose to decline this recommendation. If a district has accepted a recommendation, they can still edit their sharing settings at any time. >  
> Editing or deleting a sharing recommendation
> If you’d like to change or remove a sharing recommendation, you can do so by going to the district’s page and going to the Sharing tab. > If you have any questions about setting up your sharing recommendations or what you are requesting from connected districts, please reach out to Clever Support !

title: Setup Directions
text:
> Note: Title Clever + Canvas Setup Guide URL Name 360045827552 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Clever SSO via SAML 3. Clever SSO + Rostering
> Overview
> Clever has partnered with Canvas to create a seamless way to provide account creation, as well as Single Sign-On (SSO) access for users. There are two options for enabling SSO to Canvas from Clever:  
> Clever SSO via SAML  Canvas SSO + rostering
> If you are already using Kimono/grade passback and only want to use Clever for SSO, you can do so by using the first option, Clever SSO via SAML . Choosing this method will add a new SSO pathway to access Canvas from Clever while preserving your current rostering and grade passback setup. If your district intends to use Clever for rostering and single sign-on purposes using the Canvas SSO + Rostering application , please note the following cautions: 
> Your district will be prevented from using Kimono, Canvas’ grade passback tool. Your district's users will only be able to log in to Canvas through Clever. Users will no longer be able to log in to Canvas directly without being redirected to Clever to facilitate the login. (i.e. no hybrid logins). > For directions on how to log in to Clever from Canvas , please see the Help Center article  Single Sign-On (SSO): "Log in with Canvas"
> Setup Directions
> Clever SSO via SAML
> 1. Add the Canvas SSO (SAML) application to your Clever Dashboard. > a. From the left menu bar, navigate to Applications > Add Applications  and request the Canvas app . Select the option that says SSO (SAML). > d. Request the app and set your data sharing permissions. > 2. Configure Clever SSO via SAML for Canvas in your Clever Dashboard. > a. In your Clever Dashboard, click the Canvas app, click on  Settings , and scroll to SAML Details . Click Edit . b. Set your district's Canvas domain (e.g. clever.instructure.com ). Do not include https:// or any other value after .com . c.

title: Setup Directions
text:
(Optional) If you would like to match users on a field other than email address, you can configure the matching attributes on a per-user basis from the settings page. d. Copy the Metadata URL which you’ll enter in your Canvas admin account. > 3. Complete configuration in your Canvas administrator account. > a. Log in to your Canvas administrator account and navigate to Admin > Authentication. Click  on the   Choose an Authentication   drop-down, then select SAML. Do not choose Clever. b. Paste the metadata URL you copied from Clever in the  IdP Metadata URI   field. c. Optional: Add your portal URL in the “Log Out URL” field. d. Click Save . e. The page will reload and automatically fill the SAML values. f. Test the setup by opening a new incognito window. Go to  https://<YOURDOMAIN>.instructure.com/login/saml . You should be prompted to enter your Clever SSO credentials. You will then be logged in and redirected to Canvas. > Please note:  Canvas will not automatically roster user accounts from successful SSO logins. Your district needs to work directly with Canvas to roster users through SIS or manual import options. > Clever SSO + Rostering
> To set up SSO for Canvas, please follow the directions below:  
> Email your Canvas contact and let them know you intend to use SSO via Clever so Canvas can enable this on their side. Navigate to Applications > Add Applications and request the Canvas app . Select the option that says SSO, Rostering . Share Canvas with all intended users. In Canvas, navigate to Admin > Authentication , then click Add an identity provider to this account  and add Clever. There, you can enter your Clever District ID, choose a Login Attribute, and click Save. Your district ID can be found in the top-left of the Data Browser . Confirm that users can log in to your district's instance URL . Please navigate to https://<your domain>. instructure.com/login/clever and confirm that a student and teacher can log in to Canvas using Clever.

Once these two steps are completed, reach out to Clever Support , and we can able to enable the Canvas icon on your Clever portal. > If you have any questions about setting up Clever SSO, please contact Clever Support. We are happy to help!

User is not logged in after clicking on the application icon in the Clever Portal  4. Using the Access Portal As feature to troubleshoot
>  
> Clever Tip: To troubleshoot problems logging in to applications, we highly recommend using the  Troubleshoot Login tool . More information on this resource can be found here . > Overview
> This article explains how to troubleshoot common application issues in the Clever Portal. It outlines steps to resolve missing applications, login failures, and how to use the "Access Portal As" feature. You'll also learn how to gather error messages and escalate issues to Clever or the application's support team. >  
> Application is missing from the Clever Portal
> If a user does not see an application in the Clever Portal, there are a few things you can check:   
> Does the application support SSO? > Does the application support SSO for this user type? > Is the user successfully shared with the application? More information on constructing sharing rules can be found here . > If sharing by district: confirm the user is active in Clever. If sharing by school: confirm the user is associated with the school or is associated with at least one section  at the shared school. If sharing by rules: confirm the user meets all criteria for at least one of the sharing rules. The most common criteria that result in users not being shared are not meeting the requirements for enrolled sections. Ensure that they are enrolled in a section that meets the grade level, subject, course, etc. that is being shared with the application. You can review the Clever profile for a user, including associated sections, by using the search feature, located at the top of your Clever Dashboard. > Is the user successfully shared with the application?

title: Troubleshooting: Logging in to applications
text:
Use the Troubleshoot Sharing tool to confirm. More information on this resource can be found here . Check to make sure that the application hasn't been hidden from users by a Clever Admin. You can find more information here . Check to make sure that the application has not placed any filters on your application. You can learn more about how to request a change to an app filter here . >  
> User is not logged in after clicking on the application icon in the Clever Portal  
> If a user clicks on an app icon in their Clever Portal and receives an error from the application's website page , please contact the application's support team for assistance. > If the user clicks on the app icon and receives an error that is a Clever website , please contact Clever's support team with the error message. > Please note: If the user has recently changed schools or classes, or was recently synced to Clever, please allow 24 hours for their connected applications to be updated so they can log in. > Clever Tip: If you are seeing an error at a web URL that is not a Clever address, it will be necessary to contact the application to fix the issue. Please reach out to the application's support team to investigate further! > Using the Access Portal As  feature to troubleshoot
> Using the Access Portal As feature in your Clever Dashboard is a great way to troubleshoot and support teachers, students, and Portal-only staff with their technical issues. > Clever makes it easy for admins to access the Clever Portal as an individual user, allowing them to see precisely what they see. When troubleshooting, this can help diagnose an issue, retrieve an error code or message, or gain visibility into what might be confusing. If you encounter an error code within a user's application account, you can capture an image of it and share it directly with the application's team to learn more.

title: Troubleshooting: Logging in to applications
text: You should only use the Access Portal As feature for viewing purposes, and you should never edit anything as another user. Please note that using the Access Portal As feature won’t inform you whether a user can log into their Clever account successfully. To troubleshoot Clever logins, please see this article . You can utilize the Access Portal As feature when on a user’s profile page by clicking on the Support Tools button in the upper right corner and selecting Access Portal as the user. You will then be taken to a screen to Start Portal session , which will take you to the user's Portal. For security purposes,  if you’re accessing an admin or staff Portal, they’ll be sent a notification email letting them know their Portal has been accessed. > Be sure to log out of the user's Portal once you are done by clicking  End Portal session in the upper right corner.

title: For Clever Admins: Teacher Messages
text:
> Tip: Title For Clever Admins: Teacher Messages URL Name 360045905951 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. What is the teacher's experience? 3. What is the student experience? 4. Turning Messaging on or off 5. Accessing Messages 6. Needing details about specific Messages 7. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
> Overview
> Please note: Clever will be discontinuing Clever Messaging by December 31st, 2025 . This will allow our teams to focus on features that enhance our identity platform offerings including new free tools like Substitute Access , role-based access control , and access logs . >  
> With Messages, Teachers can communicate with students directly from the Clever Portal! From the Messages tab, teachers can search for a student and send them a message. From the student's Messages page, any of their teachers who have enabled Messages will be listed and available to receive a chat. Clever Admins can disable Messages for the entire district at any time directly from the Dashboard. Teachers can also turn their Messages on or off at any time. >  
>  
> What is the teacher experience? > In the enhanced teacher portal, Messages can be accessed by clicking the  button in the top right-hand corner . > When a teacher uses Messages for the first time, they can customize how their account will be displayed to students. > Clever Tip: Teachers can change how their name is displayed and upload a custom picture or image by selecting the upload icon. >  
>  
> To begin a chat with a student, the teacher can simply type in the student's name in the search bar or select the student's name from the list on the left-hand side. >  
> Teachers can also filter their students by class. To do this :
> Click on the Classes drop-down menu to find the desired class. Once a class is selected, only students from that class will appear in the list of students below. >  
> To send a message, select Send or press the return key.

title: For Clever Admins: Teacher Messages
text:
>  
> Once the message has been sent, the student will receive a notification in their Portal letting them know they have a new message from their teacher. > When a student sends a message to a teacher, the teacher will receive a notification at the top of their Portal. > A numerical value will appear to display the total number of new or unread messages. >  
>  
> Once the teacher clicks on the Messages button,  they will be directed to the Messages page. > Unread messages will remain in bold on the left-hand side, with a blue marker signifying that they are unread. When the teacher clicks an unread message from a student, their chat thread with that student will open and they can read the message the student sent. As a result, the red notification number at the top of the screen will decrease to the total number of unread messages that remain. >  
>  
>  
> What is the student experience? > As long as one of their teachers has Messages turned on, students will see the Messages icon on their  Clever Portal. > When they receive a message from a teacher, they will be notified at the top of their Portal. >    
> From the Messages page, students can view new and previous messages from their teachers and send a reply to continue the conversation. > On the left-hand side, students will see all of their teachers who have Messages turned on. From there, they can start or continue a chat with any of these teachers. > Please note:   If a teacher has not turned their Messages on their name won't be listed. >  
> Turning Messages on or off
> District Admins now have the ability to turn off messages for the entire district or individual users directly from the Clever Dashboard. > Disabling messages for individual users
> To disable messages for an individual teacher or student:
> Type in the users' name in the search bar and click the user's name. Click  Support Tools > Disable Messaging . Click  Disable Messaging .

title: For Clever Admins: Teacher Messages
text:
Moving forward, the user won't see the Messaging option in their Clever Portal. >  
> Disabling messages for the entire district
> To disable messages from being sent or received for the entire district:
> Click Clever Dashboard > Portal > Portal settings > Communication . Once there, click District Messaging Setting and click the toggle under  Enable Portal Messaging . Click Disable. >    
> Teachers can turn messages on or off at any time for their account! > To disable messages from being sent or received, teachers will click  Settings next to their name. Once there, they can click Turn off and click Save . > A student will be notified when a teacher has turned off Messages and will not be able to chat with that teacher until they have turned Messages back on. > Teachers can turn Messages back on at any time from  Settings  to begin chatting again! >  
> Accessing Messages
> All Message history between a teacher and students/families will be saved for the length of the school year. Clever District Admins can access a teacher's message history by using the Clever search bar in the Clever Dashboard to locate the teacher. Then, select Support tools > Download Messaging transcript . The timestamp will be in UTC time zone (this is what the "Z" refers to). Please reference the following HC for more details: For District Admins: Downloading Messaging history. If the transcript is requested for a student, announcements are not included. If the report is requested for a teacher, announcements are included. >  
> Needing details about specific Messages
> If you need details about specific messages, specific IP addresses and timestamps they can also be accessed when you navigate to  Support tools > Download Messaging transcript . You can also filter the Login Logs by date and by the ID of the user whose account the messages originated from. You can then view the IP address associated with those logins. This is the only information about the logins that we can provide.

title: For Clever Admins: Teacher Messages
text:
>  
> Frequently Asked Questions (FAQS)
> How can a teacher confirm a message has been received? > When a message has been viewed by the recipient, the word   Read   will appear underneath the message. > Who has access to message history? > All message history will be saved until the end of the school year and can be requested from Clever by a Clever Admin by reaching out to Clever Support. > Can messages be deleted or edited? > Yes! Teachers can delete messages by hovering over the message(s) and selecting  Delete. > How can teachers view unread messages? > Unread messages will remain in bold on the left-hand side, with a blue marker signifying that they are unread. When you click an unread message, your chat thread with the recipient will open and you can read the message. Once read, the red notification number at the top of the screen will decrease to the total number of unread messages that remain. > How does Clever promote respectful messaging? > If a student sends a message that contains a swear word, a dialogue will display that prompts the student to confirm they would like to send their message. They can choose to select   Don't send   and edit their message or to select   Send   and the message will be delivered to their teacher. At this time, Clever cannot detect swear words that appear within another word or if appended by a punctuation mark. Example: " word!"
> Why does a message have an alphanumeric string instead of a name? > If a student's name is an alphanumeric string instead of their actual name, it is because the student has been unenrolled from your class or they have left the district. We provide access to these historical messages as they may have content that is of value to teachers. > Are there any limitations to teacher messages due to the number of overall students enrolled in the teacher's sections? > Yes, teachers with greater than 2000 student associations will not have access to Clever Messages.

> Can students message one another using Clever Messages? > No, Clever Messages was specifically designed for student communications with teachers. Students do not have the ability to send messages to other students.

title: For Teachers: Adding apps & resources
text:
> Note: Title For Teachers: Adding apps & resources URL Name 360045975172 Article Body This article contains directions for adding: 1. Overview 2. Library apps 3. District-provisioned apps 4. Links 5. PDFs 6. Missing an app? > Overview
> You can add various resources to your Teacher Page. This article will guide you through the process of adding these different types of resources available in Clever. > Library apps:
> The Clever Library is a resource hub for teachers to discover, learn about, and adopt new educational materials for their classrooms. You can add the resources in the Library to your individual Teacher Pages for easy access by students and teachers. If your district has enabled the Clever Library, you can follow the instructions in  this article to locate and install resources. >  
>    
> District-provisioned apps: 
> Adding applications provided by your district to your Teacher Page is a quick and easy process. Please follow these steps:
> Navigate to Pages > District page on the left-hand side of your Clever Portal. Click on the three vertical dots on any resource you want to add to your Teacher Portal and click Add to Teacher Page. > Please note: Resources that have a link icon    in the top right-hand corner of the resource indicate it is a hyperlink and not an application that supports single sign-on. The resource in the image below doesn't have the link icon, suggesting it's an application that will log you and your students in instantly from the Clever Portal. >  
>  
> A pop-up will display for you to select which Teacher Page you'd like to add the app to. Please note: If you are unable to locate a district-provisioned application, please reach out to your Clever admin to request that they share the application with you. Click Add. >  
> Links:
> Teachers typically add links as redirects to applications or resources that aren't district-provisioned or aren't integrated with Clever.

title: For Teachers: Adding apps & resources
text:
For these types of resources, the link might direct you and your students to the login page of a specific application, or a resource website. Single sign-on (SSO) isn't available for linked resources, and rostering data won't be synced by Clever; instead it must be updated manually within the resource as needed. Links are a great way to provide easy access to websites, videos, Google docs, and more! > Adding links to your Teacher Page is a quick and easy process! Please follow these steps:
> Navigate to Pages > My Teacher Pages. Select the  Add option at the top of your Teacher Page and select Link . A pop-up will display allowing you to paste the URL for the page this link should direct to which should always begin with https:// Enter a title to help your students locate the link. Choose the appropriate category for your link. Select one of the provided icons to represent your link, or upload your own icon! To upload your own icon, select Upload in order to search for the appropriate image from your desktop. Images must be in the .png file format, and less than 2MB. Click Add link . >  
>  
>  PDFs
> Uploading resources as PDFs is quick and easy on Clever! Simply follow these directions: 
> Navigate to Pages > My Teacher Pages Select the  Add option at the top of your Teacher Page and select PDF . Select the  File to be uploaded from your device. The max file size is 10MB. Enter the File Name to display to students Select the Category where you want the file to be displayed on your Teacher Page Select the desired Icon or upload your own! Once the file has been successfully uploaded to Clever (Cloud is Green), select Add PDF
>  
>  
> The file is now accessible to students on your Teacher Page! When the student clicks on the file, the PDF will open in their web browser (e.g. Google Chrome). They can download or print the PDF using the tools in the top-right corner: 
>  
>  
> Need help downloading your resource as a PDF to upload to Clever?

Directions for popular programs can be found below: 
> Google Docs File > Download > PDF Document (.pdf) Google Slides File > Download > PDF Document (.pdf) Microsoft Word File > Save as > File Format: PDF > Export Microsoft PowerPoint File > Save as > File Format: PDF > Save
>  
>  
> Missing an app? > If you or your student is missing a district-provided application from your Clever Portal,  please reach out to your district's support contact . Your district manages which teachers and students can access each learning application through Clever, so they will need to add the application to your student's Portal.

What is a Teacher Quickstart Guide
section: What is a Teacher Quickstart Guide
text:
Library applications can create a Quickstart guide on Clever to help teachers feel confident about setting up your application. This proven format generates a 10% increase in user engagement with your application.

The structure of this guide was developed in response to teacher feedback: *the biggest barrier to using an app is finding the time and energy to get it set up.*

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000CKJ7&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000285gv)

Once your Quickstart Guide is published in Clever, your app detail page will show a link that teachers can access anytime, and any teacher that installs your app from the Library will be notified and nudged to use your guide if they have not yet logged in and used your application. Sometimes, teachers just need a reminder and easy steps - and Clever is here to help with that!

Teachers can immediately launch your application from the Quickstart Guide.

- Log in to Clever
- Navigate to Library > Teacher Quickstart Guide in your left hand navigation menu
- To begin, first input *Account Syncing* information. The answer is **yes** only if your application requires teachers to take an additional action after Clever sends your app the rostering data. Example actions:
 - Teacher is required to click a button to ‘sync’  their class from Clever.
 - Teacher is required to upload or input their classes into the application
- Fill out the following *How to use* steps. Your application must fill out a minimum of 1 step, and can fill out a max of 3 steps. Note that there is a character limit per step to improve readability for teachers.

A successful Quickstart Guide is one that motivates teachers to launch the application and take the simple steps involved in setup. A less successful guide might contain accurate *Getting Started* content, but may ultimately feel too complex for teachers to launch at that moment.

Tips:

1. Avoid linking to your website’s help center articles instead of writing the essential content within Clever
2. If you’re uploading screenshots for each step, indicate which button(s)/sections teachers need to engage with, using arrows, callout boxes, etc.

title: For App Partners: Recommending sharing for specific districts
heading_path: For App Partners: Recommending sharing for specific districts
text:
Smarter data sharing allows you to recommend sharing settings to districts that are connected with your app. You can send updated recommendations even after districts have enabled data sharing with you. If you do not set specific recommended sharing rules for the specific district, the district will receive your [global sharing recommendation](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360043113752).

When you send a sharing recommendation to a district, they can preview the sharing settings and choose to accept or decline the sharing update. **If a district accepts your recommendation, the recommended sharing settings will replace any current sharing rules that the district has configured for your application.** After accepting, the district can still update its sharing settings at any time.

This article covers how to send sharing recommendations to a district. To view the district experience, see our district admin guide for [sharing recommendations](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/203115007?language=en_US).

title: For App Partners: Recommending sharing for specific districts

How to set recommended sharing for a district
section: How to set recommended sharing for a district
text:
To request a sharing update from a district, go to the district’s profile page in your dashboard and use the ‘Request sharing’ button in the upper right. Alternatively, you can navigate to the 'Sharing' tab from the district profile and select ‘Edit’.

![Cursor_and_HC_artilces_-_Google_Slides-7.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl00000008X3&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000003BO3Y)

This will open a setup guide that will walk you through the following steps to recommend sharing rules for a district:

1. Choosing a sharing type:

- You can recommend that districts:
- Share all records in the district
- Share all records in specific schools
- Share custom records
- You can also
- Edit an existing recommendation if you’ve already sent one to the district
- Import the district’s current sharing setting and recommend changes

![Recommended sharing settings screen](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl00000008X3&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000004YOQG)

2. Setting customized recommendations

- If you choose to recommend sharing all records in the district, you’ll skip this step.
- If you select ‘Share all records in specific schools’, you can select which schools should be shared.

![Cursor_and_HC_artilces_-_Google_Slides-9.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl00000008X3&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000003BO3i)

- If you select ‘Share custom records’, you can configure custom sharing rules for the district. For an in-depth guide to configuring sharing rules, see [this guide](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360045770492).

![Cursor_and_HC_artilces_-_Google_Slides-10.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl00000008X3&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000003BO4b)

3. Preview and save

- On this step, preview the sharing settings you configured in the earlier steps of the guide.
- Add a message for the district that will appear in their dashboard when they review your recommended sharing settings.

Once you save your sharing recommendation, the district will receive a notification via email as well as within the Clever Dashboard. To view the district experience, you can reference [this district-facing article](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360045770232).

The **Troubleshoot user login** tool is the perfect utility for quickly identifying root cause issues of login errors and missing icons in the portal. You can find the tool in two places:

title: Troubleshooting: Troubleshoot Login tool
text:
1. Navigate to the [Clever Dashboard > Support tools > Troubleshoot login](https://schools.clever.com/troubleshoot-login) tool.

2. Select a user using **Clever ID, SIS ID, Name, or Email**and selecting the **name of the application** they having problems accessing.  
![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000K6HN&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028E2g) 
The tool will complete a root cause analysis of the issue

3. Review of the **Test summary** 
![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000K6HN&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028E2l)

4. Review the **Recommended Action** 
This will indicate *who* will need to take action to resolve the issue. There are 3 possible options: District, App, or Clever 
![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000K6HN&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028E2q)

5. Review the **Issue Details** shown underneath the Recommended Action. This will provide information on how to address any issues that have been flagged by the tool.

To simplify communication, we have provided a **Copy issue description** function to allow you to easily include this information in your communication with the district, app, or Clever.

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000K6HN&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028E30)

Additionally, the tool will highlight related Help Center articles that can be leveraged to assist with resolving the issues detected.

Please note, there may be multiple issues that will need to be addressed to restore the login for a user.
