For more information on result types, error messages, and how to resolve issue, please see [this article.](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360051319711)

---

**Which apps display in the app dropdown?**

- The application dropdown will only display applications that have been added to the district's Clever account. If an application does not display, this means the application has not been added to the district's Clever account.

**Will Library apps appear in the Troubleshoot Login tool?**

- Yes. Applications installed by teachers through Clever Library will display in the Troubleshoot Login tool

title: Clever + Schoology Setup Guide
text:
Districts can easily set up single sign-on (SSO) for Schoology, providing a seamless login experience for every user.

There are two options for enabling SSO to Schoology from Clever:

1. Clever SSO via SAML (recommended)
2. Clever SSO via Saved Passwords

Important notes about Clever SSO via SAML:

**Login pathways** 
If you choose Clever as your SAML Identity Provider (IDP) for Schoology, users will not be able to use another third-party IDP (e.g. Google, ADFS) to log into Schoology. Users can continue to log in to Schoology via app.schoology.com with their Schoology-managed credentials. If your district uses another third-party IDP to log into Schoology and would like to retain that login path, please see our [Clever SSO via Saved Passwords setup guide](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360046282971?language=en_US#h_01EGHCTYFTM83HXFQ0B0WK3F0Z).

**iOS - Login flow** 
All authentication methods, including Clever Badges, are compatible with both iOS login flows.

- **Log in directly via the Schoology app.** 
 If you click the app and search for your district, you’ll be redirected to the Clever login flow. Once you log in, you’ll be redirected to the *Schoology app.*
- **Log in via the Clever app (or at <https://clever.com>****in a web browser).** 
 The user will log in to Clever and click on the Schoology icon. The user will be logged in to Schoology *in the web browser*.

The first step is to ensure your district users have accounts in Schoology. Please work with Schoology to ensure Schoology accounts are created *prior* to setting up SSO via SAML in Clever. Clever does not have a rostering integration with Schoology

title: Clever + Schoology Setup Guide
text:
1. Log into your Clever Dashboard and add the Schoology application via this link: <https://schools.clever.com/applications/add/saml-schoology>
2. Share the users that need SSO access to Schoology.
3. In your Clever Dashboard, click the Schoology app, click on **Settings,** and scroll to **SAML Details.** Click **Edit.**
4. Enter your Schoology domain (e.g. [clever.schoology.com](http://clever.schoology.com)). *Do not include "https:// " or anything after ".com"*
5. (Optional) Matching attributes will default to email for all users. If you’d like to use a different attribute to match users between Clever and Schoology, you can edit them on the Settings page as well.
6. Click **Confirm.**
7. Under **SAML Details** copy your metadata URL:  
 ![Screenshot of Metadata URL](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka01P000000EH5J&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000003BNzq)  
 ### **In Schoology:**
8. Log into your administrator account and navigate to Tools > School Management > Integration: <https://clever.schoology.com/system_settings/integration>

title: Clever + Schoology Setup Guide
text:

This includes home devices for users who will be accessing this app from home. The Clever browser extension facilitates single sign-on for SSO (Saved Passwords) apps. 3. [Click here](https://schools.clever.com/applications/add/ilpro-schoology) to add the Schoology app.

4. Select **Request application.**

5. On the next screen, select which schools you would like to have access to Schoology. Select **Share.**

Data readiness: Your district should be sending Clever term and course data. Interoperability: If you plan on having users access McGraw Hill from platforms outside of Clever (e.g. Canvas), please be prepared to send Clever the same unique user ID you use to identify those users on other platforms (e.g., SIS ID) in your SIS sync. >

title: Troubleshooting: Data incorrect in Clever
text:
There may be discrepancies between the data in your student information system (SIS) and Clever. Some common issues are missing teacher, student, staff, or section data, or perhaps a user's primary school in Clever doesn't match what exists in your SIS. To change the data syncing to Clever, in most cases you'll need to update data in your SIS or the files your SIS is sending to Clever.  **It's not possible to manually update data in Clever that is synced via your SIS.** Below is a quick guide to help you troubleshoot missing or incorrect data in Clever.

**![](https://theme.zdassets.com/theme_assets/364037/af574183f2df705f2c75ac31fc7ab01b1a5a3d9a.png) Data incorrect in app:** *Most applications sync with Clever daily. Please allow up to 24 hours for newly updated or shared data in Clever to be reflected in your connected applications.  For more information, visit: [For Clever Admins: Apps - Sync times](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/236156648?language=en_US)*.

If the data is correct in Clever but incorrect in an app, please **contact the app's support team** directly. Applications are responsible for syncing data from Clever.

---

title: Troubleshooting: Data incorrect in Clever
text:
Depending on the type of student information system (SIS) sync you have configured with Clever, the process might be different. Your sync type (how your data is getting to Clever) can be found on the [Data sources > SIS sync](https://schools.clever.com/sync/settings)page in the Clever Dashboard.

**SFTP sync:**

![Sync status with sync type highlighted](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TkVh&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000004xby3)

If your sync type is SFTP (Secure File Transfer Protocol), this means that Clever is receiving CSV files directly from your Student Information System (SIS). The configuration and transmission of these files are managed by a contact at your district rather than Clever.

- Steps to fix data issues: Confirm the data is correct in your student information system (SIS).
Upload an updated set of data files to Clever. Please allow up to 30 minutes for the sync to complete. 
On the Sync page, confirm your sync is not on hold or hitting a sync error .
Review the data files you are sending to Clever for accuracy. You can download them on the Data sources > SIS sync page.
If the data is incorrect in the data files, contact your SIS manager -- Clever Support cannot assist with investigating data export errors.
If the data is correct in the data files but incorrect in Clever, please contact Clever Support.
- Tip to fix rollover issues: The data in Clever will rollover once we receive data for the new school year and the resulting data hold has been released. Please contact the sync manager at your district if you have any questions.

![Sync status with sync type highlighted](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TkVh&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000004xby8)

If your sync type is SFTP (SIS-managed), this means that Clever is receiving CSV files directly from your SIS. The configuration and transmission of these files are managed by your SIS rather than Clever.

- Steps to fix data issues: Confirm the data is correct in your student information system (SIS).
Contact your SIS support team to upload an updated set of data files to Clever. Please allow up to 30 minutes for the sync to complete. 
On the Sync page, confirm your sync is not on hold or hitting a sync error .
Review the data files you are sending to Clever for accuracy. You can download them on the Sync > Last Attempted Sync page. Learn more here !
If the data is incorrect in the data files, contact your SIS support team -- Clever Support cannot assist with investigating data export errors.
If the data is correct in the data files but incorrect in Clever, please contact Clever Support.
- Tip to fix rollover issues: The data in Clever will rollover once we receive data for the new school year and the resulting data hold has been released. Please contact your SIS if you have any questions.

title: Troubleshooting: Data incorrect in Clever
heading_path: Why is a student or teacher's primary school wrong in Clever, but correct in our SIS?
section: Why is a student or teacher's primary school wrong in Clever, but correct in our SIS?
text:
- For context, Clever dynamically updates the primary school assignment for students based on the total number of sections they have at a particular school site. For example, if a student has seven sections at School A and three sections at School B, their primary school would be School A in Clever.
- If you'd rather Clever use students' primary school exactly as it's listed in your SIS, we can disable our default logic for either students or teachers or both user types. Once this logic is disabled, Clever will look to your SIS data as the source of truth for primary school assignments instead of the student or teacher's sections. Please note that this is a global change that will affect all users of the same type in Clever and not just individual students.
- For more information, please see this article from our Help Center: [For District Admins: Primary School Assignment](https://support.clever.com/hc/en-us/articles/115003279987-For-District-Admins-Primary-school-assignments).

- Teachers and students can only have one primary school site in Clever. However, their additional school sites are associated with their Clever account through their section data.

- Section names in Clever are auto-generated to ensure uniqueness, improving recognition and usability for teachers and students. However, districts or schools can choose to sync their own section names to Clever. For more information on section names, please see this article that has information on how to sync section names: [For Clever Admins: Section Names](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001501?language=en_US)

- If you have gone over the troubleshooting steps above and the user is still not syncing to Clever, you can reach out to Clever Support. Some auto syncs have specific criteria as to what is required for certain user types to sync to Clever.

- If your data sync includes a **subject** field, Clever categorizes sections into subject categories based on the values you provide. For example, **subject** field values **English**, **Reading**, and **Writing** are all sorted into **english/language arts**. Everything that can’t be sorted (including blanks) will be assigned to the subject **other**. You can find more in-depth information here: [For Clever Admins: Assigning "subject" to sections](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/203448663?language=en_US).

- In order for section data to sync to Clever, the section must have students and a primary teacher assigned to it.

- Check to ensure your students are syncing to Clever with a grade associated with them, or elect a grade for the section in your SIS and sync it to Clever.

- No, at this time, it is not possible to manually enroll students into SIS-synced sections in the Clever Dashboard.

text:
> Tip: Title Temporarily disable Clever logins using Access Control URL Name 360046702972 Article Body  
> This article contains the following:  1. Overview 2. Setting up access control 2. Updating access control 3. User experience 4. FAQs
>  
> Overview
> Access control allows district admins to determine when students, teachers, and staff can access the Clever Portal and apps via Clever. Access control is intended as a temporary measure to limit potential student, teacher, or staff access to course-related information during sensitive time periods. When logging in to the Clever Portal or some connected applications, students, teachers, and staff are able to infer some information about which students and teachers are assigned to which classes (such as if they log into a reading app via Clever and see that they’re listed under 5th Period ELA with Ms. Thompson). By using access control, district admins can prevent students, teachers, and staff from viewing course-related information in Clever Portal or their connected applications by disabling login access. > Please note: Users may still be able to log into third-party applications if the applications support login methods other than Clever. >  
> Setting up access control
> You can set up access control by following these steps:
> Navigate to Clever Dashboard > Authentication > SSO settings page. Go to the Access control tab and click Edit . Select the user type(s) you wish to disable access for. Select the Start and End Dates for disabling access. >  
>  
> Updating access control
> You can return to the access control options to edit Start and End Dates at any time. You can also immediately restore access by clicking  Enabled  next to the relevant user type.

title: Temporarily disable Clever logins using Access Control
heading_path: Temporarily disable Clever logins using Access Control
section: Temporarily disable Clever logins using Access Control
text:
>  
> User experience 
> Any user who tries to log into Clever or an application via Clever while their access is disabled will see a Clever login error that tells them their login method is not enabled and that they'll need to reach out to a Clever admin if they need access. >  
> FAQs
> What type of information can users infer? > Students
> Teachers by viewing Teacher Pages and apps they will use in their upcoming courses via Clever Teachers and classmates in some connected apps
> Teachers
> Class and student associations from viewing sections and apps via Clever Class and student associations from viewing sections in connected apps
> Staff
> Duties based on available apps
> Are there other options for hiding schedules from students, without blocking access to Clever? > You can also hide Teacher Pages for up to 90 days. This will prevent students seeing Teacher Pages for their new teachers, but they may still be able to determine classmates or teachers via learning applications. > Should we enable Access Control? > You can see what students, teachers, and staff see in their Portals using the  Access Portal as user feature. Decide based on what a typical Portal looks like whether you want to disable login access using access control. >  
> Will this prevent students from accessing applications via login methods other than Clever? > Access control will only block your students from logging into the Clever Portal and using Clever SSO to log into other applications (e.g. through Log in with Clever buttons). Access Control cannot prevent users from logging into applications via other methods. If you want to block non-Clever login pathways to an application, we recommend reaching out to that application to discuss options with them directly. > How is this different from the hiding applications feature? > Clever admin have the ability to hide applications and links in Clever.

text:
There are differences between hiding apps and access control:
> The hide feature:
> Only applies to individual applications and links – it can’t be applied to multiple resources at the same time. Doesn't control users’ access to the Clever Portal. Users can still log in to the Clever Portal and see various features like Teacher Pages and Messaging. > Access control:
> Allows administrators to disable access to all Clever applications at once. Prevents selected user types from logging into the Clever Portal. > When exactly will users be able to start logging in on disable end date? > Users will be able to start logging in at midnight local time on the selected disable end date. > What should I do if I want to enable access before my scheduled end date? > From your Clever Dashboard, navigate to Clever Dashboard > Authentication > SSO settings > Access control tab , select  Edit , and change the disable end date to whatever new date you want to use. If you select the current day, users will gain access immediately.

title: For Clever Admins: Troubleshooting - Changing email addresses or email domains in Clever
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Troubleshooting - Changing email addresses or email domains in Clever
section: For Clever Admins: Troubleshooting - Changing email addresses or email domains in Clever
text:
> Important: Title For Clever Admins: Troubleshooting - Changing email addresses or email domains in Clever URL Name 360046978411 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. How to update user emails for a SFTP or SFTP (SIS-Managed) sync 3. How to update user emails for a Clever-Managed auto sync 4. How to update manually added (side-loaded) user emails 5. Important considerations when updating user emails 5. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
>  
> Overview
> As you use Clever, you may need to update your student, teacher, or staff email addresses or domains (@ example.com ) if you change the format for user emails. Updating emails is a quick change that Clever sees as an update to user accounts. You can change any data point for your users, such as their email address, grade, last name, or graduation year without any need to notify the Clever team. >   Please note: If you will be changing your user’s SIS IDs (such as teacher\_id, student\_id, or school\_id), please contact Clever Support. >  
> How to update user emails for an SFTP or SFTP (SIS-Managed) sync
> If you utilize an SFTP or SFTP (SIS-Managed) sync, you will need to work on updating the email addresses included in the CSV files you are sending to Clever. If you manage your students.csv, teachers.csv, and staff.csv, please update the student\_email, teacher\_email, and staff\_email columns to include the new email addresses for your users. If you only update emails for one user type, you only need to update that file. Once you have your updated files, you can upload them to Clever to update your user’s email addresses. > If your SIS manages the sending of your CSV files to Clever on your behalf, please contact your SIS team directly for more information on updating the email addresses included in these files. Once you’ve worked with your SIS team to update the emails included in these files and they send the updated email addresses via the CSV files, the emails will update in Clever.

text:
> How to update user emails for a Clever-Managed auto sync

> Infinite Campus Auto Sync

> To update your email addresses in Clever, you will want to work to update the email addresses in the field Clever is pulling from your SIS. If you have a custom mapping in place for emails, or if your sync type supports custom mappings and you’d like to explore syncing emails from an alternate field in your SIS to Clever, please contact Clever Support for further assistance. >  
> How to update manually added (side-loaded) user emails
> If you manually manage student and teacher emails by uploading student\_emails.csv and teacher\_emails.csv, you’ll want to update these files with the new user emails. Once you’ve updated the email addresses for your users in each file, please upload the new files via your Data sources > SIS sync > Upload page. > For more information, please see our article Manually Uploading (i.e. side-loading) user emails to Clever . > Important considerations when updating user emails
> Updating all users' accounts will likely cause a sync hold. Once the data sync completes, you can approve the hold on your Clever Dashboard > Data sources > SIS sync page. For more information on sync holds please see our article For Clever Admins: Sync Holds . > If you use Clever Passwords as your identity provider (IdP), please check if you are using the “Email” field for your usernames. If so, you will need to reset Clever Passwords once the new emails sync. This is because Clever Passwords' usernames and passwords are not updated dynamically. Click here for more information on resetting passwords.

text:
> Do you utilize SSO (Saved Passwords) applications, and if so is the "Email" field utilized for the username field for any Saved Passwords applications? If so, after syncing new email addresses, you may need to clear the cache if users are having issues logging into those SSO (Saved Password) applications. > Do you utilize any SAML applications? If so, are you using emails to match accounts? The emails will need to match between Clever and the application to ensure SAML login success. > Please notify any application partners syncing email addresses via Clever of your upcoming email changes to ensure they are prepared for the changes. > If Clever Administrator, District Help Desk, or District Curriculum Lead emails are also changing , these will need to be updated on the individual’s Clever Dashboard > Profile page . Each admin will need to update their own email by selecting the "Edit" button in the "Account information" box on their Profile page. > Please review and update your Tech Support Contact email if required. > If you utilize Clever Identity Management (IDM):
> If you provision Google accounts via Clever IDM, by default IDM references the SIS email field as the source of truth when matching and updating accounts. Updating email addresses in Clever will cause Clever IDM to update the emails for these users in Google. > Clever IDM for Active Directory and Entra ID by default looks first to the District Username field as a source of truth. Updating user emails won't directly impact emails in Active Directory or Entra ID unless you also update the username field. >  
> Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
> Do I need to notify Clever that my user’s email addresses will be changing? > No. You only need to notify Clever if your user’s sis\_ids (teacher\_id, student\_id, staff\_id, etc.) will also be changing. > Why did my sync go on hold when I updated email addresses?

> Sync holds are to prevent Clever Admins from making unintended changes to their data when large data changes occur. Review the changes on your Last Attempted Sync page and if the changes are as expected you can approve the hold. > What steps should I take to ensure minimal disruption to students and teachers? > Review the Important considerations when updating user emails section above for guidance on steps you can take to prevent disruptions.

> - Field: first\_name; Required: Y; Format: String; Description: Contact’s first name
> - Field: last\_name; Required: Y; Format: String; Description: Contact’s last name
> - Field: type; Required: Y; Format: String; Description: Type of contact - e.g.

“family”, “emergency”, or “guardian”

> - Field: phone; Required: N; Format: Integer; Description: A 10 or 11 digit phone number
> - Field: phone\_type; Required: N; Format: Option; Description: Type of phone contact. Supported values: Cell, Home, Work. > - Field: email; Required: N; Format: Email; Description: Contact’s email address. Must match format x@y.z

> How to upload your CSV file
> Web Upload
> You can upload your contacts.csv file from the Clever Dashboard > Data sources > Custom data tab. > Once uploaded, you will see the following status message:
> Please note: Please allow 10-15 minutes for custom data to process. Though Clever will not send an email notification that the data has been processed, the results will be viewable on the Sync page in the Clever Dashboard. >  
> SFTP Upload
> If you prefer to upload your contact data via SFTP:
> Connect to your Clever SFTP directory using the credentials found on your Data sources > SIS sync > Settings page under SFTP Settings . If you use a Clever-managed Auto Sync and don't have SFTP credentials available on this page, please contact Clever Support and our team can assist with providing access to a remote site for custom data contact uploads. text:
Title

For Clever Admins: Apps - Safety thresholds

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360047113052?language=en_US#h_b1931707-7878-4e19-8cb9-6b1d21597554) 
2. [Safety thresholds](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360047113052?language=en_US#h_f723888c-6033-4cba-b3fa-f30388209a1b) 
3. [How to know if your district-app connection is on hold](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360047113052?language=en_US#h_7698d144-7ceb-4d63-88b8-e9ca2aa378d2) 
4. [Next steps to continue syncing your district’s data with an app on hold](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360047113052?language=en_US#h_f00c7c4e-4f30-4072-9c8c-a22cb51bfeaa)

If your district makes large changes to the data that is synced to Clever, we put a hold on the sync to make sure the changes are intentional. In a very similar fashion, if changes to your sync or the sharing permissions for an application would cause a large percentage of data shared with the app to change or be deleted, app-side safety thresholds will not allow that data to be synced to the application until a member of the app team has had a chance to review the data.

App-side safety thresholds are an important part of syncing rostering information as it ensures that both you and the app team are aware of any potentially significant changes to your district’s data. Holds are a safeguard to prevent potentially incorrect or undesired changes from being synced to an application.

By default, if your district’s most recent sync or an update in your sharing permissions results in over 75% of any data type (e.g. schools, students, teachers, sections) being updated or over 10% being deleted, an application safety hold will be triggered. Some applications may set different safety thresholds in order to better support you.

Once a safety hold is approved, the district’s data will be fully available in Clever’s API for the application to pull.

> Adult users (teachers, admins): email address Students: first name, last name, district, state id, and date of birth Districts: NCES ID (primary)
> If NCES ID is not available, send the district name

> Data Considerations
> Please Note: myPLTW cannot match rostering information for classes whose teachers do not have an email address in Clever. Additionally, if you do have an email address on file, please ensure that the email address in myPLTW matches the email address in Clever. If no match is found, an educator account cannot be created in myPLTW . > Maintaining Student Rostering Information
> Throughout the year, myPLTW will automatically receive any student or enrollment changes that are made in your Student Information System (SIS) through Clever. Please ensure that your SIS is up-to-date so students are properly enrolled. You should expect these changes to be available in myPLTW within 48 hours of the update. > Clever Import Classrooms Guide

> Why is my data not showing up in myPLTW ? > Depending on your sync type, Clever either pulls data from your SIS or data is submitted to Clever from your SIS. That data is then made available to myPLTW to sync to their system. There is a lag time between these processes, as the sync with Clever and the sync with myPLTW may not occur at the same time.

text:
Title

For Families: How to download a Clever Badge for your student

360047770232

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Downloading Student Badges from the Clever Portal](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360047770232?language=en_US#Downloading Student Badges from the Clever Portal) 
2. [Frequently Asked Questions](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360047770232?language=en_US#Frequently Asked Questions)

Students can download their own Badges from within the Clever Portal. Once a student logs in, they can find a Badge by clicking their profile icon in the top right corner, then selecting **Download Badge**.

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl0000004VDJ&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028DZZ)

Once they click **Download Badge,**their Badge will be saved as a PDF to the downloads folder on their device. Once downloaded, this PDF can be printed for use by your student. For information about Badges and how to use them, check out this article: [For Students: How do I log into Clever using a Badge?](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360020354392)

---

title: For Families: How to download a Clever Badge for your student
heading_path: For Families: How to download a Clever Badge for your student
text:
**Why don’t I see a “Download Badge” option?**

The Download Badge option is only available for students that have Badges enabled for them by their district. If you don’t see the **Download Badge** option, please contact your district's tech support contact. If you do not see a support contact listed, please contact your student's teacher.

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl0000004VDJ&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000002lSXC)

**How am I supposed to log in without a Badge?**

In order to download a Badge, you will first need to log into the Portal using a non-Badge login method. To do so, follow the instructions here: [Logging in to the Portal](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115002717307). If you’re having trouble logging in, feel free to ask your teacher or district tech support contact for help.

**What if I don't have a printer?**

If you don't have a printer, a great alternative is to use your phone to display the Badge! Some options include:

- Take a picture of the Badge using your cellphone camera and scan the Badge from your photos app.
- Email the Badge to yourself and scan the Badge through the email app on your phone

Additional information on using your phone to display a Clever Badge can be found [here](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360020790571).

**What if I lost the Badge?**

If you lose the Badge, you can always download a new one from the Portal. It’ll be the same as the one you lost so, if you find your old one, both will continue to work.

**Related articles:**

- [For Families: Troubleshooting - Logins to Clever](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360000067006?language=en_US)

text:

Este artículo contiene lo siguiente:

Los estudiantes pueden descargar sus propias insignias desde Clever Portal. Una vez que el estudiante inicia sesión, puede encontrar un Badge haciendo clic en el ícono de su perfil en la esquina superior derecha y seleccionando luego **Download Badge** (Descargar Badge).

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl0000004VEv&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028DZZ)

Una vez que haga clic en **Download Badge** (Descargar Badge), su Badge se guardará como PDF en la carpeta de descargas de su dispositivo. Una vez que lo descargue, este PDF puede imprimirse para que lo use el estudiante. Para obtener información sobre los Badges y cómo usarlos, consulte este artículo: Para los estudiantes: [¿Cómo inicio sesión en Clever usando un Badge?](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360020354392)

title: Para familias: ¿Cómo descargar un Clever Badge para su estudiante?
heading_path: Para familias: ¿Cómo descargar un Clever Badge para su estudiante?
text:
**¿Por qué no veo la opción Download Badge (Descargar Badge)?**

- La opción **Download Badge** (Descargar Badge) solo está disponible para los estudiantes donde el distrito tiene Badges habilitados para ellos. Si no ve la opción **Download Badge** (Descargar Badge), comuníquese con el contacto de soporte técnico de su distrito. Si no ve un contacto de soporte en la lista, comuníquese con el maestro del estudiante.

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl0000004VEv&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000002lSXC)

**¿Cómo puedo iniciar sesión sin un Badge?**

- Para descargar un Badge, primero deberá iniciar sesión en el Portal con un método de inicio de sesión que no necesite un Badge. Para hacerlo, siga las instrucciones aquí: [Inicie sesión en el Portal.](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115002717307) Si tiene problemas para iniciar sesión, no dude en pedir ayuda a su maestro o al contacto de soporte técnico del distrito.

**¿Qué pasa si no tengo impresora?**

- Si no tiene una impresora, una excelente alternativa es usar su teléfono para mostrar el Badge. Algunas opciones incluyen:
 - Tome una foto del Badge con la cámara de su teléfono celular y escanee el Badge desde la aplicación de fotos.
 - Envíese por correo electrónico el Badge a usted mismo y escanee el Badge a través de la aplicación de correo electrónico en su teléfono.

Puede encontrar información adicional sobre cómo usar su teléfono para mostrar un Clever Badge [aquí](https://support.clever.com/hc/es-419/articles/360020790571).

**¿Qué pasa si pierdo el Badge?**

- Si pierde el Badge, siempre puede descargar uno nuevo desde el Portal. Será el mismo que perdió, por lo que si encuentra el anterior ambos funcionarán.

---

title: 학부모용: Student Portal에서 Badge 다운로드하는 방법
heading_path: 학부모용: Student Portal에서 Badge 다운로드하는 방법
section: 학부모용: Student Portal에서 Badge 다운로드하는 방법
text:
제목

학부모용: Student Portal에서 Badge 다운로드하는 방법

URL 이름

360047770232

Article Body

학생들은 자신의 Badge를 Clever Portal에서 다운로드할 수 있습니다. 학생은 로그인 후 우측 상단 코너에서 자신의 프로필 아이콘을 클릭하여 Badge를 찾을 수 있습니다. 그 다음 'Download Badge(Badge 다운로드)'를 선택합니다.

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl0000004VEw&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000002lYmm)

Download Badge(Badge 다운로드)'를 클릭하면 Badge가 PDF 형식으로 장치의 다운로드 폴더에 저장됩니다. 다운로드한 후 학생은 이 PDF를 프린트하여 사용할 수 있습니다. Badge에 대한 자세한 정보와 사용 방법은 다음 글을 확인하세요.

title: 학부모용: Student Portal에서 Badge 다운로드하는 방법
heading_path: 학부모용: Student Portal에서 Badge 다운로드하는 방법
text:
**왜 'Download Badge(Badge 다운로드)' 옵션이 보이지 않나요?**

Download Badge(Badge 다운로드)' 옵션은 해당 학군에서 Badge를 활성화한 학생만 이용할 수 있습니다. 'Download Badge(Badge 다운로드)' 옵션이 보이지 않는다면 해당 학군의 기술 지원팀에 문의하세요. 지원팀의 연락처를 찾을 수 없다면 학생의 선생님에게 문의하시길 바랍니다.

​![Screen_Shot_2019-09-24_at_4.20.49_PM.png](https://support.clever.com/hc/article_attachments/360039330672/Screen_Shot_2019-09-24_at_4.20.49_PM.png)

**Badge 없이 어떻게 로그인할 수 있나요?**

Badge를 다운로드하려면 먼저 Badge가 필요하지 않은 로그인 방법으로 Portal에 로그인해야 합니다. Badge 없이 로그인하려면 다음 지침을 따르세요. Portal에 로그인. 로그인하는 데 문제가 있다면 언제든지 선생님 또는 해당 학군의 기술 지원팀에 도움을 요청하세요.

**프린터가 없다면 어떻게 해야 하나요?**

프린터가 없다면 휴대폰을 사용하여 Badge를 화면에 표시하는 것도 좋은 방법입니다! 다음 방법도 사용할 수 있습니다.

- 휴대폰 카메라로 Badge 사진을 찍어 사진 앱으로 Badge를 스캔합니다.
- Badge를 자신의 메일로 전송하여 휴대폰의 이메일 앱으로 Badge를 스캔합니다

여기에서 휴대폰을 사용하여 Clever Badge를 표시할 수 있는 추가 정보를 확인할 수 있습니다.

**Badge를 분실하면 어떻게 해야 하나요?**

Badge를 분실하는 경우 언제든지 Portal에서 새로운 Badge를 다운로드할 수 있습니다. 새 Badge는 분실한 Badge와 동일한 Badge로 기존 Badge를 찾을 경우 두 Badge 모두 계속해서 사용할 수 있습니다.

text:
Puwedeng i-download ng mga estudyante ang kanilang sariling mga Badge sa Clever Portal. Kapag nakapag-log in na ang estudyante, makakakita siya ng Badge sa pamamagitan ng pag-click sa kanyang icon ng profile sa kanang sulok sa itaas, pagkatapos ay piliin ang I-download ang Badge.

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl0000004VEx&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000002lYmw)

Kapag na-click na niya ang I-download ang Badge, mase-save ang kanyang Badge bilang PDF sa folder ng mga na-download sa kanyang device. Kapag na-download na, puwedeng i-print ang PDF na ito para magamit ng iyong estudyante. Para sa impormasyong tungkol sa mga Badge at kung paano gamitin ang mga ito, tingnan ang artikulong ito: [Para sa Mga Estudyante: Paano ako magkakapag-log in sa Clever gamit ang Badge?](https://support.clever.com/hc/tl/articles/360020354392)

title: Para sa Mga Pamilya: Paano i-download ang mga Badge sa Student Portal
heading_path: Para sa Mga Pamilya: Paano i-download ang mga Badge sa Student Portal
text:
**Bakit hindi ko nakikita ang opsyong “I-download ang Badge”?**

Available lang ang I-download ang Badge para sa mga estudyanteng may naka-enable na mga Badge ng kanilang distrito. Kung hindi mo makikita ang opsyong I-download ang Badge, mangyaring makipag-ugnayan sa kontak ng suporta sa tech ng iyong distrito. Kung hindi mo makikita ang listahan ng kontak sa suporta, mangyaring makipag-ugnayan sa guro ng iyong estudyante.

**Paano makakapag-log in nang walang Badge?**

Para mag-download ng Badge, kakailanganin mo munang mag-log in sa Portal gamit ang paraan ng pag-log in nang walang Badge. Para gawin iyon, sundin ang mga tagubilin dito: [Pag-log in sa Portal](https://support.clever.com/hc/tl/articles/115002717307). Kung nagkakaproblema ka sa pag-log in, huwag mag-atubiling makipag-ugnayan sa iyong guro o sa kontak ng suporta ng tech ng iyong distrito para humingi ng tulong.

**Paano kung wala akong printer?**

Kung wala kang printer, ang magandang alternatibo ay ang paggamit sa iyong telepono para ipakita ang Badge! Kasama sa ilang opsyon ang:

- Kunan ng larawan ang Badge gamit ang camera ng iyong cellphone at i-scan ang Badge sa iyong photos app.
- I-email ang Badge sa iyong sarili sa pamamagitan ng email app sa iyong telepono

[Makikita rito ang karagdagang impormasyon sa paggamit ng iyong telepono para ipakita ang Clever Badge.](https://support.clever.com/hc/tl/articles/360020790571)

**Paano kung nawala ko ang Badge?**

Kung mawawala mo ang Badge, puwede kang mag-download ng bago mula sa Portal anumang oras. Katulad lang ito ng nawala mong Badge kaya, kung mahahanap mo ang dati mong Badge, pareho itong patuloy na gagana.

title: 对于家庭：如何在学生 Portal 下载 Badge
heading_path: 对于家庭：如何在学生 Portal 下载 Badge
section: 对于家庭：如何在学生 Portal 下载 Badge
text:
标题

对于家庭：如何在学生 Portal 下载 Badge

URL 名称

360047770232

Article Body

学生可以在 Clever Portal 内下载他们自己的 Badge。登录后，学生可以通过点击右上角的个人资料图标找到 Badge，然后选择下载 Badge。

![image.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl0000004VEz&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000002lYlL)

点击下载 Badge 后，他们的 Badge 就会以 PDF 格式保存到他们设备的下载文件夹中。下载后，PDF 可以打印出来供学生使用。关于 Badge 和它们的使用方法的信息，请查看这篇文章：[对于学生：我如何使用 Badge 登录 Clever？](https://support.clever.com/hc/zh-cn/articles/360020354392)

**为什么我看不到“下载 Badge”选项？**

下载 Badge 选项只适用于那些已由他们所在的学区启用了 Badge 的学生。如果您没有看到“下载 Badge”选项，请联系您所在学区的技术支持联系人。如果您没有看到列出支持联系人，请联系您学生的老师。

​![Screen_Shot_2019-09-24_at_4.20.49_PM.png](https://support.clever.com/hc/article_attachments/360039330672/Screen_Shot_2019-09-24_at_4.20.49_PM.png)

**没有 Badge 我该如何登录？**

为了下载 Badge，首先需要使用非 Badge 登录方法登录 Portal。为此，请遵循这里的说明：[登录 Portal](https://support.clever.com/hc/zh-cn/articles/115002717307)。如果您登录时遇到困难，请向您的老师或学区技术支持联系人寻求帮助。

**如果我没有打印机该怎么办？**

如果您没有打印机，一个不错的选择是用您的手机来展示 Badge！一些选项包括：

- 用您的手机拍照，然后从您的照片应用程序中扫描 Badge。
- 将 Badge 通过电子邮件发送给自己，并通过手机上的电子邮件应用程序扫描 Badge

[可以在这里找到关于使用手机展示 Clever Badge 的更多信息。](https://support.clever.com/hc/zh-cn/articles/360020790571)

**如果我把 Badge 丢失该怎么办？**

如果您丢失了 Badge，您始终可以从 Portal 下载一个新 Badge。它和您丢失的那个是一样的，所以如果您找到了您的旧的，两个都可以继续发挥作用。

Your app's profile in Clever Library is how teachers discover and learn about what your product does. Your profile helps explain to teachers what you do and what makes you unique. You can update your app's profile under the marketing collateral tab in your dashboard.

title: For App Partners: Update marketing collateral to showcase your product in Clever Library
heading_path: For App Partners: Update marketing collateral to showcase your product in Clever Library
How your app is showcased in Clever Library
section: How your app is showcased in Clever Library
text:
When an educator searches for your application in Clever Library, they will be directed to your app's profile page.

The following information appears on your app profile:

- Basic information about your application (Name, tagline, description)
- Details about your application (categories, grade levels, standards alignment, tags, device and platform compatibility, case studies and links to your website)
- Images to show what your application looks like (app icon, banner, and screenshots)

The application profile will also include verified teacher reviews, which includes a 5-star rating scale for how engaging, educational and easy-to-use your application is, as well as comments. [Learn more about teacher reviews](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/000001454?language=en_US).

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000ULlN&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000285Z1)

To see what your profile page looks like to a user, visit the public-facing [Clever Library](https://clever.com/library) and search for your application.

You can update what appears on your app's profile page by adding content under the marketing collateral tab in your Clever Dashboard. Every Clever Library application partner starts with a basic profile consisting of their application name and icon.

Follow these instructions to update your profile with screenshots, description, and other information:

- Log in to Clever at <https://apps.clever.com/>
- Navigate to [Library > Marketing Collateral](https://apps.clever.com/clever-academy-dev/library/collateral) in the left-hand navigation menu

There, you can add the following information:

- **App name:** The name of your product
- **Tagline:** A short description (60 characters max)
- **Long description:** A full description of your applications capabilities and features (1000 characters max)

title: For App Partners: Update marketing collateral to showcase your product in Clever Library
heading_path: For App Partners: Update marketing collateral to showcase your product in Clever Library
text:
- **Subject and categories:** Choose from a list of subject or categories your application should be listed under
- **Grade levels:** Select all grade levels your product supports
- **Standards Alignment:** Link to web pages that outline standards alignments for your application.
- **Tags:** Add up to 10 tags to help your application better appear in search ([learn more about tags](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360031356852))
- **Device and platform compatibility:** Select which platforms and operating systems your product supports
- **Pricing:** Your application’s pricing model (Freemium, Free Trial, and Free)
- **Research and case studies:** Link to web pages that host research, case studies or relevant content.
- Links to your application’s website, terms of service, and privacy policy

- **App icon:** 200px wide by 200px high, PNG, no transparency
- **Feature banner:** 400px wide by 240px high, PNG, no transparency
- **Screenshots:** Include up to 5 screenshots, along with an associated text description to describe what the screenshot displays. 1200px wide by 800px high, PNG, no transparency.

For more detail on designing great artwork for your profile, [download the artwork spec](https://clever-partner-images.s3.amazonaws.com/library/spec/library-artwork-spec.pdf).

text:
> Important: Title For Clever Admins: How do I add an STL to Clever? URL Name 360048169811 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Bulk uploading School Tech Leads via CSV 3. Upgrading an existing staff user 4. Manually adding a School Tech Lead
> Overview
> District Admins can assign certain users the School Tech Lead role which provides them with limited admin permissions in Clever for their associated school(s). To learn more about the School Tech lead role, read:  Clever Roles: School Tech Lead . > As educators are increasingly relying on technology to support online learning, having a dedicated role in Clever to help teachers manage their digital classroom in Clever is now more important than ever. > Clever Admins can add STLs to their Clever Portal today. Follow the instructions in this quick video  or follow the instructions below. > Bulk uploading School Tech Leads via CSV
> To add a School Tech Lead, or multiple School Tech Leads, via an uploaded file to Clever, please:
> Navigate to Data sources > SIS sync > Staff Data . Scroll down to the 'Manual Upload' section and select 'Download existing staff.csv'
>         
> The staff.csv file will contain all pre-existing staff in Clever for your district. > Note : DO NOT REMOVE any staff users you still want to have access to Clever. Removing a user from the staff.csv before re-uploading it will cause their record to be deleted. Rather, just add the additional user information to the file before re-uploading. > Add the desired staff members to the file, entering 'STL' or 'School Tech Lead' in the Role column. Navigate to Data sources > SIS sync > Staff Data > Manual Upload, and upload the updated staff.csv. >       
> The upload changes should be reflected in Clever in approximately 10-15 minutes
> Upgrading an existing staff user to School Tech Lead
> School Tech Leads must first be added to Clever as staff before they can be assigned the School Tech Lead role.

title: For Clever Admins: How do I add an STL to Clever?
heading_path: For Clever Admins: How do I add an STL to Clever?
section: For Clever Admins: How do I add an STL to Clever?
text:
If the individual is a teacher in Clever, or are not yet in Clever as staff, please visit:  Adding custom staff to Clever. Once the user is in Clever, navigate to their profile page using the 'Search' feature at the top of the dashboard. From their profile page, click the drop-down arrow on the top right of the page. Select 'Update Clever Role'. Select 'School Tech Lead'. >  
> Manually adding a School Tech Lead
> Navigate to your Clever Dashboard > Data sources > Custom data page. In top right corner, click Add custom data . In the drop-down menu, select  Staff. > Fill out the fields for the School Tech Lead you want to create. You’ll need to select which schools they are assigned to, or select 'Assign to all schools', as well as enter some basic identifying information. IMPORTANT: To make them into a School Tech Lead, you need to select 'School Tech Lead' in the drop-down for 'Clever Role'. Optional: Check the box to send an email notifying the staff member that their account has been created. Select 'Create Staff'
> The Username and Password field only needs to be populated if:   A) The district login method is Clever Passwords and 'District Username' or 'District Password' is selected for staff logins B) The district login method is Active Directory or LDAPS and the 'username' field in Clever is utilized for staff matching (claims rules)  C) You would like to utilize the 'District Username' and 'District Password' fields for staff logging into SSO (Saved Passwords) applications

title: Secure Sync: Changing Student Information Systems
heading_path: Secure Sync: Changing Student Information Systems
section: Secure Sync: Changing Student Information Systems
text:
> Tip: Title Secure Sync: Changing Student Information Systems URL Name 360049183691 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Process 3. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
> Overview
> Is your district moving to a new student information system (SIS)? No worries—Clever has you covered! Clever can assist in keeping your downstream application data clean and ready to go. > This process is a partnership; we are here to ensure your success! Since multiple steps are involved, we recommend planning and starting the process as early as possible to ensure minimal disruption to your students and teachers. >  
>   Please note: To prevent user disruption, Clever does not recommend completing this transition mid-year. Summer or winter breaks are the best time to work through this process due to the required sync hold that must be enabled during the conversion process. >  
>  
> Process
> Identify how you will sync data to Clever Clever provides districts with multiple methods to sync their data. If your district is transitioning to one of the SISs listed here , you can use an Auto Sync to send data to Clever. If your SIS is not listed, you can use an SFTP sync. Learn more about syncing data via SFTP here . Confirm the primary identifiers for records Clever recommends keeping the primary identifier (student\_id, teacher\_id, staff\_id, and school\_id) the same when transitioning SISs. Maintaining the same sis\_id will protect you from duplicate or lost records. If your sis\_ids are changing, Clever can complete a matching process to preserve as much historical data as possible. You can learn more about the process for changing SIS IDs here . Populate data in your new SIS To complete the transition in Clever, you will need active data in your new SIS. We recommend completing this 3-4 weeks before you would like the conversion process to be completed.

title: Secure Sync: Changing Student Information Systems
heading_path: Secure Sync: Changing Student Information Systems
section: Secure Sync: Changing Student Information Systems
text: (Optional) Make a note of your current field mappings if your sync type supports field mappings Some Clever-Managed Auto Syncs allow districts to view or complete their field mappings on the Clever Dashboard > Data sources > SIS sync > Settings > Sync Mappings box > View field mappings page. If you see your field mappings available, we recommend taking a screenshot of each data type’s mappings for future reference. Contact Clever Support  Once data is ready in your SIS, contact Clever Support and let us know the name of your SIS and your preferred method of syncing (Auto Sync, SFTP, OneRoster, etc.). We will consult with you to ensure your account is set up for success! Configure your Auto Sync or SFTP files Before Clever can complete the migration, we will need a successful data connection. If you have chosen an Auto Sync, work with our support team or your SIS provider to set up the data sync. Setup directions for Clever-managed Auto Syncs are linked here . Configure files using the directions found here if you will be syncing via SFTP. Please allow up to one week to troubleshoot getting your sync or SFTP files successfully configured. > Migrate data Contact Clever Support and let us know when you are ready to upload your first set of data from your new SIS into Clever. Before you upload new data, please consult our team on which applications to pause your data sync with. We will also enable protection settings for your account to ensure your teacher and students are minimally affected by the changes in data. All data syncing between the district and Clever will pause during this time. However, users will still be able to access Clever and their applications. Once the safety settings are applied, we will have you sync your uploaded data into Clever! If the data looks good, we will complete a matching process to preserve historical data where possible. Please allow up to 2-3 weeks for the matching process to be completed.

title: Secure Sync: Changing Student Information Systems
heading_path: Secure Sync: Changing Student Information Systems
section: Secure Sync: Changing Student Information Systems
text:
During this time, your account will appear with a sync status of "On Hold" or "System Maintenance In Progress." This is normal and will be resolved once Clever Support has finished the migration process. Confirm data changes, sync with apps The final step of the process is for you to approve the data changes. Since you have switched to a new SIS, there are probably significant changes to your data, and the sync will be placed on hold pending your approval. Review the data on your SIS sync page and confirm or discard the changes as appropriate. For more details on Sync Holds, see here . > Once the data is live in Clever, please do not remove any application pauses until you have received confirmation from the application that it is ready for new data. Applications that are not paused will receive the data within 24 hours. > Application partners manage pulling data from Clever and processing it into their system. If you have any questions about the effect of data changes in an application, please contact the application's support team. They will be happy to assist! > Ready to get started or have a question? Contact our Support Team . > Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
> Is there an option if I need more guidance and would like additional services from Clever for my sync conversion? > Yes! We offer Sync Conversion Consulting Services. The sync conversion process is a collaborative effort involving the district, Clever, and connected applications to achieve a smooth transition. While our sync conversion team is committed to helping you meet your goals, opting for our paid services can provide additional consultation and support to streamline the process further. Please let us know if you're interested in exploring this option or have any questions! > Can we upload a partial data set and send the rest of the data at a later time? > No, any accounts/data currently in Clever that you want to continue syncing to Clever must be included in your initial sync from your new SIS.

title: Secure Sync: Changing Student Information Systems
heading_path: Secure Sync: Changing Student Information Systems
section: Secure Sync: Changing Student Information Systems
text: For example, suppose you have ten teachers currently in Clever and only upload seven in your initial sync. Only including seven teachers will delete the three you didn't include from Clever and their connected applications. Even if you add the existing accounts later, Clever and their connected apps will see them as new accounts, and they will lose all historical data. > What if I don't need any historical data preserved? I have old data in Clever and we haven't been actively using it, so I don't need historical data maintained. > If this is the case, you can forego the sync conversion process. Teachers will lose any Teacher Pages in Clever that they have created, and all users will lose their historical data in their connected applications. Please provide in writing that you do not want our teams to preserve the historical data and that you understand that your users will no longer have any historical data in Clever or their connected apps. > Why does the sync or SIS ID conversion take 2-3 weeks? > Anytime you execute record linkage between data sets, the integrity of the data is always at risk. Sync conversions involve numerous steps that must be performed accurately, and depending on the complexity and size of the data, this can take time. During a school break is the best time to complete a sync conversion because the account is already often in a sync pause status. Many districts are reaching out to our teams to complete a sync conversion during the winter or summer break, which can impact timelines for completion. > tags: sync conversions

This article contains the following:

This article will give our application partners an overview of the School Tech Lead role in Clever and how School Tech Leads can interact with applications.

---

title: For App Partners: The School Tech Lead user role in Clever
heading_path: For App Partners: The School Tech Lead user role in Clever
What is a School Tech Lead?
section: What is a School Tech Lead?
text:
A School Tech Lead is a staff user role in Clever with additional permissions. District Admins can assign certain users the School Tech Lead role, which provides them with a set of specific permissions in Clever for their associated school(s).

For instructions on how a district admin can assign a staff member to the School Tech Lead Role, please see [Clever Roles: School Tech Lead](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115003207663)

These permissions are designed to empower this user in their role as an edtech coach, instructional technology specialist, digital learning specialist, etc. Users with School Tech Lead permissions are often the individuals at a school who evaluate, roll out, support, and troubleshoot technology.

School Tech Leads play an important role in helping teachers and students access your application through Clever. Continue reading to learn more about their permissions and how you can collaborate with them to drive engagement for your application.

---

title: For App Partners: The School Tech Lead user role in Clever
heading_path: For App Partners: The School Tech Lead user role in Clever
School Tech Lead tools and permissions
section: School Tech Lead tools and permissions
text:
In the past, School Tech Leads only had limited admin permissions. In July 2020, Clever launched a new and improved user experience to empower School Tech Leads. They have the following tools in Clever:

**Help districts roll out edtech**

- [Personalizing school portals](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360042044811)
- [Creating custom sections](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360020213371)
- [Monitoring edtech usage](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360044719192)

**Help train teachers and students**

- [Become a certified Clever Trainer](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360023043372)
- [Access all new Clever Academy training for School Tech Leads](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360023043372)

**Quickly resolve issues with new troubleshooting tools**

- [Temporarily access a teacher’s portal](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360044867112)
- [Troubleshoot logins to quickly diagnose the root cause of access issues](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360044867112)

**Evaluate Clever+ products in the Clever App Store**

- [Find add-on Clever+ products, such as Clever IDM, in the Clever App Store](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360050628211?language=en_US)

---

School Tech Leads (STLs) play an important role in helping teachers and students access your application through Clever. There are three ways a School Tech Lead might interact with your application:

1. **SSO into your application:** If you have shared data with the staff user role for School Tech Leads.
2. **Viewing your application in the school’s portal:** When customizing the school’s portal, an STL can view any applications the district has shared with that school.

title: Participation & Resource Usage Reports
text:
With participation reports, Clever provides greater insight into your users' participation and daily activities. To opt in to participation reports, navigate to your [Clever Dashboard > Analytics > Reports](https://schools.clever.com/analytics/reports/signup).

Clever currently requires a two-week setup time to aggregate data and make reports available to districts. Once you have signed up, Clever email you when participation reports are ready for your account.

**Subject:** *Your participation reports are ready!* 
![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TV6r&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000285Qo)

Once Clever has prepared participation reports for your schools, navigate to [Analytics > Reports](https://schools.clever.com/analytics/reports/signup) to view the data. On this page, you can view reports for the current week, Monday-Sunday. To view previous weeks, use the date selector in the top left:  
![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TV6r&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000285R7)

At this time, reports are available via manual download or [automated SFTP delivery](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360049642311?language=en_US#ExportingReports).

title: Participation & Resource Usage Reports
text:
Participation reports provide a daily snapshot that summarizes usage for students, teachers, and staff in your district, including inactive ones.

Participation reports can be downloaded individually or in bulk. Clicking **Download week** will download a zip file with the student, teacher, and staff files for each day of the selected week.

![Participation reports](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TV6r&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000285RC)

The data fields available in the download files are:

- Field Name: Description
- date: Date when user was active in the district timezone
- sis\_id: The SIS ID (student\_id) associated with the Clever record for the user. If the user's record is no longer active in Clever, the SIS ID field will display as blank.
- clever\_user\_id: The Clever ID for the user
- clever\_school\_id: The Clever ID of the school associated with the Clever record for the user.
- active: User was active on Clever on this date . 
The active use of Clever is currently defined if the user performs   any   of the following actions:
Log into their district Clever account Access an application by clicking on the app icon in the Clever Portal Access an application through an Instant Login Link Logged in to an application using a Log in with Clever button Accessing any link added to the Clever portal by the district, school, or teacher
- num\_logins: The number of times the user accessed resources through Clever during the day
- num\_resources\_accessed: The number of unique resources accessed through Clever during the day
- school\_name: The name of the primary school assigned for the user

title: Participation & Resource Usage Reports
text:
Resource Usage reports provide a daily snapshot of each resource accessed by a user on a given day and are available for active students, teachers, and staff.

Resource Usage reports can be downloaded individually or in bulk. Clicking **Download week** will download a zip file with the student, teacher, and staff files for each day of the selected week.

![Resource usage](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TV6r&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000285Q5)

The data fields available in the download files are:

- Field: Description
- date: Date when user was active in the district timezone
- sis\_id: The SIS ID (student\_id) associated with the Clever record for the user. If the user's record is no longer active in Clever, the SIS ID field will display as blank.
- clever\_user\_id: The Clever ID for the user
- clever\_school\_id: The Clever ID of the school associated with the Clever record for the use
- resource\_type: The type of resource accessed by the user. Can be one of:
clever-district-added clever-teacher-added district-link teacher-link
- resource\_name: The name of the resource on the portal. Could be the URL in case an unnamed link was added to the Clever portal
- resource\_id: The Clever ID of the resource accessed by the user. Useful in case the name of the resource is changed.
- num\_access: The number of times the specific resource was accessed through Clever during the day
- school\_name: The name of the primary school assigned for the user

title: Participation & Resource Usage Reports
text:
Navigate to [Analytics > Analytics settings](https://schools.clever.com/analytics/settings) to enable SFTP exports of reports. Once enabled, Clever will display the information to connect to the SFTP directory for your schools.

Clever will automatically upload reports to the SFTP directory at the same time the data is made available in the Clever Dashboard. Daily activity reports are available the next day by 1pm local time.

Reports will be organized as follows:

- Folder: daily-participation
 - File: {yyyy-mm-dd}-daily-participation-students.csv
 - File: {yyyy-mm-dd}-daily-participation-teachers.csv
 - File: {yyyy-mm-dd}-daily-participation-staff.csv
- Folder: resource-usage
 - File: {yyyy-mm-dd}-resource-usage-students.csv
 - File: {yyyy-mm-dd}-resource-usage-teachers.csv
 - File: {yyyy-mm-dd}-resource-usage-staff.csv

![Analytics Settings page](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TV6r&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000004apIV)

---

title: Participation & Resource Usage Reports
text:
**Which roles have access to Participation Reports?**

- Clever Admins and District Curriculum Leads can *enable* reports.
- Clever Admins and District Curriculum Leads can *view* reports.

**How can teachers view student participation data?**

- Teachers have a version of participation reports called **Analytics**. You can find information on Analytics [here](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360041755311).

**When are Participation Reports updated?**

- Reports for daily activity are available the next day by 1 pm local time. 
 *Example: the participation activity for Tuesday will be available on Wednesday at 1 pm local time.*

**Is this the same data that is available to teachers through Analytics?**

- Yes, Clever generates the exports using the same information visible to teachers in the Portal. This ensures that the teacher and school can access the same information!

**Will teachers be able to export the reports in the Portal?**

- No. Export functionality will only be available to Clever Admins.

---

title: Sharing Permission: Sharing Clever Admins
text:
> Note: Title Sharing Permission: Sharing Clever Admins URL Name 360049871231 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. How to adjust admin sharing
>  
> Overview
> By default, Clever shares all Clever Admins with any applications in Clever. Currently, granular sharing of admininistrators and admin team members isn't possible. You can choose to either share all admins with an app or share no administrators with an app. Read below to learn more about adjusting admin sharing settings for each application.  
> How to adjust admin sharing
> To adjust whether administrators are shared with a given application:
>  
> Navigate to the application's overview page and select Settings Under the  Field Access section, select  Advanced Settings Select  Customize fields shared with {app} and click  Customize fields On the  Edit Student Fields page, select  Next On the Edit Contact Fields page, select Next On the Edit District Admin Fields page, click on the slider selection for Share District Admins with {app}. Confirm the slider selection is grey to remove admins from being shared, or green to share admins. Select Save
> Once complete, admins will no longer be shared with the application. If you require administrator accounts in the application, please contact the application directly for assistance.   
> Please note: If you have uploaded extension fields to Clever. You may need to navigate through one additional "fields" page before selecting Save .

section: For App Partners: Clever’s API change policy
text:
Title

For App Partners: Clever’s API change policy

URL Name

360050157812

Article Body

This article contains the following: 
1. [Overview](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360050157812?language=en_US#Overview) 
2. [Switching to a new API version](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360050157812?language=en_US#SwitchingNewVersion) 
3. [Releasing a new API version](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360050157812?language=en_US#ReleasingNewAPI) 
4. [Deprecating an existing API version](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360050157812?language=en_US#DepricatingExistingVersion)

Clever is committed to providing the best experience for developers building on our platform. In order to make it easier and faster to build on Clever, we constantly improve by adding new features and deprecating ones that are redundant. Here’s what to expect from Clever when we make changes to our API.

As of Back to School 2021, you will need to set the major version (e.g. v1, v2) that you will be using in production. If you are moving between major versions in production, please reach out to our [Partner Engineering team](mailto:integrations@clever.com) to ensure a smooth transition.

Within a major version, you can freely make calls against any associated minor version (for example, you could use both 2.0 and 2.1, but not 3.0) by updating your URLS (e.g. <https://api.clever.com/v2.1/district>).

For detailed information on changing API versions, check out our developer documentation on [Upgrading to the latest version of Clever’s API.](https://dev.clever.com/docs/migrating-to-api-30#teachers-staff-district-admins)

We define a minor release as one that will only add new features (e.g. response fields, input parameters, endpoints, etc) and fix small bugs. Minor versions will be backwards compatible.

Major version releases may contain features that are not backwards compatible as well as feature deprecations.

Clever is committed to releasing planned API versions no more than once a year, based on the following release timeline:

- New API versions will be announced by November.
- Rostering (data and events) API versions should be released by December.
- Identity API changes should be released by March.

Any delay in this timeline will be communicated to customers in advance. In case of an emergency, Clever reserves the right to release an API version outside of this schedule to meet customer needs with proactive communications to partners.

When a new version is fully released, new applications will build to the newest API version, and will not be able to use any previous version of the API.

While we consider new versions code complete upon official release, we recognize that bugs can slip by our testing processes! For three months after a version is released, we will make updates to the version to fix any discovered bugs. Once three months have passed, we will freeze the version as-is and make no further updates.

We sometimes need to make changes to all API versions - if we do, we will communicate this with partners as soon as possible.

title: For App Partners: Clever’s API change policy
heading_path: For App Partners: Clever’s API change policy
text:
Clever will support no more than two major API versions at a time. This policy aligns with industry best practice to ensure a great front-end experience for you and your customers. This means that when a new major version is released, we will begin the deprecation and end of life process for the oldest major version.

We are committed to ensuring that deprecation goes smoothly for all customers. Therefore, the deprecation and end of life process is as follows:

- At least one year in advance of deprecation, Clever will send notice of deprecation to all partners. We will also reach out to partners who are using the API version to help determine their upgrade path and timeline.
- Once an API version is deprecated, Clever will provide only limited support for bug fixes.
- An API version will no longer be supported six months after it is deprecated. At this point, applications will be unable to access any of the version’s endpoints.

Upon announcement of API v3, we are officially beginning the deprecation and end of life process for API v1, which includes both v1.1 and v1.2. The version will be deprecated by **Back to School June 2022** and no longer accessible by **December 2022.**

![Clever Academy.png](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000KuZ7&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000035few) 
Getting started with the Analytics? Check out our [Product Spotlight: Supporting your school and district with Clever Analytics](https://clever.academy/supporting-your-school-and-district-with-clever-analytics?user_type=district_admin) available in Clever Academy!

Clever offers multiple ways to view edtech usage in your district. Below you will find a high-level overview of Clever's analytics offerings and links to additional documentation.

At Clever, we believe that secure access to edtech should be standard. As with our other core products (Rostering, Portal, Badges, and Clever Library), the Analytics tools outlined below are provided to schools at no cost.

---

title: Portal Analytics
text:
![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000KuZ7&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P00000285PB)

Using [Portal Analytics](https://schools.clever.com/analytics), district and school leaders have access to graphs and statistics related to application usage **in the Clever Portal**. Here you can view how many users are accessing their applications, how often they log in, and which schools or apps are being used the most.

Portal Analytics are available automatically and require no setup. While data can be filtered and viewed in many different ways, it does not provide insights at the user level. If you are interested in viewing user-level data, please see [Participation Reports](https://support.clever.com/s/articles/360050299552?language=en_US#h_7698d144-7ceb-4d63-88b8-e9ca2aa378d2).

For additional information on Portal Analytics, see [this article](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/115005292523).

text:
![Analytics Reports](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000KuZ7&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P000004apKq)

Participation reports allow teachers and district-level admins to view student participation for Clever-integrated applications at the user level. There are two reports provided:

- **Participation** reports provide a daily snapshot that summarizes usage for students, teachers, and staff in your district, including those that may be inactive. If you're interested in determining if a specific user accessed an application, you can do so with participation reports.
- **Resource Usage** reports provide a daily snapshot of each resource accessed by a user on a given day and are available for active students, teachers, and staff.

This data is automatically available to teachers in their Clever Portal on the Analytics page. District-level reporting (Participation Reports) must be enabled by a district-level admin.

Edtech Analytics shows you **all of your district's app usage** in one place down to the school and grade level, **whether or not they are integrated with Clever**.

Edtech Analytics must be enabled and configured by a district-level admin. Edtech Analytics is currently available for district-managed Chromebook and Windows devices and requires the installation of a secure browser extension.

title: For Clever Admins: Purchasing Clever's paid products
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Purchasing Clever's paid products
text:
To get started with purchasing a Clever product, follow the steps below:

1. Log into your Clever Admin account by heading to schools.clever.com.
2. Navigate to the Clever Product you’d like to purchase:

- Clever IDM: [Clever Dashboard > User Management > IDM](https://schools.clever.com/identity-management)
 - Classroom MFA: [Clever Dashboard > Authentication > Classroom MFA](https://schools.clever.com/mfa)
 - Premium Support: Training & Support > Premium Support
 - Consulting: Training & Support > Clever Consulting
 - Training: Training & Support > Clever Training
 - CI Solutions & Clever Badges: [Authentication > Badges > Badges+](https://schools.clever.com/badges/product/clever-badges-plus)
3. Review the overview of the product and if it feels like a good fit, click **Get started**.
4. Enter the number of licenses or sessions you wish to purchase, then click **Proceed to pricing summary.**
5. Select your desired subscription length and dates before reviewing your pricing summary. If all looks good, click **Proceed to payment method**.

- Please note that the total number of users may exceed the amount specified in step 1, as each product may have a minimum user requirement for access.
6. To purchase, select whether you’d like to pay by credit card or by purchase order and enter the required information.
7. Next, click **Review your order/quote** (depending on the payment method selected)
8. Lastly, review your order or quote and complete your purchase.

If you currently use a paid product with Clever, you can also renew your subscription via the App Store! For more information on renewals, please see our article [Clever products: Purchasing, billing, and renewals](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/000001472).

---

You can also review any current paid product subscriptions in the Clever Dashboard. Navigate to your [Billing page](https://schools.clever.com/orders), and you’ll see an overview of your subscriptions, in-progress orders, and saved items:

![Subscriptions page in the Clever Dashboard](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000Uvgn&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EMPl00000IPzQv)

title: For Clever Admins: Purchasing Clever's paid products
heading_path: For Clever Admins: Purchasing Clever's paid products
text:
**Can I send a check to pay for my order? If so, where do I send my check?**

- Yes, you can send us a check to pay for your order! Please send it to 75 Remittance Drive, Dept. 6598 Chicago, IL 60675.

**Where do I need to send my PO and/or Tax-Exempt forms?**

- POs and Tax-Exempt forms are uploaded on the order page which is accessible in the Sidebar when you click [**Billing**](https://schools.clever.com/orders).

**Why do I see more student licenses than I wanted to purchase?**

- Some of Clever’s paid products have a minimum amount you must spend to use the product. So if your quote is below the minimum, Clever will update the total to meet the minimum for that product.

**How do I request a demo?**

- To request a demo for one of Clever’s products, simply fill out [this form](https://www.clever.com/district-request-demo) and Clever will reach out to get the demo scheduled for you.

**Who do I contact to manage my subscription?**

- If you need to manage your subscription and you don’t have a direct contact, please reach out to our Support Team at support.clever.com.

**How to edit a quote to change the number of licenses?**

- To update your quote, you will need to start a new order.

**How do I switch my quote from one product to another?**

- If you created a quote for the wrong product, you must start a new order for the correct product.

**My badges aren’t working with the CI Solutions + Clever Badges integration. Help!**

- We recommend reaching out to our award-winning support team at support.clever.com.

section: For App Partners: Upgrading API versions (V2 > V3.1)
text:
> Note: Title For App Partners: Upgrading API versions (V2 > V3.1) URL Name 360051233111 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Benefits of upgrading 3. Timeline and transition overview 4. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
> Overview
> This article briefly overviews the benefits of utilizing Clever’s API V3.1 and the transition process. If you’re ready to transition, please contact your Application Success Manager or  app-success@clever.com for more information. > Benefits of upgrading
> With the release of Clever’s API v3 and now v3.1, there have been several updates to the API that benefit application partners. By upgrading from v2 to V3.1, you gain access to:
> Support for multi-role users to streamline provisioning with a single Clever ID. Richer staff data to enable access to all users who support student learning. Improved student contact relationships
> Utilize a student relationships array, which details each contact’s relationships with any students in the district’s Student Information System (SIS). For example, if a contact is listed as a parent for two students and an aunt for another, they will have one Clever ID and three entries in the student\_relationships array. Please note: Clever has deprecated the API v2 contacts endpoint. If you require assistance, please contact Clever Support. > New content/resource mapping API
> This feature allows districts to indicate via the API which resources they want shared with courses, classes, and users. > Access to five new demographic data fields: Disability Status, Primary Disability Type, Section 504 Status, Gifted/Talented Status, and Home Language Code. For a complete summary of available new fields and the accepted field values, please see our Dev Docs: What’s New in API v3.1 . Access to attendance data . Access to Clever LMS Connect .
