This article describes the possible results and actions that may be identified by the [Troubleshoot Login tool](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360046240972).

---

- Result Type: Description
- : Success The key criteria passed the system check.
- : Information The system check was unable to automatically detect the error. Please see the info message for additional details on how to proceed.
- : Warning The system check has indicated this issue may have contributed to the login failure. These issues  may need to be resolved to restore logins.
- : Failure The system check has indicated this issue is causing the login failure. These issues must be resolved to restore logins.

The following issues are resolved at the school district level. If a School Tech Lead (STL) is using the Troubleshoot Login tool and the resolution message indicates the point of resolution is the district, they will see an **Email district admin** button that will provide a quick link to email the district tech support contact. If no tech support contact is listed, the contact button will not appear, pictured below:

![](/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0Pl000000TmKb&feoid=00N1P00000A2RcS&refid=0EM1P0000028E8o)

To update your district support contact, please follow the directions found [here](https://support.clever.com/hc/s/articles/360049312351).

If they'd like to use [app], they can install it in the Clever Library." Otherwise: "This user isn't shared with [app]. Teachers can install [app] in the Clever Library and share with this user."

Please refer to [app page link] to see what types of filters are in place. If you believe the filter has been placed incorrectly, please reach out to the application. title: Troubleshooting: Troubleshoot Login tool - error messages
heading_path: Troubleshooting: Troubleshoot Login tool - error messages
text:
- Result: The user has data quality errors; Result Type: ; Description: Message: "This user was flagged by an app-specific data error. Data errors must be resolved for users to be successfully processed by the application. To resolve this error, you will need to update the data syncing to Clever. For more information about this error, please navigate to Data Quality."
Additional info:  Application data errors must be resolved in order for login access to be restored. Update the data in your SIS and resync with Clever.
- Result: The user has not logged in to Clever in the last 7 days; Result Type: ; Description: Message: "This user has not logged in to Clever in the last 7 days. We recommend confirming that the user is logging in at the correct URL: {portal URL}. If the user sees an error when they try to log in, you can copy the reference ID and look it up in the Login Logs."
Additional info:  Often, users report that they're unable to log in to an application because they are actually attempting to log in to the resource directly instead of through Clever. We recommend testing the login to the application using the  Access Portal as user feature to confirm the login is successful. Once confirmed, provide directions on how to log in to Clever to access the application.
- Result: The user has data quality warnings; Result Type: ; Description: Message: "This user was flagged by an app-specific data warning. This means that the user has a compatibility issue with the application that may result in a degraded app experience. We recommend addressing these issues or contacting the application directly to determine the impact of a particular data warning."
Additional info: Data quality warnings usually don't prevent logins to applications. However, it is best practice to resolve warnings when possible. If you're unable to resolve the error, contact the app to see if they require the warning to be resolved in order to successfully log in.

If you do, please note that your user accounts will likely not be restored automatically. Additional setup will likely be required to match users to their historical data."

text:

title: For Clever Admins: Content Mapping
text:
> Note: Title For Clever Admins: Content Mapping URL Name 360052615892 Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Getting started 3. Uploading your resource file 4. Assigning your resources 5. Finishing up 6. Editing your assignments 7. FAQ
> Overview
> Some applications allow you to map resources to specific courses, classes, or users. This can sometimes require district administrators to work with each application directly to create those mappings. To address this pain-point, we’ve created a feature that helps you manage content mapping directly from your Clever dashboard! > Once you have successfully mapped your resources, applications will be able to automatically assign the correct content to your students and teachers. Please ensure that the application is aware that you will be setting this up before you get started! >  
>  
> Getting started
> To use content mapping, navigate to the Content assignment tab on the application page in the Clever dashboard and click Get started . > Please note: If you do not see this tab on the application page, the application does not support content mapping through Clever. Always check with an application before mapping content to avoid any issues or miscommunication. >  
> Uploading your resource file
> In order to use this tool, you will need to create a resources.csv file that contains information pertinent to the resources you intend to map. >   File Name: resources.csv  
> - Field: resource\_id; Required: Y; Format: String; Description: The unique identifier of the resource as assigned by the application. > - Field: title; Required: Y; Format: String; Description: The name of the resource
>  
> Please note: The resource\_id and title must match with values that the application recognizes. If you are unsure of what to use as the resource\_id and title, you will need to reach out to the application you are working with. >  
> When you are ready, you can upload your file in Step 1 of the wizard.

title: For Clever Admins: Content Mapping
text:
>  
>   Download     Example resources.csv file
> Assigning your resources
> Once you have uploaded your resources.csv file, you are ready to start assigning those resources to your courses! > Step 2 of the content mapping wizard allows you to select courses that will be using each resource. > To add a course to a resource, click the button near the right side of the page. You can then enter a course name or course number to search for the courses you would like to map. Sections can only be mapped if they are associated with a course name or number. Please be sure to associate all of your sections with a course! > Resources can be mapped to a course across all schools or to a course at a specific school. Furthermore, courses at different schools can be mapped to the same resource. >  
>  
> You can click on the blue link at the end of a mapping rule to see which school it is for. > Finishing up
> In Step 3  of the wizard, you will be able to review the changes you have made. You can always go back and edit your mappings by navigating to the bottom of the page and selecting "Edit assignment rules". > Otherwise, you can click "Finish" and you're all set! The application will now be able to access your content mapping information and assign its resources to the intended users. > If your mapping is successful, you will see the following message:  
>  
> Please note: After these settings are applied, the application will still need to sync with your account in order for you to see those changes. If you do not see any changes, you will need to reach out to the application to have them sync with your account. ✨ Additionally, please ensure you have set sharing rules for the application . If an application requires content mapping, both sharing rules and content assignments must be configured. > Editing your assignments
> Once you To review and edit your content assignments, you can navigate back to the Content assignment tab.

title: For Clever Admins: Content Mapping
text:
You will see a summary of your current resources assigned. You will also be able to edit your existing rules. Select Edit assignment rules and you will be taken back to Step 2  of the wizard where you can make changes as needed. >  
> FAQ
> Where can I find resource IDs? > Resource IDs are created by the application. If you are unsure of what to use as the resource ID, be sure to reach out to the application you are working with. > What if I do not see the Content assignment tab? > If you do not see the Content assignment tab, that means the application does not have this feature available through Clever. You will need to reach out to the application to discuss your options for assigning resources. > Why can't I see the course I would like to assign resources to? > If you are unable to find the course you are trying to assign a resource to, please be sure that the course is included in the application's sharing permissions. For more on sharing permissions, please refer to the following article: Sharing Permissions: Overview
> What do I do if I upload an incorrect resources.csv file? > You can always re-upload a new file! New files will always overwrite the previously uploaded files. > Do I have to assign my content this way? > This is up to each application and how they choose to map content in their integration. If you have questions about other content mapping methods, you will need to reach out to the application. >  
>  
> If you have any additional questions please feel free to  open a support request  and our team will be glad to help further!

title: For Families: Student Messages
text:
> Note: Title For Families: Student Messages URL Name 360053195592 Article Body  
>  
> This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Sending and receiving messages 3. Message notifications 4. What if a teacher turns off Messages? 5. Who can see these messages? 6. How does Clever promote respectful messaging? > Overview
> Please note: Clever will be discontinuing Clever Messaging by December 31st, 2025 . This will allow our teams to focus on features that enhance our identity platform offerings including new and improved free tools like  Clever Badges , and coming soon, a more streamlined iOS app for students. >  
> Teachers and students can chat back and forth with Messages right from the Clever Portal! From your students' Messages page, any of their teachers who have enabled Messages will be listed and available to receive a chat from your student's Clever Portal. Please note that students do not have the ability to message other students. To find out more about how messaging works, read below! > Sending and receiving messages
> As long as one of their teachers has Messages turned on, your student will see the Messages icon in their Clever Portal. > When they receive a message from a teacher, they will be notified at the top of your Portal. Read below to learn about how to set up Message notifications . >  
> From the Messages page, they can view new and previous messages from their teachers and send a reply to continue the conversation. > On the left-hand side, they will see any of their teachers who have Messages turned on. From there, they can start or continue a chat with any of these teachers. > Please note:  If a teacher has never turned their Messages on their name will not be listed. > Message notifications
> Coming soon! Students can customize their Messages settings to allow for sound and browser notifications. When your student receives a message from a teacher they can choose to be notified by a sound, through their browser, or both!

title: For Families: Student Messages
text:
> To start, they will need to navigate to the Messages tab in their Clever Portal. From there, they will select the new 'Settings' button. >  
> Browser notifications
> By default, browser notifications will be set to 'off'; however, you can update this at any time! > If you'd like to enable browser notifications, toggle the 'Browser notifications' button to 'on'. > When turning browser notifications on, a pop-up window will open asking if you'd like to 'Allow' or 'Block' these notifications. To continue with turning your browser notifications on , select 'Allow'. > Once you have selected 'Allow' the 'Browser notifications' toggle will be green. > If you choose to 'Block' notifications the toggle will become disabled. To enable browser notifications in the future, you will need to go to your browser preferences and enable them from there. (See these resources for Chrome , Firefox , Safari , and Edge ). > When you're done, simply select 'Save' and your settings will be updated! > Sound notifications
> By default, sound notifications will be set to 'on', but you can adjust this at any time! From the Messages page, select 'Settings' and toggle the 'Sound notifications' button 'on' or 'off'. A green toggle will indicate that the sound notifications are 'on'. > Whether turning the notifications on or off, don't forget to select 'Save' once you're done. You can always edit these settings as needed! > What if a teacher turns off Messages? > Teachers can turn off their messages at any time. > If a teacher has turned off Messages, your student will be notified and will not be able to chat with that teacher until they have turned Messages back on. > Who can see these messages? > All Message history will be saved for the rest of the school year and can be requested from Clever by a Clever District Administrator. > How does Clever promote respectful messaging?

> If a student sends a message that contains a swear word, a dialogue will display that prompts the student to confirm they would like to send their message. They can choose to select Don't send and edit their message or to select Send and the message will be delivered to their teacher. At this time, Clever cannot detect swear words that appear within another word or if appended by a punctuation mark. Example: " word!"

title: PowerSchool Version 20.11.0
text:
> Note: Title PowerSchool Version 20.11.0 URL Name 360054192432 Article Body This article is for districts that have updated to PowerSchool version 20.11.0+ and need to update their PowerSchool permissions to grant Clever sync access. >  Please Note:       • This sync type is no longer available for new setups. If new to Clever or updating your configuration to pull data from PowerSchool, please reference our article PowerSchool Plugin Sync. •  If your schools use the North Carolina state-based PowerSchool setup, your sync method is SFTP and the sync is managed by your district. If you are interested, Clever is integrated with NCEdCloud for teacher and student logins! Click here to learn more. • If your schools use ESchoolPLUS as your SIS, please see our article on SFTP Syncs . This article is intended for districts using PowerSchool as their SIS. • If your district's PowerSchool account has any custom setup, these instructions may not be exactly correct. >  
> Updating Permissions
> PowerSchool 20.11.0+ requires permissions updates for Clever to sync successfully via DDE. To update your permissions, follow these directions: 
> Log in to PowerSchool as an admin   Navigate to:  System > Security > User Access Roles > {click on Role assigned to the Clever access account} > Export/Edit   Confirm the correct permissions have been granted to the Clever Sync access account to export the following records as outlined in  S ection 3  of this article:  Setting up your PowerSchool Auto Sync        -  Schools        -  Students        -  Sections        -  Teachers        -  CC        -  Terms Depending on your PowerSchool setup, you may also need to adjust your Data Export Manager (DEM) settings. To grant access to Data Export Manager, follow these directions:  A. Navigate to  System > Security > Users by group  and search for the Clever user account. B. Click on the Clever user account and select the tab  Admin access and roles C.

Under  Roles and Schools , select the  Action: Edit D. Check the box for  Data Export Manager Export Access  and click  OK E. Click  Submit  to save your changes Once you've made these changes, navigate to the Clever Dashboard > Data sources > SIS sync > Settings page and select  Sync Now. Clever will initiate a sync with PowerSchool. To confirm the results, please allow 10-15 minutes for the PowerSchool sync to complete. The sync status will display in your  Clever Dashboard .

title: Clever + Rethink Ed: Setup guide
text:
> Important: Title Clever + Rethink Ed: Setup guide URL Name Clever-Rethink-Ed-Setup-guide Article Body This article contains the following: 1. Overview 2. Setup process 3. Required fields 4. Support Contacts
>  
> Overview
> This guide walks through how to get set up with Rethink Ed in Clever. Before reading this guide, please make sure your district is set up with Clever! If your district has not been set up with Clever, you can get started by going to this link: clever.com/signup . For more information on setting up Clever for the first time, please see this guide . > Setup process
> If your district is already on Clever, you can connect Rethink Ed’s application by accepting your invite from them OR following these instructions:
> Log into your Clever Dashboard and select Applications > Add Applications. Search for Rethink Ed. You will then be brought to a page where you can authorize your Rethink Ed request. You will be asked if you would like to request a custom Launch Date. The Launch Date is the first day users can see the Rethink Ed icons in their Clever Portal. Product access may or may not be available on this day. Once you have made your selections, click Request . > Once you have shared data with Rethink Ed, the Rethink Ed team will set up the initial sync and will reach out to you to discuss communicating with teachers. > Recommended data sharing
> Before sharing your district's data with Rethink Ed:
> Make sure to match product applications with purchased license counts. Ensure that students and teachers are in their correct grade levels and that classes are updated for the current school year in your Student Information System (SIS). > Rethink Ed recommends that you “Share all records in my district” in Clever. You can find more info about sharing data here. > Required fields
> Check the Data Quality tab in your Clever Dashboard to see whether you’re meeting the required data fields.

title: Clever + Rethink Ed: Setup guide
text:
Rethink Ed requires the following data fields to be sent:  
> Student: district, name, school, schools, sis\_id, credentials, dob, email, ext, gender, grade, graduation\_year, hispanic\_ethnicity, location, race, state\_id, student\_number, iep\_status Teacher: district, name, school, schools, sis\_id, credentials, email, ext, state\_id, teacher\_number, title School Admin: district, name, schools, staff\_id, credentials, email, ext, roles, title District admin: district, name.first, name.last, email, title  
> Important: please be sure to share student iep\_status:
> Check your Data browser in Clever to see if student iep\_status is syncing to Clever successfully. To do this, you can go to the “Students” tab of the Data Browser and add a filter for “iep\_status equals Y” to make sure this field is in Clever. If it is not, please add this field to your SIS or SFTP data uploads. Please contact Clever Support for assistance. Once you’ve confirmed that student iep\_status is in Clever, you will need to explicitly share this field with Rethink Ed. To do so, go to Rethink Ed’s Settings page and go down to “Field Access.” Here, click into “Advanced Settings” and select “Customize fields shared with Rethink Ed.” From here, please select iep\_status to move it into the “Share with Rethink Ed” column. >       Please see For District Admins: Apps - Field access for more information. > Support Contacts
> Rethink Ed 
> support@rethinked.com  
> Clever  
> Support.clever.com (click the chat icon in the corner of the screen) Contact Clever with issues that relate to:
> Syncing iep\_status and other required fields to Clever Customizing field access
